review_text:
We just moved to a neighborhood very close to here. I have been getting so many coupons for this place, so we gave it a try. We ordered the Family Feast: a tray of mostaccoli, a try of salad, and a try of breadsticks and for ~$25. We had tons of leftovers, I'd say it could feed 6 in one sitting. 
The pasta sauce was a bit bland, I added seasoning to my which helped a bit. Sadly, I ordered meat sauce and got regular marinara, so maybe the meat has more flavor. 
The salad, I upgraded to a chopped, was awesome! Similar to other chopped salads, but super fresh and an excellent house balsamic creamy vinaigrette. A must try. 
The breadsticks are also really good. They must be fried then baked, or something. They come with a huge side of marinara, but we're also awesome in the dressing. 
We will definitely go back, my husband wants to try their beefs and I their pizza. I hope it's all tasty, it's super convienent to our new home.

This is my new go to spot on Sundays after I finish my horse riding lessons. We  ordered as an appetizer claims in wine sauce, chicken parmesan with pasta, minestrone soup, chocolate cake our first time there and loved everything. 

The second time we ordered a chopped salad, fruti de mare, and tiramisu. Again, we were very happy with our food, especially the tiramisu and will order that again next time we come. 

Our server has been Belle both times, shes very sweet and helpful and provides great service. 

This was a great find, see you soon Macianos!

If I could rate it a 1/2 star I would.

Previously a stellar, delicious establishment has turned into a second rate, cheapened shell of its former self.

My wife and I have been ordering/dining here for 5 years, always fantastic food, service..and when the occasional mistake happened, it was rectified instantly with an apology.

Fast forward to tonight, an online order for a simple pizza produced the most hideous, charred, overcooked pizza I've ever seen. This was actually approved by the location as an acceptable order? I brought it home and almost choked on my drink as I opened it.

I call the place back, yes of course after being routed to a manager they agree to remake it, but is that all? A simple apology or credit towards the next meal should have been offered in this day and age where choices are abound on every corner. It appears that management here expect disappointment, quick to just dismiss it with a replacement.

Unfortunately, they have likely lost a long time customer, as Lou Malnatis, Wise Guys, or Giordanos is now sounding the superior choice.

Tried to order online, but the order didn't go through so we ended up dining in for dinner.
Tried the deep dish pizza with sausage. The crust is very light, almost bready.   Not like Lou Malnatti's deep dish.  It was unique and tasty,  however.  Staff was very pleasant and attentive.  Domestic bottles were 2.99.   Frank Sinatra was playing overhead with a few other Italian crooner songs.   I would come back to dine in again because the place is cute.  A cross between Olive Garden and Maggianos.  If you're in the area, it's a nice change.

Amazingly and simply the BEST pizza around and probably for miles!  Our first time here we ordered for pickup and our order was beyond expectations. Crispy crust and loaded with sauce toppings and cheese. I think it weighed 5 pounds!  We dined in tonight and everyone from the hostess/greeter, to our waitress provided excellent service; frequently stopping back to see how we were doing. Our salad and pizza once again exceeded our expectations. Will return often!  Thank you for being a true business that cares about customers.

The carry out wings are  disappointing. Cold, dry and shriveled as if it's been heated and reheated several times. I ended up throwing it away to prevent me from getting sick. As one of their featured menu, I expected it to be at least  edible.

We have ordered from Macianos for years but we are now in agreement that we have placed our last order. 

The pizza used to be very good, and salads above average. However, in the past year the pizza crust edge is often burned (not just brown but black), the dough often has big, burnt bubbles in it (anyone who has worked at a pizza place for more than five minutes knows the baker is supposed to pop those during cooking!), the salads have gone down in quality, with brown lettuce, less ingredients, and less fresh. That is, if you can get them to bring it to you. The last 3 orders, at least one item was missed with delivery. Never an offer of compensation, never anything but an implied "here is your food. You can let everything else get cold while I go back and get the rest of your order". Did I mention this was the last 3 orders in a row??

Macianos has been consistent at one thing over the years: driving up prices. "Medium pizza? You mean you want more than 1 topping on that? How's 25 bucks sound?"  Maybe if I pay extra I could get one that isn't burnt or get my entire order delivered...

When you couple the now very high cost with the decline in quality and mistakes, it's time to go somewhere else. It's a shame...  We tried hard to stick it out. 4 years a few times a month but time to find another place.

First time I was there we called for reservation was told ok and said we would have a table and then found out oh no we don't take reservation but a family that came in after made a reservation smh...

Second time (tonight) go to use a coupon advertised in money savers and you say you only limit one per use which isn't stated you might want to put that on the flyer......

My husband and I order The Works pizza and BBQ pizza regularly. Their pizza is amazing! Great seasoning and they actually put a decent amount of sauce on pizza. Always comes hot and pretty quickly. Worth trying the local pizza place!

Nothing special and nothing that blew me away. Pizza is pizza. the noodles we got for the little man we noodles. 
bread was good.
Caprese salad was fresh.

REALLY over priced and there were about 15 people working, we were the only table and still waited a good thirty minutes for a pizza.

We live very close to there.We like the place and the pizza that is the only thing we ever had 

there.It always taste good just like a good pizza should.I like the place but even though it is right around the corner from me the only reason we don't go there that much it's not because there is anything wrong with the place or pizza is because we have never had a flyer sent to us or gotten a coupon or anything and we are just about a block away.And the times we have gone there I think it was A little over priced for it.We would go there more often if they send out discounts or had specials or something just a thought...

I try a lot of pizza due to my "American Food addiction" (or at least that's what i'm calling it) and i've tasted most of the favorites from Giordanos to Lou Malnati's down to Little Ceasars, and consistently Macianos is just killing it from crust to crust.  Their a little more expensive then your local Rosatis or whatever you have but not outrageous and well worth it.  No matter the size we get this pizza gets devoured by everyone.  They've improved their delivery time and become a staple in our household.  Maciano's for the win!

My favorite italian restraurant in the past. It was amazing. The past 3 visits and my carry out orders have been terrible. The portions are cut way back, the quality of the food is awful. My chopped salad had one cherry tomato, and about 10 ditalini noodles. The chicken soup was so thick and salty, i did not eat it. I am in shock on how this plave has become well below average. I will not return. I do wonder why and what happened..

Have eaten here many times with family. Food has always been fresh and well prepared. Love the pizza! To date, we have never had a problem with the food or the service. Desserts are good too, but have only had it once or twice and shared it with others. Portions are good size so I usually don't have room for dessert.

We flew in late from Phx and felt bad for coming in right before closing. The staff was very friendly and the price is perfect.  We ordered a pizza and salads and are very pleased with both. Highly recommended.

When we first moved to the area at the end of 2010, we thought we hit the jackpot with fantastic pizza. They were always good, with fast service and delicious pizza. It's unfortunate, but over the last few years the place has just gone downhill.

Pizza delivery is now hit-or-miss. Sometimes your pizza is ok, sometimes it's burnt, and sometimes your order is wrong, or they are missing something from your order. A few times I have called to complain (especially about a burnt pizza) and the manager on duty has comped a pizza. That's all well and good, but the times I have called because we were missing parts of our order - sometimes they forgot our soda, other times they forgot some of the food like wings or bread sticks. The only remedy in those instances has been for the driver to go back and bring us what we ordered.  If it was food, it's brought cold. Never a complimentary dessert, or comped item, or coupon - which I feel should be offered in those instances. They didn't do their job and the only thing they do is bring what they should have included the first time they delivered. Experiences like that really leave a bad taste in my mouth (no pun intended) and I'm less likely to offer them repeat business.

I've been hesitant in that past about trying a new pizza place, but recommendations on other places from friends make me question why I stick with Maciano's. I'll be trying new places in the future.

I hate to be writing this review and giving this place only 1-star, but it is what it is ...

When Maciano's is having a good day, the food is absolutely awesome.  The pizza (notably the sausage and sauce) is delicious, especially their deep dish.  Their entrees are quite good: for instance chicken parm has very generous portions with pasta.  We used to spend at least $200.00 a month there.

So what's the problem, right?

The problem, in two words: QUALITY CONTROL ... As in, there is none.

We are pretty forgiving in most cases.  We live 2 miles (4 minutes) away from the Elgin location, however, more times than not, the pizza is delivered cold and soggy.  Sometimes the top is burnt to a crisp and the bottom/crust is a nasty, wet-mess.  Sometimes the pizza is crispy on the bottom, cooked perfectly and delicious.  Sometimes they get your whole order right; usually they don't.

Our last experience with Maciano's was this: we order 1 large thin crust, half onions and pepperoni/ half cheese.  1 large deep dish with sausage, onions and mushrooms. 1 large chicken chopped salad with bleu cheese crumbles on the side.

We received: (1hr 20 min later) 1 large soggy, rubbery thin crust with half pepperoni the other half onions.  One cold, soggy, clumpy deep dish (which looked as it had been dropped) and one salad, covered in bleu cheese crumbles with rancid, spoiled chicken on the side.  
Two people at a few bites of the chicken and those same two people were throwing up for 24-hours and 72-hours later, still have gut-rot and diarrhea. 

Maciano's isn't cheap either.  $55+ for 16-inch dish dish and thin crust, only to get a soggy mess which results in food poisoning ....

.... It's really a shame.  If this place took a little bit more pride in it's food and paid attention to the details, it would easily be one of the best.

**Edit**

Well I've moved this up to a 3-star from 1-star, as in the past 6 months, they've seem to up'd their game, a little.  Beware though -- I've found that the food quality is WAY BETTER during off-peak hours, on off-peak days.  If I order a pizza at 4:30 pm on a, say, Tuesady, it's the best damn, 5-star pizza ever.  If I order a pizza at 6:30 pm on a Friday .... who knows what kind of mess I'll get .... so 3-star.

They have amazing customer service! Always so pleasant when I call in my order and the food is amazing! Very pleased :) 

Plus the delivery drivers are awesome too!

Service was slow, and they ran out of pepperoni. No warning - we weren't told until we tried to order. What kind of pizza place runs out of pepperoni? Enh - we only stopped in because the Mexican restaurant next door lost our reservation and couldn't seat our group
Just had the worst calzone ever !! It tasted like store bought croissant wrapped around cheese. The dough wasn't cooked all the way either, plus no sauce

They should rename this place 'Macia-YES's' ... They make a really really good thin crust pizza. The Sausage Classic is our "go to" pizza. We have also had their pasta and it is always delicioso ... We usually get the food to go but it's also a good place to eat in as well. It is kid-friendly.

We are limited in our little town to options for delivery.  Maciano's is hit or miss.  Sometimes it is good and other times it is meh.  We ordered last night a 20 inch pizza.  It looked small so I took out the tape measure and it was barely 18 inches and well done does not be charred and burned.  Recently we seem to have much more of the meh moments and with our experience last night they are likely to be on the naughty list with us for a while.  The girl answering the phone literally asked what would I like for her to do about it in a snippy tone.  I said nothing and hung up.  If they could be consistent this place as the potential to be so much better than they are.

I have had some great pizzas here and some bland ones but this one was awful.I have never had a tart pizza before.The pizza tasted like it was all fetta cheese,it was terrible.The consistency of the cheese was odd too ,it was almost grainy.We ordered several different pizzas and all of them tasted odd.The problem with this place is inconsistency.I am going to throw the rest out and order from somebody else.I used to like this place but I want a reliable pizza place.

I have been to this place a handful of times and every time i visit, I leave satisfied!

I've tried several of their meals and the pizza and it's delicious!  They have the best HOMEMADE Tiramisu I have ever had in my life too.  Usually I'm alone when I dine out because I work a lot away form home and like everyone, I get hungry too and I'm not much of a fast-food guy either.  I mention that because more than once during my visit, I've not just been "served" a meal by the waitresses.  I was pleasantly surprised by friendly conversation and enjoyed the company briefly as I dined alone.

The location is perfect for me.  The building is in a strip mall off 20.  The way they laid out their seating and floor plan simply works for what they got.  You can only do so much when you want a kitchen, check-out area, dining area, and have enough room left where the waitresses and waiters don't get too caught up in traffic.  I give them credit for creating a nice atmosphere.  I especially like the display case when you walk in near the register.  Every little bit adds "bling" and it works for me.

I'm not a picky eater at all and eat about anything except liver.  However, I do enjoy a good meal and this place definitely delivers.  I will visit again weather I'm in the mood for pizza and a soda pop, or a hearty and filling pasta dish.
Lasagna was cold in the middle. Server never came back to check on us. Did not get drink refills. Very disappointing. Best thing was the free bread.

My neighborhood pizza joint...love the crispy crust and good service.  They got an order wrong the other day and without me even asking sent me another pizza .  I liked that I didnt have to ask.  Oh and their pizzas are really good too.

Dont be misled by the strip mall location. Its not really a 'pizza joint'. I ate lunch here with my teenage daughter and mother. We had a fantastic meal. The caprese sandwhich, Cesar salad, and angel has pasta were all very very fresh and delicious. It does take a little longer because its made to order, but they have wonderful fresh bread and LaVazza coffee! Relaxing atmosphere to visit and ubwind! A real treat and great addition to the area. We will be back to try more!

Solid. I recently had a calzone. It was probably the best in the area, not to greasy, fresh, and cooked perfectly. I had the seafood past recently, it was really bad, not a lot of seafood, not a lot of pasta and it was in a bucket of white wine sauce that wasn't good.  I wish I could give it 3.5 but 4 is fine.

Maciano's was a pretty big bust. Let's just call a spade a spade and state that I really didn't enjoy too much. A three strike rule, if you will...

While the place is akin to a cozy, upscale Sabarro or low brow Maggiano's, I just couldn't get past a few lunch time bummers...

1) Overpriced: Every menu item read at least $2-$5 more than I thought it should be, especially for the quality and portions. For example, my husband's teeny tiny eggplant sandwich hosted two minuscule, silver dollar sized medallions and rang up at $8. 

2) Understaffed: I'll give a nod to our server who did mention that she was the only staff member there that afternoon (1pm on a Saturday)...so she did give us a head's up. However, from start to finish it took us almost 1.5 hrs to snag some lunch. We were constantly looking around for water, service, etc.

3) Meh eats: Portions aside, the food was lackluster. My chicken parmesan was ok at best, with a sauce that was too sweet for its own good. At least the bird was well seasoned.

It's worth noting that their free focaccia bread was the best part of my meal. Hey, free, tasty carbs are worth something in my book.

Had the spaghetti w meat sauce dinner and ravioli dinner....cheese ravioli tastes like the frozen kind you can get from your freezer section....spaghetti was nothing to write home about....sauce was meaty but bland....tried to give me a leaking bag with my carry out order....Full parking lot but everyone at the restaurant next door...that's usually an indication that something's not right....pleasant employees though

I have had delivery pizza from here several times and it was always very good. So, when my family decided to go there for dinner this evening, I figured it would be very good. 

When we arrived, the place was virtually empty. We were seated immediately and because we were in a rush, our order was placed almost soon. A gluten free menu was not available which would have been nice for us as we have a gluten free need. A large pizza was ordered as was a dinner salad. The food arrived very timely and definitely was hot. The salad we got was the Spinach-Gorgonzola and it was good, but the walnuts seemed to be coated in powered sugar?? 

The pizza was fresh and hot. One of the distinguishing factors for this place for me is their crust. Not being a big thin crust fan, the crust is important. Every other time I've had it it was crispy and delicious. Today it was soggy and slightly undercooked. The toppings were good and abundant. 

Service was quick and often. Being close and convenient it's a nice place to order from and go to for a dinner with the family.

Just went to this place for the second time. I love how they offer a Caprese salad as a side for only about $4, I always want one at other restaurants but no one will share so I have to pay and eat too much everytime, this was perfect! They also have complimentary bread and they serve it with olive oil and parm. cheese, my favorite! The only reason it gets a four is the server took a while to get to our table, but once they did they were very friendly and attentive.

Its a cute restaurant with reasonable prices. I had the linguine pasta with bolognese sauce,  and it was very good. I love Italian food, so its hard to please my tastes. They do a wonderful job. I can't wait to go back and try their Chicken Piccatta.

My family of 5 have dined and ordered delivery many of times since we live very close to this restaurant. They are very inconsistent with the taste of the food. Today we ordered 2 different side salads that are now 6.95 each for a small container. Usually we don't mind paying that much for a side salad but today the portion size was so off I thought it was a joke. Literally so little that it was comical. We also ordered 2 types of pasta and it was so flavorless I threw it out. The calamari was so oily we couldn't even eat it. These are all things we have ordered before and have been satisfied with. On top of that they forgot my dessert order and when I called to let them know (this wasn't the first time...happens almost every time) they were rude and asked if my husband could go back and get it. Who does that?  I finally just asked for a credit to my card. This place has gone down hill BIG time. Last time I'll ever order. They have little kids working there that don't know what they are doing. Nothing negative towards the kids. It's not their fault management doesn't train them. I hope you guys read this and actually do something about it.  You've lost a customer that use to order at least once a week and catering as well.
Food- dry pizza, decent pasta and bread sticks, Ok salad, and overall just kinda bland

I sincerely WISH I could give this location a higher review, but I can't do that in good conscience.  Not even on Christmas :(

So the first time I had Maciano's was from the Rockford location almost two weeks ago (see other review).  It was a delightfully appealing experience for my palate from beginning to end.  I couldn't wait to go back.

Too bad great service wasn't consistent among the locations.  Now don't get me wrong, the pizza was good, and the breadsticks were right on, but I am less than impressed with the service.

OK, so it was a Wednesday night, and the husband suggested pizza for dinner.  I had a craving for deep dish, so I told him to call in our order.  He calls, and is informed right away that they are out of deep dish pizza.  Really?  How does that even happen?!  So needless to say, we didn't order and I was highly disappointed :(

two days later, we were having friends over for poker night.  Maciano's got brought up, and we figured we would give this location another shot!  I ordered online (great process, btw, and you get 10% off of your first order).  Since we were out of their delivery range, I had the option to choose pickup.  We had it set for 6:45.  My dear, darling husband was the designated go-fer.

He calls me at 7 and tells me the place is a MADHOUSE, and that they keep telling him "five more minutes" , "three more minutes", "just a little while longer".  meanwhile, I am on the computer where you can "track" your pizza's progress (AWESOME concept, btw) and it said it was "MADE" already.  So I don't really understand the disconnect there.

Well our food was finally ready at 7:15, so 30 minutes after we were told.  But my husband said that we made it out good.  I guess it was crazy there, and there were some VERY pissed off and disappointed people there swearing and upset.  So I guess it could have been worse.

As for the food, it was still pretty solid, BUT...they got some of our order wrong.  Such as, I got the side salad with just tomatoes and onions, and it came with a everything and the wrong dressing.  And our pizza wasn't well-done like we had ordered, either.

However, the pepperoni was good, the deep dish sausage was still VERY delicious, my salad was good (what I was able to pick around, that is) and the breadsticks were SO good.  They are fluffy and flavorful.  So delicious!

For dessert, we got the delicious cookies, but we also ordered the banana xangos just to switch it up a bit.  they were an interesting concept, but WAY too heavy on the cinnamon.  And I LOVE me some cinnamon.  If it had been mixed with the sugar a little more and THEN rolled in that mixture, it would have been way better!

So I am not saying I won't order from Maciano's again, but I think they've had enough of my business for right now.

I've been ordering from these guys for two years and never had a problem. Tonight was different. They delivered  the wrong pizza. I called them up and they apologized and rectified the situation. These people know how to run a successful  business. Thank you Macianos for your understanding and amazing service. I hope to continue patronizing your store for years to come. Great pizza and great service!

Delicious! One of the few to deliver to our area & certainly the best of those few. Pizza is cheesy & tastes of fresh & quality ingredients. Great pasta too. My only compliant is that when I pay cash, the delivery driver never seem to carry enough cash to make more than a few dollars worth of change. Twice I've been short-changed & even though I've tipped $5-8 dollars (20-30 percent of what I buy), they usually seem to walk away with $8 or $10... For one pizza. I do love the online ordering system & being able to track the order.

Ordered a deep dish pizza and a double dough for our moving crew on our first night in our new place- Pizza was delicious in both varieties. Delivery was a bit slower than stated, but close and the delivery person was kind and cheery even though it was freezing out. Pizza was still super hot when it got here- I will definitely use them again!

I moved to Elgin in January 2013. Macianos has been a staple for us since then. We have spent a few hundred dollars per month. The last three times they delivered have been terrible. The last two times they didn't send the food we ordered. Tonight I stressed when ordering that we expect to get what we order. They sent the right pizza and it was burnt to a crisp. Where us the quality control. Someone knew this was crap before it was boxed. We are done. Giordanos here we come.

I have really tried to like this place ...

Tonight .... Spent over forty bucks for delivery ....

They sent everything.  Just not the lg salad.

Ouch.  Delivering it 2 hours late does not cut it.  Are you all so greedy you cannot write off lettuce and aging chicken??

Never again.

We ordered pizza for delivery from here. One of the pizzas we got was not what we ordered. The flavor was not that great so it makes me wary to try them again, if I do I might try something other than the pizza. They are more expensive than other places as well.

My fiance took me here for dinner the other night when we had some time to kill before checking out our new apartment. His friends had recommended the place, and boy, am I glad they did!! 

The bread that came with meal was soft, warm, and delicious. We also each ordered a $2 side Caesar salad, which ended up being the most generous side salad I've ever had! I was almost full before dinner. I ordered a grilled Tilapia, which came with potato wedges smothered in some kind of sauce - less than $10! He ordered a Chicken Parmesan with fettuccine. He said the chicken was great but the fettuccine was a bit dry (I agreed). 

Nice, friendly, warm atmosphere - casual with a hint of class.

I am only giving this place 4 stars right now because I'd like to come back again and try the pizza before giving it another star. I'll be there really soon.
Normally like the place and will review again. But really, 55 minutes for a plate of pasta when you're nearly empty?! Painfully slow service.

Excellent Pizza

Stopped by about a week ago to get dinner with my daughter. 
Dinner started with some nice fresh Italian Bread. They were happy to bring be some Parmesan Cheese and fresh garlic to put in the Olive Oil.   

We both had pizza.  It's the crispy thin crust cut in squares style that you typically find in the Chicago area.  The pizza was excellent.

I was pleased. The place was very crowded on that Friday night.  I will be back.

Great food and great service. Love this little neighborhood gem. 
Pizza is outstanding.

The low ratings are specifically for pick-up service, twice had had to wait for  a long time to get my carry out pizza.   The first time I waited for over ten minutes and the second time I waited half hour for my order to come through.  What gets me upset is that both times I called to place my order and they told me the pizza would be ready for pick-up within 25 minutes.   I get there and I am told it will only be a few minutes.  The few minutes turned into a long time.   Not customer oriented:(

While the pizza is okay, not bad. There so many choices of pizza around here similar to Maciano's.  Consider carry out pizza like Old Towne Pizza, & Papa Savario's instead.
Never had complaints about this place! Their pizza is perfect and I've also tried a few things off the rest of the menu, those were good too!
We have never had anything but great food and service here. They have my favorite pizza crust ever.

Macianos has really good pizza, but consistency is the issue here.  One night you might order a deep dish and get a wonderful pie, then on your next try you might get a load of uncooked meats and undercooked dough, and then on another it might be charred to a crisp.  Delivery is sometimes an issue also with a long wait and varying levels of accuracy.  I rated it 4 stars because when good, it really is good.
$10.49 for this tiny piece of rubbery lasagna?  Really, Maciano's, really?
Great size portions and FRESH food always!

Being disabled, I can't get out and about very often and, thus,
need to find restaurants with take-out or delivery. I've tried all
of the Italian places in the Elgin area and just discovered
Macianos.

My first order was on Saturday, 8/10/13. Being intrigued by
their menu claim which boasted "huge" desserts at costs of
$5 -6.50, I decided to order three individual items--chocolate
cake, banana carmel cheesecake xangos and tiramisu. The
xangos and cake were sizable and quite good. The tiramisu
was flat out one of the best I've ever had and was about four
times the size of those offered by their competitors. The
reason for purchasing desserts only, was to augment my
already planned dinner of filet mignon and sea scallops.

My second order was placed on Sunday, 8/11/13. It
consisted of a very generous portion of lasagna with meat
sauce and, of course, another tiramisu. Again, I was pleased
with the quality and freshness.

Delivery in both cases was very prompt and courteous. I
have now found my new number one (uno) italian joint.

Pizza is the best I've had in this area and I'd like to think I know my pizza!  

They start you off with free fresh garlic sticks (don't make the mistake of eating too many).

They would have gotten five stars, but the diet was flat.
Best calzones! !!  Great place for dinner with the kids or a date night.  Casual dining with lots to choose from.

They have really tasty pizza but the service is what makes their business suffer greatly. Being a waitress myself I tend to be forgiving on less than great service on busy nights. But when it takes them 5 minutes to greet and seat you when there are only three other parties in the restaurant, what is that about?? Our server wasn't attentive at all and I ended up with an empty beverage for most of my time there. When the pizza came, 20 years later, my lasagna I ordered didn't come until after the pizza and I had to remind them!!! Terrible service shouldn't have to waste such yummy food. Too bad because I won't go back voluntarily.
Great food. Great people. Management was wonderful when they mada a mistake.

It has been a long time since I have been so disappointed with a meal. This was a complete waste of time and money. We ordered 2 Calzone's, a Spinach & Gorgonzola Salad and a cup of soup. The Calzone's were just baked dough with a hint of cheese in the middle. It was basically the equivalent of eating baked pizza dough with dipping sauce. The soup was beyond awful. It was a cup full of stewed tomatoes floating in a broth with some diced carrots and celery. I have never seen anything like it. The Spinach and Gorgonzola Salad was edible, but it's pretty pathetic that the only good thing to come out of our delivery bag were the glazed  walnuts on the salad. Yep, ordered from an Italian restaurant to get decent glazed walnuts...how sad.

If you order carry out from this place and they tell you 20-30 minutes DONT YOU BELIEVE IT! We ordered 2 pizzas and sat waiting with a line of pissed off customers for almost 2 hours. This is not the first time but it will definitely be the last. They are chronically understaffed and can't keep up with orders. The counter staff is indifferent and the manager hides in the back.  They lie about the wait time and ignore you once they collect your money. I don't care how convenient they are or how many coupons they circulate. Never ever again.

Very reasonably priced! I got penne pasta in alfredo sauce with scallops, clams, and mussels. It was all very delicious. The scallops were huge and everything was very good. I am definitely going to order from here again. The delivery driver was very prompt and respectful.

Waste of $36. Ordered 2 Pasta Maciano's which is penne pasta and chicken with a white sauce. After waiting for some time, it arrived with with no white sauce. Normally I would call and complain but the last time I did, they gave me a coupon to use on my next meal. When I opted to use the used the coupon, I ordered Chicken vodka cream pasta and it arrived without the chicken. Why bother? Never again, I am convinced  this place is poorly managed.

My wife and I have either dined in or delivered from Maciano's in Elgin more than 2 dozen times since they opened. Their opening was a blessing because we don't have many options in terms of delivery. The food is great... when it's not messed up.

The last three orders have had issues. Two of the orders has stuff missing and our last order had MOLD in the salad. The first time I chalked it up as a simple mistake. With the second order, I called to let them know that this was a recurring issue. In the last issue, the mold in the food put an end from ordering from them. After speaking with the manager, they offered a credit, which is a nice gesture but no assurance that things would change. 

Sorry Maciano's, you had 5 stars but now you lost this frequent customer....

We really like Maciano's. It's convenient to where we live and their pizza is the best in west Elgin (sorry Nicks, your za and I don't agree...). Now that Nesler has an in-route to getting to the strip mall, I hope their business as well as Sammy's does well. Anyway... my only beef is that they do not have coupons for dine-in! Everything is take-out only, and we like to eat in at restaurants. Plus it's pure profit on the alcohol... I hope Maciano's is around for a while, their service is outstanding and food is really good for the price.

My wife and I have dined in and had delivery from here on numerous occasions. While the food is typically good they just can NOT seem to get the order right. How hard is it to make a regular size chopped salad with no onion. 1st time they send me a family size tray, another time no chicken, the next time no dressing? I refuse to ever order again. Get some new management and hire/train employees that can comprehend and put together an order. Its a pizza place not a nuclear power plant.. Shame on me for continuing to give them my business.
Great pizza and great service.  We have quit ordering from our other local place due to terrible employees and now exclusively eat here.

This place reminds me of an ol' neighborhood Italian joint from Chicago.  The interior is casual and comfortable, the service is very friendly, the prices are reasonable, and the food is fine and tasty.  It's not fancy-schmancy, but it doesn't try to be, either.  The thin crust pizza is as good or better than anyplace else within a 30-minute drive.  It's a real gem in a non-descript strip mall.

Nothing fancy, just a delicious hot dog stand food!

Kojak's in Cary is kind of a hole in the wall but as far as gyros, hot dogs, and pizza puffs, its good stuff.

Huge Fan! It is not summer unless my family is hitting up Kojak's on a Monday night for some of their delicious $1.25 Chicago dogs night. The restaurant's decor is nothing all that impressive (this is no Portillos) but the food is excellent and way more affordable than Portillos. 

Great food! Highly recommend!

I've been coming here for many years and this place never disappoints. 

I've had the burgers, Italian beefs, Philly cheese steaks, etc. I've never had bad food here. This place always seems to be busy when I go, so now I started placing my order over the phone and picking it up. Seems as if they are pricier then other beef places around as well, but I'm not gonna complain since they serve quality food.

Definitely hole-in-the wall place, but I'm generally not dissuaded by that type of ambiance. Kojak's has an extensive menu with typical hot-dog/Italian beef/gyros lineup, which is common for the Chicago area. The staff was super friendly and cooked everything to order. We got their gyro combo that came with the sandwich, a small side of fries, and a medium drink. It was a very good size sandwich and extremely tasty. The fries were hit or miss, either very good or kind of crunchy. Our daughter had a grilled cheese sandwich, and the few bites that we managed to steal from her were quite delicious. I'll have to stop by again to try other items that seemed appealing on their menu.

I've ate here twice now. First time 2 hot dog special. The hot dogs are average and nothing to talk about. The second time I had the gyros combo meal. Not that good. The gyros needs more spices and was extremely oily. Also they give almost no tzasiki sauce which is rather dissapointing.

If your in a rush and want a cheap tasting hot dog joint, here you go. Otherwise spend your money elsewhere. Just an average stop.

Sorry guys.
This place is the best! Looking for friendly people, the best French fries ever, and the best burger? This is the place for all of that! This food is amazing.

You know I don't like to downgrade but the last 3-4 times here I go there and pick up a carry out orders And they just can't get the order right  and the quality of the food has gone down , I'm probably not coming back anymore it's unfortunate, because this was my place to go for so many years , a time when they new your name or at least acknowledged  that they remembered a returning customer  and made you feel welcomed and they were glad to see you with an occasional handshake Now it's just like they don't care who you are.

Very Very good. Especially for out here!!! Burgers , gyros ( both regular and chicken ) are outstanding.. U can even get gravy bread!!!! Usually have to go back home (city) for that!!!! This place would be good in the city, but out here where food sucks it's FREAKING GREAT! ( Never tried the beef. I'm a beef snob and always get disappointed out here).

Good burgers, authentic Chicago hot dogs and Italian beef.  Prepared fresh when you order. Gyros, cheesesteaks, salads and a lengthy list of tasty fried appetizers like mushrooms, chips, rings, fries, and poppers.  Entrees and cold sandwiches as well. Nice friendly help.
Their delivery is always fast and accurate and their food is amazing. Never failed to disappoint we are frequent fans of kojaks!

I order from here frequently when I'm at work and LOVE IT! I've had many different things (chicken gyro, regular gyro, Greek salad, cheese fries, sweet potato fries, etc) and I've throroughly enjoyed all of it. They deliver pretty quickly, always friendly and a couple of them already know who I am when they walk in. Reasonably priced for a good amount of food. Never been to the actual restaurant but their service is great. I will definitely keep ordering from them.

Wow, drove by this a million times, finally my Dad asked me to take him here. Great Food, reasonable prices, Clean place and a Friendly staff. Don't expect fancy tablecloths or to have your order super fast BUT it's Worth the wait!

I've only been here a few times and have only had the dogs.  This is kind of a plain looking place right past the big curve in downtown Cary.  In fact, I'd driven past it for years and never even noticed it.

But, I did notice it and one day stopped in.  The bottom line is: they have some seriously good dogs, made the right way, and pretty decent fries to accompany them.

And, when you're in the mood for an authentic Chicago-style hot dog, that's really all that matters isn't it?

I'm driving along and all I keep seeing are Jimmy John's franchises.  I'm in the mood for a chicken breast on a pita.  I am getting a little nervous as I hit the Cary border and I haven't noticed a likely fit for my culinary craving.  I should have opened my Yelp app, but I had resigned myself to eating later if something didn't jump out at me on my immediate route.  Before you knew it, there was Kojaks.

We pulled in the parking lot and I couldn't tell from looking at the building if they were open.  But there were cars in the lot, so we walked in.  Everyone working there was very nice.  The gal who took our order even made suggestions when we asked her opinion.  We went with chicken on a pita and gyros.  Both came with a side of fries and a medium drink.  We also added on the kickin' chicken soup since the picture looked so good once I started to breeze through the Yelp photos.

There was a fair amount of seating, so we had our choice of spots to dine-in.  The food didn't take very long and everything was served piping hot just the way I like it.  Especially the soup!  

The pita bread was really fresh!  The chicken was chopped into small pieces and it was cooked nicely, but it had absolutely no seasoning.  I tried the gyros and they were very good.  The strips of meat were nicely cut and not hacked up.  Consistent seems to be an appropriate word to describe the piece of meat.  The tzatziki sauce was one of my favorites ever!  I had one bite of it and it was really, really good.  This was seasoned and had some garlic notes.  It was a great sauce!  The soup...I love soup.  This soup had highs and lows.  Highs were the giant - I mean seriously too big for the spoon - pieces of chicken breast.  There was more than one chicken chunk like this and I was pleased.  The noodles were not overcooked, so that also ranked high.  But, there were large red bell pepper chunks that were unexpected and not appealing to me as well as the use of red pepper flakes to add a sense of heat to the broth.  It took away from what I thought could be a very tasty soup.

A friend was working nearby and he wanted hot dogs, so we grabbed the two dog deal which came with fries and a medium drink.  The total was $7.48 for the hot dog special.  This does not seem reasonably priced for what it was.  The fries here are nothing special.  Frozen, not fresh cut.  The hot dogs and buns were average.  

Overall, it was fine, but I can't say that I would seek them out again.

- Very friendly staff

The Good:
- Chili Dog
- Fries
- Gyros
- Chicken Gyros

The Bad:
???

Heard a bunch of people talking about the deep fried OREO.  Sounded pretty good.

Place was hopping with people, always a good sign.

If you want a waist friendly place then please move on.

Now if what you really want is hot, fresh, yummy OMG I can't do this every week food then this is the place for you.

My family is in the process of moving to the area and we're eating out a bit more than normal.  Right now fast food fits the bill.  This place, with REALLY tasty fast food fits the bill perhaps too well.

The Gyros are fresh and juicy.  The fried mushrooms are standard, but the Italian beef - the heavens parted and the angels sang - well you get the idea.  Add to that friendly cheerful staff who actually appear to enjoy going to work and you have a very positive experience.

I'm kinda sorry this place is actually so close.  It's hard to resist.
Delicious. I always loved this place! There's alot of places to get burgers, gyros, hotdogs etc.. but this will always be one of my favorites!!

I recently moved into Cary, and seen this restaurant down the block from my apartment. I decided to drop in to finally have a taste of Kojaks, and I was very impressed by how clean it is and the portraits on the walls of schools around the neighborhood, it was a nice small place, the staff were very friendly. The register lady was very informative and friendly as well. I ordered a hot dog special. My word... when I got home and took a bite out of that hot dog. It was BLISS... and let me tell you those French fries were to die for!! Very very delicious! I will definitely be coming back for more of their grubs... Love their food quality here. Highly recommend you all to stop by Kojaks sometime. I will also be submitting this as a Ingress Portal, deserves the attention they get. :-)

If you live in or around Cary you probably don't need to read a review about Kojak's (because you've been there!). For everyone else - it's good. And when I say "good" I mean good, not great. Everything is satisfactory, nothing more and nothing less than you would expect from a classic gyro joint. While I have been here well over 10 times, I haven't been very adventurous with the menu. Typically I'll go for a gyro sandwich or gyro plate, but have tried a few other things like salads and some sides. Their menu is pretty big, so if you have kids or are having an office lunch, everyone will be able to find something (even that one coworker who always claims they're on a diet). 

Chili - good flavor, but way too many beans for my liking. 
Gyros - Pretty good. But Mr. Beefy's down the road is better. 
Salads - Surprisingly good for a gyro place. The Southwest Chicken is my favorite. 
Italian Beef - Great choice. A close second after Portillo's. 
Fries - Love them. 

The staff is also super friendly and attentive. :)

I loved  their beef pittas and the chicken  pittas, the hot dogs were great , small  place but good food the gal at the front was very friendly  the only thing  that was little annoying  was the cooks being loud and little  bad mouthed  other than that very good experience
I had the best Italian Beef today.  It was juicy the way I ordered it and tasty.

Used to be one the best places to go for gyros and hotdogs in Cary. Today it is the worst. Slow service, incorrect order and at 1:00 on a Saturday they ran out of fries. It is not worth the money anymore.

Love Kojaks! Fav place to eat in Cary. Just had the gyros platter and it was on fleek. Soo good. Everything fresh and yummy. Love the greek salad with feta. Lettuce is fresh and green, not white outer rind like most other places give.  Only thing is they need their soup year round. Love it! :)

Love this place. I eat here about once a week. I usually get the Gyro but I have tried pretty much everything the menu has to offer. The staff is super friendly and always makes you feel welcome. The food quality and speed is amazing! I would always recommend this place. Got a lot of different items on the menu. My favorites are Gyro, Chicken Gyro, Italian Sausage, and Dollar Dog Mondays! I, however, am not a fan of their Italian Beef, I do not recommend it. It doesn't have enough flavor. (Go to Portillo's in Crystal Lake for a good beef). 

Always a great time and great food! They treat you right here!
Place is BOMB! Delivery is usually pretty quick, too. Been going close to 10 years, and don't plan on stopping soon :)
tiajuana street dog is awesome. will be back for more

Ordered from here last Friday and all I can say is that there staff needs big improvements. An hour after I placed the order someone called  and asked if our order was pickup or delivery I told them delivery. Then five minutes  later the phone rings again telling me that my credit card didn't go through. I read them the card and most of the numbers  were wrong and it went through. Then another five minutes goes by and the phone rings again asking about our order and I'm glad they did because 40% of the order was wrong. I finally  got my food an hour and a half after i placed  the first call if I ever order from here again I'll place my order 24 hours in advance so they have plenty of time to get it right

Holy crap. We were in the area from highland park, fishing at Julian's trout farm, and found this place on yelp. One of best lunches we've ever had. Started with Raw fish tuna tacos. They were perfect. I had a blackened chicken salad which was so good and flavorful. Had lots of veges and a little arugula. Wife had a chicken sandwich that she said was the best she ever had. I'm now eating my kids burger, which is a 10. Washing it down with an anti-hero. Great spot. Great beers and great people working here.
I've never been in there but have ordered for delivery and they have the best Southwest Salad...no joke. I've heard they have good burgers but I'll stick with the salad. I'm serious, it's that good.
I had the best Italian Beef today.  It was juicy the way I ordered it and tasty.

Used to be one the best places to go for gyros and hotdogs in Cary. Today it is the worst. Slow service, incorrect order and at 1:00 on a Saturday they ran out of fries. It is not worth the money anymore.

Love Kojaks! Fav place to eat in Cary. Just had the gyros platter and it was on fleek. Soo good. Everything fresh and yummy. Love the greek salad with feta. Lettuce is fresh and green, not white outer rind like most other places give.  Only thing is they need their soup year round. Love it! :)

Love this place. I eat here about once a week. I usually get the Gyro but I have tried pretty much everything the menu has to offer. The staff is super friendly and always makes you feel welcome. The food quality and speed is amazing! I would always recommend this place. Got a lot of different items on the menu. My favorites are Gyro, Chicken Gyro, Italian Sausage, and Dollar Dog Mondays! I, however, am not a fan of their Italian Beef, I do not recommend it. It doesn't have enough flavor. (Go to Portillo's in Crystal Lake for a good beef). 

Always a great time and great food! They treat you right here!
Place is BOMB! Delivery is usually pretty quick, too. Been going close to 10 years, and don't plan on stopping soon :)
tiajuana street dog is awesome. will be back for more

Ordered from here last Friday and all I can say is that there staff needs big improvements. An hour after I placed the order someone called  and asked if our order was pickup or delivery I told them delivery. Then five minutes  later the phone rings again telling me that my credit card didn't go through. I read them the card and most of the numbers  were wrong and it went through. Then another five minutes goes by and the phone rings again asking about our order and I'm glad they did because 40% of the order was wrong. I finally  got my food an hour and a half after i placed  the first call if I ever order from here again I'll place my order 24 hours in advance so they have plenty of time to get it right

Holy crap. We were in the area from highland park, fishing at Julian's trout farm, and found this place on yelp. One of best lunches we've ever had. Started with Raw fish tuna tacos. They were perfect. I had a blackened chicken salad which was so good and flavorful. Had lots of veges and a little arugula. Wife had a chicken sandwich that she said was the best she ever had. I'm now eating my kids burger, which is a 10. Washing it down with an anti-hero. Great spot. Great beers and great people working here.
I've never been in there but have ordered for delivery and they have the best Southwest Salad...no joke. I've heard they have good burgers but I'll stick with the salad. I'm serious, it's that good.

Perfect food for what it is-inexpensive burgers/sandwiches/gyros/hotdogs type place. Food is REALLY good, delivery is shockingly fast and everything I've had there is delicious. I want to give it a lower rating because having yummy food delivered to me really fast on the cheap is dangerous...but sounds like my personal issue.

Kojak's has good food and a huge variety. There may be better hot dogs, beefs or gyros out there at different establishments, but collectively Kojak's is hard to beat. Great for the mom or dad whose family likes different things for dinner - you can get them all here and leave knowing that you'll enjoy a good meal. There's only one other place like this in the area (Mr Beefy's) and it doesn't compare.

Now, ordinarily I wouldn't give a hot dog stand five stars - realistically hot dogs ARE hot dogs and there's not that much difference between them. However, where Kojak's earns its fifth star is their support of the community. They sponsor high school groups and youth teams. And they were very supportive of an event supporting area non-profits that I was involved with, so I've seen their graciousness first-hand.

Bottomline - any place that offers good food and generously steps up to support the community they do business in will always get my business. By the way, Brunch Cafe in FRG is operated by the same ownership and also actively supports the community.

2 words: Chicken Gyro.  Yum.  A Kojak delight.

Good hot dogs, generous greek salads with feta cheese and kalamata olives, flame grilled burgers.  Parking lot can get crammed at rush times.  They have an outdoor deck with a few tables and umbrellas in pleasant weather.
A decent place, with a friendly and helpful staff, but the food wasn't anything special.  Tried the hot dogs, gyros, and Italian beef - they were all good, but just good, nothing special.

Kojak's is a must stop for anyone cruising by on route 14. The family that owns and operates this place really cares about their customers and takes the time to get to know your name if you allow them to. I am always greeted with a smile and hows your family doing? I have been eating their Gyros since they have opened and can't find many that compare! They give large portions of food, bring your appetite. They deliver and cater too. 
The owners also own The Brunch in Fox River Grove...a must stop for breakfast just off of Route 14 on route 22.

Sometimes you just forget to Yelp about your regular everyday places. I cannot count the number of times I have been to Kojaks in Cary because I have literally been going there on average once per week since they opened their doors. But I can count the number of times I have been disappointed... ZERO. If you are in the neighborhood and in the mood for a sandwich, this is the only place to go. They have just about every type of kind of sandwich you can possibly think of (not just hot dogs) and they do them all up right. Even the dinner and salad items are very good for a fast food restaurant. If you're in the mood, the shakes and malts are as good as you will find anywhere. To top it all off, it's a friendly family run operation.  You cannot go wrong with Kojaks.

Used to frequent Kojacks all the time. It was a great place with great food, great service and friendly people. Never a complaint or wrong food in at least the 10 years we've been going there. In the last 3 months, poor service, higher prices and wrong orders. Just not the same place with the new owners. Cannot recommend Kojacks anymore. So sad to see an old staple of Cary start to go bad.
Great Food! But getting a little pricey lately.
Good atmosphere. It's the kind of place that CG high school kids hang out after a basketball or football game. Nice friendly people. Food is just OK though.

A total go-to place for hot dogs, burgers, fries, gyros, and other fried items. But don't miss their dinners either: their chicken kabobs are the best in the area (just ask for them well done) and their shrimp basket ain't half bad either. As Elizabeth noted the menu here is larger than one would expect from such a small place.

Service is fast and friendly, and prices are good. Delivery is quick; we've never had a botched order from them.

All in all, Kojak's is a winner!

Stopped by early one evening.   The menu is huge and has a little bit of everything for everyone.   Most of the people I saw here were greeted by name..  so that tells me this place has a loyal following.    I saw Moms picking up dinner..  High schoolers and folks from the train stopped for a quick bite before going home.      Food was good...   tasty.     If I was driving by,...  I would definitely stop in !

Just had dinner here. Yum! Tried the cheeseburger which comes with grilled onions, pickles, ketchup and mustard (i added lettuce) and it has a nice grilled bun. Very good. My husband got the Chicken Gryos that had honey mustard, lettuce and tomato, i think? We both enjoyed our meals.  Fries were also good, very hot and crisp. I think just the frozen kind you would expect at this type of place. 

Keep in mind...they close early though, we got there just before 8:00pm not knowing they closed then.  The guys were very friendly though and never made us feel rushed even though we were there late.

We've ordered take-out and delivery many, many times with both small orders and large ones covering seven people or more. They get it right every time and delivery is always fast. 

We're still trying to get through the entire menu to find something that isn't good. That's the quandary- if you order the massive gyro built for two you might be missing out on the chicken sandwich or the Reuben. Then there's there the fried chicken dinner that is just mouth watering. The burgers aren't half bad either. 

They are consistently good with friendly service and and we love, love, love their delivery!

Kojacks has a very fiendly staff and great food. Their burgers are juicy and delicious. My son loves the bacon burger. My wife enjoys the gyros, while I like the Italian beef. I would recommend Kojacks to anyone who wants good food served by friendly people that know you.

If you want a french dip or a dog in Cary, this is the place to go.  The hot dogs are true Chicago style.  Lots of carry-out service, and they deliver!  The burgers are nothing to write home about, but if you have kids, the corn dog will make them giggly.  The shakes are also good.  It's kind of a dumpy but clean atmosphere with only a few small tables -- takey outie is preferred.  The staff is fast, friendly, patient and pleasant.  The gyros plate will easily feed two.  If you're craving a dog in Cary, this is the place to go.
Friendly place.  Pretty good food.  The only thing exceptional about the place is the sense of community you get there.  Warm and fuzzy at Kojak's.
Kojak's is great and has something for just about everyone. Just remember that they are not open on Sundays.

Love the gyros!  We usually get one order of a gyro with fries and split it between the two of us, and it's still plenty of food. I always ask for extra sauce though because (1) it's so good and (2) they can sometimes be a tad stingy with it. We also usually skip the onions because they tend to be VERY strong.  Only bad thing is that they are closed on Sundays.
Everything great here. Best fries and beef in the county. Closed on Sundays only bad part.

This is my husbands favorite place. I love the little house and the whole feel of it. Problem is, if we ate here more than once a mth, would wouldn't make it to see 40. But that is to be expected and its amazing! Its a must go!

Just had dinner here. Yum! Tried the cheeseburger which comes with grilled onions, pickles, ketchup and mustard (i added lettuce) and it has a nice grilled bun. Very good. My husband got the Chicken Gryos that had honey mustard, lettuce and tomato, i think? We both enjoyed our meals.  Fries were also good, very hot and crisp. I think just the frozen kind you would expect at this type of place. 

Keep in mind...they close early though, we got there just before 8:00pm not knowing they closed then.  The guys were very friendly though and never made us feel rushed even though we were there late.

We've ordered take-out and delivery many, many times with both small orders and large ones covering seven people or more. They get it right every time and delivery is always fast. 

We're still trying to get through the entire menu to find something that isn't good. That's the quandary- if you order the massive gyro built for two you might be missing out on the chicken sandwich or the Reuben. Then there's there the fried chicken dinner that is just mouth watering. The burgers aren't half bad either. 

They are consistently good with friendly service and and we love, love, love their delivery!

Kojacks has a very fiendly staff and great food. Their burgers are juicy and delicious. My son loves the bacon burger. My wife enjoys the gyros, while I like the Italian beef. I would recommend Kojacks to anyone who wants good food served by friendly people that know you.

If you want a french dip or a dog in Cary, this is the place to go.  The hot dogs are true Chicago style.  Lots of carry-out service, and they deliver!  The burgers are nothing to write home about, but if you have kids, the corn dog will make them giggly.  The shakes are also good.  It's kind of a dumpy but clean atmosphere with only a few small tables -- takey outie is preferred.  The staff is fast, friendly, patient and pleasant.  The gyros plate will easily feed two.  If you're craving a dog in Cary, this is the place to go.
Friendly place.  Pretty good food.  The only thing exceptional about the place is the sense of community you get there.  Warm and fuzzy at Kojak's.
Kojak's is great and has something for just about everyone. Just remember that they are not open on Sundays.

Love the gyros!  We usually get one order of a gyro with fries and split it between the two of us, and it's still plenty of food. I always ask for extra sauce though because (1) it's so good and (2) they can sometimes be a tad stingy with it. We also usually skip the onions because they tend to be VERY strong.  Only bad thing is that they are closed on Sundays.
Everything great here. Best fries and beef in the county. Closed on Sundays only bad part.

This is my husbands favorite place. I love the little house and the whole feel of it. Problem is, if we ate here more than once a mth, would wouldn't make it to see 40. But that is to be expected and its amazing! Its a must go!

I would give this place a 6 star if I could! 
It was ABSOLUTELY amazing, and they didn't like when they said everything was organic and freshly made (they even said they don't have a microwave in the back!) 
This place used the be a food truck before it became a restaurant, and frankly I am glad it wasn't a truck that I had to find and I know exactly where it will be the next time that I want to eat here. 

The inside of the restaurant is cute! Nice and trendy. I came here for a quick lunch and the service was great, and quick. I really want to come back with a group of friends to eat and have some beer. I noticed there was a selection of craft beer there that I want to try! 

The gringo was a fried taco and it was super flavorful, and the aioli sauce on the shrimp taco and the veggie taco was fresh and flavorful. One thing that I liked about this place was the menu, each taco is sold individually (like a food truck) so you have the option of eating just one, or FIVE depending on how hungry you are, and you have the ability to mix and match.

My whole group very much enjoyed Fired It Up Fusion Tacos. I loved that everything was local and organic. There were different taco fusion taco options. My favorite was the shrimp won tons. They were so food and fresh and i could have had that as my lunch. 

Others at my table ordered tacos with shrimp as well as the remoulade. I tried another taco which was okay for me.  My hunny had the truck ir in other words burrito. It was very huge and tasty. 

I loved the indoor and outdoor set up here. Our server was cool. Their lemonade is also home made and it made everything just right.

In case you are in the area, check them out. They also have a location in nearby Naperville.

So right out the gate I'm a regular at the old Aurora location. Mind you I was excited about the move to Naperville, but that excitement was extinguished by my first visit. 


The hostess greeted us and took us to our table, and on the approach a very rude server runs up and yells at the host "You're not putting them there! Put them somewhere else!" And the poor stunned hostess didn't know what to do. She asked the server "Well where should I put them?" To which the unpleasant server replied "I don't care but not here"

So I get it. There's an eleven top waiting for space, but don't scream at the hostess in front of the guest. Later when that eleven top got sat they didn't even end up at that table. So clearly the hostess had things in hand. The server was more concerned with getting the eleven top. 

So we get sat outside. Not my preference, but the flustered host was trying to recover. 

Then we sit. And sit. And sit some more. Finally the server comes over. Asks if this is our first time at FIU. WE SAY NO. He proceeds to explain the concept. Okay. Whatever. 

Next he asks if we want to put in a drink order. I ask what beers are on tap. He says to me "We only have local beers and you probably don't know what they are..."

Excuse me? I can tell you all the local brewers, their regular beers and seasonal beers. Now the server doesn't know this, but I'm pissed. 

So I ask well what do you have. He begins rattling off styles of beer "I've got two IPAs, a double bock, an American IPA, and a Farmhouse Pale Ale"

Well first off it's a doppelbock. And not all IPAs are the same. So I ask what breweries, and his response ... "I don't know"

So you believe I'm too stupid to know the local beers, and then can't be bothered to tell me the breweries? Fine. I'll have the Farmhouse because right now Solemn Oath has Hexafoos, and my guess is that's what you meant when you said Farmhouse Pale Ale. I hope I'm not too stupid to figure that out. 

Food comes and it tastes bland. Like I said I'm used to Aurora. I know what the food tastes like. This isn't it. 

We eat, and wait forever for the server to come back to get the check. The check shows an IPA. 

Okay. I give up. I'm too stupid to know the local beers, but you're too stupid to enter the right beer? Without a doubt I had a Hexafoos.

I won't be going back because of the insulting, arrogant, incompetent staff and the underwhelming food. 

I also will not be going to Naperville anymore. See my other review as to why I won't be going there. This place should change their name to FuckItUp Tacos. They had a good thing going, but now it's apparently time to watch success burn for the sheer fun of it. Hope the fire keeps you warm!

Best tacos ever. Amazing unique flavors. The shrimp wontons are my favorite. They sometimes have unique tacos like an Italian beef taco. Love the concept and I think it's probably one of the better restaurants in Wheaton.

We had the guacamole and chips. The chips were very good as well as the guacamole. 
 We really liked the chop house tacos! They were tasty and spicy! The chicken tacos were really good too! They have a homemade jalapeo- habanero salsa which is sweet at first and then the heat kicks in. Wow! Great food and it's organic!! Awesome!

"I want the cheeseburger taco and the gringo taco to get married and have babies together." 

I mentioned this to the dude (one of the cooks, I think?) who brought us our tacos and he was in complete agreement and said he needed to give that a try. I hope that someday that makes it onto the menu because DAMN that would be good. Those are totally my two favorite tacos here and you know what they say about two great tastes that taste great together...no, wait, that was peanut butter and chocolate or something muddled in my 80s-brain. 

Here's what's great about the new Wheaton Fire It Up location. I mean, in addition to the already awesome food. There's more space than the Naperville location so you don't have as long of a wait. 

Last night, my wife and I stopped by for some pre-Thanksgiving Taco Tuesday grubbin' and left full and happy after indulging in a couple of cocktails, the parmesan chips and guac, and a round of tacos. 

Our waiter was super friendly, and tho I don't often use the phrase "chill" he was super chill. We had a slight speed bump in the fact that our chips were stale when they arrived. We were so hungry that we ate almost all of them anyway before I had a chance to mention they were stale, but when I did he brought us an entire fresh order complete with more guac. After that, you know we were feelin' guacy. (I need you guys to embrace that as a phrase. K thnx). 

The tacos were just as awesome as Naperthrill, and we stuffed ourselves on shrimp, pork, cheeseburger and gringo. All delicious. All prepared fresh and done extremely well. 

I'm not sure if we'll return to this location based on distance from our house, but the size of the place definitely has something going for it and it's absolutely just as great as their other location. I hope FIU continues expanding and perhaps will open a location in my backyard someday.

No wait...that might be bad.

Disappointing. I don't even know where to begin. 

When I first saw the menu, I was excited about having pablano  gauc -I'm a vegetarian, so avocados and pablanos are two of my absolutely favorite things. I then read some reviews, and I saw a few people say how the menu was too simple, or rather, every taco tasted the same, with a big dependency on the alioi. I've make alioi myself and have always enjoyed it, so I thought it might be a fun adventure. I also read about the Parmesan chips, and how they tasted stale. Again, I was up for trying something new.

When we arrived, at 5:30 on a Friday, the place was filled. The host was very nice and asked if we wanted to wait for a table or eat at the bar. We said we'd wait at the bar for a table. The place had a nice vibe, the  bartender was very friendly. In all, it seemed nice.

We were told we'd have to wait 45 minutes, and we only  had to wait 10. Again, nice.

Then we got our gauc and chips. I make guac at least once a week. Fresh gauc isn't watery, it has chunks in it. It isn't  a paste. This was...like store bought gauc. Making matters worse, it had a level of spice and heat to it, but it didn't taste anything like a pablano.  Hubby immediately said, your guac is a million times better. It needed pablano flavor and salt..and actual avocado.  The chips?  What are they thinking. They are soggy and stale tasting. Seriously. Not our thing at all.

We then got our tacos. They looked good. I had a pablano and a veggie. Hubby had a poor boy and a gringo. We also split a beans and rice. The beans and rice were the only truly interesting part of dinner and they were oily. It was basmati rice with a lot of cumin and beans. It  reminded hubby of a curry of sorts.  The tacos? Both of mine tasted the same. They were the same, save for the one having cabbage and the other having mushrooms.  Hubby kind of enjoyed his gringo, but he couldn't eat his poor boy.  he said we make better tacos at home (lamb carnitas  being a favorite of his).

We finally decided that it was nice to try something new, but we wished we went to  Bien Truche or its sister restaurant.  Way better, and way more innovative and delicious. 

We will not be going back. When we want to just pick up tacos, we will go to Los Burritos.

This place might be a good taco truck, but a restaurant charging a reasonable amount of money? Skip it and head to Geneva or Glen Ellyn.

I was looking for some quick eats and found FIU as great place for that on an early Saturday evening. I had been to the Naperville location a few years back and didn't really find it that great, so I was hoping a different location might be a better experience. 

Had a seat at the bar and the server was great. I couldn't decide on what to order so I went with my servers suggestion and enjoyed my order.  

The Chophouse taco (steak, Portobello, onion, cabbage and the house spicy sauce) and the Shrimp taco (shrimp, cabbage, lemon aioli).  Both were very flavorful, using fresh ingredients and cooked well.  I loved the bit of spice in the Chophouse and added a bit more with the sauces provided. 

I wish there was more of a craft beer/cocktail menu, but I liked that the craft beer they did have were from local breweries.

At last... patio dining at its finest. I've been a fan of the taco fusion creator since my first elite event in January 2014. I am a fan of their unique specials. The current chicken pesto club didn't disappoint, just available through Mother's Day.

A fresh Margarita sure hit the spot today on the patio. You'll be pleased they have a full bar here anx the patio is the perfect setting to enjoy tacos. During the week the lunch special is a great value, but don't forget Sangria Saturday's.

Fresh, local, organic is the Fire It Up way, always has been from their food truck beginning. Bring in a group and get yourself a rail. And don't forget the Fire It Up sauce.

Found this place on yelp when passing through town. Totally unique with lots of "small college town" charm. Probably best for couples or folks wanting a few drinks. I had my young daughter with me so we just got a couple of unique tacos off the limited menu. They were delicious - but messy! - and we enjoyed a nutritious and light lunch for like $15 total! Would return if we get back to Wheaton.

Everyone I bring here loves Fire It Up as much as I do! From Sangria Saturday to Parmesan Herb Tortilla Chips to Quinoa Salad to the Veggie Truck (my favorite: 2 meals for $9), the VERY fresh, local, organic ingredients are outstanding!
Meat-eaters will love the Cheeseburger Tacos. The only warning: They play their music VERY LOUDLY, and refuse to turn it down, always citing the manager and owner who are not present, even if you are the only party there. Hard to converse inside or on the patio when you have to shout.

First off the atmosphere and service was amazing. We sat outside and enjoyed a delightful dinner.

The margaritas were very good and fresh. The chips and guacamole were delicious as well. The guacamole was extremely fresh. 

We ordered the Rail, it comes with 4 different types of tacos with three of each. We ordered the chophouse, shrimp, bbq pork, and the steak. Each taco was served on a flour tortilla and came with coleslaw on it. 

The chophouse was actually our least favorite. It had a spicy sauce on it and mushrooms. But compared to the others it was just not as good. 

The shrimp was our favorite. The shrimp were extremely fresh and had a great flavor.

The bbq pork was also amazing. The pork was juicy and full of flavor and the combination with the coleslaw and flour tortilla worked well.

The steak taco was good as well. More along the lines of a classic steak taco. Good flavor and the steak was juicy.

Overall the food was alright. I would definitely go back to enjoy a margarita on the outside patio.

Cute place!  Old building they rehabbed it and they got it right!  Love the outside seating area, nice shady area, perfect for a warm Summer Day.

One of the partners waited on his and he was so enthusiastic to tell us about how the place came to be.  

They have a lunch special of two tacos and one side for $8 which is a screaming deal for organic, local, fresh and clean food.  They don't have a soda fountain.  They make their own lemonade, iced tea and their margarita mix is made by hand.  Can't wait to bring my husband here for their huge selection of beers.  Remember they started out as a food truck outside a brewery.

Food is delicious!  Start with the parm chips and guac.  You can't go wrong with any of the tacos.  Shrimp poorboy and BBQ pork were delicious!  

When you re done with lunch, check-out the resale shop on the corner.  Fun place to browse and they had some unique offerings.

Wheaton has come a long way from its dry days in the 1980's!

I've probably been to Fire It Up a dozen times since it opened, and I love the food, warm reception and style of the place. The quality of the food has been consistently great, and the service always feels personal - not creepy personal, quite the opposite - it feels friendly and organic rather than sterile or cheesy.

I haven't had anything there that I haven't liked, and I've eaten three-quarters of the items on the menu - not all at one time of course.

I'll keep coming back! Careful with the hot sauce. 

AC

Our favorite new taco place. Good vibe, decent prices and really good tacos. We've been a few times now and our favorite is the chophouse taco followed by the pork and shrimp. Really, though, we've tried all tacos so far except the fried one and we love them all. Guac and chips are also good. Just wish you could get a few chips and some salsa for free or a half size of these starters, which are really too big for two people.

Service is good, but it would be nice if they automatically brought waters to the table. We've had to ask each time. 

Go on Saturday for their special sangrias. Really good and nice in this hot weather.

I'm starting to think that Fire It Up puts some sort of highly addicting drug in their hot sauce, because I find myself dreaming about their tacos (drowning in their amazing and tongue searing sauce) all the time.

Both the Naperville and Wheaton locations are virtually identical, except that the Wheaton locale is a bit snazzier inside, is located steps away from Wheaton College, and has a bar at which you can sit while you eat your delicious tacos.

Highly recommended to those who are in love with tacos, hot sauce, and/or local beer. I mean seriously, how can you go wrong with that combination?

It's always nice having new places to eat during my trips back home to the burbs! We went to Fire It Up on Mothers Day and sat outside on the patio. Started with drinks and the margarita was so fresh! Pretty sweet, definitely hard to have more than one, but definitely worth a try. The chips and guac were amazing, there is something about those perfectly fried chips with parmesan that is so addicting! Tacos were speciality and very street taco style (which is my favorite). Try the steak taco and the shrimp taco and I guarantee you won't regret it!

Got takeout from here tonight, as we were so excited to find out there was a Fire It Up in Wheaton. The Naperville location is 5-star amazing and I was pumped to find a location closer to home. I ordered my usual order from the Naperville location: chips and guac, a gringo taco, a cheeseburger taco, and a BLT taco. The chips, the amazing incredible delicious Parmesan dusted chips I am OBSESSED with at the Naperville location, were... Off. They were so greasy that they weren't crunchy, but almost chewy. They were bendable. They were still parm dusted, but there was a ton of parm at the bottom of the dish, too. The guac was brownish at the edges of the container. The gringo taco was just so greasy it was almost inedible. Even the BLT taco was greasy from the single strip of bacon on it. 

Typically I would say this is my own fault for getting takeout, but I get takeout at the other location, further from my house, and it arrives perfect, consistently. I guess this is what i get for  choosing convenience over reliability. I may check this place out again if I'm right in Wheaton, but otherwise, the schlep out to the edges of Naperville for perfect chips and fresh guac is well worth it.
Went on beautiful Sunday afternoon. Tacos not very flavorful and some just really not good flavor combos.  I would not recommend at all

Excellent place! Very friendly staff and very personable. Our server was very informative and helped us decide what to get! We ordered the Cuban rolls for an appetizer, it was awesome!
