I had a steak taco and a cheeseburger taco both were excellent! My wife had a BBQ pork taco and a chop house taco which she enjoyed! She also had a white sangria, which she liked it but complained to me that it was drier and sourer then she likes. (she prefers sweet sangrias) otherwise we both enjoyed our dinner date there.
Not worth the price for the portions you get. Completely disappointed with this place.

I went there for the first time this week, but went with some family that are regulars. Around 6pm on Taco Tuesday, and they were able to nearly immediately seat a table for 7. 

Quick and friendly service, tasty food - sounds good to me. 

I'm sure some could think it's a tad pricey for individual tacos ($3.50-$4.25) that aren't huge, but I do like that it's locally sourced and organic, so I get it. Taco Tuesday helps with the price a bit though. 

Between our group we tried just about every taco. BBQ pork was definitely a hit. Shrimp Po' Boy had a nice kick. 

Overall, I'll definitely be back!

Love this place! 

Came here for lunch and loved every bite I took! 

As an appetizer started off with the Cuban rolls. These are spicy...So if you don't like spicy these aren't for you.  If you like spice..you won't regret it! 

For tacos.. Gringo taco is the best! It truly melts in your mouth!

Lastly.. Parmesan chips r amazing! 

If you are in the Wheaton area or Naperville check this place out! 

All fresh ingredients too! That's a plus

Sooooo....can you just cut and paste my review from the other Fire It Up location to right here? No, I can't be a big old lazy? Okay.

I've been to this new location twice and it's completely consistent in quality and FLAVORS. Flavors are in all caps because they are that good. My go-to favorites are the Big Truck and the BBQ pork tacos, but guess what? Everything is ridiculously good. The hot sauce is incredible. The staff is friendly and the place looks real nice.

What's great about this specific location is the new space - it has a really cute enclosed outdoor patio. It's practically snowing now, but I can easily see myself drinking margaritas in the sunshine before taking a train home (College Ave train station is steps away). Unfortunately I don't think that train line goes anywhere near my house, so I will need to move.

This place is great! To begin, our table ordered two appetizers -guacamole and shrimp wontons. Although the guacamole was good, the wontons were so much better. 
Most everyone ordered tacos and were happy. Some tacos were better than others but all were good. People were happy.
I ordered the shrimp quinoa salad and that rocked! It had a blend of flavors i would not have known to put together and it was amazing. So good i actually thought about going back today (the day after eating there). 
We also ordered the brownie chimichanga bites which were the perfect size for each person to end the evening with a last bite of yumminess. Just so good.
Of course all this great food was served by a great waitress ( thanks Emily) and came out fast at the proper temp. Really enjoyed the meal :)

This place was so tasty!  All of their ingredients and selections are local and organic!  They used to be a good truck and popped up into this place with tasty craft beers and all kinds of tacos.  The best taco I had was the Chophouse for sure!! 

The staff was great and they were so accommodating about getting us a table on the outdoor patio!  Yum!  Thanks, Fire It Up!  What a pleasant surprise on a random Friday evening!
Yum!  The beef spring roll was amazing... Gringo & BBQ Pork tacos both solid choices.  Friendly staff.
Great place. Glad that it's on other side of Wheaton. Not in Danada where everything else is. Tacos are the best. Will be back 100%

Several years ago, I was lucky enough to dine at Fire It Up in Naperville as part of a Yelp event. Fast forward to now, and I have since been to the Naperville location multiple times, with a variety of friends, and recommended it more times than I can remember! 

Now, enter: Wheaton! What a great location! I was so happy to hear that what was once a food truck now has a second restaurant in a downtown location, again next to the train!

Fire It Up in Wheaton does not disappoint! The decor and ambiance is the same if not improved - it's a beautiful location, and Julie and Rick did a fantastic job of decorating the new spot to match it's Naperville locale. The outdoor patio dining is a great addition! There is a full bar complete with seating here, which is a great add as well!

The food and service is fantastic, as I would expect! The menu is the same - why mess with perfection?? Head over to my review of the Naperville location for food-specific reviews but in short: don't miss the shrimp won ton appetizer!!

My wife and I have been going here for months, and we can't get enough of this place! The space itself has an industrial yet casual vibe, and the staff is great. The gal who typically is at the hostess podium is so nice and looks like Arya Stark from Game of Thrones. We've also had the pleasure of having Bill (probably the most personable waiter we've ever had) and Grace as our waiters like 95% of the time, and they're awesome.

Now for the food, it's our go-to taco spot. We really like the guac and chips, appreciate the local beer selection and use of organic ingredients, and LOVE the tacos (get them with corn tortillas). My personal favorite is the Cheeseburger Taco. Sweet jeebus, it tastes so crisp and the mayo compliments the meat and cheese so well! Also, their special salsa will always be part of my meal as I cant help but squeeze that ish' all over my tacos and chips. It has this sweet start and the finish has an even-handed heat to it that I cant get enough of. 

The wifey and I are lifers for this place!

I want to really love this place, but:

The tacos are WAY overdressed with with greens.  There is literally a mini-salad on each one.  This isn't necessarily a terrible thing, and I get it - it's a cheap and healthy way to add bulk and make it look like you're getting a lot of bang for your buck.  But there's really no variation from taco to taco.  The same mixed greens - everywhere, in abundant qualities.  This makes it difficult to savor the really high quality, locally sourced meats that they're using.  The steak they used was tender and well-seasoned, but it was hard to realize that with a mouth full of lettuce.

We tried six different tacos, and overall they were pretty decent.  The least successful were the shrimp (overcooked and rubbery), the veggie (mostly just rice with a hearty helping of the aforementioned greens; not very exciting) and the BBQ pork (sauce was a little too sweet and there was a little too much of it).  The steak was great, though - and the sauce on the southwest chicken was amazing.  

Chips were good, salsa was good.... sangria was delicious and the margaritas are strong.

As far as service goes - our waitress was attentive but not obnoxiously so.  The stool seating is not very comfortable, but since this isn't really a place that you're going to linger for a long time, I guess that's okay.  It would be nice if there were hooks for coats or purses, though.

Patio looks fun, so I'll probably be back when it warms up!

Great tacos and atmosphere! If youre looking for authentic Mexican tacos, this isnt the place. However, the food here is incredible and different. The chips and guac are a must. Also try the Gringo Taco with a deep fried tortilla.

As expected, a big win for me. I'm a regular of their Naperville location and I've never been disappointed, I was in the area and thought I'd stop in this one to see what it was like. It's obviously bigger than the Naperville location, but not overwhelming. With ample outdoor seating which will be nice when that season comes! I ordered the gringo, cheeseburger and BLT tacos the gringo and cheeseburger I get every time because they are amazing but my third I like to switch up. Everything tasted freaking great! My boyfriend always gets the truck with the hot sauce and just raves about that too. My one and only complaint here is they make super weak margaritas and taste like I'm just drinking the syrup. Not good, and at 8 bucks a pop I expect more, think about it, if you make them decent, meaning I can actually taste the tequila then I will most definitely order another one. But I left drink only about half. Don't come here for those unless they decided to be better at it. I decided to not let that effect my 5 star rating because it's not like I went there for the booze. So just a heads up on that, hit up a bar after for booze. All in all great job guys your still my favorite taco joint!

I do not get all these 5-star reviews AT ALL. I would have rated this place 1-star if it weren't for the waitress who seemed flustered but very sweet. 
I came here last week with a few people & we were very, very disappointed in this place.
I live nearby so I've been wanting to check it out for awhile. We came around 7pm on a Wednesday & weren't greeted promptly. When we were greeted, about 5 minutes later..we were told it would be a half hour wait even though there were open tables & no one else waiting. After about 15 minutes I asked if we could at least sit down & order drinks. The hostess then informs us the reason she didn't seat us is because "the kitchen is backed up". OK...but can we sit down?! (we won't order food for awhile if the chefs need a little more time)...... She then seats us.

We order a few drinks, some sangria & a couple on-tap beers. (nothing wrong here, the drinks were good).
Then, about 15 mins later we each order about 3 tacos each. Which, as I'd like to mention..none of them really appealed to us. It seems all of the tacos on the menu have mayo..or aioli or some other sauce they are drenched in. I understand this is a 'fusion' restaurant but the menu lacks restraint. That's already a red flag.

Fast forward 50 minutes...YES 50... We finally get our tacos.

I can handle a long wait on food if it's worth it but these tacos...were AWFUL. The flour tortilla's they serve are not homemade & pretty bad quality to start. They really skimp on the actual meats- and add a lot of fillers like lettuce & sauces. I could make better tacos at home. 

If you go to this place...walk right back out and head down the street to 'a toda madre' where your money will be well spent.  Won't be returning here unless it's solely for drinks.

Possibly the worst chips and guac I've ever had. I have a hard time figuring out if the chips were stale or if the oil wasn't hot enough and made the chips an oily, soft mess. You shouldn't be able to bend chips without breaking them. Thank goodness I had a margarita to wash the taste away. Wait a second......where's the salt on my glass? There it is! It's on a slice of lime floating in the glass. How unusual! How unique! How dumb! There's a reason why restaurants don't put the salt on a lime floating in the glass. It's because the salt is meant to be tasted with each sip without having to shove your fingers into the glass to pick up the lime and lick it.  

The tacos are actually decent, but not outstanding. The Cheeseburger taco is an actual cheeseburger in a flour tortilla. The Gringo has a (very) deep fried flour tortilla and it's pretty good. 

Summary: If you're a foodie expecting something like Big Star, stay away. If you're a person with more simple tastes, give it a try. If the chips weren't so awful I'd rate this place a 3.5.

This is probably my favorite place to go with the family for healthy food.  My husband and I have literally tried everything on the menu and our favorite tacos are probably the chophouse, barbeque pork, gringo and portabella.  They also have great salads and the chips and guacamole are a must have every time we go!  My husband, a fan of craft beer, also has fun trying new beers as they change their beer menu occasionally.  Fire it Up will not disappoint!

Came in just as they opened on a Friday and was seated right away. The Parmesan chips were really good and I ordered the chicken taco and the bbq port taco. The chicken taco is very mild but flavorful, while the bbq pork has a lot of flavor, not the hot kind, just the good kind. Very impressed with the food integrity and local sourcing. The presentation is good and the staff is friendly. I will definitely be back here.
Excellent chips, very light and flaky. Good Guacamole. Although, I dont drink, the craft beers seem popular. Outdoor patio.  Tacos are great.

Everything was fantastic! Service, cleanliness, ambience, value, and quality were all fabulous. I know it is a reach to compare Wheaton/Naperville to Detroit but the whole experience reminded me of the restaurants of the downtown Detroit revitalization. A little bit on the hipster side but warm and welcoming with just outstanding food. The Spicy Cuban rolls, parmesan herb'd chips, and steak tacos were top of my list!. Definitely a destination restaurant.

When traveling, I always like to try local places. Today, I chose Fire It Up.

The service was great and tacos were good. 

This is a quaint little place that locally sources, including their beer. I ordered the following:

Half Acre Pony Pilsner - this was a nice local beer, lighter, yummy.

Chips and Guac - the Guac was fresh and tasty. The chips were Parmesan dusted. They were ok, kind of bland. 

2 tacos- Taco Tuesday! I order one with Bbq pork. Good flavor, sweet & crispy from the cabbage. The second, steak & mushroom with a little bite. Both had a nice mix of taste and texture, filling.

Lastly, the music was spot on with my taste. Started with 311 (love them!), Incubus, Weezer, the Gorillaz, Beck, RHCP, etc. good music is always a win for me. 

Try them out! Worth it!
Atmosphere is great nice for a small place. They also have a nice outside patio.The service was great with friendly people. The food is good as they use organic ingredients.

Up front I gotta say they need to work on their organization. I came in with my wife and two small children and it is very frustrating to see the same size group sit down at the same time as us and they get drinks and appetizers before we even got our drinks. 

That being said, these are quite possibly the best tacos I've ever had. Not traditional, that's for sure but everything is pumped so full of flavor. They marinate everything and every taco has their own special sauce. I realized halfway through my three tacos that I haven't even been putting the awesome homemade hot sauce on them!

They also have a great beer selection ND the chimichanga desert is to die for.

Definitely recommend checking this place out.

Went in on a Saturday @11:45am and were sat right away. We had a great waitress. We had an appetizer of parmesan chips and guacamole - very average and chips were not warm and had very little flavor. 
It took nearly 45 min to get our burrito and 2 tacos... the tortillas were cool to touch. Hard to believe they have/had food trucks with turn-around times like that. 
Average meal.  I hope they just a had a bad day and are better than our visit, especially with so many other great options out there.

My wife and I stopped in here last night for dinner. Being from Wheaton, there are a lot of nice places to eat, but the choices are limited when it comes to finding restaurants with fresh and satisfying options that offer a nice atmosphere. This place exceeded out expectations. The service, food, drinks and atmosphere are all top notch. They serve Mexican style options with a creative twist sure to fit anyone's tastebuds.   I put this restaurant at the top of the casual options in Wheaton.

The place I have been searching for my whole life.  Craft beers and nacho everyday tacos and burritos?  Yes please.  Margaritas were fresh made, so many tacos I couldn't decide, and a friendly laid back atmosphere.  Chips and fresh chunky guac almost had me filled up before dinner came.  I actually had the 'truck' burrito which had a little bit of everything in it and was a different bite every time.  Family ordered a few different tacos and I tried them all and everything was fresh and tasty.  Cant wait to go back and sit outside.

The chips were stale.  The Margarita was way too salty.  The flour tortillas tasted like cheap flour tortillas you can buy at the store.  Corn tortillas were not bad.  I won't be going back.  If you're looking for the best tacos in Wheaton, go to Mi Casa.
Tacos were outstanding.   Margaritas are incredible.  Grace is the best server ever.  Try this place you wont be disappointed.
Fernando was our waiter and was great. Helped with choices and information. Food was delicious and fresh. I had a salad with shrimp added. Wonderful! Chips and guacamole quite tasty

I was at the train station 20 minutes early while headed downtown for a late meeting and noticed that there is finally a  restaurant near the college avenue Metra station.  The food is awesome. They have good beer at the bar, in Wheaton!  Within walking distance from Wheaton college!  This place is going to kill it.
Very good tacos. The home made sauces and organic components make this place.  This is our new taco Tuesday joint.

If you want authentic Mexican food, this isn't the place you want to go to, but if you want delicious food that has some Mexican flavors and definitely tasty, this place is PERFECT. Super delicious, and the service is amazing. All their sodas are locally made, and with actual sugar, no artificial sweeteners, and their beer is all locally brewed too.

Went for the first time today.  Would like to give it 3 1/2 stars as I thought it was good....but not great.
Chips & guacamole grew on me.  Would have liked the chips to not be chewy...wish they were fresh and hot.
Had a Gringo taco which I really enjoyed, and a shrimp taco, which was pretty good.  Rice & beans was interesting....just ok.  Margarita was average.  
 I will likely go back to try other things on the menu.  
I honestly think A toda Madre in Glen Ellyn is much better tasting...but not a bad choice to try again!

Even though I am only giving 3 stars I can see why this restaurant gets many 4-5 stars. The ambiance is wonderful, especially the surprising outdoor seating area which is not expected when viewd from the entrance; in fact the venue appeared 'closed' when our family pulled up. 
It was a warm late August Saturday evening and we had our choice of 'in or out'. The inside appears clean and inviting and with a nice atmosphere but we chose 'out' and it reminded us of some of our old Lincoln Park haunts; A very inviting patio. The kids liked it too. (Be warned to bring mosquito spray though). 
The service was prompt and friendly, they explained the 'origin story' and their food quality. Waitperson recommended items and alerted us to the portion size.
We did the chips and guacamole; I also asked for salsa as well. The chips were OK...1/2 were crispy and  1/2 were chewy...not sure which it was supposed to be! I like em crispy. 
The guac was great.
The salsa was so so though my wife liked it. To me it tasted sort of relishy and was a paste like consistency.
My son got the pulled pork taco and enjoyed it. My wife got the steak and Portobello mushroom tacos and like them. I ordered 'The Truck'; their burrito w/ steak, chicken and shrimp. The waitperson recommended I get the shrimp on the side after I mentioned that did not sound like a good combo.
I did. The burrito was a solid 'good'.  My wife had the lemonade (really good) and I had the margarita...so so again because the taste was a little sweet and the salt was 'on the lime'. I had not realized what 'salt on the lime' meant, it meant they placed the salt on the lime in your drink...duh)
It may be picky but I think salt 'on the rim' is a standard that makes it easier for those of us who like salt margaritas to actually make it easier to taste a little salt w/ each sip instead of pulling out a lime to lick it!  At $8 it as just OK. 
All in all it was a pleasant experience but it lacked something important: It did not seem to me to taste like the expected Mexican fair; more new age Wheaton Mexican. I appreciate organic/locally sourced/etc. but want some Mexican tastiness too.
Another gripe: Paying 5-7 bucks for chips and salsa/guac is a deal breaker for me. 99.999% of Mexican restaurants provide immediate gratis chips and salsa to their customers. A table of 4 goes through them like crazy and at that price there should have at least been a refill or two of the chips to make it worthwhile.
Sooo; while I can see that they run a good establishment I would not return due to my reservations stated above though I encourage anyone to give it a try...my wife and kids like their fair...I thought it was OK. Obviously others seem to like that taste of this version of 'Mexican' cooking.

Service was excellent. Food was delicious. I had the guac and chips and a side of salsa. So good! Then I had the gringo taco, shrimp taco, and bbq pork taco. Everything was so dang delicious. Can't forget the brownie wonton dessert that is perfect to share!! I will definitely be back here I the future!
This is our Families go to Taco place! Great service, and Larniecia is one of a kind Server! My daughter craves FIU once a week. Only improvement would be having Soda or Sparkling water as an option.

We have been here 4 or 5 times now and unfortunately the food is constantly cold, not sure what the problem is, the menu is good....nice choices but it just falls short.....wish it was better we live close and would like a nice Mexican alternative, probably given this place the last chance before looking for someplace else

Great, great tacos.  The parmesan chips and guac were licked clean from the plate.  The margarita isn't your traditional variety (no salt around rim), but it was still good.  Service was excellent and the sauces mean business.  We got take out one night and dined in another.  Both times we were happy customers.

This place was delicious! We went two days in a row when we had family in town. Started with chips and guac and had bbq pork and gringo taco. All delicious and the service was excellent. This is a nice spot and priced very reasonably.

Went for lunch today and will go back for more.  I had the Gringo Taco and the BBQ pork taco. Both were equally delicious with very different flavors. The beans and rice are fabulous. I still can't believe I'm commenting on a side but seriously, it's very good.

I went here for lunch and it was very good! I ordered the shrimp, southwest chicken, and chophouse tacos! I also tried some of my boyfriend's BBQ pork taco and it was very yummy. Each taco's prices ranged from $3.50-$4.25. I've been here twice and would continue coming here.
Excellent tacos, Definitely have to try 'the gringo'. All fresh and local (when possible) ingredients are used. We're coming back again!

Seriously,  best tacos  I have ever eaten in my entire life!!! If you are in the area, this is a must! I  Try the shrimp and Gringo tacos and guacamole  and Parmesan chips.  Totally out of this world!!!

The waitstaff are very friendly and will talk through the menu with you. This was very helpful as we wanted to order one of everything,

Love the ambiance and decor.  Very clean and cozy.

I love tacos. It is a hot and heavy love affair, one that I am proud to acknowledge. I had been looking for a decent place in the suburbs to make out of this world tacos, like the ones I can get from the trucks downtown. Fire it up is that place!!! The menu is amazing, very diverse, and I love that they source most all of their ingredients, drinks, beers, and spirits from local companies! The root beer, soda, and lemonade are all locally made! Sweet! The tacos are ordered individually, so you can get a nice array of whatever your heart desires. I love getting the portabella and the veggie tacos. The veggie ones have a little kick to them, and both are super flavorful. The chips and salsa is also really amazing, the Parmesan chips are handmade, and are out of this world with their homemade salsa. My kids like he BLT and chicken tacos, my teenager even had a steak tack from last night that he couldn't finish for lunch today and said it was still amazing as a leftover! Score! The servers are super friendly, quick to make awesome suggestions, and are also super knowledgeable about the menu and ingredients. Fire It Up, you are supporting my taco love affair, and I thank you for that.

I'm updating my review.  I've always enjoyed the food here but service and wait times have been hit or miss lately.  Received a nice note from the owner and they assured me that they are on top of this (and I truly believe they are!) Great news as we need you to stay around and continue bringing us those great tacos, wonderful hot sauce and to die for desserts!

My new fave place! Gotta get the steak and shrimp tacos and the Parmesan chips I could eat everyday...awesome guac too. Wish I didn't work so many Saturday's and Tuesday nights cuz would love to go twice a week taco Tuesday & sangria Saturday. Only thing I didn't really like was the margarita had a unique taste I couldn't figure out...but both sangrias yum!

Fire it Up is really a fun and delicious meal!! I had multiple tacos, but my favorite was the Cheeseburger Taco. It was so tasty and flavorful! In addition, I tried the Parmesan chips and guacamole which were the best chips and guacamole I have ever had! I highly suggest you try out this restaurant because you will not be disappointed.

I am happy to see a restaurant back at this location after a long vacancy. We had an excellent dinner here the first week they were open. Both the food and service were excellent. Prices were a little on the higher side but given that they try to source local and organic I think that is expected. I was also happy to see local beers on draft. I wish the weather was warmer so we could have enjoyed their outdoor patio. We hope they succeed and will certainly be returning.

My husband and I have eaten here - both dine-in and take out. The menu is simple, the food is fresh, and everything tastes good! I like that they use locally found produce and ingredients. My only two complaints - the service from some wait staff could be improved (just a bit more professional) and the dessert offerings could be more diverse (only one option right now). Also, thanks for creating options for us gluten free folks!

My advice: Try this place in summer! We went on a pretty cold winter's evening and it was almost as cold inside as it was outside. Most of the diners were wearing their coats. They have a big old fireplace that was not working. I asked our server about this and he said they tried to light it a week before and it was blowing smoke into the room. Don't you think they might try and get it working in a week?
I'm not used to not getting complimentary chips and salsa in a Mexican restaurant, but that was okay. The chips and guac we ordered were interesting. The tacos were tasty and the waiter was very nice. The biggest problem, it is hard to enjoy a dinner when you are freezing! The waiter even told us he went and stood by the heat exchange when he had a free minute. Hmmm...
If they are still around in summer, we would certainly give them another try!

Wide selection of Tacos. Very good taste profiles. Salsa's are fresh and tasty. Sangria is well made. Service is very good. Margarita needs serious work and draft beer is $7 which is laughable.  They have a chance to do really well, but I detect a bit of arrogance coming from the owners after a few meals here.  They obviously know nothing about the better taco place down the street or they would serve a drinkable margarita.
AMAZING FOOD! First off, it was delicious! The food tasted fresh, they actually use organic ingredients, and did I mention it's delicious!? Great service and fun environment!

This place is great! My boyfriend and I dined yesterday afternoon for a late lunch and loved it! The service is excellent and the staff very spot on and friendly. We had the cheeseburger taco, the BLT taco and a burrito called " THE TRUCK". All 3 did not disappoint. The Truck had to be our favorite. The blend of steak and pulled pork were fantubulous!  We will definitely be back. If you want a upbeat atmosphere, great music and an awesome treat, try Fire It Up in Wheaton. Keep up the great work!
Really great taste sensation. Cozy atmosphere, informative wait staff and great local menu of beer choices.  Patio looks great but will have to wait for summer to try that out. Can't wait to go back.
Pretty good. Guacamole was great and tacos were much bigger than expected. Bbq pork taco was the clear favorite in our house. We did take out. Will certainly try dine in next.

This was awesome!!! We went on taco Tuesday and were happy with so much more than the price of the tacos! The guacamole was the best I've had in recent history of eating out for Mexican food at least once a week! Great choice of local brewery beers that were just a little pricey. The waitress was great and we saw her cleaning the chairs as we were leaving demonstrating the cleanliness of the restaurant! We will make this a regular spot for sure!

The food was Awesome.  Great flavor and looked as good as it taste.  The waiter was informative and attentive.  I had the chophouse taco and chicken taco, both we're very good.  The beans and rice were a surprise to me, as they both came in a bowl together.  But, once again they were really good.  I highly recommend you try this place. I only wish they could set up shop in Naperville.  We need more little unique restaurants like this one.
The food is excellent and the staff is friendly. Guac and Parmesan chips were the best!

Excellent! Friendly and knowledgeable staff...great beer...even better food! Have already been back three times and am eager to go back. BBQ pork tacos and fresh made salsa will keep me coming back. Thank you for coming to Wheaton!

Went there for lunch today for the first time and will definitely go back.  The food was delicious.  Our waitress, Grace, made some suggestions and they were spot on.  The margaritas were good too.  We did the chips and guac - very tasty, the Cuban rolls appetizer that was awesome just enough spice.  Then we had a Gringo and a Steak taco that we split.  I will definitely go back and take more of my friends.

I have to be honest, I really wanted to like this place, but I can't think of one thing I'd go back for.    Chips were stale, guacamole portion was tiny and the flavor was boring, margarita was terrible (too sour and too sweet at the same time.  Confused? So was I).  I ordered the shrimp taco and the gringo. The gringo was literally dripping from being so soggy.  For two lunch specials, a margarita, a soft drink and a guacamole appetizer, we paid $50.  Pros: our server was delightful, the tomatillo salsa was good and I love the location.  Unfortunately, none of those things will bring me back.  Didn't understand the hype.

Awesome tacos. Even the ice tea was great which was apparently organic. All of the staff was very friendly. I have been dreaming of the tacos since I left. I will definitely return soon. Loved the chophouse taco.  Not like any taco I've had before.

In summary, the food was good, not great and over priced for what it was. We got take out from here last week and were excited to try it based on the reviews. We love good Mexican, but we weren't overly impressed. We got four different types of tacos and they had decent flavor with an interesting departure from traditional Mexican.  Compared to other choices in the area, this one fell short.

Love the food here. It's tasty and fresh.  Their shrimp taco is divine.  The parm chips are crunchy and tasty.  I also enjoy the steak tacos...really good.. just melts in your mouth.  This place is great for lunch, dinner with and /or without kids.

Fantastic!  My husband and I stopped here for lunch last week and had a fantastic meal.  We both agreed that the BBQ pork tacos were our favorite.  The quinoa salad was also really nice.  We love that it's organic and local ingredients.  The beer/liquor menu is impressive and they have homemade tea/lemonade for those who don't drink alcohol.  We are so glad that this is finally open...highly recommend!
We stopped in for lunch on a Sunday. The food and service were excellent. We tried several of the tacos. We'll be back.

We went on Saturday for lunch and opted to sit outside on the patio.We were seated directly across from a speaker which was playing rap music quite loudly and we were having trouble hearing each other. We moved to another table further away from the music. When our waiter, William, came with our drinks, he mentioned that we had moved so we told him why. He replied " We're a rockin place. My mother likes it." He then walks away without taking our orders. Two noisy freight trains had passed (the restaurant backs up to the train station) before he ambled over to take our order. The food was just ok. My husband had asked for corn tortillas but got flour. I wanted to ask for lemons for my fresh lemonade because it had little flavor, but William was nowhere in sight. When we were finished and ready to leave he came and offered more lemonade and we asked for the check instead. When we had the check and looked at the total we handed him our charge card. He went off printed customer and restaurant tabs, gave them to us and left. My daughter noticed that the top receipt didn't match the total on the other receipts. William didn't appear again (there were only 3 tables outside and 1 inside that were occupied). We went in to the bar and asked who was in charge and the gentleman there said that he was. He assured us that it wasn't a scam and recharged us the correct amount for our meal, while supposedly deleting the incorrect charge. 3 days later I have been charged the correct bill total but still have the incorrect charge as a hold on my credit card. I told the friend who had recommended Fire it Up to us and was told that a very similar problem had occurred there with his son and date. I resent that I have a hold on my account and that I have to spend time monitoring the situation until it is taken care of properly. I would recommend that everyone checks their receipts carefully especially if you are charging your meals!
We have had business Christmas parties.  By far the best prime rib in the area. Always my favorite.  You won't finish it. So it makes great lunch the next day

Here's an honest review for you. When you first see the building you're a little weirded out because it seems out of place. I mean it really seems out of place. You walk into a set of double doors. You don't think of it at the time but the doors are not aligned but consciously you're telling yourself that something isn't right. When you enter the restaurant you're met by darkeness. I'm not kidding it is really dark in this place. 

I'm boring myself while writing this so I'll get straight to the point. This place  is awkward. The reviews of this place are fairly accurate. The bread that comes out before your meal should be warm and fresh. It wasn't either. The salad is mediocre with 1 cherry tomato and a dab of dressing. I give this restaurant 3 stores because despite the awkward feeling the food was actually pretty good. My tip would be to ask for your steak seasoned a little harder than usual because it taste a little bland. Good but bland.

Okay so to be fair I don't really like red meat so this may be a 5 star place for a steak person. But at any rate I love this restaurant, it's an old school supper club. Relish tray on the tables, house made ranch dressing, fresh baked bread, thick prime rib, decent wine choices. Can't go wrong here for a meat and potatoes kind of person!

All I can say is, if this is a four-star suburban restaurant, I can never leave Chicago. I can't recall ever having such a terrible meal, and I really feel bad saying that. The server was really nice but this meal could not be redeemed. 
I was with friends looking for something to eat after Kuiper's, and honestly there were so few options, this seemed like the best one. Sadly none of us were happy. The veggie plate at the start looked old and wilted. Soup tasted like water. Alfredo tasted like NOTHING (literally). Salad was wilted.
I don't know. I would have put this maybe on an applebee's type quality level before the food came out but it was not even that... sorry Sorrento's.
The only place I know where you can get a bread basket, relish tray, soup, salad, and your main course meal of amazing quality for an amazing price! Family owned and run, THE BEST

What a great little gem hidden in the cornfields! After some apple picking we yelped and found Sorrento's and decided to give it a try. We read about the Prime Rib and had to give it a try. 

Yes, the decor is dated but that's the magic of this old school supper club. Very clean and great service! To start they bring out a veggie tray and a bread basket with the most amazing cheese spread and butter. We had the king Prime Rib and Vinnie's Filet Special. Twice baked potato was good but the garlic mashed stole the show. Oh and I can't forget my favorite creamy garlic dressing. Delish! We finished out our meal with the chocolate cake! Yum! 

Very reasonably priced and definitely would come back again! So excited we found a new place!

This is my favorite restaurant and if you're ever in the Sycamore, IL area, don't miss it. Great food, varied menu, good service, reasonable prices. The salmon is fab and the filet mignon melts in your mouth. Generous portions, good presentation,

Even living in the suburbs, my wife and I still make the drive out here. Definitely an old school Wisconsin supper club feel. Decor is a little dated, but we definitely don't come to admire sconces.

Service is always top notch and more than willing to accommodate the large groups we typically go with.

The food is some of the best in the area. My wife typically tries the same thing. I have been stuck on prime rib for the duration of time we've been coming here. Simply put, the best prime rib I've ever had.

In the middle of nowhere sits this old-school, frozen-in-a-different era, totally unhip, un-ironic, dinosauric time-capsule of a  supper club. It is as square as a Republican Bachelor Party. From the look of most of the clientele you would swear you were either at a Republican Bachelor Party where the Men brought their wives along for good measure, or a seminar for Post-retirement planning. (No disrespect intended).
The Menu is free of hyperbole, and cleverness. It's straight and narrow. 
It is one of the single greatest restaurants in Northern Illinois, and maybe the Country.
This is what high-class "going out" was back in the day. If you catch the rhythm, you'll see that this is still a high-class joint.
And the food--meaning Steak and Prime Rib--is divine.
Order an Old-fashioned, or a Martooni, or a Manhattan. It will be made perfectly.
You get a relish tray, just like in the day-radishes, celery, etc.  A perfect light appetizer.
Maybe a salad or a soup (The baked French Onion is a work of Art)-all perfect.
All of this in anticipation of the main event-a hunk of bloody-rare Prime Rib the size and shape of a Birthday Cake. Perfectly seasoned. Perfect in every way. (yes, of course you can get it cooked to the temperature you like--it's my review, though)
Or a Steak like a Clincher Softball. Yep-perfect!
It ain't cheap-cheap, but at the same time, it won't disturb the molecular structure of your Credit Card. WORTH every penny!!
Dress up just a little, Get in the car, put some Sinatra on the Stereo, and take the big drive out west.
And dine like a King and Queen...
A classic American Steakhouse rather reminiscent of a Northern Supper Club. Sorrento's has never dissapointed, the portions are generous, food solid, prices are more than fair.
Place was very very good! Prices were however a bit high.....if you're looking for a good pasta go with their Fetta Alfredo

Best restaurant in the DeKalb area. The prime rib is probably the best steak I have ever had, and their baked french onion soup is my favorite soup anywhere. Not cheap but relatively inexpensive as far as steakhouses go.

I went with a group of 12 to celebrate my 40th Birthday. It was a wonderful night. Several of us ordered the prime rib which was the special that day. We all received beautiful cuts of meat cooked to perfection! The relish tray, bread, and salad were fresh and delicious! The corn chowder soup was very tasty just a bit thin. I also tried a piece of fried shrimp and a bite of lasagna. Both were very good. The portion of  lasagna is huge! We all had a very wonderful night! We left full and happy.

We had a group of 12 for a retirement party this past weekend. Thank you to the staff at Sorentos for making our day a memory of a lifetime. The prime rib, filets and shrimp were outstanding! Our waitress 'Abby' did a phenominal job keeping up with all of our requests with a big smile on her face. We will tell all our friends and family. We will be back soon. Thank you again.

I came here for a friend's birthday party dinner and I had such high hopes when I saw Chilean Sea Bass on the menu (had this at the Tao in Las Vegas, so maybe not a fair comparison!). The service was great, however, the food and especially the presentation were lacking. The first thing delivered was a basket of crackers and a half loaf of pre sliced bread...not even warm bread! There was also a platter of various veggies. Next came the soup. I ordered the minestrone soup...flavorful but lukewarm. Next came the salad...if you can call it that. It was a bowl of lettuce, and not the nice green kind either...more of the white, hard lettuce you find near the middle. It came with, I kid you not, one cherry tomato, one cucumber slice, and a small dab of salad dressing...needless to say, I did not finish this! The main course came and I had ordered the garlic mashed potatoes as a side dish. They were on the heavy side and were served on a side plate, even though there was more than enough room on the main plate. The sea bass did not have much flavor, and on the plate were two small carrots and a broccoli stem. All in all very disappointed with my experience, especially for what you pay.

I never write reviews but i felt a moral obligation to do so today. This is the worst place my family and I have ever eaten. If you like Aldi style ravioli's and tortellini covered in Prego sauce, then this is the place for you. My husband had the turkey diner which came with canned vegetables, smothered in gravy. The stench alone from the actual meat made you feel uneasy and unsure of how old this bird really was. Stale bread, stale crackers, stale ambience, and stale air from the older gentleman sitting near us burping out load, I had no other option but to give this place 1 star. The positive aspect of our visit was our waitress was sweet and made sure our food came out quick and our water was cold and refreshing. Everything else was disappointing!!!

With Johnnys in Dekalb closing, we "refound" this hidden gem.

While my wife does not like the decor, I find it very appealing. Like going to your grandparents house in Wisconsin. In fact, it has a Wisconsin supper club feel.

The Prime Rib is second to none and very inexpensive, with the larger cut going for around 22 bucks. Side choices are plentiful and the staff very friendly. This is easy to show up here casual or dressed to the nines and still feel "in place".

They bring out a cheese dip and veggie tray with bread when you sit down. TVs are only in bar and I do not think they have wifi, both are pluses for us. Kids will most likely feel at home here as well.

Chicken ribs, steaks, fish are all on the menu. We have tried much of it and never been disappointed. Even when the lot looks full, we have never waited for a seat. This is probably due to the fact that it is almost TARDIS like being bigger on the inside than it looks from the outside. Highly recommended.

Go to Sorrento's if you are in the boonies and need to satisfy your prime rib or steak hankering at a reasonable price.

A definite supper club feel, this place is a great venue for a meal with the baby boomers. We took mom here for Mother's Day, and it is great for a late lunch or early dinner on a Sunday. 

The filets were good, cooked perfectly. My dad said the lamb was a bit overlooked. They serve fish too, but none of us tried it. Try the baked French onion soup for a heartier appetizer to your meal, because the salad is lackluster. For dessert we tried the carrot cake and chocolate cake. Save your appetite, fill yourself up with the steak or go somewhere else for dessert because the cakes were dry and bland. 

Service was fine, but a bit slow on the drink refills and clearing away plates. Prices are reasonable for the cut of meat and all that is included with dinner.

I'm not hating this place; it has a few things that are really good, and others that could use improvement. But I'm sure I will be back with my parents in the future - and I'll focus on the simple filet and skip (or forgive) the rest.

3 stars
Last visited 5/12/13

The portions and the prices are unreal!  The food was good, but not great outstanding.  I am by no means a prime rib expert, but I thought mine was a on the fatty side.  The size of the prime rib was amazing and it came with a side, soup, and a salad!  I tried my sister in law's chicken parm and I would order that again in a heartbeat.  Everyone raved about the au-gratin potatoes and I thought they were decent, but not even in the same ballpark as Carsons.  Overall this place is a solid 3.5, but I had to round up for the huge portions at a fraction of city prices!

Old School Super Club all the way!

Is the decor dated? Yes
An attentive wait staff? Yes
Is it dark inside with soft lighting? Yes
Oak wall panels with a wood beam ceiling? Yes
A separate bar area for a cocktail before dinner? Yes
Before ordering, do they serve a relish tray to munch on? Yes
Do they serve the best prime rib cooked to your specifications? Yes
O.K.! But will I need a doggie bag for a midnight snack? Depending, but Yes!
Fantastic food, great food and very clean.  The prime rib is amazing!

I thought it was fabulous. Yes like another review said it does remind you of a dinner club but the food is great. Since there are not to many choices in Sycamore for steaks. This place is great. I will be back when back in the area.

We had our company party here last night, it is a bit of a drive for me living in Chicago but was of so worth it as the Steak Lover that I am 

I had the prime Rib and it was perfect you could of almost cut it with a butter knife, nice and juicy and oh so full of flavor, this was one of if not the best prime rib i have ever eaten and I have had prime rib all over from mom and pop places too Morton's steak house 

service was great they have a nice room in the basement for private parties and they don't charge to use the room my boss said, makes me sad I didn't go to the dinner last year I truly missed out on a great dinner last year I won't be missing any more after that meal 

I had the cheese cake it was good think it may have been Eli's but I recommend the chocolate cake it was huge piece and tasty also I tried some, they also have a flaming ice cream they put a piece of ice in brandy then put it on top of ice cream and light I was told it is very good not on the menu that I know of so have to ask for it

This place is a great hidden gem for steak and other terrific meals.  I haven't had anything but the prime rib dinner for the last 20 or 30 times I have been there.  The baked French onion soup is awesome, the blue cheese is homemade and it is always what I get on my salad.  This place is older looking and the crowd is also mostly 55+.  I really like this place and will continue to be a regular.  The only thing I wish they would change is the wait staff uniforms- they are so dated!  They look like something a polygamist cult would be forced to wear.  Otherwise, go there!

Been coming here for several years now. They have a wonderful staff. From Anita at the front door to every server I have had there, they are attentive and treat you like they've known you forever. Their drinks are good and stiff, I'm a whiskey sour drinker so I would know. They also have reasonably priced wines and some decent beer choices. I like that they bring you a relish tray, crackers, bread and this interesting cheddar spread to start (very 'Wisconsinish'). You get soup AND salad with your meal. Prime rib can't be beat. Go on Wednesday for a good deal. Ribs and steaks are excellent too. Broiled haddock is good too. It's a huge, meaty piece with just the right amount of butter and seasoning. LOVE their au gratin potato side dish. They do a Friday night fish fry which is good, but it's not beer battered so don't go expecting it to be as you will be disappointed. The ambiance is out of date, but for some reason it adds to the feel of the place so I don't consider it to be a bad thing. Save room for a brandy ice for dessert. Yummy :) I would give this place five stars, but I have never been impressed with their Italian dishes. Admittedly, being an Italian I am pickier about that than most, but the fact of the matter is that the owners are Italian and in my opinion they could make things like the tortellini or the eggplant parm better if they really wanted to. All in all the good far surpasses the negatives so I highly recommend Sorrento's to anyone in the area.

I went to Sorrento's on the recommendation from someone who is local. The decor reminds me of a banquet hall and is a little dated but still a nice restaurant. I ordered or the specials and decided on steak and a twice baked potato. I prefer my steak well done and it came out pretty good. Sometimes places comprehend burnt=well done but Sorrento's did a nice job. Unfortunatly my twice baked potato was still cold in the center so by the time it was replaced I was half way done with my steak. 

I will probably go back to give it another try. It was not a bad experience but not an amazing, can't get off my mind experience.

My best friend and I went to Sorrento's to celebrate our birthdays on Saturday, and I have to say that our experience was somewhat mixed.  First off, I was given a beautiful and tasty slab of prime rib, and the mashed potatoes were excellent.  But, although my prime rib and mashed potatoes were great, both were barely warm when served.  My friend said that the strip steak she ordered was cooked to medium rare, but she really had a hard time cutting it, and her mashed potatoes were barely warm, as well. The onion soup, (plain, not French onion) was like lukewarm, greasy dishwater with a few onion strings in it.  Thank goodness the salads were fresh, with decent dressings, although they were average iceberg with a few baby lettuce leaves thrown in as an accent.  We really enjoyed the relish tray, mostly because it isn't something you find at restaurants much anymore, and it provided a nice break from the same old, same old salads.  
No, we didn't send back our soup, or our meals to be (re?)heated, because we've both had bad experiences in other restaurants sending things back to the kitchen.
After a long discussion, we've decided we probably will try Sorrento's again, but next time we will be much more aware of what not to order, and will be keeping on top of the food temp.  We have to wonder whether coming in early to eat was a good idea, and if that was the reason that nothing was at serving temp except the salad and the relish tray!  As a final note, we want to emphasize that the staff is a great group of people, always pleasant and warm.

If you're this far west of Chicago, almost to DeKalb, Sorrento's is a good dinner alternative.

Sorrento's is a large portions, big tables, big families and birthday parties, Italian and American restaurant with a few good surprises.  No one in Chicago serves giant pieces of prime rib for $22, like the do here.  The food is good and basic, or the locals wouldn't keep coming back.  People don't come here for exotic vegetables or the presentation of the desserts.  The vegetables are basic and overcooked, and that's just the way it is.  But the steaks are good, the shrimp are big, and the desserts are large.  Service is good.

HOLLY DEAD SLAB OF FAT COW ON A PLATE! Don't even bother looking at anything else on the menu but the prime rib! No fo reals dawg! This place don't joke when it comes to the prime rib! My piece must have been close to 2 inches thick, nice and pink just like I like it and juicy! My only regret and maybe it is a good thing is that they do not have a place in the city. If you find yourself in what I call Corn county this is a must stop and stuff your face place!

Best steakhouse in Dekalb county. Prime Rib is second to none! You will not go away hungry, from the time you sit down until you leave the food doesn't stop. It starts with bread, crackers and fresh vegetables with a excellent cheese spread. Then comes your soup and salad followed up by your entree. The service is excellent and your drinks are never empty.

I usually don't order steak... just not the biggest fan. However, I ordered the filet last night. It was perfectly medium-rare, just as ordered. Cut like butter and tasted amazing. I have food allergies, which makes dining out challenging at times, but the waitress and kitchen assured me that my food was free of any of my allergens and my food still came out amazing. It is old school, considering the fact that you get a cracker basket, sliced veggies, and bread to start. Plus, you get a lot of food for what you pay. Believe me, I just moved to the area from the DC area with my husband who grew up in Sycamore. He said that the restaurant hadn't changed since he went as a kid. And, compared to DC prices, we are saving big money! Cozy setting for a nicer dinner out. Staff was very attentive and helpful - my water glass was never empty. They have a limited wine list, but giant pours for around $6 per glass.

We had a great meal here this past Sunday evening...nice service and good food.  My husband had the highly recommended prime rib...it was huge, tender, and perfectly cooked.  I had the strip steak and shrimp special...also very nice.  The sauted mushrooms were a pleasant surprise.  We both chose the French onion au gratin soup...good but nothing special, the salad which was good with a nice chunky bleu cheese dressing.  My twice baked potato was just okay.  The young waitress was very pleasant and helpful.  Brief but reasonable wine list.  We will definitely be back!

Was not impressed. Our server and service was great which is why there was 2 stars given. We went for Prime Rib night and had lackluster iceberg lettuce salad, and under performing cuts of Prime Rib. Baked potato was good but how can you screw that up, the mashed potatoes my daughter got, were at least partially fake (dehydrated/powdered). Best thing I had was the Brandy Alexander.  Worst part was the super strong smell of damp basement where we were sitting. I had to move seats, and it was still SO bad, we put a napkin and menu over the floor vent we sat by. Decor is beyond creepy, kinda like Grandmas house but not in a good way. I'd rather go to Fireside in Sugar Grove.

Incredible "Thanksgiving Dinner" wrapped up to go w/ all the fixins. All the hot items were covered in Saran wrap to stay pipping hot for the long ride home. Everything mentioned on menu was included. My server Cindy was excellent. Very affordable prices for a high quality meal. Turkey dinner is Sunday afternoons only. Check their website for menu & daily specials. Can't wait to go back!

Due to having family in the City, we have dined at numerous trendy Chicago restaurants.  Always leave feeling like we've been raped.  Thirteen-fifteen bucks for a 3 ounce martini and never less that $500 for a party of 4.  Keep the fancy decor and "see and be seen"  venues.  We will take Sorrento's "dated" decor any day of the week.  Generous pours for martinis at cheap prices,  relish/cheese spread/salad/soup/entree all included,  quality entrees, awesome dessert martinis (brandy alexander/pink squirrel are our favs), and always reliable service....I can deal with dated decor.  It's real.  The staff is real.  The food is excellent.  Thank you Sorrentos for not changing!!

Good food but only slightly average service. Overall the place is old and caters to a older crowd. Good food, nice portions but it's all a little bland. 

They are well known for prime rib and steaks.  

We hit these guys maybe twice a year.
I love Sorrento's!  I have a steak every time I visit.  This is the place we come for family gatherings and celebrations.  Very friendly people run the place and they always seem glad you are there!

Best prime rib and fillet you will ever have. Why go to Gibson's and Morton's. Great homemade salad dressings and generous cocktails. Family owned always make you feel at home. Once you go you'll be hooked no matter how far you have to travel.

I'd say that this place is one of the better Korean restaurants in the Chicagoland area. Every meal comes with side order dishes including probably the best kimchi I've ever eaten at a restaurant. 

Yesterday was my first time there and our group ordered the seafood pancake and the big seafood soup. The seafood pancake was huge and very delicious. Generally places serve this dish and it is pretty skinny and flat. However, they served this dish and it was thick and very filling. The seafood inside was also very fresh.

Years ago,  I had written a review for here on a previous account that no longer exists (thanks Yelp) so after being a loyal customer for many years, I thought I'd write anothee review.  

Food: still very good 
Kbbq: this review solely judging kbbq galbi and beef tongue only.  Cooked on gas grill. 
Service: very nice couple that runs the restaurant,  mom and pop feel for sure 

Love Mr. and Mrs. Chang (the owners) ! So heartwarming on a cold day :)  Mr.  Chang is always smiling and showing that Korean hospitality. 

Galbi is still great quality,  but back in the day,  the galbi use to be the best where I could see the marbling so beautifully.  Don't know if they changed their meat source,  but with rise in prices,  I would have expected similar quality.  There's definitely competition brewing for who actually has the best "prime" galbi in town now.

The soup that comes with the kbbq order is the best out of all the Illinois kbbq places.  Nicely seasoned,  not your typical bland watery soup.  

Other soups on the menu are also very good.  Nice clean place.  And they also remodeled/remodeling so it will be one of the better looking places.  

Bottom line: Hit this place up! You won't regret it!

Don't judge the book by cover. The outside of this restaurant doesn't do justice to the inside and the food it serves. I confess I have been by the restaurant twice before I finally went in.  And so glad was I to do that. The food was amazing. We went in for lunch and the service was a little slow therefore 4 star. Food was totally a 5 star. We had the combination BBQ platter. The waiter said it's for 2 people sharing... no it's totally for 4. There was so much food left for us. We were 4 of us. Ordered bibimbap, tofu soup in addition to the BBQ. We had more food then we could eat. But we were very happy with all of them. Will sure visit again whenever we go pass Chicago. A must visit for Korean food lovers.

Really disappointed--food was bland, BBQ portion sizes are too small (see photo), and service was bad.

I like Korean food, and cook it at home often. I have worked at a Korean restaurant and Korean grocery store. I even married into a Korean family recently ^^  My husband and I are on a mission to dine at as many Korean restaurants in Chicagoland as possible... but Koreana is not one that we will return to. I would say Koreana is ok -if- you live nearby, but it definitely wasn't worth the 45-minute drive from our home.

Food was bland... The banchan and kalbi were bland and unimpressive. My own Korean homecooking has much more flavor. Of all the Korean restaurants that I have reviewed on Yelp, I would say Koreana's banchan rank at the bottom. Koreana served: kimchi, kkakdugi (radish kimchi), eomuk (stir-fried fish cake), bean sprouts, broccoli with cho-jang, and something that resembled a cold jeon of some sorts.

BBQ portion sizes are too small... I realize that Korean BBQ is expensive, but as you can see from the photo, one portion of thick samgyeopsal (pork belly) only has 4 pieces of meat for $20.99. The kalbi (marianted beef), which also seemed a bit skimpy, was $29.99. That's quite pricey considering many Korean BBQs charge $25 or $30 per person for All-You-Can-Eat. 

Service was bad... The staff is friendly. We were seated quickly. We were served tea and banchan quickly. But... the server started our BBQ at such an extremely low temperature, that after 20 minutes of our meat NOT cooking on the grill, we had to ask her to "please, turn up the heat!" All the banchan were gone before the meat was even cooked. And we were super disappointed that they didn't serve rice or doenjang (bean paste) soup with our meal. Every Korean restaurant we have dined at serves complimentary rice and soup. 

Oh, but then, as our meal neared the end, and the server turned off the BBQ grill because we were done grilling, only then did they serve the rice and soup. What's up with that Koreana?!?! Geez, would have been nice to have soup at the beginning of our meal, you know during that awkward time when our meat WASN'T cooking and we were just starring off into space!!

They give you a good serving of the food you order. They are nice and if you don't have a table with the grill to cook the food, then the kitchen will cook your food. I like when the kitchen does it because they put in spices and onions that you don't get yourself to cook your own meat.

I tried rice tea for the first time. When I took my first sip, I thought it tasted weird. Then I kept drinking it and liked it. It reminded me of the rice at the bottom of a rice cooker that burnt a little. I know I know this sounds weird, but growing up my favorite part of rice was burnt part on the bottom because kids like crunchy things. Weird but it's different than the usual soft rice on the top.

The Hamul Pajun (seafood pancake) is BIG. They cut it up for you which is nice so you can grab pieces. They have a lot of octopus and squid and scallions.

Chicken bulgolgi is very spicy, but tasty. Just be prepared for a kick. Good thing they give you rice.

The beef bulgolgi is good too. They cut the pieces small so it seemed like little it was an endless plate of beef.

They gave us this puffed rice dessert. It was sweetened and crunchy. very tasty. I kept going back for more.

Mom and Pop shop all the way. Just how I like it. Tonight, we walked in looking like total amateurs, but the owner just chased me out of the joint for writing a thank you note in Korean. If you want something authentic and tasty without breaking the bank, come here. Hands down, best around.

I think Koreana has the best Korean food in the Chicagoland area (outside of my mom's kitchen). 

Korean restaurants aren't really known for good service, but I would say Koreana does a decent job. They are much more attentive than most Korean restaurants I've been to. They take reservations, and call ahead if you have a big party. They will accommodate you. 

Their galbi tang is delicious. It's beef soup with 3-4 thick chunks of beef short rib with Korean vermicelli, dates, radish, etc. It's savory soup with lots of garlic and tender short ribs that you barely even need to chew. My go to dish here.

If people ask me recommendations for Korean BBQ, I tell them to come here. The meat is good quality and decently priced. You get what you pay for here. I usually get chadol (thin slices of beef) and samgyupssal (thick slices of pork belly). If you want the full experience, get some alcohol like a true Korean would. soju or makoli (Korean rice wine). Mix the makoli with sprite!

another gem of Schaumburg for those who will travel away from the big box stores for lunch. I have never had their dinner menu, so I cannot comment.

The lunch specials are great, and for sub-$10 without a large lunch crowd (plus all the pickled veg and kim chi that comes with a normal Korean meal), you cannot complain about this.

Phenomenal, delicious and truly authentic!!
Come hungry and try the many delicious items in the menu if Korean food is your favorite, you won't regret your visit here.

Great food!!! I love this place, the food is here is amazing. They have amazing side dishes and their service is good. The only small down part is that not all tables have grills and sometimes there is a long wait to get a table. ( Can you blame them?) However, when a table opens up, you will realize why it was worth the wait!
I def go back here multiple times.

Food was average, i was dissapointed due to the place looking better in the pictures. My table was pretty dirty and service wasnt as great. I felt a little rushed. Especially when the guy grabbed the tongs and started cooking all the food for me, lol maybe it wasnt in accordance with his instructions manual. but overall i did leave full. Just might try a  different korean restaurant next time.

We arrived at 6:45 pm and that was the perfect time. Afterwards, everyone was coming for dinner. We ordered the combo. The food and meat was ok. Also, the combo didn't come with any sides, which I thought was traditional for Korean BBQ. The waitresses didn't check on us, so I ran out of napkins and water. I thought it was an alright experience. I have had better.

If I walk in and find Korean folks at a Korean restaurant I know I am going to be happy.  That said, we walked in and found tons of Korean's and a bus was pulling up to drop off tourists from Korea!  The table behind us was serving each other a lot of soju and doing some weird bending of the arm into their neighbors arm like at a wedding to drink!  That said, they were having a good time and it was probably for thee best that they were not driving.   Who knew that Korean's visiting the US would come to Schaumburg for Korean BBQ!  Ok, enough of that stuff.. 

So we ordered the combo sampler as well as some lovely marinated short ribs.. I couldn't pronounce the name there so I won't even try to spell it on here.  As usual, we loved all of the little tasty sides (the kimchi isn't as spicy or fermented as I like and there is always a weird mayonnaise type dish but all in all super good!) and could care less about the lettuce or salad.  It was all about the portions of grilled meat, tiny glasses for beer and a couple of three bottles of soju between the 3 of us.  Honestly, I haven't had a bad meal here and I spend a lot of time eating Asian food with Asian people.  

Not sure how anyone has bad service there unless they are slammed as the owner was constantly coming over to our table and helping us to cook our meat or serve it up.

Finally, a Korean restaurant in the area that's worth going to!  I've tried all the others in the area and was so disappointed that I almost didn't want to try this place, thinking that it would be the same.  Fortunately, I decided to try it out anyways and I'm so glad I did!
I dropped by with my girl on a Friday evening and got seated immediately.  The first thing I noticed was the mouth watering aroma of Korean grilled meats that filled the place.  The next thing I noticed was that the place was packed with mostly Koreans.  That's usually a good sign that the food is authentic.
We ordered the kimchee stew, marinated galbi(short ribs) and a big bottle of Korean beer.  The service started out a tad bit slow, but it wasn't anything to complain about.  They brought out the banchan(side dishes) and the beer to start off with.  What was surprising was that one of the banchans was galbi jjim(braised short ribs).  This is usually a main dish, and quite an expensive one at that.  I was surprised that they offered it for free as a banchan.  After a few sips of beer, the main dishes came out.  The kimchee stew tasted a bit different(gingery?) from other ones I've tried, but I got used to it quickly and really enjoyed it.  The marinated galbi was a tiny bit chewy, but still tasty.  We both really enjoyed the meal.
As noted, the service started out a tad bit slow, but once we were all settled in, the service was great.  Many different people walked by to make sure we were doing okay.  They had absolutely no problems with us asking for stuff and they did everything with a smile.  
All in all, I would say this is the best Korean restaurant in the area.  The food was great, the service was great, and it actually felt a bit like Korea in there.  I would definitely recommend this place to friends.  Try it out if you haven't!

Food: Good
Service: Acceptable
Price: Average
Ambience: Typical Korean BBQ

It's not bad but it's not outstanding. I didn't find anything special or out standing about this place. The meat, appetizers, service, price are all standard Korean BBQ.

Been eating here the last few years. Everytime we are craving for Korean food this is the place we come visit. I love their Chop Chae ! It's also a great for group dining as they have the tables where you can make your own barbq bolgogii.
Like any ethnic restaurants, if you see that ethnic group populating that restaurant, do as they do and have a seat and enjoy the ethnic atmosphere.

I made reservations as suggested by another Yelper and got seated right away (on a Friday evening too!)

First impression was that the layout was a little awkward Some of the tables were very close together while others were more spaced apart. You can easily bump into someone or something in certain parts of the restaurant. Also, the tables and chairs didn't all match, and by that, I mean some tables were a different material and appearance than others. If the food is great though, it doesn't matter if they have the ugliest furniture ever or the worst layout.

The banchans, or mini side dishes, were pretty good (we got seven for a party of two). I don't know too many Korean restaurants in the area that offer a beef banchan, so definitely a plus!

I ordered dolsot bibimbap (hot stone bowl of beef, rice, veggies), which was pretty good. I couldn't finish at least half of it because the banchans helped fill me up. My friend ordered the yukgaejang (beef soup). I tried some of her dish, which was pretty decent.

Our table didn't have the buzzer that other Yelpers had mentioned in their reviews. However, service was good, and the employees were attentive.

Overall, I recommend going to this restaurant.

Made reservations for dinner for 2 earlier in the day. When we arrived, there was already a bunch of people in front of us. It was confusing because we waited awhile but no one came to us. I finally went to the front of the restaurant and told the lady about our reservations. She simply said okay. From that point on, I was expecting slow/poor service for the rest of the night, especially as we continued to wait without given a proper response. Also, we noticed a couple of empty tables, but no one was being seated. A bunch of other tables cleared out and the little old lady came to everyone and simply asked who was next. I reminded her about our reservations and she seated us, not because of our reservations, but simply because I spoke up next. All in all though, we waited about 10 minutes.

Everything changed the moment we were seated. Each table had a call button, so when pressed, someone comes immediately to assist you. That was amazing. Not only that, many people came by casually asking how we were doing and very genuinely doing so.

We had the seafood pancake to start and it was amazing. They jam-packed the pancake with seafood and scallions and was almost too much, relative to the batter. It was delicious, accompanied by perfectly grilled octopus and a sweet sesame soy sauce for dipping.

I had the spicy tofu soup with seafood. Their portions were a lot bigger than other places (92 Town & Ttowa). I immediately tasted the broth and it was the perfect spicy seafood flavor. However, I did not find too many seafood pieces in my soup. Nonetheless, it was delicious. The egg was likely put in a little too early as it wasn't as runny as it should be, as it was already slightly cooked in the hot soup (92 Town's egg was perfect). Just as tasty if not more than 92 Town's but definitely larger portion. My boyfriend had the spicy beef soup, and it was a little too spicy for him, but he still enjoyed it. His portion was even bigger than mine, so much so, that we had leftovers (we never have leftovers).

All in all, a little pricy, but Korean food generally is, but huge portions and delicious authentic food and the best service I've had in a long time, which means a lot, especially for an Asian restaurant. Also, reservations don't seem to matter, so just get there asap. Also, found their menu to have fewer options and/or less variety, at least for their non-bbq selection.

My daughter and I wandered in here one afternoon and we now have a favorite special lunch spot. The bibimbap is fantastic and we both can't wait to have errands in the area to have an excuse to stop in again.

Great Korean food if you are looking for something in the Schaumburg area. The place will get pretty busy during dinner time. There's always a large group of Koreans coming off of shuttle buses that dine here.

On a Friday right after work (around 8pm), there wasn't much of a wait for a party of 2. Maybe we were just lucky. The restaurant was packed and a line developed later in the evening. I love that feeling when you're at an awesome place but didn't have to wait!

I got the yukgaejang which is a Korean beef soup. The ingredients tasted fresh and the soup was hearty and well seasoned. It's mildly spicy, but definitely nothing compared to other spicy Korean dishes. 

My friend ordered the dolsot (hot stone bowl) bibimbap. It looked fresh and yummy. 

The banchans (free side dishes) didn't disappoint, usually my favorite part of eating at a Korean restaurant. And as with other Korean restaurants, they'll keep the banchans coming to your heart's content. 

The food was a tiny bit on the pricier side, I  think, for this kind of cuisine, but at least it was quality. Overall, I was quite satisfied. This was one of the better Korean restaurants I'd been to in a while.
Service was very slow. Had the kimchi jigae and I was not a fan of it as the dish wasn't very flavorful. Husband loved his bibimbap though!

I have been coming here since I was 10 years old.  They changed owners over the years and this one is the best by far.  The food here is fresh and they serve good quality meat unlike other Korean restaurants.  The spicy soups are amazing here.   Love this place

Never again.....the service was careless and uninspired. 
The meal was served piecemeal; appetizer and one entree first. 45 minute wait for the second entree. 
The hot tea was apparently left over from lunch and stone cold.
The food is so-so and priced higher than it merits.
I won't be back.

Have been here for at least 10 times, near to my previous office.
Good for lunch and dinner for me.

If you want simple lung just order the Dumplings soup, which is healthy and good for lunch.
If you want to have a big meal, traditional Korean BBQ is so good for family gathering or friends parties. Beef tongue, Porkbelly, or just regular chicken, pork or beef bugulgi is wonderful enough to make your stomach satisfied.

Cold noodle is good but not my style. 

Dol all bb bam is always attractive for me, whether lunch or dinner.

Service is good if you show some respect to those kind and helpful folks.

What else? Say Hi to your Korean friends!

Food took forever,  it wasn't even busy,  they sat us near the door and every time the door opened I was greeted by the most chilling cold breeze ever, the server never came around when I needed her,   food was not worth the wait, I do not recommend it and they also seem racist to non Asian people,  because we waited,  some other Hispanic people were waiting forever,  but a few Asian tables got their food first despite coming in after us.

My friend and I ordered the Korean BBQ for 2 and I have never been so satisfied with a meal in my life! We took our time, tried every combination imaginable, and left a few pounds heavier than we arrived. SO worth it!

The staff was very helpful and accommodating, the dining area was clean and open, and the food was AMAZING!

If I lived nearby, I would eat here every day.
Overpriced and blended food.  Not worth the money.  Service is OK.  Nothing special. I don't know why people like this place.  Yelp failed.

This place was pretty f*cking good! Coming from LA where there's kbbq places in every corner, I didn't really have high expectations coming into this place. But this place definitely exceeded my expectations! Their kalbi was the best. Prices were very reasonable. Service was very nice and attentive. No complaints 
Will definitely come back when I'm in the area again
Awesome place! Very nice people in charge. Good Korean bbq. Noodles can be very spicy if you choose and my family and I love spicy so it was nice.
Koreana has real, authentic Korean; the prices are steep but worth it. If you like spice, and you are white, be sure to tell them because they seem to assume that white means no spice.

I've visited this location for almost 30 years; it's gone through a few owners, and there have been ups and downs because of it. But the current owner does things right. Even though I don't live anywhere near the place, I make a point of dropping in a lot. 

The food is just outstanding, plain and simple. No matter what I or my friends order, it's delicious. The bulgogi, bibim bap, and chap chae are my favorites. There's also a special place in my heart for their kimchee stew, especially on a day like today where the wind chill is below zero. Any time we had a question about a dish, the staff always gave a thorough answer. We've also asked for suggestions, and were happy with the recommendations.

Speaking of the staff...the servers are no-nonsense, efficient, and attentive, but not in the overly solicitous way Americans seem to expect. Which, frankly, is a relief. Your server won't come by every few minutes to ask if they can get you anything, or top off the water glass you've barely touched. If you want something, press the call button at your table, or simply raise your hand to get a server's attention, and they will respond quickly. Otherwise, they're going to give you space to enjoy your meal and your friends. To be honest, I wish more restaurants were like this.

You want "authentic" Korean - go here,  You want to cook at your table - go here, you want true small restaurant atmosphere - go here. Yout want amazing Korean BBQ and the sides that go with it - go here.

You want high-brow and to be waited on hand and foot - avoid here ,but this ain't (sic) that kind of place.

This place is amazing.  We are going back for sure.  Reservation made (and held - even though there were some "regulars" trying to "schmooze" their way in).  Great place.  They leave you alone, to the point where you have to flag them down in you actually want something - but we liked that.
