Tried Koreana for the first time today for lunch.  Another review had mentioned a lunch rush and specials for $5.95.  The lunch specials are now $7.99 (still not a bad value for what you get) and there was plenty of seating available.

The menu is limited at lunch time, only about 12 dishes, all for the same price, which come with soup and some additional appetizers such as kimchi and others that I am not well-versed enough with Korean food to identify.  My family enjoyed them, though.

I had the beef bulgogi, which while not being the best I've ever had, was certainly good enough to enjoy, if a little plain.  My wife loved the Bibimbap.

I would definitely come here again, but not all the time.

The pork bulgogi and bibimbap were absolutely delish--and so pretty to look at!  I watched food being cooked right on top of a neighboring table, which was fun.  The serving sizes were so huge that I would have needed to be rolled out of the restaurant if I had actually eaten everything.  With that being said, I would rather have a much smaller portion and lower price--it WAS lunch after all.  If I had been thinking straight, I would have just ordered ONE entree and shared it with my dining companion.  But I'm not sorry, since I got to sample two different dishes.  Anyway, I was very glad to have stopped at this little joint on my way back to Madison.  Thumbs up.

Had lunch with a long-time-no-seen friend here. Just walk in, no reservation needed, which is cool.

The grill/bbq is excellent, especially the bbq pork. It's been a while that I havn't had anything I can call it BBQ. _ or free appetizers are delicious as well. Too sad we only ordered two dishes. The environment is Korean-like but with TV in every conner to keep you attracted. Wow, this place is good.   
However, what is not good about this place is also fairly notable. The lady who took our orders is NOT very friendly. She went back-and-forth and was not helpful when we were struggling on which one to order. Moreover, she left us with the impression that people work at this awesome restaurant do not care what costumer's feeling. Too bad for a decent Korean Restaurant like this.

But anyway, for their good food, I will be back.
Only ate there once but it was extremely good!

My friend kept on insisting that I need to try this place because of their impeccable service and delicious food.  So finally after a friend's graduation, we decided to give this place a try.  We called ahead to reserve a table because we had a large group (thank goodness we did because it wasn't a huge place and it was getting busy).

As we walked in, we were immediately seated and offered water and tea.  My section of the group opted out of korean bbq and decided to order other things off the menu:

Appetizers:
- Seafood Pancake - mixed seafood w/ onions fried in a batter.  This is one of my favorite things to order in a Korean restaurant.  I don't know why, but something about all the flavors and textures makes it delicious.  Dip it in some homemade soy sauce for more flavor.
  
- Ddukbokki - sweet and spicy rice cake w/ squid,  fish cake and mix vegetables.  If you like spicy food, then this dish is for you.  All the flavors complimented each other well.  

Entrees:
- Kimchi Jjigae - spicy soup with kimchi, tofu, vegetables, and pork.  OMG...this was soo good.  It was spicy and the right amount of sour.

- Beef Chop Chae - clear noodles with beef and vegetables.  This dish did not stand out for me.  It was just average and taste like any other Korean place.

The food also came with a couple of side dishes.  It was not as much or as tasty as what I'm used to at other Korean restaurants.  But overall, I enjoyed this place.  The food was a little above average and the service here was great.  Definitely will consider coming back when I'm in the area again.

Lunch ends early whenever they feel like it, if they hand you a dinner menu, LEAVE.

PRICE INCREASE, only about a half dozen lunch specials are $8, the other half just got raised 10-25% and does pop them into that extra dollar sign.  
Korean BBQ much more expensive. Avoid peak times and that ENDLESS droning lunchtime reality real estate TV, yikes.

*Don't forget Viet House and Asian Noodle House do the same menu ALL day. HIGHLY recommended, Yu's unfortunately has really tanked for lunch.

the food is very authentic and the best part is the staff is very nice and friendly and accommodating.  Too often going to Korean, the language barrier, or the staff make it hard to just plain order.  Not at Koreana, everyone was very friendly nice, and most importantly the food was excellent!

On my quest to find Korean BBQ comparable to LA in the NW burbs, I have yet to. However this is the closest. Food is quality and service, because servers are generally younger, is better than most korean restaurants. This is my go to place.

My family went here a few weeks ago for lunch on a Saturday and we were very happy.

We are new to Korean BBQ and have not been to one is 15+ years.  We told the person who took our order and she helped us with what to order.

What was really great is she also came over and helped us cook our food.  I also did my part putting food on the grill and off, but it was really helpful to get some direction on where the hot and cold areas of the grill were.

At the end of the meal they brought us a sample of a special coffee they make there.  Very nice, and I am not really a coffee drinker.  I will need to order that next time.

As far as the food, which is why you go there, it was very good.  We had an assortment: beef, chicken, pork, shrimp, mushrooms.  My daughter had noodles, and we had different appetizer type dishes.

All tasted very good.  

I think we lucked out on the service, they indicated it is very busy at dinner time.  So if you are new I recommend going for lunch.

One of the top Korean restaurants in the city.  It's located in a strip mall and when I arrived there was no lighted sign.  Hopefully that will get fixed soon.  Even without a sign, though, it was packed on a Sunday night.  Make reservations!

We had the combination barbeque that we cooked on our table.  It included beef bulgogi and short ribs.  It was spectacular.  I'm also partial to that spicy been curd soup that's a Korean specialty and they really did it right.

Another thing that really sets this restaurant apart from other Korean restaurants I've tried is the wonderful friendliness of the staff.  The waitresses were very attentive and the owners stopped by our table several times to make sure we were doing well.

I will definitely come back when in Schaumburg!
Good food. Don't order beef tong though since its too thick and hard to swallow. good seafood pancake.

Excellent banchan (including rarely seen beef side) and kimchi.

Ho-hum spicy chicken barbecue.

Good service.

BUZZ
- Kalbi (2/10)

I ALSO TRIED
- Chadolbaegi (6/10)
- Chadol Surprise (Yes, I made up this name) (4/10)
- Nakji Bokum (6/10)
- Mool Nengmyun (4/10)

Koreana has been in this location for something like 30 years probably. Put it this way, I remember my grandma buying me lunch here when I "graduated" elementary school, and by that time, we had already known about this place and had been coming here occasionally. That being said, since then, this place has had like 5+ different owners, all trying to do something different. Unfortunately, through the heyday of Korean BBQ, Koreana just kept failing, because nobody would come here! Their regular food was mediocre, and their BBQ paled in both taste and value. I mean, c'mon! We had Garden Buffet, Gangnam Galbi (the original Gangnam Style), San Soo Gap San, and other places in the original Chicago K-Town! Nobody went to freaking Hoffman Estates to get Korean food! But, every time Korean failed, there was another wide eyed (wow that's racist!) Korean family who wanted to take the reigns. We must be on our 5th owner by now! 

Anyway, I randomly took my parents here for dinner recently and noticed that, for the first time, there were actually PEOPLE here! It's usually so quiet! Then I Yelped and was surprised to find people were actually commenting on their KBBQ! I was like, whoa, no way! Did a decent KBBQ place just pop up here in Hoffman?! So, I picked up my parents from the airport one night, and came here to try their BBQ..

CHADOL
We sat at a grilling table, but they had to bring out a portable butane burner with the stone pan for the chadol. Guess it slides through the grill. The meat was ok, definitely passable. It wasn't all that fatty, so that's good, but regardless, it was a bit chewy, unlike Cho Sun Ok. All in all, decent.

CHADOL SURPRISE
I don't know what this is called, but if you get Chadolbaegi, you automatically (I think) get bbokumbap. Basically, after you're done grilling all your chadol, they take the hot pan, dump a bunch of rice, and your kimchi, spinach, bean sprouts, and some other kimchi-like stuff in there, along with some of the last slices of chadol, to make a Korean fried rice. Cho Sun Ok is notorious for this, because theirs is so good! Koreana? Sorry. Lacks in seasoning and lacks in spice. Flavor's are all right, but you almost want to sprinkle some salt on this thing. Certainly edible, but not all that enjoyable.

KALBI
Ok, here we go, this is it right? WRONG! Slices are pretty chewy too, and the meat's not the greatest quality. Sometimes you get slices where you chew forever, and eventually have to spit it out...gracefully. That alone puts a huge damper on it, but the flavor also suffers. Their marinade has way too much ginger in it. It's not like your tongue is burning with ginger, but the key to a great kalbi marinade is the blending of all the flavors. It should come out as a sweet, smoky, salty masterpiece. You should never actually, specifically, taste the ginger. So I really didn't enjoy this kalbi.

NAKJI BOKUM
This is basically octopus cooked in a sweet & spicy sauce, deep red in color. The octopus was bleh, tasted a bit too much like the ocean. The sauce was decent, although little to no spice at all. Quick Tip, mix this with the Chadol Surprise and it's very palatable!

MOOL NENGMYUN
For some reason, young'ns (20's-40's) love to get ice cold Nengmyun after KBBQ. I think it's absolutely refreshing. Older folks don't share the sentiment though, for some reason. Anyway, their myun (noodles) are very very chewy and actually a little hard. It'd seem easy to cut with your teeth, but it's not that easy. The broth is very plain. Couple slices of beef, a slice of pear and an egg. No radish, no cucumbers. The broth itself is pretty light, to the point where when you add vinegar, it doesn't taste like "Vinegary Nengmyun" it tastes like "Vinegar." But, definitely gets points for being ice cold, with crushed ice in it. I definitely would NOT come here just to get this, but it did it's job post KBBQ meal.

FAILURANA
Sorry. Koreana STILL succumbs to the great Chicago Korean Food Failure. Chicago has the worst Korean food on the planet. It makes no sense, but somehow that's what it is. Koreana is your average Chicago Korean restaurant, nothing more.

Always liked this casual place, especially for the little dishes with kimchi, daikon kimchi, tofu, etc. they bring out... Sorry, I don't know the name of the dishes. 

Seems much brighter inside and not so depressing these days. (or at least it seemed to me. haha)

Staff is friendly, or maybe they were just paying more attention to the grill and our burning kalbi and bulgolgi than we were. That's an inherent problem of catching up with someone you haven't seen for years at a Korean BBQ place.   

Beef can be cooked at table, pork they will not allow you to. Health regulations or something - didn't get the whole story. 

The restaurant was full for a Sunday evening, but not overly loud or obnoxious.

Came here on a Thursday around 6pm or so. Place was nicely packed but there was no wait, and the atmosphere was great. Everyone was enjoying themselves! (And the decor is pretty nice and homey too)

Banchan were fresh and tasty. Bulgogi was oh so good. Chap chae (sp?) was also delicious. I was given a spicy soybean paste soup (Doenjang jjigae) along with the Bulgogi, which was great! I didn't really see that listed on the menu so it was a pleasant surprise. The miso soup my cousin received, however, was very bland. But, it's miso soup; that's far from what we came here to eat :D

Our bill came to $32 - I'd say that's damn reasonable for two full bellies of goodness!

Also, the service here was great. I mean, probably not to the level large American chains adhere to, but I find their ass-kissing style to just be too much anyway. BUT, compared to other Korean restaurants I've been to, the servers here were super friendly and very helpful. For me, perfection!

I am not a Korean food expert (hence only 4 stars, cause I don't think I could defend 5 with my experience), but I've been to Cho Sun Ok in Chicago and.. this place has better tasting food (what we got at least) and the service was awesome.

I am making this my go-to Korean food spot! :D

Nom nom.

There's a lot of reviews of this place, and it's already rated highly, so my review will probably get lost in here.  But after going last night, I had to create a Yelp account to give this place praises.  The food was fantastic, the atmosphere was great, and the service was phenomenal.  The owner (or manager) visited our table multiple times, giving us recommendations on what to order, checking to make sure everything was good, and asking us if he could get us anything else.  

I will definitely be back.

The good was ok. The service was bad. Very bad!! We got the table with the grill and she kept forgetting about our food. We had to do it ourselves. We had to keep asking for things we were suppose to have with our meal. Not what I was expecting in cleanliness. Probably won't go there again.

This was a busy Saturday night, it was just before 9 when we got seated.

Our party of five split an order of beef bulgogi and Korean bbq combination which included beef galbi, ribeye steak, jumbo shrimp, mushrooms and chicken and pork bulgogi. The owner (I forgot his name, I have to go back and ask now) is an unassuming man with a quirky sense of humor. When I asked for a bottle of soju, he came back with his own shot glass at one point and shared a shot with us. The sides kept coming, the Bulls were on and winning against the Hornets. Everything was delicious. And the shaved ice dessert (patbingsoo) with vanilla ice cream and assorted toppings (beans, fruit and jellied items) ended it all just right. 

This was my third time at Koreana and it's been the best time so far.
Great food. Courteous service staff. The owner's husband is funny as hell. The prices are good as well!

I wanted to take my parents for Korean food for the first time; they'd never had it before. The staff was very friendly, they all must've talked about it being their first time because they kept asking my parents how they were enjoying the meal!! We each had stone-bowl Bibimbap and it was delish. The kimchi and other appetizers that came with it were great too. We stuffed ourselves full to the brim, and we're definitely coming back.

It is very much a local restaurant as it fits in with its surroundings of the strip mall and just outside of the Woodfield retail area.  The environment is quite simple and has tables to the side which have vents for those wanting Korean BBQ or those who want prepared meals from the kitchen.  

One person in our group had the mul neng myun which my friend enjoyed.  She's also had the bibim neng myun but with the rising temps, she wanted to cool down.  My friend and I ordered similar dishes: stir fried squid and stir fried octopus.  While some places might be similar, these dishes were cooked to their proper tenderness and spiced right. 

The food here is good but the number of menu items were pretty limited and the prices for the Korean BBQ was pretty high.  If you're looking for a cheap meal, there are very few options.  I expect a little more upscale environment, a better variety of banchan, and better service for the higher prices.  I won't complain if friends want to go here but it won't be at the top of my personal choice.
Awesome delicious food. And the employees where really friendly must try if you like Korean food. The servings are huge and delicious I just can't stress it enough. Its a must try place.

It was a blessing in disguise that Todai has been (permanently) closed, because we were diverted to this little gem, which has quickly become my new favorite Korean bbq restaurant.  

Service:  Koreana has restored my faith in Chicago area Korean restaurants, which are notorious for terrible service, and they have revolutionized the system by adding a "call" button at each table.  Yeah, I'm serious.  You push the button and they come to you, it's brilliant.  

Food:  Their marinated kalbi (short rib) is deliciously seasoned and perfectly juicy and tender.  It's one of the best I've had in the Chicago area, and that's saying a lot.  Our server did an expert job of cooking the entire batch for us, which was unusual since they usually leave you on your own.  The sides and stews were great, but you really have to come for their awesome bbq.    

So put on some scrubby outfit you don't care about since you WILL come out smelling like a giant slab of cooked meat, come hungry, and get your MEAT on.  And if you can still think about Korean food afterwards, there's a Korean grocery store next door, very convenient.

Went here a couple weekends ago with friends for the first time. Service was decent and the food was good. The place is definitely not what you'd consider modern. Our grill had to stay on by rigging a pencil to it. LOL. The place was clean so that's always nice and reassuring. The meat we used to bbq was fresh and the marinade was up to par. I'm a big critic of Korean food since my parents make some stellar homemade food. It is worth going here and the prices werr2 reasonable. At the end of the day, it was $22 per couple... not bad.

I take my Korean bbq very seriously.  I look at the extensive Yelp reviews, peruse the menu, chat with fellow Yelpers, and even call the restaurant ahead of time to make sure of the food offerings!  Dining out is no cheap task, but when I do, I make sure to have all my bases covered! 

But on a very spontaneous evening, me and the bf were roaming around the Northwest Suburbs looking for some comfort FOOD.  Indian? Nah.  Thai? Too ordinary.  Korean bbq- yep, I'm always game for that!

So the stars aligned for this place, and surprises that turn out successfully are always welcome in my book.  The ambience was my favorite kinda joint: Mom and Pop with friendly service. To add to the authenticity to the place and the stamp or approval, all the dinners were of Korean descent, and had massive amounts of food at their table.  I couldn't see this being a crummy spot with all the spreads that were laid out.

Marinated chicken was neatly grilled atop sheet of foil that was placed on gas grill.  Thoughtful, since no small bits were lost thru the grates.  Beef kalbi was well marinated.  Fresh selection of panchan, although not the largest (San Soo) or the best (Cho Sun).  

The star of the meal was the warm squid appetizer with the spicy sauce.  It was "carved" into a blooming rose which the dcor was exquisite as the taste. 

Prices reasonable.  Parking easy.

Yum... if you don't know where to start when it comes to the menu, tell the awesome staff you want to try everything!

They fired up the tableside bbq and made about 7 different cuts of delicious marinated meats. It came with a bunch of various sides meant to be eaten all together in lettuce leaves.

Definitely going back...

My husband & I had dinner this evening @ Koreana.  
The staff is very friendly & the food was great!
We forgot about the bell as to my husbands water ran out & was not ever filled. But he drank mine & was fine. We sat waiting for the check, forgetting about the bell.. We've noticed all Korean places let you have your space & time.. if you need something, I think it's more like- Speak Up!
I don't recall dessert being on the menu, but it may have. None was offered at the end of the meal. I think this would be a nice touch even if it's not custom in Korean places, as I overheard the 2 couples behind us saying, "Where are we headed for dessert?" as they were leaving. 
Overall great! We will be back!

Complimentary plates are always better than what I ordered. LOL.
Korean pronunciation based food names are not friendly for non-Korean. Maybe some more image would help.
Polite service is enjoyable.

One of the top Korean restaurants in the city.  It's located in a strip mall and when I arrived there was no lighted sign.  Hopefully that will get fixed soon.  Even without a sign, though, it was packed on a Sunday night.  Make reservations!

We had the combination barbeque that we cooked on our table.  It included beef bulgogi and short ribs.  It was spectacular.  I'm also partial to that spicy been curd soup that's a Korean specialty and they really did it right.

Another thing that really sets this restaurant apart from other Korean restaurants I've tried is the wonderful friendliness of the staff.  The waitresses were very attentive and the owners stopped by our table several times to make sure we were doing well.

I will definitely come back when in Schaumburg!
Good food. Don't order beef tong though since its too thick and hard to swallow. good seafood pancake.

Excellent banchan (including rarely seen beef side) and kimchi.

Ho-hum spicy chicken barbecue.

Good service.

The good was ok. The service was bad. Very bad!! We got the table with the grill and she kept forgetting about our food. We had to do it ourselves. We had to keep asking for things we were suppose to have with our meal. Not what I was expecting in cleanliness. Probably won't go there again.

This was a busy Saturday night, it was just before 9 when we got seated.

Great food. Courteous service staff. The owner's husband is funny as hell. The prices are good as well!

Awesome delicious food. And the employees where really friendly must try if you like Korean food. The servings are huge and delicious I just can't stress it enough. Its a must try place.

Food:  Their marinated kalbi (short rib) is deliciously seasoned and perfectly juicy and tender.  It's one of the best I've had in the Chicago area, and that's saying a lot.  Our server did an expert job of cooking the entire batch for us, which was unusual since they usually leave you on your own.  The sides and stews were great, but you really have to come for their awesome bbq.    

So put on some scrubby outfit you don't care about since you WILL come out smelling like a giant slab of cooked meat, come hungry, and get your MEAT on.  And if you can still think about Korean food afterwards, there's a Korean grocery store next door, very convenient.

Went here a couple weekends ago with friends for the first time. Service was decent and the food was good. The place is definitely not what you'd consider modern. Our grill had to stay on by rigging a pencil to it. LOL. The place was clean so that's always nice and reassuring. The meat we used to bbq was fresh and the marinade was up to par. I'm a big critic of Korean food since my parents make some stellar homemade food. It is worth going here and the prices werr2 reasonable. At the end of the day, it was $22 per couple... not bad.

I take my Korean bbq very seriously.  I look at the extensive Yelp reviews, peruse the menu, chat with fellow Yelpers, and even call the restaurant ahead of time to make sure of the food offerings!  Dining out is no cheap task, but when I do, I make sure to have all my bases covered! 

But on a very spontaneous evening, me and the bf were roaming around the Northwest Suburbs looking for some comfort FOOD.  Indian? Nah.  Thai? Too ordinary.  Korean bbq- yep, I'm always game for that!

So the stars aligned for this place, and surprises that turn out successfully are always welcome in my book.  The ambience was my favorite kinda joint: Mom and Pop with friendly service. To add to the authenticity to the place and the stamp or approval, all the dinners were of Korean descent, and had massive amounts of food at their table.  I couldn't see this being a crummy spot with all the spreads that were laid out.

Marinated chicken was neatly grilled atop sheet of foil that was placed on gas grill.  Thoughtful, since no small bits were lost thru the grates.  Beef kalbi was well marinated.  Fresh selection of panchan, although not the largest (San Soo) or the best (Cho Sun).  

The star of the meal was the warm squid appetizer with the spicy sauce.  It was "carved" into a blooming rose which the dcor was exquisite as the taste. 

Prices reasonable.  Parking easy.

Yum... if you don't know where to start when it comes to the menu, tell the awesome staff you want to try everything!

They fired up the tableside bbq and made about 7 different cuts of delicious marinated meats. It came with a bunch of various sides meant to be eaten all together in lettuce leaves.

Definitely going back...

My husband & I had dinner this evening @ Koreana.  
The staff is very friendly & the food was great!
We forgot about the bell as to my husbands water ran out & was not ever filled. But he drank mine & was fine. We sat waiting for the check, forgetting about the bell.. We've noticed all Korean places let you have your space & time.. if you need something, I think it's more like- Speak Up!
I don't recall dessert being on the menu, but it may have. None was offered at the end of the meal. I think this would be a nice touch even if it's not custom in Korean places, as I overheard the 2 couples behind us saying, "Where are we headed for dessert?" as they were leaving. 
Overall great! We will be back!

Complimentary plates are always better than what I ordered. LOL.
Korean pronunciation based food names are not friendly for non-Korean. Maybe some more image would help.
Polite service is enjoyable.

So sad to have to update my review to say this, but... twice now, I've found a hair in my bibimbap after I brought it home. Not the same color as my hair. Need to find a non-awkward way to suggest the cooks wear hats, but until then, I'll probably stay away from the bibimbaps here.

Their consistency needs to improve before I redo their ratings.  Lets just say whatever they were serving as their kimchi jigae was absolutely awful contrasting to previous orders...did nobody taste it that day prior to offering it to the customers?  How does Koreans mess up Kimchi, seriously?

Ever since I moved from the city to the burbs, I've been hoping to find a delicious spot to satisfy my dolsot bi bim bop cravings. What can I say but...victory! Koreana serves up a delicious stone bowl filled with all the yummy fix'ns. Along with my food came a nice variety of banchan (those tasty little side dishes) and also miso soup. The miso soup was actually the only thing that was a bit bland and meh. Everything else was deeeeeelicious. My fiance was nursing a cold and deciding on a soup to order that would warm him up, but not be too spicy. One of the owners - an older man - came right over to our table and asked us if we had any questions or needed any help. We told him our conundrum, and he effusively told us he'd whip us up the perfect soup. When our food came out, the soup was delicious! The perfect level of spice, and filled with all kinds of delicious noodles, veg, meat, etc. The owner also insisted my fiance try some spicy pickled onions, claiming this would be sure to clear his cold. He emerged with a special little plate of the pickled delights (at no charge). 

This place was jam packed with folks on a Friday night around 6pm, and about 95% were speaking Korean, which seems to bode well for the authenticity of the food. I found everything we had to be delicious and just as good as the city staples SSGS, Cho Sun Ok, Solga (for their dolsot bi bim bop), etc. The restaurant is very cozy, and the owners and waitresses are really helpful and friendly. The owners walk around, shmoozing, joking and laughing with patrons. Very much a family run business. It's great! The owners make you feel very welcome. Definitely a different vibe than many other Korean BBQ spots I've been to where the service tends to be absolutely terrible. I was going to give this place four stars for dependable and tasty food, but the friendly servers and awesome owners pushed it up to a fiver. I highly recommend this place and will be going back. Also, just a heads up that they DO take reservations. No more waiting in line for an hour for your BBQ fix!

I came here tonight with a party of 3 to check out their Korean food. After reading about the Korean BBQ (K-BBQ), my husband and I ordered their "Combo (For 2)" BBQ, which included shrimp, bulgogi, kalbi, chicken kalbi, daeji bulgogi (pork ribeye), mushrooms, and onion. Our friend ordered the dduk-mandoo-gook (rice cake and dumpling soup). 

SERVICE (Preface): The service wasn't that great (NOTE: Don't stop reading here. You MUST keep reading to understand why I note this as such). Because we had K-BBQ, we had someone coming around frequently to cook our BBQ food. However, once we were done, they didn't swing by anymore. One woman came by once to refill our waters once without asking. 

SERVICE (Cont'd): Towards the end, we were disappointed that they didn't swing by anymore and check up on us; ask if we were okay, etc. We were waiting for them to come with our check!! We waited and waited and waited. But then ("light bulb goes off!"), we realized that they have the SERVICE BUTTONS. We were thinking like Americans and not like Koreans!! American-style: Be served well: the servers come by all the time and ask you if you need anything, how your food is, etc.... Korean-style: Let the servers know when you need something!!! Totally forgot that this restaurant has the service buttons. When you need something, you push that little button with weird characters that is next to your table. That gets the servers attention! They come when you push the button and you can let them know at that time!!! Totally forgot that they had this! OUR FAULT.

FOOD (K-BBQ): Portions were reasonable for the price you paid. I thought that the portions for the BBQ was pretty generous. However, I wasn't impressed by the seasonings. They were "okay". Personally, I didn't think they had enough flavor/seasoning/marinade. They were too lightly seasoned and could have had more flavor. I felt this way about all of them. The two best that I enjoyed were the (1) bulgogi, and (2) daeji bulgogi (pork bulgogi). The chicken kalbi lacked flavor and wasn't too impressive. The kalbi - same as chicken kalbi. 

FOOD (Dduk Mandoo Gook "rice cake and dumpling soup"): While I did not taste this myself, he said it was good. He enjoyed it. After reconsidering some of the reviews and going ourself, I am leaning towards the fact that their dishes (soups, jjigaes, etc.) may be better than their BBQ, but I'll report back after I go back again.

COST: This is a relatively more expensive Korean restaurant. I give it $$ (not sure what yelp has it at). On average, your dish (be it soup, noodles, appetizers, etc.) are greater than $9.99. If you're looking for cheap Korean food, this is not your place. If you want to take somebody to impress them with more expensive food, this may be it. WHILE the food is slightly more expensive, I think they make up for it with very generous portions. The dduk-mandoo-gook was fairly large. The guy only ate 1/2 of it! 

AMBIANCE: For a Korean restaurant in Chicago, it was clean, and they had nice decor. Not overly fancy but not too casual. 

CONCLUSION: All in all, a decent Korean restaurant (not cheap). Was not impressed with their BBQ, but it is still A-OK, and I DO want to go back to try their non-BBQ food. Other peoples' non-BBQ dishes looked tasty. Will go back again, but not for K-BBQ. Go to "Woo Li Mal" for all you can eat K-BBQ with meat that has better/more flavor!)

(Pictures to come!)

My favorite KBBQ place (as well as Korean food in general)! I don't like driving into Chicago for it as I live in Dekalb and it's a bit far already (however, it's not my fault that Dekalb has nothing in the way of diverse food offerings). 
I've had both varieties of samgyeopsal, pork bulgogi, beef bulgogi, and probably a few other things I don't remember as far as BBQ goes. The samgyeopsal is my favorite but it's all extremely good. I recently went with my roommate and had dolsot bibimbap and found that theirs is excellent, so it's probably not much of a stretch to say their whole menu is good. 
Their tea is also one of my favorite things on the planet, although they don't serve it in summer, that just makes me want it that much more by fall.
They give a pretty good selection of banchan that is refillable, including kimchi, potato, jalapeno beef (is there a better name for this? idk), coleslaw, bean sprouts, seaweed, radish, and more. I usually end up with 8-10 every time I go. Also, if you get BBQ, you get a bowl of soondubu jjigae as well.
The service is fantastic for a Korean restaurant. I hate when American restaurants force servers to hover over me and ask about my food every 2 minutes; the people here usually ask once or twice, or not at all if they're busy and I love it. Obviously it's not for everyone, though.
In summary, yes I recommend coming here and doing it as often as you can. I'm sure I'll be a frequent visitor through my years at university. :)

one of the best yuk-gye-jang (spicy beef broth soup with shredded beef and veggies) ive ever had in chicago. cheap, tasty, and large portion to fill you up until next day.

really, i cant wait to visit this place again to try other menu items.
my god i crave some yukgyejang now!

highly recommended!

Went here for some meat-on-fire action with a friend. My friend was very white so the proprietor decide to cook our barbeque for us lol. 

The Pros:
1. Good quality meat (we got kalbi and bulgogi). 
2. Tasty Marinade
3. Fast Service
4. Good Quality Banchans (Side dishes)
5. BBQ Comes with rice and korean miso soup

The Cons:
1. NOT ALL YOU CAN EAT! - They give large portions but I'd prefer all you can eat because I'm a gluttonous pig. (OINK OINK!)
2. Only can order 1 meat per order so you don't really get a variety if your group is too small. 
3. Prices are a little steep for designated portion sizes. (like 19.00 for 10 thin slices of short rib)
4. Not as many Banchans as BBQ hut. (Still a lot though).

Overall I'd say this place is great and the service is friendly. The best advice is come with a lot of people so you can try different cuts of meat.

My boyfriend found this place through yelp and decided that we should try it out because many people on here raved about it. (The best decision he made!)

We walked in and was seated down immediately (it wasn't extremely busy when we got there, but it started to pick up after 20min) and was greeted by friendly man (I'm assuming the boss). My bf and I wanted to try something different and more authentic Korean food, the boss suggested we should try out the Du Buk Ki(Spicy Rice Cake w/ fishcake and squid). He told us that it was really popular in Korea, and they make it the best in the country. My bf and I decided to try it out....all I can say is....OMG it was delicious!!!! I'm not sure whether they make it the best in the country, but it is definitely more than good enough to satisfy me! We were also served with mini free appetizers, which was also yummy. I ordered bibimbop and my bf had a soup (w/ clear noodles and mx vegetables, beef, and comes with rice).  They were equally delicious. 

The service was incredible as well. We were approached by over 2-3 different servers just to check up on us whether everything was good and if we needed anything else. At the end of the day, the boss gave us his business card and told us to call the restaurant before coming (takes us 45min to get to Schaumburg) just in case it's too pack on Friday-Sunday.

Overall, I say definitely give this place a try. You won't regret it!

I've been meaning to write a review for Koreana for a few weeks now. After a disappointing experience at a nearby Korean restaurant, my friend was very reluctant to try another Korean joint in the neighborhood. This spot is tucked away on a side street off of Golf Rd in a strip mall, but fortunately we found it pretty easily. 

Hands down, Koreana is THE best Korean dining experience I've EVER had. Not only was the food exquisite, the service is EXCEPTIONAL. This is the first Korean BBQ joint I've been to where the server cooks everything for you. The wait staff is crazy attentive and the owner actually came up and spoke with us several times to make sure everything was ok. Among the best wait staff I've ever experienced. I've often told people to suck it up, that Korean restaurants are about the food not the service. At Koreana, you don't have to compromise either.

wow! holy koreans!  This place is packed with Koreans which is a good sign, I guess :)  On the night we were there, we weren't really craving bbq, so I ordered some duk mandoo guk for a cold night.  Pretty decent...I liked how it tasted really cozy and homemade....however, my one gripe about it was that my mandoo were a bit over-cooked and the filling of my mandoo were out and about swimming around my soup.  I like them in-tact in my soup....

My husband ordered the bibimbap and enjoyed the fact that it had a LOT of stuff inside of it, with a generous portion of bulgogi....he's been to other places where the meat is kind of meager, so the caveman side of him enjoyed the mucho meat :)

Overall, the banchan were also yummy.....would be open for a re-visit to try the bbq next time, since it seems like that is the thing to get there!

This is my standard Korean fare and BBQ go to joint in my area. Nothing spectacular and service is typically lacking. They do try their best but there is way more square footage than their meager staff can handle during peak hours. The food is a cut above the other Korean restaurants in the immediate area so I go here by default.

Their lunch specials are the best value for miles around. You get tons of food for either $4.95 or $5.95, the latter price includes chicken. It's barely smaller than their much more expensive super combination plate and contains all the same items. This place gets PACKED during lunch time so try to beat the rush.

We tried Koreana last night for the first time after reading so many positive reviews on here and loved it!! Everything was great....delicious food, outstanding service, large portions, and reasonable prices. They really took the time to explain everything to us and there were at least 5 different staff members checking in on us, asking if we want refills on the complementary side dishes, etc. All BBQ entrees come with these side dishes as well as Korean Miso soup which is so good, has some spice and tofu and veggies in it so way more exciting that traditional miso soup. We will definitely be back! I would recommend reservations as it was very crowded when we went.

Unfortunately, I didn't have a great first time experience. The whole restaurant only had one server which made it really poor customer service. The lights on the wall are dirty need to be clean. The wall and ceiling are also dirty. I work in the restaurant industry seeing the dinning room dirty makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like. The food was good. However, I hope he owner reads this and spends some money freshening up the restaurant.

Just went to this place last night and it was awesome!  I went here long ago as a kid with my mom and was surprised to see it still there.  Might be different owners now though?  Anyways, the food is fresh and delicious, prices are fair for the portion you get (a lot) and it's really authentic.  Tastes like home cooking!  This place gets uber busy too during the week too which just goes to show you that their food it worth it :)

So glad I now know of two places that have original home (Korean) cooking close by :)

I was there with 4 other people today and we were very ANGRY!

Yes, this place has a good food. I admit that, however, Customer service is TERRIBLE!!!!

We ordered the food, and about half hour later, only 1/4 food came out. WTF? And she was giving us excuses on how they get ready for appointment people, and Im like wtf? Seriously? If the food didnt come within few minutes, we would have left. We are not blaming the waitresses, but the chef's basic skills are not developed. Should I return? I think not. Ive had better experience, better taste, and BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE. If you want to wait like an hour and receive horrible services, then go here... Otherwise, you're better off somewhere else.

With my son heading to South Korea for a month we've made a point of trying some of the local Korean restaurants lately.

Koreana is in my old stomping grounds and I had been a number of times in the 80's and 90's.
I had not been since I moved back to IL.

The place is pretty much how I remember it.
The dcor has an Asian flare but isn't completely over the top.
When we went for a late Saturday lunch it was busy, but not crowded.

Prices are a bit higher than a typical Chinese restaurant, but with cause in my opinion.

Our waitress was the owner's wife and she was very helpful in picking dishes that our son would likely see while in South Korea.  
We enjoyed a very good miso soup and a spicy miso soup.
The traditional plates of side dishes came out and they were excellent.
They were flavorful and spicy without destroying your taste buds for the rest of the meal.

We enjoyed a shrimp and rice stir fry, grilled Spanish mackerel and a beef rib, make-it-yourself lettuce wrap dish.

The shrimp and rice was quite good, but not far from a more typical Chinese version, which was expected.
The grilled mackerel was excellent!  Note, mackerel is an oily and more dense fleshed fish.  If you do not like a "fishy" fish.. do not order the mackerel.. 
The beef rib dish was really tender and tasty.  

The owner came by and we shared that our son was heading to South Korea for an extended trip.
He helped him figure out how to eat the rib dish, then hung out with us and provided lots of great insights on the food, culture and activities available in South Korea.
Great Host, Great Food.
We'll be back soon.

I really enjoyed the BBQ here at Koreana (or "House of Taste" as their guest ticket calls them).  That's what they do best, and that's what you should stick to.

The service is prompt--so much so that you really do not need appetizers under any circumstance.  We ordered a couple noodle dishes in addition to Kalbe beef and other BBQ favorites.  I definitely recommend that you save your money by not ordering the noodle dishes.  They are overpriced, taste average, and are completely outshined by the BBQ.

Service was really good.  The servers were very attentive, and there is a button you can push at any time if you need assistance.  The only complaint that I have is that they do not bring water out unless you ask for it.

Definitely make a stop at Koreana for some tasty BBQ next time you're in the neighborhood!

(BTW, I was the only white person there.  Everyone else was Korean or some other Asian.  I barely noticed this aside from entering and leaving, though.) 

Food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Value: 3/5

I'm giving this place four stars even though their Kalbi left much to be desired. Overall this is a very solid place for Korean food outside of the city or Arlington Heights.

Despite being packed on a Sunday night they found us a new table that was away from the door after we complained about a draft. The interior was clean and relaxed. We were eating at like 8:30pm on a Sunday and it was totally full so I'm guessing there may be a wait during prime time.

The seafood pajun was huge and delicious - the two of us shared that and a single order of kalbi and were stuffed. Plenty of side dishes served with the kalbi left us very full and unable to finish it all. The Kalbi itself really could use some seasoning but the pajun, prices and service made it worth-while for me. Will definitely be back

Went to Koreana with my boyfriend and some friends for Saturday night dinner. We got stuck at the table next to the kitchen which is a pet pieve of my boyfriends so we asked to move to a different table. They had plenty open. We were told that they couldn't move us those were all taken for reservations. I found this surprising as the table we were at had a grill and those didn't. I would think people requesting reservations would cook there own food. I honestly don't think they wanted to move us to another table. They had plenty of tables for four people open. Also the table was taped togather on the one side and was greasy. Kind of gross they could do a better job cleaning the tables off here. We were also basically on top of another table which made it very cramped eating here. For dinner we all had the  Bulgogi. The Bulgogi had a great taste but was a little on the greasy side. The Miso soup that came with it was also quite good. The portion sizes were also nice and big here. Over all I really enjoyed the food but was a bit turned off that they gave us such a crappy table when they weren't busy and the grease sides of the table. Would have given them 4 stars easly if they would have seated us at a different table.

It's been a year since I last ate here, and boy was it different in taste. I always think that this restaurant lost its taste because I was a frequent customer, and as time went by, it just got worse. I think now its climbing back to its old status.

Service was just great. I love this family and their commitment to this restaurant. The owner even came out and gave us a farewell. Now that doesn't happen anytime soon, even when there were still customers inside. The panchan (side dishes) were great, and the seng kalbi (unmarinated short ribs) was very fresh and tasty. At the end, the tenjang guk was delicious, better than before. The only reason why I give it 4 stars is because of the fact that it doesnt have the same, awesome taste before. Overall, great prices, great service, great food.

We had dinner at A Toda Madre with a friend on a Friday night and it was an enjoyable meal.

Dcor: The first thing I noticed was the curtain covering the entryway... was I entering a night club or a restaurant. Then, just after stepping through, I realized that it is probably because you enter into the bar area and it is meant to make it feel larger and/or more private? Not sure. Anyway, the bar area is pretty sizeable with a bunch of stools and a lively vibe. As you progress further in you are greeted by the hostess who is the gatekeeper to the dining room. Well, one of the two dining rooms. There is one up front (pretty small as it is dominated by a big center island table) and one in back (that, from the looks of it, seemed much larger and a bit more subdued - probably because it was secluded from the bar).

Staff: The hostess was friendly and our waiter was great. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly as well. As far as the cooks, everything came out hot and tasted fresh but we did hit a snag near the end of our meal... something was going on in the kitchen and it caused a SIGNIFICANT delay. But, it was a small occurrence.

Food/Drinks: We started off with a house cocktail (I forget which one, but it was tasty) and a Limonada (very tasty and sizable) before jumping into some apps: Guacamole (pretty meh, seemed as if it was JUST avocado...) and we added the Salsa Trio (all were tasty and the Habanero one was GREAT!). For our meal we all ordered assorted tacos and shared. We had: Pastor (one of our favorites), Diabla (meh, pretty passable and lacking... not that great), Bien Trucha (pretty enjoyable and tasty), and Pulpito (WOW! Amazing!). Each order came with four tacos and they are about what you'd expect size-wise from "street tacos." As I mentioned before, it took FOREVER for them to bring out the Pulpito so they gave us some little app for free - it was four chips with some kind of crap or something on top... it was VERY tasty as well. So, ultimately, the food here is enjoyable you just have to find your favorites.

Value: The prices are really not terrible and, if you order well, you will leave full (both your stomach and your wallet).

We had an enjoyable first meal at A Toda Madre and are already looking forward to returning again - we want to try all of the tacos at least once!

Ugh. When is an Al Pastor Taco not an Al Pastor Taco? Answer: when its served at A Toda Madre. At least they didn't try to sell it off as a T-bone Steak. Saying: This is the way we serve T-bone Steak with a flair you wouldn't dare challenge.

I had lunch at this upscale almost uncious, presumptuous Mexican Restaurant yesterday. I have had many servings of Al Pastor and this was unlike any I have yet to have. It left me speechless. A guest had the fish taco made with Tilapia. Some years ago, When I found out how Tilapia was raised, I swore off this fish forever. Yet here it was featured. At the urging of my guest, I sampled this taco and it didn't taste like Tilapia. All I could say was that it was some kind of a fish. That's all. 

I will say that my Line Drink was astounding and my guest said the Sangria made here is as good as Yerba Buena.  Maybe the trick is to get hammered on offerings from the full service bar; then you wouldn't notice you weren't served "steak".

Wow. I am very impressed and I have to admit it, I didn't think I would like this place. 

You're going to think I'm prejudice but ... Ok fine I am! I am Mexican born in Tijuana and very proud of Mexico, Mexican food and Mexican drinks (sorry about the Mexican music I like some types but others not so much) and when I found this place smack in the middle of Glenn Ellyn (not a very Latino neighborhood) and not a place known for Mexican food and then it's "gourmet" tacos which is kind of pretentious to begin with and usually just ruins Mexican food and leaves you wanting Mexican fast food! 

I was wrong. 

I got the a toda madre tacos and they were heavenly everything from the pineapple pico de gallo to the salsa cruda, and the tacos themselves were just excellent!

After living in the area for almost a year and trying every Mexican place I could find I finally found my spot for good Mexican food, and the ambience is really hip. Bring a date here or meet friends because the music is on point and the beer list is amazing!

Brought a guest from foodie Mexico City here and she was astonished and said that this was food from home--not "like" home--Home. Came back with more guests that hail from Mexico and they too were so happy with how good the food was here as well. The food at A Toda Madre respects Mexican cuisine, so if you're expecting the kind of Mexican/Tex-Mex you'd find at Chili's or Chipotle, you probably should seek your norovirus at those types of places instead. A Toda Madre is the real deal, and it's really REALLY good. Recommend reservations for large groups and in my experience the food is family friendly for kids that didn't grow up just eating chicken nuggets in ketchup too (at least, my 3 year old nephew and 16 month old niece liked it. They chowed down!). In my opinion, the best eat-in restaurant currently in Glen Ellyn.

Great contemporary Mexican food. The food presentation was foodie artsy. Nice atmosphere.
Waitress with the Persian name was very helpful and welcoming with great service. The Pescado Tacos were crunchy and delicious. I shall return to continue the dinning experience and sample more of the menu selections.

So good...I've always been a big Bien Trucha fan and my wife has wondered if she'd ever get to go there or ATM in Geneva.

We went after a recent Ale Fest in Lisle (Arboretum) on a hot Saturday and I had pumped ATM up so much, offered a guarantee (if you don't like it, feel free to kick me).  No one kicked me, partly because they were full after dinner and I think partly because my recommendation was enjoyed.

Gourmet street tacos is what they're known for, but the elote, guacamole and ceviche are very fresh and it all blends together for a great experience.    The shrimp and avocado tacos and al pastor are the best in my book and the soft shell crab tacos were a hit as well.

Wait times can be long, but we did go on a Saturday around 5:30 without reservations so expected it.   Good cocktails in a festive atmosphere help everything and they have a team service approach so you won't wait for drink refills, plates to be removed and food to be delivered at perfect intervals.

Holy mole (pun intended) wow, what a divine and surprising knock out this place turned out to be.  I thought I was going to a traditional mom and pop place so this was a really nice surprise. Housed in a corner location on Glen Ellyns main shopping strip, A Toda Madre has Stylish cozy, inviting contemporary decor,  communal table, high original tin ceilings, brick walls with hanging wall flower gardens and I'm told a cool outdoor garden.

And then there is the food!!! Was not expecting this outstanding and exciting contemporary Mexican small plates and other dishes with this level of flavor, freshness and authenticity. 

So what rocked...? 

1. Guacamole del Dia, guacamole infused with fresh plum, cilantro, red onion and charred Serrano was unique and delicious. 
2. Fish of the day - The pan seared filet of snapper, I have no idea how it was prepared, just bring me more! 
3. The pastor marinated pork tacos with pineapple Pico de Gallo and salsa Morita and portabello mushroom tacos with chili de arbol-mojo de ano were some of the best tacos I've eaten in recent memory.  I'm told that their sister restaurant in Geneva Il was voted best tacos in Chicagoland which after eating these and their tacos does not surprise me at all.
4. Esquites-grilled corn,Epazote butter,  lemon aioli, Queso Comida Chile Piquin
5 Carlota!!! Mexican Maria cookies with tequila crema and key lime curd. The dense texture and tangy flavor was a big winner. 

Reasonably priced drinks.  The real icing and cherry on the whole night was Azucena, our delightful server who we enjoyed thoroughly.

The place was packed with gaggles of women enjoying a night out with friends and being away the swirling madness of home, kids, husband, chores etc. It never ceases to amaze me How groups of women, when out together can all talk and listen at the same time and process everything they are all simultaneously talking about and listening to. It is truly a phenomenon no man will ever understand (part of a long list of such stuff), but their spirit and joy in being out with each other filled the space with lots of positive energy (and noise!!! :-D)

Great time. Can't wait to go back, and try their sister restaurant which I'm told has a bigger menu as well.

Second summer, second quick meal at the bar. Same bartender - two new tacos - the skirt steak with chorizo and the diabla shrimp. Both were excellent although wildly different. The skirt steak is probably the closest to a traditional Mexican taco here and yet it is more flavorful with the addition of the chorizo and green (avocado? sauce). The diabla shrimp was 6 or maybe 6.5 on a 10 point heat scale - nowhere near as hot as they make it sound. Still very flavorful.

My favorite hands down is still the barriga (pork belly) tacos. 

Service was exemplary - quick, mindful attentive and friendly.

Can't wait for the next opportunity. If I lived in this town I'd bd here way too often!
Nice place, nice atmosphere....  good food.... fair prices.    This is a place you should check out....

Hands down, this was the best Mexican food I've had since I left Arizona. I also want to note that our waiter had impeccable timing. The only down side is the small and narrow space proved to be extremely loud; however, it was a small price to pay for what was an incredible meal.

The chips, bean dip, and salsa we started with were perfect to whet my appetite. Then...we ate until we were stuffed. 

We started with:
--Tostada de Ceviche: This was some of the tastiest ceviche I've ever had and an very unique combo of ingredients - tilapia, avocado, chile oil, cucumber, apple, crispy leeks.
--Pica Pica Brochetas: I'll take just about bacon-wrapped anything, let alone shrimp - and this pineapple/lime/onion combo did not disappoint.

I could have eaten a dozen of their tacos but settled on splitting two orders:
--Chilango Tacos: Grilled skirt steak, chicharron, cilantro-onion, salsa verde cruda
--A Toda Madre Tacos: Pastor marinated pork, chihuahua, pineapple pico de gallo, salsa morita

And, on the side, we also shared a small plate (although, I could have eaten a gallon bucket of this):
--Esquites: An entire bowl of Mexican street corn...um, yes, please.

We also each had two beers from a nicely curated selection of both Mexican and local beers. I wish I could have hollowed out a leg for some dessert.

For this entire meal, plus drinks and tip, we only paid $75. I call that more than a deal. I highly recommend A Toda Madre and hope to go back the next time I'm in the Chicagoland area.

A Toda Madre is a modern Mexican restaurant with a city feel in the burbs! You are able to make reservations or get on the call list where they text you 15 mins before your table opens up. That is what we did and it worked perfectly! We had the Pepino drink which was very refreshing. We ordered the watermelon guacamole, Pollo Tacos, Barriga (pork belly) Tacos, and the Esquites (Mexican steer corn). Everything was delicious my favorite tacos were the Barriga. The service was great and our server and the manager were very attentive. I will be back to try more food!

Very nice place to grab some tasty Mexican food. Trendy place with a nice vibe. We tried esquittes and a  veggies taco - they were well made and super tasty. If you find street parking, stop by to grab some awesome mexican food!

I've always been a sucker for good looks and a sense of humor.  A Toda Madre is the epitome of both!  This fun and trendy restaurant sits on a corner in downtown Glen Ellyn, but you don't have to look too hard, you just have to look for the hoards of people lining up to ask for a table.
The vibe here is lively and fun.  Sleek and stylish but still minimalisitc.  The staff is enthusiastic and friendly and their popularity doesn't seem to be phase them.

This Angeleno and her local friend stopped by here on a rainy Tuesday sans reservations and scored a table for 2 with ease.  It was around 6:30, but by 7:00, the place was BRIMMING!  So if you come at a peak time, call ahead!
Our server was funny and warm and offered up some suggestions since the menu here is full of tempting bites.  We opted for the Manoneada and the Al Pastor Margarita for our drinks.  Both were delicious.  For dinner we ordered the special guacamole of the day which was nectarine.  Yes, nectarine.  Warm chips accompanied the chunky guac and it was all delicious.  We sampled their most popular tacos the "bien trucha" and the "toda madre".  4 tacos per order left us with FULL bellies and leftovers.  My dining companion and I agreed that the pork tacos were way more flavorful than the carne asada ones.    We had no room for dessert but it sounded amazing.

All in all a REALLY pleasant surprise in the Chicago burbs.  A Toda Madre truly earns its name with great ambiance, fantastic food and outstanding service.  Highly Highly recommend!

I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. I can tell why this place is always packed during the evenings. Great atmosphere and the personnel was very nice and inviting. The food was fantastic! You can't go wrong with the quality of food a toda madre has to offer. What sealed the deal for us was our awesome waitress, Shannon. She seemed like a one-lady army with almost too many tables to take care of. But, she was extremely knowledgeable and funny-while being on top of her game. Coming from the food service, I recognize good talent on the floor. Very well done. This place deserves 5 stars and I'll be sure to continue my business with this restaurant. Great date-night place!

$2 for a tiny portion of "just ok" Habanero (wimpy) sauce. Now let's talk about the good stuff.

I loved the Geneva location. Quirky, loud, fun.. I always sat at the bar overlooking the kitchen.

Glen Ellyn is a whole bunch bigger. Still loud, still crowded and the food is still excellent. It's just not as quirky (it's in a storefront, not in an old split level home)

We started with the gratis chips.. they are very good, but don't come with salsa.. but instead a smooth bean dip. Different, tastes good, not sure how we feel about that...

We needed some Guacamole.... ordered it, and it was very good. Not spectacular, but very good.

For the meal we wanted tacos.. so we ordered two plates to share (Yay! I always get more that way!) I ordered the Bien Trucha Tacos... (Steak and Chorizo) 4 of them for 11 bucks and they were terrific.. I would get them again (oh, wait.. I have!) 

Lisa ordered the Pescadillas, so like.. this is the difference between your regular Taqueria and a place like this... also 11 bucks for 4. Swordfish taco's that were on the "squirm in your seat" side of awesomeness. Really delicious!

I just needed to try the drunken beans, I love beans but I found the beer taste (and smell) to be overpowering (kind of reminded me of waking up in college after a big night and the bottles/cups/smell are everywhere) I couldn't eat them and neither could Lisa. But that's just a personal preference thing.

All in all, a somewhat reasonably priced meal (expensive compared to your local taco place, but not for a very good meal) and a nice way to spend an hour or so. 

We'll be back, I just wish they were better at salsa's and not so cheap about them.. next time, I'll sneak my own bottle in (hopefully the restaurant doesn't read these reviews)

LOUD, LOUD, LOUD. Food and service is great but the playlist of tunes will give you a serious headache. Imagine your at a stoplight and the kid next to you is playing his music so loud the bass is reverberating you in your car. Everyone in the place has to talk louder to be heard over the pounding. Good news if you have tinnitus you won't hear the ringing in your ears.

Let's start with the bad- the salsa or what not is strange. Maybe it's because I was expecting salsa and it was beans or something... Still not sure what it was. The worst part of our experience was our server from the start she had an attitude. We sat down for 8 mins before getting acknowledged by the server, she told us she would be with us in a minute and then it was longer. She wasn't busy busy to not be helping us. She kept going back to other tables, checking how things were... Seriously multiple times! I truly felt judged because we weren't older like the other tables and we weren't in the "nicest" clothes as we didn't PLAN on going there. The portions are small and come out at different times. I don't eat red meat and my BF does, we asked if we could sub the type of meat and she said no. So we didn't share, I watched him eat and then he watched me eat. I feel like there should be a way to cater to both situations. And I truly wonder if this place knows that people can truly be allergic to meats... As I am. We got margaritas and they were the smallest ones I have ever seen a restaurant serve, and for $10?! They are good, but expensive!
The good- The atmosphere, decor, is amazing. The food is great, we had steak tacos and pescado tacos. The drinks are great. Everything is great minus the service. But because of the terrible service I won't be going back.
Delicious food! Visiting from Los Angels and I had to stop in to try this place!  service was excellent! The chips and Guacamole are amazing!

Hats off to the customer service. Went there on a weekend during lunch time, usually when the cute downtown is packed and it's hard to find parking, this place was packed. And here we were- a group of 22 people. The staff here went out of their way to help. Much appreciate that as I realize how difficult it is to accommodate large parties on weekend lunch hours. 

Food - amazing tacos. Loved their signature al today madre tacos. Simply superb. We ordered almost every type of taco and each type was better than the previous. Guac was really fresh and delicious too. I will definitely go again to try other items on their menu.

Ambience- stylish/trendy corner spot located at cute glen Ellyn downtown. Good spot to take someone out for a date. 

Overall, loved this place and would recommend to all

This place has small shareable plates, so its perfect for when you can't make up your mind. Saturday night was very busy. Server was knowledgeable. Lots of seafood options. I would strogly suggest trying something you've never had before, rather than playing it safe.

Hip atmosphere. Came here for my 21st birthday with my family. Bill ended up being over $100. Expected because we were in downtown Glen ellyn. 

Our server really lacked service. That's a huge hit for me. He was a guy. Hostess girls did a great job. Place was packed, YOU have to make reservations beforehand, because it's smaller. Bar had no places to sit. This was on a weekday. 

Food, I'd recommend sharing - Pricey smaller portions. 
My family each ordered something and we shared one thing/taco from each.


They start off by serving a yummy bean dip with chips. Wish the bean dip was larger. Slammed it!

The chicken pollo taco were OK. Wouldn't get that one again.
Non alcoholic orange hisbuscus drink was too sweet for my liking. Wish I tried the lime soda one. 
TACOS DONT COME WITH SALSA.... Gave to buy separate. Bummer.


Must try the rice, super delicious. 2 y/o daughter loved it. I loved it. Melts in your mouth. Filled with flavor. 


They did offer key lime cake, small piece with a little candle after my mom asked. I mentioned it was my birthday but server kinda laughed in my face. Don't even think he said happy birthday.. But whatever. Was there for the food, not him 

Wouldn't come with family again, but a place for a drink and tacos w/ friend or 2
*Don't bring younger kids, they don't have booster or highchair. Not the right environment for them!

I have really wanted to come here for some time and I FINALLY made it! We had dinner with family prior to coming here but my boo knew I wanted to come so we ended up just grabbing drinks and guac and chips. 

First of so we walked into a really swanky looking spot. Kinda small but packed. If I didn't know any better I would've thought we were somewhere in the west loop and not the burbs. When we got there we were looking for a spot at the bar but that was packed but I did see a few empty tables so I asked the hostess how long. She said an hour. But then this couple got up and we were able to sit at the bar. 

I loved sitting there because I got to watch our bartender shake it up. He was using his cocktail shakers like morracas! I had the traditional Margarita and it was fantastic! So fresh and yummy! The guac came with a spicy bean dip. So yummy. It's a little pricy so i don't know if it's a good place for an everyday bar but definitely a great date night or special occasion spot.

My wife and I visited for her birthday and we had a great experience. The staff was knowledgeable, the starters and main courses were amazing, and the setting is very nice. Being artsy-types, we loved the mural in the back. We'll be back soon!

This is as good as it gets for gourmet fancy hipster tacos.  There should be more gourmet fancy hipster tacos.  Just saying.  Our tacos were truly outstanding.  They come in a large group of four for sharing.  But I ate all mine on my own.  We also ordered the betabel salad, which was extremely fresh and flavorful.  To finish, we had the special ceviche of the day, which was salmon.  There were cubes of serano jelly on this dish that were out of this world.  The atmosphere makes the best use of this awkwardly shaped space.  The decor involves warm wood, an eclectic group of chairs that don't match, and inventive light fixtures.  I feel a good designer's touch all over this space--especially in the use of a bookshelf as a see-through  divider stocked with kitchen stuff including cook books.  (I was ready to get all worried if a chef ran out of the kitchen to consult one-but this did not happen during my visit.)  We experienced friendly and attentive service, but we also opened up the joint on a Saturday lunch visit.  By the time we left, the place was pretty full.  I'll keep this in mind next time I'm in town to visit one of my most favorite yarn stores that is right around the corner (String Theory--check them out, too!).

Loud loud loud....the music was blasting and the 4 of us could barely have a conversation at the table.  The tacos were good, but the service was not.  Our server couldn't be found for most of our dinner. We have been to ATM twice and I don't think we will give it another try.

Great place with great food! We sat at the bar and had awesome service. The bartenders and staff at this place really hustle! My only complaint is that the food is definitely over priced. You're obviously paying for the location and hip ambiance. It's very small here so I would plan anything with a large party here but it's a great date night spot.

Angel makes the best mojito I have ever had. In fact, he exquisitely executes all the drinks on the menu. He also makes great recommendations on specials, etc.. High quality food in a hip little spot in downtown Glen Ellyn. I recommend sharing some tacos and drinking your way through the menu!! Request to managers: Add churro dessert to the menu! We have been to sister spot in Geneva as well. Both are great, staff at this location is excellent!!

I love the location in Geneva and the Glen Ellyn location was cool too. Pro to Glen Ellyn location, bigger tables. The Glen Ellyn location is loud and the Geneva location is a lot smaller but both have very good food and drinks!

I have been here twice.  Both times the management was my main turnoff- rude to us BOTH times.  Once wondering how long we planned to be there (we order lunch right after arriving and hadn't yet gotten the food?).  The food is okay - its tacos! The staff is very nice and the space is decorated nice.  We don't frequent this place - Fire and Wine has a better menu and nicer management!

Such a great spot! I have been to Bien Trucha, their sister restaurant, and both are equally delicious. What I loved about a toda madre was the laid back vibe and welcoming staff. We tried the pescado and a toda madre (al pastor) tacos. I don't normally get fish tacos but these were phenomenal! Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!

They will be out of business if they keep their customer service up.  Nothing can ruin a good meal more than lousy service, that is if you have a chance to even sit down. 

My daughter and I went there on Fri at 7:15pm. When we walked past the side window there were literally 5 open tables. When we got to the front there were quite a few people waiting. We were told that the first table open would be between 9-9:30pm. I mentioned the open tables and was told those were reserved....reserved?  Wth?!?  We had to be at Midway Airport by 9:30ish so that wasn't going to work.  Sorry, no taco is that good to wait 2-2 1/2 hours when you're hungry and have limited time.  Even if we had time to wait I wouldn't have waited. 

Since my daughter is gluten intolerant, our options were slim. We drove all the way to Wheaton to Gia Mia. MUCH better system for seating customers. We were running behind so I was actually going to order something to go. She sat us instead and told us she was waiting for 5 minutes for the other people and she wasn't worried because she knew another seat would open up. Service was great at Gia Mia and the food was awesome.  Great gluten free pizza too.

Love this restaurant, great drinks, amazing food and a fun upbeat atmosphere. 
Everything I have had tastes quite good as it is type of restaurant that adds a special twist of flavor to each dish.  Grab some friends and go have a good time... but do make a reservation or risk waiting.

Ahhhhhhh I love Yelp for letting me find this spot!

I had family from out of town visiting and since I work in Glen Ellyn we yelped in the area and decided to give A Toda Madre a try.  Ohh boy they did not disappoint! 

They were pretty busy for a Thursday night, but now I realize why. They're good and they're not open Sunday and Monday. Bummer less availability. 

The restaurant was really loud and small, has a bar feel to it. I'm not picky so it didn't bother me. The portions are for sharing (kind of like tapas) which I LOVE!! I'm one of those that prefer variety than a large entree to myself. We ordered corn for the sides, the House Tacos, Fish Tacos, Salmon Ceviche, and a couple more dishes I can't recall. I just remembered the Fish tacos I would say blew me away. They were sooooooo moist and flakey, not over battered and oily like most fish tacos I've had at other places. The corn was a hit, and house tacos were very flavorful. We killed everything that came out! Craving for some tacos now...lol uhhh

Food was really good. The tacos were pretty small here though. Don't expect to spend $12 on tacos and be set. Pretty packed too during lunch so make sure you arrive early if you want a table. I was in a rush so I sat at the bar. Very nice looking place inside.

Delicious! And a great unique suburb spot.  All the food was amazing!  The 4 stars is because it is sooo very noisy.  We had a hard time hearing each other talk.

We tried both gaucs, the seasonal and regular, and loved them both.  We got the beet tostadas (probably butchered that) which were so fresh and good.  Also ordered both pork tacos and the steak tacos.  All 4 of us were happy.  It was enough food for us, but it may be on the smaller side for big eaters.

Ugh! What's the point of this restaurant anyway? You can't get in ever! Since it opened we've tried several times to no avail! Why would I want to wait 2 hrs for dinner? Or go to eat at 5pm and then be rushed?! Count me out!

Been waiting to come here for two years not since they opened and finally was able to tonight.

The restaurant is closed mondays, which i totally respect everyone has to be closed and have some time off but it is definitely a tinier joint so the days they are open they are usually hopping! Which Is great, but sometimes I just want to be able to walk in on a busy day and be sat. But hey we can dream right?! 

The service was outstanding, the waitress was very attentive and gave great recommendations for myself and my family. She knew the menu well enough to be able to list favorites, and answer questions without looking at it which I acknowledge and look for when I dine out in restaurants. I like when the staff are educated on the menu and the ingredients. She made good recommendations and was able to tell me what to expect.

The other staff were constantly filling my water and cleaning the table so no extra empty plates were there taking up space, and I always had a full glass of water- which I love. I hate staring at empty dirty dishes. 

The food was good, not outstanding but very flavorful. Loved the Steak Tacos and the Corn side dish. The Shrimp tacos were just okay, honestly nothing special like the Steak Tacos. But the corn was my favorite part of the meal, light enough but different than any I have had before all around a great combination. 

Not realizing the restaurant was a Tapas minded feel, we ordered a few things and ended up ordering more because there wasnt much to the dishes, meaning not a whole lot of food to go around. But That's the style and Idea so I get it, more to share and more to try. Personally not my favorite type of food but hey, to each his own.

The Mojito was tasty one of the best I have had, as for the margaritas again tasty but nothing out of this world. 

The Pricepoint is a tad high I felt for what we got but in the end was satisfied!

I went here for my birthday and was very happy with our experience.  

We showed up at 12:30. They open at noon and the place was already packed. We were told we had to wait 30 minutes for a table so we had drinks at the bar. I had a "frescada" it tasted so fresh with chunks of strawberries yummmm!!! My mom ordered a sangria, which was great as well.

We ended up waiting less than 30mins . when we got to our table it was so tight. I couldn't pick up a chip without bumping my brother next to me. That is my only complaint, very tight on space. 

We ordered a variety of tacos, guac of the day (with pear), flan and a lime infused dessert. 

Our server was great, bartender was helpful andthe bus boys were super friendly, will be back soon.

I recently went to a "trendy" taco place in Chicago and honestly I think A Toda Madre has ruined me. The food and cocktails are so much better at this little place in the burbs.  We normally sit at the bar so service is a little more consistent than what you get at a table sometimes. The only negative I have is that it's pricey but if you take it easy on the drinks it's pretty reasonable. Some things to try that you wouldn't think of:

Papas con huevos. Potatoes in a spicy aoli sauce topped with an sunny side up egg

Red pepper soup. I like soup but I rarely order it out, except here. 

Chili Quiles perhaps the best I've ever had.

If you like authentic, family style Mexican food with a modern twist and a cool bar atmosphere, visit A Toda Madre. Literally the place is a toda madre and just makes for a great evening with good food, great service, and the guacamole is spectacular.

My only complaint is that it's a little pricy for Mexican food, but I'd say it's worth it everytime.

everything it's so good,  but the best part of my experience it was the excellent service from the bartender asucena.
thank you i will back soon

Worth the 40 min drive! I originally planned on going to  Bien Trucha in Geneva but the 1 hour drive stopped me. So glad I found out that ATM moved to Glen Ellyn! 

We came in during lunchtime. Didn't want to wait for dinner and I'm not a fan of the crowds. Good thing too, since we were probably the 5th customer to come in and were seated right away.

We started off with a free botana (appetizer) of bean dip and chips. Nothing too fancy but it was free so I loved it lol! We also ordered the guacamole del dia. Both my husband and I loved it, the watermelon provided a sweet and refreshing touch to regular guac.  Could have used more chips though. 

We also ordered a variety of tacos (pescado, chilango, and barriga) and esquites. Oh my goodness. All of them were delicious! My favorite is the pescado or crispy battered tilapa with red cabbage on top. It was sweet and sour and spicy and crunchy and soft all at the same time! Couldn't get enough of it!  Loved the esquites or mexican corn salad too! Just a tad expensive for a small bowl. Nevertheless, I would have ordered 5 of those and eat them in one sitting.

As for drinks, we ordered mango juice and it was good. Reminded me of home and that's a huge compliment. :)

Overall genuine service, lovely people, and EXCELLENT food!!!
