What I will say is that it's a great place to hang out on the outdoor patio when the weather is nice.  During the day you can sit and eat lunch, maybe have some drinks, and watch all the motorcycles and sports cars wiz down Main Street.  For me this is a novelty!

At night it's a great place to catch up with friends and have a couple too many drinks.

Besides that, it's good bar food.  The burgers and fries are always good.

The food was not terrible. It was ok. But the service was actually crappy. They bring your food and don't say do you need anything else? So you end up waiting 20 minutes to ask your waitress for some napkins and whatever else you need. The nachos are ridiculous. Piled high with no plate and bizarrely the guacamole tastes like bananas. I'm not kidding. Tomatoes are lack luster. Quesadillas are good but they didn't get us any sour cream. Potato salad pretty good too. Sticky table though and my shirt is going to feel like waffles all day. In short, if you want mediocre food, cool decor, and bad service, the filling station is for you.

We have had some good food here before but won't be back.  It's a great day here in Chicago and this local restaurant had limited servers , sat us, then ignored our table for over 20 minutes. No offer of drinks , not even " we will be right with you ".  We ended up across the street and were welcomed warmly. 

Summers here filling station.  Customers matter !!

We made the mistake of visiting the Filling Station Pub & Grill on Memorial Day 2016 and won't be returning. The wait time for food was unacceptably long, our waitress was rude, and the entrees tasted like warmed-over bar food. I ordered a sandwich known as the Moo & Oink, which is a combination of meat and cheese that tasted like a microwaved Hot Pocket. Our waitress certainly did not help. "The kitchen is backed up," she said at one point, "I'm just telling you so that you don't ask me where your food is," as if asking about the status of our dinner was an inconvenience to her. As one point, I asked to speak with a manager about the poor quality of the food and the long wait time, and I was told the manager was too busy to talk -- which says everything you need to know about this establishment.

We got sucked into this place because we noticed that their patio was usually pretty full. Good indication of a great restaurant, right? NOPE!  It was just plain 'ol bar food and not very good either. Music was way too loud to carry on any kind of conversation. Scantily clad waitresses with their butt cheeks hanging out torn short shorts. Turkey burger tasted like cardboard on white bread. Over done fries. Coleslaw out of a can. Plastic tasteless shrimp. 
We'll never return.

Wow this was overall bad. A bunch of 18 year olds. We were seated across from the drink station and bathroom. The place was not crowed. She set my drink  on the opposite side of the table . My boyfriends beer was flat. Waited awhile for chips and salsa. Homemade salsa tasted like tomato sauce. They get you in for the outdoor sitting everything else bad. Ps both bathrooms were gross.

Went here before a concert at the Arcada, cheap and good food and it was easy to park in their parking lot and walk over to the concert.

Big outdoor patio that would be fun when it's warm enough.

I like the story behind this place, that it used to be an old time gas station. Love all the antiques on the walls.

I had the Philly Cheese Steak, wasn't like they make it in Philly but it was still tasty.

First time we have tried The Filling Station and will probably be our last. Went there this past Saturday and sat outside on the patio.  

Server was decent, I think she may have been new.  All of the servers outside looked to be between the ages of 18 and 21.  There was a younger guy out there that swatted flies the ENTIRE time we were out there.  I think it was very disgusting to do that while people are eating and while food is being served.  Most people who sit outside are aware that there will be flies around, no need to swat at them.  Also witnessed a server place ice into a cup with her HAND!!!  Very unsanitary. 

We ordered the sampler platter.  What a disappointment that was.  There were 3 of us in our party and we received 2 chicken wings, chicken tenders, cheese sticks,what they call Armadillo eggs (jalapeno poppers),  and a boat load of french fries.  They should really look at this item and make some adjustments.  2 of each item does no good when there more than 2 people in a party.  

We did not order anything else off of the menu.  And don't know if we will be back to try anything.

Zero stars in my opinion! I have never had such a rude immature service in my entire life. Growing up in Bartlett I've been to this place many many times before, it has been a couple years decided to go back for a nice relaxing dinner on their patio since it was very nice outside. As soon as I sat down the people that I was meeting with right off the bat said our server had a bad attitude. I get that everyone has a bad day but you don't tell your customers about it. I was a server for a few years not an easy job by any means, but if you can't handle it go work somewhere else. Being in our 20s definitely didn't help the situation every other table was about 40 or over and did not get the same rude attitude from the girl server. 30 minutes after my brother and his friend asked for lemons they asked again nicely didn't even say anything about her forgetting. She then begins to tell us how she was stressed and had a full patio, basically stating that she did not have time to go get A couple lemons. So honestly, I asked if she wanted me to get them from the bar..After a couple more minutes she came over and threw three lemons on a soggy napkin on her table and walked away didn't even respond when my brother said thank you. Few minutes after that I received my drink which got slammed in front of me on the table also with no : here you go can I get you anything else would you like to order food, nothing no response stormed away. Little shocked that I was being treated like this after doing nothing walked inside to get a drink from the bar instead hoping that he would've been in a little bit better of a mood, I was the only person standing at the bar while he was unpacking beer I didn't tap my fingers didn't make a sound, just waited patiently for him to be done, when I asked him for a Corona and a Coke all he did was fold his arms and shake his head. So I asked if he was serious? He said I was rude to his server and he could deny service to whom ever he wanted. When we tried to ask the server what the issue was she rolled her eyes and walked away multiple times. I don't really understand who lets a couple snotty twentysomething year-old run their bar but I don't think it's very good for business.looking on yelp and Facebook I saw very many one star reviews this place is been around for a long time and I know a lot of people that like the area they should get their act together or they will eventually go under. I'm 27 years old but I guess Look Young, I have never not tipped a person in my entire life as I am a hairstylist and work for tips myself it's embarrassing to treat someone like that that is not customer service. I understand we're not a fancy place downtown but it's usually great place for friends to meet up I will never go there again in my life! I will be sure to tell every single client that will sits in my chair about my unpleasant experience it doesn't matter what kind of day you're having I have never treated a client/customer in this manner and I have actually been screamed and yelled and swore at. UNCALLED for, and shocking!

The setup of the bar, restaurant, and patio is great. The service and food, not so much. All of the servers were playing on cell phones while guests await service. Ordered the Cheesy Stripper, sandwich was decent but nothing special. Interested to check out this place again strictly for drinks.

Awful service! Awful wait time for food (which is mediocre at best). Tried this place 2x within the last month thinking the first bad experience was a fluke. It wasn't. SO many more enjoyable places in St. Charles to dine and have drinks at! Done with this place!

Great place to get a good beer, hang out with friends. Patio is amazing, great location. My favorites on the menu is the the woody, whisky bacon burger and the south west salad. The spicy avocado ranch is out of this world.
Gets pretty busy on the weekends.  Prices are fair, but drinks are made weak.  So many other choices in downtown St Charles to check out.

A bit over-rated and has become essentially a drunk "hang-out" over the years.

I used to go to the Filling Station quite a bit some years back, either with buddies or on a few dates. This place is a staple for the downtown St. Charles river-walk area, or at least people say so.   Of course, in your early to mid 20s - things and places aren't always as they seem or are hyped up to be.

By day into early evening, this is nothing more than your average restaurant.  When the place is empty, the dining room actually looks nice. I remember the food being "okay", but nothing spectacular where I would warrant going there to get take-out on my way home from someplace.

By mid evening into the early AM hours - this essentially becomes a glorified pub and "hang-out" for mostly 20's to 30's, though all ages are present.  The dining area almost becomes swallowed up with bodies to the point where it hampers and intrudes on the few stragglers left sitting at tables, trying to finish a meal.

Many times, me and my buddies specifically remember coming here and it was obvious that not only was the place severely understaffed for the crowd at hand - it was also probably over-capacity.  Now, this is not to be confused with it simply 'being crowded'. When there are no tables, hundreds of people standing shoulder to shoulder and wall to wall to the point where you can't even meander around (think almost Times Square on New Years Eve, only on a much smaller level), and the noise level so loud that you have to scream in the ears of waitresses to place an order or your buddies to communicate - to me that is over capacity and simply not safe.  This is in hindsight, as when you are 22, you tend not to analyze logistics, or care too much :)

Best examples for this can be found on prime drinking nights - St. Patrick's Day (Night), Thanksgiving Eve (probably the worst in terms of crowds and poor service), New Years Eve, and even Black Friday night - also nights that correspond with many colleges being out of session beginning their holiday break.  Many times people will even crowd outside to the outdoor patio to smoke and drink - even though it may be 20 degrees out!  In my opinion, the outdoor seating area shouldn't even be open past a certain date, or when there are extreme cold temperatures - as it just adds to drunken loitering which can just further compound potential problems.  I realize the need for some people to have a smoke, though, so that is why this remains open.

Some of these times were also pre-2009 when smoking was still legal inside and many of these people had lit cigarettes.  We would sometimes discuss afterwards that if somebody jokingly yelled "FIRE", probably 50 people would die just by being crushed or trampled.  IT WAS THAT WALL TO WALL PACKED.

Many of the bouncers and employees are also rude, or simply - A-holes.  I remember one time during an uncrowded session some bouncer or employee standing against a wall behind my party w/ some friends or co-workers - he giggled and made some comment to the effect of, "look that dude has a Jimi Hendrix tattoo all over his arm."  The comment wasn't in a complimentary tone, as if I had Minnie Mouse or Rainbow Bright on my arm, and I just kinda looked back and gave the guy a dirty look and thought to myself - yah man - I don't dress like Jersey Shore and listen to Lil' Wayne and emo like you probably do.  

As mentioned above, place can become loud and rowdy.  I took a few dates here where after awhile, me and the girl had to leave because we could barely converse without basically screaming at each other - we finished our conversation during a brisk walk by the Fox River.  I would not recommend this place for families, or stuff like dates or just casual dining UNLESS you come early enough - say before 8pm.

I also remember bathrooms being small, smelly, and dirty with grimy floors.

Lastly, this place is notorious for people loitering in the parking lot at very late hours, probably wasted. I saw this firsthand the times I was leaving here some years back, and now many times I see this SAME STUFF passing by while driving home from unrelated agenda.

I haven't been here in about 2 years, and have no urgency to go back anytime soon.  I think the place is overrated and can be grounds for trouble on several different fronts, and I'm a bit past the stage of having poor service or standing uncomfortably in a bar if I want to get a pre-Holiday beer with some friends - there are plenty of other places I can do that at.
Still a great place to rest, After the Scarecrow Fest.

I don't even know where to start with the horrible experience I had here last night. We arrived NYE a little after 7, we sit down, it's a good 15 minutes before being greeted (the place was dead maybe 10 people in the bar) so finally we get drink menus, the waitress was unfamiliar with the mixology of several of their house speciality drinks. After a good 20 minutes we finally got the drinks we ordered, she couldn't remember who ordered what but we got them. She came back a short time later to take our order. Now the menu is pretty simple sandwiches, burgers, appetizers, so all we were ordering was based on the menu, for example I wanted a turkey burger plan on a pretzel bun with fries. I got a turkey burger with everything plus grilled onions. All 6 people at the table got WRONG ORDERS. It took another 10-15 minutes for us to get the corrected orders however mine was still incorrect but at that point I'm starving so I just ate it, more waiting and then a manager came, after listening to the problems we were experiencing his exact words "I'll look into this and get back to you", another 15 minutes goes by.... He comes back and says it's not the kitchen (way to throw your server under a bus) and that he will comp some of the food and buy us a round. All in all he only took off like $40. He was unprofessional and seemed annoyed that he even had to deal with us. I wish anyone that visits this establishment the best of luck.
Food still has not come can't tell you if it's any good were one minute from leaving. Terrible service   Just ask again about our food. Told them we want to leave. Going to check

First time ever here and last. The onion roll dripping with grease. The chicken I ordered came out raw.
I was sick the whole night. Service was horrible, had kids working that don't know what they're doing.

Do your self a favor and walk across the street and go to pub 222.  It was a nice day so I thought let's sit on the patio and have lunch. I was technically working so I had a Coke.  It came in a can.  My first thought was their fountain machine was not working. Then I asked the waitress and she said no.  The manager said to only serve cans on the patio. I asked later and found out it was $1.75 a can.    This is an obvious rip off.  The owner just wants people to drink alcohol  on the patio and to make up money from those that don't.  This is the first reason never to go back.  Second  - the food was served in a HUGE wicker basket.  It made the burger look small and the food appear to be small even though it wasn't.  Hard to even reach your food in the basket.   Another terrible manager decision.  This place is just not worth it.   One bright side was a nice waitress but she was just ok.  There are so many other places to eat in that sea so please stay away from this one

This was the worst experience I've had in a long time. Me and my date sat down and waited 10 minutes to be greeted. We watched the waitresses stand and talk to the cook in near the back door. The waitresses clearly seen me and my date sitting waiting. Before I left I asked why hasn't anyone greeted us. The three waitresses that were talking blamed the waitress working outside for not greeting us but we we're sitting inside. There is no way I'll ever go back there. I'll also tell my friends about how we were ignored. Very poor service at this place.

Have gone here many times to sit outside. The food is what it is. Great fries, average burgers, I had a good blue cheese chicken sandwich. The service tonight was poor. Not very busy but not much attention from the server. Wrong meal for my daughter. Might be time to try another outdoor place.

I'm in town visiting family. Decided to stop here for lunch, as my Mom had good things to stay about the food.

I ordered the streak sandwich, medium rare. I was served a well done steak, gross! I had the waitress take it back and ordered a Philly cheese streak instead. I waited over 20 minutes for my Philly cheese steak to come out, all the while every other table around me was served and the rest of my party had finished eating while I waited for my food. Normally at restaurants when food is sent back something else is made on the fly. Apparently not here.

When I ordered my Philly cheese steak I was asked how I wanted it cooked, I said medium rate. Again I was served well done. We asked to speak to manager, she was horrible. Told me there is no way to order philly cheese steak differently due to the thin meat. I said fine, but your servers shouldn't ask me because when I order medium rare I expect medium rare. Manager comped my meal, but nothing else despite me telling her my experience and food was bad.

Overall experience was bad, only reason why I give two stars instead of one is because the drinks were strong.

I took my dad on fathers day. He picked it as the place to go.  He ordered a quesadilla and was told that was a dinner item and could only be made after 5.  WHAT? So he got the hot cheesy stripper instead.  I loved the names of the items.  There were 4 of us and we all loved our food and drinks.  Our servers were great.  It was a beautiful day to sit outside.  I will be back.  So yes GO THERE!!!
I usually like it. We were there for drinks, it smelled like sewerage. We had to leave. Felt bad for the patrons eating there.
Garbage

Stopped in Saturday night with a group of friends. First time for all of us. Decor is a modern hip take on the gas station complete with a three piece band of stick bass, mandolin and guitar at just the right volume. Food was pretty good if not spectacular. The shrimp po' boy was big and satisfying, burgers were juicy and cooked perfectly. Oh and the fries! The highlight was the end of the meal when we were offered a Complimentary Brazilian dessert which was absolutely delicious. Friendly bar and wait staff made our night.

We have gone to The Filling Station  for years.  There fish fry's were amazing.   However tonight we were totally disappointed.  Paper thin fish.   No refills on beverages.  I even voiced complaint about the fish and all I got was a server that shrugged her shoulders and basically said oh well.

The Filling Station is definitely not my favorite location in STC, however, we stopped in recently on the night of my cousin's 21st birthday. I've eaten here two different times, and the food has been very much mediocre. The place used to be crazy busy every time I was out on a weekend evening, but on this occasion the place was nearly empty. We had great service from our waitress- she was very friendly and attentive and speedy with our drink refills. This is not a place that I will return (only because there are other places I enjoy more) but would happily go back if I was invited.

First impressions are hard to break for me.  I hold a grudge.  Gave this place a second chance and was delightfully surprised.

On my initial visit we sat inside.  Kinda dark.  Moldy smelling.  Old wooden chairs that may have been purchased at a near by antique shop on North Avenue.  Ordered fish & chips.  Got dry fish and chips that could have used more seasoning.  Saving grace...plenty of drink specials.

Second time around, a group of us were looking for airconditioning and cold refreshments after 9 holes of golf at Pottowatamie.  Sat inside again, but this time next to the bar in front.  More light, less moldy smell.  There was only one girl working our area so the wait was a bit longer than usual, but we kept ourselves busy with the flat screens & talk of hot dog eating contests.

Ice cold Coke...automatic 2 stars!  Fast refill service for thirsty golfers on a 80+ degree summer afternoon...make that 4 stars!

Their sandwiches are huge!  The BLT is stuffed with what seemed to be 3 layers of crunchy bacon, some lettuce, a slice of tomato, and a generous smear of mayo.  Overflowing bacon falling off my sandwich made me a happy camper=)  Best side of coleslaw that I've had in a long while, a little on the sweet side.

Would have sat in their outside beer garden in the front if we hadn't been baking for 3 hours earlier on the golf course.  All patio tables seemed to be under the protection of huge umbrellas, so it wouldn't have been that bad.  Free wi-fi too!

Never returning. My wife and I say outside and no waitress approached us for a good 20-30 min. We had at least 4 different ones look directly at us as they served tables around us. So after one finally decided we could possibly be paying customers she came and took our order. We sat and had 2 outrageously priced drinks, had to listen to 38 year old for frat "bros" yell the entire time and when the food finally showed up I wished it hadn't. Never going back.
Really great bar food that won't break the bank. Awesome burgers and sandwiches as well as good drink specials. Fun place to swing by for a few drinks late night as well. Great patio!

I've been here on 2 or 3 occasions, and I don't remember anything special about the food or drink here. What I do remember is that the servers at this place are very attractive. 4 stars for that, 2 stars for food drink. Hence the 3 star. The place has a nice patio, but I'd rather pay a bit more for the Office or another establishment in St Chaz

Not very good. Not very good at all.
We were in St. Charles this past Sunday. Not the best day to be here as alot of businesses were closed. After we had done all the exploring we could, The Filling Station was one of just a few places open for lunch. We chose it because, A) we were hungry, and B) if you like that show American Pickers, it's kinda neat. They have all this old service station memorabilia, hence the name of the place. (In case you hadn't already put that together, I thoughtfully threw that in. I'm digging for a few "useful" votes - ha ha ha.)
It was pretty dead. There was a guy at the bar, and one other couple. We sat at a high-top table overlooking the beer garden, which I imagine is nice during the summer months. Our very cute and polite server took our drink order, and then we got down to the business of deciding what to order. The menu here is not very exciting - but I do enjoy a good sandwich, and they had about 11 to offer. But they too, didn't sound all that thrilling. I decided on The Big Cheese on sourdough (3 cheese, grilled, with tomato), and my husband chose The Woody (same as above, but with bacon and onion). We opted for fries as our sides. Our server brought us our beers, took our order, and departed. We had both ordered Hacker-Pschorr. I looked at my beer. My husband looked at his. We both took a sip. We both made a face. We both set them down. I don't know what the heck that was, but if you look at the picture I posted, you'll agree - no way that's a Hacker-Pschorr. I'm no beer expert (shout-out to Nichole K. : please forgive my amateur description of this), but it was the color of whiskey. It had positively no head to it. It tasted gross. We mentioned this to our server and she went to the bar to ask the bartender what it was. Her reply? "That's Hacker-Pschorr Amber." Is there even such a thing? (Nichole? Nichole?) And if so, that's not what we ordered. She took it back and we settled for Goose Island 312. YAWN.
The sandwiches were small, the fries limp, and the beer disappointing. Service was good, with the exception of the bartender. It was a bummer. Too bad too, because we don't get out to St. Charles much.

I went here for drinks on a random Saturday night and I was surprised by how dead it was.  I am told that it gets slam packed in the summer, but this early spring night was a ghost town.  They were advertising a free bulls jersey, but nobody seemed to have any idea how you could win it.  The drinks were average and affordable, I guess I am used to Chicago prices.  The one downside was that there were little flies all over the place.  I call them "poo flies", but who knows what they were.  We kept having to swat them away.  I guess I would come back when the patio is open, but I won't be going out of my way to come back.
It's 9 Dollar BEER NIGHT! Cool place to be in the summer for sure!

I've driven by this place for a few years and finally stopped in. It looked like a cool place from the outside and when you go in, it lives up to that perception. Every waitress is super cute and the patio is awesome. And then there's the food. I had the Cajun tuna and it was quite the letdown. It was like a tender steak which is fine for steak, but not fish. It was obviously a processed "fish" filet. The wild rice and Texas toast were both good. The fish letting it all down.
Bad service and did not thank us for leaving a generous tip! Also had to get my own napkins! Food was awful!

We came here because Neo Pizzeria website had false information. It closed at 11PM instead of 1AM. We wanted to find a place other than McDonalds to eat and have a good time. Boy were we disappointed lol. Granted we came for food and not the drinks or atmosphere which is unusual I guess. I am a late night prowler, and unfortunately was stuck in St. Charles.

The Good:

Waitress was very pleasant but was forgetful of a lot of things.

Atmosphere was unique to say the least and the crowd was really lively.

The Badzzz:

Food. I've never felt so unhappy and mislead by the menu at this place. 

"Supreme" Nachos stated it was "oven baked" chips. To everyone's dismay, the $11 Nachos turned out to be Tostitos with lukewarm semi solid cheese mixed with beef. Tostitos.... Literally for $11. We laughed and estimated the amount to be of the $2 bag variety. 

Combo Platter literally looked like it was put together from different packs of things from the store and MICROWAVED. It didn't taste or feel made, I literally cringe that I was served a Microwaved combo platter. Which tasted worse than the microwavable stuff at the store. $14

The only edible items are their wraps and the fries.

Eating all this made me regret life the next day when I couldn't eat until around 4PM due to the food from last night. It wasn't until I went to the toilet I felt better and alive again.

I would have given this place One star if the waitress hadn't been so nice and attentive.

Based on other reviews we didn't bother with the food here. This is a review for the bar only. I liked the space. It is really spread out and I thought it was cute. I could tell the patio would be really fun in the Summer. We had great service and the prices seemed reasonable. The beer list was just OK though.
Service was really slow.  Ordered our burgers medium,  got them well done.  Didn't bother complaining due to other reviews. Fries were half crispy, half soggy. I won't be going back.

Now this is a place I can really relate too. I'm one of the fresher people from college and definitely miss that scene. But this place is kind of like college all over again. Small spaces, lots of people, out door patio, long lines at the bar., cheap drinks. Not too shabby I must say.

The place is actually pretty big because it is also a restaurant. However if you come for the night life, you tend to stay more towards the bar side of the place. The includes 2 small rooms and the outdoor patio area. Outdoor area is nice as it has a lot of tables. But out of the few times I've been here, it's always packed. Walking inside is annoying and I feel like a tiger stalking its prey when I wait for a table.

Getting a drink usually takes forever unless you have your own waitress. There are even 4 bartenders behind a small bar but still slow. So annoying. Like I'm sure they can afford to open another bar just so that there's less traffic. Guess the cheap drinks make up for that though. Different specials on different nights so you could just plan accordingly.

DTSC (downtown St. Charles) after the bars close is cop central though. Cops on foot and in cars just waiting for some dumb guy to do something stupid so that they can get them. Be weary of this and have a DD.

I met up here with a friend on Saturday afternoon for some beers, the place was pretty empty when I arrived, but slowly filled up.  Our server was great, we never had empty beers and the food was brought out quickly and still hot.  I ordered a burger and asked for it medium rare, it came out somewhere between well and well done, there was no pink anywhere.  The burger was still pretty good, but was definitely overcooked.  They also have fantastic fresh cut fries that are actually crispy.  Most fresh cut fries are soggy and limp and not very good, but these were excellent.  They have a fairly limited beer menu, especially the draft beers, if you are a beer snob, look elsewhere.  Overall a decent experience, I would go back, but there are a lot of good places in downtown St. Charles.
Had lunch there twice and the food was greasy. They have a great location but I felt they just pushed food at me. The waitresses spent their time on their phones rather than attending to customers.

Came here with a group of about 15 people last Thursday night around like 9pm. The place was dead. We sat outside which was nice, moved two tables together, with no help from any servers.  Most of us ordered a beer on tap so no complaints there. A few people ordered a coffee with baileys in it and they said that was good. Our waitress was terrible. She would walk by our table and not ask if we needed anything, we had to wave her down and she had our table plus like 2 small tables and no one else was even at the bar inside or outside. She forgot my friends coke after like 3 times having to come back because she would walk away before even taking everyones orders. At one point when I had to once again wave her down because a few of us wanted to order an appetizer, she said ok, what do you want, you can write it down. I said excuse me, did you just ask for me to write down what I wanted? ( because I thought maybe I misheard her) She then said, what do you want? She was quiet and gave off the vibe that she wanted to be anywhere but there. So we get the food and I ordered chips and salsa, I played it safe there. Chips were warm and good. Salsa tasted like it came out of an off brand no taste to it jug o salsa. No thanks. Drinks on tap were cheap, $3.50 for a blue moon. I do like the big outside seating area but the service was not good and I'm not so sure I would attempt to order actual food besides chips upon a next visit.

We got there at 440pm, a handfull of people at the bar. NO ONE in the dining room. We gave our order 10 min later, after 30 minutes we ask our server where our food it, she said "it takes longer to cook a well done burger then medium well. I said I asked for medium and my husband asked for medium well. She said yes that takes longer to cook them. My husband spoke up and said he could see the cooks eating french fries and fooling around in the kitchen. We asked for the manager and she came back and said he had an emergency with the plumbing and the COOK was helping him and they were short staffed! Finally 10 min later we get our food and his isn't even cooked to medium, he didn't finish it. He said the french fries were greasy.  We spent $35.00 for nothing and the manager never came to see us! When we were leaving, he was taking off in his pick up truck! I would have gave this ZERO stars but I had to rate it something.

I went here for lunch one day. I was highly disappointed. I've had much better food at dive bars.

It wasn't really busy (i've been a server) and the waitress was terrible. She never checked up on us. To get our check it took FOREVER.

Our food too. I mean really. It's fairly standard bar food. It's not that hard to make.

It was a waste of money ugh.

By far the worst service I've had.
Food was tasteless and no one seems to know what there job is there.
Paying attention to your customers is not what is taught here. 
I will not return.
Great patio, pretty good service but the food is lackluster in portion and taste. Go here to have a beer, not for a meal.

Fine for a quick bite. 

Not for those looking for a fine dining experience. 

But if you are in St Charles and want a bite to eat, and are not terribly fussy, then you will be fine. TVs on the walls so you can pretend to listen to your date while watching the game.

Basically just a fast food type place. Don't expect much more.

I have conflicting views of this place since more than half of my girlfriends worked here at some point or another and don't have lovely things to say about it. That being said, I love a good burger and this place knows how to make one. The big fill is an excellent burger and the grilled onions that come on top plus the buttery toasted bun puts it in my top 5 burgers of all time. Plus, the beer garden is fun and they allow us to bring our puppy which to me is the best customer service a dog loving girl can ask for.

My husband and I used to go to The Filling Station quite a bit, back in the day. Ahhh, the 90's....not a care in the world but  to decide where to hang out on the weekends. 

So my husband got the salad that was either a close match or the same one he used to get, but said they really skimped on the ingredients. I had fajitas....I know, it's not the right place for fajitas, but it sounded better than a sandwich. The only issue I had was the chicken was very much over-cooked...seasoning was fine. I guess the tortillas were a little miserable too, but I would excuse that if the meat had been cooked correctly. 

The kids menu was priced right...everything around $3.50 as it should be. (Don't you hate when you go someplace and the kids menu is like $7-8 an item? Ugh. My kids are 3 and 5...they never eat $8 worth of food anywhere!) Unfortunately, even though I specifically asked for the quesadilla not to be "grilled" as stated on the menu, just to have the cheese melted in the microwave....it came out grilled. I saw the waitress write out my request.

A great place to go for drink if you're 20-something....and apparently heavily tatooed, as we noticed yesterday, but I guess I've grown up since my last visit.

Second time here. First time was not anything special. However, this second time (while they celebrated their 25th year in business) everything was great. Great food, atmosphere and caught the USA soccer team playing on one of their overhead tv screens. We will go back again - both times we sat indoors. I have driven by many times and their outdoor seating area is usually packed.

If you want a few beers outside during the summer its a great place but for do not eat anything.  Food sucks and the service sucks so its a double whammy to wait for crappy food.  Tried again one last time last night - 4 people at the bar, 1 other table and me and the wife.  6:45 PM.  The little hipster waiter in skinny jeans took 10 minutes to get a drink order, and another 10 to come back with it. Saw the writing on the wall so we placed our food order - A "Woody" for me and the wife got a burger of some type.  No special requests or special cooking - just of the shelf stuff with a appetizer of nachos.  Over 20 minutes later we see him again and I ask for another beer - 10 minutes after that he brings my beer and the nachos - and about 3 minutes later our other foods shows up.  Again - only 1 other table.  Nachos are kind of gross - sandwiches are edible but nothing more.  SO my review is pretty much in line with others - food and service sucks but a nice place to have beer in the summer outside.  The inside is getting pretty tired and grungy.
The whiskey bacon burger on a pretzel bun is fantastic!
Great spot to ride your bike to, sit on the outside patio, have lunch and a drink!  Right on Main Street so you can people watch and listen to good music.
Amazing food! Went for my first date and  we loved it! The whiskey burger was one of the best! My mouth is watering thinking about it! My date has the cheesy stripper and it was good too!

Came here today with some of my favorite people after a day at Kane County Flea Market.We were seated promptly and our server was quick and efficient. Prices were great and the portions were huge! We each got a sandwich , that came with a massive pile of fries. Honestly...had I known how large the portion of fries were, we could have split one order amongst the four of us.
Not a bad place to grab a bite in the area.Really 3.5 stars,but I will be generous because everyone was so darned nice...A little kindness goes a VERY long way!

Regular hang out, good times, but more often than not, there exists the drama of Jersey Shore with late night fights and screaming/crying twenty-something girls. 

Good place for food and drinks on the patio during the day or early evening.

We were going riding and picked the Filling station as our meeting point. My friend and I got there a little early so we decided to grab a beer with a few people while we waited for the rest to show up. We found a table outside since it was a nice out and the waitress came right over and asked us if we needed menus, when we said no we werent eating she got a look on her face that made us think she was mad. We told her we were ordering a beer but were not sure which ones yet. It took her forever to get back to us and take our drink order, just because we were not ordering food doesn't mean you get to ignore us! They had a nice selection of fall beers, I chose the Red Hoptober, It was very good. I would go back for the beer and to try the food, but hope the waitress is nicer next time!

Great burgers, and a nice little patio to sit outside.  I have never had anything I didn't like - the food is great!
However, I made the mistake of coming here on a Saturday night in the summertime, where beer comes in plastic cups and the music significantly hurt my head - I felt really old.  Ugh.  Stick to daylight hours for visiting and dining, and come back here on a Saturday night if your 21 and looking to get laid.

You've got at least four chances to like this place.

1. Do you ride a Harley? Always lots of weekend warriors parked here, inside they're sipping on Stella and complaining when the bartender runs out of the Stella glasses.

2. Do you like to people watch? They've got one of the most popular "beer gardens" in St. Charles. Actually, they've got the ONLY beer garden in St. Charles. The one at the St. Charles pub doesn't count -- it overlooks the parking lot and an antique store.

3. Do you like fried chicken? Stop by on Wednesday for all you can eat broasted chicken. When I was a boy, we used to walk 5 miles uphill both ways to get broasted chicken in the days BKFC (before KFC). It's really, really good! And good greasy fries to go with it!

4. Do you like old gas station memorabilia? The old gas station signs on the walls and all over the outside are easily worth 3x what the business is. Don't believe me, try checking out eBay to see what a real  4 foot wide steel Standard Oil sign goes for.

Other than that, the place has a cool retro vibe, usually a bunch of non-trendy people in it, live music on occasion, Golden Tee machine, a good selection of beer, friendly staff. I took off one star for the cheap plastic seats outside and the hard-to-find parking.

This restaurant/pub (yeah, you're not allowed to call it a "bar in St. Charles), is all about the outdoor seating.  They have a prime spot on 64, and if you aren't too afraid of the river bugs (or running into several exes if you went to STC high school) then it is a good choice for pub food and drinks.

HOWEVER, I've had a lot of misses with the food, young waitstaff, and obnoxious patrons.  With Pub 222's courtyard-style outdoor seating soooo near, and a million other pubs with decent food choices, I'd rather be elsewhere.  

It is all about the reunions here.. and I will surely be back.  The trick is to get as drunk as everyone else, but isn't that always the trick?

Abbey, a very thin dark haired bartender at The Filling Station Pub & Grill was extremely rude to me the last time I was a customer at the bar. I came into the bar thinking I was going to have a nice night with my friends, well I was wrong. She asked me for my ID and yes this is in their job description but when I went to get my ID she then starred me down and rudely said "I need to see all your friends IDs that you are with." First off, I too work at a bar and this is nobody's responsibility but hers. I understand the importance of IDing customers who look underage, but at no point in time was this my job, not to mention she had the time to ID them on her own. She then came out from the bar and approached my table asking everyone for their ID. She said to me "What is with your attitude problem?". Me being a server of 6 years have never once in my career attacked or approached a customer in this way because I know that no matter how bad the day is, a customer never deserves to be treated in such a way. She will never make money for this bar, nor will she ever gain the respect of customers if she continues to speak to them in this way. She is a poor excuse for a bartender and should be dismissed from this establishment if they want to continue making a profit. 
-an angry customer

The Filling Station is basically a family friendly biker bar.  Good bar food, with some standout items, like the potato salad.   Its great fun in the summer to sit out on the patio with '70's classic rock in the background and have a Corona.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in St. Charles especially when it is nice outside. I like the outdoor patio area. Menu items I recommend are: the onion loaf, the woody, and the burgers. If you like potato salad be sure and get that instead of fries with your sandwich. The onion loaf comes with a yummy sauce that is different from your typical ranch.

I love this place. I don't know if it's because I've lived in STC my whole life or what but it's great. Usually I only come here at night but I decided to check out there food since it's been forever since I've eaten here. It's definitely a different vibe at dinner time then at the late hours of the weekend nights. I ordered the Woody and it was so good. I found the service to be lacking as refills too way too long and we waited for about 20 minutes to get our check while the server chatted with the other girls working. I've been here at lunch time before and the service is so much better, that is why I gave it 4 stars. So my suggestions would be to check it out for lunch or stop by and have a drink or three on the weekends. They usually have pretty good drink specials too.

The only redeeming quality this place has is the outside patio. The service is TERRIBLE and the drinks are even worse. I ordered a Long Island and for some reason they thought that sweet and sour and coke are the main ingredients. It was disgusting. Make sure to order a tall if you get a vodka lemonade because the $4 they're charging you for it is for a half-pint glass full of lemonade with a splash of vodka. The Filler is a great place for just-turned 21 year olds that want cheap beer and crappy bar food. Personally, I think I'll stick to the Geneva bars.

Giving this place one star is too many!  Bad food and service.  My bandmates and I went here after practice on a Monday night and we all came up with the same conclution, this place sucks!  We shared some apps. and they where all very poorly made.  My dryed up, overcooked rubberbands that they call squid, where more like dog food than anything that should be served at a resturaunt!  The sliders that we got where burnt, and the only thing that was edible was the nachos.  
  If you want to see what is wrong with service these days look no further!  OMG I need to check my phone I got a text! Im sure this is what was going through our servers head the whole time we where there.  The bartender was doing the same thing also!  I think there was a manager there, but I couldn't tell him apart from the other D-Bags that were drinking cheep beer and Jager bombs.  If you like to drink crap, and food isn't your thing, go to this dive.  If you want to spend your money on good food and drinks look elsewhere.  Anyone over the age of 25 should know better than to go to this place!  I'm sorry I wasted my money at this joint!

Went here for lunch with friends before heading over to Pottawatomie Park for the Paddleboat ride.  We told our waitress, Mallory that we were short on time and she was great in getting our order rushed through so we made it on time for the cruise.

Decor is tons of gas station memorabilia.  Very cute and kitchy!  They had an outdoor patio seating area which looked great for people watching but it was a very hot day so we sat inside.  Ordered the burger & fries which was so huge I almost couldn't finish it all.  Very tasty!  I'd go back again next time I'm in the area.
The goto pub and grill for those who require no-frills eating and enjoyment. Very popular weekend bar for 20 somethings. Sandwhiches and chips are the staple.

I go here with my friends two or three times a year and annually on St. Paddy's Day.  I've had the nachos and Philly, which are both worth a try.  The atmosphere is very inviting to large groups of people, and I will continue to go there for years to come...

I enjoyed this place - simple menu, great patio, and down the road from a few other bars.
 I found it very weird that since we sat on the patio if you order a soft drink it comes from a can... 
Otherwise, the waitstaff was pleasant enough and the prices were reasonable.

OK for starters let me say I rarely give 2 stars so my experience must have been bad so I'll let you be the judge after reading my review. 
1st off there was a 20 min wait, it was a Saturday night no big deal the hostess asked us if we would like to wait in the lobby or in the bar. We decided to wait in the bar for seating outside,,,, Big Mistake!!! The waitress in the bar was nice very attentive however shes just bringing us beer and its a small bar I realize how many beers I've had and ask our waitress to check on our table. Long story short They forgot about us 45 min later I'm noticing new guests being seated outside. So were off to a bad start. 
2nd Now were buzzed & starving!! We order right away and an appetizer to start with. The waitress specifically asks us if we want the "nachos as an appetizer". 3 more beers & I also ask for a ice water. 
3rd I get my ice water and there is crud in the glass GROSS Again I'm pretty easy going but I'm getting aggravated at this point. I send the water back and patiently wait for a new one.... 
4th OH No! All the food comes out at the same time! She specifically asked us "do you want the nachos as an appetizer" I gave the food runner a look of death. Still no water & the nachos are cold. 
5th I still have no water and no real apology from the waitress. 
6th at this point I'm expecting a manger to come over no one ever does 
I finally get my water after we ask for it. They did take the nachos off the bill BUT that really doesn't make it right. A manager should have come over and apologized or something there was just no customer service our entire visit. No apology for the table no explanation for the food coming out at the same time. 

I mean the food was good however I can get food like that anywhere. Its bar food. To top it all off the nachos weren't even good... Its a cool atmosphere but the wait staff needs some major training in customer service. I wont be returning.
Cool vintage decor, but food is average at best, and the sevice not that great.

Yes, this place is filled with gas station memorabilia. It is also filled with dead animals. On the walls. Interesting combination, no?

The food here is good bar/pub food. The nachos are huge and very tasty. The burgers are great. There are good drink specials every night of the week.

I enjoy eating lunch on the patio when the weather is nice. Get there early... it fills up! Evenings are the same, the patio is packed.
avoid the weekends here unless youre a bro.  otherwise youll fit in perfectly.  normal drinks.  outdoor seating is nice for nice days/nights.

We've been here about 10 times. I always get The Woody. I have had an excellent sandwich once or twice but I'm an optimist, so I keep ordering it. It usually doesn't work out and I can't figure out why. They have been making it FOREVER, so what is so hard? Today was no exception. Ordered it on rye but was told they don't have any (more on that later). So went with oat bran. Wait a bit. Here it comes but this is some random sandwich with avocado (NOT on this sandwich) and without the red onion. Take it back. Wait a bit. Here it comes. On sour dough rather than the oat I ordered and in the same basket it went back to the kitchen in. (I recognize the ketchup corner I had made.) Might have been a few new fries in there but the old ones were still there, too. Don't want to wait any longer, so I eat it. But that's just tacky. My friend had the corned beef on the mysteriously unavailable rye. I asked why it was that he got rye and was told that the Rocket 88 sandwich was made up early in the day and held until it was ordered. (This was 5 p.m.!) I really, really wish this place could get it right.

A year ago I would have had a slightly higher rating. After dining at The Filling Station no less than 4 times this year, I can't rate any higher than two stars. Service is average, food is below par but I do like the interior. If you're simply looking for an evening drink, have at it. There's always a great late night crowd and in warmer months the beer garden is hopping.
Was not a fan of the appetizer combo platter; thought it was too expensive for what was included. Patty melt was great, though! Not sure what people see in the potato salad - it was bland.

This place is great in the summertime. Sit outside and have a few drinks and some cheap bar food all in downtown st. charles. service varies depending on who you get but more often than not it's good.

I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS PLACE FOR EVEN A ZOO ANIMAL!  The food is not only disgusting but they also have a tendency to ring up WAY too many drinks on you tab.  I brought my sister there for drinks after dinner and the waitress THERESA can't seem to count how many drinks we REALLY had.  Then when you dispute the charges WATCH OUT for the owner Pete who isn't coherent enough to form a decent sentence.  I will never go to this place again!  Apparently my sister and me drank 3 beers, 4 rum and cokes and 5 pinot grigios in 3 hours!  We would have been passed out if that were the case but they won't credit us back.  I am turning them into the Better Business Bureau.  CUSTOMER BEWARE!

I've been going here sense they opened and now I can only go when it's during the day.  Now, I have gotten to old for the night life here on the weekends.  During the summer this is the place to go.  They have a great beer garden that looks out on to Rt. 64 and when bar hoping this place is packed. Everybody goes here. The girls are cute and your not allowed to work here if your not.  They have good typical pub food and good times but it can feel like your hanging out at Kindercare on the late weekend nights. If you want to find out what's going on for after hours, make sure you stop here before last call.
Great Atmosphere, (fun outdoor area)  Great Burgers and Great Hand Cut Fries!!  What more could you ask for?  Wait... Don't pass up the onion loaf!!!!

I live in STC so for me going to the Filler, as it is fondly known, is like a class reunion every time. The food here is really good and the patio is great. BUT if you go after 9 pm its next to impossible to get a drink b/c it's soooo crowded. I have to give the servers props b/c it is so crowded but if I have to wait more than 20 mins I'd just as soon go somewhere else.

This is usually our place to eat after hanging out at Kane County Flea Market. The outdoor garden is best, but it was too cold for that yesterday.

We have always had something to eat when we have come here. Though the eats are basic, they are always good. This time I had the beef brisket. Way too many fries but  I guess some folks like that.

It's never too loud despite the TV monitors everywhere. The decor is cool, especially since as folks say, it's authentic and not just knock-off kitsch such as you would find at a Friday's. Good service, and a decent selection of beers.
Cool hangout place, but the food is very mediocre.  Can get ridiculously crowded.

This place always has great food and service no matter which location you pick! I would definitely recommend this restaurant for breakfast any time. They do have lunch as well, from select salads and sandwiches, but breakfast is the way to go.

The service was pretty great. My only critical thing was that the waiter didn't tell us his name which they usually do, or should! Otherwise the service was great and quick. 

My grandmother ordered the banana bread french toast. Three pieces of thick french toast with slices of banana on top, served with syrup. My mother ordered the create your own omelette with mushrooms, bacon, and cheddar jack cheese. Omlettes are served with hashbrowns (non-shredded, but you can ask for those) and an English muffin (house made jam is served with this as well - it's delicious). I ordered the create your own omelette as well, only with spinach, bacon, and goat cheese (also with hashbrowns and an English muffin). Also, I had to order the pumpkin pancakes which have candied pecans inside. 

All of this food was delicious. If you haven't been out to this restaurant, definitely give it a try next time you're craving breakfast!

I love this restaurant. It is owned by the nicest family you will ever meet too. I worked there for a month over the holidays and got to learn a lot about how they run their stores. They treat the employees really well, have awesome goals and are always trying to improve. I can't say enough good things about them. 

Their pancakes are awesome.

First off,   My grandmother loves it here.   We have been eating out a lot due to kitchen being remodeled...  

Staff is usually friendly. 

I ordered a egg white omelette with avocados, it was very dry and they forgot to use egg whites.

I was here on a weekend, a group of 7. The restaurant was really busy, there was about a 30 minute wait (which isn't that bad for a breakfast place on a weekend). the staff was really friendly. So I ordered the create your own omelette, with the harbor potatoes and an English muffin, and the food was really good, everything tasted great. really enjoyed my meal definitely will be back.

I don't understand the hype with this breakfast place in Schaumburg. The harbor potatoes were cold and stale. The pancakes were undercooked. Link sausages were burnt and very dry. However, the service was quite good. Our server was quick and polite. The other good aspect is the coffee. It's much better than the common diner coffees.

Came to Egg Harbor because the wait at Wildberry was way too long. We rather wait for 20 min than 1 hour and 15 min, so we settled for Egg Harbor. We came in a party of 7 and they easily accommodated us to a suitable table. The decor of this restaurant is so cute. Even the cups were engraved so cutely. The waitress was friendly and very accommodating. I accidentally ordered the wrong drink and she kinda changed it to the proper drink. 

I had the meat lover skillet: ham, sausage and bacon! I even add extra ingredients like green pepper and onion but I wish she informed me that they were extra charges too because I wasn't very please to see I got charged $.79/item. But nonetheless, it was pretty tasty even if the chunks of onions and green peppers were bigger than expected. I was also to substitute the biscuit for a flavored pancake for $1 extra charge which she did inform me about. I actually was not too impress with the pancakes. I got blackberry banana pancakes and it was kind of an odd mix I must say but I have it a shot and they just left the blackberry as a whole and it was not sweet at all. Overall, an okay experience.

3.5 stars - would come back in hopes of giving a 4.

Pretty good, not amazing. I like Wildberry more.

When I saw Egg Harbor pop up, my first thought was, "Uh-oh." I've heard great things about EHC over the years, yet I never made it to one.

Fast-forward to an ultra busy day at Wildberry (wait was bordering on two hours) and we were hungry -- too hungry to wait. We walked right back out and drove down to EHC and were seated within 25 minutes. The packed lobby led us to believe it would be much longer, but they move people FAST.

Prices are on par with Wildberry, although Wildberry has a more creative menu (crepes, etc.). Egg Harbor does have more expensive coffee, and that put me off from ordering one.

We had:
1) Dynamite Veggie Egg White Omelet
2) Garden Delight Omelette
3) Winter in Italy French Toast

The omelets were good, and the Winter in Italy NAILED it. Really, really good. Interesting ingredients and flavours. I could never eat a whole plate of it, but I couldn't resist slicing a piece from my friend's plate, haha. Yum.

Pro Tip: Free coffee by the coffee bar.

I cannot begin to describe the wonderful morning I experienced here. I had their Signature Buttermilk Pancake Combo with sausage links, scrambled eggs, and a glass of orange juice. Simply delicious! The orange juice is a must with anything you eat there as it it fresh-squeezed and as good as it gets. The pancakes lived up to their name (being signature and all) and were as light and fluffy as the highest cloud in the sky. The sausage links and scrambled eggs were perfect sides in the combo and complimented the pancakes perfectly. I highly recommend and will be returning very soon (hopefully to make it a tradition!).

Customer service here is out of this world! I visit a few times a month and I am always greeted with an upbeat attitude. Egg harbor does a great job of hiring positive and welcoming staff. I always order the San Antonio skillet to go and it is ready in under 10 minutes and delicious. Also very affordable! Love this place!
This place is amazing. Me and my girlfriends go to breakfast place whenever we don't feel like trying anything new. Highly recommend

Egg Harbor is a great place to try but not always the best for a stress-free breakfast.

I had been itching to visit this restaurant ever since it opened a couple months ago and don't regret it one bit. The food was tasty, the employees were very friendly and the complimentary coffee all sold me. Being that I visited Memorial Day weekend on a Sunday morning, I wasn't expecting any less than to have to wait to be seated. It was VERY crowded but the wait was only about 20 minutes - from the looks of things I was expecting AT LEAST an hour.

The reason I gave Egg Harbor 3 stars was due to the fact that my boyfriend and I had to ask 12 questions before we could even put our order in. There is a charge for EVERY little thing and we weren't looking to spend $62 because of a food substitute (side of pancakes instead of potatoes for example) or an extra coffee. The menu is a bit misleading and it was more hassle than it was worth. My boyfriend and I had seen the Summer In Italy French Toast on Egg Harbor's Yelp profile before we stopped in and were sold immediately. However, when we had spotted it on the menu it was $11 for JUST the french toast...huh? That plan was out. 
If you try making anything a meal (meaning adding bacon/sausage, eggs, etc to your pancakes or french toast) they give you a smaller portion of the pancakes, french toast, etc. So if I want more of one food I get a smaller portion of another...alright. A majority of the questions we had asked either had a long explanation or had to be answered by a manager which was a little annoying. (Keep in mind they were only questions about substituting sides, what meals came with, etc.).

I must say, the food was definitely tasty. I got my first Egg's Benedict and I would certainly be back for it again. Our food was hot, served neatly and our waiter was very accommodating throughout our visit. My meal (Egg's Benedict with a side of potatoes) was filling and was just enough for me personally. Being that I had never had an Egg's Benedict before I didn't have much to compare it to but I enjoyed myself. I figured since I like English muffins, Canadian bacon and any type of egg all of it together with hollandaise sauce poured over it would be A-OK with me.

One thing I love about Egg Harbor is how much they sell themselves with their merchandise. The bowls, mugs and other items engraved with the logo are really neat and are all for sale when you walk in. 

All in all, I would visit Egg Harbor again for sure. It was very clean, they had plenty of menu options for everyone (just watch out for those hidden charges and meal changes) and the food was definitely worth it.

This was the first time for my family and I and we really enjoyed it.  The blueberry cobbler coffee smelled great and tasted just as good.  
My daughters got the Italian style french toast (beautiful and very tasty) and a combo with blueberry pancakes and scrambled eggs & sausage.  My wife got the granola pancake special, also with scrambled eggs and sausage.  And I got the cinnamon role french toast combo, again with eggs over hard & sausage.  
Everything was cooked perfectly and served with great hospitality.   We really enjoyed our experience!

The only issue we experienced was with our booth.  We sat along the wall and the booth rocked when we leaned forward.

I love the fact that this place is brand new and super clean. Staff is on top of everything. They greet you at the door and are very nice.
Food is delicious and priced well. I've been here several times and have never had a problem with any of the menu items or the service. 
Any skillet you try will please you. Plentiful and tastes great.

I love eggs, I mean who doesn't? Actually, I love eggs, bacon, coffee...etc. I guess I just described breakfast. OK, I love breakfast, and I mean LOOOOOOVE. I could eat breakfast for lunch and dinner, so I think it is bordering on obsession. Where do I take care of such hunger pangs? If in Schaumburg, this would be the breakfast spot.

We lived in Schaumburg not too long ago, and we still like to frequent the neighborhood. I heard that this place opened right by Woodfield, and I was pumped. Like the other Egg Harbor Caf locations, expect a lot of people on weekends. They get you seated fairly quickly, and trust me it is well worth the wait. 

We rolled in on a Sunday, at around 10:30am, and I thought the wait would be close to an hour.  I was told it would be 15-20 minutes, and indeed it was. We were seated and I already knew what I wanted. I ordered the Meaty skillet, and true to the name...it was meat-tastic!  This place has found a new loyal customer, and when I'm back in the "Burg" this will definitely be a stop for me.

We stopped here with a group of 10 (four of which were kids) a few Sunday's back and as expected, we had a 45 minute wait at about 10:30.  We went in expecting that with such a large party.

As for food - it was really good.  I had the Geneva Rosti - a Swiss traditional of eggs, bacon, onions, potatoes all baked together.  It was served with sour cream and a side of fruit and an English muffin (with I believe homemade jelly).  I really loved my dish and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to try something a little different for breakfast.

My husband had some sort of Santa Fe scrambler/skillet with jalapenos and peppers and onions that he also really liked.  The others around the table also had different skillets or pancakes and everyone liked their dish.

Our server was good - especially given the large party and it being busy with Sunday brunch.  If in the area (or one of their sister locations), I would go back to Egg Harbor.

Stopped here with my fianc for a quick late breakfast and we loved it! He had the egg salad melt which came with quite a bit of food. Side salad, large whole sandwich, and a side of delicious potatoes. I ordered the bacado omelette. SO good! Our server was friendly and attentive - she even offered to make our sodas to go! Very sweet.

Egg Harbor Cafe is a Denny's that isn't trying to kill you; in fact, they're pretty nice!

We chose to dine for brunch during the week.  The restaurant wasn't full, but it wasn't crowded either.  Our family had plenty of privacy to chat amongst ourselves.

Not too hungry, I chose 'Cassie's Crpes' for my meal. These were wonderful.  Normally, you could expect a crepe to be either sweet or savory, yet these were right in the middle and quite delicious. Try them, if that's what you're in to.

The dcor, as you might have predicted, was largely egg-themed, right down to the placemats. 

Never one to shy away from a challenge, I picked up the tiny jar of crayons and entered myself into the Egg Harbor Cafe's Egg Drawing Contest!

Please see my entry in the photo gallery.

Prices are fair, food is amazing. So many different items on the menu to choose from that was the biggest challenge with dining here. Waited 20 minutes on a busy Saturday for a table but was well worth the wait.

My husband and I have always loved egg harbor. Before the Schaumburg location opened up we often went to the one in Arlington Heights. The new location does not disappoint. The restaurant is very well set up and we have never had to wait very long for a table. They always have great specials and the staff is so friendly and accommodating. One of our favorite breakfast spots for sure!

I really enjoyed this brunch place! We went on a Sunday morning, and we expected a wait as there is one with any brunch place. The wait was about 20 minutes, which was do-able. The service was quick and extremely friendly. Prices were reasonably as well. What I really enjoyed about this place is that they offer quite a few healthier and tasty options. It isn't just a brunch place filled with extremely sweet and dessert type breakfast options and maybe some eggs. There is quite the variety - I got the protein wrap, and it was quite delicious. It was a bit dry for my taste, but the salsa on the side was the perfect addition to take care of that. The portions are plenty and the ingredients tasted fresh. I will definitely be back here :)
Me & my wife stopped by for breakfast. We have the Garden Omelet. Excellent. Pot of coffee & pitcher of ice water on the table. No need to call for refill.

I've loved Egg Harbor Cafe since I started working in palatine more than 12 years ago. Used to go to the one in Arlington Heights for lunch all the time. Fast-forward to 2015, and looky-loo, I now have one in my hood! 

Came here on a Sunday morning around 10am with a party of 6 and the place was packed. Parking was a bit difficult, but hey, sometimes that's the price you pay. Note: similar to Wildberry, no reservations permitted. 

Now on to the grub... I ordered the traditional breakfast of eggs, chicken sausage, cheese grits, and an english muffin. Pretty tasty, even though the cheese grits were not actually cheesy. I grew up on (and still make) cheese grits that were actually yellow from the cheddar cheese...these were creamy white with flecks of yellow. But that's just a personal  preference, they were still good. The chicken sausage was just as I remembered, delicious. 

Coffee and strawberry orange juice were both awesome and our waitress, while busy, was very nice and accommodating of our quasi-large party. 

Super happy it's now in my area and I'll def be back with my friends again.

Restaurant review
What an amazing new brunch restaurant. I really want to go to wild berry but my sister-in-law insisted that we try this new breakfast restaurant. We were lucky because he went on December 28 which was their 30th anniversary. They had a variety of special deals that were was only one for one day. Intelligentsia coffee was only $.60 it came in a nice thermos kept it hot throughout the meal. In addition I was able to get two different entres. One was the Shauna sun-up which was yogurt with granola and strawberries and bananas. This was likely the best yogurt parfait I ever had. I didn't get a chance to try the homemade banana bread which is included with this entre. I also tried the meggsican frittata. This included eggs chorizo onions and melted cheese which was topped with sour cream and tomatoes. Although I didn't really care from a flour tortilla the rest of it was quite delicious. For the price of 4.95 that day it was quite a deal. The normal price is a low bit more than that for each of those. The server was quite friendly and she came in to check to make sure that our meal was okay. I'll be the definately come back for breakfast some other time.

Pros: Friendly service, inexpensive brunch, well lit restaurant

Cons: Very small parking lot and slightly long wait times

Hidden deals:
I will need to mark their anniversary date on my calendar as the prices were ridiculously cheap

Good food and great service. This place is clean and good pricing! Not too greasy and hey have a great selection. I enjoy trying something. Ew every time I go. Very friendly, attentive staff and good atmosphere.

Service is good, prices are affordable and food is tasty.


They did mess up our skillet order however, but were able to quickly fix us another one with the correct request. Coffee was mediocre though. Had the autumn in Italy French toast which was delicious.

Definitely not as good as wildberry - which has so many more delicious options and better coffee options.

This past Sunday we enjoyed an awesome breakfast at the new Egg Harbor in Schaumburg. We arrived and as expectetd it was packed. I went in to check the wait for four and they said no more than 15 to 20 mins. Not bad for 10am on Sunday however I couldnt believe we would be sat in under 30 mins. We waited outside bc it was sunny out and they have these great heated lamps to stand near when cold - perfect thoughtful touch!

We were called for our table only 13mins later! Whaaaat?? How? Well we sat and we immediately greeted and asked for a drink order. They have water available before you sit and everyone is extremely friendly. We spoke with three waitresses ensuring our visit was going well...but we only had one server. Amazing! They genuinely cared and it was so nice to see teamwork like this. 

We ordered and our food tool maybe 10 mins tops and it was served to order (bc we are annoying and went back and forth on what we wanted)

My kids were so excited about the menu they couldn't maket up their mind! Adorable. One ordered Green Eggs and Ham bc she couldn't believe that was a realy thing!! ;-) lol and the other ordered the rainbow pancakes - which even I thought was delish.

Never ran out of napkins drinks or anything. They were very prompt and efficient. I didn't feel rushed as all. They all just worked great together to turn their tables. 

Can't wait to return! Oh and even your register staff was top notch! 

Thank you!

This is the place you want to be for breakfast. Never had to wait more than half and hour on a Sunday morning. The food is always 100% of the time, outstanding. The menu is full of things for everyone to enjoy. The cheese grits with bacon and jalapeos is amazing. I love that each table has its own water carafe, so no more waiting impatiently for your waiter to stop by and offer more. The coffee bar is another great perk! The coffee is delicious and so are all the special lattes. The food is good portioned and they always have a special. I keep going back, and I continue to be more and more pleased. Today I had fried green tomatoes Benedict and it was so so good. A great spot that you definitely need to try. Not a bad thing to say about this place!

Great coffee (intelligentsia), great service, cute atmosphere, and the food is great too. Cassie's crepes, the skillets, the Belgian waffle combo and the omelette are all great. 

Perfect for a cozy breakfast out.
Very good!  If you are going soon try there Strawberry orange juice, I know it sounds not so good but it's one of the best things ever!!!

Being a newly transformed nutritarian who cheats with eggs and dairy frequently, this place has some great options for vegetarians! The veggie delight skillet is great. Assorted with sweet potatoes, zucchini, avocado, black beans and red pepper, topped with mozzarella cheese and eggs cooked to your preference. I requested spinach and mushrooms in addition to include daily nutritarian dietary requirements! It was delicious! 
You're given a wheat English muffin and homemade berry pure. The pure is not overly sweet but just right! Maybe it could do with even less sugar, but it's fine now too.

The only thing I would change if I were to come and order this again (which is likely), I would request a lesser amount of sweet potatoes and an increase of the green stuff! I realize this is the base, but they are overly filling and I could not finish them! Not to mention, although better than white potatoes, they are still a starch! 

Regardless, this is a personal preference and does NOT take away from the quality or deliciousness of the dish! Some people, my husband included, would love this!

They have great coffee options with baristas preparing quality beverages too!

Awesome family place for breakfast/lunch/brunch! The servers were really friendly and attentive. I had a fresh-pressed OJ and cinnamon roll french toast, and my husband had the San Antonio skillet. The OJ really was fresh-pressed! (I was coming off a cold, and was drinking fresh pressed OJ every chance I got). My husband mentioned that they "didn't skimp on the chorizo" in his skillet, which is a high compliment coming from him. My French toast was fluffy and cinnamon-y without being too sweet (big plus).

All in all, the meal was great, and Egg Harbor would def be my go to place for brunch if I'm ever in the area again.

My fiance' and I came here after reading the Yelp reviews and decided to try them out, we were NOT disappointed. This place gets extremely crowded. The coffee is great and so is the food. The staff, eventhough they are busy, they provide great service.
First time, very loud. Food was good for everyone. Was seated right away. Wooden bench seats not the most comfortable, but very spacious.

This place is awesome. 
Service is fast, even when there is a wait out the door!
Food quality is great, not greasy, not full of salt, and no gobs of cheese to cover up your meal. 

What you get here is fresh, light, and perfectly portioned. The coffee is always hot, the juice is always fresh, the little touches like the buttered english muffin that is still soft and chewy instead of hard and crusty. My favorite are the Swedish Style pancakes, they are so delicious!

Do yourself a favor and come here for breakfast!

First time here and will definitely return.  

Expect a brief wait during heavy traffic times (Sunday brunch), but once seated you will definitely have a meal and service worth the minimal wait.  Our waitress, Mayra, was extremely attentive, from order taking to drink refills to bringing the check, but never making us feel rushed.  In between, the rest of the staff was just as amenable and courteous.  For the business of the restaurant, the food was delivered insanely fast to the table, and was fresh and delicious.

If you can't decide between between sweet and savory, you can even get a substitute of blueberry pancakes with your breakfast skillet for a mere $1 more!  (and when they say "small pancakes", they really mean normal size, not silver dollar!)

Soda and coffee both come with free refills, including a carafe of each on the table.  Further more, they'll even bring you to-go cups for both at the end of your meal!

This is a great breakfast place! This is day three of coming here.  Service is top notch.  The staff has been trained very well and all have a happy smile. 
I like the coffee which is always very hot which I love! The oatmeal breakfast was very good.

This is by far one of the best breakfast restaurants the family has ever found. I hope that they open one up in Nashville, TN. Fantastic variety including many unique options like cinnamon role French Toast.

A great place to get a fast breakfast. They have a lot of options, and their specials are pretty good. While I would have had to wait 45+ minutes at Wildberry down the street, I was seated in 10 minutes at Egg Harbor and they were really fast.

It was great to see a new location i have been going to the Barrington location for the past several years actually have over 100 check ins there... All the food here is excellent I really have never had anything mediocre The staff is spot on friendly and very accommodating. If you haven't been you must try

First time here ..im always up fir breakfast and im glad i found another great breakfast place in Schaumburg IL. The food was great. The service was absolutely fantastic.  The hosts were all so friendly. Probably the friendliest compared to other famous breakfast places in Schaumburg and I loved that.

The girls at the counter made sure everything was alright. 
Only thing different I found from other similar places  was that they offer English muffin with everything instead of the usual pancakes.  This is no big deal as I requested pancakes instead and they had no problem. 

Got the pancakes to go but syrup was missing. ...but hey everyone can make a small mistake like that.....not a big deal.
