i have visited this location several times since they opened hoping to get a better experience before i post a review...but it does not measure up (in all aspects) to the other locations...the interior does not feel cozy like the one in hinsdale...the industrial theme on this location screams "eat-and-go" and feels too "corporate"...the seats and tables are so flimsy and cheaply made (sit on the booth seating and lightly rock your butt sideways and you're in danger of breaking the seats - all their seats were built like this)...the staff were clumsily rushing (i truly believe this is how they were trained since all of them were this way)...on different visits: they practically threw the place setting on us when they were setting up, spilled water all over the table, two minutes after bringing our food , have asked if we were done and started to clean our table, we couldn't even relax and eat...we listened to the music of dropping silverware in the dining area several times...this is "not" how to compete with a 5-star wildberry cafe across the street...this is not the egg harbor cafe that i have come to love...this is her evil twin sister...

We stayed at a hotel nearby and ordered carry out. I had the key west crepes which were amazing. The skillet San Antonio was a hit with my hubby and my daughter said the scrambled eggs were really good!

We loved it! We've eaten at wildberry which was good but we both agreed this was much better. The service is great and the wait wasn't too long, about 25 minutes on Valentine's Day. We both ordered Benedict's and they were perfect. The pancakes were phenomenal as well! Eat here!

This place opened a few weeks ago and I have been here 4 times.  So far all experiences have been great!  Service and food are both amazing!  I often go to Wildberry and Richard Walkers; this is almost as good as those.  I'm sure I'll be going here often and recommend you give it a try!
This is by far one of my favorite breakfast spots. Great service, great times! The coffee is above the rest!

We are super fans of Egg Harbor! So happy they brought a location to Schaumburg! They offer the basics for breakfast but also unique options which keeps us coming week after week! Love the loose leaf teas, coffee is amazing, everything we have ever gotten has been great! This is where we bring friends and out of town guests. Kid friendly, great service. Our favorite breakfast place!

The service is excellent however can be a little extreme at times. An example of this is 4 people standing to greet you at the door is a little awkward. 

For some odd reason this is the second time we have been sat by the server station which I do not recommend. 

The food is of good quality and on the healthy side, the prices are higher than average for a breakfast diner. 

We were checked on over 6 times I am pretty sure because it's still fairly new and they want to make a good impression. 

Try it out, I will be back!

So, I took my staff out to breakfast for having a great month.  The place was bright, clean and open.  I thought this could be a new regular breakfast place but it does not come close to Wildberry.  The tea was made with fresh leaves which was pretty cool.  Menu had a great selection and the server was nice.  Now you're asking why is this review only one star?  

It is one star for all of the above.  I did not know that my poached eggs came with hair.  Imagine picking up your fork for the second bite and there is an embedded coarse grey hair hanging from the warm, runny yolk. Rodent Hair?  Yep - there was the gag reflex going off.  

The 20-Something Manager came over and did the scripted apology and added that this had been a recurring problem over the past two weeks and they were working on it!!!!  Who volunteers that information???  My staff all looked at each other and we were pretty much done eating - who wouldn't be?  

He said he would "take care of the bill".  We flagged the server over and she dropped off the bill?  What!  Yes - the bill...  My hairy poached eggs were removed.  Child manager comes back and says that he meant "taking care of the bill" just meant my portion.  Even though my staff challenged him.  

That is why this scary place to eat is a "one star" rating.   One hair means there are many and I will never eat there again. I guess they are still too new to provide hair nets for their staff and rodent traps.

Very impressed!  Was looking for a new place to try and decided to come here instead of wild berry/walkers (my normal goto for heady breakfast)
Im very pick when it comes to good breakfast, I won't go back to a place if something is sub par. I'll def be coming back here!

I ordered the traditional combo, and upgraded to the candied bacon (super worth it), eggs were cooked perfectly (over easy)
I would give the pancakes a 7/10 which is a lot from me, I'm a  pancake snob and most places have bland pancakes or don't satisfy me fully, these got close haha
These weere a lot less bland than morst other places but if they played with the recipe a little they could probably have something legendary.
That is literally the only thing I have to say about this place that isn't exceptional!

If you're looking for something good hit up egg harbor
We were visiting family in Chicago from California and we loved eating at Egg Harbor. Great breakfast! Will go back next time we are in town.

Place is very cute, modern country decor. Staff were all super friendly. I had the Bavarian Benedict and it was amazing. Little crispy potato pancakes topped w bacon crumbles, poached eggs and sour cream. Add on house made tomatillo salsa. Hot tea came in the cutest individual brewer as well. Delicious, I will be back!

Absolutely wonderful breakfast! Went here on Sunday morning, and there was absolutely no wait - which is unheard of! We were immediately greeted and seated. They have flavored coffee available and brought a carafe to the table so we never had to wait for refills. The menu has great variety, including omlettes, skillets, pancakes, crepes...you name it, it's on there. Our server was an absolute sweetheart, she was patient and courteous and took time to explain and check on ingredients for certain items on the menu. (I have food allergies). I had a simple eggs breakfast, and swapped out of the bread for pancakes, which was free of charge. The pancakes were fluffy, and sweet without syrup. The quantities of food was plentiful. My boyfriend ordered Eggs Benedict, and he enjoyed it very much. They offer togo cups for your drinks as well as your food, and we left with fresh coffee in hand. We will most certainly be returning here - great place!

Food is good, though menu does not have alot of options compared to other breakfast resturants. I went out of my comfort zone and ordered the skillet and it was really good. Service was good, but our "actual" server only came to the table once to give us our check (three different servers during breakfast) which is crappy for them, unless they split tips... which i doubt.
Excellent brunch place with plenty options to chose from the menu. I had the Bacado Omelette and it was tasty. It was light and filling. Would likely come back and reccomend this place.

Fantastic breakfasts and huge portions. Overall good value for money with most breakfast options around $10. I now understand why this place is always busy. I will be back here often. 

Try the orange and strawberry juice, it's delicious!

My first time here (visiting from California), and I have to say, this is a great place for breakfast! The strawberry-orange juice was amazing! The portions- they're huge! Not sure if this is a Chicago-only joint, but it's definitely a must!

Have been 3 times - once for lunch, twice for breakfast. Lunch was very nice - great salad and service. First breakfast quite tasty, good service, not rushed. Second breakfast (2 weeks ago) was great quality and taste-wise, but service was extremely rushed (peak time was fast approaching) and they actually vacuumed the booth behind us while we were eating. The vacuum was so loud we could not converse until he finished. The waitress told us to take all the time we wanted, but it was obvious they were trying hard to hustle us out. Granted, the entry was packed with people waiting to be seated (to the point we could barely pay the check), but sort of made the great food fade in memory.

I'll go back, but probably not for breakfast...
Fist time here and food was fresh, service was friendly, good kids menu too. I'll be back!
Great place great service! Hazelnut coffee is the best from here! The omelets are huge enough for two people.

This place was across from our hotel , we decided to stop in.   We ( 4people) were seated immediately , prompt greeting by server and food was served quickly.  Food was excellent and coffee was top notch

We waited 25 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. Our server was friendly and helpful. Our food came out super fast and was absolutely delicious. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone and will be coming back again.

Fabulous breakfast/brunch place. Busy and popular especially on a Sunday! Omlettes are delicious as are the eggs benedict. Coffee is good and plentiful, they even give you a to go cup when you leave! The coffee mugs are really cool too. Waitstaff are super friendly and attentive.

Spilled out of Marriott courtyard and into this dream of a restaurant.  Employees are gracious and professional, food is amazing. Get the strawberry orange juice!  Everything is clean and comfortable.  This is my new go to for first start when in Schaumburg.

One of my favorite restaurants. This location is new but the staff is well trained. The seating area is larger than other locations and it cuts down wait times. The only drawback is the fact that the parking is somewhat limited. Both times I was there, had to circle the lot a couple times to find parking. But it was worth it. :)

My fave breakfast place. First time at this location, and our party of 9 waited about 15 minutes on a Saturday morning around 10 AM. Much larger than the Arlington Heights location with plenty of parking. Service was prompt and friendly with food coming out fast. My fave dish is the door county melt. Can't resist it each time we go. Also had the blueberry pancakes and they are the size of a dinner plate. We usually get a carafe of fresh squeezed orange juice and it definitely hits the spot. Splitting checks for large groups is not a problem if needed.

Food was good, nothing extraordinary..but i am a bigger fan of diner type food.  I like traditional hashbrowns over what they serve which is diced potatos.  I had the butchershop omelet and it was ik, but it seemed kind of bland.  They must not use a good ham to give that imelete a unique taste..
Best breakfast place around! The coffee station while you are waiting for your table is great. Staff is always friendly. Food is served hot, and large portions. Can't wait to go back!
Fresh squeezed OJ, intellegista coffee! Had the chorizo chilaquiles and my be had the Denver omelette great food. Great service, food came quickly. Try it!!!  Our tab was under $25!
My favorite breakfast plate is cinnamon roll French toast.

Good solid breakfast before heading home from a weekend of shenanigans with friends. Coffee bar made the wait much better, and the food was fantastic. I got the Popeye Crepes with a side of cheesy grits (mmm, grits), Hubben did a build your own skillet, and we both walked out happily full (and my threatening hangover miraculous disappeared!)

Second visit to an egg Hathor cafe in this area...oatmeal was nothing short of amazing! Who would think that? Such a pleasant surprise. They also serve flavored coffee as well as regular. Love that! Strawberry orange juice is a treat!  Lemon poppyseed pancakes are almost a must. Definite winner!
I ordered autumn in Italy French tost..it was the best..loved it..I will visit this place again!!

EGGCELENT me and my fella came here as I read the reviews on Yelp. Pleased we found it as we come to Elk Grove Village for work quite a bit. I had the goat cheese sausage scramble. I added avocado. Tony ate the special of the day blueberry pancakes. He loved them 'light and fluffy'. My scramble was perfecto. Would definitely come back here again. Have already bookmarked it for my next visit :) Coffee was great. Oh yes the fresh orange juice w strawberry was amazing too. Service too was great. Thanks. We will be back. Cheers!

Great breakfast place if you're in the Schaumburg area.   Good food that's not greasy.  The staff is very pleasant and accomodating. Price is reasonable.  Come early (especially if you're in a large group) because it can get crowded.

My first visit to an Egg Harbor location. Had extra time and decided to go out of my way while headed to work to try them out. The service was good and my omlette was delivered quickly. The jelly in a squeeze bottle was a unique touch but the coffee was anemic.
Thalia (T) was by far the sweetest and most cheerful server I've ever had. The food was fantastic, but I would come back just to see her again.

My fianc and I came to the new Egg Harbor Cafe location in Schaumburg for Sunday breakfast. The service & food was great! We have been to he old location and can honestly say the service & food was better at this new location. The food was made exactly how we requested it. The staff is friendly and the place is clean. Highly recommend & will definitely return.
Great food amazing fast service, impressed us very much. I will recommend to anyone.  Eggs benedicts and blue berry pancakes are my recommendation:)
I've only been to Egg Harbor Cafe once, but that is all it took to win me over. This place has a great atmosphere, friendly service, and great food to choose from. I will definitely be going back.
Today was my 2nd time going. Love the food and service. Wait wasn't as bad as I thought being Mother's Day. Waitress was super nice and patient. She was attentive and fast. We will be going back.
The food here is great we will being eating here once a week for now on. Words can not express how good the service is here. If you get a chance to eat here do it you won't regret it.

This place is great. We ate breakfast here while on a trip and they have am extensive gluten free menu. The restaurant was packed but the staff was very friendly and very efficient. We were never waiting too long for anything and our waitress was very attentive.
You get what you pay for here!!! A little expensive but completely worth it. It's clean, the employees are super friendly and the food is delicious!
such a cute place!! cozy environment and delicious food.
Amazing food, ambience and staff. Loved everything about it. Would visit again and again

My daughter and I ate here for the first time on Thursday for breakfast.  The food was fabulous and I liked the fact that you could choose a smaller portion.  The portion was the perfect size leaving you satisfied and not stuffed.  Looking forward to returning and trying the lunch menu!

The prices are a bit high for the ambiance but I do have to say that food is best for breakfast (atleast in schaumburg) the service is nice and super friendly I haven't seen one Person that works here that does not have a. Smile on his face. The eggs Benedictine were fab

I always get the Door County Melt and am never disappointed! Breakfast is great, too. Great service, nice atmosphere. I've been to this one once and the one in Arlington heights a dozen times. That's my go-to place when I have out-of-town company as the menu offers a nice variety, so everyone can find something they like. The Arlington Hts one closes at 2-not sure about the Schaumburg one- and we often find ourselves finishing up while they are cleaning around us, so I guess it would be nice if they were open til 3.

I was so excited to see an Egg Harbor open up in Schaumburg instead of driving all the way to Elmhurst! Great service and great food and the service was excellent. Can be quite a wait during the breakfast/lunch rush!
Great food and quick service! Eggs were delicious. The only reason for one star less than 5 is lack of healthier food options.
A little pricey for breakfast,  but the service is outstanding and the food is great. Good portion sizes- not overwhelming but filling.

Excellent brunch cafe! My colleague and I were traveling for work and found this place on Yelp with a great rating.  From the moment we walked in, it lives up to the high rating. We were greeted with a warm welcoming smile and say immediately. The wait staff was so pleasant and gave us the custom breakfast we were looking for. The food was fresh and delicious. The service was high class, the food tasted great and the restaurant was clean and welcoming. I would HIGHLY recommend this brunch cafe!
Went here yesterday morning and it was fabulous! Great service, food and best of all, NO WAIT to be seated. Super excited about this location opening!

Wife said the crab legs were really good.  The rest of the food was average.  On crab night the bill was 75.oo.  price a bit high if you don't eat the crab legs.  Great place for lunch or at a cheaper rate.

It is such a hit or miss buffet. At times it is great, lots of options and tons of food but unfortunately that is only the very busy times. 

If you come here during the week its almost not worth it. Hardly any food, choices or service. Or the food has been out on warming trays for so long its just like rubber. 

But on a busy night/ weekend? Tons of hot food, everyone in a good mood, crab legs galore and lots of choices. 

The stir fry was always my go to still. They make your to order, but they changed the beef and it is now mystery meat. Go with the chicken or scallops.

An ok small servings buffet.  If you go on seafood night or a holiday, expect to pay a lot and if you aren't going to be eating the seafood, don't go, it's a waste of money.

If it is a regular night, it might be ok, not sure since I went on a holiday.  If the food was the same minus the crab legs, I would say it's ok to go. If the food is totally different on a regular night I would say don't go.

I liked that they had some dim sum, the shrimp ones were great the first time I had them and super salty the second time.

There is Orange Juice next to the Coke Free Style Machine (The one that lets you mix and match coke products), it's a bit hard to see the label so look for it in a big black dispenser.

Pork Chops were so dry we couldn't cut it with a knife, even the steak knife we got didn't work. 

I did enjoy the risotto though, creamy and decently flavorful. 

The salad bar was a good thought in making exciting salads but poorly executed since they weren't that good and there aren't a lot of individual ingredients I could use to customize things.

The roast beef is pretty cooked, I prefer things pink or red so I didn't enjoy that much.

The deserts are ok.

They also have this 90 minute eating time limit but it took 15 minutes to seat us.  They ended up not enforcing it as far as i could tell since people that came before us stayed until about the time we left and we left like 30 minutes after the 90 minutes so maybe they only enforce it when they are busy or seeing you chow down on crab legs non stop? Not sure, but I don't like the pressure I felt with a clock ticking even if it's not enforced.

My first visit here, I am very disappointed. My family started eating and a few minutes in I noticed my breadstick was riddled in black mold! We told the cashier's which got us the manager after worrying about whose register was getting a voided transaction. The one stated "i always get the voids!" The manager acted like it has happened before and wasn't very sympathetic to our having found and eaten this food!!

The worst place I've ever been in friend of mine suggested to go there on the weekend for the seafood buffet I believe the buffet was one of the worst Buffet at my advice save your money go somewhere else don't even try it

Not worth the over $30 price. The best food was the expresso gelato and coconut gelato. The other desserts were good. 
The pork chop and chicken were dry. Not much variety. The food that was edible didn't have good flavor. The atmosphere was good around. Not impressed!

Waste of time and money. Service was horrible. Prices online did not match what we were charged and Shift Manager Pam was rude and could have cared less. She basically told me she would inform the IT Dept. and walked away. We ended up paying $29.99 for mediocre food. The brisket was rock hard and black (I have a picture) and the garlic bread sticks were so rock hard I took a video, the noise rivals that of a toddler on a drum set. Their 'Special', the prime rib, was no better than any other run of the mill buffet. The food selections in general were terrible for $30!! I should have known better when 90% of the seats were empty at 6:30 PM on a Saturday. Worst Dining experience of my life! Don't waste your time or money!!!
Very over priced compare with food quality, better go to the any Chinese Buffet restaurant.

It's all you can eat snow crab legs on Friday and Saturday night.  The crab legs were pretty good last night but sometimes they are salty and small.  The buffet consists of a variety of food.  Chinese food , Mexican food, sushi, pizza, Brazilian,  and more.  There is a lot of different desserts too.  Overall this place is pretty good it's around $30 a person but the only thing is any children over 2 years old is full price ( I deducted a star for that. ) If it was just rating for the food I would give it 4 stars.

I was coerced into going here for lunch - which was more like an early dinner.  I can tell you I will not be back.  Two items mislabeled- (i.e. something labeled avocado and egg actually had FISH in it). and nothing really stood out.  The Captn Crunch french toast didnt even taste like the worst regular french toast I had. 

Honest- the highlight of my meal was the ice cold milk.  I cannot tell you one thing I had that stood out as remarkable. Don't waste your time.

It's very good food but it's a very expensive buffet for the area.We are in Elgin not Vegas...We've eaten there only a few times but I liked the old buffet better.I wish they would change it back to the one that was there before.And that 90 minute thing makes you feel like a child that's not how you relax at a meal.They also sat two people next two us that we could pretty much touch elbows with at a long table.They were eating with no manners and talking so loud we had to yell to talk to each other.The seating is not the greatest.

Interesting place.  I decided to try it since I was here at Grand Victoria to see Huey Lewis & the News and Gin Blossoms concert.  I thought u can't go wrong with a buffet right??   Oh yes u can.  First of all dinner is served from 4-9pm, which is cool.  Waited in line for 15 mins.  Not bad for a Sunday.  The server thought I was part of the Mexican party ahead of me even though the receipt stated party of 2(???).  Another host asked her if she needed help, which I told her yes she did and the new host sat me & my partner.   The buffet was $20.99 per person and we were told we had 90 mins to eat.  I jokingly asked the host would they kick us out or will someone tell us.  She laughed.   ???????  I don't think anything was funny; I actually wanted to know.  The food selections were decent.  Some were bland or tasteless all together.  My suggestion would be to only use a spoonful serving to see if u actually like the item.  One of the pastas in a bowl taste like watered down Alfredo sauce.  The fried chicken was tasteless, u do better going to your local grocery store's hot kitchen section.  The bus boys asked me 11 times in 90 mins is everything ok.  What the hell could not be ok??  U are given me 90 to get my food, sit down, chew, swallow whole pieces of food so I won't be embarrassed when u tell me time's up, get your butt out of here.  In summary, I won't be back even if I get the free buffet coupon.

I've been there several times. It's a pretty good buffet (the wait staff is great) although it has a few problems:

- the plates they put out are right from the dishwasher and are so hot you burn your hands on them when you hold them. 
- the plastic cups they use always look dirty. 
- they no longer provide paper napkins. 
- several dishes in the buffet each day are not marked. 
- their crab is often too salty. They don't prepare it consistently.
- the scallops aren't fresh.
They expect you to pay $32 per person with a 90 minute done in experience. What? That is unprofessional and it's obvious that all they care about is the money rather than the customer's experience.

Hmmmm 37$ for dinner... little too pricey.. friday with a long wait..a little too noisy.. the hostess that brought us to the table was great that she even consented to letting us choose our table.. now lets start..
Server-its a buffet but it take a long time to remove our used plates, that we had to use the other dirty table for it. He was kind enough to chat with the other table that speaks his language,but failed to dollow up on his other customers. 
Clam chowder was good.. soft clams not gritty..
Steamed crab legs-overcooked. I opted for the cold crab legs.
Short ribs-soft and sauce was flavorful.  
Brazilian steak-bland.
Sushi-needs more choices and nori a bit more fresh please. It was already chewy.
For deserts. Loved the crepe but the parfait was disappointing.. and I had to eat it last and killed my loving the deserts.. 
Staff behind the lines were great!! Cleaning after messy customers asap, accomdating (except the lady that serves the steamed crabs, too busy talking to another staff).. one of the staff that was cleaning even pulled my chair, he was a gentleman. 
All in all, average... better to come here if you have the crab legs and lobster cravings so it will be worth the amount you paid for.

This casino is a continuous disappointment, take your money elsewhere.  So this review is about the buffet,

I get some comps from all the money I donate to the casino, they offer a buffet.  So I go to the buffet on my birthday for a lobster feast.  Its a long line at 6 30 so I go and offer the casino my money until 8 pm when I take a break for the buffet.  They have an employee standing there saying the line is closed???  Its an hour before closing, and I came there for a birthday feast.
  I went back in and grabbed my 200 back off the craps table-    This casino sux .

My family and I have gone to this particular buffet several times in the past and thoroughly enjoyed the food. Its been awhile and we went today. It was horrible. I found two strands of hair in the fried rice. The mashed potatoes were sour. Generally, the food was either bland or oversalted. The salad was even terrible. Wilted and old lettuce and spinach leaves.. etc.   This buffet used to be great and delicious, now it's a place to avoid eating at.

Not all of the items are quality, but go for the unlimited crab legs and stir fry.   

Food- First of all, most of the items here aren't very quality.  The thing that makes this place so great is the unlimited crab legs.  YUUUUMMMM!  Plus the stir fry station is just as good as big bowl and stir crazy and you can get it unlimited.  Usually when you go to a restaurant you get scallops and you get tiny shriveled up balls of mucus.  These are huge hardcore scallops for people who actually want to be full when their done eating.  They also have pretty much every soda drink you could think of, including my personal fav, gold peak iced tea.  

Service- Staff is nice and takes away finished plates frequently.

My family used to go to QVC's buffet for the crab legs back when I was in middle/high school. So I was interested in trying it out after the renovations & name-change. We got there on Friday, their seafood night ($29.99), but the line was extremely long, reaching the casino's front entrance doors. We left and returned on a Saturday, their prime rib night ($24.99). There was still a line maybe 30 people deep and we waited about 30-45 mins before being seated.

The food was lackluster. Nothing stood out. The lobster mac & cheese was overcooked and not cheesy. The desserts were pretty to look at, but bad in taste. The kahlua cake was stale. No reason to return.

Lunch (Mon-Sat) - $14.99
Sunday brunch - $19.99
Dinner (Sun-Thu) - $18.99
Seafood night (Fri) - $29.99
Prime rib night (Sat) - $24.99

My dad had 2 free dinner buffets coupons from Indulge. Waiting until the day it expires, he invited me to go. 

At first, I was skeptical. Let's face it, it's in a casino. Buffets are kind of gross. All you can eat is less appealing than ordering something from a menu. 

My dad was insistent we go early and apparently arriving at 4:10pm wasn't early enough. The line was relatively long but understandable. People eat like they haven't been fed for days. 

I started with the salad bar. It is standard, modest and fresh. My timing to grab crab legs was perfect. First in line while a new batch arrived. I stuck out 2 plates and the worker bee hesitated. Based upon her expression, she was disgusted with me. 

I was worried I wouldn't get my monies worth if I paid $30 for the same experience. It turns out, the amount of crab legs I indulged upon is far less expensive than dining out at any seafood restaurant. 

I told this to my boyfriend. Even though he's not a gambler and a hater for all buffets, he said my review makes it worth for him to pay the debt.

I've gone to this buffet about 5 times thanks to having free buffet passes.   

I will say that the presentation of the food looks great and I was able to find a few things I liked.   Best items for me were the mashed potatoes and the crusted chicken.   Oddly enough my favorite food item there were the cookies.   For me they tasted extra fresh.

Unfortunately since their reopening I feel like their food quality has gone down.   My last two visits in particular was disappointing.   The prime rib tasted rubbery, rice overcooked.    To top it off on my last visit there were a bunch of fruit flies buzzing all over the desserts.    Total turn off.

I don't see myself coming back even with the free passes.   Will go to Prime Burger instead.
Not nearly as good as buffets in Vegas. Just think Golden Corral with fancy plating and fancy seasonings. The food is okay but the price is not. Never have I felt like I have gotten my money's worth.

Bring back the old buffet!  Much better than Indulge Buffet, with in my opinion is close to having nothing to eat.  The beef at the carving station is ALWAYS grizzly and very tuff to chew. Salad station is minimal at best now, like I said have to actually look for something to eat. Not worth the cost.
The "scallops" in the stir fry tasted off, the texture was funny. I'm pretty sure those were fish balls (ground up fish mixed with flour/seasoning) and not actual scallops!

Definitely enjoyed my first experience at Indulge Buffet. The place was quite crowded on a Saturday night, but they had more than enough food and options for everyone. The big hit of course was the crab legs, but they also had good pizza, salads, fruit, and a variety of other delicious meats and sides. Beverages are served from the Coke machines that allow you to have many choices, and the staff was very friendly and kind. My favorite part of the entire experience personally was all of the desserts, my least favorite was the price- $75 for two of us, and I definitely can't eat that much food to get my money worth.
90 minutes to eat is ridiculous, especially if I'm paying so much already. It's just rude to ask customers to hurry themselves while eating. They don't care about the customers experience at all.

I lose my mind here.  I love the variety.  My favorites are the cappuccino machine (best cappuccino I have EVER tasted) and the freshly baked cookies.  The almond cookies were sooooo good.  I loved my orzo pasta with mushrooms.  The taco bar.  The yummy gravy with peppercorns for the mashed potatoes.  Pure mmmmmmm!

I left my review for this place under the casino and the older listing for their former buffet. I just saw this listing opened up here.

Pro: Dcor is nice

Con: Terrible food 
         Cheap poor quality food made to look pretty

I actually paid to go there. Most people are free diners from casino points.
Even for free food most people left after the first plate with full plates.

1) Desserts stale and over sweetened

2) Brazilian station: Over salted poor quality meat

3) Chinese Station: bitter cheap vegetables cooked to  your spec in a stir fry.
    They use the low grade rice that even the cheapest of the Chinese restaurants won't use.

4) Mediterranean and Italian: I don't know where to start but Salad in a glass? I could just imagine a senior or a child breaking one of these.

Pizza: was fair, maybe the only thing you can eat here.

All meats and chicken very poor  quality.

Maybe if you are drunk and like bad seafood this will work for you. More of the seafood lovers come out on a Friday and hoard up all the smelly crab legs and foul smelling fish.

I say if you are going to eat there and you really want to eat your whole meal, its probably better to dine at the Prime Burger place.

I haven't tried the steakhouse yet, but, I'm hesitant.

Its all poor quality cheap food. They could have saved the money on the dcor and bought better quality food.

It's not the food preparers fault when they don't give them much to work with,

Took an out of town friend to do a little gambling and then a bite to eat. The two stars are for the dcor and cleanliness only. I couldn't give any for the food. Golden Corral (only been there once) has better quality and tasting food than this place. Just terrible.

I really want to like this place and I will try it again, hoping to give it another star or two...but I'm suspicious. I recall the previous version of this place, which slowly got crusty around the edges. Not just the decor, but also the food started out good, but over the years got tired and vaguely industrial.

This new version was pretty decent the first two times I went, although the service was really spotty. Staff was newish so could be forgiven for having trouble collecting plates and renewing silverware.

But tonight....well, everything was slightly tired, old and crusted over. And the place was damn near empty, so it wasn't an issue of too many people. It was just a slow night. So food sat out longer which means, INDULGE...you have a MANAGEMENT PROBLEM. Whoever is pacing the kitchen and presentation of food needs a talking to. If you're not careful, this place will go straight back to nasty food for a captive audience in a casino pavilion. And that would be a shame. They're capable of more.

So on to tonight's problems. Brisket very over cooked, or nearly raw. Nothing in between burnt and bleeding. BBQ sauce sour...like it has been spoiled a bit, or maybe way too much vinegar. But not nice. Ribs...cooked ok, maybe overdone a bit, but not too bad....but drenched in that same sour tasting sauce. Sweet or spicy sauce would be ok. But very sour tastes at a buffet make you worry that you're eating spoiled food. 

Sopes (a mexican delight) had been sitting out long enough to get hard and pasty, not even warm. The salsas changed colors when I stirred them which means no one is attending to them to keep them fresh. Very dingy till you stir in the crust and freshen. Ick. 

Fried chicken not back but a bit dry. Ok, that's hard to avoid, but the best way would be to fill the pans a little at a time, pacing the kitchen, rather than filling it to the gills for a crowd that is not there and then letting it sit there and dry out. Steaks...about the same quality as Golden Corral. Meh. Be ready to chew. A lot. The Brazlian Steakhouse bits and pieces were burned, the station was unmanned and was very unappetizing tonight.

On the plus side the lobster mac and cheese was fresh and had big hunks of lobster in it. Better than I expected!

Desserts...chocolate mousse was dingy and had oxidized a skin like coating over it. Chocolate cheesecake tasted like cardboard. On the plus side, the gelato was really nice, presented well, but it's hard to ruin ice cream.

Indulge...please for the love of all that is holy, get your management act in order and make this place a destination worth of lines. I'll try again and attempt to give you more stars. We in Elgin really need you to do this right. BE the only not-crusty Buffet in our food wasteland. Live up to your potential. 

Please. 

We're rooting for you. But if you bring the same careless management style to this new decor, you're just trying to put lipstick on a pig. And that won't fly.

The buffet in this place is not worth the price. They do have a varied selection of food, but nothing that is special. Deserts are OK. Always busy for crab legs Fri and Sat. I do not eat seafood so that does not matter to me. Glasses are clean but spotty for beverages. This really does not appeal to me for the sense that there are much better buffets that can serve 2 for the price of this one. I do like that they have 80's music on during dinnertime. But actually enjoyed the lunch menu better. But a lot of the same stuff is listed for both. Stop in if you get it for free. If you pay full price , I guarantee you, you will be disappointed

I was so looking forward to this reopening.
I was very disappointed with the food. Every thing looks very nice, however the food in some cases was cold when it should have been hot. They also had some old food that they where trying to push before they put out new stuff. I used to go a lot for the crab legs. I can honestly say I will not be back what a waste of a very pretty place.
Excellent quality of food!  Very clean, awesome customer service.  They have the best fountain soda machine!  A must stop when in town!

Everything looked straight out of the school cafeteria, cooks didn't speak English, hard to navigate the day old stuff,

Decent salads, though.
What can you say a 5 star buffet.went on seafood night great .over 30 doller on that night. Can get a lunch for 15.more a special  occasion  place  not cheap . Food is great will be back.

I had heard the food here was good and when a friend asked me to meet him here for dinner I was excited. He had prepaid to were were able to basically walk right in but had he not the line was long. We were seated quickly and then ventured out to to find something to eat. I am a rather picky eater but there was enough here that I was able to find things to eat. They do have the coke experience machine which was cool to try different coke products. Most of the food was so so but the twicw baked potato was awesome. I would go back for that. The buffet is very very loud so do not plan on hearing anything the person you are dining with has to say. I was surprised but the large amount of children at the casino buffet.
Not enough drink stations and bus ladies made me feel rushed to turn the table. Meat needs to be more rare. Thousand Island was good. Decor was pretty. Crab legs were being consumed everywhere!!

They have decent food and desserts. 

But, if you're not a Gold or Silver club member, be prepared to wait 2 hrs for the seafood buffet because the high rollers get "preferred seating". That means that you will stand there watching the high rollers get seated while the management tells you they are full. They won't care if you give up and leave the line because the high rollers spend way more money than your meal costs. The manager tonight actually said that to the lady complaining to him tonight. Apparently a couple large high roller groups came in and us nobodies were standing there just waiting for them to be seated. In the meantime, they sat the other high rollers that came up. The lady and her husband complained to the girl at the register who called the manager. The manager came up and approved them to seat some of us in the other line while they waited to be able to sit the large groups. The lady suggested that they alternate the two lines. The manager told her that wasn't going to happen because they had preferred seating and came very close to saying that the rest of us didn't matter. If I hasn't been waiting an hour, I would have walked out. They sat the couple and their little girl who had apparently been at the head of the line for 30 minutes waiting for a seat. Once they were seated, quite a few groups were seated. How long would we all have been standing there waiting if they hadn't said anything??

Went to Indulge with some friends for the Sunday night buffet. With it being a holiday weekend I was really expecting this buffet to be hopping it wasn't... The decor here is very nice. It has a nice trendy upscale feeling. When we entered I was really expecting Vegas style food because the decor was fab. The service however is my first point of complaint. At one point one of the people I was eating with actually got up and handed the dirty dishes to one of the many buss boys that were just standing around talking. We also used the table next to us for dirty plates because they rarely came around to take our dirty plates away. The place was pretty empty with plenty of people standing around there was no reason for this to happen. The food was very hit or miss. Many of the items on the buffet were old and you can tell they were sitting around for a long time (The cheddar cheese soup and New York strip steaks were two examples) . Other items were very good. I really enjoyed the Garlic breadstix and pizza. The cheese selection was also very good and they kept it stocked. I also really liked the shrimp risotto. The risotto was very cheesy and the shrimp were high quality. I enjoyed the Desserts however think they should give you a bigger scoop of the Gelatto. I went back a few times because the scoop was so small. They were however very good about giving multiple scoops on request. Will give another try hoping the problems we had were just a off night. Would easly be 4 or 5 stars if the food was fresh and the if  the dirty plates were taken away faster.

I took my family here for an Easter treat. I honestly think I have had better food at Golden Corral. All the meat or chicken I had was dry and overcooked. The prime rib didnt even have a hint of pink, same as their steaks. The chicken was decent, but no better thanKFC. The duck was plain disgusting. For the price of over $90 for 3, I couldnt be more disappointed. I had read about major upgrades to the food. Well, I didnt see it. The new decor was nice and the wait was appropriate. But we went for the food and wont be returning.

Pricey if you don't have a free buffet coupon. Nothing good to say about the food. Many items cold and crusty, Lots more too salty and over done.  Tough fried chicken, dried up and cold pizza, greasy fried fish and chips yuck.Desserts were pretty good but not outstanding. Went for lunch on a weekday at 11:45.

Simply put, GVC really out did themselves this time.  Walking in I was struck by how nice (and quirky) some of the decorations were.  The selection of foods is varied and amazing, a stir fry station, a brazilian steak house station, mexican station, an asian station and they even have a brick oven for the pizzas.  The deserts are also a huge improvment and are simply amazing.

I'm impressed Elgin! The Friday night  All-You-Can-Eat Seafood buffet was worth the HOUR long wait.  The food was a plenty and very tasty!! Much nicer ambiance then I ever expected! Beautiful decor. Took our teen-age kids and went as a family night and we were all left saying "great comments!"  Keep up the fantastic work!!

This was our first visit after the big remodel.  I have one word for the new dcor: hideous.  White vinyl padded walls, 60's style chairs, green strings hung as curtains...ugh!  Thank goodness I sat by the window so I had something pleasant to look at.  

As far as the food goes, I have never been so disappointed.  I literally could have gotten a better meal at the Old Country Buffet.  The food stations were novel and served things you won't normally see in a buffet.  However, the food was either under or over cooked and not warm.  A quarter of the spots were out of food and a lot of things were mislabeled or not labeled well.  The salad bar is a joke!  There were exactly three items you could put on your lettuce: cucumbers, eggs and anemic tomatoes.  All exaggeration aside, the number of salad dressings far exceeded the number of salad toppings.

Additionally, there's something wrong with the buffet line's setup; I had to wait so long in line just to get to the potatoes, that my meat had completely cooled off.  My husband had finished eating his entire plate before I even sat down with him.

Bottom line: one less place I'll be frequenting.
Great food for a bargain compared to many other buffets. I usually go on saturdays and they have a great selection with quality selections.

I've been here multiple times so this isn't a one time thing, but I remember when they first opened and hey, not going to lie, the food was pretty decent. Not great, but it's a buffet so quantity over quality, so I came here a couple more times and it got progressively worse, by like, a lot. Now, the food is stale, the meats are terrible, the sushi bar is pathetic, the desserts are overly sweet, and it's just bad. I only come here since I can eat here for free from the points, but I definitely wouldn't be here if I had to pay.

We thought we'd give the new buffet a try for lunch. Very happy with the changes in contrast to the old casino buffet. Food was varied and interesting. The new decor was indeed an improvement. We speculate it will have a cool look at night. The old buffet was approaching cafeteria style, this newly revamped buffet was a great deal for 32 bucks for 2 for luch & tastey. We are going back when in the mood for a buffet meal.

The new buffet is pretty t look at but the food is pretty tasteless, they make it look nice but bland, the only thing that is decent is the wok cooking that they make while you wait, it is OK. The desserts are horrible and most of the staff cant speak English so they are not helpful

We have been coming to the buffet for years and let me say since they remolded the food has steadily gone downhill, we went last night and the risotto with shrimp was lukewarm and extremely dried out. I asked if there was any fresh coming soon, the dour faced women said not till this whole pan is eaten... I asked for a manager, I figured for $30 you should enjoy the food. He did take care of it and it was quite tasty but come on QVC, step it up !

Looks are deceiving! First off I commend GVC for the absolutely gorgeous update in the decor of the buffet. However, with the long waits, cold food, limited food choices, and just awkwardness of the staff, Indulge is just not worth it anymore especially when you consider that they raised their prices.

I'm updating my review to a 4 star from a 2 star sole based upon the customer service. After seeing my less than satisfactory review- Red Robin corporate contacted me and make amends. Customer service like this is what it should be about! Good job

The food here is good, so if You want to order to go, that may not be a bad idea. 

The customer service here absolutely stinks. The hostesses have not been upfront on our last two visits. They are slow once they arrive. The servers are blah, almost put off at the idea of a table. They are super slow too, for drink orders, refills, first check back for food. It's bad. I blame the management. (For example the ledge next to us was covered in dust, gross, made us worry about the kitchen cleanliness if the front of the house was so dirty.) An unmotivated manager cannot lead hourly workers to greatness. Corporate should drop in for a visit and enforce some changes, because Red Robin does not have a bad product, just this location sucks at selling it.

I have been to this Red Robin many times and I have to say it has gotten worse each time we go. The turnover with the staff is incredible and I'm sure results in the awful customer service and terrible customer service because everyone is always in training mode. But this location isn't even doing the basics: getting orders correct, refills, making sure the food is served at correct temperature, or even checking on the table a few times while they are there. It's disappointing, because the food is actually good it's the staff that's terrible. 
I swore I would never go back to this location but my boyfriend and I received a gift card as a gift and it's the only location close to us- we hadn't been in months so I broke down and agreed to go because my boyfriend loves the chili con queso, and again it was more than disappointing and again, I am swearing off Red Robin. Thanks for us losing $40+ on a meal when it was awful and couldn't get the servers attention for the life of us to correct it. South Elgin Red Robin needs some serious help! On a positive I have been to other great Red Robin's- oswego being one- and it's a completely different experience. Which says a lot.

Just nope last night. For having to pay over $10 for a burger this should have been amazing and the only thing that was even close was the attitude of our server. 
This was the first time I'd ever been to a Red Robin, and I was given three choices of temperatures of meat and picked "pink with pink juice" (the most rare) as did my one friend. After waiting an inordinate amount of time on a Tuesday night, we received our obviously well done burgers. Again, for $10+ for a burger, I should be getting what I'm asking for here, especially at a burger place. When we told the server she was extremely apologetic and nice. As we were about to leave she asked if the manager had come around and we said no and she said he said he was going to and to hold on (I guess the slowness in the kitchen and his urgency matched that night). When he got around to talking to us he was condescending and dismissive, walking away mid sentence. I think he should take a page from the servers books of how to deal with customers- she acted more like a manager than he did. 
Even though he gave us a gift card ( Ohhh $5!!) I won't be back. Not worth that again.

Very slow service even though hardly any people were in the restaurant. My friend and I both ordered our burgers with veggie patties and they gave my friend a burger w bacon on it. Very awful. Go to a different location if you can.

Red Robin is my jam. I've been coming to this location for years-- with friends, on dates, work meetings, etc. and every time has been nothing but great!

It saddens me to see the staff here running around and being overworked. They are SO kind but run from thing to thing and are doing so many things at once-- cleaning tables, hosting, helping other tables, running food, cleaning. I don't know much about the management but it seems short staffed and that must be stressful for the loyal servers there. :/

To the reviews who complain about management or service -- these people work their butts off. If you don't understand the service industry and don't treat them with respect, you'll never be satisfied. To those reading those negative reviews - don't be deterred, it's a great restaurant!!! 

Love me some banzai burgers and sweet potato fries. I'll always choose you Red Robin.

Was so impressed with the manager Julie at this location. If I had my own restaurant I would put her in charge of it. She worked the room treating everyone like they were her family. I love the Arctic cod sandwich and the garlic fries are fantastic. I had them season it with Cajun seasoning though because it's a little bland if you don't. They also have some of the best onion rings around.
What a disappointment today.   I ordered the cod and it was cold and super salty.   Usually the service is good but today it wasn't.   I think the waiter was new.  He was nice just slow.

First asked the manager for a booth but received some lame excuse that servers were not assigned to the booths that were open. Really? I ordered the Nantucket entree for $14.99 - the way it was brought out to me was disappointing. A basket of fried fish with fries thrown around. The wait time to receive the food was just too long and they were not that busy. The food certainly was not worth the wait. Finally was asked if I wanted a refill on my coffee - when the gal brought the coffee she picked up the cup with her fingers all over where one would put their lips on to drink - probably no training on cleanliness at this location. Spent about $70.00 for a family of 4. Not a good dining experience. Will not be returning to this location.

I read other people's reviews about the South Elgin location and am really surprised by some people's comments. My family and I frequent this particular restaurant often and we have always had really great service. My daughter has multiple food allergies and the manager is always very accommodating to us and puts my mind at ease. Our wait staff is always pleasant and tends to us promptly. Our last experience was last week, we went for my daughter's bday. The girls made her feel so special giving her a balloon and singing to her.  We definitely will be going back again soon.

We were unsure of where to go and the perfect place appeared, Red Robin. I have had some good and some bad experiences over the years at this franchise, but this was the best I have ever had. Between the server, the food, and the manager nothing could compare. The waitress, Katie was sweet and accommodating for new parents. And we took advantage of the 2 for 15 dollar special, which was a good deal. Our pretzel bites apparently were overcooked of which we were so hungry that it eluded us. But the Manager came over and comped us because of it. It is hard in this day of age to get good customer service, but after this I will definitely be coming back with my family in the future. Whatever you are doing at this location keep on doing it!
Came here for dinner with some family members. The food was OK and the service was fine. It just seemed kind of pricey for a burger and fries that you can get anywhere.
Love this place! servers are always nice, atmosphere is very chill and never have complaints about the food! one of the best chain restaurants around here

Got in at 6:10, sat down right away.  Ordered drinks and appetizers.  When drinks came ordered the meals. Food did finally show up 45 minutes after ordering.  Boca burger overcooked and hard as a rock.  Other burger over well and ordered pink.  Fries cold. Substitute garlic fries horribly over seasoned.  Better choices these days . And $70 for dinner for two adults and two teens (with no adult beverages) so not worth it any longer.
Not for me. Over priced for an average burger. The few times I've been to one of their locations the service has been slow each time.
Fantastic salad and impeccable service. Britney did a brilliant job and the salad was more fresh than a new born baby right out of the womb.

The service was good but the prices are high enough that it should be good.Today I blew almost half my grocery bill on one meal with my family.My kids had macaroni and apples and we had burgers fries and onion rings and yes its stepped up a litle from McDonalds but with all the gourmet burger places opening and the fast food joints serving stepped up burgers and fries,I think you can get comprable for less these days.The other factor is that burgers,fries,macaroni,etc.. can all be fixed at home probably with better extras for alot cheaper at home,its not lobster .

Gross food, dirty restaurant and horrible service.  If you like those things go for it.  Table was dirty, server did not give us silverware, i had to ask for refiills of water, do I need to go on.  I won't talk about the disgusting bathrooms or how my burger tasted like chalk and my wife's mac and cheese with barely any cheese.  Oh and it was my daughter's birthday  mentioned it at the beginning of the meal so we could get her a sundae.  Guess what they forgot, a sundae.  I should of known better but I'm done with Red Robin.
Service was terribly slow. Food took 40 minutes, drink refills long after they were empty, and extra fries never arrived. More often than not there is a problem at this location.
Good vibe, food, and drinks! Love RR! Good servers, actually care and are friendly!
Terrible service! The waiter that we had said he would be back in five minutes took him like 20 to 25 minutes then said the same thing again smh never coming back here again!

Could not ask for a better night. Our family has a tradition when someone leaves town. If we goto RR they will return safe. My daughter is leaving for college tomorrow. I will say the service has been hit or miss. Tonight they hit it out of the park. Christine was awesome. Best service ever. She made the cook redo my egg so I had runny yoke. Whole family had a great knight.

I am updating my review as the Manager reached out to me to rectify the poor service.  It is clear that he cares about the service and wants to see his customers happy.  I understand that restaurants have their bad nights and mistakes happen (although a mistake on each meal ordered is kinda baffling).  We will continue to give Red Robin business since we have always been happy with the service and food at the Oswego location near our home.
I asked for a booth and the hostess told me no! The majority of the booths were available. I was not happy.
Meh.

If there's one word to describe my dining experience here this evening it would be disappointed. I love Red Robin. I have had many positive experiences here, this evening was definitely lacking.

What's normally a quick and attentive service was somewhat slow and more relaxed than pervious visits. Having been to this location several times, I have come to expect a cheerful, efficient server. Immediately I noticed that while he was friendly, that next level of personable service was missing. To his credit, tables with small kids he did well talking to them and making them feel welcome. He did an alright job, however, bottomless speckled lemonade was only refilled once (despite being emptied). I did notice he seemed to be the only waiter for what seemed like quite a few tables given it was dinner time on a weekend. And about our napkins: we literally had to ask him for individual napkins after the place setting ones were soiled. He mentioned corporate was really watching what they spent?? Not sure what to make of that. The food was alright in preparation. One very positive note: any of their fries are delicious! Garlic, steak and sweet potato all were really enjoyed!

Another mark on an otherwise pleasant experience was realizing that for all that non-service I received, I still had to pay. Overpriced I felt, given the level of service and mediocrity of the food we received. I don't know what happened this evening and I will gladly update this review and give it 1+ star (more hopefully) my next go around. For now Red Robin, you let me down and I hope this isn't what I should come to expect.

I am usually a fan of the Red Robin chain, but boy was this location unpleasant. I also rarely give out one stars, but this place was a road bump throughout a day where we celebrated a birthday. 

Atmosphere:
Typical Red Robin decor. You have been to one, you have been to all of them. I actually really do enjoy their theme. Lots of knick knacks and interesting things to observe. My favorite was the George Costanza painting with him on the couch. Yes, the painting of George from that episode! One thing that really turned a few us off was that the tables were kind of stick and that the Silverware wasn't fully clean. Most of us were eating burgers, but Red Robin really needs to check their silverware before putting them out there. There was more than one set that wasn't fully clean. 


Food:
That particular Friday night wasn't super busy, but I felt that the food was below Red Robin standards. My friend ordered sweet potato fries and they were cold! Also one thing I look forward to every time I go to Red Robin is their Freckled Lemonade. I received Lemonade with barely any of the Strawberry flavored fusion that I craved. At least I got my burger made just right. Fry service was lackluster at this location. They give you smaller portions and sometimes they aren't fresh.

Service:
We did not expect to be at that particular location for almost 3 hours, but that is what ended up happening. We spent over an hour waiting for our food, and it took another 25 minutes to get our bill. We ended up missing our Thor 2 movie time because of the amount of time it took to get service. We had to wait another hour for the next showtime...  We asked for a round of fries to hold us over, but no fries came until our burgers came. This service continued on with lackluster beverage service. This was also the first Red Robin waitress I have had that wasn't friendly. The service wasted a lot of our time that could have been spent on celebrating the Birthday girl's night.

Red Robin has my respect when it comes to their chain. Just please save yourself some time and happiness by avoiding this location. I would have complained to the manager if it was my birthday that day.

Never had a problem with this Red Robin. Their food is consistently good, never feels like it was rushed to be made and is presented rather well.
We've never had a problem with service and all the servers have been friendly and knowledgeable.
My only complaint would be the occasional speed, or lack there of of the staff. This is likely more a staffing issue and not a server issue so I knocked off a star.
As far as chains go, this is a good bet.

Red robin is normally a very good place to eat casually.  Usually good food and service.  This is the second time that we have been to this location where it takes a long time to get our food and the place seems to be understaffed.  To be sure, the staff is good and the food is good when you finally get it.  You even see staff running in order to get their job done.

We didn't see any bus persons last night and the waiters were bussing tables.  It appeared that 20% of the tables were unoccupied because they didn't have enough staff to serve.

We will probably not go back to the South Elgin location any more because it seems like a train reck.   There are nice people there who seem to work hard.  Come on Red Robin, hire some more staff so they can do their jobs.
It's a chain, therefore, expectations are low.  Food is standard but service is hit or miss....most of the time being a miss.  I prefer the Algonquin Location.

I hate this location. Asked for a booth and was sent to a table. The restaurant was half empty! After waiting at a table for 15 minutes nobody had even come to our table to say hello. Staff was busy talking amongst themselves. Even the manager walked by and I ignored my wife and I. We walked out without even a word from the staff. Will never return.

Everyone,

My own imposed rules for any Chain Restaurant review:

1. Must visit at least three times.  Two of which must be distinctly different formats; i.e. one weekday night and one weekend night.
2. Since the food should be the same everywhere, with the exception of regional items, the food category will only be judged on the quality of the expected food (i.e. temperature, consistency, and amount).
3. Ratings are based on a 10 point scale with 5 being average, which does not mean bad.  What a score of 5 means is that the category meets expectations for that establishments format. 

Thanks.

Red Robin - South Elgin

Location/Layout - 6/10:  Red Robin can be found on Randall Rd in South Elgin, directly in front of the Home Depot.  Parking is ample and shared with adjacent businesses.  The interior has the standard Red Robin motif, which borders on kid friendly with giant robin statues and arcade games but also incorporates the standard chain restaurant flair design.  The interior is very spacious and offers several different seating styles including two seat booths, high and low tables, and booth/table combos.  The eating area is typically neatly kept but will occasionally have balloons floating around.  The bar area is knee walled off from the main dining room and offers a respite for those looking to get a break from all the kids running around, while giving greater access to the televised events.  As noted, there are TVs throughout, with the majority (still only 4) found in the bar area.  Unfortunately, they are between 19 and 22 inches and unless you are directly under one of the TVs they are almost useless at that size.  Although, they still offer the TV in the floor in the waiting area, which is a very cool touch, but the Plexiglas is starting to get hazed and scratched making it hard to view the image.  .         

Service - 5/10: Service is varied and fairly solid.  The only issue is that while all the servers are very attentive when taking your order and immediately after the food is served there are dead times between placing the order and having the food delivered or after your food has been verified alright where you end up on an island with no assistance.  I would like to see check ins because the food does take some time to be delivered and there are needs such as refills and questions about bar drinks or dessert that get missed for quite some time.    

Food - 6/10: By definition the offerings are upscale burgers and American fare, after all they refer to themselves as Red Robin "Gourmet " Burgers.  The food at this location is usually hot and usually very freshly prepared.  Because our groups orders vary we have noticed temperature issues, presumably because one order is waiting while the other is being finished.  Also, we have had a lot of occasions where something was incorrect or missing from our food.  The issue is always fixed once we are able to get the attention of our server.  The menu focuses on burgers mainly with a nice selection of other sandwiches and a hand full of apps, salads, and entrees.  In general this is more upscale quick service and is prepared on demand with unique toppings and variations.  The burgers and sandwiches are served in plastic boats with a liner and wrapped in the same liner.  This presentation does not live up to the "gourmet" theme and the wrappers always seem to disintegrate or melt with all the fat and juices that come off the sandwiches and fries.  A note about the fries, they are steak cut and seasoned with their house seasoning but more importantly for fry lovers, they are endless.  You can also choose from a short list of other options instead of fries for those that prefer a change.  Menu pricing overall is slightly high on average for burgers and entrees.  On the other hand, the apps and desserts can be very costly especially for the amount of food; although, they do have weekday deals on apps which are very reasonable.  Lastly, they do have a full bar with liquor and a fairly solid list of beer options.  Pricing on drinks are good and they always have a unique twist on a dessert drink, like a Guinness milk shake that are worth trying.  

Overall Experience - 6/10:  Red Robin is always a very solid option for a good burger or sandwich.  We always seem to find our way there during a shopping excursion because they usually deliver a tasty meal and good price, in a friendly clean environment.

This restaurant is a joke. I've been there a lot mainly just to visit the few good people there. Most of the staff is flustered and undertrained. The management there is nowhere to be found when needed and ticket times average between 18-30min when they are supposed to be 7-10min. Most of the bartenders are kind and prompt. 

The other thing that gets me about this red robin is I've sat at the bar and looked around the restaurant and seen tables stay dirty for over an hour after people leave. How sanitary can that be.... Meanwhile I see a guy sitting at a table in a button up on his phone (assuming its the "manager"). Why not help you staff so this place doesn't seem like a zoo. 

There are many places around here to get some good food with great service. Here you only have a slight chance of getting that here.

Not happy with the service at all. The last 3 times we have been there the service was BAD!! Some of the bad things are.....no greeting when we walk in. Waiting to be seated cause no one acknowledges us at the door. Then there is the slow service and the lack of refills on drinks. Management really needs to step up their game. I love Red Robin. The garlic fries are sooooo good!!

I really love their Caesar wraps! That is the only entree I order so I cannot comment on the burgers. I have to say that they are great at service when it is not too busy. When the restaurant is full, I feel that there should be more servers to help out. We do have to wait quite a bit for our server to come back to the table. I still give this restaurant 4 stars though because those wraps are the bomb and when the restaurant is not packed, we do get great service!

As good as Red Robin gets. The river whiskey burger is the best thing to eat here. The unlimited fries is hard to get sometimes, though they advertise "endless fries." A second helping can means big basket of fries or five fries and you could get it with your check. Please be careful with the bathroom doors. They are a finger pincher, because they are not aligned correctly.
Everything besides the burgers are just processed crap and even the burgers aren't that good

After my last experience at this particular restaurant I will probably never go back. It started with no service and cold food when I took my wife out to dinner. After my complaint to the manager they said they would send me a gift card and asked how much my bill was when my gift card finally arrived I took my wife out to dinner again. To my surprise I found out the gift card was for only $10 it was a slap in my face. If I'd known that it was only $10 I would've gave it away to some other sucker.

Food was really good, they forgot a couple extras that we ordered with our meal. But all in all, good food and atmosphere. The kids had the bottomless root beer floats that we're really good and the waitress kept them coming at a steady pace without having to ask for a refill.
I do have to comment on the waitress, her name was Shandra, I think, she was so great, soooo nice and it seems like she knew us personally. She made the whole time we were there enjoyable and comfortable.
We will return.

The service here at this location was extremely slow. Everything- SLOW. The food was okay at best, but the server we had took approximately 20-25 minutes in between tables to ask us how we were doing. It took us 25 minutes to get our check AND get it run.

If one word could sum up our Red Robin experience, it would be disappointing. My family and I went a little after a typical evening crowd at 7:30pm. The only seating options were along the walls or windows of the restaurant. The main seating area in the middle was completely unoccupied. Our server was not as attentive as she could've been, slow on taking drink order. We thought we would rush things up by placing our app and food order at the same time along with the drinks. Chips and salsa never made it out, and we were never charged. Must've been forgotten, even after it was written down. Kid chicken fingers and broccoli tops were the child's dish... wow, two broccoli tops. Seriously? Simple chicken sandwich... so lackluster, did not even come with any sort of dressing, which made the sandwich a bit dry. Peppercorn burger was the last dish, and it was lacking in something as well, as my husband did not even finish it. The fries were decent. The server came back and asked if we wanted a refill on the fries and the broccoli. I expected the question about the fries, but the broccoli? The whole lackluster experience, will be the last time we visit this chain restaurant.

Looking for a good burger?  Look elsewhere.  Five Guys is waaaay better.  Portillo's burgers are better.  Burger King is better for Pete's sake!  To be known for one thing and not be good at it leaves me to wonder how this chain is so popular - the power of marketing, I suppose.

What happened to this place?  This place use to have huge, tasty burgers and now its a haven for small kids.  The atmosphere is similar to being at a circus.  The food is pricey, tasteless and small.  Why would I go back to this place when I can spend my money on a good meal somewhere else?

I have tried this restaurant before and it was mediocre at best. We arrived later in the evening two hours before close.

Staff - friendly, but not on the ball. They were too interested in leaving to care much about the customers. The male servers were too busy flirting with the female servers.

Food - The should remove "Gourmet" from the Gourmet Burgers. They are definitely not gourmet according to the standard definition. We both ordered medium well. Mine didn't come with the toppings I ordered. My wife's was half cooked. There were parts of raw meat in her burger. She ended up throwing most of her burger a way. The fries were overcooked, cold, and over seasoned.

Price - Not very competitive. I could go a few blocks down the road to a very nice Mexican restaurant and get an elaborate, high quality meal for the same price.

We left unsatisfied and the server didn't even offer us money off the bill for my wife's half finished burger. We will emphatically not be returning to this restaurant ever again! Red Robin needs to read this review as they have a lot of work to do in order to keep from going out of business! I finally figured out why they would sell alcohol in a restaurant like this... to help you forget about the horrible food!

Overall the place is pretty good, nice and clean, somewhat friendly staff, (service was a little slow) however my biggest grip has to be there pricing, way overpriced food, for the quality you get. Close to 30 dollars for burgers, fries and sodas for 2 is a little high.
omg the food is great the portions are big a bit pricey but i love the tower of onion rings great menu if you want a big bad ass burger go here yum yum yum i cant say enough about this place

Note -- this is 420 Randall Rd, not 20 Randall Rd -- couldn't change it after entering it...

Just like Chili's only bigger, menu is more limited. Great for kids, groups. We didn't have the burgers, so I can't really comment on whether they're actually "gourmet", but I will say the buffalo chicken tenders are definitely NOT gourmet. All in all, totally adequate, especially for kids.
Went during the middle of the day on a week day when it wasn't busy or full of screaming kids. The service and good and the food was better.

This place has good food (I love the fires and the Caesar wrap) and I give 4 stars just for that! Another good things is that we usually do not have to wait to be seated at this location. One negative that I have is that the staff does need to be trained a bit more. The last time my husband and I ate here, the waitress did forget to put part of my order in and was no where to be found when we needed her for extra drinks and then later the check. She did however apologize for not putting in part of the order on time and was honest enough to say that she had forgotten to do so. We like honesty here so its no biggie, just wish they would step it up on that department.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin in quite a while, and turns out... pretty much the same. Boring.

Mom and I were there for lunch, and while I get that most people want to be rushed during lunch in order to get back to the office or what have you, the quantity of strollers and minivans told me that it was a more leisurely crowd we were witnessing. The service however, was all about turnover.

The pre-burger salad I ordered arrived *with* the food. The veggie burger is no longer a big fat easily-mistaken-for-meat Boca, it's now a small, boring Gardenburger. My drink however, didn't arrive when my mom's did, but rather with the rest of the food - and without an apology.

$10 for a dinner salad, $9 for a burger... too much for where they are. Corporate or not. I'm not a fan. And no, I don't want a balloon.

Good, solid burgers with lots of topping choices. Endless steak fries are very good. They have the tastiest chicken tortilla soup I've ever had. They found it was my brother's first time there and the manager came over and introduced herself and gave him a complimentary bottle of signature blend seasoning - what a nice touch. The staff is always super friendly and the place is super kid friendly but still good for adult only groups.

I've already been here a couple of times and I like their burgers.  Though they do seem a bit overpriced for burgers but they do what they do well.  Great for kids or adults that act like kids and just want to stuff their face with a burger that has entirely too many things stuffed inside of it.  Remember, the more animals the better!

Bottomless steak fries, pretty fast service and little kids throwing their crayons all over, who could beat that?
I agree with other reviewers .... good burgers and shakes but a bit pricey for what they are.  I have to say the burgers and their fries are good.  Service was ok ... all in all not bad.

We frequently order food from Red Robin for our company meetings and the staff, Melisa & manager Greg, always make sure our orders are correct and ready to pick up on time.  I am always a little nervous about how it will turn out, but the orders are always double checked and accurate. Specific orders are never a problem. Everyone is satisfied with their food orders back at the office. They gave us extra fries and plenty of tableware & condiments.  The ordering and pick up process is very easy. They make me look good!

well.... I went once.  I should have known the burger chain wasn't a great idea.  I'm all for crazy toppings on a burger, but it's all for nothing if the meat has no taste.  Also, the never ending fries???  I guess you have to chase down and tackle someone to receive that deal, cause it never was made available to me.  I'll never go back. Plenty of other joints to get a good burger.

I felt like I was in my grandma's kitchen. That being said, the food is made fresh we waited about 10 minutes for enchiladas de queso topped with fresh veggies and cheese, two tacos de rajas, and a torta de milanesa de pollo. 

Everything was very well made and served with pickled peppers and carrots. Two salsas were available both the green and red salsa were great. However, they also served a salsa with the chips that had pieces of roasted poblano peppers. Tasted amazing. 

Seating was a bit limited on a Saturday afternoon only because the place was packed with people. Definitely heading back if I'm ever in town.

Honest review: bad michael jackson bad lol taco bell places like these gives real mexican food a bad name. 
First off its dirty not like a dump where theres trash on it but u know what i mean like when u walk into a place like wtf is this. The service was bad sometimes if u speak english in a mexican restaurant they give u bad service they treat u different and they might talk bad about u in spanish but im mexican so i just laugh. I was there so i saw how they prepared it everything was premade so they just took it out of a bucket ,already cooked, put it in the Microwave to warm it up then just put it on the grill for a second.
