These are all great things about the restaurant. If not for the waiting, this would definitely have 5 stars.

I have a suggestion about the name of the restaurant; it seems like the name of the restaurant should be changed to "Wine & Waiting". Because, that is what we did for over an hour. The business of not having reservations is ridiculous. Especially when you have "call aheads" and "walk ins" and "names on lists" and they're all different, but really they're all the same.

We called ahead at about 6:30 pm and were told that we would be seated at 7:30 pm. Ok. That's fine. We were about 30 minutes away at that time and could figure out what to do with an extra 30 minutes. We arrived around 7:05, maybe 7:10 and were told that it was going to be 15-20 minutes "but probably less" past our "call ahead time". So...7:45 pm to 7:50 pm at the latest. Judging by the amazing pasta last time, I figured we could wait. Turns out there were 3 other groups of 2-3 that were waiting for that time as well. And there were people that were just "walk ins" that were seated before us. Everyone that was a "walk in" was told 45 minutes to an hour "but probably less". Turns out way less, if you have certain circumstances. 

Circumstances I saw that will get you in faster:
1. Have a baby with you. Complain multiple times that the baby can't wait til 8:30 to eat, even though you waited until 7:45 to show up for dinner at a restaurant. You will be seated in 10 minutes.

2. Ask if "so & so" is working. If not, ask if someone else is working. Come up with common names like "Anthony" or "Michael". Turns out they both work there. You will be seated in 10-15 minutes and will have champagne waiting at your table.

3. Tell them it is your anniversary. You will be seated in 10-15 minutes.

***FYI, "It's my birthday" doesn't work. Don't try that one. Even if it is your birthday.

We were finally seated around 8:05 pm. We were greeted by our waitress and she said she would be right out with water. I tried ordering wine before she ran off, but was unsuccessful. Ten minutes later, she came back with water. Does it really take that much time to get water? I feel like they need to hire someone that specifically does water refills. You get a large glass bottle of water, so you won't run out anytime soon (for 2 people). Putting water down should be part of "setting the table". She came back, asked for our drink orders, then ran off. It seems like they do have some wait staff that brings out the wine and food, so I'm pretty sure they could handle the water as well. 

Our pizza bread and food was brought out pretty quickly. They were consumed quickly. Halfway through my meal, the waitress asked if the guys who had brought the food had offered parmesan "nope". She then proceeded to pour it all over my dish (what was left of it), even after I said stop. Meh. More cheese, I guess..I'm not really complaining about that one. We didn't get dessert, because we were both stuffed. Even though the waitress basically told us about every single dish and was like "are you sure" "are you sure" "are you sure" "take one home for later" "No really, take one home". No thanks, we don't want one. (But seriously, the nutella calzone from the previous time was awesome as were the donuts).

It seems like maybe they weren't prepared for a busy night. Our waitress explained that on chillier nights, they get more people. I get it...it's cold and you want to stuff your face with pasta. Understandable. But prepare for it and hire more staff!

Also, it's very LOUD. We nearly had to shout to hear each other. 

Maybe this is just a one time experience (though it was our second time). The first time was great. The waiting is not acceptable. Allowing others to go ahead because of certain circumstances is not acceptable. Maybe if I were on the receiving end of the gold standard service, I would feel different. I really, really wanted to like this restaurant since I have been basically dreaming about the pasta since we last came here about a month ago. Maybe we will try again at 11 am on a Tuesday for a shorter wait and a quieter restaurant.

First timer and we weren't disappointed.  The ambiance was rowdy and fun.  The acoustics did lend itself to being overly loud at times.  The staff were  friendly and the service prompt.  The blackened shrimp and grits took me back to the south and they were grand!  The salmon was tasty, but not the taste bud joy of the shrimp.  My friend was a little disappointed in her rigatoni saying it was bland as well.  All in all, food experience.
Food and service were excellent. We had small plates, the grilled romaine salad, pizza and pasta. All was very, very good. Highly recommend.

It can be hard to get excited about restaurants in the area, but this is a new exception to the rule for me.  This was our first visit and we went in past 8 on a Thursday and got the only open table-so apparently I was the only person who wasn't in on the secret.  Our server Valerie was so friendly upbeat and helpful with the menu.  The cheapest Pinot on the menu was absolutely delicious, they had a pretty solid draft beer menu and also long list of bottles and cans-many from local brew houses.  

The menu wasn't huge but I still couldn't narrow it down.  We ordered Pepper Shrimp, Stuffed Gnocchi, and the Arugula and Pancetta Pizza.   The small plates were delicious and the wood fired pizza was good combo of crispy and chewy.  A bit of char, the Pancetta was crisp and the arugula and cheese were fresh.  I think I may have licked the plate clean from the Shrimp.  Absolutely delicious.  

Prices were actually very reasonable for the quality.  And it looks that as long as your kids are somewhat civilized, they have a great kids menu,and WiFi to keep them distracted while you order that second glass.  Very cozy upscale appearance, great food, and no pretension.  Cant wait to go back.

Came her for my daughters graduation. As usual they did not disappoint. Heidi was our waitress and she was amazing. Paced our meal and was friendly. The food was delicious as usual. The cod was tender and flakey. The medallions were tender and tasty. The chicken capris was out of this world. The salad were fresh and well dressed. The small plate had nothing but heartache because we couldn't decide. We chose the pork belly, arranchi, and gnocchi and all were amazing!!! 
Seriously, this place is a gem. If you haven't been run!

We wanted to have a fantastic experience like most of the reviews but 
unfortunately that wasn't the case.
It was a Wednesday night about 6:30.
We called ahead to be put on the wait list as most reviewers suggested.
It was my wife and I.
There were 3 hostesses. 
I hope they are just new.
They acknowledged we called ahead and 
gave us a pager just like everyone else. We stood at the bar. Two minutes later they offered us a high top table. I explained that due to double knee replacement surgery my wife couldn't sit in the high chairs. The girl that seemed more in control then offered a table in the bar area that she described as 
"More private" it was also a high top table 
on the path to the kitchen and where all the servers picked up their drinks from the bar.
High top and not private.?
We went back to the bar and waited for 
a table at a normal height.
So much for calling ahead.

We like reisling  wine. They offered one reisling. Made our choice easier but come on! What's your restaurant's name?
 
Our pager went off!
No the table is  not ready, just checking to make sure a low table is ok- really? Now we're referring to the group of hostesses as the three stooges.

Yes ,we did finally get a table. Next to the screaming kids and family.

Our server arrived with the bottle of reisling 
we started in the bar area. Very good start.
Then he proceeded to give us a scripted 
5 minute tour of the wine list, beer list, nightly specials (read off a sheet in his guest check holder.) Didn't even acknowledge that we already had something to drink. 
The food was good.
We had 
Grilled lettuce
Ricotta and honey
Spicy shrimp
Spicy salami pizza

The tall tables haunted us. They ring the window area facing the street. Our booth view forced us to stare at people's legs and crotches.

We wouldn't go back. Too much negative.

Could not believe how crowded it was at 6:00pm on a Friday night.  I thought we were among the early diners. they said half an hour.... an hour later.... we finally got seated. the high top by the window is perfect, glad we escaped the booth, they look so tight.  there were four of us and we ordered shirmp with polenta, shrimp with angel hair pasta, mussels, sopressata pizza, so spicy, short rib ragu and pork belly.  yeah its a lot of food for four, but we ate it .  all was fantastic, I would order any one of them to eat by itself for dinner, except the pizza way to spicy.  I would like to go back and try other things on the menu, probably a weekday because the crowd and wait are the only turn offs.  
drinks were fantastic and they have a decent wine by the glass menu.  all in all a good experience. I would go back, and invite friends.

Fire + Wine gets a lot of attention in Glen Ellyn these days, and it's well deserved. We ordered quite a few things off their menu, and *every* single thing I tasted was the best of its kind.

We started off with the arancini (and a Vanilla Porter for me, which was quite good thank you very much). As far as we could tell it was half real risotto and real mozzarella on the inside, with two different elements of crunchiness on the outside; the batter, and a smattering of thin, crunchy onion rings. There were six in total, and they don't get any better than this.

Just as we got done with the arancini, our pizzas came out. My wife got the prosciutto pie, and all I really managed to eat of it was a piece of prosciutto (absolutely marvelous) and an olive (mellowed, but still very flavorful). I was torn between artichoke and pesto, and the bianco; on recommendation from the server, I picked the artichoke and pesto and was rewarded with pleasantly bitter arugula, buttery artichoke and fresh pesto.

In both cases the crust was perfect. Flavorful, soft on the inside but with the perfect amount of chew. Top quality fresh ingredients all around, too.

For dessert we decided to get a butterscotch budino, but were also given a panna cotta, and I didn't argue. The panna cotta was creamy and slightly tangy, melding well with a whole blackberry and sauce on top. The budino was out-of-this-world excellent; thick, creamy, rich. Save room for dessert here, folks.

I have no doubts that we'll be back here again, for the best pizza we've had since we came back from Naples.

Went here on Valentine's Day. Everything was great from the waitress's knowledge of the menu and wine, the size/taste of the pizzas, the quality of service, and gluten friendly menu. The restaurant had low lightening and soft music in the background. I saw people dressed up (like myself) or dressed very casual. Only warning is if you don't like sitting close to other parties, request seating ahead of time. I almost felt like I was on a date with the couple next to us ;)

Go! I highly recommend.

Overall OK. 
Wait: too long (90 min at 8 pm on a Sat night), 
ambiance: very good, though a bit too loud @ 9:30pm
Food: OK, portions: OK
Service: good
Drinks: pricey for small sizes  ($13 for 6 OZ of a mid-range wine)
In our case 2012 Cleaver which retails for $16 a bottle)
http://www.winetransit.com/the-cleaver-red-blend-2012-750-ml-40184.html?vfsku=40184&vfsku=40184&gpla=pla&gclid=CjwKEAiA_ra1BRDV-byb_aDqpQoSJAA-ofB9EVXyHPzyUrgc5csU905o-egj9lHbU7gvBvf3yXkAJxoCS-nw_wcB

We came all the way from Naperville but were a bit underwhelmed, though it looked like a local favorite with lots of friends enjoying a meal together (in groups of 6-8 people per table).  We didn't try any of their famous fire-oven pizzas but the eggplant lasagna was quite good.  We also didn't get to try their zucchinis fries, because we had already had some as a snack at the Jameson Irish Pub (across the street) while waiting for our names to be called.

This place is nice. Love the decor. Seated right away. Although it was not at peak hours. The food was yummy.  Had the Gnocchi, Bean dip, Pepper Shrimp, and Beef Medallions. The pita bread was a little Salty.  Our waiter, was interesting.  He didn't suggest anything. Being there for the first time, I would have liked to have heard some specials.  I asked if they had Sangria he said no. He suggested a drink with Cantaloupe, but he had no idea what it was called.  It was sooo good, although I don't care for vodka. Either way, I severely over tipped.  I'm a light weight.

A 4.75 star experience, which I don't feel bad about rounding up. 

Service was overly prompt and appropriately friendly. We came early in the day, so no dinner rush delays. Pizza and ricotta honeycomb out within about 5 minutes of ordering. We didn't know what to expect of it, other than the Yelpers had liked it.  And, sure enough, it was amazing.  We got a few more pieces of bread so that we could properly finish off all of the spread.  

Pizza was cooked all the way thru, but not very hot in the middle. Still amazing, but another 30 seconds in the oven would have made it absolutely perfect. 

We also split a bottle of red and an order of tiramisu for dessert.  Both were also great.

Pricing as good or better than expected for the quality (portions appropriately small- the two of us comfortably split everything). $80-ish for an app, pizza, dessert, and mid-range bottle of red. No complaints.

Our first time at Fire + Wine was this past weekend on sweetest day. All 4 of us were very excited to try this place out and were not disappointed. I see a lot of reviewers talk about the wait. (We used to live in the city so we are used to having to wait a bit for good food!) We called ahead and put down our name for the call ahead list (not reservations) for 8:15pm. We got there early checked in and headed to the irish pub across the street for drinks while we waited. We got a call about 15 mins after our call ahead time. Our server Jennifer was awesome, brought out samples of wine for us to taste before ordering, and gave us great recommendations. We ordered the crisp pork belly, the ricotta with honeycomb, mussells, black pepper shrimp (comes with polenta)  and the regina margherita pizza to split between 4 people. Everything was delicious and our favorite was the tender crisp pork belly. Great flavor. Everyone was very happy with their wine as well. They have an extensive list of craft beers for the non winos! This place is awesome for a date night or even a girls night! Music wasn't too loud and we could hear everyone at the table. We will be back!

We have eaten here no less than 3 dozen times. This is one of our favorite restaurants. The owners and staff are great people who truly enjoy what they do. They seem like one big happy family. 

Now to the food. The menu has a wide variety of items. Start with the house salad. Seriously one of the best I've ever had. The menu is filled with top notch dishes from top to bottom. Pizzas are unique always changing. They have dishes that range from octopus, scallops, pasta dishes, hangar steak, prosciutto plate, meatballs, and a killer calzone. Never had a bad dish and they are always prepared perfectly. 

Wine selection is awesome and wide ranging yet very reasonably priced. The bar tenders can always direct you to something good depending on your preferences. 

No matter what night of the weak you go, there is typically some wait to get seated. That is because it's that good. Great people, great food, make it Glen Ellyn's best Restaruant ...hands down.

Came here with a girlfriend when our husbands were doing their fantasy football draft- their loss! This place is great- cool atmosphere, amazing food, good wine list, and awesome staff (Heidi was our server- she's a lot of fun, knowledgable, and attentive.)

We ordered the black pepper shrimp with polenta, the Parma classic pizza, and the chocolate empanada for dessert. All were delicious!

We had such a fantastic time, so much so that I'm already back to try more!

Seriously I LOVE this place. Every time I come here I leave 110% satisfied. 

Have had a few different glasses of wine, cocktails as well as beers from their list. They try to keep it pretty local for the beers and have great choices to choose from when it comes to wine and liquor from the bar!

Everything I have eaten is great and full of flavor and taste! One of my favorite things on the menu is the Grilled Romaine Salad. It is big enough to share as an appetizer with a friend or two or even for yourself for a meal. One of the best things on the menu but I say that about everything! I love the Pastas, Pizzas and dishes as well. One of my go to's is the Salmon or even a vodka Pasta. Again you cant pick a bad thing because there isnt anything bad on the menu!

The service is always amazing and the staff here are super friendly and knowledgable on the menu. Love when they are able to help me pair my wine/beer to a great dish. Servers make great recommendations when it comes to wine and will even give you a little taste prior to ordering a full glass. Thoroughly enjoy a few of their servers in particular that I like to request them if they are in for the night and will wait a little longer to be sat in their section ( Yda or Nate). Love their character, personableness and table-side manner. When it comes to this place you cannot go wrong!

The wait is usually pretty long as they do not take reservations but it is well worth it!

Have been here multiple times. Every time the wait list has been poorly managed. This time I came for my birthday with my parents, sister, wife and daughter... For my birthday.  We called ahead and they said there was no wait, we showed up 10 minutes later and they told us 1.5-2 hour wait. I told them I was frustrated and began to leave. An older woman who was managing the multiple teenage hostesses stopped me from leaving just to explain to me why I was wrong. She unnecessarily escalated the situation and ruined my birthday dinner. 

Lack of respect. The seating/hostesses are handled by children and it shows.

Absolutely excellent! 

Service was outstanding snd the food was fresh and really tasty. The pizzas, salads, zucchini fries, and eggplant parmesan were all great!

Yum! I tried this place for the first time last Friday with a friend. We both loved it and will be back! 
It was packed so I recommend calling ahead. The service was great and the food came out quickly and was delicious! 
We had: 
Cosmos- very refreshing and nice orange flavor ($9)

Ricotta/honeycomb small plate- delicious and fun to try- would like about twice the amount of bread and honeycomb for the price though ($10)

House salad- really tasty house dressing, pecans, Gorgonzola, fennel, greens and tomatoes ($6)

Shrimp and avocado salad- also really good, shrimp were cooked well and had a nice flavor ($14)

Vodka pasta- fresh pasta with a spicy tomato cream sauce and crispy pancetta. I really liked it! You have to like spicy though. ($14)

Kale and mushroom pizza- wood-fired, nice crust and flavor- my friend said it was good! ($14) 

Homemade donuts- so good! Little pieces of fried dough with powdered sugar and a chocolate/honey dipping sauce. Enough for 4. ($5) 

We'll be back to try more small plates, pizzas and pastas!

Food and service were good but our table in the bar had an ant problem. They were crawling on our table and I was constantly killing them with my drink napkins. Told server who brought over the manager who said they have never had ants. Killed a few more and gave him the napkin which he kept for the bug exterminator. Bit gross... they could have at least comped our drinks!

Grilled romaine salad was to die for. Margarita pizza was as good as the pizza in Italy. Margaritas were ice cold and perfect. Italian doughnuts and cappuccino were excellent. Service was solid too. Can't wait to return. Cannot say enough about this place.

Went back again with another friend from the city and she also gave it a thumbs up. Tried the mussels this time with butternut squash tortellini with sage browned butter, salmon salad, and beet salad. So full we skipped dessert. Attentive service at a table and never felt rushed or crowded to move on by server. Another winner!! She eats out in the city all the time and we both had a wonderful time! Thanks F+W!
Oh very happening place to eat!  Interesting entree selections.  And everything is delicious
Love this place! Perfect place for a first date:) the food is amazing and so is the atmosphere.
My favorite place in downtown Glen Ellyn. Go their once a month with a friend and have tried almost everything.  Great wine list too!
Great place and food. The environment in this place reminds me going to the city without the expensive parking.

Small plates Italiano, a great way to dine, well done also by Quartino...
The two of us did have a solid 90 min wait, but that was what we were told to expect so we settled in to the cozy, convivial (place was jumpin'!) bar to nurse a well made martini and French 75...
Started with a whipped ricotta and honey, quite yummy; octopus pretty spicy but still delish, scallops, pizza, all very nice... 
One slight prob, my main resto pet peeve I guess...warm red wine! Been to many fine restaurants, some with somms, that still don't seem to consider this a glitch in their wine service...cellar temp, please...we had coupla $10 glasses of Barbera that were grossly warm. Our gracious waiter Brian fixed us up with some drinkable Tempranillo and we were happy...
We did enjoy and would return.

This place is awesome! The bf and I went there for our first time about 3-4 months ago and just had dessert! Holy Nutella calzone!! Sooo good! We returned about 2 weeks ago for dinner and were yet again blown away with the food! We had the mussels and gnocchi as an app! Amazing! We had the grilled romaine next and holy moly...this salad is to die for! The bacon. The shallots. The dressing! Drool!! For our entree we split a pizza and it did not disappoint! Keep it up guys! The service was great and the staff was friendly. FYI-they don't take reservations..however you can call ahead and get put on a wait list!

This is by far one of my favorite places to stop in at weather it is for a smooth glass of red wine, a trendy cocktail, a small bite, or a large comforting satisfying meal. Upon arriving parking is not a challenge their is a lot across the street. The staff is very friendly very knowledge on their foods and drink items. Kate is a great server she is very personable and really make you feel like your part of the fire and wine family. The atmosphere Is a upbeat cozy dark wine cellar feel lit with many candles and high top tables. The Honey comb ricotta appetizer the homemade Pizzas and pasta specials are a must. If you are a Nutella fan they have a Nutella stuffed calzone with chocolate sauce. There tower of doughnuts with dipping sauces are irresistible.  This place is kid friendly and offers choices off the kids menu. They are always changing the menu seasonally and they offer suggestions on comment cards. I had recently suggested a sangria sorbet to my waitress Kate. I hope to see it on the menu in the near future. The only down fall is  I would recommend going later in the evening or week day they are a popular place and do not take reservations but who came blame them for being so popular . This is a highly recommended  unique dining experience to any one who enjoys a decadent bite and a sinful sip.  Thanks fire and wine for making me a happy customer cheers!

Exceptional food. All dishes had distinct flavors. The black pepper shrimp was exquisite for a starter. The Hanger steak was so tender. Make sure to save room for the Nutella calzone with an espresso. Still savoring.  Decided before we left to go back soon.

After having to wait many two hours almost every time I want to eat here, I'm not sure I will frequent often. We thought we left long wait times when we left the city. The food is good, service is good and it's nice to support a local biz but not sure it's worth all the hassle.
a well deserved always busy - my favorite place to get all my guilty pleasure foods at, I'm addicted, always

The food is generally good as is the service.  My only complaint is with the wine pour.  Glass of wine is priced on high side and yet the amount is not generous.  We don't go here as often as we would for this reason alone.  They should understand if they had a better value with the wine they would make out better in the long run.

Seriously...the food here is BOMB. My husband & I live nearby so we are lucky to get takeout here often :)    

A few faves:
Black Pepper Shrimp: OhmyGod...truly perfect. Quality shrimp, small roasted peppers, polenta with just the right amount of creamy sauce. Everything I want in a dish is in here.

Meatball sliders: Tender meatballs with a lovely roasted tomato sauce on fresh bread.

Four cheese pizza: Great take on a rather simplistic pie.

Thoughtful food & cozy vibe if you dine in. Highly recommend, most everything that we have tried here has been great.

Fire and Wine is one of my most favorite restaurants. The food is so fresh and amazing! The wine list is great and plenty to choose from form a dry red to a light and refreshing white. They even have craft cocktails and a large array of craft beers. If that doesn't do it for youths staff is excellent! I have never had a visit without superb service! Highly recommended!

I came for dinner with a friend and we had an absolutely fantastic meal.

Decor: The bar area is a pretty standard bar and the restaurant portion is nicely decorated with a real "homey" feel. It is a very welcoming place to enjoy a meal or some drinks. The light level is low but helps to make it feel more intimate and set a low-key vibe. We had a table just inside the restaurant part so I didn't get a chance to see how large the entire place is or how many tables they might have.
Bathroom: Just like the rest of the place it is nicely kept and very inviting

Staff: The bartender (pre-dinner drinks) and our waiter were very friendly and attentive. Whenever our drinks were empty they were ready and willing to refill and the food was delivered very quickly. We also chatted with the owner who is a very cool guy who does exactly what you would want an owner to do: he manned the bar a bit, chatted with customers, and shot the shit with us despite his time being obviously stretched very thin. It's the small touches that are outstanding.

Food: Wow. Let me say that again, WOW. Everything we had was outstanding. We started with some bourbon (Maker's - a little larger selection would be cool) and then were seated for dinner. We began with the Mussels (SO DAMN GOOD) and the Prosciutto Di Parma (yum!) and then had Filet of Beef Medallions and the Hanger Steak (both superb!). For dessert we had bourbon Old Fashions and then a round of beers at the bar.

Value: The prices are respectable for the serving sizes. Factor in the level of service and the taste of the food and you are more than getting your money's worth.

This place is wonderful and I cannot wait until I am back in town to come back!

We ate tonight at Fire & Wine. We had a party of 9 and our waitress (Valerie) memorized all of our names. I had the seafood risotto. It was delicious. The service from Valerie was amazing. Great place!!

"The Panna Cotta was the best thing I've ever put in my mouth.  Don't tell my husband."  - I wrote this on the comment card that the waitress asked us to fill out.

All joking aside, this was one of the best desserts I've had.  If only the small dish was the size of a semi-truck tire, then it would have been perfect.  Panna Cotta is like an Italian pudding, and Fire + Wine adds this balsamic drizzle and salt that combines well with the sweetness.

Ok wait.  Rewind.  I ate dinner here too.  Fire + Wine was a perfect halfway point for my friend and I to meet.  I arrived first and settled in with a glass of Prosecco.  Our waitress was also very sweet and attentive.

Many of the small plates were temping, like the arancini, burrata, or ricotta with honeycomb.  Do you see a pattern here?  So many cheesy options!  But I ordered a pizza instead, hoping to return sometime with a small group to do the small plates.

I loved my pizza.  I had the White Pizza, with mozzarella, goat cheese, pickled hot peppers, and basil.  Fire + Wine makes Neopolitan-style pizza which was perfectly chewy and not at all charred or burnt.  I didn't eat the whole thing; one pizza and perhaps a salad would make a nice meal for two.  I ate all but 2-3 slices and ate the rest for lunch the next day.

I enjoyed my meal here, but arriving early is always a good idea.  I got a table without any wait on a Wednesday at 5:30 p.m.  By the time we left, there were several people waiting for a table.  Fire + Wine is a great choice for a (quiet) ladies night out or a date night.

My husband and I visited this place on a rainy Saturday night.  We were pretty early (before 6 pm) so I thought maybe we'd get in pretty fast, but the wait was an hour!  Luckily we weren't starving yet so we went down the street for a drink.  After waiting an hour, my standards go up a bit, but this place totally surpassed them.  The food was fantastic!!  The menu has a mix of small plates and pizzas.  We had the prosciutto de parma, the shrimp and avocado salad, and the kale and wild mushroom pizza.  Seriously, everything was delicious.  The prosciutto dish was my husband's favorite because he is a cured meat fanatic.  I'm not really a fan, but the roasted peppers, artichokes, mozzarella, bread, and arugula won me over by being extremely flavorful and fresh.  The salad had some of the best shrimp I've ever had in the Midwest - they were large, plump, and perfectly cooked!  The pizza to me was the star of the show (my husband disagrees).  The crust was perfect and the mushrooms were actually a unique assortment of wild mushrooms and not just "baby bellas" or something.  

We also had some wine - I would say that the wine was very good, but the server fell a little flat on recommendations.  But everything else was perfect.  We'll definitely come back, even with a super long wait and a bit of a drive to get there.  I was very pleased.

I went here to celebrate all the amazing achievements at work. This place is incredible! All the food is made from scratch and is so delicious. We shared a bunch of appetizers and fresh pizzas. The dough on the pizza was thin and crispy. The dessert with the Nutella on it... Was like heaven. You will not be sorry if you eat here. Make a reservation, it gets very busy.
I am sensitive to dairy and the waitress was amazing, spending time with me discussing my food options. Food is as great as the service is!

What can I say about our visit on Friday? I have so many great ways to describe the amazing hospitality we received from your entire team. The first impression of the restaurant was awesome, cozy but not cramped, modern yet rustic, lively and energetic. Even in a huge snowstorm, the restaurant was buzzing-that's saying something! Amy, our server, was so sweet. She was incredibly accommodating, friendly and so genuine. Starting off our dinner with the signature martini was a great option, but once the bubbles arrived to the table, the true celebrations had begun! I have the highest of praise for the food, drinks and associates at Fire + Wine and I have already shared my excellent experience with many of my friends and will continue to do so for a long while. 

My HIGHEST recommendation for Fire + Wine!
Very good. Smaller portions. Dishes are done well.

Fire + Wine is THE place to eat at in Glen Ellyn!!  They don't take reservations but do take "call ahead seating". Highly recommend calling ahead.  We enjoy ordering several of the small plates.  Every menu item we have tried has been fabulous.  Great ambiance, friendly staff and quick service.  They are kid-friendly.  Our kids love the chalkboards and chalk.  Fire + Wine is a must if you are in the western Chicago suburbs.

Being forced to be gluten free, I realized I am a lot of work to go out to eat with.  But fire and wine is always helpful, friendly and have great menu items for me.  I can have pasta,  pizza, most of the appetizers and beer!!!!  We frequent here and have never had bad service.  Not once.  One of my most highly recommended restaurants in the Chicago area!  But its so good its busy so go early or call ahead.

Yes, this is as good as it gets.  I've heard so many great things about Fire + Wine and since we are moving away from the area soon, I knew we needed to try it out before then! We visited on a Thursday and as I expected we had about 30 minute wait before we could get a table.  The bar area was also pretty full so we didn't even end up getting drinks prior to our dinner.

We had a nice quiet table in the back which was really enjoyable because we were easily able to carry on a conversation.  We order the prosciutto di parma which included prosciutto, artichoke hearts, housemade mozzerella, and balsamic, the medjool dates and chorizo, and bianco pizza.  Everything was the bomb.com.  If I had to choose a favorite I would probably pick the dates & chorizo.  The combination has never sounded for good in theory to me, but in practice it is amazing.  Plus the spicy red sauce that covered the dish was also amazing.  I could eat those everyday.

I really loved the pizza too.  The butternut squash and sage combination is one of my absolute favorites plus it was cheesy and a little bit salty.  Our server tried to convince us to get dessert and I'm sure the desserts are also amazing but I stuffed myself to full with the pizza so we had to pass.  I cannot wait to visit here again to try dessert.

Even though the restaurant was full, I was surprised with how quickly our orders came out.  Plus they staggered our dishes so we didn't have to wait long for our first dish to come out.  

If you are looking for a great date night restaurant this place could be it!

Outstanding. Six of us went. Every meal was made and served to perfection. Our server, Renee, hit all of the marks. I had seafood risotto. The best risotto I've had in some time. Will I return? In spades!!

I just went here for the first time a couple of weekends ago for dinner with friends.  I also brought along my 5 month old son.  I was worried that this was too fancy of a place for him, but the staff was so accommodating!  He slept most of the time anyway.  

I love that they have a diverse menu of small plates, pizza, and entrees.  Every ingredient they use is fresh and you can definitely taste the quality in everything they make.  I had the muscles to start which were delicious.  It's all in the broth with muscles and they didn't disappoint.  I could of just ordered more bread and soaked up all the broth for my meal but I did not.  

I ordered a shrimp and pesto pizza as my main dish and it was so good!  I love the thin crust and how you can taste the wood fire in it.  The service was amazing and our server was so friendly and knowledgeable of everything it was impressive.  I will definitely be back here to try more items on the menu!

Went in on Sunday night for dinner with my family. Everything was amazing, we ordered: Eggplant lasagna - the crispy eggplant was a pleasant surprise and delish! Scallops and cauliflower - not usually a fan of cauliflower, but this was great. Gnocci - best I've had, they seemed to be slightly fried which made it more enjoyable.  They gave me a panna cotta for my birthday, which I've never tried and we loved it - it had a pinch too much of sea salt - but still very good!  Most importantly, my mom is a big fan of this place and she's one picky lady! She even picked up business cards to hand out to her friends lol.
This place is amazing. Each and every time I go there the food is outstanding. The staff is attentive and the drinks are fun!  The wait may be long but we'll worth it.

Nice place in our current home town of Glen Ellyn.

Had passed by and always thought it was just a wine bar - ends up to be a pretty good sized restaurant.  Food was great, and a few different decent glasses of wine.  Overall a pretty classy yet fun ambiance.  

It was a Friday night and we were probably the least dressed up there as we were in our traditional California casual and had a toddler with us in tow (didn't see another kid in the place) but had a booth and it worked out well.

When they're on this place is a 5. I've been here 4 times and my wife has been there several more times than I have. We both agree that they're not super consistent, but I've never had a terrible experience. Off nights the food isn't as good and is probably a 3.5. We went two nights last week and the first time it was a 5. The second time we ordered the same salad and there was less dressing and the dressing seemed different and not as good. Pizza was also not as good. Great place overall to have in GE though.

This is probably my favorite place in town to eat at...me and my boyfriend would eat here every day if we could! We love wine, almost always get a bottle when we come here. We also LOVE the pizza. OMG the Regina Margherita pizza is fabulous. I get it every time without fail. The appetizers are unique and the specials are also very delicious. Some of the dishes are slightly like a Tapas restaurant, but if you want a real treat that tastes good every time, this is the place for you.

Only warning....watch out for the waits! This place gets PACKED on any day. Show up early before the rush, like 5:30 or so.

This place is where my husband and I go for most of our dates.  We never liked to go to the same place on multiple dates,  but Fire and Wine is always so much fun.

The food is superb. The Aricini mozzarella and zucchini fries are really good appetizers.  We enjoyed their specialty pizza when we tried it,  but we usually get a pasta dish. 

We have never been disappointed and we always have great service. It can get very busy,  so it's best to go early.  But, if you find yourself waiting in line,  it's worth it.

I read through the reviews on here and I thought a nice Christmas time meal here was in order... I finally made it here last night.
According to their website, they don't take reservations...some of these reviews made me think I'd be standing in line to get in if my timing was bad so my friend and I settled for an early dinner to beat the rush.  We got here about 5pm on a Saturday night.

I had pasta on Christmas Eve so I wasn't in the mood for pasta...next visit here I need to try pasta for sure!  We were undecided about so many things... beer or wine? What appetizer?

So we settled for a glass of wine to pair with our dinner - we got the arancini for an appetizer, pizza with sausage & pepperoni (I can't recall the one we ordered) and for dessert, flourless chocolate cake which wasn't on the dessert menu, but recommended by our server.
Our server was pretty great, she recommended a wine we might like and offered up samples ahead of time.  I ended up ordering a second glass of wine, being the one she mentioned.

I'm glad we got in early and made a reservation as we were leaving, the place was getting crowded, there isn't much room to hang out in the bar area, if people are sitting at the bar.

Fantastic!!  Seriously!  My new favorite restaurant.  Every dish was fantastic, great atmosphere, awesome service, very reasonable prices. I can't wait to return. Be sure to leave some room for dessert. Kudos!

Absolutely love this restaurant.  I've been 3 times in 3 weeks, and it's been amazing every single time.  

The food never disappoints.  Michael the owner is very attentive to his guests.  I would eat here every day if it was possible.  

The homemade pasta dishes are simply divine.

My husband and I have been going to F+W since it opened. We live down the street and we have dinner there at least once a week. Everybody we've taken there for dinner loves it. The staff is great, I think we've had about every waiter/waitress and they are all wonderful. We love Val, she always hugs us when we come in, they really make you feel welcome, like family. A couple "must-try" items (in my opinion): Grilled Romaine salad, Vodka pasta (we like to add chicken), the gnocchi small plate, the meatballs, and the Nutella calzone. Delicious and worth the wait.

Awesome good. 
It's located in bp gas station. Prob the best in this town. 
Must go and try it . Good people here to

My husband and I were in the area and I had a craving for Mediterranean food. This place really hit the spot. You probably wouldn't have high expectations for a restaurant attached to a BP gas station, but don't let appearances fool you. I had the beef shwarma and my husband had the kifta kabobs. Neither of us were disappointed. The yellow rice was flavorful and plentiful. The shwarma and kifta were well seasoned and were deliciously smoky!

I would have liked a little more vegetables on my plate though. We each had three half slices tomato and a small pile of onions. Some shredded lettuce or more tomato would have been a real plus. A little more of the delicious tzatziki would have been nice too, but these are just minor complaints since the food was really great. If we're ever in the area again, we'll definitely be going back!

I felt compelled to write this review the same day I visited Larsa's. It's not easy to find unless you are in West Elgin on a no-name street. It's connected to a gas station by a shared door. You might drive right by it if you're not careful. 

The restaurant is quaint and clean. About 6 tables with chairs and maybe 6 table tops with stools. The menu looks brand new, it's computerized and has really nice pictures of all the meals. I ordered a Chicago Gyros with Fries/Soda and it was 8.95 including tax. The Gyros was fresh made. Crispy meat. The tzatziki sauce was delicious. The key word here is "Fresh". Everything from the Pita to the tomatoes and onions was fresh. All other tzatziki sauces I've had pale in comparison to this sauce. 

Everything is fresh made in this restaurant and you can taste it. So if you're in the middle of nowhere (Elgin), please stop by.

We absolutely love eating here! It's kind of strange being located next to a gas station, but don't let that fool you. The food is absolutely wonderful, and the atmosphere is quiet and simple. If you are in the area, you must stop in.

I'm not a vegetarian but tried the veggie platter. It was just perfect. I just stopped in to pick-up but noticed the place was very nice and clean. I can't wait to go back and try some of the meat dishes.

Amazing food. Love this place. Ingredients are always fresh.
I make the trip out here once a week to get my fix of these delicious dishes. 
My favorite is the kafta plate. Meat is seasoned well and tender. Rice is beyond yum. 
I've tried the gyro and the chicken shawerma plates and I was not impressed. I'm also particular as to how I like my food, specifically chicken shawerma. It wasn't bad but not my favorite either. 
Staff is friendly.  Very helpful. The location kind of sucks because it is in the closed down bp  gas station and you can totally miss it of you blink.  
Definitely worth the trip to check out this phenomenal food.

This place is dynamite!

I'd highly recommend making the trip to give this place a try.  We live in Crystal Lake and drove about 30 minutes to get here, but it was well worth the drive.  There aren't enough Mediterranean places in the general area, which is stupid, so this is definitely the go-to spot for some tasty hummus and other healthy goodness.  They keep the place very clean and all the employees were very nice. Give it a try, for sure!

I got over the being adjoined to a gas station after I had my first bite...you simply have one of the best gyros I have ever experienced, and your fries are the bomb! Your service - always friendly! I find it hard to believe you exist! Just thank you, and know you are one of those places that came as a complete surprise and make life a wonder! You should consider catering/delivery as you grow!

Here's another one of those, don't judge a book by its cover places. Let me tell you, the GPS wasn't quite sure if we were here or not as we approached. We turned in and thought we were at a gas station. Well, we were except that it was abandoned. It felt like a Stephen King novel where it looks like everyone was going about their business and then all of a sudden they vanished into thin air leaving everything behind just as it was. Exactly like that. 

We walked in the door and went to our left into the restaurant. The attached gas station/quick shop is immediately to the right. There were maybe ten tables inside and you place your order at the counter. The women working the counter were nice. I was overwhelmed standing there trying to make a decision. I was with two of my sisters and there were three to-go containers of baklava - that was an easy decision. I ordered a combination plate with a little of everything and my sisters both order Kifta/kefta kabob. They seemed to cook everything to order except for maybe the steak and the rice. The steak was my least favorite thing on the plate. It was too chewy for me. The rice was good though. But the chicken breast and the kabob were the highlights for me!  I specifically asked for Tzatziki sauce and I think my sisters ended up with a garlic type sauce. The garlic sauce was too potent for them while I found my sauce to be delicious!  Lunch for the three of us was reasonable. We probably could have ordered smarter and not spent quite as much, but everyone was happy so it was well worth it!
Seriously, the best gyro I've ever had. We go here for a great meal and are never, ever disappointed. Hot, fresh, and an outstanding platter at a steal of a price!

For a restaurant inside of a gas station, I'd say Larsa's is fairly decent.  Obviously it's not the best middle eastern food I've had but for the location and area it's not a bad bet.  I ordered the chicken shawarma plate which came with chicken, a ton of rice, a pita and a couple slices of tomato and onion.  The chicken had some flavor but was a little dry as was the pita.  If you have a hankering for food while getting gas maybe grab a plate to go.  I wouldn't recommend the wraps since some of my coworkers ordered it and said it was extremely dry due to a lack of sauce.
I come here everyday for lunch and the high quality keeps me coming back for more.

The reviews do this place justice. It's been on my radar for awhile (because of all the positive reviews) and my husband and I finally ate here for lunch yesterday. The food was awesome. I ordered the chicken and hummus (with jalapeno/cilantro hummus) and my husband ordered the steak and hummus. We both agreed that the chicken was well-seasoned and juicy and tasted much better than the steak. We will definitely be back to try a gyro or one of the yummy looking salads!

It's definitely weird that they are located in a closed Amoco gas station though. There's yellow caution tape around the gas pumps and in the not-yet-empty convenience store. The shelves are empty, but there are still drinks in the coolers. Just weird.  Don't let that deter you from trying the food though - if you like Mediterranean food, you won't be disappointed.

WOW, this might just be my first 5 star review!! Now, first of all, lets get this out of the way, it's located inside of an abandoned gas station, which is completely fine and dandy, back to the review. Immediately upon entering I noticed they have a really nice digital changing menu, with a wide variety of items, now.. I am pretty new to this kind of food, so I just went with what looked good, and I ordered the #3 Beef Shawarma wrap, with a side of Tabouleh salad. All I have to say is this wrap was AMAZING!! Perfectly seasoned/tender beef topped with the freshest pickles, tomatoes, onions, and a Tahini sauce mixture made to blow your taste buds all the way to next Tuesday. 

As for the Tabouleh salad, it's probably the freshest, and healthiest tasting thing I have consumed in awhile! Delicious lemon juice/olive oil dressing, chopped mint, onions, bulgur, tomato, and parsley, chopped so fine the flavors literally explode together, I can't say I've had anything quite like it, definitely an immune system booster.  Overall, I will definitely be returning to Larsa's Kitchen!! Looking forward to trying other items on the menu, and I will update my review. OHH!! And how can I forget the AMAZING perfectly seasoned & crisp fries? Just try them folks, and you'll see EXACTLY what I'm talking about, these are not soggy grease joint fries NoOo NOoOo. Also, kudos to the kind lady working the kitchen by herself for the superior service with a smile, thank you for that. Will be back!!
Very unassuming place and attached to a BP station no less. But the food here is excellent! Anytime I'm in the area, I head here to eat lunch or dinner.

Not impressed at all. In fact, I was quite disappointed after reading all of the good reviews.
I had the Steak Shawarma and the steak was very dry and over cooked. It was one step away from being beef jerky.

Rice was bland. Over-all dish could have used more seasoning. 
The tahini sauce was good but not good enough to give this place more than two stars.

If you like or want to try Middle Eastern food, this is a great place.  I've been there a few times for lunch and like it.   

The place is connected to a closed gas station, which confused the first time I went there.  Great lunch spot.

Since there isn't anywhere around us to get our schawarma and falafel on, we decided to make the trek to Larsa's all the way from Batavia to Elgin. Coming to this place is very odd. First of all, it's in an old BP station. You park where the now-defunct gas pumps are and you walk in the glass doors towards the left. If you need to use the washroom, you walk back through the "lobby" and into the old mini-mart part of the building and pray that the ladies' room isn't locked... dammit. So then you go to the men's room, hold your breath as you hover over the seat, and then go back into the restaurant and order some falafel.

Their falafels are cute! They look like mini donuts, and are tasty to boot. The beef schawarma is just okay - it was basically seasoned chunks of steak, which might be to some people's liking but we enjoy the giant-cone-of-meat schawarma instead. The kufta kebabs were also delicious.

All in all, decent food. Not the best Middle Eastern I've had. We'll continue to try to find a decent Mediterranean place in the tri-cities area (I can't believe there is such a dearth of them in Batavia/Geneva/Saint Charles... someone please open a decent schawarma place soon! I AM DYING HERE.)
Absolutely, fantastic! Quick, inexpensive, but wonderful. Some of the best greek I've had.

Must've caught the B Team the other day. It was a Saturday lunch a bit after 12 and I have been craving Middle Eastern food since we had a promotional menu at my work. The chicken shawarma was dry and the gyro meat was overly cooked. Fries portion was generous, but that didn't really make up for the other things.

Spending $20+ dollars at an abandoned gas station and getting subpar food was not the way I wanted to spend my Saturday.

Wow, Larsa's is interesting!

I only had a falafel. The pita was too big and dry, that's why a star was lost, but the falafel, toppings and tahini were great. I'd go back to try other items for sure. 

The interesting thing is the location. A run down gas station no longer in service houses Larsa's. The drive thru signs are up but you can't use it. There is caution tape around the pumps. The gas station side has product still in it but is locked up. I worry that this totally unattractive mess will steer potential business away. 

If you are brave, drive in, eat, stay, Larsa's will not disappoint on flavor. 

But truly, I hope they find a new location.

Basically you must try the lentil soup, a very hearty version of this staple, and the kefta kabob on bright yellow rice. I've had the chicken kabob as well and while it's made of breast meat and therefore tends to be dry and flavorless, this was certainly not the case with this kabob. The tabouleh, a bright tomato, parsley, and bulgur salad, dressed with lemon juice, is quite delicious.

Wow, this place is tasty. Very fresh consistent food with a friendly staff.

I worry about their location though as the gas station to which they are attached shut down sometime near their opening.

Larsa, if you are reading this, I would be happy to help you find a new location to keep you in business!

If you like fresh and flavorful food? This is the place. 

This is a once a week place for me. The staff are really nice too. 

Ive tried most of the items and have found them all very good.

The moment m'lady -- who keeps her ear to the goddamn ground! -- heard there was a Mediterranean spot in a shuttered BP Amoco station in Elgin, we were both like, "No brainer, dude." Much pump and jazz and jubilation ensued, and endured, for the weeks 'til we finally got a chance to check it out. And there we were: Pulling up alongside a non-functioning gas pump, parking our car for lunch.

Only negative? Right off the bat, no high chairs for the mega tiny patrons. Admittedly, I was pretty surprised -- it's probably more of an oversight than anything, but definitely one worth rectifying, in my mind. We're in the suburbs, homey, and tiny people live here, too. Buy a couple high chairs, toss 'em in the corner. No brainer. We ordered for take-out, as a result.

The food was great: An order of very fresh mujaddara, a pair of veg platters (falafel x 3, hummus, babaganoush, dolmas x 3, a wee pile of lettuce, cups of tahini) and baklava. Everything hit the spot like a champ. We were impressed.

I've since tried the jalapeo-cilantro hummus (awesome) and more of the aforementioned on a subsequent early evening hang with friends and everything held up. These folks are doing it right, fighting the good fight..

(maybe just get a couple high chairs)

Fresh, good, prepared right then.  Food was tasty and for lunch in this area, healthier than I deserved.  

The one downside is that I passed by it for years because I didn't know it was there.  The gas station is closed and unless you pay close attention, you'd drive right by this business.

Pay attention! Its on the left side of the building and its worth a quick meal.

Service and food was excellent. I love the hot sauce !!!
If you are near and want some great Mediterrean food, please stop and check this place out.
I got the Kifta kabob plate and it was amazing ! The rice is yummy as well.

I give this 2 kabobs up !

Bizarre location.. Like walking into a horror flick...and then BAM.. Big time restaurant   

I really liked there digital menu behind the counter.. Very cool with HD pictures of the food and prices.  

Nice selection and pricing was reasonable..too many things to select. 
I went w/gyro salad and a beef shawarma.

I'll be back tomorrow for a couple more beef shawarmas. Tahini, dill and hot sauces are very good. 

The gyro meat is great .. Salad super fresh..big portion. 

Way to go Yelp. Wouldn't have ever came here.  

Will be back

Food was delicious. Lentil soup was homemade & phenomenal. I had the chicken Sharma & my niece got the gyro. We also shared the regular hummus, which was freshly made and great!! It was hard to find in the BP gas station, but we'll worth the turn around to get there. Nice ambiance in the place. Would defiantly recommend & make the trip up to Elgin to eat there again.
Kinda scary from the outside, but once in the restaurant it is super nice and clean. Food was very fresh and tasty. Can't wait to bring coworkers and friends to this place!  Highly recommend.

Let me first start by saying that you can tell a lot from a place (especially a mom-and-pop shop) as soon as you walk in the door and smell the air inside the establishment. So, smell is my first indicator.  If the place smells raunchy, chances are the food is going to smell and it taste like the place. Amirite?  I don't know if it was because I was the first one in when they open at 11:01 but this place smelled nothing short of lemony fresh. Spik and span! 

The food is really really good and it's honestly the best and freshest Hummus I have ever tasted!! it will definitely come back.

This place is amazing! We used to live right down the street from an amazing Greek place in Cali but this is better. The place is run by all women and they are so sweet and the food is fantastic! Highly recommended
WE LOVE IT here.  Fast, healthy and always good food.
Very tasty! Greek salad fresh with good romain. Shawarma very good. Can't wait to try the other stuff. Cool that it's in a Gas Station!

Larsa's is a Mediterranean restaurant in an Elgin gas station. A gas station that is currently closed, mind you...

That out of the way, wow! They have incredible food and service. The gyro is the best I've ever had, the sauce is incredible. The shawarma, falafel and hummus are also very good. I just wish it were closer to home.
This place is very underrated. Chicken kabobs and schwarma are very tasty and seasoned perfectly. Baba ghannouj is very tasty.

Don't let the shady, gas station, taped off location deter you. This is excellent, authentic Mediterranean food! Everything we get here is delicious and the service is fast and friendly. Only 4 stars since we would never consider dining in. Great for pick-up!!

I don't even generally like this genre of food, but I LOVE Larsa's. 

You can tell when someone puts pride in their work, especially in the food business, and the care and pride this family puts into this restaurant is highly evident. The place is spotless, from the front door to the grill every inch is clean. I love how they use the flat screen TVs for menus in the wall, wonderfully creative!

The food is some of the freshest I have had anywhere, my personal favorite are the gyros. The meat is perfectly seasoned and not at all greasy, I can't stand when your gyros sandwich is dripping in grease. The pitas are fluffy and soft, the tomatoes exactly ripe. 

Do yourself a favor and give Larsa's a try, you will only have improved your life by doing so. And have others have pointed out, unfortunately the attached BP has been closed, ignore the downtrodden look of the outside.

Omgoodness huge portions of yummy food and great prices.  Don't let the gas station throw you off!  It's definitely NOT gas station food!  We had gyros plate and chicken shawarma wrap.  Both were large portions and very tasty.  We ended up taking a large to go container home and had plenty for lunch the next day.  Don't forget to try the jalapeo hummus.  It is yummus!!!

I always go here when I'm in the mood for something fresh and healthy.   Our family favorites are mediterranean salad,  hummus, gyro meat and tabouleh salad.  Agreed, their location is strange but you won't think twice about it after having their food.

This place offers something completely different from the average fast food restaurant. Items seem to be made fresh and very authentic and homemade which makes them not only tasty but a refreshing change from packaged meals

I stopped here for a quick bite for dinner. I thought my GPS was taking me to a closed gas station, but on further inspection there was the little restaurant. The hummus needed more spices it was below average for me. The falafel pita was delicious! I added feta and it really hit the spot! Unfortunately the baklava was dry and hard. I would not order that again. Overall this place is easily passed up because of its inconvenient location, but I would come back for the falafel pita!

EXCELLENT food, I had low expectations for a place that is in a gas station, but I was happily blown away by their food!

The Dolmas were some of the best I have ever had, usually they seem to lack flavor, but Larsa's dolmas have a great seasoning to their rice, I order them every time!

The shwarma (both beef and chicken) were winners at my office, and I loved their twist on the hummus where they add jalapeno and cilantro -- they have the 'original' as well.

I will definitely be back - I go there weekly!

This is a must try.

The food is fresh, flavorful and inexpensive, especially for the quality and amount of food that you get. 

The proprietors are always smiling and friendly.    Everything is fresh and piping hot and wonderfully tasty.  Don't forget a piece of their exceptional baklava for dessert.

STILL OPEN!! The gas station is closed but Larsa's is still open!

Great lunch spot! Everything is made fresh to order, including chopping the salads and veggies on the spot. There is a short delay because of this, but it's worth it for the fresh food. Also, you can call ahead so it's ready when you arrive.

I'm a big fan of the Mediterranean salad with pita chips and their tabbouleh!
Awesome flavor! Great portions for the price. Gyros are moist and the fries are crispy. Friendly staff.

Larsa's is a great unexpected find in an unusual location. It's a must try if you like Mediterranean food and you live in the Elgin area. As other reviews have said, if you are driving a long distance and expecting great ambience, this is not the place. It's attached to an abandoned gas station. However, it is very clean and looks nice inside. I probably would have never tried it, but my mother recommended it to me.

Despite the unusual location, the food is really good and has always been fresh. The falafel pita and vegetarian plates are my favorites. The humus, baba ganoush, and dolmas are top notch. I've been about 4 times and the food has always been consistent and fresh. The staff is friendly. I really hope people frequent Larsa's so that it stays open. I always tend to forget it's there because I don't travel that far down McLean too often. It would be a shame to have such a well run family restaurant close. I'm hoping the positive reviews will bring many return customers.

Great food, great price, nice people, Super clean!

Odd location connected to a BP gas station that is currently out of business.  If I lived closer this would be my lunch go to spot.  You have to try the veggie platter, the shwarma, and the salads.  All fresh and tasty.
Good meal. Waited 15 min for fresh food. I am ok with this. The only chink in their armor is the dry pita. Spread some oil on the flat-top and grill it a bit. It will do wonders.

Really good food- excellent prices. Hope they remain open now that the adjacent gas station has closed. The hummus and falafel sandwich are very good- spicy and delicious falafel with great hot sauce. Gyro was also excellent. We get take out often and are always happy! Super friendly owners and staff. Clean, well run place. A hidden gem!

Yay! Excellent Mediterranean food in Elgin! The gas station location is off-putting, but it is quite pleasant inside. The menu has a great variety, the portions are generous, and the flavors are great.

This place is a solid 4 stars. It was clean and the food was decent. I ordered the falafel salad while my hubby got the kifta kabob plate and an order of jalepeno hummus and pitas. My 2 complaints are that the falafels were overcooked (dry and crunchy) and the olives had pits (no one wants to see people spitting out pits while they eat). I ordered a side of tza tziki sauce and not only thought it was tasty, I wished there was more of it to soften my dry falafel. I tried my hubby's food and I thoroughly enjoyed them as well. The hummus had a nice kick, pitas tasted fresh and were soft and the kabob was seasoned well and not overly dry. We'd definitely go back.

Very good food here. Freshly made. The falafel are very good. We enjoyed the vegetarian platter and the Mediterranean salad, no onions!  The pita chips are very good as well. Very clean on the inside. Don't let the closed gas station next door stop you from checking this place out!!

Great food.  I had the triple combo, chicken shwarma, chicken kabob, and kifta kabob, with rice pita and jalapeo hummus.  Everything was freshly prepared and cooked while we waited.  The kifta was my favorite, and the jalapeno hummus was excellent!  I'd like to see them add lamb and beef kabobs.

The restaurant has been updated with newer decor, and lcd menus.  It's well kept and very clean.  One oddity, it's part of a gas station! Even worse, the gas station is closed for business.  This means that the place has no external lights at night, and almost looks like it's closed, as you drive by.  If you can get past this, as we have, you will not be disappointed by the authentic food they produce here.  

Larsa's is a great addition to the local food scene and I hope it's here to stay.
Super fresh...super tasty...don't pass it by; walk on in. Unusual location providing an excellent dining experience.
Amazing Mediterranean food.   Kabob great.   Gyro wonderful.   The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside but it's some of the best I've had.

I like Larsa's. The location is a little scary but the atmosphere, staff and food are all really good. We have tried the Schwarma, falafel, hummus, and Dolma. All are good. We will continue to frequent Larsa's
Excellent food, don't let the old gas station turn you away!  Family owned, clean and yummy!!

This place has amazing food. Be braze and look past the location of the place, it is well worth going in and eating or getting take out. 

We have not had a bad meal/experience here. The staff is very friendly and approachable. There is nothing but satisfied customers eating their meals every time we have dined in or gotten take out.

It is a Diamond in the rough with great food and pricing - well worth it.

Just moved the area and was craving Tabouli and Baba ganoush. So happens there was a mailer from Larsa's in my welcome package so I decided to check them out. I am so glad I did! Aside from the restaurant being attached to an abandoned gas station I have never tasted food so fresh! The menu was simple but offered variety. I also tried the Chicago Gyro, wow! Tons of fresh meat and a tasty pita. I will be back soon!
Love the food - funky location and prefer takeout. Abandoned gas station is not my idea of a restaurant, but the people are quite friendly and helpful. The food is fresh and delicious.

A really nice meal. The only thing missing was that the chicken was lacking a bit of spiciness.. Everything else, especially the hummus was delicious! I had the chicken plate..... Oh yeah, the baklava was amazing.... Id be willing to go here just for the baklava!
Awesome gyros. Almost makes me forget how much I miss goodfellas.

This place shares the same building with a BP gas station. The lady who took my order was very nice. I had the Beef Schwarma plate, which was surprisingly good. I'll definitely come back when I'm in the area.

Really weird location,but completely awesome Mediterranean food.  Just park next to an abandoned gas pump and walk right in the door on the left hand side of the building. :)  Clean and simple setting with a large arabic and greek menu.   So far I have tried both the beef and chicken shawarma and hummus, which were absolutely delicious. They are closed Sundays, which is a shame, and this has quickly become a favorite of mine when I want something different.

Truly a bizarre place.  It really is a restaurant in a former BP gas station (that has closed). So.. you park along the sidewalk, or next to a pump.  The only bathroom is in the gas station portion, so they have most of it roped off except the path to the bathroom.  There are still neon signs and racks up, and old soda sitting on the shelf.  Food is great, though the menu is perhaps a little limited (probably speeds things up).  I'm taking off a star because the woman behind the counter (likely the daughter of the owner) seemed to be staring into space as she took our order and barely responded.  They also barely peeped when our order was ready, had my wife not been paying attention who knows how long it would have sit.  Also I think they could perhaps clean out the gas station portion so it doesn't look so odd (even if they don't technically rent that portion), or does that make it more interesting?

I was a little concerned when I first approached this place. It's attached to an old closed down gas station. However, based on the other yelp reviews, I took a chance, and it was well worth it. The interior was very clean, an the food was great.  The lady and gentleman who were working here were warm and friendly.  The man taking our order was very kind and patient with my elderly mother in helping her to make a decision.  He remembered a comment she had made about her teeth and ability to chew, and came out to ask her about a potentially different bread option for her sandwich that would work better with her dentures.  Everyone loved the food that they ordered.  The music playing laid a nice ambience. This place was a hidden gem.

Not a bad little place. I've done carry-out here a handful of times. The homemade lentil soup is delish! Almost as good as my Mom's. Locally other than Trader Joe's it's the only place I can get falafel. There Falafel Pita is really good. This is one of my go to places - so glad I found this little gem!

It's hard to find some fresh and authentic tasting Mediterrean food in the burbs. Fill your gas tank and then your stomach at this amazing find! 
I had the Chicken shawarma and fries- really good and fresh. Loved the fries :-) my husband had the chicken and hummus plate, they give you a lot of hummus there. They were both reasonably priced. 
The location was super clean and love to hear the Arabic music in the background. Can't wait to go back and try their salads!
The gyro is the best I've ever had. Chicken Kabob is great too. Try it. Friendly service and great food. Salads are loaded with meat.
This place is so incredible. I wish we weren't roadtripping and could be regulars here. They ran out of baklava, so I'd have to come back and try it. What a treasure, the flavors are unbelievable!!!
Absolutely delish!  The tenderest, most flavorful dolmas I have had in decades. Why get fast food when you can get this for the same price just as quickly, but lovingly made from scratch?

thought to try this place as most of the reviews seemed positive, but big disappointment.  $9 for a chicken pita lunch combo where there was hardly any chicken and mostly lettuce and sauce while the fries looked store bought and just re-fried from the freezer... Best part was the Pepsi which I rate a 9/10.  $9 for this combo is hardly a reason to go back.
Food is cooked with pride.   Strange location but don't let that deter you!  I will be back.

Don't let their location fool you! The food is divine. I had the vegetarian platter and the tabouleh salad, all was great. Best baba ganoush I've ever had.  My husbands' gyro was wonderful.
So nice to have good choices that aren't the typical chain fare.
Fabulous food, wonderful staff, a not to missed place for fast but freshly made and delicious food.

Amazing! It took me a moment to work up the nerve to go in. After reading some of the rave reviews I just had to try this place. The attached abandoned gas station is what almost scared me away...luckily I went inside. I feel terrible as I don't know her name, but the young woman that took my order was super friendly and patient, as I could but decide what to order. You are a doll! The menu is over head, but on flat screen tv's which was rather genius. I had the chicken and hummus plate, with the cilantro jalapeno hummus. First, the chicken is incredibly flavorful and juicy....Delicious! If you don't mind hot spicy,  the cilantro jalapeno hummus is incredible. It's mild for my taste, but had a nice kick to the end which didn't disappoint.....Now, I wish I could give six stars, because what happened next just made my indecisive day! It took me a moment to decide what to initially order, because I have a soft spot for falafel and couldn't decide. When I jokingly told the young lady about my falafel addiction, so told me that I could order a few falafel, even though it was not on the menu as I side item. How nice was that!!!

This review is a little late, as I have gone back already two more times in the past month. Check out this diamond in the rough, and you will NOT be disappointed!

So weird how it's attached to a broken down gas station, but there's nothing bad to say about it.  Great food at good prices served by nice people.  I got the chicken with the hummus and everything was great!

Oh my, so delicious! Affordable, fast, and superb! If you're looking for some pita and hummus to accent dinner, or expect to eat a gyro wrap for lunch, I definitely recommend stopping by here. Don't let the abandoned gas station creep you out!

Amid a vast array of fast food chains stands Larsa's Kitchen/Medterranean Grill, a healthy & affordable alternative this side of McLean Blvd.
Located where Goodfella's used to be (BP Gas station)

First impressions... The dining area is very clean & chic. I chose to carry out, but will dine-in next time. 
Also, the staff was friendly. I was thanked for my patronage when I left. That was very nice :)

I had the beef & chicken shawarma on a bed of basmatti rice. Added 2 falafels as well.
The food tasted great. Their homemade tahini sauce was the best condiment.
Great value for excellent food.

So, you might think this place is closed.  It's not!  The gas station next door is closed, though.  

The food is absolutely delicious!  We drive 20 miles just to eat here. I wish I could take the cook lady home with me to cook for my family.  It is that good!!  My husband gets the combo dinner platter and I get the juicy chicken kabobs.  You can definitely tell these are family recipes that are unique to this place.  In addition, the cilantro jalapeo hummus is the bomb and the pita is served warm.  I hope this place does well and stays in business, so I can make it my regular weekend dinner place with my family.
Outstanding. Can't wait to go back. Don't be put off by the outside of the building which was a Amoco gas station. It was  fresh and fabulous.

Great food in an odd location (half of a gas station). I had the Vegetarian Platter and everything was fresh and tasty. This place will be a go-to spot for me now even though it's a couple miles from my office. The gas station is currently closed but the food is still great!

Very good quality food. Had chicken and hummus (cilantro jalapeo) plate, kefka kabob and beef sharwarma. Everything was yummy. Kids liked the generous order of crispy French fries. The owners are lovely people.

We saw this on YELP and had to give it a try! I pulled in with my wife and we truly laughed because it is attached to a gas station that closed! NO worries, this a great little place. Very authentic, fresh Mediterranean food.  The Resturant is casual and very clean! Definitely will be back. Nice people and reasonable prices! The Beef Shawarma and homemade Tza Tziki sauce are out of this world.
Pretty good food. Had the chicken shawarma which was overall good.  Crazy location but worth stopping at.

Best food in Elgin. We go here at least once a week because the food is fresh, flavorful and cooked to perfection every time. Never had a bad experience. So glad I stumbled upon this little place next to a closed down gas station. It's a favorite and our go-to every Friday night.

Out of 2 places of Mediterranean places in elgin I tried. This one is the best one. The dolmas are authentic, the falafel wrap is flavorful. To narrow it all down, everything here is GOOD!! I always recommend  this place to everybody. Very affordable and clean. The staff are really nice  !  It's a hidden gem.
Delicious.   I can't wait to try everything.  So far....I have had the chicken and hummus a couple times and the gyro once.  Looking forward to other menu items.

Connected curiously to a Amoco gas station convenience store, the restaurant blossoms into a small Wonka wonder when you enter.  

The interior is very clean, warmly decorated, with a open well operated kitchen.  The menu choices are provided on a sharp row of displays over the counter with appetizingly photographed presentations of the shawarma, kabab, salads, gyros, and sides.  Attractive and clean chairs, tables and lighting offer a pleasant dine-in experience, while they are efficiently equipped to provide a great take-out meal as well.

I tried the shawarma and hummus plate with a side of dolmas.  The dolmas were scrumptious.  Great seasoning, perfectly sized, with quality grape leafs.  The hummus was wonderful, and the pita perfectly warmed and fresh.  The shawarma was tender, flavorful, and plentiful in portion.

Others at the table had salads topped with gyro meat.  The heapings of gyro and salad were ample enough for any appetite, and the gyro meat sliced and lightly crisped expertly.  The salad greens, cucumber, and tomato were fresh and crisp.  

Throughout the meal, pleasant Mediterranean music played.  The staff was quite friendly, and the food was prepared fresh and well presented.  I would recommend they upgrade their plates used with the salads;  the food presentation and quality are not done justice by that canvas.  Perhaps black plastic plates would offer more contrast and finesse at minimal extra cost.

A delicious, reasonably priced establishment in an area not well represented in food quality and diversity.  Very highly recommended.  I plan to be back frequently.
We decided to try based on the ratings in yelp    The Chicago gyro with fries combo is huge.  Highly recommend!!!

We randomly stumbled on this place and almost didn't go in as its in an out of business gas station, but we are so glad we did.  Amazing food and the people were so nice.  Highly recommend!! You'll be pleasantly surprised :)

Wow! This place surprised me. It is located next to a gas station that just closed. The food is great and the woman behind the counter (possibly the owner) couldn't have been nicer. I would definitely go here again.

Huge portions. I got beef shawarma, wife got a chicken pita, son got Caesar salad and daughter got a side of rice. Way too much food. Everything was very good and actually pretty healthy I think. Baklava sucked as it was all dried out and wouldn't get that again but everything else was very good. Dipping the fries in the Greek salad dressing and feta cheese was a delish idea for Greek fries!

Darn good authentic Mexican food. I like the "help yourself" chips and salsa bar. If you're going for lunch get there early to avoid the line and if you want a table. More of a "lunch" place. Not somewhere you would go for a family dinner, the interior is a bit lacking but the food more than makes up for it. 
My favorite thing is the vegetarian sopes.

The steak tacos were 1/10, bland and horrible. The pastor was 4/10. Rice was 7/10 not bad. Hot sauce was 3/10. Not the worst I've had, but not good. The price was outrageous. 5 tacos, some rice and a drink was $17. I don't recomend this place at al

Right next to my boyfriend's house, El Faro is a go-to! They have excellent authentic Mexican food with great prices and friendly staff. Their food is always ready very quickly and they are very generous with their salsas. 

Good location for dine in or take out. When dining in, you get free chips and salsa. Would recommend to anybody in the area!
