This was the worst Mexican food I have ever had! The tacos were extremely bland. The service was insanely slow. To be fair, the other locations are much much better.
We order off the catering menu - Taco bar is fantastic, fresh, authentic and a great price.

Get here early as the lunch crowd usually fills up the limited seating. The food is ok. Not the best Mexican food but if you're looking for decent food and a reasonable price then this is the place for you. The steak and chicken could use more seasoning on. It can taste bland if you do not add any salsa. The chorizo is not as greasy as most however its a bit mushy for my liking. I prefer chorizo to be a bit crispy. The place has its own "chips and salsa bar". You can help yourself to chips, pico de gallo, their red or green salsa, and jalapeo slices with carrots. I've had the regular burrito and burrito suizo and I prefer to eat the burrito suizo as the sauce and cheese help elevate the flavor no matter the protein you chose. 
There are daily lunch specials. My favorite is on Wednesdays. 3 burritos for $10.95. That's less than $4 for a football sized burrito!
I come here all the time. Excellent portion and the price of the food is just right. Also great service. The food comes out fast. Hot plate coming right up.

I used to love this place as I used to come here two to three times a week. However, lately I've noticed the cook does not wear gloves and constantly wipes his nose on his shoulder and hands. I stopped coming here for two months then I came back because I was craving but only to find out in those 2 months he hasn't changed his habits. There are no sanitary standards. In fact one of the employees was sweeping as I was eating and all the dust was flying everywhere. Definitely not coming back.
Fantastic burritos. Very close in taste to my favorite from El Farol in Summit Illinois (I don't think the places are related). I've never found a place with this kind of burrito "recipe".

Worst experience ever, they closed at 11:00 pm, but today I got there before 10:30 and they told Me only Togo orders, I was not expecting to be but 20 minutes top, needless to say this is the second time I experienced this in other occasion they told me that some items were not available because they have turn off the fryer, most of the restaurants will keep the same service until closing, so now you know if you want to have dinner go befor 9:00 and you might get service. Very disappointed.

Worst Mexican restaurant ever. Ordered tortas for lunch. Picked up food and went back to work to eat our lunch. My workers and I started eating and quickly realized something was wrong with our food. It tasted like there was some sort of cleaner in the meat. Called el faro to express our dilemma and all I got was attitude. Headed up there to show employees the horrible tasting food. Which quickly was followed with more attitude and the cooks and or cook started speaking profanities and insults in Spanish about myself and my co worker. Not realizing I speak fluent Spanish. Horrible horrible place!!! Never ever again! Do yourself a favor and stay away. If I could give it negative stars, I would!

HORRIBLE! Tostados were not hardshell... just a soggy taco.  Barbocoa meat was eh but tons of fat..tacos were bad as well as carne asada/steak.  Ordered a steak chimichanga, received ground beef in it...they look big just loaded with lettuce..BAD! Tamales smelled spoiled were dry and not good.  The only decent thing was the torta but really can't mess that up.  Horchata really watered down

Place: this spot is decent sized. It's not a huge spot and not small where you feel crammed in. But it is hard to see from McLean so you might have to look out for their sign or neighboring spots. Their bathrooms are maintained and seats and floor stay clean. I constantly come in here and see an employee cleaning something. 

I also wouldn't recommend this particular location for any parties or large sized groups due to seating and how busy it gets during lunch time. 

Food: I've tried torta, taco, and burrito. So I'm basing my review on these foods. I like the streak the most. Good flavor and it's not dry. The Carnitas (shredded pork) is dry and doesn't have much taste. The Barbacoa contains absolutely no flavor at all. I would recommend the three items I've had here just be more selective with meat choice. Steak and chicken can do no wrong. But the rest comes down to preference. 

The waitress is always nice and polite when I come in. I work nearby and come in all the time. I'd recommend this restaurant AT LEAST for a first time try. 

I also want to note this place offers daily lunch specials and Menudo on weekends. They also have chips and salsa that you can grab yourself (self-serve). They also have jalapeos, lime and red/green available to grab

Oops, accidentally posted this review for the wrong location in Elgin...so here it is in the correct place now!

This place is near a friend's house so we decided to give them a try for dinner take-out.  The carnitas (pork) in my burrito was dry!  I've never had dry carnitas before so I'm not sure if this was leftover from the day before or what, but I was very disappointed.  The other ingredients in the burrito were fine and they are HUGE!  One burrito would easily be two meals for me.  My friend had the steak burrito and he said his steak was also on the dry & not tender side.  Hmm.  Perhaps they didn't have as busy of a Monday or Tuesday lunch hour so this meat wasn't fresh...

I will say I loved their refried beans and rice!  So flavorful I could have eaten those as my entire meal.

I'm sure we'll give them a try for other stuff again so hopefully I'll have a better review update to share in the future.

I love the El Faro chain - I have been going to the one in East Dundee for years but today I found myself in this part of town.

I got the El Pastor Burrito - dang, I forgot how huge they are.  Like a different reviewer noted, this thing was as big as a football...and only $5 with tax!  It was so huge it'll be lunch for two days.

The flavor was great and the salsas made my sinuses burn - which is a good thing this time of year-clears the sinuses!  :)

Of the three El Faro's I've been to, this is the nicest one. Not a bad place to grab a bite (the burritos are HUGE and usually a good deal) and catch up on your Mexican soap operas if you're into that kind of thing ;) 

Portions usually border on the generous (did I mention the HUGE burritos??) and pretty well priced compared to other places. It's not the dirtiest place around but far from the cleanest either. For the location to my daily routine and the money, it's not a bad place at all. 

There are other Mexican places within a short drive I'd prefer to go to, but overall, I'll be back in line for my HUGE burrito :)
Chicken enchiladas are amazing.  Good prices,  service is satisfactory, pretty clean. Hard to see from McLean but worth the hunt.
Great authentic Mexican food for a good price. Their horchata is great too, and they have plentiful servings of food. Restaurants a little small but this is the best El Faro of the three in my area!
We have been in El Faro numerous times for their burritos. Always good and always filling.

Been coming to El Faro at Tyler Creek Plaza for lunch for a few years and have never been disappointed.

Absolutely love the Enchilada Suiza and the Rice and Beans are always fresh and delicious.   The freshly made salsa and other condiments are delicious. There is also always a selection of homemade Empanada's and the Horchata is so tasty.

Entertainment is always guaranteed with a flat screen that runs Mexican soaps at lunch.  There are daily lunch specials to save you a few $.

About the only downside is if you come towards the end of the lunch crowd you are left with plastic forks and knifes when they run out of regular silverware :)

They place looks very clean and the staff is always cleaning up so you feel good about the food quality.  I can only recommend you check it out.
Authentic Mexican food made by the people who invented it. Well priced not badly proportioned. The flavor is pretty good.

This El Faro location is great for a quick lunch.  It's a smaller restaurant that gets quite crowded at lunch time so the earlier you go the better.  

It's definitely nothing fancy.  You place your order at the counter and get your own drinks, chips and salsa.  But it's authentic Mexican food served fast and at a good price.

The chicken taco salad is one of the BEST I have ever had.  It's huge and comes with rice and beans on the plate.  The salad is actually more than enough food, it is loaded with chicken, so I rarely have room for the sides, but they are tasty. 

I love that they have a little serve yourself pico de gallo/salsa set up.  Both are fresh and yummy.

Not impressed.  The tamales were dry, had almost no filling and didn't even seem homemade...more like a frozen tamale overcooked in a microwave.  Carnitas meat was plentiful but extremely dry.  The chorizo burrito was tasty but not worth driving our of your way for one.  Liked the extreme heat on both of their salsas but the overall flavor was meh.  Most of the tables were dirty and the only staff on duty for dinner was an order taker and cook.  Given their reputation I would give them another try but will lower my expectations.

It's your usual mexican fare, but a little on the pricey side. IAnd FYI when they say spicy, they do mean spicy. If you're in the neighborhood and hankering for a taco, go for it, but it's not something to drive out of the way for.

This El Faro, in Tyler Creek Plaza, is my favorite place to eat. I love Mexican food, and I've been to every Mexican place in the area. This El Faro is the best in my opinion because the rice and beans are great, the service is good and fast, the food is authentic, and this place is very clean. If you eat in, they have self-serve chips and pico de gallo. They have awesome daily specials and everyday specials and are open till 11pm on weekdays. If you want to get a delicious burrito the size of a newborn baby, this is the place for you. The enchiladas are also legit, great mole sauce, but you can get verde or red. You can't go wrong with the tacos. Try a chorizo taco with onion and cilantro for brunch one day and you won't be sorry. I would definitely recommend getting something authentic, like tacos, enchiladas, burritos or 
tortas though if you eat here, not quesadillas, taco salad or nachos.
It was good taco.

I just had to update my review after trying the Gluten Free crust on my latest visit. So glad I took the risk and did. The crust was very good, especially for being GF. I was afraid that the crust would ruin the pizza, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was delicious. If you are looking for a good pizza, with a good GF crust, look no further than Raimondo's!!

I love pizza. Pizza is my go to and I would eat it 7 days a week if it wouldn't cause obesity. But this pizza is GARBAGE. It is in no way shape or form a good pizza place. Only nice thing about this place is that they have a bar. But it makes sense because Raimondos needs to liquor up people for them to want to eat this food. 

SKIP IT! It's TRASH.

Family Italian -
When you order the pizza they make it from scratch so it takes a little longer, but worth the wait! GREAT beer selection. Appetizers rule, try the artichoke flatbread, amazing.
Bring the kids or make it a date night. If your lucky enough to be there on a night when Mike is IN THE HOUSE strike up a conversation. 
It is genuine Italian from start to finsh. ENJOY

Great beer selection, great pizza and italian beef. Their pizza of the month is always unique and delicious. For the person that's complaining of the long wait for pizza.....it's worth it, enjoy a good beer that's not miller light and have some patience. 
The owner is a great guy that will talk beer knowledge with you all day long which I loved. They have limited beers that you'll never see at another restaurant.....
support the small businesse owner...this guy is my hero and the service is great....if you go during dinner time in the subarbs then your expectations should be set accordingly (stop your whining) about the wait.

Excellent Service and delicious food. Just hosted a grand opening for my daughters nail salon adjacent to Raimondos.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good pizzas and the best wings in the fox valley area!   The owners are down to earth people!   It's our new favorite place to meet up with family and friends!  Try them today!
Had a few friends try the wings and this is how they describe them:  wings are the bomb.com!
LOVE THIS PLACE! Extremely unique & you have the all around experience here. The Italian nachos were great & the large beer selection. Will be back!

First time we ordered from here the pizza was amazing. On to the 3rd time we have ordered, 3 of the 18" pizzas. Their concept of extra cheese is lacking. Definitely not $96 including tip worthy pizza. We will definitely be searching elsewhere for delivery pizza due to lack of consistency of quality.

Disappointed. 

This is a place that my husband and I really wanted to like. We went the first time and our experience was pretty bad. Well, so we gave it a second chance and it wasn't much better. It takes a while to get the pizza and it states on the menu that their "homemade pies" take 25-30 minutes to make. 


SERVICE:
Not the greatest. Maybe they're understaffed like so many of the reviews say, but hire some people! There are tons of unemployed Americans that need jobs. Whatever. It took a few minutes for us to be seated both times, even though there were booth open and not a ton of families there at the time. I asked for tips on drinks, but the waitress told me she doesn't drink beer. Ok, but my question was on the cider. Ok, I'm not going to ding her for not drinking alcohol. She never offered us another round, nor brought us water. After finishing our drinks during the appetizer, she never was really around for longer than a second to even think about bringing us anything.
My husband said that he would give the service 3 stars, but I disagree..closer to 1-2.


FOOD:
Garlic bread:
We ordered the garlic bread as an appetizer. We received it maybe 15 minutes after ordering it. For what it was, it should've taken 10 minutes. It was overdone and burnt **the second pic is of the garlic bread they brought out second". It was literally rock hard. Also, no garlic. The second basket brought was better and not hard, but still just like glorified toast. It was like an italian beef roll cut in quarters and toasted, then with butter on it. No fresh garlic, and not even the crappy garlic powder that some restaurants use for their garlic bread. Pretty disappointed.

Pizza:
Good, but nothing to write home about. I like the texture of the braided crust, but there's really nothing else that is greater than average. About 2-3 pieces of nickel sized sausage per piece of our sausage and garlic pizza. Average pizza, that's what I would call it.

Drinks:
They have a good selection beer/cider/wine list. For that, I give them a star. Unfortunately, the average bar has a good selection.

It takes a significant amount of time to order, wait for food, and then wait for the bill after finishing food. The service isn't the greatest. I wish we would've had a better time, either time, but we won't be back. With so many other pizza places in the area, we won't be back.

BEST GLUTEN FREE PIZZA IN THE AREA!!! I have tried many Pizza places trying to find the best GF Pizza, and I found it here at Raimundo's. The crust is delicious and I think the cheese they use is of great quality as you can tell in the taste. The GF wings they have are also very tasty and not spicy at all. They only have the Hot n Spicy flavor and I was a little worried about trying them at first, but I'm glad I did. They were tender and packed with taste, without making my mouth feel like it was on fire. I also really like the fact that every time I call to place an order, the person answering the phone is friendly and isn't trying to rush you off the phone. Great place to grab a quick bite to eat, for a drink and appetizers, and also for a family dinner.
One of the few places to get pizza by the slice. I like to have them cook it for an extra 3 minutes or else it is too flimsy. Portions are a good size

Great pizza. Terrible service. Looking at you Lauren L Ticket #79255 (in case anyone researches or cares). 

This is my first review only because this was way outside of the norm of service you receive anywhere and management, as well as potential patrons, need to be aware and have some expectations set if you are lucky to have our server.

We were in town for a family reunion. This place had solid reviews both in ratings and quantity. It was not very busy, maybe two other tables, and we were greeted by a sweet girl directing us to our table. 

And that's when it went downhill. How you may ask when we just walked in? It started with our server beginning to take our drink orders and abruptly saying she will be back when someone yelled at her from the oven. This set the tempo as our server brought everything over with the cold hand of indifference including her robotic, insincere, and minimal conversational tone. 

For the record, we ordered a few drinks and a bottle of wine, Valley of the Moon, from their reserve menu along with several pizzas and some gelato for our daughter. EVERYTHING was GREAT. 

Disappointing we had to get her attention to get anything. You know...as in pretending we were waving down a plane to rescue us at one point. She was not engaging. No refills on beer or coke offered. Our bottle of wine was brought over, sans cork, already open with two glasses. She was never in any hurry. Making eye contact was difficult and when it did happen it provided the opposite reaction from what we needed. I walked over to the bar and register, where she was hiding from giving any additional discretionary effort, and I begin speaking to my 8yr old daughter about dessert. We eventually ordered there, with her, because why would we not want someone to ask us if we needed dessert as is the almost knee jerk reaction tradition of any server. Kudos for being different. She did not look up. I finally asked what the gelato flavors were where she recited. We choose and walked back. 

Her engagement was reminiscent of a 160 character restriction on Twitter. She only thanked us while we were walking out, which obviously was facetious and muscle memory.

We tipped 20% because who knows what day she had. I hope it gets better. For me, if I lived here I would never return because of the very negative, memorable experience we had. 

Again great pizza! But maybe you need a buffet because we could have fumbled around serving and smiling at our table ourselves...or hire nicer robots.

Their home made sauce is delicious! Great beer selection, & a nice glass of port rounds out a lovely lunch.
We only visit Chicago once a year but make sure we grab a bite here before we leave.
Service was pretty good. However the crust was a bit soggy  and the sauce a little dry

This is a great place for beer and pizza and their Italian dinners and sandwiches are also top notch. What sets this place apart is the fine selection of European beers. Mike knows his stuff and will take the time to explain the various choices and discuss your taste preferences to make an appropriate recommendation to try. I have not been disappointed yet. Also save room and try the Belgium Ale Cherry Bomb for desert. Who would have thought that beer and ice cream could go together so well?
Excellent Pizza. Great friendly staff..make you feel like family. The Godfather pizza is awesome. Not skimpy on ingredients! Yes, I would take my Mother there too.
Great unique beer selection, friendly staff, and great food!

Good food. The price for two small pizzas was $41.00. 
We felt it was a little over priced. The delivery service though was on point. 
Maybe they should offer coupons to help with the prices.

Best pizza in the area, hands down.  The veggie pizza is delicious (add pepperoncini). They always have a fun, special pizza of month.  The staff is amazing.  Plan on spending some time there because it's worth enjoying the atmosphere and meeting the staff.  Most importantly, the beer list is always top notch.  If you have any questions or are curious to try new beers, ask the staff. Everyone is very much "in the know".  Great place for a family pizza night!

I can't say enough great things about this place. We had reservations next door at the Turf Room and it was SO busy there, we couldn't even get a drink while we waited. 
No one gave us the time of day. :( 

SO, we wandered into Raimondos and never regretted our decision not only to get a drink but stay there and eat. 

We were warmly greeted by the owner Mike and his descriptions of the food and beer were beyond words. It felt like we came home to "moms house" and we were immediately amongst friends and  family. 

The beers were refreshing and delightful. Mike described each beer like a sommelier describes wine. So passionate! 

The food was to die for! We plan to return home again to "moms house" (aka Raimondos) SOON! 

What a great experience! I highly recommend this place.

I have to tell you the lower ratings are concerning What is wrong with people? :) We are long time fans of raimondos and from reading yelp reviews, it would seem one must either love it or hate it. I guess we go in the love category. I have had 2 parties here, both in the range of 30 guests, and I have dined her on several occasions. Maybe others prefer pizza made ahead? I just don't get it. To make a pizza this good it takes time!! It is not sitting in a box on a hot plate or under a burner.  Put your phones away and spend some quality time with your guest while waiting! Talk, enjoy a drink, laugh a little! Enjoy the ambiance!

Great pizza and great conversation with the owner Mike. He certainly takes his pizza and beer serious but really prided himself on how he relates to his guests. I'm a pizza snob so when I said it was good it is certainly worth eating.

Great service. My girlfriend and I decided to build our own pizza and the waitress matched the price to a pizza that had almost the same ingredients. All of such made the bill decently less expensive. All the employees are really friendly.

We continue to love this place and updated menu only makes it better!

Try the spinach and artichoke flatbread - it's got an extra zip that makes it awesome!!

The pizzas are great and I love the new pasta choices. 

Looking for dessert? Try their homemade options!

And yes, the beer selection is great! They have successfully converted me from a wine only drinker. 

But honestly - it's all about the people. Whether it's Mike or his mom or his dad - they care about you as a customer and  a person. And of course Ryan, Kelsey and all the wait staff are great people. Eric and the crew make great food and Andy and the behind the scenes crew really do an awesome job. Sometimes it takes longer than if you went to a fast food place but hey, that's ok, because I love anyplace where I can relax, have a great meal , and chat with people who treat you like family.

Upon entering Raimondo's, you immediately note the decor. Did someone actually envisage a vintage 1950's pizza joint with a modern day spin? The floor plan is open with plenty of classic booths. It's simple, inviting and it works. The view at the end of the bar allows you to continually scan the entire operation. I liked the environment, not so much the pizza.

Basically the yelp reviews are telltale with a very clear point; if you serve "Craft Beers" & "Signature Pizza" you must be "Kick-Ass-Good"! NFW! 

Again, the beer selection and  Customer Service dominate each review. A description of "Taste" is brief and secondary in thought. Agree, management and staff will kill you with "Kindness"!

However, what about the taste?  BLAND. "Ach-N-Lou's" Pizza Pub in Aurora smokes this place. By severe contrast, "Emil's" pizza found in Woodman's freezer case will inspire your taste buds.

Our 16" Thin Crust...Sausage, Mushroom, Onion & Black Olive arrived cool to the touch with a spongy crust. Not OK, let it be known this is the first time in a while I did not scorch the roof of my mouth!  A pathetic presentation equaled in taste.

I'm sorry, if your looking for a classic tavern style pizza, look elsewhere. But if your pizza taste buds crave the "Hand Crafted Italian Beef and Giardiniera", The" B-L-T"or the "Bacon Cheeseburger" SIGNATURE PIZZA PIE...hey, this is your place.

For me, the above is best served on fresh bread as a sandwich, not pizza.

C'mon people

Great pizza place!  So nice to be able to eat gluten free pizza that doesn't taste like cardboard. They have many gluten free options, including non-pizza items, that are very good. Staff is friendly. Decent-sized bar. My husband really enjoys the beer selection.  Food can take a little longer than other places to come out, so keep that in mind.  It's worth the wait, but maybe not if you go in their starving hungry!
Visited from out of town and had a great meal.  Place was open late, service was great, coke was good, pizza and cheese bread was good.

Okay Yelp??? 4.5 Stars???

(One side note before I get into this, since I've been in restaurants most of my life, I'm going to say that they were understaffed and there was a major issue that they just didn't mention to anybody, so take this as you will)

We sat down and the restaurant wasn't even half full, we then proceeded to wait and wait and wait and wait for pizza. I have never in my life got up before I received the food, but in this case I had to get it to go and left... I understand pizza can take a while, but wow... The only thing that I ate while I was there was the garlic bread, not my cup of tea and when we did finally eat the pizza, I was even less impressed.

My other gripe is that our server kept taking her order pad and despite the fact that she has an apron with multiple pockets, stuck it in the back of her pants by her underwear. Frankly, I don't want your hands touching anything that's touched your butt, if they are going to touch my food.
I love going here when I am in the area. The staff is so friendly, the beer is great, and overall it's very chill. I have only had pizza and gelato from here.

Best pizza in the western burbs for sure. Owner is friendly and went out of his way to make my order complete. You have to stop by for even a slice when passing by. The sauce is great and all the ingredients are fresh. Make it a goal to stop I promise you won't be disappointed.

Sadly disappointed. 

First time there is was really good.  One of the owners greeted and sat us - told us a bit about the family owned restaurant and fresh ingredients and specialities - and the food was really good. The marinara was really good and the meatballs were awesome.  We went back a few more times and thought that we found a nice spot we would be coming to for years. 

So...why the 2 stars?  Well, we went back about a month ago and had really bad and slow service. We sat a long time and waited for the server to come and greet us at the table. Then it took a very long time for each phase of the meal and we actually got the feeling we were more of a bother to the server than anything. He didn't seem to really care to do his job one bit. We chalked it up as a one off and that maybe he was having a bad day.  But... We went back again last night and had a very similar experience.  Eventually that same waiter came over, but only to tell us that our waitress is coming soon. She did, and we order a very simple meal: 2 unsweetened iced teas, a meatball sandwich, and the bruschetta. It took 10 minutes for her to bring us the very watered down iced tea (might as well just drink water). Then it took another 47 minutes to get our food. Yes, I timed it after the iced teas took so long.  47 minutes for a meatball sandwich and bruschetta!  Unfriendly, blah attitudes to with that awful service too.  To add insult to injury, my wife got sick that night and I felt like complete crap too. 

Could it be us?  Did we do something to piss them off?  Why the crappy service?  We are not demanding people and always treat people in restaurants nicely regardless of how they are because 1) we are respectful; 2) we don't want spit and boogers in our food. Plus, we always tip - even when the service is not deserving. So, it seems to me that it's just how this place operates. Regardless, the service is so bad that we will just go elsewhere. 

Oh yah, 2 stars. Well, the 3 non stars are for the last 2 servers and experience, plus the decline in food and getting sick. The 2 stars given are because I know the owner is a good guy and we had a nice experience with him our first few visits. Too bad his servers don't have the same attitude with customer service as he does.
Excellent service, phenomenal food. The specialty pizzas are great, and such an awesome beer selection! Super friendly staff, family-owned and it feels like it, in a good way.

What's good about this place is the food, especially the pizza, and the beer selection. The problem with Raimondo's is actually getting the pizza and the beer. You see, the service is non-existent. 

My significant other and I stopped in today at 5 pm.  We were greeted immediately by a polite waitress who advised our server would be by shortly. After waiting 15 minutes without another visit from their staff, we left. 

My advice?  If you're looking for a slice of Raimondo's deliciousness, arrange for carry out instead.
Completely terrible service, due to that I did not order a single item from the menu.

Overpriced and the pizza was pretty mediocre (I got the Godfather pizza). Ordered the pizza for pickup, was told it would be 20 minutes. I ended up having to wait an additional 25 minutes for the pizza to be ready. Not only that but they put meat on my wife's half of the pizza. She doesn't eat meat so naturally this was a bit of an issue. We were told we could have a small credit on a future bill (we have no idea how much this credit will be fore and are not even sure we want to return).

The service was so slow. It took 7 minutes to wait to get a table but no one else was waiting - they just couldn't bother to wait on us. When we complained about how long the pizza took - after 37 minutes with no one coming to check on us or refill our drinks - they said it was because everything was handmade. Are they making the dough from scratch that moment??? You can get a deep dish pizza from scratch and have it to your table sooner. Some employees said 20-25 minutes to get a pizza; another said 30. No matter what, it took 45 minutes with almost no other customers for us to get a pizza. The frustrating part is, the waiter just kept making excuses about being shorthanded - but 7 people working when it is not busy is not shorthanded - it is inefficiency. My husband worked at a pizza place for years and said that their timing was extraordinary.

Finally! A great neighborhood pizza place on the west side. We love their pizza and everything we've tasted so far. We will
Keep coming back for more!

The owners are very friendly and always make great conversation. Beer selection is great and we really enjoy it every time!

It's ok. I guess for that area it's the best around for what it has to offer. Service was slow but she was doing what she could. What's odd is the wife and I felt sick after leaving there not sure if it's what we ate or not. To sum it up The restaurant itself is nice the food ahh...And prices are on the higher side. I don't believe I would go back.

I'd like to add more stars.... But the service is not pleasant and 50 minutes for a dine in pizza is toooooo long.  I mentioned to the waitress the diet pop was off went over like a turd in a punch bowl. Overheard the manager telling people they were short on staff... Too bad or discount my check for bad or slow service. I like the pizza but the service stinks.
I love this place!! The food is delicious!! The owner is always nice to me each time I go in and remembers me every time! Definitely will keep going back!

I wish I could give .5 stars...because this is more like a 2.5. 

So this may fall into what I call the "Hangover Effect". I saw rave reviews and had high hopes. (This happened with that movie The Hangover - people said it was the most hilarious movie ever made of all time EVER...I saw It.  I laughed once. I believe I may have laughed at least double that, had it not been so, so hyped.)

Anyway - I was intrigued with Italian Nachos. Whaaat? turns out, it was sauce and cheese over nacho chips with Italian beef sprinkled on top (for $2 more bucks). 
Overall it was a little disappointing. 

We got the "original crust" ala supremo. So...and maybe those of you in North Aurora had once experienced the nectar of Gods that was Franks Pizza - and if so, please know that this is where I was - Franks was our favorite. But this was not Franks. Boo. The crust was bland. It was crusty on the outside and warm and pillowy on the inside, but it lacked depth beyond that. The sauce was under seasoned. actually, the whole pizza seemed under seasoned. I mean, it wasn't the worst pizza by any stretch of the imagination - but it didn't blow any socks off either. Also - when the menu said "ask for dipping sauce" with the crust style - we did and we thought it would be garlic butter sauce...and it wasn't. just bland marinara. Lesson learned.

The service was extraordinarily friendly. There was one young guy in there running the whole of front of house-  the bar and all the tables and the running of food. It wasn't that busy but that kid was working his tail off. 

We heard the beer selection was awesome, but we weren't drinking and frankly, I am not a beer person but maybe that would change things...the Italian beef that had been sprinkled on our nachos was good and I would consider returning to try the beef on its own...but probably not the pizza.

Sweet Pizza, great beer, good people. The owners are nice as hell. I'll be back every time I'm back in Chicago. 


Highly recommend the "Godfather slice"

I have lunch here twice a week. I eat during off hour's but everything's been great and fresh. They are located in a strip mall, please don't let that scare you away! I've never had their pizza, but I've had all of their sandwiches and pastas to feel comfortable enough to judge! Italian beef, meatball sub, and Italian chicken sandwich have all been four stars!! The sandwiches have always been fresh and full of flavor!! With this knowledge I don't see why the pizza wouldn't follow. If I'm wrong please let me know, I believe they're on point!

Very good pasta dishes and the wings are to die for.  I do like their selection of beer is very comprehensive.  Overall in house service is pretty good and attentive.

Ordered delivery one time and it was kind of slow....and we are only about 5 minutes away.  I picked it up the next time, it was very good quality pizza.

My favorite are the pasta dishes....very good portions for $12....usually can only eat half of the servings.

My husband and I just moved into the area, so the first thing we wanted to do was try out some new places. So, using the excuse that I still didn't have my kitchen organized enough to cook, we headed out to try Raimondo's. 

First of all, the thing that got us here is that they have a pretty nice beer selection. While I wish a little more was on draft, the bottled selection was diverse and exciting. Even better, their staff really seems to have a passion for it and took to suggesting beers for us based on what we had already ordered. 

We ordered a double dough with giardiniera and sausage. The pizza was really delish! The toppings were clearly very fresh and sauce was fantastic. Normally left over pizza is just something I need to get through, but I was super excited to come home the next night and heat it up again. It really was a well made delicious pizza. I'm excited to try more combinations of toppings as they definitely give you a TON of choices. 

One of the owner's came over and asked how everything was and mentioned that he didn't think he'd seen us in there before (they clearly know their customers). We told him we just moved in and he insisted we have some gelato on the house. It was such a nice gesture. He also asked where we were at and let us know that they deliver as well, which is great! Its a nice atmosphere, so I'd definitely like to dine in and enjoy the beer selection most of the time, but having the delivery option is always good too. 

If you are in the area and in the mood for some homemade fresh pizza, don't pass this place up! I know we will definitely be back.

I can't believe I haven't already written this. My wife went to Raimondo's with a friend a while ago and told me I should check it out because they have a pretty interesting beer selection and the beer guy there (Mike) is pretty enthusiastic about it. 

Well, she was right and it's one of my favorite places now. The beer selection is excellent (especially for trying stuff you may not be able to get in the stores), the pizza is fantastic, the pastas and sandwiches are great, and even the gelato is good. 

Beyond all of that, though, is the atmosphere. There are people enjoying beers at the bar, older folks, younger folks, and lots of families when we go. My 2-year-old son asks me about Susie and Ryan and Mike a lot - he loves the attention they give him (and the pizza, of course). 

There are beer tasting events, charitable events, and other cool community things all the time. I had my first beer from Solemn Oath there, for example. Also, after their St. Baldrick's event, most of the staff was shaved bald! That's some commitment. 

Overall, I miss the old-fashioned pizza joints from the past. (Charlotte's, Shakey's, etc.) There's a personality to them that's not manufactured by some marketing focus group. Raimondo's has that warmth and personality. It's just a nice place with great food and excellent people.

If you want some tasty Italian food, accompanied by a huge (sophisticated) beer selection, while being killed with kindness from the wait staff and owner, this place is for you. My personal favorite is the spaghetti with sausage and my kids love the ravioli. The garlic bread that comes with your pasta dish is also a nice combo of butter and garlicky goodness. I also recommend that you try the Italian Nachos appetizer, an interesting combo of tortilla chips, marinara sauce, hamburger and cheese. As alluded to earlier, on most occasions the owner visits our table and is genuinely interested in us and likes to talk "craft brews," which I also enjoy. Pay them a visit soon!

Good customer service. Sub par food. I ordered buffalo wings and pizza. The pizza was ok. The thin crust was not crisp and they were very stingy with the toppings. It tasted okay, but not great. 
The buffalo wings were terrible. The skin was rubbery and the sauce was tasteless. When I returned them the owner explained to me that they're supposed to be that way!!? He explained that they do not make them themselves. They also bake them because they don't have a fryer. He buys this brand because they are gluten free (no breading). While I appreciate that the business has gluten free options I am not gluten sensitive and wanted crispy tasty buffalo wings, not baked chicken with gross sauce. He did however refund my money without question or argument which I appreciated. 
We went here another time before for a very fun st bald ricks event and it was great. Good beer and cider selection.

Stopped in tonight and had great service and great pizza.  We went thin crust versus the double-dough.  I'm a d-d fan but with my son and wife, they are primarily thin.

Sausage was good on the pizza and service was fast, pleasant and accurate.

Can't wait to stop back to try other items on the menu.  Welcome BACK you guys.  I've lived in North Aurora since '98 and missed you when you left.

Pizza = Awesome (Both Double Dough and Thin Crust)
Pasta = Awesome (You get at least 2 servings with one order)
Atmosphere = Family oriented, sincere and very, very nice neighborhood joint.  I leave here on a Friday night feeling better than when I came in and that's only after having one beer.
Large Groups = No problem.  They have a private room in the back with a door so you don't have to deal with the noise from the restaurant.  My book club meets here every month (15 people) and we get the best service.

First visit to Raimando's tonight.  Saw all the good reviews and thought we'd try it out.  Pizza was very good for the price.  Their thin crust was almost New York style in a way.  Good sauce and good overall taste.  Definitely would go back.

Went there with the family tonight.  This was a first visit.  I had driven by it many times and kept saying I need to try this place.  Well I shouldn't have waited.  Great food, great service, and great prices about sum it up.  

We started off with the cheesy garlic bread appetizer.  Real garlic, lots of cheese and what must be a homemade marinara sauce to dip it in.  Next was a medium half sausage half mushroom original pizza.  The mushrooms where fresh and tasty and the sausage was out of this world.  Same great sauce as the appetizer.  

Don't remember the servers name, but attentive would be an understatement.  He kept the drinks filled, made sure we had everything we needed and could not have done a better job.

The decor is modern and comfortable.  Everything is clean.  Plenty of parking.  

Add in a couple of soft drinks and we were out the door for $26 + tip.  

We will be back!
One of the best pizzas I have had (Godfathers)!!  The spaghetti and meat sauce was outstanding. If I ever come back to Aurora, I would definitely eat here.

We go here a couple times a month.  Pizza slices are easy to get and good.  The meatball sandwich is great.  Never seems to busy (which is nice).  Great place for the family or just to get some gelato.

Finally got around to trying Raimondo's today for lunch. Wasn't sure if this was just a sit down place or if it was a order at the counter place. I was happy when I arrived today that I can order at the counter and get Pizza by the slice. Raimondo's saved me from the nasty pizza hut express down the street. The pizza here is home made and taste great. The people here are friendly and accommodating. The restaurant was also very clean and much nicer then my other lunch alternatives.  Because I went during work hours I didn't get to try any of the beers but they also have a great beer selection with many different selections. Looking forward to coming back and trying one of the sandwitches or Itialian dishes.

The service is good and the owner makes a point to remember us and the kids. My wife and I are both gluten free. The pizza is really good considering our situation and is, in our opinion, the best GF pizza in the area.

I love their bar. Amazing selection of microbrews and foreign beers. The service is great, too. The only reason they're getting a 4-Star Rating is because I'm really picky about my pizza. I'm not a fan of the food, but to be fair, ALL of my friends are. Great place!

Pizza is good, good selection of craft beers. A bit on the pricey side though. I would give this place 4 stars if the pricing was a bit more consistent with the quality of the pizza, worth checking out though the pizza is good, and if you like a beer with your pizza the selection is good and interesting.

It is great to have such a delicious go-to spot for reasonably priced lunch or dinner. The food is 5 star quality. I especially love the ravioli and bruschetta!

The service however, is hit or miss. I am hoping this is simply due to the newness of the business. Three out of 5 times we have had great service. The other two times were awful - one resulting in us walking out after being seated for 10 minutes without being acknowledged (this was on an extremely busy evening but nonetheless not an excuse)! 

I will continue to be a customer because of the times we have had a wonderful experience, along with the delicious food. I will try to stick to weekdays or lunch hours if dining in though.

I really don't know why it has taken so long for me to review this place, but this is the best combination of pizza and beer I have ever had the pleasure of indulging in... and I do indulge here quite often.  The pizza and lasagna rank as some of the best in the area.  I've had other foods here, but those are the best.  The beer selection is fantastic with a focus on imported and craft beers.  My wife and I are pretty regular customers, and we are on a first name basis with most of the staff.

A few things I will point out.  The service is good, but at times a bit slow.  That's not a problem for most people.  I've always felt that the atmosphere is one that invites you to stay, drink, and have a good time.  However, some times we are in a hurry and still want to eat in.  There's an easy solution.  Just call your order in on your way out the door, and you'll have a quicker meal.

Ordered pizza for delivery. Crust was gross - soggy and undercooked. They were generous with the toppings, but the crust was too flimsy to withstand them. The order was also wrong - girl I spoke too on the phone didn't seem to understand the concept of ordering toppings on half of the pizza. Not worth the time, money or calories.
The italian beef was very tasty, only problem is I ordered a combo! Oh and I didnt get the pickle I was promised either.  Good beer selection and friendly staff.

Uhm hello. I love this place. 
Nicest service ever from a place where I'm not a regular. 
Pizza was damn good, maybe not as authentic as the love of my life (v&v paesano..mmmm) but very good. 
I love how there's a bar here. Also, they offer a selection of craft beers that is ever changing. 
My bf and I came in on a Friday night-- we ordered wings (which I can't eat, tear) and a supreme pizza (half veggie) and were immediately told our wait time. That like never happens.  The owner (can't for the life of me remember his name) came over and chatted us up, talked about the history of Raimondo's (previously located on 31 from 1989-01), and his status as a craft brew aficianado.  I honestly don't recall what they had on tap-- I'm strictly wine/vodka for the most part, but you could tell he was very passionate about his beer..and his business.
According to my bf, the wings were excellent, and as I mentioned before-- the pizza (and wine) were great.  The service bumped this pace up to 5 stars for me, it was so accomodating and genuine, no fake niceness here!!

I'm always on the run so it's nice to have a place to stop in and get good food fast.  My husband gets Italian beef sandwiches and pizza-by-the-slice from Raimondo's several times a week.  Their pizzas are really good and they offer pies all day long (either made to order or by-the-slice.) 

I also really appreciate the hospitality they offer here.  Michael is very friendly and accommodating and always makes my husband and I feel very welcome.

In addition to good food and gelato, they also have a unique variety of wine and beer,  and both are priced very reasonably.
Great pizza! Best crust I've found in a long time. Sandwiches are okay but amazing beer selection

The food here is okay, parking is easy, the noise level is fine, and it's nice that the tv in the bar area shows things besides sports.  We've had a bunch of things from their menu but nothing food-wise really stood out to us other than the delicious marinara sauce for dipping their bread sticks.  The service from host and wait staff is pretty good.

We ordered a Sombrero pizza and it was
great!  The service was also fantastic. Thanks!!

Probably the most friendly and sociable staff I've ever witnessed. Not to mention the actual customers dining there, it is literally like being on the set of Cheers, everyone wants to chit chat and converse, share stories and just shoot the breeze. The food, OUTSTANDING!! Ordered a large thin crust with sausage, black olives and mushrooms ..just so so so good! 

I tried their on-tap Oktoberfest by Bells brewing, and it was fantastic. The owner, Mike, then insisted that I try the Sam Adams Pumpkin Ale, claiming he was a big fan of it. Tried it, loved it! Buying a case asap as a matter of fact. 

But back to the point ... Raimondo's is an excellent place to get phenomenal food, and be surrounded and served by the greatest staff in Chicagoland, and friendliest people you can imagine. It's almost as if all the nicest people in the area just flock to this place to eat and watch the game and drink great beer. That's another thing ..their beer selection is out of this world!! You don't often find a place that offers the really rare and hard to find brews, you usually have to go deep into Chicago for that, and its usually $8+ per draft/bottle there! This is not your typical sports bar by any means ;) 

Reasonable prices, amazing food, great staff, wonderful and friendly atmosphere, fast service and a top notch beer selection. Yeah, I'll be back :D 

-Ryan

So nice to see a "family owner/operator" establishment like we did years ago. Whether it's seeing the "dad" blending his homemade sauces, or "mom" being there & ready to help in any capacity it's truly nice to see their level of care. As a lot of these comments make mention of the owner Michael being knowledgable as he is in not only their homemade menu, but his knowledge of the extensive craft beer menu which he takes allot of pride in & should really helps to narrow down what exactly most likely you'd want. I'd say keep it up, but in a family type establishment such as this, I'm quite confident the actions in which they display are genuine, & they'll naturally keep it up what they're so good at doing...

With the abundance of pizza places in this area, you have to be really, really good to stand out. This place was just.. good.

We actually went here based on the huge amount of 5 star ratings, and I wasn't as impressed as the reviews indicated. We ordered 3... yes 3, different pizzas, and all were... OK.  One veggie pizza, one custom (bacon, sausage, pepperoni), and the "Godfather" (italian beef & giardiniera). I myself wasn't a fan of the "original" crust.. just too doughy for me.. if I return I'd definitely go with the thin crust.  I could only finish 2 pieces of pizza, and it was mainly because of the dough... not the toppings.

Of the 3 (I tried all), the custom one was actually my favorite. The bacon was delicious, crisp and flavorful, and the "secret blend" sausage is quite good.  

Our server was decent, he knew a lot about the beer selections. One suggestion to the owners; provide a daily list of beers on a piece of paper or whatever so we don't have to stand up from our table and try to read the chalkboard every time we order a beer. 

The cheesy garlic bread appetizer we ordered was embarrassingly small. It's just bread and cheese, and at that price point, it simply needs to be a larger portion.

While we never spoke to the owner personally, he was making his rounds around the place and seemed nice and personable. We did make a reservation and was pleasantly surprised when we arrived that there was a table with a large "Reserved" sign on it with my name on the check. Bonus points for that.

I'm sure eventually we'll try this place again (my wife loves pizza), and I'll definitely go with the thin crust next time and probably order my own custom pizza.  Maybe that will make the difference. Good pizza, good service, and as Yelp indicates with a 3-star review, "A-OK".

They have a very diverse beer selection and the owner Mike is a true beer expert.   Their monthly specialty pizzas are unique and generally exceptional.  They also have multiple efforts to help charitable causes which is just another reason to support an awesome local business.  Check out their beer tasting sessions as a way to sample many unique beers, learn a lot about these unique brews,  have some great pizza and hang out with some great people.

This is a "great good place"!  It has a friendly atmospehere and very yummy pizza.  They have a really great beer list with some unique beers you wont normally find other places.  The owner - Michael - is a real gentleman and a truly nice person.  My wife and i have been in here about 5 times now and each time he says hello and we chat.  Most recently we sat at the bar and he helped us choose some new beers which were very enjoyable.  This is a place you should defnitely check out.  It doesnt try to be flashy but is very sincere in its service and its food.  You won't find a nice bunch of people either.

This restaurant is simply Frantastic!!!  The food is just divine. The "Godfather" pizza is out of this world. The ingredients of it just melt in your mouth and makes you longing for more. Besides the wonderful owner (Michael), the wine, gelato just complete the whole thing. What a great find in North Aurora. Graci!

Their Pizza is the BEST!!!!!!  When you order sausage and mushroom pizza it is overloaded to the tilt with sausage and mushroom, the way it should be done.  Seriously the best pizza place in North Aurora, and possible contender for the Fox Valley Area.  The chicken ceasar salad was HUGE, and tasty.  Great selection of beer, and the manager  or owner always comes by to see how everything is.  I would say skip the Turf Room (which is right next to this place) and grab a pizza instead.

We use to get their pizza at their old location years ago in North Aurora across from A&W. we were really bummed when they went out of business. Now their back and better than ever!  Awesome pizza and great selection of micro brewed beers. This is a must try!!!!!!!!  It just may end up being your favorite pizza place too!  It's definitely our families again.  Great food, Great service, great atmosphere, what more could you ask for?
Have been here twice for a monthly Book club meeting. Have tried the Lasagna and the pizza. Both were very tasty. Drinks are good too!

First off, I want to say this place is one of the few pizza places that makes gluten free pizza, and it is expensive, but better than eating sand, because almost everywhere else that offers gluten free pizza crusts are all the frozen- pre packaged type.  They are gritty and taste horrible.  This gluten-free is the best I have had from a pizza joint (but still not as good as the store bought SCAR crusts, Pastorelli's sauce, and some Sargento Mozzerella).  Problem is this, unless you are eating here, don't order it for take-out.  They are notorious for telling you a time over the phone and then making it very early.  It has happened three times (that I know of) in the last 4 purchases.  Once the owner even laughed about it like it was funny that my pizza had been sitting on top of the oven for 20+ minutes.  Honestly, don't understand why if you say on the phone 45 mins you would make it 20 mins early, but that is their deal.  I will not buy from here any more because it has happened multiple times already.  PS.  Don't believe Mike (the owners son), the first time this happened he was very apologetic and gave me a song and dace about they are a family business, give us another chance, yada, yada... then the last time, he acted like I was ridiculous for requiring that the pizza be made closer to the time specified time then 20 minutes and stated that I should take my business elsewhere because I was obviously too picky for them to make happy.  LOL!  Seriously, I cannot make this up.  Requiring a pizza establishment to make a pizza and it still be hot and edible when I pick it up, was too much to ask.

Just had their pizza of the month.  A Ruben pizza its even better than the Sombrero which was my favorite pizza anywhere!!! 

We usually stop in at Raimondo's a couple times a month to get my Pizza fix. Eight times out of ten we get their Sombrero Pizza the best Taco Pizza anywhere but had to try the Reuben pie which I didn't have for over ten years while they were gone.

 It was better than I remembered and instead of just St Pattys day they offer it all of March it is probably the BEST pizza I have ever ate. Stop by this month and try it you wont be disappointed .

The owners here really care about their customers after you've been there once the'll remember you forever too!!!!

I'm so happy to stumble on this place after my favourite pizza place closed.  The pizza is delicious.  The crust, although thin, isn't too hard and has a good flavour.  I love the sauce and the unique pies.  Definitely get an order of the garlic bread, which is simple but very garlic-y.

Another big reason to come here?  Pretty good beer selection.  They have a good variety of beers and seem to regularly change what they have.  I usually feel like I have to go to Geneva Alehouse to find good brews, but this place always pleases.

Had these guys deliver a gluten free pizza. I don't have to eat gluten free, I just chose to when I can. I have to say the pizza was excellent! The gelato was amazing as well. I will definitely be going to check them out for a sit down meal!

Rueben pizza for St. Patty's day-genius-and delicious. This is probably the most gourmet pizza joint of the main 3 near this corner. The owner is very engaging & easy to talk to. Yummy pastas from momma's old world recipes. Looking forward to trying the Cheeseburger pizza next. See ya soon

Went with a group the other night. Awesome family business. Had excellent service, great food and met a great family. Since there was a large group we tried both crusts. Tough choice, they were both good. Loved the pistachio gelato. Others had chocolate and it was gone instantly! Will definately go back.

Hands down, the best pizza place in the Fox Valley. It's nearly gourmet - and the only reason I say nearly is because it's fresh and fabulous without being pretentious. Here's a better way to explain it: When you walk in, it smells like the first really great pizza place you visited when you were a kid. The owner and his team are friendly and helpful - it's a family-run business and you can tell. Don't forget to try the gelato - pistachio or double chocolate - both are out of this world. If you love Gario's pizza but it's too far to drive so you settle for Eddie's or Charlie Fox's, try Raimondo's - you will never go anywhere else again.
Great service , Definitely try the Godfather pizza if you like spicy food! Also the beers on tap are a must try!!  Highly recommended :)

first time trying the pizza and I must report that i have had store bought/frozen pizza that tasted better!!!!!!!!  very generic crust, tasteless, soft and spongy.  jp p's review from 11/2/2013 pretty much sums it all up!  seems like the beer is the reason for the 4.5 star rating!  if you looking for good pizza, you won't find it here.

Love their pizza, especially the thin crust. The beer list is the best in North Aurora.  They have lots of craft beers, with a list that is constantly rotating. Family friendly, my kids crayon drawings are hanging on the wall. I get to come back later after the kids are in bed for some tasty brews, guided by Mike, who knows how to pick out just the right beer for you. Try this place out!

Changing my review.  I have been here a couple of times with friends. The pizza is really good. I love their specialty pizza. They have a great beer selection. The service is one of the best in the area. It's a very warm and friendly environment. The staff makes eye contact and are very genuine. If you're  lucky enough to meet one of the owners you'll feel good about giving them your business. I'm glad I gave them a second chance or else I would be missing out on a great place.

Great beer selection and the owner is always more than willing to help you choose something you'll love. Plus their pizza is probably the best in the area.  Just wish they had a bigger bar and more TVs.

This place is unbelievable! Friends told us to go and we kept putting it off...that's our loss! Great beer, amazing pizza and the crust?? To die for. We had so much fun the first night that we came back the next night. And we'll be here at least once a week. It's small and intimate but the service is personable and the food is amazing. Take time for the gelato. And add some cherry beer to make it a float. You'll thank me.

Discovered this restaurant through beermenus.com.  The pizza is great.  I love thin crust pizza the thinner the better and they will make the crust as thin as possible to order.  They carry a variety of craft beers that changes often and Michael always provides great beer suggestions.  The staff and owners are fantastic.  Customers are treated like family, whether you are a regular or a newby, and everyone appears to be genuinly happy that you are there.
We ordered take out on a lazy Saturday and the Cheeseburger pizza was very good and the service even better.
Great food at good prices. Cheesy garlic bread and pizza are awesome. Great eclectic beer selection. The owner is engaging and cares.
Great gluten free pizza. Free ingredients. Cold craft beers and a warm atmosphere. My family and I will become regulars at Raimondo's Pizza & Pub.
Nice to have a local joint that can make good pizza. Courteous staff and quick delivery.

The pizza and sandwiches are as good as it gets! My favorite sandwich is the Italian Beef and my favorite pizza is the Bacon Cheeseburger. The God Father is an Italian Beef and giardiniera pizza and is a must-try. The atmosphere inside is relaxed and friendly and the selection of beer and wine is excellent.

I missed out on Raimondo's the first time around, so we made sure to check it out when they re-opened in their new location. We love local businesses, especially when they are family -owned. 

We went at lunchtime and ordered an Ala Supremo pizza. While we waited, we enjoyed monster-sized Cokes and watched the lunch crowd. A lot of people had to wait for pizza by the slice as a new pepperoni pie was about to come out of the oven. I can imagine that this would irritate me if I had a short lunch break and just wanted a slice. However, they had only been open for 10 days, so I will cut them some slack. Nobody seemed angry, and the staff apologized multiple times. And there's something to be said for knowing that they have very fresh pizza by the slice. 

I normally hate the double-dough-style crusts, but this crust was awesome. I thoroughly enjoyed the crisp crust under the toppings and the delicious "pizza bone" left at the end. The pizza is heavy on the cheese, which was not at all a problem for us. Lots of great toppings. We really enjoyed our pizza.

The drink selection was a pleasant surprise. First, there are fountain Cokes. Yes - Coke at a pizza place! Their beer list is impressive, with many different microbrews and Oberon on tap. Amazing. Can't wait to go back for dinner.

There are very few pizza places in the suburbs I would return to. Raimondo's made the cut. We will be back, and we will bring friends.

Excellent lunch special for about $8.00. Two meats and two sides. Yum!

Got the falafel which was exquisite with a hint of cilantro and the spicy chili chicken which had a beautiful deep red colored sauce and had great taste ( delicate middle eastern spices). Cucumber sauce on the side was refreshing. I picked as my sides, the lebanese salad and lebanese style hummus. Owner and woman working there were very polite and take pride in their food. The gyros and meats are brought in fresh, not frozen. The owners explained that this was why their food tastes so good. 

Very impressed overall and would return!!!

It's good and I'd definitely come back. Places like this are fantastic for people trying to eat healthy. My lamb kefta kabobs were very good and the quantity of food was good for the price. Wifey-poo's beef koubideh was very good as well. The falafel were cooked perfectly and the tahini sauce was good.
Everything was cooked correctly and service was fantastic. So, why only 4 stars? This place has fallen to the curse of suburbia. ... the same curse that turns fantastic Italian restaurants in to pusgetti and meatball - serving boredom.... suburbanites, as a whole, are really timid eaters. So, restaurants have to dumb down at least part of their menu to keep enough traffic to stay open.... but if they go too far it slowly kills the menu. You can see that happening here. The hummus was bland, as to not offend anyone. The meats were grilled perfectly, showing the potential of this place,  but where there should be sumac and saffron  there's black pepper and a little salt..... so, nothing is too ethnic, as to not offend anyone. ... but it's also a bit boring.  All the glorious character of Pakistan and Lebanon that should be in this food is muted. 
Still good though. I'll be back, and next time I'll bring my own sumac.

While I would like to give Pita BBQ three and a half stars, I am giving it four because of my 11 year old son. 

We have had food from Pita BBQ three times; we dined in once and carried out twice. All three times, our food has been delicious. Very, very good. We order the same thing every time, Chicken Shawarma Sandwich for me, Spicy Chili Chicken Sandwich for the hubby, an order of falafel and hummus for the adult female, two kids chicken shawarma meals with rice for the kids and two orders of fries. Every. Single. Time. Annnnddddd.... every single time we have ordered this, they have gotten the order wrong. Every. Single. Time. However, the food is really, really good, so we go back (and it isn't like we live nearby. We are in Algonquin, Pita BBQ is in South Elgin).

Second issue:  the wait time. For-ev-er. It's an uncomfortable wait time. We place our order and we sit. Well, not "we". If my husband is in the area, he will place and order and wait.... and wait.... and wait.... for our order.  Awkwardly long. But, the food is really, really good. So he waits. Last time he was there, he was told he should call it in. However, it's pretty much illegal to call and drive. *insert eyeroll*

However, with all that being said... my picky 11 year old asks for Pita BBQ at least five times a week. Yes, at least FIVE times a week. He would probably ask for it every day but as soon as he starts to open his mouth and starts with his usual "you know what would be great for dinner" bit... I throw him the evil death stare and he stops mid-sentence.  

Food is super yummy, wait time is slow and orders are not always correct. Go for the food!!

Excellent food.  Great prices.  Great service.  Pita BBQ is a hidden gem.  

Their falafel is excellent.  The hummus is fresh, large and presented in beautiful manner.  French fries are great, 100% potatoes with nothing added.  The prices are super reasonable.  I spent $23 on a family of 3 and we had more food than we could eat.  If you like Mediterranean food, run, don't walk to Pita BBQ!
One note, they're closed on Mondays.
Great food and the owner genuinely cares about his customers.  I highly recommend it! BEST middle eastern food around and the lunch special is bomb!  TRY IT!!

Stopped by the South Elgin location recently and it was fantastic! Great customer service, clean location, and excellent, fresh food. There lunch special is unbeatable, under 10 bucks you get a plate of food and a drink. I've visited their Streamwood location many times and had to drive for work into South Elgin. I was very pleased to find another location, so excited to come back.

The spicy chicken is AMAZING !! The staff is very friendly.
We love going there to get some great food.
Come on by and try it.
Love their chicken schwarma meal, always good and filling! My husband like the spicy chicken. Their hummus and pita is tasty!

Not quite the same as other Mediterranean places we go to. Ordered the chicken shawarma plate with hummus and Lebanese salad, plus a side of fries. Chicken had great flavor and fresh cut fries were hot/crispy. Salad didn't taste fresh and pita was not fluffy like Naf Naf.

Meh. I can't speak to the whole menu, but the pita/wrap stinks and that ruins my whole impression. It's dry, crunchy and too large. Pita is the key to excellent Middle Eastern food.  I'd sooner drive to Naf Naf or Pita House than eat here again, which stinks because it's three minutes up the raid from me.  
The falafel are fine, but the pita overwhelms them so it's hard to give it any more than two stars. Fresh pita is where it's at.

Great food,  great portions and a great staff. I got the combo platter (enough for two meals). When I was picking up my order the cook said he threw in a an extra portion of the spicy chilly chicken. (I ordered beef shawarma and chicken shawarma) 

Would highly recommend.

This used to be one of my favorite places to eat at but our last experience was enough to stop us from going again. 

I normally would order, sit and wait for my food but the last time I went I stood up and watched my food being prepared, I cringed when I saw the grill, it looked grimy like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. I ordered the spicy chili chicken as a side for my husband to try, the cook went to the fridge and came back with a paint bucket (it was an actual paint bucket) that had the chili chicken and cooked it on the grimy grill. 

I'm glad that I decided to watch my food being cooked or else I would have probably kept going back. The sanitary conditions of this place are horrible. I would not recommend this place to anyone unless you want to end up sick!

So I came here for lunch break on Saturday and ordered a chicken kabob with hummus and garlic sauce and a side salad.  Took my debit card out, and for some reason it wouldn't work on their machine. The card worked earlier at target/Starbucks but wouldn't here. I didn't have cash or any other card to pay with and the owner said not to
Worry about it and to pay whenever I get a chance. I mentioned that I don't live in the area and I'm not there often, and he said it was totally fine. What awesome customer service. I will continue to go here because of the owners generosity (and the food of course) anytime I'm in the area! 

The chicken was well seasoned and the homemade hummus was delicious! I really liked the garlic sauce it wasn't too overwhelming. Highly recommend this place!

Awesome Chilli chicken platter!  That is all I have to say.  

Prices are good - quantity and quality of food is awesome for the price.  So overall great value for money!  Recommend for a take out for sure!
This place has great food, great service, and Mohammed and wife do whatever it takes to make your dining experience great.  We eat there every couple of months..  2 thumbs up...

If you enjoy middle eastern cuisine then this is just ok. I have spent a good amount of time in Dearborn, Michigan where the middle eastern is the best in the U.S. In my opinion.

This is just ok though. The tahini is bland for dipping the falafel in. The chicken and meat schawarma is ok. They didn't have any baklava today, so maybe next time.

The biggest downside is it's expensive. For a $13 mixed plate its seemed small. Also, its strange to me that hummus isn't included with every plate.
Usually this place is great. Haven't had it for awhile but the beef shawarma was awful. Usually it's really moist and full of flavor, but tonight, it looked and tasted old.
My son loves this place!   The pita here is amazing.  I like naf naf but this place is much closer and good too. Also the price is reasonable.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. The chicken shawarma plate is my go-to. Amazing food, awesome service. And do not forget about the garlic sauce. Put on everything, you will not be disappointed.

Went here this afternoon when I was in Elgin area. They seem to have a pretty extensive menu. I had the combination meal which was good. Although only had chicken and beef but no lamb. For $13 I would have thought they have included all the 3 meats. Place was clean and organized.

I've driven past a few times but finally stopped today, small, clean place with plenty of room to eat in. I was honestly disappointed in my vegetarian Falafel plate. The chickpeas came out a bit too fried and the Basmati rice in clumps at times. The hummus and bread was good but again I felt it being a too "fast food" more than the usual Pita places I stop in. I will try it again sometime, maybe a different cook and wait times lol

I had a hankering for a Gyro but I couldn't quite decide between that or some kabob. I've passed this place a few times and decided to hit it over my usual kabob spot. This place was epic. I was warmly greeted when I walked in. There's a huge menu on the wall that's easy to read and understand. All your typical Mediterranean staples. The Gyro meat was tender and juicy, the sauces were fantastic, the shawarma was tender and not dry, which is key. The salad was amazing.
The dining room is super big, clean and could easily handle a table for 12 without bothering anyone else. They had some cool funky ethnic music playing and that made it all come together.
One employee came to ask how everything was and if we needed anything else, like napkins or sauces... seriously? That was top notch! I'll be back for sure! Keep up the good work.

Great food and even better service. I Highly recommended. The food tasted like homemade, I was impressed. The wife and kids loved the food as well. My wife and I liked that the kids menu was just smaller portions of the regular menu. The kids loved the chicken kabobs.

Spicy chili chicken is THE best plated item we've had here. The spicy fries and hummus are tasty too. 

Steak is on the dry side and the chicken shwarma was a bit on the salty side.

They keep the inside very cold, nice on a hot day... On a cooler day not so much.  

Took them more than 50 min for a to go order for 4 people... They did their best to make up for it by giving us an extra plate of food... And wrote a very nice email after reading this review... So I rounded up to 4 stars :)

Stopped by tonight and this place just keeps getting better!  A few new menu items, which look interesting.  Had a really fresh shawarma, which is among my favorites in all the world(believe me I have been all over the world and try to taste local shawarma joints).  The falafels were also freshly made and delicious. 
I love the fresh cut French fries, best in town, especially dipping them in the hot sauce and garlic sauce.
The nice man behind the counter(I think owner) asked if I wanted a sample of the chili chicken he was cooking. It was awesome, kind of reminded me of good Indian food. I'll certainly get it next time. 
Anyways, give this place a shot if you want to try something different and better than the run of mill quick dining, if you love shawarma, try this place!
Amazing food and a great atmosphere.  All-around, a winner in the food department and I will definitely be coming back.
Oh I love the chili chicken. The plate (with extra garlic sauce) is one of my favorite quick lunch options in the area. If you like spicy chicken you won't be disappointed!

First time (I think?) at the South Elgin location and there are a few differences I spotted. I say "I think" it's my first time here because I'm almost positive that it originally opened under a different name. Yes, now I remember. It used to be "simply kabobs" and I first heard of it thru Groupon. 

Heard of this location thru the folks at Pita BBQ on rt. 59. My fianc is a fan of the unusually red Spicy Chicken. He noticed that the chicken at this location, although still nice and tender, was a different cut and texture. Bigger chicken chunks, more cubed rather than shredded. He prefers the shreddier version because there is more sauce. I like this version because the meat is more tender and juicy. The other difference is the absence of tea and iced tea. Not a huge deal, but I used to like when the other location offered an Arabian type hot tea. 

Despite the differences, still think this place is decent and glad they're expanding. I recommend the combo dinner plate. Tons of meat and good chance to try the different kinds for $13. Big enough to share between two. Also tastes good as leftovers if you don't feel like sharing!
Awesome Falafel wrap, I consider the best in Chicago. I hope they bring the best lentil soup soon
The spicy chili chicken plate was a delight. The lovely smell of spices with delicious hummus on side is a rarity. Would definitely recommend trying it out.

My first time trying this place out.  Ordered 2 spicy chicken chili plates with hummus and slaw for both, spicy fries, rice. It was all very tasty, but they forgot to include the pita bread for both plates, so we had to eat the hummus on its own.  Double check your carry out order before leaving!

A work friend recommended this place last week, and I'm glad they did. When scouting places to eat along Randall Rd, my eye wouldn't normally land on a place like this, but it will from now on. I had the chicken shawarma wrap, and loved it. It's ample too, so it's plenty enough to make a meal out of by itself. They also have really good kabobs and a nice veggie plate if you're staying away from meat. They're quick too, which is great for a place that will likely be a stop I'll make when getting lunch during the work day.

Awesome food everytime. My wife and I share the combination. We've turned down the owner's sample generosity only because we're so full.
Highly recommended spot for quick, convenient, and deliciously fresh grilled food.

username: R I C K Y B O B B Y.
review_text:
So happy this location was opened.  I used to travel 25 min to get to the Streamwood location, because it is that good, but now, it's a quick 5 min trip from my house.  Add to it that it's on my way to work and they get plenty of business from me.  Great food and great customer service.

Between the two locations, I have tried everything on the menu.  My personal favorite is the Beef Kefta wraps, but it appears that is going to be a seasonal item now.  Right behind it though is the Chicken Shwarma wrap.  Such a refreshing combination of flavors.  If you are in a flavor rut, try it out.  It will get you back on track.  

One secret item that I think people are passing on that they shouldn't, is the Tandoori burger.  I tried this for the first time last week, and must say that I was amazed how much I enjoyed it.  Again, a flavor explosion that I was not expecting.  So good!  Take a chance and try it out.  

If you find yourself in the area, do not hesitate to check this place out.  While there are only a few reviews for this location, check out Streamwood's reviews, and you will see that the consistency is there.  Looking forward to my next trip!

I started going to Pita BBQ when I lived in Streamwood.  When I got a new job on the west side of Elgin, I was so happy to discover a new location just minutes from work!  I am happy that they brought back the chicken kebabs, which were gone for a bit.  Great option for healthy, yummy, filling lunch.  I saw another reviewer post that he had difficulty with his debit card and the owner worked with him, and that happened to me as well.  I am an established customer there, but it was still a lovely mark of trust that I had left my credit card at work and needed to go back to work with my order and call in my credit card to pay for my meal - feels very small town and neighborly.
