They have recently changed the pita bread and it is softer now.  Eat here!

I'll start by saying that I was highly excited to find out that a Mediterranean style dining establishment had finally graced our area.  My wife and I generally travel to either Pita Puff, Pita House or Pita Inn for this kind of food. 

Stopped in last week and tried a chicken kabob shish kabob sandwich.  It's basically chunks of grilled white meat rolled inside of a large, thin pita, along with some tomato, onion and cucumber.  I graced this sandwich with some of their homemade hot sauce and that white Lebanese garlicky sauce that restaurants like these serve.  Pure heaven.  It's pretty simple, but the sauces make it something special.   

I have also tried their chicken kabob plate (meal) which is the same kind of chicken served over a bed of saffron rice alongside some salad, with some pita bread on the side.  I liked this equally, and really just ended up dumping all of my meal ingredients into my pita, along with copious amounts of hot and white sauce.  This was also delicious.  

For me, what makes a place like this is the flavor of the sauces and dressings.  It's very good here.  I wouldn't compare it to others, since it's pretty much different from others.  But it's very good and I was told they are homemade.  The hot sauce isn't overly spicy like some others are.  You can use quite a bit of this without making your meal unbearably hot.  

My fear is that they will not draw in enough customers here.  Nothing has really lasted in this location.  If people check this place out, they will like it and return.  I highly recommend it.  If I had liked their baklava better (didn't enjoy it at all), I might have given them 5 stars.  It was dry and crusty without much flavor for my tastes.  

Check the place out.

Went there with a friend for lunch. Waited 30 mins for food, which was unexpected. Then we got our food. The order was missing rice that we clearly ordered and the fries are so salty I couldn't eat them. The food itself was good. If you want a sandwich or pita with a soda/water and have 1/2 an hour to wait. This is the place to go. I'm not going to bother with it again since the salt has destroyed my taste for a bit.

This is a new restaurant, only open about 3-4 weeks, in South Elgin. We decided to stop in and check it out, and were pleased overall with the location and the food. The restaurant is aesthetically pleasing, particularly for a "fast food" type of place. Their menu is simple, but very clear- and nice to look at on the wall, and I also like that they have a kids menu. We tried the gyro plate and the beef shwarma plate- my gyro meat was a touch dry, but everything else was absolutely delicious. I enjoyed both the Lebanese salad and the slaw (very different from American slaw though), and the Baklava dessert was delicious. The restaurant itself is very spacious, with many types of seating including two huge sections for large groups. The employees seemed friendly, and I was given a free beverage while I waited for my food to be prepared. Overall, a very pleasant experience. We will definitely be back to try out a few of the other items on the menu.

You REALLY want to eat here! It's so plain outside and so delicious inside. Simple middle eastern menu and everything tastes fresh. The falafel isn't frozen like the pita place that used to occupy this strip center building. It must be made to order because it's sooo good.

Lebanese cuisine, how I love thee... Detroit-area Lebanese restaurants have spoiled me for good with their fresh pillowy pitas, magical whipped garlic paste, and perfectly spiced everything. I haven't found anything comparable in Illinois (*yet*), but that doesn't mean I'm not a fan of Pita BBQ.

We ordered the combination grill which was a great way to sample the menu- the chicken kabob, rice, and lebanese cucumber & tomato salad were all pleasant, if not the stars of the show. The chicken & beef shawarma were seasoned nicely but our portions were dry. That issue would have to improve for me to order the shawarma again. 

But what will bring me back to Pita BBQ are...

-The spicy chili chicken- Simmered with onions and a deep reddish-hued sauce with mellow heat, it's craveable. Really good. If I could recommend one thing that you must try, it would be this. 
-Falafel (fried crisp, but tender & flavorful on the inside) I will just order a whole plate next time.
-Spicy fries 
-Garlic sauce (mild & creamy, not super garlicky. We put it on everything- fries, rice, everything.)

The only thing I wasn't impressed with were the pitas- run of the mill grocery store pita pockets. :/ Not what I would expect from a Lebanese restaurant. 

Really friendly & helpful staff. The menu is easy to navigate for on-the-go orders.
My favorite is the spicy chili chicken! So delicious! This place has awesome food along with really great service. Pita BBQ is a highly recommended!
Idk who was taking our order but he was rude and impatient to someone who hadn't been to the restaurant before

This is not your typical gyro fast food establishment.  This is a very high quality Mediterranean themed restaurant with very fresh foods.  Falafels are execellent, the baba ganoush is pricey but some of the best eggplant I've ever had.    The meats are tender and have excellent taste.  The chili chicken is delicious but is not for the faint of heart.  Pitas are made fresh daily along with their fries.  Spicey fries are incredible but again not for the faint of heart.  Highly recommend this place given the quality, speed and freshness of the food.

Let me start by saying I have never tried Mediterranean foods so I was a little scared going into this place but I can now say stepping foot inside this place was the best move!!! The food is amazing. The spicy chili chicken plate was overflowing with delicious well seasoned chicken, rice,  salad it was crave worthy. I would definitely stop by there again. The people there are super friendly and the atmosphere is warm and inviting love this place!!!

This place is AMAZING!!! I have had almost everything on the menu. So far, the spicy chicken and chicken kabob are my favorite. The hummus is out of this world good. If you get a wrap, spicy with rice is a must. The staff is very friendly. The food is fresh. The layout accommodates groups of any size.
Chili chicken is the best! Pita and garlic sauce that comes with plate are phenomenal. Also newer clean restaurant.

I was hoping this place would be similar to the downtown restaurant Roti.  I had the spicy chili chicken wrap and it was not good. I don't understand what the hype is about this place. My boyfriend had the gyro and it had no flavor. Not your typical lamb gyros which was very disappointing. We threw away our food after 2 bites. On top of the flavor the presentation was not appetizing. Sloppy, soggy and too messy to eat. I won't be back.

I liked this place.  We ordered the falafel wrap and the spicy chili chicken wrap and split an order of spicy fries.  The falafel wrap was huge and the chicken wrap was the size of a regular gyro.  Falafel was delicious as was the chili chicken, however the chili chicken wrap was VERY messy so be forewarned.  The spicy fries were good, but not worth an extra dollar to sprinkle a little spicy paprika mixture onto the regular fries, c'mon guys.  The food was good, the place was clean, and the people were friendly.  I'd recommend this place to everyone and I look forward to eating here again if I'm in the area.

This is my second visit and although there is a 10-15 minute wait time to receive your food it's worth the wait.  I didn't want to cook today but didn't want fast food.  They truly are a better alternative compare to the other quick food establishments.  Everything I've tried taste homemade and not greasy.  I like the combination plate because I like variety and enough for lunch the next day.
Love this place! Great food, easy-to-read menu with just the right amount of choices, clean establishment, and friendly staff. I sometimes come here 2x/week for lunch. Mmmmmm.

Delcicious food. Chili chicken was tender and juicy. Beef shwarma a little dry but well seasoned.  Pita nice and fluffy. Reasonable prices (about $9 per person)  Food came out quickly and plenty of space within the restaurant itself. Ample parking. Would return.

I've been here three times and I will definitely continue to patronize.  The facility is clean and the staff is very friendly.  I also like how they over a variety of complimentary sauces.  The falafel sandwich is HUGE and delicious.  The falafel itself it good, fritters are on the smaller and crunchier side but still tasty.  I also had the vegetarian feast (twice), which was very good.  My only complaint was that the first time I got the vegetarian feast, it came with red cabbage salad and three falafel.  The second time, I only got two falafel and no cabbage!  I didn't realize it until I got home and was very disappointed.  My other small gripe is that the pitas are not terribly fresh or soft-- but the hummus and baba ghanoush were good enough that you don't notice so much if you slather it on.

Went a bit earlier in the day and it was night and day different.  This time the pieces of meat were what one would expect and not scraps left over from the day.  Everything was fresher and tasted better.

I grew up in Skokie, so I get the difference between the Shawarma at Pita BBQ that is made from layers of marinated thinly sliced meat that is put on a rotating vertical spit to marinate in its own juices and the mass-produced gyros loaves, of finely ground meat pressed into a cylinder that everyone is accustomed to seeing at every gyro joint in the city and suburbs.

Pita BBQ is authentic shawarma!  My family and I have eaten there three times in the past week.  The chicken and steak shawarma are incredible.  They do have a gyro cylinder if that's your thing.

They also have something called Chili Chicken.  I thought is was going to be normal chili made out of ground chicken.  Nope.  We're talking chunks of marinated chicken sauteed with fried onions and some type of chili spices.

My wife always gets the salad with the chicken which she loves.  The chicken is similar in flavor to the chicken shawarma.  My daughter loves the chicken kabob wrap.  The wrap is actually a thinly rolled large pita.

Sides and sauces are great.  They have a hot sauce that I would compare to harissa sauce you would expect at a middle eastern restaurant.  Tahini sauce, yum.  I didn't care for the dill sauce.  It tastes mayonnaise based.  The humus is excellent.  It's cute how they put a little olive oil and a dash of sumac in the center of the little side dish of hummus like you would expect on a big plate of humus at an authentic middle eastern restaurant.  The Lebanese salad is really nice with chunks of fresh cucumber and tomato. The Basmati rice is light and fluffy.  Not heavy and oily.

I grew up on falafel before I knew I had a gluten intolerance.  Who would have thought we would see the day we could get falafel in the western suburbs?  Wish I could try it and review it for you.

The closest you are going to get to this food is Just Kabobs on Randall and 64.  I've been going to Just Kabobs since day one.  I love it.  Huge portions of good tasting comfort food.  The difference between the two, Just Kabobs is more of a Greek cuisine and Pita BBQ is Middle Eastern which is more unique to this area right now.  Think back to how novel Just  Kabobs was when it opened and brought its cuisine to St. Charles.  Depends on what you're in the mood for.

Nice change of pace in Randall Rd! Service is fast and most choices are relatively healthy. The vegetarian feast was tasty. 3 kids meal choices. My favorite was the rice and chicken shawarma. Lebanese salad was good and fresh. I like variety of sauces.
I went here wanting a Greek salad but got a really good chicken Mediterranean salad. It was amazing the flavors that one salad had. I didn't care for the pita chip.

Been here probably 15 times since they opened up, and I love it! The combination plate gives you a good taste of everything and is enough for two meals; order it with the hummus and rice unless you prefer a lighter option. If you want something with a little zing to it, you can't go wrong with the spicy chili chicken, it's what hooked me on this great little place.

So happy they opened up this location.  Now I don't have to drive all the way to streamwood or schaumburg when I need my falafel fix.  LOVE the garlic sauce...way better than eating your falafels with plain old tahini.  My spouse really likes their chili chicken.
Chicken shwarma is my fav! Customer service is great and prices are reasonable. Love the garlic sauce as well. I usually get the plate option and it comes with a good amount of food.

Pulled up at 8.45 and they close at 9. The staff could not have been nicer. The menu is simple and easy but plenty to choose from. We grabbed our food to go. It traveled well, the chicken kabob was tender and flavorful. My wife had the Mediterranean salad and she said she should have stopped eating it 10 mins ago but it was too good to stop.
First visit today - the spicy steak Shawarma was absolutely delicious as was the Baklava!  Can't wait to try more of their menu.

Tasty way better than the average pick up place. Been there once, will for sure try again.

Friendly staff, good food.

Looking forward to our next quick lunch with y'all.
Really flavorful food.  Nice price.  The pitas have really improved since they first opened.  I really appreciate this place since they are the best if not only Mediterranean restaurant in the area.
Very good food.  The Spicy  chili Chicken  and Falafel are absolutely  delicious.    I cannot wait to get back and order more.

This is sort of a Mediterranean Chipotle.  Simple menu.  Shawarma plates and wraps, gyros, kabob, falafel.  I had the steak shawarma.  Good spice.  The steak was decent.    Rice was a little plain.  Side of falafel was quite good.  Interior was clean and the music was sort of pleasant new age mediterranean.  Prices are a reasonable $7-$10.  Staff was decent.  I am probably rating this a bit higher than it might deserve; but it is a good and highly welcome variation to the express lunch offerings in the area.  I really hope it makes it.

Delicious Shawarma wrap, basmati rice and chicken "kabob" for the kids meal. My older daughter had the Spicy Chili Chicken wrap, but it is not served like the other wraps with veggies and the thin pita wrap. It's served in a large thick pita and is rather overflowing with the red sauce. It was tasty but very messy & nothing to really balance it out; maybe it would be better as part of a plate. My girls both loved the fries! Very fluffy inside and really the only American food on the menu. We would come back! We felt like we were eating real food. It was a nice change of pace and we left stuffed!

I dislike coffee.

I for some reason find myself craving coffee from this place.  I can only assume they put sugar-crack in their coffee, but never in my life have I ever ordered so many different types of coffees, due to their specials-of-the-day.  Just fantastic.

Their sandwiches ... how the hell do they make their sandwiches so good?  It's not like they're reinventing the culinary-wheel here, and upon first glance, the sandwiches almost look a little under-whelming ... but then my god -- perfection.

Their soups are amazing as well.  A coffee, sandwich and bag of chips runs about $10, but it's delicious and filling.  The service is A+.  The owners work there, along with their staff.  They take pride in the establishment and it shows.

I personally can't stand Doctor Who -- but I get it and don't judge, it's just not my thing, like Star Trek vs Star Wars.  And to be fair, I've caught a few episodes of FarScape there, so I'll give them a pass.

Bottom line -- a great place for coffee and sandwiches.  Fair prices for great food and service.

This place is great! The Dr Who goodness is awesome, the vibe is chill, the sandwiches are scrumptious, the coffee is smooth and pleasant, they make their own salad dressings in house, and there's live music and fun events! Trivia nights are in the works! 

This place makes it easy to become a regular so.....

Allons-y!!

We're a family of Whovians, and we recently moved to the area, so we had to go. 

The staff is friendly, the kids and I loved the decorations, and we were all fans of the food.
I had the blue box cafe salad, which comes with bleu cheese, bacon, and hardboiled eggs. The eggs were overdone ( which is super easy to do with hardboiled eggs anyway, honestly), but the salad was still really good. The little monsters each had the grilled cheese, and they loved it. 

I also had an iced black coffee, and I loved it, it was really flavorful.

Also, for my Pokemon Go friends: There is a pokespot that is incredibly close, so you can actually access it while inside the cafe. Splendid time to throw a lure on while sitting down for lunch. There are also a bunch of poke spots in the area, so you can take a nice little walk afterwards and easily hit 8+ pokespots ( a bunch of which all had lures on them at the time)

I definitely plan on going back again. I am a fan!

I think I heard that sometimes they host board game events, too

While I am a major geek, I am not a Whovian...but I brought three to Elgin with me, so of course this was the place for lunch!!

Small but well appointed with Dr. Who accoutrements (everything from fan art to cast photos to the crack in the wall of time by the door, not to mention multiple TVs playing the program around the room), this little cafe is every Dr. Who fan's dream. 

If the food wasn't any good this would simply be a kitschy novelty spot, but they do indeed deliver with solid meal options. My friends and I had an assortment of soups and sandwiches and everyone was happy. My grilled cheese (aka The Melted Goodness) came with your choice of up to three cheeses; I went for the gusto with the max, and I have to say that three was too much! It was overflowing. Next time I would narrow to just swiss and pepper jack. The bread was beautifully griddled though, and a local strawberry lemonade went nicely with it.

Service was friendly and fairly fast, even as the place filled up. Whovians, be sure to check out their merchandise (mugs and such)! 

(PS Make sure you peek behind the tardis door in the corner...Don't blink!)

The only thing I loved more than the incredibly Whovian decor was the delicious food and premium ingredients! The nerd in me felt right at home. These guys really nailed it. From the throwback episodes of Doctor Who playing silently on every wall, to the calm and imaginative playlist flowing from the speakers at an appropriate decibel level, this place captured my heart. Dalek shaped Ghirardelli chocolate pops? Who can compete? Nerds and hungry folk alike will love the great food, warm service and inviting ambiance of this little cafe. Great place to study, lunch, or nerd out with your favorite companions.

I go there quite often for coffee or a sandwich. I am impress as they do have a good deli sandwich. Would rather eat there instead of Subway, as good quality Boar's Head meats are used on their sandwich.

I have been here quite a few times, even when they first opened! Business has clearly boomed since then!

There decor is not overkill, but had enough pictures and incorporating things to make it have that specific Doctor Who theme.

As a Whovian, I think it is fantastic that this place exists(and so close to home)! I particularly love the subtle menu names that play on characters and what not from the show. I believe that even if I wasn't as knowledgeable about the show, this place could peak my interest. I love that they always have at least one tv playing Doctor Who.

The food and coffee here are also good.
Sandwiches are always fresh!
I was amazed a couple weeks ago when I ordered a breakfast sandwich, because it was one of the best I've ever had. You get to pick your own meat, cheese, and bread. Mine was sausage and provolone on sourdough.
Their selection of chips are great, and they have coke products as fountain drinks. 
All of their baked goods look amazing as well!

Last of all, the staff is always kind, attentive and welcoming! Smiling faces are the cherry on top!

I've never watched an episode of Doctor Who but I still am smitten by this coffeeshop's decor.  From the 2D Police Box on the wall to the baristas matching blue "Keep Calm and Drink a Latte" blue shirts, this place would be any Doctor Who's fan hangout.  

They offer complimentary wifi, just ask for the password.  They also show Doctor Who episodes on their one tv in the cafe.  I had the pleasure of trying their turtle latte...deeelish!  They also rotate a daily soup.  Today it was pasta fagioli.  Pretty good.

I like the bench seating but after a few hours your butt can get a little sore.  Decent amount of electrical outlets for you to stay charged.  There's ample street parking too.  Also seems to be a police hangout!

I take my coffee very seriously. With that being said... I have yet to find an iced coffee that can even come close to comparison. This is an establishment that makes Elgin a little better. 10 stars to the owners!

Great cup of coffee. Friendly service. Cute atmosphere. Any Dr. Who fan would love this place. Prices are comparable with Starbucks. However, the specialty drinks are unique. Great local establishment.

Foid was good, but overpriced for what you get. We had 2 Turkey Caesar wraps & 2 small drinks, no sides, no pickles and it was just over $18.00. The wraps were your standard deli Turkey meat on a whole grain wrap, but small a small wrap compared to other places. For a $ rating I feel that they were overpriced and should have $$ rating as everything has an extra charge!

A great little cafe. My daughter and I came to see the Dr. Who decor, but we were also really pleased by the quality of the sandwiches and desserts.  Friendly staff made the experience all the more enjoyable. Would definitely visit again.

I had a great experience catering with Blue Box Cafe. The restaurant itself is so cute and homey- a perfect place to go and get some work done, and enjoy a delicious bite of food. They serve both breakfast and lunch- but my catering order was for lunch. I ordered 20 boxed lunches which included a sandwich, chips, and a cookie- and felt the price was fair for the items purchased. The people who ate the lunches said they were fresh and delicious. I'll definitely be back!

I really wanted to like this place as a friend had talked about it. I wasn't impressed by the Dr. Who theme and the food reminded me of something I'd get in a cafeteria. I got the sausage gumbo which was super hot but was on par with Campbell's and my Dad got a tuna sandwich (came with no pickle) which was thinly made and could have come out of my own kitchen easily. Very unimpressive for $12. Maybe I'll come back for just a coffee to go sometime.

This cafe is a welcome addition to downtown Elgin's restaurant scene.  It's a quaint little coffee and sandwich shop. The restaurant is clean and the workers are friendly. 

They have a lot of tasty sandwich offerings. Today, however, I ordered the tuna melt and I was a bit disappointed.  It had the least amount of tuna salad I've ever had on a sandwich. I'm attaching a photo but it is deceiving.  It was basically a grilled cheese with a schmeer of tuna salad.  Maybe it was an isolated incident, so I'm not letting it effect my rating.  

If you are a Dr. Who fan, you'll love this place. The owner is a big fan of the show, and has lots of references to the show throughout the cafe.

Just found this little restaurant. The food was amazing.service was top notch. We had a larger party (there were 9 of us). They brought out food in a timely manner. They had episodes of Dr. Who on TV. Atmosphere was spot on. Definitely will be back. Only downside was parking. There was a small lot behind to park in or you had to do street parking which was limited to 30 minutes.

Fantastic atmosphere, great food, even better staff. The only thing more delicious than the decor is the food! A fantastic mix of geeky and functional. 

The staff all wear geeky shirts, are very nice, and provide excellent service. 

The fresh brewed tea is wonderful too.

When it comes to service, good options and amazing tea lattes, blue box cafe is amazing. You have to be a fan of Dr. Who to really love and understand the ambiance of it. 

Food: There is a ton of options here. Salads are pricey but a huge portion. Eating healthy anywhere always equals pricey. I like their turkey rueben, Bluebox salad, Caesar wrap and definitely their seasonal Turkey Gobbler (I believe that it is called that). The turkey gobbler is really delicious. You could probably look at the ingredients and make it at home after Thanksgiving, but I'm looking for the convenience of being ready to eat without carving a freshly baked turkey. Come on. 

Drinks: I love coffee but for some reason their coffee is too strong for me. I was informed by a worker there that it could be the milk option that I have chosen and suggested to go with higher fat in the milk would help. The milk did make a difference, but I still can't handle it. My choice of poison is their London Fog latte and some honey. Hot or cold, it just gives me the right amount of caffeine needed to complete the rest of my day at work.

Snacks: Try their magic bar with chocolate and coconut!?! They have other options, but this is my choice. 

Line: The line may be confusing on where to order if it is your first time. Sometimes, the line starts directly in front of the register or curves along the drink bar. Just ask the person in front of you if they are in line. 

Bathrooms: if you are needing to go to the bathroom, they do not have a direct one. It is more of a communal one with the other businesses in the building. Every attempt that I've tried to go, I've always ran into an issue such as no toilet paper or dirty. It's not their fault since it is shared. 

The workers: They are very sweet people. I have seen some random acts of kindness with whom, I believe, are the owners to people in the area that not even customers. To treat others with respect and humanity, this is always cool in my book. 

Try different things until you find your niche. It took me a little while to give up on their coffee options.

*insert clever Doctor Who quote/reference*

I have yet to jump on the Doctor Who bandwagon (and probably never will), but my sister is a hugeee fan. While she and my mother were visiting Elgin, we decided to lunch at the Blue Box Cafe, which is some kind of Doctor Who-inspired cafe in downtown Elgin.

Yep, the walls are covered with blue phone booths and British coffee mugs and all sort of things related to the Doctor(s). Thankfully, you don't have to be a Whovian to appreciate this cafe. The cafe is otherwise pretty simple & cute, the menu boasts a variety of drinks and sandwiches, and the atmosphere is pretty chill.

I had an almond latte and the veggielicious sandwich (with chips), my sister had one of the salads, and my mother had some kind of sandwich, as well. My veggielicious sandwich was realllllyyy good, like.... mmmlicious! It was huge, which was perfect for my hungry tummy. I ate the whole thing and basically licked my fingers afterwards. Mmm. My sister loved her salad and my mom enjoyed her meal, too. We were all happy to have lunch here, and my sister was especially excited to get her Doctor Who fix.

Blue Box Cafe is definitely a great addition to Elgin.
I hope the downtown area continues to grow.

I recently enjoyed a Dirty Earl here, weird but I liked it.  Earl Gray tea, steamed soy and espresso.  I will be trying that at home this weekend.

Wish they had more Doctor Who stuff here.  I met a friend who told me about the place and I got there, realizing I had been here before.  Obviously not memorable the first time.  

But this time the Dirty Earl was.  

I also got a BLT and the bacon was surprisingly good.  I wasn't sure if it was going to be more a fake rubbery sort of bacon but it was a yummy sandwich.

This is a great eclectic sandwich shop modeled after the TV show Dr. Who. Delicious gourmet sandwich's, coffee bar, free Wi-Fi makes this a great place to hang out at by yourself or with friends. I just wish I lived closer so I could come more often!

I had a caf Italiano, and Metropolis has never tasted so good. The shots were balanced and sweet with a creamy finish.

Eggplant on the veggie sandwich was roasted perfectly.

Blue Box's success is attributed to far more than Dr. Who cult following.
Fun little corner of Elgin.  Solid sandwhich, nice ambiance for a lunch/breakfast sandwhich place.   Well executed!

Great mild Doctor Who themed. The best thing are the sandwiches. My husband took me there because of the Doctor Who theme. We loved the great friendly service and tasty fresh sandwiches. We will definitely go back.

I really wanted to like this place. But its Nothing special. The turkey ruben had hardly any turkey and no slaw per the menu description. It was not thick at all like a real ruben. $8 for that??? Plus extra for chips and pop. So a $12 crappy lunch??? Also it looks like my 3rd grade son decorated the place. I really dont understand the positive reviews.

Came here for the first time today. It was very cute on the inside! I got the Elgin Club Sandwich on sourdough bread along with a Magic Bar Hot Latte with whole milk. I do like that they offer almond milk as an alternative. The coffee was delicious and the temperature of it was perfect. The sandwich was good; I enjoyed the siracha mayo. The quality was good and I like that they use Boar Heads meats. Though, I feel like $8 for a standard sandwich is a lot. Give me something unique and I'd pay $8 all day. Also, every table in the restaurant was dirty. There was one table that had a cup of soda sitting there the whole 45 minutes I was there. They bring your food to your table, so it totally surprised me that the person running the food could not bring a towel with them. There's not that many tables in there, it would probably take a total of two minutes to simply wipe the dang tables off. I made sure to wipe my own table off before I left so someone would have a clean table to sit at. If I do return here in the future, it would only be for the coffee.

It's a really small place and it has uhmm.. some small bites and some varieties of coffee. It's self service and they have some 10 tables for about 30 odd people to be seated. I liked today (Saturday) - geeky discussion, so might be a good place to come by and chill out. 

I hoped to see a little more food options in the future :)

I had the veggielicious with no cheese sandwich and it was delicious! Only thing was that I found sticker label on my eggplant. Which to me is a minor flaw considering that it proves they cook with fresh ingredients, so I just picked it out. I find it hard to find something healthy when dining out but this place caters to everyone. I was amused with their Dr. Who theme but being that I have never watched the show, I felt as though I was kinda missing out. I really like their teas especially their ginger lime tea. I live in Elgin so it's nice that it's nearby. I will definitely be back.

Perfect place for a casual paced meal and decorated with cool decor! Love having it in downtown Elgin as it serves as an excellent place for coffee, and other pick me up drinks as well as a meal with several delicious sandwiches and soups which I always enjoy.

This place has REALLY good food and has a really great staff and management as well.  My favorite food item has to be the "Reuben Reuben" (which I order on sourdough), but it is definitely one of a kind.  They also have really good salads and excellent coffee creations.  Their hazelnut latte is amazing.  I really have nothing but good things to say about Blue Box and I'm really glad it's available as a lunch option close to where I work.  Thanks Blue Box!

Blue Box has it all Great food, lots of fun and a fabulous staff.  When you want to great sandwich or a great side try this place as it is run by a person who truly knows how to provide tasty food at great prices

I really enjoy the layout and menu selection. There are always a nice group of people having coffee and the staff when you enter will great you with a friendly smile and "hello". The food is fresh and delicious. Just a great vibe all together.  If you want to support local business, downtown Elgin and a privetly owned shop with great food, stop by. I will continue to be a loyal customer.

Love this place! As a former fan of Doctor Who (11th Doctor, seasons 5-7) this place was the perfect place to rekindle my love for the show. 
My family lives in town but I live in Southern California, so this was my first visit here! (They opened just 2 months after I moved!)

Anyway visited yesterday on the second to last day of my visit. We arrived around 8:30 and the place wasn't too busy but there were a few people there which is always a good thing, I think. 

I spent a good minute or two marveling at the interior and atmosphere. I loved the corner with the TARDIS door and the coat rack with the coat and scarf and cane! And the fez and bow ties were so cute. It made me happy being in there.

I liked the menu, it was your basic cafe menu with sandwiches and salads and coffee selections. I liked that the menu wasn't overwhelmed with the DW theme. I ate a breakfast sandwich with bacon, cheddar, and egg on sourdough. I also had a mint mocha latte which I surprisingly liked even though I'm not generally a fan of mocha coffees.

They were playing season 1 of the rebooted season of Doctor Who ( 9th Doctor and Rose Tyler). It was so cool!

I saw they have all these events with discussions and trivia games and was so bummed I was only visiting. If I still lived here I can guarantee you that I'd work here or be here every single day!!

Let's say you just want some good food at a good price.  GO THERE.  Want to order, go sit down at a clean table then have your food delivered a few minutes later?  GO THERE!  Are you into DR. WHO?  Why haven't you been there yet?  It's awesome!  GO THERE!!!

Great food, great people, all around a great local business that I am happy to support as much as possible. You will notice their prices are a bit higher than other comparable restaurants, but it is well worth the few extra dollars. I try to visit at least once a week and been pleased with everything I have ordered.
Great atmosphere, very cozy. The staff is very friendly, delicious sandwiches and coffee.
I got the Elgin club and it was pretty good, but at $8 for a little sandwich I feel that I didn't get much value for my money.
Both times I've gone the coffee has been really tasty! I love Metropolis coffee and I'm so glad they serve it. I still need to try some food items. :)

What's this?  A new cafe in Elgin AND they are Doctor Who fans to boot? 
ALLONS-Y!

We popped in for lunch on a Saturday & the place was bustling.  There were still tables open so we could sit down, but they did a steady stream of business both for the coffee and the sandwiches.

I had the Veggielicious & the Hubs had the Elgin Club.  Both were darn good & they toasted the bread.  The club sandwich didn't come with lettuce or tomato, though, so next time we would ask for that to be added (it wasn't supposed to come with it or anything, we just felt the sandwich would have been a little better with those 2 added, though it was quite delicious as is).  We didn't have coffee, though, so we'll have to give that a try another time.

They are open for breakfast as well, with a couple of breakfast sandwich options.  They are closed on Sundays, though.

I can't say enough good things about this establishment or the people who worked there.  First, let me start with our scenario.   It was my son's 10th birthday and he is a huge whovian.  We already had his themed birthday party prior but the day of his birthday, but what could we do to top that?  I did a search on the internet and came across the Blue Box Cafe.  I noticed that the hours are until 7pm during the week so I used the contact us to obtain more information.  A quick reply happened from Chris, the co-owner, which was warm and welcoming to me that he would be there waiting for us and if we needed to stay a bit longer after 7pm, that he would accommodate.  

When we arrived, we were not let down.  My son was so surprised with all the paintings, pictures, memorabilia, gifts, and decorations.   Knowing that it was my son's birthday, they wished him a happy one which made him feel so special.  On three tv's was an episode of doctor who playing and then Chris made this even more special.  He asked my son what was his favorite episode and he would put it on.  We took many pictures and really enjoyed the atmosphere in its entirety.

The staff was absolutely perfect.  It went beyond wishing my boy a happy birthday.  There was a sense of care in the midst of everything.  They almost seemed to be happy working there.   Fancy that.  Employees who care.  One gentlemen was just so pleasant that he really made an impact on my 11 year old daughter.  He was just so nice and friendly.  It was amazing.  Employees like this are a valued commodity in today's world.

My family isn't a huge sandwich/salad/soup for dinner, so I was a bit apprehensive about this.  I was blown away about the food.  I went with the Submarine Italiano and it was fantastic.  The bread was soft and fresh, the meats were rich and the sweet pickle that they put on there just made it complete.  I also had a chance to try my 6 year old daughters grilled cheese, which her response was "they made me pick three cheeses" as if it was the hardest thing that she had to do all day.  Perfectly grilled.  Perfectly tasty.  I also had a taste of my 9 year old son's chicken and rice soup.  Thick and full.  There was chicken in there.  A lot of chicken.  The taste was again, just perfect.   Although I didn't try the salads, they looked well presented and fresh.  

When speaking to Chris, he did tell us about the events that they host which appears to be even more engaging than just a sandwich shop.  I highly recommend The Blue Box to all, regardless if you are a whovian or not.   You will enjoy yourself.

I like the restaurant it has a great atmosphere.However, the food is good there I feel like it could have A little more excitement to it.Mainly the sandwiches they are all on mostly just regular bread.But the drinks are good and the restaurant is set up real cool like you are really there in a Dr. Who movie.We like going there just for something fun and different to do.It is a fun place in to go in Elgin.

I'll be honest, I come to Blue Box way too often, but Chris and his wife are so wonderful that I look forward to a coffee or breakfast on my way to work each morning. The cafe is doing a wonderful job promoting downtown Elgin with events and fresh ideas. Everyone I've dealt with are friendly and the decor seems to continue getting better each month. 

I think I'd visit even more if the place was a little bigger, with some couches and small tables for board games or cards. But then I'd probably never leave, which would be bad. Give it a try!

You can tell a lot of love has been put into this place.  There are so many little flourishes added to make any fan of the Doctor happy.

Their drinks are pretty good, as is the food.  I was here with a small group and everyone seemed pleased with their meal.  We came back later in the evening to warm up with another cup and weren't disappointed.

The place is a little small, and when they have live music you have to go into the hallway to have a conversation, but it's a nice little indy and I do plan on returning!

I've been a LOOOOONG time Dr. Who fan, so when I found myself in Elgin, ready for lunch, I HAD to go check out the Blue Box Cafe. It was a really nice shop. Not huge, but definitely cozy. The staff was friendly, and didn't try to rush me, which I appreciated. I ordered a Ruben, and I was a little surprised to find that it had sweet coleslaw on it, instead of sauerkraut, but it was very tasty. The iced peppermint tea was very good too. I chilled out, eating my sandwich and enjoying the (appropriately themed) TV show episode. I noticed on the calendar that there are discussion nights, but alas, I had a rehearsal to get to, and couldn't stay for that evening's event. I would definitely come back, next time I am in town. (I particularly enjoyed the blue police box in the parking lot.)

I was covering a news story and we took a break to grab some grub. I immediately recognized the Blue Box reference and went inside. It's like the perfect hang out for Whovians and non Whovians alike. But getting to the food; excellent turkey club. It's better than if I made it at home. The soup was really good, too. Hit the spot. It's a really awesome place and I wish there was something like this in Rogers Park. Hint hint.
Delicious gourmet sandwiches at a reasonable price.  very fresh ingredients, and custom orders are never a problem!  Plenty of room to eat in or take out!  Very friendly fast service.

I am basing my experience as a first-time customer and I have to say that the ambience is really excellent however the customer Service given by the plus size dark-haired woman with the piercing who prepared my food was less than desirable. 

After coming in from the back she prepared my food with bare hands she did not have any gloves so the sanitation was definitely not there. I'm talking about bare hands touching raw onion putting it into my chili and the same with the cheese, meat that went on my Sandwich and condiments. She seemed offended when I asked her questions about the menu and asked if she could put the sandwich on the Panini press. Then after she was done with the food she said thanks like she was finished with my order but she forgot to make my latte. 

The owner however seemed very cool and genuine about the business. He talked about live music during the week. I mentioned to both of them that I was a first time customer and only the owner showed interest the woman with the dark hair with the piercing didn't seem like she could give a care in the world. I'm not sure if preparing food with no gloves is up to the health code and I have not tried the food yet this review is solely on my experience and interaction with the staff. The young boy who took my order was very nice and provided good customer service as well.
A little expensive and our sandwiches were pretty small. While I liked the theme, I do not think I'll return.

I paid about $9 (includes $1 tip) for a cheese sandwich and a small bottle of Canada Dry ginger ale. The sandwich was about 1/2" thick. No pickle. No chips. $4 lunch for $9.
Never again.
This pains me as a Dr. Who fan.
Very chilled environment, great sandwiches I tried the BLT! Would definatley recommend

This place is awesome, it's apparently very new two to three months new since this posting. I've been brought here twice by my boss' food/coffee run at lunch time in recollection it wasn't super busy. The location was between a third and half of capacity. You'll find all kinds of people there and various occupations. It's a nice little people watching location because of the large windows and somewhat busy street in downtown Elgin.

If you like Doctor Who, this is your place--your home. The location is covered with Doctor Who memorabilia or spin offs of it. They even have a live sized TARUS (Police Box) door!

I've had their Elgin BLT and Turkey Ranch which I can both suggest, they were exec lent and delicious--They toast the bread and give the sandwiches some TLC. I'm getting hungry just writing this.

I haven't had their coffee so I can't speak to that but their machine does have carbonated water if that is a thing for you--It is for me!

Their staff was nice too.

Overall, this is a place you should hit up for lunch and coffee (as I've been told) at least. I will be going here for at least another third time and probably more.

Dr. Who fans must try this place! The theme is just awesome. 

I ordered a chai tea with soy and a breakfast sandwich. Paid only like $6 for both. And they were both excellent! Glad I tried this place out.
Had the BLT and almost gagged. The sandwich was smothered in mayonnaise. The three stars are for the decent cup of coffee.
Best coffee shop in Downtown Elgin!  The owners and employees are super friendly and the food is very good.  Even if you are not a Doctor Who fan (I am...), the decor and atmosphere are super fun!

My husband and I love the Blue Box Cafe!

We live right down the street and always swing by. I can't say enough about the staff - the owner Chris and his wife are some of the kindest and hardest working people we've had the pleasure to meet. They recognize us by name, and I always hear my husband come home, telling me about the good coffee he got that morning, or how he loves the ham and cheese breakfast sandwich. 

The cafe is special, as it prides itself on being a Dr. Who-themed cafe. Though I am not familiar with the show, I can see how much attention went into detail for their themeing. Every time I go in, there is something new that screams Dr. Who.

The food is very good. The pressed hot sandwiches never fail to impress. I love how we can build our own sandwich - they have many many things to chose from, and it's a nice "homemade" alternative to Subway. 

While the cafe did recently get wireless to give it more of a "coffeehouse feel", I would be pleased to find more seating availability. It is always a tight squeeze when eating in there, and sometimes you are pressed to find a seat. 

The atmosphere of the cafe is nice too. You can tell they are working really hard to bring customers and attention to downtown Elgin, as they host improv nights, live bands, etc. 

Good job Blue Box, keep up the good work!
The Blue Box BLT is amazing! Awesome atmosphere and service. A plus if you are a Doctor Who fan.
I loved the coffee here! The turtle lattes are scrumptious while the atmosphere is trendy and innovative; points for a Doctor Who theme!

The wife, kids and I went to check this place out. We are Dr. Who fans so we had to go. The parking was easy. Super clean place with a fantastic vibe. I had the grill cheese which was very good. We enjoyed looking at the decor while eating and relaxing. The staff was friendly. The kids liked the free wifi so they could send pictures to their friends. I'm excited to have an easy place to get a beverage and a sandwich with a great vibe. Only down side was when you first get there the menu board is a bit overwhelming. We just grabbed a menu and that was easier.

Nice atmosphere. Friendly service. Tasty sandwiches.

The club sandwich lacks the (traditional) third slice of bread, lettuce and tomato, but it's still good nonetheless. The veggie (eggplant) sandwich is excellent. You can also "build your own" which may be a good option.

The espresso was not so great, however, the traditional coffee is pretty good.

Hands down, this place is one of the best in Elgin! I went for a Chai Tea Latte, it was very tasty (totally recommend it) I'd say it has a similar taste to Starbucks Chai Tea Latte. 
I as well had the breakfast sandwich, it was delicious and perfect for a quick breakfast before class. 
The staff is super friendly and the shop is cozy and clean along with a nice view of Elgin. :)

Blue box has the best sandwiches anywhere an the Elgin area!!! My wife and I have never left disappointed. Plus, it has a cool environment and a very friendly staff. This is my favorite go to lunch spot.

Bring your Sonic Screwdriver!

This place is great for those that get the gag, but still good for those that don't.

Good coffee, good food, good decor and location.

I particularly enjoyed the Tom Baker outfit on the coatrack at the back.

Been here quite a few times. Service is good and the bring your meal to your table. Owners are great friendly people. So far everything I have ordered has been good. My fav is the BLT n coffee. Has a nice small coffee shop feel. They have special events as well with live music. I will be back again soon!

I absolutely am in love with this place!!! The gourmet lattes are to die for. The tea is made from FRESH HERBS. The decor is a classy and modern doctor who theme. These people care about their customers. I feel so welcome every time I visit. I recommend anyone in the Elgin area to make this a regular routine and show support. Tastes like theirs are hard to find. This cafe has made downtown Elgin and an even brighter and happier place to spend your time. Great job guys!!! Keep up the awesome work.
So fun! Very friendly. Delicious black coffee and baked goods. I also love their white chocolate and lavender drink.
Great sandwich! Had the Italian sub-yummy! I see the Reuben from a far & for sure will try on my next visit.

Great coffee & muffins! Loved the Dr. atmosphere (which is why I went in the first place). Kinda pricey on the coffee but then they were much, MUCH better than that trendy super popular place that is on most corners everywhere. Didn't have any of the sandwiches though. Again, just coffee & muffins. If you are looking for some seriously excellent coffee and are willing to pay for it, this is the place to go.
Great sandwich and breakfast place, great coffee, cooky decor, I'm not hip to Doctor Who but I can appreciate the theme. Lovely addition to downtown Elgin!!!
We are big Doctor Who fans and loved it here. The food and service was great, we will definitely go back.
This place is very good in what it offers and is only getting better. Will review again after a few more stops.
I ordered the Reuben and it was so delicious!  They have great varieties of chips.  I liked the neighborhood feel and decor!  I will definitely be back!

Tried this place for the first time today.  We ordered the soup of the day and sandwiches.  Both very good.  The meat, cheese and especially the bread were very fresh.  Two daily soup specials were delicious but a generous serving.  We will make this a regular rotation,in our lunch outings.  Service was great!

I love the theme! Not saturated with the Doctor, just right. The Club is made with Boar's Head deli meat and it's amazing. Get a dirty chai tea iced and you'll forget the sugary Starbuck's version. Sandwiches are small for the price but good.

This is a great sandwich and soup shop. Great place to get a hot, pressed sandwich. Staff is great and I had no complaints during my first visit.

I got the Rueben, which, to be truthful was 100% faithful to the traditional rueben. Instead of sauerkraut, Blue Box uses coleslaw. I was not disappointed, it was a great substitution! And the bagged chips were great too!

And if you're a fan of Dr Who fan, lots of to enjoy at the Blue Box.
Love this place. I'm not a Dr. Who fan, but a lot of my friends are. Nicely decorated, friendly staff, great coffee and teas and good sandwiches!

I came here on a Saturday with my wife and her parents. All of us enjoy Doctor Who to varying degrees, which was a major draw. I love the idea of a geek-themed coffeehouse! 

Now, that being said, this place is not just for fans of Doctor Who, it's actually a really great cafe, that has an tasteful geek slant.

I went in expecting to be surrounded by inundated with Doctor Who stuff, cluttering the walls and tables, but I was delighted to see that this place has just enough Doctor Who stuff to thrill the fans, but unobtrusive enough to be ignored by someone who is not a fan.

For starters, there's the staff. They were all charming, fun, sweet, and most importantly, incredibly helpful and professional. Whoever hired this staff should be a hiring consultant for other coffee shops. We also took a moment to speak with the owner, who was working with his staff on the front lines, not just sitting back watching, which shows you his devotion to his craft. He was also a charming, fun, sincere guy, and he was very grateful that we were there. He explained his business philosophy and love for Doctor Who, and it made writing this review much easier. It's hard not to love someone who loves what he does and does it well.

They use Metropolis Coffee, which is a company based in Chicago, which I absolutely love. I had ordered a couple of shots over ice, (and yes, I know, any coffee geek knows that ice murders a shot, I know, I run a coffeeshop, but I also like what I like) which was made perfectly. Rich and syrupy, and plenty strong. I know what shots of Redline Espresso are supposed to taste like, and the barista who made my shots apparently knows what they are supposed to taste like as well, because it was exactly what I was looking for. The espresso machine they use also shows that they're not just playing around.

Then there was the food. Holy moley! I'm a fella who loves his sandwiches, and they knocked it out of the park!! I ordered the Elgin Club, and I don't even remember what was on it (bunch of meat, bacon, and some sort of spicy mayo), and I was entirely blown away. It was out of this world (which makes sense in a sci fi themed cafe)!! Toasted bread, plenty of proteins, and a perfect size. I wasn't even especially hungry, but I demolished the sandwich and thought about getting another.

Instead I got a couple of pastries!!

They had something that I believe was called a "Magic Bar," which was like a brownie, but with butterscotch and graham cracker crust. I could probably eat a whole tray of those, and most definitely it would be my undoing. It was rich!

I would contest that the Blue Box is a place for people who like a good cafe, if you like great coffee, great food, and great dessert.

Bonus points if you hail from Galifreyan.
Its a small place and can get some coffee. Nothing great.

Great little cafe. They have a nice selection of sandwiches, some muffins/brownies, good coffee and a really chill atmosphere. The workers were super friendy- great service. I got a mint madness iced latte- delicious!! Kinda pricey though...About the same price as starbucks- 16oz=around $4.

I enjoyed everything about it. Coffee is great, breakfast sandwich was a good size and tasty. Staff was friendly and I thoroughly loved the themed decor. Very comparable in price to the brand name place that starts with D, but I appreciate that it is not. You definitely need to try it!

I've been here several times and am totally rooting for the place to succeed.  The Dr. Who theme is fun (even for those of us who have never watched the show (yes ... I know)), although the noise from the episodes that are playing on the TV can be a bit obtrusive.  The coffee is fantastic and the food is decent, with a number of vegetarian options.  The owners have obviously put a lot of thought into every aspect of the business, and it shows.  Very much recommended.

Great atmosphere, high quality coffee drinks made with care, and tons of delicious sandwiches. The offer gluten free options as well which i love! A must visit in Elgin in the morning or at lunchtime.

A little bit of a challenge to find (but they are working on that). Reuben & yummy Metropolis Coffee mad the trip well worth it.  Being a Dr Who fan doesn't hurt either.  Already planning my next trip there.

Good atmosphere, and the food and coffee are good (when they're good) but I have found the preparation and quality to be inconsistent.  I'm hoping things will improve and this will become a regular stop for me.
The food and service was good. It was neat to see the Dr Who items. However, the bad part is the food is a bit pricey.
Good coffee and free wifi. Like the parking garage next door. Would like to see them offer sugar free syrups for the espresso drinks. Skinny options are a plus for me.

Let me just say, the coffee! The coffee was SO GOOD! I don't get anything fancy, just plain ol' coffee and I add my own sugar and milk. But it was wonderful! They have a big board with all of the different types of coffees you can get but I like mine simple. I love that the parking garage across the street always seems to have the 30 min parking spots open so I can just pop in, get my coffee and be on my way. My husband really enjoys their sandwiches and the prices are very reasonable. It's a cute, cozy place with tables to sit at if you are getting food. We'll be back!
What kind of coffeehouse does not have brewed iced tea or a coffee of the day? Missed marketing opportunities!
Just not good food. Friendly service and good guacamole but thats about it. The chips were a bit stale to start and the food just not fresh enough. Would not return.

Everyone,

My own imposed rules for any Chain Restaurant review:

1. Must visit at least three times.  Two of which must be distinctly different formats; i.e. one weekday night and one weekend night.
2. Since the food should be the same everywhere, with the exception of regional items, the food category will only be judged on the quality of the expected food (i.e. temperature, consistency, and amount).
3. Ratings are based on a 10 point scale with 5 being average, which does not mean bad.  What a score of 5 means is that the category meets expectations for that establishments format. 

Thanks.

McDonalds - Larkin Ave

Location/Layout - 5.5/10:  This McDonalds is located on Larkin Ave in Elgin, just west of McLean and directly across the street from Larking High School.  The store was recently updated to coincide with the McCafe launch and has a very modern feel along with a small area in front of the washrooms and adjacent to the order counter that is laid out like a coffee house.  With the retrofit they finally moved the fountain from behind the counter and allowed refills to be self service.  There are two drive up lanes, which helps speed up the drive through process but combined with the layout of the building creates an odd parking lot where most of the spaces are a good distance from the entrance; but it is not necessarily a bad thing to get a few steps before or after any meal.  

Service - 3.5/10:  The rating is not reflective of staff which is always expedient and usually very friendly.  The score is due to multiple signs and decisions made by management.  First, there are signs limiting the duration of your stay to no more than 20 minutes.  While I understand they are located across the street from a high school, this does not create the most customer focused environment.  This is even more confusing based on the fact that they built their interior to be a coffee house with WIFI and bench type seating for working on laptops?  Next are the signs limiting refills to one per customer but the fountain is self serve?   Additionally, there is a sign noting the limit of condiments and charges associated with any above "normal".  Lastly is the choice of TV station.  I am not picking a lane politically and I do believe in an owner's right to choose their own stations.  But if you want to have news on I feel it should be something like CLTV, The Weather Channel, or a proprietary channel similar to other fast food options so you do not alienate any of your possible clients.  

Food - 5/10: Orders are filled very quick and accurately, especially given how busy this location gets.  The two recent issues I have experienced both have to do with the fries.  First they are always overly salted, which can be rectified if you request a special lightly salted order.  But the bigger issue is that they are always considerably short in volume.  For example a large rarely fills 2/3rds of the container.  The sandwiches on the other hand are very well constructed and often get close to emulating the pictures of the item.        

Overall Experience - 5/10:  On the whole this is a very people friendly and efficient McDonalds.  They always satisfy when you have that Big Mac or QPC craving.  Unfortunately, I also get the McDonalds fry craving only to be left wanting both a giant drink and more fries.

Worst McDonald's I've ever been to. The only thing they're consistent with is screwing up orders and being absolutely slow. The general manager does not follow through with corporate complaints and frankly has no idea how to train employees. I'll get my chicken nugget fix at one of the other million McDonalds, thanks.

This is hands down the slowest McDonalds in the entire area. You sit at the speaker for about two minutes every time before anyone even says anything. On several occasions I've seen a few cars go through the other lane before my order is taken. Then they're usually chatting with each other inside at the window where they take your money. Finally after wasting at least ten minutes of your time you get your food. Avoid this location at all costs.
The best McDonald's in our region. They are really fast, nice and just a great bunch of people.
It's McDonalds....standard fast food fare.  No surprises is a good thing. And this place has not messed up an order of mine (drive through or walk in) and everything has tasted like what I expect.

Just had another horrible customer service experience... tried to pay with my ISIS wallet app as this location is listed to use it and your inept employees didn't know how to use it. TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES!!!

Went to McDonalds drive thru today 9/13 at 12:18am  I ordered 1 fish fillet. 1 Big Mac. 20 piece Mcnugget. I was informed that there was no Fish Fillet after midnight. No problem. I asked to replace the Fish Fillet with either a Big Mac or a Quarter Pounder . I got my order and received the Big Mac and nuggets only. I called back right away. They offered to replace what I was missing although I opted not to drive back. So basically they lost a sale of 1 sandwich. Friends let me tell you. I go everywhere as mystery diner...even a fast food drive thru.  I had just left Jimmy's Charhouse and have also been at many many different  restaurants every day in the past almost daily..Im out daily as a  critique  So....Ok. Ok. We are talking McDonalds drive thru at midnight "ish" .....bottom line. Bear Family....2 of your employees were very accomodating. ....i have never met them. 1 is the woman that took my order and money named Rina. ..the other Maria that graciously gave me my order. Both were very accomodating and friendly.also hot and fresh..I need the McDonalds on Summit St in Elgin to know my experience was exceptional. Thank you. Good help at those hours are hard to come by. Please recognize these 2 individuals for a gracious mystery restaurant conosuier. ..

Service through the drive-through is always very quick! Quick tip though ask for no salt on your fries unless you like salt with a little fry! And be sure to always check your bag before you drive off they seem to be very forgetful on completing an order!

Havent been to Mc D's for a long time and wont be going back! Had a Big Mac for $4.19. I only live 5 min away, and COLD. VERY slow service at 11pm.!! For another $1 I could have had a GREAT burger from Smashburger!!!!! It was the McDonalds on Summit in Elgin!!!!

Wed night (3/5/14) drive thru waited 13 mins to get a coffee at night
Guy just handed me the coffee 
N not even a "thanks" or "have a good night" or "sorry value the wait"

Friday night (3/7/14) drive thru again!
Ordered two mcdoubles n 2 cups with just ice since we had our drinks in the car already 
We needed the cups with ice only 
What appeared to be the manager cause of her uniform being different from the rest,, not even a "thank you" n once I reminded her about the cups cause she was stepping back like my order was over 
She said "what"?
N then other employee hand her the cups n gave them to me n then she gave me even more attitude when I asked her if I can have 2 straws????? 
The place might be clean but customer service is. Garbage!!
Service is quick in the morning. Food is not always hot, just lukewarm.
Ordered a bunch of food. Ordered 40 nuggets. Got home and only found 20. Had to drive all the way back to get the other 20. And they didn't comp anything for coming back.
Orders are frequently wrong. Staff is either resenting me for the fact that they have to do something or overly fake cheerful and hyper. I've stopped going here.

I liked this McDonald's until I got an Iced Coffee on Friday that was horrible, because it barely had any cream or a hint of hazelnut. Then today, I received lettuce in my iced coffee. I will now get my iced coffee somewhere else or make my own.

Worst mcdonalds in all of Elgin.  Managers and staff are incompetent.  Ive had issues every time i go, always attitude from staff and orders are always incorrect.  If you want to pay for bad service McDonalds on summit is perfect for you. Management from here and bluff city mcds have promised me free meals in the mail but somehow ive never received. Never going back.

I would give one star but had to give McDonald credit for redoing the restaurant.  Place is nice and easy drive thru.  As PROS.  However on the negative side.  Customer Service bad!.  Person taking your order speaker box -Drive thru. NOT very friendly. No hello good morning and thank you after taking your order.  Person taking your payment same No hello good morning and thank you. And most of all the person who is giving your order No hello good morning and thank you. NO SMILE either. This is not the first time I had experience going here.  I guess they are just there to work and get paid for the day.  There are some cases that I missed some items in my to go bag and when get home don't bother to go back as it will cost me more on gas.   Other than that place looks great, but need work badly on customer service.
You will be surprised how clean this McDonald if you come from the city like me

A couple years ago, this McDonald's was rebuilt from the ground up, and it is a nice clean restaurant. However, this did not change what historically may be the worst McDonald's on the planet. Frequently, the order is filled incorrectly. There is a dual-lane drive through where one lane is ignored for three or four orders by the order-taker. There is an occasional good employee behind the counter, but by and large, customer service is negligible and borderline rude at times. In spite of the new building, however, most of the parking is located far in back of the building with little room for pedestrians to get to the door. The only reason I ever go in there or drive through at all is because it is close to home, but if I have time and a hankering for McDonald's, I'll choose to go across town to avoid this one. If Yelp allowed no stars, that's what it would deserve, but it is kept clean, so they should get some credit ... but clean doesn't make up for an overall dismal operation.

This is by far the worst McDonald's I have ever been to.  For years we have tried and tried with no success.

Can you imagine a McDonald's that serves the cold soggy fries?  If my reputation was partially, based on fries, I would make sure they are always perfect.

They don't understand what you are saying. So half the time the orders are incorrect.  I'm just saying...

We thought we'd stop in for a late snack. What a mistake.. screaming kids on top of them screwing up our order. And, the manager would not give more than alame "sorry" after messing up the refund, after the mistaken order, and making us wait 10 minutes while taking other peoples orders... choose another Mickey Dee!!!!

Do I get that worked up over a cup of water? Yes. Yes I do.

The service here is okay. No one is particularly friendly, but they aren't completely off-putting. If someone smiled, the place may explode (or at least that's how they act). My food was hot, which was nice, and the order was as accurate as they would let it be.

I pulled up to the drive-through and asked for a Number 4. The girl at the window asked me what I wanted to drink, and I said "just water". Pop makes me sick, so I don't drink it. She offered me a bottle of water, which would cost me extra. I said no, just a cup of water. I was told that I could not have a cup of water, because water is free (I fail to see why that is a problem), so I would have to get something else. She offered me an apple juice, so I took that. When I got my receipt, I was charged $1 extra for a tiny, tiny juice box (that didn't even come with a straw, and for anyone who has tried to drink a juice box without a straw, you know it's a pain), and they gave me a cup of water with it anyway! I'm irritated that I was forced to order something that I didn't even want, and it cost me more for the honor!

When I called the manager, I was told that I could order the items separately (and be charged more), or get a bottle of water (and be charged more). He said that the computer won't let them give me water with a meal, so I asked why they can't just ring up a pop and put water in the cup instead. Apparently, that never occurred to them. Real creative thinkers working here, I guess.

Two stars, and I feel like I'm being generous.
I never going back to this McDonald's ever they mess up my order and did give my receipt and expect me that my order is ready!!!!!
These guys wont refill your coffee just for stepping outside.

I went here last weekend for brunch and it was delicious! I had an omelette frittata with whole wheat pancakes, and I don't have one negative thing to say about the food. The whole wheat pancakes were some of the best I've had from a restaurant :)

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because their up-charges are pretty insane. Two cheeses? Extra $2. Whole wheat pancakes instead of regular? Extra $2....seems a little high!

I haven't been here for breakfast since they moved from across the street. The new place seems larger but has lost something in the plain decor. Still looks like an Applebee's minus the bar.

The food is good but pricey. Service today was okay. Waitress was pleasant but side of hash browns was delivered well after main meal and not done to my request (I like them crispy). Coffee delivered promptly.

One thing kinda cheezed me off was that I ordered short stack of blueberry pancakes. After looking at what I thought was a high breakfast bill I noticed that short stack of cakes was $7.10 with blueberries adding an additional $2.00 making it a total of $9.10. A regular order of blueberry pancakes is only $9.00. That's bass ackwards right? Proper waitstaff would have noted that. That's a lotta green for average pancakes.

So $28 (not incuding tip)  for pancakes, waffle, hash browns and coffee (wife drinks water) is a bit pricey in my book. You can find similar quality elsewhere for a bit less money.

Good food... but very, very over priced.

Two omelettes and two coffees $32 including tax and tip.  Ouch!!

I always like to go to new places for breakfast, but I usually regret not going where I really love (Jojos, or Ikea if I'm being cheap on a weekday).  This place was not bad, but it did seem a little overpriced.  People were ok, but not overly friendly.  I got a scrambler, which was good.  The gyro meat was kinda crispy (what?) and the hash browns were under cooked.  Again, not bad, but would not be my first choice.

Been going here a lot before they moved and always liked it, not this time, ordered the skirt steak skillet and the skirt steak was inedible, I bought and cooked skirt steak many times. Theirs was not trimmed, marinated or cooked properly.  The fat in the steak should add to the flavor, not make it so it couldn't be chewed. The owner didn't seem to care so I don't care if I ever go back. Looks like you lost another customer.

Service was a 1/5. Food was a 2/5. This restaurant is way over priced, so getting horrible treatment and food just made it worse. Never going back again after many years of going. The host was very unfriendly. She's a middle aged women so I'm assuming she's a family friend or relative. Because she didn't seem to care that she was so rude. When I asked her the total of my order over the phone she had such an attitude and didn't even bother to tell me. I ordered a meat lovers skillet and the hash browns were so dry and burnt it was almost inedible. I ordered a salad as well and didn't even get any dressing. I work at a breakfast restaurant that is also family owned and prices, service, and food over top this place. This USED to be my favorite breakfast place but their service and food is going down the drain.

Good for them to relocate about 2 blocks Southwest of their old location on Barrington Road. Anyone familiar with the area will agree that the Egg Basket on this side of the street is much more visible to a passerby and the ample parking is a welcome change. 

I try avoiding Sunday brunch for obvious reasons but it's hard saying, "No" to a dad who seldom offers going out for breakfast or spending any time with his elder daughter on the weekends.

When we arrived, it was a full house! Every chair and booth were occupied, except for this makeshift table for two that was tucked away in a corner next to the front desk but situated in a way that whoever sat there would be seen by everyone who entered, exited, walked by and worked at the restaurant. The hostess seemed apprehensive about asking my dad and me if we'd sit there or wait 10-20 minutes... I think she was getting used to being turned down by everyone she asked before us. We'd rather eat than wait to be seated.

The location has changed but everything else about this place is same ol' same ol'... Right down to the coffee refills being slow to come by. The breakfast entrees are average and familiar but cost more than other restaurants with the same concept.

That is why this place is 2.5 - 3 stars. I don't crave the Egg Basket...

This place is absolutely jam packed on Sundays, but surprisingly when I went in there we were greeted and served our food in under 15 minutes. Quite impressive considering the amount of people in the building. As for the food, it was solid, if something short of excellent. The Denver omelette was delicious, but the hash browns were a bit greasy. Still, not a bad choice for a breakfast joint if you want to avoid a chain like Denny's or IHOP.

Came in at 8:30am on a Saturday. Was seated immediately. Place was clean and service was attentive. Ordered corned beef hash skillet with side of pancakes.   Food was good and prices were reasonable. Definitely a good choice for breakfast.

I may be wrong but the quantity they serve is a bit toooooooo much for breakfast!  
A lot of variety in the menu to choose from!
Pancakes were yumm.
The biscuit and gravy were a hit for me. 
The omelette we ordered were to be without spinach and one without mushrooms but both had these ingredients in it! Thank god my husband isn't allergic to those and just let is go rather than complaining and waiting another 15-20 mins for another one.
The coffee served is average.
Staff is courteous and kind.
I love this place ever since it opened. The fluffy omelets are so good I always ask them to put avocado. Their coffee is also very good and I drink straight black no cream or sugar.

My husband and two daughters have never been at this breakfast place, we were seated in 3 minutes, our server greeted us as soon as we sat down with coffee and a warm smile. We explained to her that we are new to the area and we have never been to this restaurant. Shanon suggested her favorites!  One was the  meat-lover's skillet, which I ordered and loved.  Husband ordered a gyro omelette and my kids had French toast with bacon.  All the ingredients were fresh, Service was top notch my kids loved Shanon, she went out of her way to make sure my family was happy, Now a days that kind of service is hard to find. We really enjoyed our breakfast and will be coming back for sure.
The steak Benedict was very tasty as were the hash browns. The atmosphere was friendly great wait staff. Definitely great place to bring the whole family.

We really thought the new location would give this place a new vibe, but alas it has not.  We used to rave about Egg Basket, but it started to become less than lackluster for us.

We went out for breakfast on a Sunday morning and we were seated right away.  I can't tell if this new location has more seats than the last, but its definitely more open.  It is weird not seeing a huge bar in there though, lol.  We thought maybe thats why they moved so they could have alcohol added to their menu, or maybe their lease was just up.

Waitress was very attentive, especially with coffee.

Now onto the food, my blueberry pancakes were OK, I do love their batter, its nice and thick and has a great crust to it, however, the blueberries were lacking.  Hubby's skillet was just OK too, he got the country skillet because he felt like some biscuits and gravy action with a little something extra.  The gravy didn't have much kick to it and there was barely any sausage.

Meh...

This place reminds me of a Holiday Inn or any mediocre breakfast diner. It was extremely loud and crowded when I arrived (approximately mid morning). I was not wow'ed by anything either.  I wasn't craving breakfast, so I ordered a burger (since I thought it was a safe option for me).  But the burger I got was so dry and tasteless.  I guess I should have stuck with pancakes. 

Would I come back?  No.  But maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, so whatever you do don't get their cheeseburgers.

Unacceptable food.  Chicken and rice soup tastes like lemon soup.  Hash browns were tolerable with hot sauce.  And DON'T TOUCH THE BREAD.  Reused in basket!  Hostess is very rude but thought she was amusing.  Our waitress was friendly.  She was the light at the end of this dark tunnel.

I just came here for the first time. The corned beef hash is pretty great. The coffee is not bad.

Tom, my waiter, was unbelievable. Very friendly and attentive. He seems to really care about whether your food is good, anticipates anything you may need before you even ask, all without being overbearing. Very outgoing. 

The place is big and clean. Nice atmosphere. Got here before the rush on a weekday. I'll have to go back and try more stuff!

I've finally got to try this place after hearing about it for so long. Walking in they were packed but luckily we didn't have to wait. We were seated right away. I ordered the gyros skillet, I got my gyros well done & let me just say my taste buds were happy. I also ordered a side of bacon... Yummy! My mom got sausage patties, I personally liked the bacon more. I think the sausage needed to be cooked more. The coffee ; BEST COFFEE I EVER HAD. I had 3 cups of it. The service was excellent, such a nice, friendly waitress we got. Will defiantly come back!!

Since they've moved to a new location I thought I should bring over my previous review, which still holds true, and add my thoughts on their new spot.

I don't know, maybe it's because we had been going to their original location for so many years that the new place just seems strange. There's nothing really wrong with it.  It's in the old Applebee's spot so there's plenty of booths and tables, though it is not as huge of a location as their original so you may be more likely to wait for a table if you come at a peak time.  I do miss the high ceiling and the bright airiness from all the windows at their previous location, though.

With that said - everything I've said about their good food & service still stands:
