They have a HUGE menu and there are always some specials.  We've been coming here for many years and my husband's family for many more prior to my appearance.  All the servers and staff are very friendly and the food typically comes out pretty quick.

I especially like how many meals (not all, for breakfast & lunch) come with fruit.  It may not say this on the menu but I've been surprised a number of times to have two big slices of melon and an orange wedge garnishing my plate.

I haven't had anything here I didn't like.  My hubby is a pancake snob, however, and he says their pancakes are "too grainy" for his taste.  I tried 'em and they seemed like fine normal pancakes to me.  I really love their French Toast.  Big, thick fluffy slices cooked to golden perfection.  Slather on some butter and that warm syrup and I'm content.

A nice family Restaurant. Great place to enjoy breakfast, the atmosphere is comfortable. There scrambled eggs are delicious, there hash brown are homemade and very delicious! This is our second time here and we haven't been disappointed. Highly recommended location. Be prepared to wait a few minutes before being seated however you'll enjoy your meal.
I have come here for years. Staff is always friendly and food is always great. We tend to go around noon so wait time is minimal to none.

This was my first time at their new location, my last visit was sometime in late 2012. 

Their new location is easier to spot than their last and there is ample parking. The inside is very nice and has plenty of seating arrangements. 

I ordered biscuits and gravy with eggs and sausage which was prepared incredibly fast. I only had to wait a short time for pancakes. Their service was very friendly and very attentive. 

Overall I really liked the new location and setting. Their service was great including the fact that I had a server in training. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

My husband and I been coming here since they opened. The amount you received for your buck was great. They are truly failing now. We came for lunch about a month ago chicken tortilla soup. What we received was jalapeo soup. Not kidding it was LOADED  with them and no chicken. Was told cook was on vacation and someone else was cooking. Had to pass on their soup. 
The Mexican skillet breakfast with skirt steak was worth $11.95. Meat was tender and the serving was worth it.  In September we noticed a change in the breakfast. Smaller portion of meat hash browns were soggie. Then Today the meat was tough didn't taste like skirt steak. The Server Chris puts the plates on our  table they weren't hot. She didn't give us napkins didn't ask if we needed anything else. We ended up talking to the manager about it. Then Chris comes over to see what the problem was. Our food was cold but the eggs. Then she rolls her eyes. If you don't like your job then go somewhere else. I know waitresses look forward to tips and you can tell the hustlers!!!! She Still didn't come back. I don't know who is cooking or purchasing the meat but it's poor. I raved about this place now I am disappointed.
Every time I come here I can kick myself.  Expensive and the food is terrible.  The potatoes with my eggs tasted like cold grease and the toast was cold and hard.  Last time here
Excellent "classic" omelette!!! Great food, nice atmosphere, fairly priced and friendly service from Jessica! I leave a happy customer!!!

the food was actually pretty decent.  i liked their hash browns very much.  generous portions.  we had breakfast there on a sunday.  i had the steak and eggs.  my steak came out a little more well done than i wanted.  the waitress was so nice.  very friendly and professional (jessica).  she offered to take my order off the bill or have a new steak made.  we opted for a new steak.  when the manager came over to question our 'complaint', we got attitude from him.  he didn't even introduce himself and ask what was wrong with my steak.  not how you handle the situation.  after we told him my steak was overcooked, he walked away shaking his head, which i don't think he realized i was watching him.  i then saw him talking to an older couple in the corner (the owners i presume), who kept looking at our table.  it was obvious they were talking about us.  when they brought me my new steak, it was on the rare side of what i wanted.  i told the waitress don't worry about it.  i ate a portion of it.  the waitress then told us that we could not take the leftover in a to-go box.  this shocked me.  did they actually think i was trying to get a free steak out of my meal?  believe me, i can afford to buy myself a steak.  but when a customer orders a steak and it doesn't come out cooked to order, the manager should take care of the problem.  we actually had been wanting to eat at this restaurant, but after this rude treatment from the managers, i will not eat here again.  they do not know how to treat customers with respect.  did you actually think that i could not see you talking about us in the corner?  if you have something to say about the customers, don't be so obvious talking about them in the corner and looking their way.  go back in the kitchen and do it behind closed doors.  

outside of that, the food was actually pretty good.  but after that kind of treatment, i won't go back, and i'll tell anyone else that asks, not to go there either.
Great service, good portions, waffle is amazing. Isabella was great!!!! The corn beef hash was not good, I don't recommend it. Over all good experience....

I try to treat my kids to a breakfast out every so often and since my son had been here before, I thought I would bring my daughter here as well. 

The place was packed but for a Sunday morning at 10 am ,the wait was minimal (just over 5 minutes.) We were led to out seata in the very crowded dining room and were seated in a nice little booth.

A woman came around and offered me coffee and a short time later a gentleman with water. It was just a few minutes before the waitress came by to take our orders.

I ordered the spinach and feta omlette, my son the mickey mouse pancakes and my daughter the chocolate chip pancakes. The portions are huge.The kids loved their food. I cannot say the same for mine. The feta tasted funny.

Coffee and water service came around regularly. The waiter staff was very nice but the food is just okay.

I think I will sticm with Omega.

George K-The  Food and Service was out of this world. Please order the Skirt Steak Skillet topped with Melted Swiss......acompanyied with a fresh Grapefruit Juice and a side of Bacon wow!!!!! You must get up and go!! You now what I'm going to head out my self I'm hungry a giant see yeah there:-)
I've been s customer of the Egg Basket restaurant for years. Their quality of food and service is outstanding. I highly recommend this place for breakfast, brunch or lunch.

I made a yelp just to leave a review for this place. I've been here a few times and every time the service seems the same. Rude waitresses and every time I order something I ask for no meat on it for religious purposes, I even ask them to double check it and surprise there's always meat in it. After the second time it happened I'm never coming back
Basic breakfast food with better service. We usually like to take our time while out eating and can feel rushed, not here, even when they're busy. Thank you.
Excellent breakfast! Have yummy small fresh hand squeezed orange juice.  Bacon cooked nice and crisp. Perfect pancakes that were light and fluffy. Reasonably priced. Friendly and prompt service.

Definitely not my favorite breakfast place in the Schaumburg/Hoffman/Streamwood area... Nor my second.  Or my third.  

My husband and I have a tradition of going for breakfast after voting and before work each election day and we decided to give this place a try.  The ambiance itself is fine, lots of tables and a decent amount of folks talking over coffee and eggs, and no wait,  but that could also have been due to it being a Tuesday.  

Our server was friendly enough and the menu was large.  I asked what her favorite omelette was and ended up going with her suggestion.  But it's now Saturday and I can't remember the name even though half of it is still in my fridge and won't be eaten at this point.  What I do remember is that the omelette was pretty unmemorable.  

And that is the word that can basically sum up all of our food: unmemorable.  The hashbrowns were just ok, the pancakes also ok, the slice of melon that came with my meal,  warm,  definitely not fresh,  and therefore gross.  My husband opted for a turkey sandwich and fries and wasn't thrilled about the portion.  He did say that the turkey tasted real as opposed to like lunch meat so I guess at least there's that? 

If I lived in a small town and didn't have any other breakfast restaurant options, I would be alright with going to the Egg Basket.  At least once in a great while.  Fortunately, I live in the suburbs and have many, many awesome options.  I don't think that we will be returning anytime soon.
love this place come here a lot and the servers is great along with the food. just like a family own you use to find

Spent over $50.  Had a problem with one of the plates.  CBH tasted terrible.  Asked them to remove the plate and remove it from the bill.  They took a couple dollars off instead of removing thy item.  Instead of taking care of the problem, they refused to let me leave happy.  Now I will be taking my once or twice a month visits to IHOP or omega. The manager there had no interest in helping. Way to go. Tripping over $100 bills to save pennies.  I guess they don't like repeat business.
Egg Basket is straight up the BOMB.com!!! We love this place and have been going here since we moved to Streamwood 12 years ago! Great all American breakfast! Great prices!
Seriously the best pancakes in the history of pancakes. And we love Dee!! She's our favorite server, so sweet, professional, and such a riot!!

I have been going to The Egg Basket for a couple of years now and it seemed strange to me that they moved, specially to a smaller location square foot wise. However, our waitress today explained that the table set up that they had allowed more people than the older one. 

Now to the food part. This place has never disappointed me. Maybe if I was picky about the wait times like some people I would complain, but since I'm not I love this place because their food is always fresh and delicious. Today I visited the new spot for the first time after my 10k muddy race I did along with my family, and as any runner or athlete would relate, after a good and rough workout, one is starving. I ordered a vegetable omelette which turned out to be a avocado omelette because I ordered to put avocado on my omelette (which the veggie doesn't have), and substituted hash browns with fresh fruit which was very fresh and very delicious. 

Will definitely keep coming back to this place because it's my to go spot after a race I have.

This place was disappointing. I ordered the avocado skillet and asked for my eggs over medium. My eggs were over cooked and they yolk was hard. The star in my opinion should be the avocado, however the wee an afterthought. They were 3 slices of an avocado on the side of the skillet. They skillet was almost inedible because of all of the jalapeos. I love love spicy food but I couldn't eat this. There were many I had to pick them out. I won't be visiting again.

I'm a fan of brunch diners.  I've been to Omega, Wildberry and now Egg Basket. The service was really quick but it was a weekday. Everyone was polite and quick to keep coffee and water coming. I do think it is a bit expensive and the food taste is just okay. I think they want to be like a Wildberry, however, they are more like an IHOP.  I like IHOP, they are just a different price point.

This is a new location for this restaurant and I have to say it has not changed for the better. It seems much smaller and not a good layout because of the way everyone seemed to keep bumping in to each other. The food was okay and the service was on the slow side. Our server also forgot some of the things we ordered and seemed annoyed when we asked her again.
Horrible Staff, especially the ones that answer the phone.
45 minutes after what was supposed to be a 15 minute wait, I wished I would have just waited out the wait at IHOP. The food was horrible and the service worst. First and last time!

I had family visiting from out of state and my husband and I took them here Sunday around 11:30 am.  As mentioned in other reviews, that's a busy time and we had a 10 minute wait.  They handed us one of those buzz round discs (which weren't working) but it was numbered and the hostesses regularly kept coming outside when a table freed up to find the group who was next.  (Was obvious they've done this before as they had the system downpat really well)

This was our first visit to Egg Basket ever (though we'd eaten at the old location they took over, which was an Applebee's many times).  Service was good though tables were a little cramped, especially if/when there are little ones standing in the narrow walkway.

Two of us ordered skillets and they arrived hot and well cooked.  Someone else ordered an omelette which was also well prepared, as was the 4th meal.

The only interesting thing was the omelette order asked for "half cheese" (he has lactose issues with too much dairy) and the waitress who took our order immediately mentioned she'd write it down but not to be surprised if they didn't do it.  She didn't say if that's cause of the cooks being so busy OR if it's because the cooks don't like special orders.  As she warned, the omelette did come with the full cheese.

The waitress, overall, was friendly and competent.  One person asked some questions and she was able to answer them, discussing what the ingredients were and how they were prepared very well.

Overall, we had a good time and would definitely go there again.
Gr8t place to have Bfast never had a bad meal or service. Strongly recommend.. i love their skillets..

My wife and I went on a Sunday morning to the new location of Egg Basket.  What a disappointment   First the service was poor and the food was cold.  Our server helped out two tables that sat after us . We were not even recognized by her while all we wanted was a glass of water and two coffees. I saw that people that came after us was served quicker with water and coffee.  Our server must of left our food under the warmer lights for a long time since our food came to our table cold. Then it was difficult to track her down.  I will never go back to this restaurant again we have a lot of choices to get great service and warm food.

They use processed cheese on their skillets and they serve the whipped butter frozen so its impossible to spread. The portions were small and the restaurant was dingy and smelt like mold. Everything else was okay.

I have frequently visited this place with my family and I always experience the same gripes. During peak times the place is always packed with no room for people to stand around peacefully. Always people bumping into each other... its a mess. Unsure if this place has more room than the last location but I doubt it. My next issue is their pancakes. They are one of the worsts I have ever tasted. They have a funky taste I cant get over. I do enjoy their skillets however! Only reason i go back here and there. Service is adequate. Worth giving them a try in my opinion.
Be there this afternoon for lunch . There is big parking lot few car . Been seat it by window, find lot ants under my table food is ok but

Big fan of Feta & Spinach omelet.   I don't know what kind of feta cheese they use in their feta & spinach omelet, but it is AMAZING!  The feta makes this omelet.  If the feta cheese sucks, then the omelet sucks.  Walker Bros. uses crappy feta cheese, & it tastes it.   My cousin goes crazy for the spinach & feta omelet here.
I like the generous portions too. Quality of Bacon can be improved upon.  We had a male waiter last visit a week ago, he was really nice & very efficient.  right on top of things & didn't miss anything.  Even though we were a party of 4.  I have to mention that the choice of wall colors, (orange & bright yellow) are hideous for a restaurant.  I can't stand looking at them...so we prefer to sit up by the booths near the windows.
I did love the previous place...more open, more booths, no ugly wall colors.
Same owners, same friendly wait staff, same great food. I love this restaurant. Best breakfast in Chicagoland period.

I'm not a big fan of this place. We're here on a Sunday morning, we were seated immediately and we're waited on immediately.  Food was served in mediocre time. The timing wouldn't have been bad if the food were good, but it wasn't.  All of the food went cold very quickly like it might have been sitting before it was served. I ordered ham off the bone, eggs over easy and side of pancakes. The eggs were cooked perfectly,  but the ham was extremely salty like it might be low quality ham. I did not like the pancakes at all, but I'm fussy about my pancakes. My daughter ordered the steak scrambler which was very bland like no seasoning was used in the cooking process. Sprinkling table salt on this could not help.
If you want real authentic Puerto Rican food with flavor that won't disappoint then this is the catering place for you.

Both times I've been here the service has been fantastic!

The food is pretty good and a little cheaper than Panera. 

Main options are soup, sandwich, or potato. I'd recommend getting a choose 2.

Ugh...such a let down at McAllister's. This was definitely a one and done for both my husband and I. At one point, I actually said to him, "It feels like I am eating at Jewel-Osco." The tuna salad sandwich was plain - it needed significantly more seasoning, crunchy, not limp, lettuce and another tomato. The sides were nothing to write home about, and the iced tea, which is apparently a specialty, was so lacking in flavor that I did not even bother finishing it.

On the flip side, the service was really wonderful, especially considering this is a best casual dining spot. So we waited in the lunch line for 10 minutes, when we did finally get up to the counter, the cashier was polite and friendly. Our food came out quickly, and we were checked upon several times at the table by other staff members. I did appreciate that attention, although it was not necessary.

However, the bottom line is that I have plenty of other fast-casual options in the area, including Panera, Portillo's, and even Chipotle. As such, I would not return to McAlister's. The food just was not good enough.

Tried McAlister's for the first time with my kids.  We went at an off time around 4PM...this is our summer routine.  They stay up until 3AM and wake up at about 11AM, so lunch is around 4PM.  Haha.  Anyway, it wasn't busy at all because of the oddball timing.

My daughter had the broccoli cheese soup in a bread bowl, not anything remarkable, but fine.      My son and I both ordered the 2 For special where you can choose 2 of the following: 1/2 sandwich, 1/2 spud, 1/2 salad, or soup.  I ordered the Reuben and a Roast Beef Spud and my son chose the Club and Bacon/Cheese Spud.  I'm not sure if they just gave us a whole potato because of the time of day or if this was a half order, but the potato was huge.

The Reuben was okay; the bread was not grilled, more like toasted.  I am an avid Reuben fan and this was edible, but nothing special.  The baked potato I had was topped with small pieces of roast beef, grilled onions, and cheese.  It was fine, but there was a weird smell I got a whiff of in a few bites.  It may have been whatever the onions were grilled in, but it was a little off-putting.  My son said his club sandwich and bacon cheese potato were fine.

I used a coupon found in one of the coupon packs you get in the mail.  It was for 2 meals and 2 drinks for $14.99.  This basically gave us our drinks free.  It was an okay meal while out shopping, but nothing to rave about.

I'll keep it simple and say that it's great food with excellent service. They were extremely considerate of my family and I and were extremely accommodating.  I was honestly very pleasantly surprised with food!

A good alternative to places like Subway, Jimmie John's, etc.
I have tried the French dip sandwich, also tuna salad on a croissant, and grilled chicken on a croissant, also love their garden salad (you can add tuna, or chicken salad to it).  Everything I've had from McAlister's has been fresh, and satisfying, not a "gutbuster" meal at all.  Service is attentive, and very friendly.  It has become a regular go-to place for me, since Subway in downtown Geneva closed.

Hoping to improve on my previous experience with McAlister's new location, I stopped by for a second time with the family. Unfortunately, I wish we'd stayed home and shared a box of saltines. 

The food wasn't terrible. I'll give them that. It wasn't great, but it wasn't terrible. Our big takeaway was that mostly everything tasted wet. My second-shot at the Four Cheese Griller was served on a different bread than the first time around, and although I'm not sure how that happened -- the first bread turned out to have been better. We ordered some veggie nachos to share but the nachos turned out to be not-so-veggie so I can't comment on those. I did actually get my side of mac and cheese this time, and it was both mac and cheesy. 

Once again, the biggest issue we had with McAlister's was the service. We ordered a gallon of sweet tea to go at the register, and all three of us heard the girl behind the counter instruct another worker to go get the tea. Somehow, it didn't seem to register with him (even though she said it twice). Still, we had to wait for our food anyway so I didn't really see it being an issue. Spoiler alert: I was wrong. 

Fast forward to picking up our lunch and there's still no tea to be seen. We stood at the counter waiting with our bags for a few minutes and no one seemed to notice. It felt like the giant plastic bags in our hands were acting as some sort of super-powered invisibility cloak to the staff. I spotted a random tea-jug up at the ordering station and watched as a couple of people ordered and left it behind. Eureka! Our tea! I finally called down to the person working behind the register and asked him if it was ours. He shrugged and carried it down to us, and this is where things get weird. 

He plopped (yeah, plopped. I don't think I've ever used that word but it's totally accurate here) our jug down on the counter and walked away without saying a word. Normally, whatever. Plop my tea. I was waiting for it anyway and my food is getting cold. 

However, I felt like this jug could have used some instruction and/or an apology/basic acknowledgement of the fact that this tea varied somewhat from the menu photo. Apparently, they'd run out of lids for the gallon bottles, so someone had taken a piece of plastic wrap and put it over the top, wrapping it with a rubber band to "secure" the liquid. If you know anything about transporting liquids, this is obviously not a strategy for success. Since we were driving a Jeep home, it definitely made for a memorable experience.  

We stared at it for a minute, then back to the staff (who were once again oblivious to our presence), and then collectively gave up on McAlister's. It was like our will to want them to try just eased out of us like a sigh. We still drive by every so often and discuss how we wish we could just eat at McAlister's already, but at this point I'd honestly rather make the 6-hour drive to Missouri for the same food with some decent service.  

Sorry, McAlister's. I really wanted to love you, but I don't think you feel the same.

Instant favorite!  It's funny, we saw the coupons for this place for close to a year before finally giving it a whirl.  Better late than never.  I'm a sandwich kind of guy and gravitate towards clubs and subs the most, which they have an abundance.  If not for the sandwiches I'd still have an easy time choosing from many of their panini's, soups, salads and other warm sandwiches.  Each plate comes with a side of your choice and a pickle.  My son has a craving for their BLT and we like their flavored lemonade's with free refills.  Service here is with a smile and they come around to tables asking if you'd like a refill, and inquire if your meal is okay.  We see coupons for McAlister's in the mail for $3 off a $10 order or two full meals for $14.99.  You can't beat it.  We hope McAlister's is here to stay because it's our new favorite fast food spot.  Cheers.

My husband and I have eaten here at least a dozen times and it's always good. Portions are large, we almost always take food home. Hubbies favorite is the corn beef sandwich, I am a big fan of the salads, they are all delicious. The macaroni and cheese is the best side dish, it taste like they actually use cheese to make it! Be sure to upload their app because you accumulate pretty quickly to get free stuff!

I am definitely a fan of McAlister's lemonade and sandwiches! 

Not only do they have great flavored lemonade, but they also have a killer french dip sandwich! The massive potatoes they offer to are pretty delicious. Prepare to share with a friend, they are really 2 potatoes and really good. 

Each time I've been we've had great customer service at the counter and the food comes to the table out fresh and hot. 

Worth a stop in, and don't forget the wildberry lemonade!

We really like it here. The place is very clean, orders are simple and the food comes out fast for both dine-in and to-go. The menu is large for a deli and they have tons of baked potatoes too...always yummy.

I love the wildberry lemon-aid and you get HUGE cups for a drink with free refills. The sandwiches and salads are both good, i would rate it as a step up from Panera and less money so a win-win.

My first impression... "I was having a scary nightmare and was reminded of one of many imposter deli's in Naperville". You know... the healthy choice, watered down soup, loaded baked potato and salad establishments that have no idea how to make an authentic Rueben kind of place?

The Rueben Sandwich at McAlister's really needs to be reconstituted to enjoy, or at least offer a complimentary quart of sweet tea to wash down a dry sandwich with no flavor. "Yep" it sucks.

Ohhh, damn, I just read that a McAlister's is "coming soon" to Naperville to join the competitive ranks of other deli establishments that have no clue as well. McAllister's will fit right in!

"Told Ya".

I was curious about this place opening.  I've had never heard of them and didn't know it was a chain from the south. 
First impression walking in. .it was busy, they had only been open about a week or so. They really looked like they were trying to be a more modern version of Papers Bread. There was modern music on the speakers, which Panera is more like a library.

Pretty straight forward menu. I am still unaware that its a chain mind you.  I liked the options on the baked potatoes and the pasta selections.

After a pretty long  in line I started to get that chain store feeling. Ok our turn at the register...I'm ready.
I go for the Memphis..turkey, ham, roast beef and provolone on a wheat roll. I opt for the potato salad side and a bowl of chili. My wife goes for the Reuben sandwich and a cup of chicken dumpling soup quick is an extra $3.50. My son gets the four cheese grilled cheese with chips. The drinks are 32 oz and they get it for you, which adds to your time at the register. The offer free refills on the sweet tea, which I got but who's getting a refill after the 32 oz bucket of tea? 

You them take your drinks to a table if you can find one and wait for the servers to bring your food. We found a nice high top table in the front. Service was a bit slow and disjointed, but they are new and probably still working out the bugs.  We kept getting a server asking us if we ordered the cup of extra mayo.  We had no food on our table yet!

The good finally was dropped off and looked good. The meat seemed to be a decent quality, you gEt a decent amount of meat on thevsandwiches (unlike Panera, where you have to search for the meat) the sandwichesv actually looked like the pictures! lthe bread wasn't artisan as Panera but good. Soft and fresh. Here's where the chain store feel comes into light. 
The soup. ..plain and very tasteless with huge noodles taking up most of the small cup. The chili...definitely bought in a huge can and warmed up. The quality and taste is more like you'd find in a hospital cafeteria. Certainly industrial grade. Disappointing.  The chips my son  as his side were plain Jay's chips.  No options here. Just plain Jay's. At least at Subway you get a choice.
The potato salad was the highlight! You get a nice size scoop,  not to big,  not to little. Great taste and texture.
Don't get me wrong. . Sandwiches were good..almost very good but at $11.00 per person, I'm expecting very good. 

I decided to take the chili home so I had to go up and wait in the line and asked for a take home container for a bowl of chili.  The young server said yes they have a container and then stared at me.  After an awkward couple of seconds she asked if I wanted one. .yes I do, I replied. She turned to the people in the kitchen to get the bowl.  The guy said ok do I want a lid. Yes I do I replied. A lot of work for just  ok chili. 
Dont get me wrong, they do a nice job and things will get better as they are trained and open for a bit. The food is good and I will be back to try the potato options. They can get rid of the take home Styrofoam containers. Don't be like everyone else.  
They do a good job for what they do but because they are a chain they they aren't striving  to be great or different. I was hoping for great. They came around and asked  we needed anything and took empty plates away.  That was nice.  I'd go back.

We had quick accurate ordering, prompt delivery to our table, & a friendly clean environment. The food was good. I had a tuna salad which was average, broccoli cheddar soup that was very good, & unsweetened iced tea that I might drive out of my way to order. The staff was very friendly. Our dirty plates were removed from the table pretty quickly & we were asked if we needed refills on our tea. Overall we had a good experience, & will go back to try other food from the menu.

So.... I couldn't believe that we have one now in town. Love this place in Indy!!

Blown away at the slow service. We ordered a salad and soup and were still sitting here without food 20 minutes later. 
There are about 10 people in here with us, we were also told that they are out of multiple food items when we ordered. How can this even happen? Wouldn't you cover the kitchen to impress when your new? 
Can I add... Still sitting here without food!!!

This was my first time trying McAlister's and it was pretty good. I ordered the New Orleans Muffuletta sandwich; it has ham, salami, an olive salad topped with provolone cheese. The flavor of the olives gave the sandwich a nice touch. However, the only negative to the sandwich was the thickness of the bread. I had to take off the top part of the bread since it was so filling. Overall, I am a fan of the sandwich and would come again.

This was one of the worst experiences i have ever had. second time there. First time the had just opened and learning. So I cut them some slack. Today, I go in with my kids. We order 4 items. One was a salad. All 3 non salad orders were wrong. I repeated my order 3 times to the cashier and he repeated the right order back. When I get home and look at the food it's all wrong. I call and the manager is rude. He says I'll give you a vip card. Why would I want that and to come back. You wait 15 minutes for your food at a deli. That in and of itself is wrong. By taking so long you would think the order would be right. 
These people are rude and dont care about your food or.orders. why be rudrto a customer when you messed up. I will never eat or spend money at this place again

I was a bit nervous stopping in here with some of the reviews, but my college love of McAlister's Deli down in Blormal would not stop me from giving it a try- and I was not disappointed. I took my order to go, but did not call in advance- so walked up to the counter and ordered like everyone else. I came around dinner time on a weekday, and there was only a short line. I had my food in hand only 10 minutes after I ordered, which I thought was reasonable. I had the McAlister's Club- which is a fairly typical sandwich- and it was delicious. I also liked the cole slaw and potato salad we had as sides. My husband had a spicy chicken hot sandwich- and he said his was good too (fairly typical deli fair). My favorite thing at McAlister's is the cheesecake- and I was so glad to see that this location had it on the menu. The serving is fairly large, so my hubby and I split a piece- it was just as delicious as I remembered from college years ago!

My sandwich was also large enough that I had leftovers for lunch today- my husbands was not and he was able to finish his in one serving.

We will definitely be back in the future- friendly staff, efficient, good food, great dessert- and decent price. I'd say give it a try- and if you are worried about it being new- wait a couple weeks and give it a try!

1.No one knows what they are doing.
2.Waited 20 minutes for my food.
3.did not receive what I ordered.
4.Very plain and not very good.

We went this past weekend during lunchtime. It was busy but not crowded, the service was fine and the food was really good. I used to visit all the time down south so I am excited to have one close to home. 

We will be going often!

Omg...So many great choices. I had the French dip, hubby had the Rueben and Mark had the Big Nasty. All were really yummy. The Big Nasty was huge, and the gravy was pretty tasty.  Mark only could eat half. My side of Mac and cheese was really good. Usually restaurant Mac and cheese requires a bit of salt but this one was spot on. Had their famous sweet tea which was ok I guess for tea, Fernando thought it was really good. I never drink tea so not a good judge. Next time I will stick with my diet coke, my favorite. Can't wait to come again.

I was so excited when I heard there was a mcalisters opening up nearby! Everything I've had is amazing from their sweet tea, soups, sandwiches, pasta, and desserts. The restaurant is very nicely done, the staff is amazing, and they even refilled my drinks as soon as I needed it! I will be back!
Love the Banh Mi - awesome flavors!  A better alternative to the same old deli places in my opinion!

I give it three with a note that the rating should be described just as 'OK'. Fist time there and it was busy but line wasn't long to order. I'm of course a fussy guy so I order my pastrami on rye cheese only heated. So when I saw it brought to my table with lettuce and tomato I said no biggie I;ll just remove but turns out it had mustard too eek!!!!

They were good about correcting it but the OK comes from the portion being small compared to other pastrami I've had from other deli. It was like half of what I would consider a good size portion, but being it's a franchise, one should expect small portions I guess.

The pastrami was tasty enough though that if I really had a yearning for a pastrami and was passing by.

Went this past Sunday and while the restaurant was crowded the service showed some signs of stress. 

First off I was served my food on a dirty plate hat did not appear to have been washed. 

The portion sizes are relatively small. I had their signature black Angus club sandwich which was a disappointment. 

Not a real alternative to Panera.

Very hit or miss.  Either the portions are too big or too small.  Got soup and sandwich and the portions were very small. Left still hungry ;(. 
Great ice tea though.  If you are hungry get a large salad.

I am saddened to see all of the poor reviews on here. We visited last Saturday at lunchtime. While crowded, we had no trouble finding a table. I ordered the pick two- cheese spud and chicken salad croissant. I asked for sour cream on the side. I was very pleased that they give you a generous amount! Usually it is such a small plop and is never enough for me! I thought it was VERY GOOD and would definitely order it all again. My husband had the New Yorker. He also likes it. Lots of meat piled high. I had the wild berry sweet tea. It was also very good! So good in fact, that I went online and found the berry flavoring and ordered some for at home! The service did seem a tad bit like they still were unsure of themselves, but all were very friendly and pleasant. 

We will definitely be back again!

Growing up in Chicago in a Jewish neighborhood my ears perk up at the mere mention of a deli. Thick corn beef sandwichs, pastrami and large juicy dill pickle spears tantalize my fantasies.... Forget it, it ain't happening here. This place is a fast food version of a lower class Panera. Wait in line, order from a gigantic menu board and they bring to your table. I ordered the grilled chicken with lettuce, tomato and Swiss cheese with honey mustard sauce on a croissant.  Served with a pickle spear that was a dried out pretender of a pickle and chips. The "chicken breast" was a small 3 inch square and 1/8 inch thick piece of chicken. Mixed in with rectangular pieces of chicken. Poor would be a compliment. And no Swiss cheese. I guess they forgot that. The croissant seemed to be day old the way it fell apart. The wive had half a tuna fish salad sandwich and a cup of tortilla soup. Yea, the tuna was very good. Small as could be but tasty. The soup was not a soup but a thick gravy that was really tangy with very little taste except hot. Her pickled pear was about 3inches long and dry as a bone. A large ice tea (which was good) and a dry raisin oatmeal cookie finished it off. That meal was $19.00. It wasn't worth it. I wasn't impressed at all. This place is ten miles away from being a deli.  Overpriced for what you get..... If you're really hungry.....keep driving past this place.

If it weren't for the yummy pb cookie, I would have no stars to give. As in many previous posts the service was horrible-my to go order sat up on the counter while everyone else got their meals. The lightning and overall atmosphere made me feel like I was forced to study hall or detention after school

I'm amazed by the bad reviews of McAlister's--we've gone at least a dozen times since they opened, during busy times, slow times, weekdays, weekends, and we've never had a bad meal or bad service. I usually get the Southwestern Turkey Melt and my husband gets the McAlister's Club, paired with potato salad and sweet teas (peach for me). Very, very good sandwiches. The potato salad tastes great but, for my personal taste, I'd like it a little creamier, but I'm sure they're either following the corporate recipe or getting it provided to them. Other nitpick is, one time I had a baked potato (baked, not microwaved!) and it was a big overbaked--I enjoy eating the potato skin and this one was "crispified." But the potato itself was delicious. Service is always good, food usually comes in 10-15 min. and a manager is usually cruising the room, visiting the tables and asking how everything is.They will also refill your tea for you! Atmosphere is cozy and casual. Definitely recommend!
Good menu variety - things you wouldn't ordinarily find at a sandwich shop like  a variety of baked potatoes...

For a place that says they aim to exceed your appetite, the meat portions are the smallest I've ever had at a deli.  Roast beef was good.  Baguette was not a baguette in any sense of the word.  The kids grilled cheese sandwiches were really un-notable.  All bread - barely any cheese.  Mac and cheese side saved the day for our kids and was a big hit.  No plans to come back.

I have been there a few times before. When eating inside it a great experience. Ordering anything to go is another story. First off, I simply ordered 2 sandwiches. A Ruben and a roast beef sandwich. After waiting 15 minutes for 2 sandwiches, I drove home to discover they gave me a tuna sandwich instead of a Ruben. Seriously? How hard is your job? My receipt shows correctly what I ordered but yet they gave me something different. If you cant do a simply food order correctly in a reasonable amount of time I would at least expect my check to be comp-ed from the manager. NO. instead when i called and explained it would be a inconvenience to drive back because of how far I live he only offered to comp the 1 item that was messed up. Kinda rude not to refund my entire order since it was their mistake... might not do order to go again...
Was very satisfied with the food and there was excellent service. It did take about 15 minutes to get the food but you could tell the food was made very fresh. I'll definitely be coming here again.

I have been waiting for this place to open for months now, this is a staple fast casual chain in the south where I attended college.  The sandwich and salad menu is extensive.  They do have a unique set of items in "spuds," meal sized baked potatoes with toppings.  The potato salad and sweet tea are excellent.

I drove in from DeKalb today to try out the new location.  The place was very busy, and today being the 4th day the restaurant was open, service was a little slow but very friendly.  It will probably take a few weeks for everyone to get in their groove.  I was ordering take out, so I stood off to the side waiting for my order, and it was very obvious that the employees were double-checking all the orders.  

I had the opportunity to chat with Jay, I believe he is the franchise owner, he was a nice guy.  I will definitely be back.

WOW. First time here this week.  Pecanberry salad excellent as was BLT.  Tried the New Yorker, and Turkey sandwiches.  All were good.  I originally ordered wrong and Carlos the manager was quick to correct my mistake.  Will was offering refills and Jazzy stopped by several times and asked if everything was ok.  Broccolli cheddar was good but could have been hotter.  $21 for 3 meals and the sandwiches are piled high with meat, unlike Panera.  This is replacing Panera in our world. Food was good and excellent employees. It has ample seating inside and you never have to wait for a table.  Wish they had a few tables outside.  This will be out twice a week lunch spot.  I am very picky and this location did everything right.
Prices high compared to others.  Asked if slaw was mayo based and was told it was--it wasn't.  Sandwich just so-so
Went for lunch and had horseradish beef and it was fresh and good. Staff very friendly. I'd go back.
Second time here and another wonderful experience! Staff was attentive and came by our table a few time to check if we needed anything.

Came on a Friday evening...pretty busy but line went quick. Ordered the New Yorker and it showed up not so warm and taste very average.  My daughter ordered a simple Ham/cheese with mayo and it showed up with spicy mustard instead.  Had to send it back.  They made another with mayo and it turned out ok however they still put lettuce on it without asking for that.   The sweet tea was pretty tasty.  My other daughter has a kids grilled cheese which showed up with the cheese only 1/2 way melted.

Don't think I'd go back.  Panera a better option.
Overall it is good to see a new option to other casual dining chains in the area.  The menu is pretty wide so grab a menu while you wait in line to order.  Overall "good" food and reasonable prices.

Every time my coworkers and I go here we always leave very satisfied. The service is quick and efficient. For what you pay you do get a decent amount of food compared to places like panera. Also the wild berry lemonade is incredible.
Won't be back. Food was OK, perhaps under a heart lamp too long. Chili looked like it came out of a can. Expect them to be gone soon.

Made my first visit to this great new deli since Panera left this location. Fabulous food, very attentive service. We ordered our food and were given a number. The food was promptly delivered and a few times through out the meal the staff was asking us if we needed anything. They took our trays when we were done so no work involved. I had a great half sandwich and salad and had to try a side of their potato salad!! Don't miss out on that...excellent!!  My next visit I will try a loaded potato! I will be making this place a frequent lunch/dinner stop!!

This is just another chain sandwich shop. Yes, it is a new place and it was crowded, but a half hour wait for a takeout sandwich? Not acceptable. Maybe the service will improve once they get the kinks worked out, but there were at least 8 people back in the kitchen so there is really no excuse. While waiting I saw about a third of the table orders being returned because they were wrong. Once I did get my sandwich it was nothing special and the bread was stale with a minimal amount of meat. It would have been cheaper and I would have been home sooner if I just went to the Jewel and got a quarter pound of corned beef and a loaf of rye bread.

Not good. I ordered a cold sandwich and it said it had gravy on it, so i asked what that meant. The woman behind the counter told me she never had it but she thought it was au jus. I ordered the sandwich and it came with the worst, salty brown gravy and it was room temp. i also ordered the potato soup. it was so stiff and dried out that i could stand my spoon in it. I like my soups thick, but this was dried out and never re-hidrated. Not to sound too picky but my water tasted like dirt. They offer lemon and i had two, it was still so bad i didnt even drink it. I see no reason to give them a second try.
Not the best.  I went a couple times.  Nothing was excellent.  Wait time for food is way too long.  Needs some work. Probably won't be going back, unless some improvements are made.

Fast, friendly service. Great food. Huge portions. Great prices. Need I say more?
This is by far our favorite breakfast restaurant. They serve breakfast and lunch, but there are so many delicious breakfast options, we haven't gotten through all of them yet! 
The "Eggs & More" options are outstanding. Hash browns are always cooked to perfection, the bacon is thick and perfectly and evenly cooked, eggs are fresh and also always good.
Steak and eggs - OMG amazing!
Chicken and waffles- this was new for us and delicious! 
The kids portions are also very generous. Pigs in a blanket, Mickey Mouse pancakes, all so good!
I would be remiss if I didn't point out the BEST SERVERS AROUND, particularly, GINA.
Talk about attentive service with a smile! She remembers her customers name, their stories from the last time she saw them, and she's just an all around awesome lady. There are several great ones, they all are, but we have grown to know and appreciate Gina so even the kids ask to sit in her section!
Try it out, you will be glad you did!

Wonderful breakfast place! Huge portions for great prices! My favorite is the Chicken Fajita Omelet- comes with three huge pancakes and hashbrowns. I can eat off of that for 3 meals. They also just recently added gluten free pancakes that are the fluffiest gluten free anything I have had to date. 

The only downside to this restaurant is there is always a wait on the weekends. Plan for a 10-15 minute wait before you go. I prefer to call ahead and just eat in peace at home.

We used to go here ALL THE TIME for breakfast, usually on a weekend.  
You can see from looking here that their food is good - on any given weekend morning, the line is literally out the door. 
I agree, the food is good.  Up until out last visit, we were customers for life.  
On our last visit, my entire family had hair in their food.  Multiple hairs.  DISGUSTING.  The waitress seemed annoyed when we showed her and asked for a manager.  When the manager came over, she too seemed annoyed that we didn't want to order something else.  
What a terrible experience.  We plan on never going back again, which is too bad because the breakfast is quite good.  
The manager really made no attempt to fix our situation other than to ask if we wanted something else.  Would YOU want something else after you got hairy pancakes and eggs?  Yeah, neither would I.  Very disappointing.  
Don't plan on ever returning.  Just go to Colonial Cafe next door, it's the same thing.  
What a shame.
I love their french toast so much I can't say more good things. They usually cook my eggs wrong thou, can't seem to figure out over hard :-) Always busy.

VERY RACIST ESTABLISHMENT: Worst and most unbelievable experience my wife and I ever had.  We stopped in and I ordered my food.  My wife was tasting my food, and the waitress told us that it is against there policy to let patrons share food.  Say what!?! - if I pay for my food, who are they to tell me my wife can not taste my food.  Then the waitress was standing there watching like we were children.  I am 47 and make a very good living, I don't need to be treated like that for food I was paying for.  I feel it was because my wife is Asian.  I had them box our food and we left. We will never go back.  I would recommend avoiding this racist place that has ignorant policies about sharing food you pay for.

Husband and I stopped because we both had forgotten to eat one morning recently and we happened to be in the area. Brooke was our server and she was outstanding!! Such a warm heart and so kind. She's meant to be so much more in this world but I was blessed to have crossed paths with her. We had their chicken omelet wrap and my husband had their corned beef hash skillet. We both loved our meals. Service was top notch! Establishment was clean and bright on a rainy afternoon! Really enjoyed our meals and took home leftovers to do it again another day soon! Thanks Brooke for an amazing first visit. We will be back for sure!!
A great breakfast.  We had the typical eggs, sausages, hash brown potatoes and toast.  Every thing was cooked just right.  The hash brown potatoes crispy.  Service was prompt and friendly.

Breakfast on a Saturday at 11:00 AM. 10 minute wait to be seated, 10 minutes wait for food, great service (thanks Christin) food was what we expected (good nothing over the top) pricing fair. The egg was served cold.

The food is very, very good. But the service, 9 times out of 10 is very, very bad. Really rude waitresses with attitude. Their personalities are so bad, that it really makes me avoid this place when possible. I keep coming back for the food, but probably not for much longer. Really a shame..

This review applies to both locations. The management has sit down talks with you, the hostesses are curteous and quick, and the food is without a doubt 5 star. I'm a breakfast aficionado and I reccomend this place as a, "must eat location" while out in the Northwest suburbs. All the waiters and waitressess are amazing  Brandon is a great chef. Brooke was new and still gave the 5 star service I come here for. If you are debating of going anywhere for breakfast then deliberate no longer. Burnt toast is the Northwest suburbs finest. 

P.s. There is a running gag to tip Edgar regardless of if he was involved in your service or not.

Went here this morning for breakfast, and it was the Bomb. Sourdough toast that was brimming with flavor. County fried steak is a must. Gravy, eggs, and hash browns that were perfect.
This place does it right!

This place is awesome if you don't like it there is just something wrong with you.
Get a lot of food and it's so good

I love breakfast food. This place has a unique menu for a breakfast place. 
I usually get the gyro and egg meal with a side of French toast. I take most of it home but it is so good. 

They use amazing bread for the French toast. 

If you go on the weekend be ready to wait there is almost always a long line.

So it's been a little bit since I've eaten here, I ordered their corned beef hash with they over easy eggs and pancakes.. There's something to be said when my meal shows up and my son says those are best looking over easy eggs I've seen.. 
Again they never fail to impress on even the simplest things, the quality, service and the atmosphere here is matched by none.

Everything is fantastic. Specials are gourmet. Try the Florentine benedict. And you gotta have a coffee shake! I would pay like a billion dollars for it..good thing it is still $3.99. Hurry before they figure it out. Service is always with a smile and top notch. Don't go anywhere else.

Came here with the girls for a Sunday breakfast at 8am while in town for a softball tournament. Friendly, fast service. The smoked sausage skillet was delightful, pancakes fluffy and the kids loved the French toast sticks and apple cinnamon streusel pancakes. Highly recommend you check them out in in Algonquin.

We placed a huge order for our store location which is Dicks Sporting Goods. They did an amazing job not just taking the order with organization, but making sure everything was correct as well. Hayley B is the person that assisted us on the phone. Not only was a huge order like that ready in 20 minutes but Hayley made sure to stock us up on everything we could possibly need from hot sauces to butter napkins salt the works. She did a great job and the cooks did amazing as well. All the food was fabulous and we will definitely be doing large orders from you in the future as well! Thank you!

Dicks Sporting Goods Algonquin IL

My first time here and I was very happy with the food. 

I have to say, the name of the restaurant, had always kept me away. I mean burnt toast, really. Anyway a friend advised I go and I have always heard good news about the place.

We showed up on a Sunday mid morning. Packed!  We were only 2, so the wait was reasonable. 

Fast service, good coffee. I love that, since for me breakfast is only food without good coffee.

The food portions were huge! I had seafood egg Benedict. I am a big fan of eggs Benedict. I opted to try something funky.  I was not impressed with the size and or temperature of the seafood. It was cold and so small!  But the sauce was great! 

The hash browns, which my dinner partner had go on and on about were perfect! Get them eith the cheese and onions! The bomb!

Overall great place, I think next time I will stick to traditional eggs Benedict!

This place is great, we go here for breakfast often.
The food is great, service quick and friendly even though there is a crowd.

For me at breakfast, coffee is important.
Very important.... 
Here it's hot, in big easy to hold mugs and great tasting.... 
My opening statement said it...
This place is great!

One of our favorite breakfast spots! They have a wonderful menu selection,  yes - the prices are a little higher, but you get what you pay for! Great portions, never had problems with slow service or waiters (they will keep your drinks filled).
Tried many different plates, never had anything we didn't like. I love their coffee bar and selections.  If you order a special latte or what not, it's definitely worth it!
Be careful what time you come. There can be a line (if your in a rush).

We are a regular and it's nice to spoil yourself once in a while ;)

Huge portions and not your normal breakfast fare. Huge omelets and lots of vegetarian options. Hubby had the breakfast tacos and just thought the chorizo needed a bit more spice, otherwise great. Very friendly staff and it was packed! It happened to be Easter but we were able to get seated at a 2 seater right away!

The one thing that was memorable about this place is that it was Arctic in there. They weren't very busy for a breakfast restaurant at noon which was I guess good but surprising. I'm used to the insanity at Wildberry where you wait outside for 3 years before you get a pancake. The menu was pretty average for a breakfast restaurant. The standard fare of pancakes, eggs, french toast and skillets. I really couldn't get over how cold I was to enjoy my breakfast. They had waffles that had bacon cooked into them that we're pretty good but overly salty. And the chicken that came with the waffles was more a chicken stick than an actual chicken breast. I had the two eggs bacon and pancake combo with upgraded chocolate chip pancakes. My pet peeve is when chocolate-chip pancakes don't actually have chocolate chips baked into them. I think only one pancake actually had chocolate chips and the other just had them sprinkled in between the layers. The whipped cream was good on the pancakes and the pancakes themselves were fluffy I just hate a misrepresented meal. It was pretty budget-friendly as well for the both of us with pop it came to $30 before tip. And the bus boys are on their A-game with cleaning the tables left and right. The waitress was also very nice and I would eat there again if it was closer to home.

Have been going here for years.  You get a ton of food for a good price!  All the servers we've ever had are amazing! Even the owner is great. Whenever he is there he checks with most of the customers on their experience.

Stop looking! This is the BESTbreakfast place in the area and its not even close!

The food is 10/10 (chicken club is my favorite)
The atmosphere is 8/10 (better with the outdoor coming)

The owner is a extremely nice. I will keep coming here weekly!

Amazing food but extremely slow service. Every time i go there i end up waiting a half hour for a fork or sometimes even my water and my check. It's mostly the fork or the check. It just gets annoying.

I've only been here twice but I'd say this is an average brunch location. The service was prompt and the food was as expected but nothing to rave about. Overall a good place to grab breakfast or lunch.
best breakfast super fast secice, this is why there is a line out the door every morning
Gia and her staff are awesome! Great food! Eat breakfast here every weekend. Recommend the Chocolate chip pancakes!

As a single guy, I love that they have a bar. (Not an alcoholic type bar [although they do serve mimosas], a bar around the drink prep area) I almost never hafta wait for seating for 1, even when it was Easter and mother's day, I had a seat within 2 minutes of walking in. Food is great, and you get a LOT of it. 

So popular, you may need to park on the Meijer's side. Sitting at the bar also nets you the entrainment of watching the staff interact, which, if you're by yourself beats the heck out of being bored by yourself.

This place is the real deal, been there a few times, haven't had anything bad yet. Portions are large, you don't need to order extra sides. Prices are very reasonable especially for the portion sizes you receive, many items are under $10 which is rare these days.

Fantastic Breakfast place. A must try.. the servings are HUGE though! Good or bad, you be the judge!! Classic favorite of mine is two scrambled eggs with sausage links and a side of hashbrowns with French Toast. The French Toast is gaint!! But delicious! A MUST try is the hot chocolate though, it's basically a dessert!

Awesome brunch place, they sit you down quick and serve you very fast! Perfect for anyone who is extremely hungry. The food itself is delicious and the portion sizes are large. My husband got the Spanish skillet with a side of blueberry pancakes and a Bloody Mary - he loved all of it. I ordered chilaquiles with avocado on the side and a fresh squeezed strawberry orange juice mimosa - it was all excellent! If you're in the area I highly recommend it - you won't regret it!

I'll tell you, speaking on a "gluten-free" note, these guys really have their stuff going on!
This is my wife and I's favorite breakfast spot!  No matter how busy it is, there is still service with a smile--every time!
We both truly love their gluten-free waffles and pancakes--amazing!
Happy Eating!
--Chef JB

Best breakfast place in Algonquin, as evidenced by the crowds of people who wait for a table. I would give this place 5 stars if they labeled which items on their menu were gluten free. With breakfast, it's fairly easy (order eggs, hash browns are probably safe), but I can't recommend this as a "GF establishment" without dedicated GF items. Though they do offer GF pancakes as a side. Holla! 

Food is hot and quick. Waitstaff has always been great. I recommend Burnt Toast if you are not in a rush!
Great chicken club sandwich. Attentive service and reasonable prices.
Pretty good.  But they certainly could use more waiting area space.

It is a shame because it has the potential to be better.  The service is slow and the food average.  Don't think I'll be back.  The last time I was there I ordered the half egg salad sandwich with soup.  The egg salad was flavorless.  I had to add salt and as I was eating my soup and taking more broth out of the bowl I noticed a chip and big crack in the bowl.
Every time we eat here, it's a pretty great experience. The food is always great and the staff are all good at their job. The stuffed French toast is fantastic!
Always can depend on this place for a great meal and awesome service! Love love love burnt toast! Always worth the weekend morning wait!

Well hello Chicken and Waffles, nice to meet you!  Please tell me about yourself.  Oh you are a rosemary fried chicken breast, and there is bacon in the waffle batter? Oh and you invited some more thick cut bacon to hang out on the plate, well that was nice of you. If you don't mind, I'm going to cover you in maple syrup now and get myself a nice fork full of all of this and make some strange pleasure noises as I clear my plate.

Yes, you will have to wait on the weekends, because this place is packed.  Yes, it is worth the wait, and it's nice to get a real cup of coffee at a breakfast place, not some brown water.

Been here many times and will be back many times.

Can't afford to visit here too often as its pricy and I usually go for breakfast but it does have great food and very friendly service!  You have to try the hot chocolate, holy delicious calories!  Haha!

Went for breakfast today and had the combo 4.  2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon, and 2 pancakes.  Food was amazing.  Bacon is thick and cooked just right.  I also had the strawberry orange which was very good.  This is the first time I ever had strawberry OJ.  Inside was nice and it was busy but the food came out fast.  Server was a 10,
Very good! I've only ever had their breakfast, but never disappointed. Their biscuits and gravy are the best I've had. They also serve some really yummy chocolate milk.

Burnt toast is pretty good and very consistent. We enjoy their breakfasts and lunches almost every time we go. The salad I had for lunch today was very fresh. 
It can get pricey if you aren't careful. 
Food and service 4/5.
you guys ever think about reopening at night as a night club but changing the name to "Turnt Boast". That would be lit.

Definitely worth the wait. Love the stuffed pumpkin cupcakes. Always fast service and the staff really cater to my four year old. Large portion sizing! I always end up with breakfast for the next day, I'm okay with that! Descent pricing for the amount and quality of food. I return often, and have never had a bad experience.

This is, hands down, the best breakfast place in Algonquin/Lake in the Hills. Family owned, Burnt Toast has a great selection of classics, plus some unique offerings as well.

My standard order is the Gyros Omelette, which comes with tomato, onion, and feta. The combination of the savory gyro, tied with the creamy sharp feta, makes it such a tasty breakfast dish. Plus the portion is huge!

Service is always top notch. Servers know their menu and are open with recommendations.

This location can be difficult for large parties, so I recommend going to their Elgin location down the road.

I will definitely be back soon!

I've been to this location once so far. I like the idea of having breakfast later than the usual breakfast hours. My bro, his friend and I went one day. I forgot what I ordered. I think I ordered a skillet. Anyway, staff was nice. Our waitress was sweet. Food was served rather quickly. Food was delicious!!!!!!  Actually, the first time I went here was when I thought the family and I were gonna meet here for Mother's Day, but it was at another location since one of my brothers had bad communication. Either way, both locations were so packed for the holiday. 
I'd definitely go back.
difficult to see from the main road, we stopped by really hungry...   great food, real stuff, prices ok... love it, bacon and coffee delicious!!!

Great great breakfast and brunch restaurant. First of all this was my first time here and I had just ran the muddy buddy so I was hungry for some good breakfast so I went on yelp and found this place. 

Once I came in, I saw a familiar face and that was a friend of mine that used to go to college with so that was really nice seeing her again. Despite that the restaurant was packed they sat us right away the first thing I noticed was the coffee cups they weren't those little cups you usually see in the breakfast places. These cups were huge and they kept it full. We were ready to order and about 15 minutes later our food arrived. Outstanding service.

Now to the good part (the food). I order the baby spinach and gruyere omelet with hash browns and wheat toast. Hash browns.... the best hash browns I've had in my entire life the crispness of it and the flavor it's perfect and not to greasy like other restaurants. Now the omelet, it might look small and not very filling but trust me it fills you up. But the eggs are nicely cooked along with the cheese and spinach . I couldn't be more satisfied with this place. Definitely one of my fave breakfast places. But what is Sure about this place is that they got the best hash browns.
Favorite place to get breakfast. Never had a bad meal here. Country fried steak is great and would recommend it!!
Three words. Strawberry Orange Juice. Their steak and eggs are amazing!  Be sure to request onions and cheese on your hash browns. And the best pancakes IN THE WORLD!!! My son loves them.

You can never go wrong with breakfast food, and this place takes it to the next level. They offer some of the most decadent dessert-like pancakes and waffles around, but also some of the classics just done bigger and better than your average run of the mill cafe. My only qualm with places like this is that they close early afternoon and I could happily eat breakfast for dinner any day of the week!

I went here last week for breakfast (day after Christmas) with friends after one friend suggested it. I looked up reviews, had a good rating on Yelp, so we headed over! The parking lot was jammed packed so we were a bit worried about the wait but with all the people waiting it was only 10 minutes for the three of us.

Service wasn't very friendly or very fast but it was decent enough. We didn't have silverware - had to ask twice to get some, also, but all in all was decent enough.

I ordered the Meat Lovers Omelette which had ham, bacon, sausage. It was very tasty but I had to pay extra to get cheese in it...Seems a bit strange to pay extra for cheese in an omelette, but whatever. It was a bit dry but overall the flavors were good. I was able to change out the pancakes that came with my meal for Ghirardelli Chocolate Chip Pancakes. Oh my goodness, they were absolutely delicious pancakes! They also have chocolate batter pancakes but I think I made the right choice in going with the chocolate chips. They were sooo crazy chocolatey! It also came with grits which were meh. Not the best I've had and not the worst I've had....they tasted a bit rubbery to me though.

I also got a Ghirardelli Hot Chocolate which was topped with a ton of whipped cream, Christmas sprinkles, a candy cane and chocolate syrup. It was huge, so tasty and so rich! Absolutely delicious but this was a chocolate overload for breakfast! 

This was a massive amount of food---way too much! I ended up taking most of it home because the hot chocolate was so filling.

I think the food is very hit or miss here...what's good is amazing and what's miss is just very mediocre. It's definitely a good breakfast spot with tons of options, so will definitely be back to try some other menu items and will definitely get those chocolate chip pancakes again!

I have been here 4 times for breakfast and all my experiences were great.  You might want to turn around when you see the long lines, but the staff manages to get you seated quickly. The wait staff is friendly and the food heavenly.  I am very fond of their thick bacon and also their stuffed french toast.
This place is amazing. My wife and I have been here a few times and it's always great food and great service. Sometimes there is a wait to be seated but it is worth it.

The restaurant itself is adorable, modern and clean. Servers were professional and timely. I didn't care for the scrambled eggs, but the Chocolate Ghirardelli Crepes were delicious (even at home, since they were too plentiful to finish at the restaurant). 
Go early in the morning.

I had the toasted coconut french toast, OMG WHAT WAS I THINKING!!! It tasted like barf! The French Toast wasn't bad once you scraped all the nastiest off. My daughter had the chocolate chip pancakes, way to much chocolate sauce all over it. My son had the blt, can't go to wrong with that. Coffee was very strong and I like strong coffee. Waitress was good and on top of everything.

This is our favorite breakfast spot! Usually have to wait a little bit for a table, but it's worth it. (The Elgin location also has a nice area for outdoor seating.) They serve huge portions at affordable prices. The skillets, omelets, pancakes, and hash browns are delicious...but I'd stay away from the biscuits and gravy. They also serve unique coffee drinks and mimosas, along with a smaller menu that changes with the season. They also have lunch options if you'd prefer lunch over breakfast.

Clean, Friendly staff and good service. Food was in front of me fast and i had nothing bad to say about it. As a matter of fact, there were 5 of us and none of us had any dissatisfaction. This place is awesome! I will go back for more.

I heard this place was "the place" to go to in Algonquin. I was wrong. HUGE wait, which is fine if they have a fast staff that can turn tables. Breakfast is supposed to be quick, not a 2 hour experience. I have no idea why it took 35 minutes in a farm town to get a table. 

Food was below average and staff spilled coffee on my table. Won't be going back. 
Best breakfast place I've been to near the area is Brunch cafe in Roselle.

Had breakfast here with a friend yesterday morning. I had the gruyere cheese and asparagus omelette. The omelette was very heavy on the asparagus (and unfortunately, not the good asparagus tips - 99% stems) and very light on the cheese. I had the little cup of grits and they were totally bland. I had to douse them with hot sauce. Coffee was mediocre. Waitress was friendly when she came and took our order, but after our food was delivered (and it wasn't by our waitress), she never checked on us during our meal! I had to flag someone else down just to get a refill on my coffee.

I ordered Carry-out. I went to pick up the food, they had it on the floor, behind the cashiers desk. This can't be sanitary. Next time I am just going to call the health department. I asked to speak to a manager: Gia she said that there was no where else to put it for limited space. This is not a solution. She made it seem as if it is was my fault for ordering carry-out. Well she is right, I no longer go here. I suggest they come up with a better solution. I asked them if they went to a place and had their food on the floor, would you eat it? There answer was of course "no" They should take their own advice.

There seem to be a million awesome breakfast places in Algonquin and I am jealous.  I came here on a Sunday morning with the boyfriend to enjoy a nice brunch.  It was a little hidden since it is set back, but we found it okay.

I ordered a Strawberry Orange Mimosa which I highly recommend.  It had great flavor.  For my meal, I ordered the Spinach and grueyre  cheese omelet.  I substitute the pumpkin pancakes to go with it which were awesome, but I didn't realize they came with nuts, so I gave the top one to my boyfriend.  We also got a side of corn beef has which we scarfed.

Everything was awesome here and the service is good.  I am sure we will be back once we finish exploring some of the other highly rated Algonquin breakfast joints!

The food here is always good and the
service is always up to par. Coffee flows
freely and you get what you order. The only problem is in the weekend there is a short wait at times but this is a good thing. Grand
Marnier  French toast is my favorite. Yum yum yum yum!!!!

I like the fact that my family and I were seated quickly. The servers were quick too. However, I wasn't too pleased with their food. As a food connoisseur, I wasn't pleased with my order. I ordered the meat lovers skillet. It had more hash browns than meat. The bacon and sausage were scanty and coffee tasted watered down. Servings were smaller than expected.  Prices a bit higher than usual.

They have the friendliest wait staff there. Great food. Always consistent. The best french toast in the business.  Will continue to go back. Love that place. I think they could add on and be twice the size and still pack them in. The owners know how to run a great business.

Worst experience ever!!! $2 up charge if you are sharing your food what a dump policy!!! Rude waitress, she rushed me to order my food & very un-respectful manager.  I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there.

Excellent breakfast/brunch spot with top quality ingredients and service. From traditional fare to more adventurous dishes, everything is fresh and delicious. Don't miss the fresh-squeezed juices on the menu. Can get very busy on the weekends, but still well worth the wait!

This love is awsome .They have good breakfast here the pancakes are good I got the steak skillet. They put slot of steak In it cheese peppers onions .it's so good you can bring the family they are open early in the morning and close at 2:30

First time here... but not last! Chicken & Waffles was the most delicious thing I've had in a long time. The chicken breasts were pounded thin - flavorful, juicy and crispy. The waffles were studded with lean bacon - with even more sliced bacon layered on top :)

I never miss an opportunity to go to this restaurant while I am in Chicago.  I have no idea how good the lunches or dinners are, because I'm always here for breakfast!  Portions are beyond generous,  service is great,  and prices are reasonable.  There are lots of dishes from which to choose,  but I stick to the myriad pancake variations,  Belgian waffles, and most often:  Grand Mariner French Toast!   I prefer to come with my wife,  who's quick to share her leftovers with me.  More to savor!

Family business offering fantastic food, service, and attentive owners. Love this place and the custom roasted coffee. Corn beef hash and eggs with the best hash brown potatoes is excellent. Corn-beef benedict was also excellent. Special was a 1/2 backed chicken on a waffle - looked incredible!  They also offer multi-grain waffles and pancakes for those looking for a healthier choices.

This is pretty much the only good place in 10-15 miles to get breakfast brunch. Every time I come the food is consistently good, and the line is out the door in confirmation. Ghiradelli hot chocolate is awesome. Waffles are awesome. Benedict is awesome. Service and wait times are so so.
Great food, went there for lunch. Felt hustled by the hostess as far as the seating. Great food, nice atmosphere.

We've been here a few times, and we like the food and the place, but the service is not always the best. The woman who showed us to our table looked miserable, didn't answer our greeting or our thanks; she just dumped the menus on the table and walked away. The server was just ok, not too friendly but efficient enough, and brought us the check right after he brought us the food. What really annoyed us though was that we had just finished our brunch but were still drinking coffee; it was 2 o'clock, and the place closes at 2.30, but the server came back, picked up the check and virtually kicked us out saying we were his last table so he would bring the check to the checkout for us to pay right away. I'm not sure if his shift was over, or wanted to be free that last half hour to clean up or whatever tasks he needs to do, but I think it was rude and awful service. We won't be back any time soon; there are far too many good pancake houses around with great, friendly service and the same food quality, so that's it, Burnt Toast.

The food is amazing but I'm wondering if there have been staff changes.have come every week for 5 years and loved the regular team. Now they all seem rushed, not to friendly, not rude, just not what we are use to. 

Being a vegetarian I lived coming here because I could get veggie skillets. Last Sunday when I ordered Spanish skillet no chorizo and lite jalapeo I was told the kitchen doesn't take special requests.. ... Really?

I don't think we'll be going back looks like the search is on for a place that allows my food how I want it. 

Not sure what changes are happening but the friendly atmosphere seems to be fading.

I take my wife and kids here after church on Sundays, great food and kid friendly. 
I had the meat lovers omelette or skillet (both are great) my wife gets the Denver skillet. Always cooked perfectly and good sized portions. 
The manager came by and asked if it was ok to give the kids suckers after dinner. 
(Very nice of her)
The wait staff is always on top of everything, refills are on the table before the glass is empty.

Friendly staff, very busy, but were seated quickly. As others have mentioned, it's fairly loud. I learned how to read lips quickly. 

Tried the Grand Marnier French Toast. Huge serving and just..."eh". Sauce/topping went chillly and runny very quickly Got a side of sausage links, which were cold and oddly chewy. My side of the bill (with a water) was $16. Ouch. Say what you will about Colonial Cafe (located just across the street), but the food is hot and it's not over-priced. 

They get points for the kind waitress and interesting selection of options. Not sure if I'll be back...:/

My wife and I went there on Sunday around 1PM.  The place was packed but there was no line.  So we were seated within 10 minutes.   Staffs were very helpful and friendly.  Although they were super busy, they did take time to answer questions and make short friendly conversations.  Unfortunately, it was a different story with the front receptionist.  She had no energy and forced smiles briefly.  We felt like we were bothering her and made us feel unwelcome.  Not exactly the magic I was looking for but I guess she was tired.  So we pushed on and decided to enjoy our lunch anyway.
           
         The restaurant was clean and modern but somewhat loud.  When we were seated at a booth, we had to really pay attention to each other to understand.  But we weren't there for conversation anyway.  I ordered a Denver Skillet and she had a specialty French Toast that was on separate menu.  My Denver Skillet was pretty decent but her french toast was just way too sweet.  Even wtih side berries and fruits, it was really hard to digest.
