Perhaps that french toast was meant for a kid or a teenager.  Thankfully, coffee helped kill some of that sweetness.  By the way, coffee tasted really good.  Portions were generous and I eneded up taking some pancakes that came as side with my Denver Skillet home.         

         Overall, I enjoyed my meal and the experience, I will come back again and try some other dishes on the menu.
Below average food. Dirty carpet with the dirty carpet funk. I don't think I'll be back.

The staff here is very attentive and friendly.  The portions are a tad huge, but the food is really good.  The reason they don't get 5 stars is because of the noise.  The last 3 times we've been in, we get seated at the tiny booth in the corner by the kitchen with a speaker right over the table.  I was unable to hold a conversation with my husband because the music and kitchen was so loud.  The food is awesome,  the ambiance is definitely lacking.
Been to burnt toast a number of times for both breakfast and lunch. A great place to eat, service is excellent and I highly recommend going.
My wife and have eaten here several times. Service great, food quality excellent and portions are rrasonable. Favorite place for breakfast, put them in the same class as Walker Bros

Great breakfast joint with attentive service.  I got the breakfast burrito which was AMAZING!  My guests ordered various egg dishes and they were all good made with care and served with a smile.  Can't beat that!

Recently visited the newer location in the old Ruby Tuesday building, which appeared to be lightly renovated.  In spite of the lacking service (it was a busy Sunday brunch) the food makes this a solid 4-star review.  

Once our order was taken the food runner was the last person we saw until we were nearly done; no checkup from the waitress to make sure the order was correct or to ask for additional items.  Also had no water refills until we were ready for the check.  The place was emptying out and them the waitress started come back around, so either she was a little spacey or they were understaffed that morning.

Pancakes were as good as were in the old place, and the menu seems to have expanded, with a larger kitchen most likely.  I opted for the seafood omelet which can sometimes be a risky maneuver but it was done really well.  The side of wheat toast was burnt, but we sort of laughed at the irony.

Good to see the quality is still there after taking on a much larger space.

New to the area and tried this place for brunch today. Delicious French toast, very quick and efficient service (waited less time than they told us), and a clean and friendly atmosphere. Will definitely be back to try other menu items!

This place is awesome!

Waitstaff is beyond friendly.

Food comes out quickly, even when packed.

Food tastes great.
Consistently good service and food.
Honestly, all breakfast food tastes the same. Delicious. This place is great to bring your mom or have a quick girls breakfast because it's a little more "dressy". Coffee is good.

Service was fast and friendly....we had to park at the Meijer store next door because the parking lot was packed as was the restaurant. We only had to wait about 3-5 min to get seated. The food is very good and portions are large. One piece of French toast is huge!! We were in and out(table of 4) in under an hour. Will be going back frequently, excited to try so of the different menu choices!

I had an exceptional breakfast here.  The food was great, we were seated very quickly on a packed Saturday morning.  Our waitress was unintentive to us but a manager was quick pick up the slack.  The portions are huge and the price is great.  If you like breakfast half as much as I do it's a must visit.
Great service. We come here a lot and always have a good experience. The team is extremely friendly and attentive. The food is great. I've never had anything that wasn't good. I highly recommend!
Had breakfast here the other day. Meat lovers skillet and my daughter got a Mickey Mouse pancake. Huge portions quick service and great food.

This place is as good as it gets when it comes to breakfast. Fantastic food and great service. At first our server seemed a little testy but she lightened up after a few minutes. Probably due to my being a nice guy. :) The food is of great quality and the amount is huge. The slightly higher cost is well worth it. As I was eating it I was in awe as to how the heck to they make these normal items taste so much better than everywhere else. If you like to eat breakfast out this is definitly the place to do it.

I am very surprised at how much I enjoyed this restaurant. It has been in the area for years, but for some reason this was a first time visit for me. The restaurant itself is quite large, with lots of areas for seating - it was also quite busy on a Friday evening and did require a reservation for a our party of 6. All the food we tried was delicious 

We got the following: 
- Avocado wontons 
- Chopped salad (half-portion) 
- Eggplant parm
- Gnocchi 

Everything was absolutely delicious, and all of us left stuffed and satisfied. The portions are very large - we did more of a "family style" dinner, given the large portion sizes. We had very little food left over. We also ordered dessert - a slice of the salted caramel cake. The cake slice itself was huge, and we weren't able to finish it between the 6 of us, but it was definitely worth it! They also serve black dog gelato here, which is great if I'm ever craving it! I will definitely be back here and have already recommended the place to my friends! A great option for a quality Italian restaurant in the area! :)

A friend and I came for dinner. Little did we realize that, after 8pm, the adjoining bar becomes a rowdy hangout for the 50+ crowd.

Service was flippant and dismal. We were seated, and 15 minutes later our server returned for our drink order and to give us the specials. By that time we had already decided on entrees.

We shared the Italian Beef rolls appetizer.

Verdict: Okay if you're an Italian Beef fan (obv.). I thought they were alright.

I had the Skirt Steak entree.

Verdict: Pretty darn good, actually, and cooked medium rare as I requested.

Service was SLOW, though, throughout the entire night.  We had to ASK for more drinks, which any good server would be sure to hone in on without prompting (alcohol = $).

Overall, it was an okay experience. If I returned, I'd be sure it wasn't on a Friday or Saturday night - those Cougars are cray!

What the heck, Zeal?!

My family and I have been coming to Zeal for many years now, and out of all of our visits, this was by far the WORST. 

We had made reservations ahead of time, and yet, we were stuck in the auxiliary dining room despite the fact that there were plenty of tables in the main dining room. I suppose our reservation just wasn't good enough, now was it?

After about 20 minutes with no service what so ever, we asked to be seated outside. This request was met, but only for us to be ignored all together once seated.

It will be a very LONG time before we return, and I hope that something changes in the meantime.

I just got home from this place and I'm trying hard to not drop it to 1 star. There were a couple saving graces which made this a slightly more enjoyable dining experience than chili's. Actually, now that I think about it, the pick 2 for $20 menu at chili's is a lot better. 

We came here for an anniversary dinner and we thought it would nice. Zeal. Sounds as fancy as Jack's Bistro. And it was fancy. Light up menus. Sweet decor. Damn good free bread. But that's about where it ends. Hell, before it even began, the booth they say us at was dirty. We had to clean the seats ourselves. The hostess had on tiny booty shorts. I mean if I wasn't on a wedding anniversary dinner.... Errrrr.... Pardon me as I get slapped. ---- anyways, the waitress was about as helpful as a nun at a whore whorehouse. She forgot the bread that went with the oil. My wine glass was empty for about 10 minutes before it was filled up, and she didn't really eat meat so couldn't offer suggestions. And she was slow. On the contrary, the waitress the table behind us was amazing. Explained the entire menu to her guests so thoroughly that I ended up listening to her suggestions. 

The food...

Burnt pasta. It was ok. Needed salt. The caramelized crust was reminiscent of Burts pizza. :( But it lacked salt. Maybe I have an issue. I need more salt on everything. So I thought....

Lobstersicle. Waitress probably should have told me it was skewered before I bit it off in my mouth. It's was ok. A bit too fried. A bit too $17. No worth it. 

The tortaralle 4 cheese pasta. Again, nothing I can't make at home. Boring. 

Lamb shank. For the first time in a long time, food was too salty. Couldn't eat it. It was supposed to be sauted in garlic. Maybe they used Garlic salt. Minus the garlic....The potatoes that came with it tasted like dried flake potatoes. But there were chunks in it so idk. 

Dessert: yea we were hoping for some kinda complimentary anniversary dessert. None came and we weren't impressed with food as it was so we head over to baskin Robbins for $1.31 scoops. Bullshit because multiple Yelp reviews said they give complementary dessert for occasions and the table behind us with the awesome waitress got some for a birthday. 

All in all zeal takes like zima. Tastes like zhit. Our $115 tab (pre tip) tasted more like it would be overpriced for $50. 

Stay away. Unless you want bread and oil. Then go.

I had dinner at Zeal last weekend with a group for a bachelorette party.  We were treated wonderfully not only by our server, who did a fantastic job of handling a large table alone, but also by Chef Vince.

Our table was ready on time for the reservation that had been made, and we never had to wait for anything.  Water was immediately filled, drink orders taken, bread given...

There are two portion sizes here: generous (sharing plates/lighter bites) and enormous (entrees - see photo.)  There had to be over a pound of pasta in the dish.  The huge portions weren't just for the pasta though... I had a ribeye steak that was much larger than the price tag.  Almost everyone at the table had a doggie-bag.

Chef Vince visited our table as our dinner was coming out, and then again at the end of the meal to ensure everyone enjoyed.  He even treated the bride-to-be to a complimentary dessert cocktail, which everyone at the table got to enjoy a sip of.

I'm not really out in Schaumburg too often anymore, but I'm keeping Zeal on my list!

A group of us ate here last evening. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the service. The food was good, but there was nothing special about it. Everyone ordered a different meal and we also ordered 5 appetizers for the table. Some of the food was very inventive but most was just average. Dropped a lot of money to just have an average meal.

I'm basing this review on a Lunch visit; dinner may be very different.  This pleasant restaurant has an amazingly large (but not illuminated) Lunch menu with a wide range of items, some very reasonably priced.  Our group of 3 had the Asiago & Mozzarella Encrusted Prime Rib Panini, the Beef Brisket Sandwich (Both reasonable at $12), and a "Make your own Pasta" item.  My Panini was impressive, but awkward to eat (lots of hardened cheese "overflow"), and quite bland.  The others reported theirs were fine.  The one big warning: Ordering the U-Call it Pasta somehow resulted in a $17 charge for a plain spaghetti marinara with ONE meat ball!  Perhaps we were overcharged, but it was printed on the bill as if normal.  All in all, pleasant but not outstanding food with a very good server, Karen taking care of us for the hours we were there.

Fantastic. We had dinner here last night. The food and service was great. Unfortunately I can't remember our waiters name but he was great!

We ordered the Italian Beef Rolls as an appetizer which are egg rolls with beef and mozzarella cheese on them. You get 4 huge ones. These were amazing!

The entrees at the table were the Grouper, served over angel hair pasta. Seasoned with herbs and lemon. The fish is very light and melts in your mouth. It was great.
The Veal Special served with roasted veggies and rositto. The veal was a bit chewy but very good as well.  There was another special which was a pasta dish served with seafood: mussels, clams, lobster, shrimp, and calarmi. This was again very tasting. The lobster was delicious.

I ordered the Ocean Blue cocktail. Very taste!! 

We of course had to try some dessert as well. We tried a classic cannoli and the italian lemon cake (recommended by the waiter) with some cappuccinos. Both again delicious. Must Try the Lemon Cake.

Awesome food and super friendly staff. I just had appetizers tonight but had bread with oil and vinegar..,. Outstanding many restaurants skimp on the oil. They have a great mix with spices and cheese. Follows that with "pork winks" which are ribs. Great. Will stop next tumor to try a full entree.

Went here for a double date and had appetizers, dinner and dessert. Let me first start by saying this is a great place for either a semi low key dinner to a more upscale. Both work here. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Their cocktails are unique and very tasty, about $8 a drink. 

The appetizers are also pretty unique. I had the lobstericle which is like lobster on a stick deep fried. This was ridiculously yummy. You only get one but it's huge, also $17. It comes with two sauces and one has a decent spice. I also tried the calamari "fries" which are huge pieces of calamari fried. My friends had the burnt pasta. That was tasty but not as "burnt" or crispy as we were expecting.

For dinner I had the sea bass which was phenomenal. Well prepared. Others had steak and sliders. Everyone loved their meals.

For dessert you must try their ice cream which has caramel popcorn rolled into it, and chocolate.

All this amazing food does come at a price. For four of us, appetizers + dinner + dessert and a couple drinks was about $300 with the tip.

So its been quite awhile since I have been  here,,, seems like it was going to be nice out, so wanted to try and get some dinner with some pals on the patio. Too cold... so we ate inside. 

The server gave me flack for asking for separate checks, hmm... not smart if you want a good tip. My pals are drinkers... I am not, just asked for lemon, for my water. So she brought me one little lemon sliver for my water, had to ask for more... again, you know... service... tips.

Food... I ordered an old favorite... grilled calamari steaks.  The pic I have loaded from last year, was what I loved. WAS amazing... what I got tonight, was with overcooked limp and soggy artichokes(?).. no peppers to be seen. So utterly tasteless... salt and pepper didn't do any good. Balsamic didn't do much either.

The half order of a kale salad was equally awful... the only good item at dinner was the bread.

Figured the gelato was going to be decent... it was not. Got pistachio and salted caramel. Bland and blander...  was my memory wrong? Did I imagine that the last time.. this dessert had lines of swirled caramel, whipped cream and a layer of caramel corn at the bottom? I think I found one piece.

Wow... the level of food in this place has dropped... for $30-50pp meals... really? I think the prices have gone up while the quality has gone down... I dunno Vince. Where did the magic go?

Over priced over rated I kinda of felt disappointed I did not feel like there was an explosion in my taste buds 
 
but that's just my opinion it was not the worst restaurant in the world I Ate Way, Wars food trust me I had my share of bad food especially traveling to all of Asia  so sorry zeal my taste buds didn't love you
Really bad service and the food was not great like the price! I'll never go back there. Paid 115 dollars for two without wine and dessert pretty expensive

Weird place. Kind of musty feeling to the restaurant.  Menu literally lights up when opened. The lobster on a stick appetizer was good but hard to get off the stick. My Osso bucks was good. The ribeye was grizzly and the prime rib lasagna was a strange dish. Wouldn't go back

I feel like I need to try this restaurant one more time in order to give it a proper review. 
My friend and and I had 7 pm reservations in a Saturday night. We arrived pretty much on time and we were seated right away. 
The restaurant is decorated very nicely and it's lit just perfectly, a little dim. 
We were seated and were given a drink menu. I went with a martini called the Razzle Dazzle. My friend got a margarita. 
My drink was just ok, nothing to exciting. 
We sat for a long time talking and catching up before even opening the menu. Our server was nice and gave us time to talk and never tried to rush us at all. 
After forgetting that we hadn't ordered yet, we opened the menus to see what we would order. The menus light us, pretty cool, lol. 
I went with the marinated skirt steak with a side of roasted potatoes and Brussel sprouts. 
My steak was absolutely perfectly seasoned and cooked medium rare just the way I like it. It was a decent size of steak and it was tender I probably could have cut it with just my fork. My sides were just ok, roasted potatoes are roasted potatoes, they tasted like the ones I make in my oven and the Brussel sprouts were a bit dry and flavorless for my taste.
The menu has a lot to offer and they had daily specials posted in a chalkboard on a wall. 
The service was ok, we were left alone for a while. 
There was a live band playing in the bar area which was very crowded and it sounded like everyone in there was having a good time. 
This is on my list of places to try again. There were many dishes that sounded delish.

Quality Inn desk staff recommended Zeal, so we walked on over to give it a try. Thursday night at 7:30pm was not too busy. Bar was hopping and the live entertainment was a bonus, although we dined in the restaurant proper. We tried the beef brisket and the scallops, both of which were excellent. Salad was finely-chopped and tasty. Would definitely recommend and would return.

Zeal is very very good but not amazing.  My partner had the filet medallions and I had chicken with Angel hair pasta.  We each tried each other's meal and agreed that one of the medallions was very tasty while the other two were ok.  The chicken was nothing to write home about.  The service is outstanding, the restaurant is beautiful and the menus set the stage for an unforgettable experience....that just never came.  I knew I wanted to try their desserts so we got their sea salt caramel gelato with popcorn.  This was outstanding which surprised me because unlike thier gorgeous entree menu the dessert menu was a crooked photocopy.

This place was SO good. Big portions (even the half plates was two meals for me!), great atmosphere, and fairly decent prices. The food was delicious and goes beyond anything an Olive Garden or Maggianos could give you. Definitely will come here again just to try the rest of their menu!

Had pretty high expectations based on the reviews and the upscale look, and it was alright. 

Food- We started off with 3 appetizers.  Asian pork wings, guacamole wontons, and the "burnt pasta."  The wings were just decent but they were definitely more like short ribs than wings.  The wontons I thought were awful because they for some reason were so sour!  The burnt pasta was good but it was basically just baked spaghetti, nothing too special.  The highlight honestly was the fresh baked bread and premixed balsamic, Parmesan, crushed red, and olive oil.  For dinner I had the filet trio, with horseradish steak butter crust.  It was pretty good, the steak was cooked well but wasn't very moist.  The mashed potatoes were smooth, but lacked flavor, could've used some garlic and left the skins in.  The asparagus was burnt on purpose but I didn't like that.  Everyone else seemed ok, but not thrilled with their dish.

Service- Good, water and bread refills often 

Id recommend it for a nice night out, but some awkward flavor profiles keep this restaurant from living up to its potential.

We visited Chef Vince's restaurant 3x in 2015. We started with our first visit on Valentine's Day, we loved it so much I came back for my 32nd birthday with a party of 20 people, and now on our last day of 2015, we are back to close up the year. All of the food has never disappoint with it generous portions, delicious and balanced flavors being just right and the attentiveness from the Chef himself coming out to greet his patrons makes this place our favorite go-to. We will be back many more times! 

Check out my tips for dishes to order! 

There are very few places that would get all 5 stars review from me but time and time again, this place has proven to be a favorite in quality, taste, portion, price, service and ambiance.

Came here this past Sunday night with a few friends. My friend ordered a pasta dish vegetarian and realized that there was a meatball in the dish. He got charged for the dish even though the mistaken was of the restaurant and when we pointed it out, the server was willing to comp the dish but then had to pay for dessert which was INITIALLY comped (due to friend's birthday).

I do not think I will be coming here again and for any vegetarians out there, I would definitely stay away.

Went here on Friday night with my husband. I thought it's a  nice place. However, our order took a little longer. When we finally got our food, The skirt steak my husband ordered was overcooked when he requested for medium. Then one side was missing on my plate. It took a little while before my husband got his new steak. When he finally got it for the second time around, he's missing one side. Just funny that they never got our order correctly.
Anyway, they gave us dessert. It was nice of them.

Amazing food! I love how Zeal is very creative with their menu items. They really take a big step out of the box and it does not disappoint. They've managed to hit it out of the park with great tasting fresh ingredients and a well thought out combination of flavors. Things that shouldn't be expected to work are actually very well balanced and delicious on their own. Their pizza is great and their burger was the juiciest I've ever had. Kudos Chef!
Amazing Italian food not far from the Woodfield mall in Schaumburg burnt pasta is amazing and so is the lobster cicle

It was ok. Best part of my meal were the sweet potato tots. Tried the cheesesteak egg rolls, they were pretty good, and the sliders were ok.  My fianc said the lambchops were amazing!  I don't know that I'd come back, but the service was great!

The service, portions, prices, and innovative menu make this place a great dining experience.

Went here with a friend visiting from out of town. Had a great experience. Almost all the food was very tasty, with the exception of the kale salad which was way too sweet. Otherwise Service was excellent!

Would highly recommend.

I went in here two Thursdays ago for the first time ever. It is a very nice place I will give it that.

I ordered two drinks that came out to $13.44, I tipped $4.00 for a total of $17.44. When I was checking my bank account this past week  and they charged my account $18.00. It wasn't a big deal, it's only 56 cents so I wasn't even irritated. 

I used to be a waitress so I know it's super illegal and not allowed to charge anything but the amount written on the credit card slip. So I called them Thursday to let them know that it happened and that if it happened to the wrong person it could really mess up their business. 

When I called and asked to speak to the manager I was put on hold for a few minutes and when the person came back to the phone they told me that they couldn't find a manager and asked why I was calling. I told them everything that happened and they took my name and number and said a manager would call me back.

It is now Saturday and I have not heard back from anyone. I am wondering if they just threw away my message and didn't even hand it to a manager. 

This is what irritated me and made me decide to come to Yelp. I wasn't even mad about the 56 cent extra charge nor did I want to do anything about it but let them know it happened. I wonder how many other people they have falsely charged. It is not right and I should have received a call back. I was already generous with my 4.00 tip which one was a beer, so they only had to make one drink and hand me a bottle of beer. 

I seriously wish I never came to this place and will not be returning, very unprofessional.

This is a very solid date night place.  The hubs and I hadn't been out alone for a while, and I had this bookmarked for a few months. They had great gf options, so we gave it a go. 

Out waiter, Todd was fabulous.  He was very attentitive, but not overly so.  

We began with a mojito for my mr and the house martini for myself.  It was amazing. I now need to make fig infused vodka at home. 

We opted for no appetizers, but I did get the gf bread for an extra 2.5.  I may have been judged, but it said seconds were included so I asked for my second serving. Carbs. Biotches. 

For entrees, my husband got the pasta special Diablo something and I got the gluten free chicken parm. Both entrees were very good.  I only had a bite or few of mine though as I loaded up on a loaf of bread first. 


We ended our meal with gluten free chocolate cake...because chocolate and two cappuccinos. We ended up bringing the cake home but drank our cappuccinos.  

My minus one star is for the price and ambiance. Our bill with tip was 120.00.  Ouch. The ambiance was odd too. Kind of a mix between a family restaurant and a date night place.

This place is solid. Their craft cocktails such as the Cremenza are delicious and will set you back $8--which is pretty standard for Schaumburg. The Cremenza is a sweet martini with fig infused vodka. The sweetness is subtle compared to a Cosmo. The seafood bisque was creamy, spicy and was perfect for a rainy fall night. There were yummy chunks of lobster and shrimp in it. The veal chop was just a tad dry but had a great caramelization on the outside. The bread is cutely served on a cutting board with a knife that fits into it. The bread is served with a pretty dip of oil, balsamic, freshly cut basil, Parmesan and red pepper. SO GOOD! 

The ambiance is similar in fanciness to a Cheesecake Factory. There's live music at 8pm weekends and the bar area has large TVs for watching the game. I'd definitely come back

Zeal is an interesting place in Schaumburg to grab a bite to eat. We came in right after work and sat in the front/bar area. Service was kind of slow and the waitress was pretty quirky - but that's fine. 

What I had at the restaurant wasn't bad (chicken parm - make sure to order with the housemade Suprema sauce as it absolutely has a leg up on standard marinara), and the portions are heaping - the menu does come across as unwieldy and somewhat unfocused. It is an "Italian-themed" place, but they must offer over 40 items. They offer steaks/chops and seafood, tapas/small plates style items, entrees, sliders, make your own pasta dishes, large salads etc. It's good to have a lot of options, but this might be too much - you don't want to spread yourself to the point of being considered an upscale Cheesecake Factory.

I wouldn't go out of my way to get out to Schaumburg for Zeal - but if you are in the mood for big portions and pretty solid food this is not a bad spot.

I was here couple weekends ago for a friends bday dinner. I ordered a vegetarian pasta dish and I realized that there was meatballs in the dish. When I got my bill, I got charged for the dish even though the mistaken was of the restaurant and when I pointed it out, the server was willing to comp the dish but then had to pay for dessert which was INITIALLY comped, since it was my friends birthday

I do not recommend coming here again especially for any vegetarians

One of my now favorite restaurants... 
Easily found location in Mall drive near Woodfield Mall.. We had a reservation at 615pm.. Came in at 610pm and was immediately seated.. It was not full yet that time so the hostess was kind enough to give us a booth when we requested it.. 
Menu, both the main and dessert/drink was illuminated.. Very unique..
Ambience was loud dimly lit but i loved it... 
Food::: We ordered the Calamari Fries as appetizers.. Well seasoned and i love the breading... And the Gnocchi supereme.. As it was described, light.. And so creamy... I love it... A dish that i will be ordering repeatedly..
The complimentary freshly baked bread and the olive oil dipping with Balsamic vinegar was sooo good... 
Entrees:: Zuppa de Peche was also good, lobster was on a tad overcooked side.. But flavors was great... The sauce did not overpower the seafood.. Briciole.. I love the tanginess and thickness of the sauce.. 
Clean washrooms and since you have a garlicky breath after a meal, they have a complimentary mouthwash.. Which is a first for me.. You know that the restaurant was well thought of...
They have musical guests that starts every 8pm.. Unfortunately we were leaving when they started..
I was going to give it a 5 stars, but it was our server who disappointed me... He forgot things and would check on us for after a little bit of a wait... Good thing other servers checked up on us and was kind enough to give us extra bread with our to go bag... All in all, a GREAT EXPERIENCE...  And would come back again... And highly recommended..

We rate Chef Vince Zeal's restaurant 5 stars.  The food is divine and plentiful.  You receive more food than you pay for and could possibly eat at one sitting.  We always have food left over for the next evening.   Chef Vince came to our table and greeted us, which made us feel welcomed. We have followed him throughout the years and do enjoy this restaurant immensely.
He is a magnificent Chef.

I don't even know where to begin. I wish I was able to give zero stars. We came here a birthday party. I get it. We are a huge party. Things won't be as smooth as it would be if the waitress waited on a group of 4 instead. However, that doesn't mean we get to be forgotten or treated any worse. 

1. I got seated and she does her round for drinks. I asked for a Shirley temple and she gives me a bizarre look like I was from another planet. It's not that uncommon. 

2. We have been seated for 25 minutes now and bread was still in the process of being handed out. That's fine, too. I understand since we were a larger party, things would take some time to fully satisfy everyone. 

3.  I asked for a refill and waited ages before I was able to get one. This is probably my biggest pet peeve. I shouldn't have to ask for a refill and she should notice this without me even bringing it up to her attention. 

4. We finished our round of bread, and I had asked if we could get another set since its been an hour and we haven't gotten our food yet. She refills everyone's bread plate except mine. Again, I thought she was going to get more bread for me since she ran out right when she was at my end of the table. Oh silly me... I should never assume. 

5. Finally! The food! For the price we paid, we did receive a huge portion. I can't complain about that. It wasn't the best thing I've had but at least I paid for what I was given. However, the waitress spills the birthday girls wine on her to go box and cake. What does she do? She brings another glass for her. Sounds responsible and appropriate, right? Well, she never cleaned up the table and just left that glass of wine there as well. So not only did her personal items ended up getting wet from the dripping table but now her cake wasn't even replaced either since its drenched full of wine. 

6.  I finally got tired of it. It's fine to disappoint me but when you make the birthday girl upset, you're ruining something that she chose to celebrate her day at your restaurant. I go over to the hostess and ask for the manager on duty. She says to me "mistakes happen, right?" Yes, I do agree mistakes happen, but you also have to please your guests when you made a mistake. Ruining her belongings wasn't a part of her plan. Not being able to have the rest of her cake (not comped for the spill or the ruined cake FYI). I thought that was ridiculous. 

7. My final upsetting experience. I had asked for the chef to call me since I am obviously upset by my experience and I have yet to receive a call. No wonder this restaurant has terrible service. I don't want a refund or a gift card or anything. I just want this experience to never happen to anyone else.

I went to zeal on the recommendation of s friend, I do not think I would go back not bad but just not good. Service was atrocious our waitress and then chef for that matter spent 20 minutes talking to the table next to us (the first time) before we even got water. My wife had the veggie arriabata 16 bucks for veggie pasta and 5 extra for vegetables it came out with no taste I mean arriabata should have some taste.

I had the prime rib enjoyed it but overall the mixture of the service and food wasn't what we expected.

Nice place, good design and pleasant atmosphere.  Our server, Courtney, was excellent!  Perfect combo of friendly and attentive with a bit of fun. :)

Not as many choices for wines as I would have liked but the Chianti I had was quite good.

3 out of the 4 of us really enjoyed our meals: chicken parm, lobster roll sliders & the porcini pasta bags arrabiata.  2 surprises with my porcini arrabiatta - it was in the 1/2 plates section & holy cow - it is easily 4 servings! I took most of it home and it will make at least 2 dinners for the Hubs & I.  Second surprise was the $22 price tag on the dish so at least for that price you get plenty of food.  The lobster roll said it came with either tater tots or shoestring fries & the Hubs opted for shoestring fries - though they were anything but, just the size of regular fries and not the thin ones you would expect with "shoestring" in the description.

My father-in-law said his bracciole was just "okay" and that it had way too much bread crumbs.  But that didn't stop him from cleaning his plate, either.

We also shared the calamari fries which were tender & plentiful for $8.95.  And they give you warm bread with a plate of olive oil, parm, herbs & balsamic for dipping which was quite tasty.

Side note - the prices on their website are not current as of this writing.  Several dishes are a few dollars more now than what is listed online (my pasta was $4 more than the web lists it as) so they need to update their website.  They also have a few more dishes than what is shown online.

The food was pretty good.  We got a bunch of seafood items.  The server was good and checked up on us.  Pretty casual atmosphere, and a lively place for sure.  

We ordered the seafood tower, along with the grilled calamari, the stuffed sausage and peppers, and antipasto.  Food was pretty good.  The seafood was cold and we polished it off.

When we got the bill we were a bit surprised because the seafood tower was charged at $150.  As of 6/22/2015, the price on the website is $105.  The price on Yelp menu is $105.  The price on opentable is $105.  I understand that menu prices can change but this is a bit much.

Surely there was a mistake in our bill.  We called over the server and he said he had no idea and passed us up to the manager.  Evidently Chef Vince was not there that day, so we talked to the manager.  She was pretty firm and tried to blame us for not calling the restaurant.  She mentioned something about market prices and how we were given a good portion of food.  She said the menu on the website hadn't been updated in 2 years and should not be relied upon.  Ok, but we preordered off the website/opentable.  But sure, it's on us to make sure that the price listed is incorrect, right?

If it's market price, it should probably just be noted as market price.  Regardless, the manager was not very helpful and tried to tell us how it was worth every dollar since she had seen the kitchen putting it together.  Hmm ok, I hope every item on the menu is worth every dollar lol.  We asked for her to meet us in the middle, on a matter of a principle.  She refused.

Regardless, the overall experience was pretty good, but the incident at the end of the visit left us a little salty.  It's not the kind of service we expected from this establishment, but it is what it is.  I hope they end up changing their online menus to reflect current prices (this isn't 1999, it should be a fairly simple fix).  And guys, always call the restaurant and check prices (cause it's our job to do that).

Chef Vince has done it again! Zeal is the perfect venue for a night out or a romantic meal with your lovebug. 

I went with a few friends for a birthday celebration and the staff was incredibly warm and welcoming. I brought a cake for the party and Chef Vince himself offered to take it back to the fridge for me! A+ service! 

I sat at a booth with my friends and we ordered drinks. Mojitos all around! These came out quickly and were very refreshing! We waited for another member of our party to join us and we ordered our food. I ordered the chopped shrimp cocktail and the lobster sliders. The rest of my table ordered sausage bread, and the stuffed peppers. Everything came out quickly and at the proper temperature. 

Let's start out with the chopped shrimp cocktail. First off, WOW! This is a huge appetizer! I shared with the table and still had enough to come home. It comes with pretzel bread crostini and I didn't even bother dipping it in the cocktail, I just ate it with a fork. The cocktail consists of shrimp, avocado, cilantro, and a tangy cocktail sauce that is not your normal cocktail sauce. It tasted very fresh, like it was made in house. The whole appetizer was fresh tasting and not at all soggy. I could have just eaten that. It was amazing. 

My lobster rolls were phenomenal. No faux lobster here! All fresh and delicious. The salad was served on toasted buns and seasoned perfectly with salt and pepper and there was a hint of red pepper in there as well. I opted for the tater tots instead of the french fries, and those were crisp and had great seasoning. Again, a large portion, so I was able to bring a whole lobster sandwich home with me. 

Overall, an excellent dining experience. All of my dining partners said their food was excellent (no one shared hahahaha!) and there were no problems. Our server was very personable and really funny, cracking jokes with us all night. The food was insanely good, I am sitting here wishing I had a lobster roll right at this moment. I will definitely be back for more of Chef Vince's unique and innovative eats!
Very good food & atmosphere. The server was pleasant & attentive. Loved the light up menu! Can't wait to go back.

1st time customer who came here for lunch during the week based on the positive reviews.  My wife and I sat in a booth in the bar area.  Our waiter was also the bartender so service was a bit slow (they could use additional help), but he was very personable and didn't forget about us.  Lunch specials are very reasonable and food was plentiful and tasty.  We'll be back.

I Really enjoyed my experience at this restaurant, as it was our first time about 3 weeks ago. We ordered the pork wings (great taste, great sauce) and lobster on a skewer as a starter (soooo delicious, words cannot explain)

Our server, Lauren was really nice and accommodating. 

For entrees we ordered the chilean sea bass, which was very tasty and healthy (Big thing for me when restaurants have very healthy alternatives to the basic pasta and such) my boyfriend ordered the special of the night, which was a pasta with red sauce and seafood blend of Lobster tails, jumbo shrimp, mussels, with large portions WOW very impressed, glad they didn't skimp out on the seafood. 

For dessert, we ordered chef Vince's caramel gelato served with popcorn, fantastic pairing and flavor, what a great idea! Also its really nice to meet the owner/chef when you're dining in, it shows he cares for the restaurant, as not many owners and chefs go out of their way to do so.

We only went for lunch - it's the best rated place in the area that had Lobster Rolls

Lobster rolls ended up being lobster sliders.  I'm partial to the traditional format of split texas toast bun.  The buns they did use should have had more butter.

The lobster itself was good quality - a few larger chunks but mostly shredded.  They didn't go overboard with mayo, which I also appreciated.

The place was also pretty empty and a little dark inside.  Not necessarily a bad thing, but made me wonder.

All-in-all, I'd go back if I really wanted lobster roll and didn't have time to drive further.

Chef Vince continues to out do himself! I took 2 clients here for lunch and always, the food was amazing. We had the Italian Beef egg rolls, gnocchi, chicken suprema, then salted caramel gelato. His combination of flavors is amazing! Friendly, comfortable, exceptional!

Great owner, great staff. Prime rib lasagna, meatball salad, burnt pasta, yummy desserts, everything I've tried has been delicious. Chef Vince takes the time to come out and chat with customers at the tables  which to me shows he really cares. Great music in the bar.  Great atmosphere. A little bit of an older crowd then me (I'm 45), but better then going to a place with a bunch of twenty year olds being obnoxious.  Recommend Zeal to anyone who wants a great dining experience, thanks  Vince.

I can't really wrap my brain around this place. First and foremost, the food is good. I mean very good. It's everything else besides the food that makes me say, "Huh?"

Hubs and I made a reservation for Valentine's Day dinner. I know I know...a dinner out on Valetine's Day can be a total mess, but hear me out. The valet (seriously, I was annoyed that there were no parking spots for us, only valet) parked our car roughly 15 feet where we pulled up and we headed inside to a very packed restaurant. The bar itself, off to the right, was quite busy with all the lovebirds swallowing their liquid courage or spicing up their date nights. We hung up our coats in the closet off to the left and were seated on time.

When we got to our booth I was a bit taken aback by the giant, glowing flatscreens situated around the room. When the chalkboard specials up on the wall reflect entrees in the $25-$40 price point, TVs don't seem to be a great fit for the dining room. It was distracting to say the least. Speaking of distracting, the light up menus were beyond strange. If it's took dark to read a menu, then maybe better lighting is necessary. Just saying. 

All that being said, the food was fabulous. I ordered the sea bass special that was pretty perfect. It was meaty but flaky and the sauce was divine. Flavor and portions were all in check.  Our server was friendly but incredibly harried due to the influx of holiday diners. 

So, yes, I would certainly go back to Zeal for the food. The ambiance and the occasionally harried service could use a bit of a revamp.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. The people are too (thanks Kim) ... And of course chef Vince! 

I chose to cater Zeal for our company Christmas party. I've never heard my co workers race about how delicious the food is (and we cater in A LOT). TOP NOTCH. 

Favorite - linguini / sausage ravioli / chopped salad / meatballs (huge)

Everyone was so easy to work with and happy to help. Delicious meal and great experience.

We're all planning to go there for lunch ASAP. (Lunch menu looks bomb) 

Can't thank you guys enough!!!! Thanks Kim and Vince.

I am not sure where all of the 5 star reviews are coming from. It may be the WOW factor with the light up menu. That's about it. 

This place is lackluster. I ordered the "Build your own pasta bowl" and while the portions are generous, the sauce just lacked flavor. I was not sure how to remedy this meal. I will say Maggiano's is better. 

I am also displeased by the other waitress constantly talking loudly on her cell phone. I KNOW it was near closing time but leave the dining room. No one needed to hear about you and your girlfriend's issues. Yeah.. rating: MEH... I've had better!

Great food..great service..great atmosphere. This place really does it right with chef vinces many years of restaurant and cooking experience and unique menu (literally unique as the menus light up!) makes u want to go back and try every dish..and u can easily do that as they offer some dishes as a tapas style dining experience (very large portions!!) my favorite was prob the peppers stuffed with sausage in a red brandy sauce..simply amazing..and the burnt pasta..who woulda thought burnt pasta could taste so amazing?! The eggplant was also amazing..and I can't leave out the crusty bread with olive oil,cheese,garlic,balsamic concoction..could have drank it..it was so awesome. A true mouthgasm experience!!

We dined here on 6/19 (Father's Day)

Chef Vince's Zeal is one of our favorite restaurants & one we come back to again & again. Normally, our server Lauren is available to provide us with great service, but on recent visits we've had Jackie & Todd, both of whom were super accommodating & on point with their service. For our most recent visit on 6/19, everything from start to finish was fantastic! I was most pleased with my 16oz NY strip with Asparagus & Yukon Gold mashed potatoes. My steak was cooked to a perfect MR & the chopped salad we always order did not disappoint! Family members that we dined with were happy with their Seafood Diablo & Short Rib Lasagna! My wife had the BBQ Beef Brisket & was pleasantly surprised by the hush puppies! The highlight of our night was FINALLY getting to meet Chef Vince! It was great to talk with him & compliment him on a great establishment! Over all, our visit was a perfect one & we will tell friends & family that they need to come to Chef Vince's Zeal!

I would give it a 5/5 but the service was not great. Overall then food was good. We ordered the calamari (which was amazing), the cheesy beef egg rolls, rolled zucchini and Burnt pasta (which was actually good)... For the main meal we had chicken parmesan which was cooked just right. I would definitely come back and try some other things at this restaurant.

I like the environment it was cute on the inside and the night we went there was a live band and the place was just full of people.

Chef Vince does it again -- another great restaurant with a great menu. One thing that definitely stands out about Chef Vince's restaurants is the value you get (the dishes aren't really that cheap but you get good portions and good ingredients). Another thing is the use of high quality, fresh ingredients -- so that you don't have a huge variety of flavors in each dish but rather you get a refined interpretation of the main theme of each dish. The main meat of each dish is represented well without the side dishes or sauces interfering with the experience. With that said, all the side items are always edible and delicious (especially grilled vegetables) so make sure you finish everything on the plate. The interior is very spacious with lots of separated areas and the lighted menus add an elegant touch (although they are a little heavy).

Here were the items I tried:

Bread and olive oil: Nice flavorful bread served with a delicious mix of cheese, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. The star of this is definitely the balsamic vinegar which has a very nice sweetness to it.

Lobstercicle: If you are a shrimp tempura addict, you will undoubtedly be a lobstercicle addict. Meaty chunks of lobster are encased by a fluffy, crispy tempura batter which is very flavorful even without any dipping sauces. 

Grouper francaise: The grouper is nice and firm with large flakes. The mild flavor of the meat is complemented by a mild francaise sauce (lemon, butter, flour, spices) served over a fluffy bed of angel hair pasta.

Pine nuts crusted scallop: Large scallops enveloped in pine nuts, flavored by a delicious balsamic vinegar.

Porkchop vesuvio: Perfectly juicy and tender pork chop -- with a delicious sauce made from garlic, white wine, and olive oil and seasoned with herbs.

Vincenzo pizza fritta: If you think you've tried all the types of pizza out there -- you probably haven't tried pizza that's both baked and fried... this gives you both a crispy and crunchy texture at the same time -- mixed with delicious fresh ingredients and a slightly sweeter tomato sauce. This one is definitely big enough for 2.

A zeal original: What happens if you mix caramel corn with chocolate with a sea salt caramel gelato? One of the most luxurious gelatos you'll ever have the pleasure of tasting. This is definitely a must try.

Overall: Great food, great value, great atmosphere. Definitely a great place to take family or friends.

I liked this place! Great ambience and food! Bread tasted a bit like dough. Their olive oil mix for the bread was pretty special and we liked it a lot. We ordered stuffed lamb pasta pillow with osso bucco gravy special and chicken Parmesan; both were delicious! Lamb was chewy and chicken was tender. Sauces for both dishes weren't too heavy but right to the point. Unfortunately, their dessert was a miss. We had tiramisu and we didn't like it at all...that's why it's a 4-star. Will return some time if around.

Modern atmosphere. Bar area is a great time. Favorite dish is their pizza. Its a must have. Bread with the oil and balsamic is excellent. Owner is very friendly and often walking around greeting tables.
Nice bar.       Restaurant is decent.    Great Osso Bucco! :)    Good service.      They have live music Thursday-Saturday.      I will come back again.

The outside looks nicer then inside... The food is average. I had a turkey burger and it was just ok for me.

The atmosphere is... Eh. That's the word that comes to mind when I walked into this place. At least they have a bar!

I've been here four or five times and routinely I can count on an excellent meal here. My favorite appetizer is the Melrose peppers which, born in Melrose Park, they are upholding their namesake in outstanding flavors. My stand-by meal is the Osso Bucco which is very generous in its proportion. Tender as hell!  It's very hard to find an Italian restaurant in the northwest suburbs which is NOT a chain, so this has become one of our favorite go to Italian restaurants. Their desserts are excellent!

I stopped in for a drink with a friend around 11p on a Saturday night. The bar area had a decent amount of people. Unfortunately for me being in my mid 40's, I was the youngest person there. The crowd appeared to have the average age over 65. I LOOKED AROUND FOR THE A.E.D. just in case someone went down and I needed to render aid to them. 
The band that happened to be there was pretty good.
My favorite restaurant in Schaumburg area.  Save room for dessert and get carrot cake slice or the ice cream with popcorn.

The best Italian food hands down.  Chef Vince is not only a wonderful person who cares about his business, but an amazing chef who has created a top notch menu. For appetizers, the cheesy beef egg rolls are a treat. The chopped salad with candied nuts and mango dressing is perfect and the chicken suprema which is eggplant parm, chicken parm on a bed of noodles with suprema (vodka) sauce is to die for.  The pizza is light, fresh and top notch.  The pasta bowls are enough for 3 meals.  The dessert menu is wonderful and the zeal gelato is unique, yet perfect.  Zeal also features live music in the lively bar on the weekend. A great date destination, I can't recommend zeal enough and would give 10 stars if I could.

Sausage breaddddddd.  Omg so good.   Light up menus ? How cool.  Free mouthwash machine in restroom hell yea:-). 

The place was friendly and warm. The menu had so much to choose from I wish I could have tried a bit of everything.  The sausage bread was out of this world.  The complimentary bread and olive oil was very good.  The meatloaf and stuffed meatballs were very tasty although I would give slight upper hand to meatloaf. The polenta was cooked perfectly. To finish the chocolate layer cake was scrumptious.  

I can't wait to go back.

Very weird experience to say the least. First it felt like I walked into a 1980's time machine. Very dated atmosphere, even the waitresses dressed and had a 80's vibe about them. We had reservations on a Saturday night, so I completely understand that even with reservations you might wait. And hour and 10 minutes for reservation is a little much however. Folding chairs for seats... That should sum it up. Very weird, not what I was expecting.

I had high hopes due to the relatively good reviews. But felt it was just average. Well a step up from olive garden. And hint I dont like olive garden. We had the calamari fries. Then texture was good. Crispy and tender but it lacked flavor. We tried a salad but the dressing was very acidic. We both ordered a chicken and pasta dish. It was drowning in sauce. The spindini sauce was a bit bland. The suprema sauce was a little better. But each dish was 24 bucks which was very expensive for chicken and pasta.

My husband and I decided on going to Zeal a couple weeks ago for Valentine's Day dinner. I would like to thank Yelp for helping us find out about this place. I had noticed majority of the reviews for this place being great and that is what made us decide on it. 


We had a 4:30 reservation last night and was running late. We called to let them know and they were very understanding about it. My husband asked the hostess how many reservations they had for the night and she said 400 people are supposed to be there for Valentines Day.....WOW!!! We had an older lady seat us which didn't bother us at all.....hey, we all have to make a living right?! Good for her to be standing on her feet like that all those hours at her age.


Awesome touch with those light up menus!! It was so unique!!! At first when we sat down it seemed like our server Lauren was rushing us. We get it that she wanted to turn and burn her tables to make more money, but it was our first time dining there. She slowed it down after my husband explained to her that and we wanted to take our time with everything. We felt terrible for her as we saw a lady complaining at the next table over sending her back with food to the kitchen untouched. My husband was in the restaurant industry for over 13 years and both Lauren and my husband had a venting session on how people can be lousy that you serve and nothing you do can make the customer happy

Onto the food....that olive oil balsamic vinegar concoction was like crack!! Super addicting and so good! I swear you could make a meal just from that with their bread. My husband asked Lauren what was in it and she told us. Yes, we're going to try making it at home with some Italian bread! 

We ordered the Italian beef egg rolls and they were just ok. I think if your a first time diner there I would encourage you to order it, but probably wouldn't get it again. We also had the Chopped Salad. The nuts in the salad were absolutely fantastic!!!! I'm still thinking of that salad now and how good it was. It looked very similar to the Portillo's Chopped Salad, but tasted so much better then theirs. The half order would be enough for at least 4 people! I think if we were to come here again we would skip the egg rolls and just get that salad.

I ordered the Chicken Parmesan with Angel Hair Pasta. I thought the chicken tasted outstanding with a flavorful egg batter to it.  The pasta wasn't anything to write home about. My husband who is Italian makes just as good if not better pasta. My husband ordered their Kobe Beef Sliders with Tater Tots. His sliders looked good and dare I say it cute?! They had the Zeal logo on top of the buns. Nice touch! Although I didn't have a taste of the sliders my husband thought they were very filling. I had one of his Tater Tots and it tasted hot and fresh. 

For dessert we ordered their Zeal signature Chocolate Chip Gelato with Garret's Popcorn. From the moment I saw a pic of it on Yelp, I knew we had to order it. It was rich, decadent, along with the perfect amount of sweet and saltiness. 

My husband noticed a couple things while we were dining. He didn't care for the placemats they use at the setting of each table. He was wondering how they clean them....maybe through a dishwasher? We observed a busboy taking a towel and wiping each one off. The husband didn't think it was very sanitary. Also, he noticed the carpeting.......although it hides dirt.....if wine spilled that carpet would be done for. These two factors is why Zeal gets 4 stars instead of 5. The TV's I thought were kind of strange in the dining area, but didn't really bother us. 

Portions are HUGE here which we thought was awesome! I still have leftover chicken and pasta which is enough for lunch today!! Despite those couple things, we enjoyed Zeal and will definitely be coming back here again!!! Once again, Thanks to Yelp and Yelp users for this fantastic recommendation.

Chef Vince, you are a godsend!  I've been to Zeal twice and am definitely a fan of this restaurant.  Not only is the food delicious but the ambiance and service were great as well!  To start you off, you're given this bread and olive oil concoction that you could easily make a meal out of because it's just that good.  This dipping oil isn't your typical Italian restaurant mix of oil and parmesan cheese.  No, this is 10 times better.  It's a mix of olive oil with balsamic vinegar which adds a nice tanginess along with parmesan cheese and herbs (basil and not sure what else).  

As for the meal itself, everything is very reasonably priced (possibly too cheap) for quality food and VERY generous portions.  Since I've only been here twice I've only tried 2 things but I will say both were delicious.  I've had the stuffed meatballs ($10 for lunch) and "The Bootie" sandwich($8 Yes, it's called that and yes my friend giggled like a little schoolgirl when I said the name when ordering haha).  Let me tell you, the portions were so large I barely ate half of my food both times.  I really can't complain about having too much good food besides it being not so kind on my waistline, but I think it's worth it!  

The meatballs are stuffed with prosciutto, coppacola, ham, salami, and cheese and served over polenta.  UM YUM?!  You can't go wrong with those ingredients and I highly recommend trying this dish when you dine here.  The meatballs are tender balls of yummy goodness and the polenta is nice and creamy.  As for "The Bootie", this is basically an Italian beef sandwich but so much better since they layer Italian beef with cheese and prime rib along with a ton of peppers (your choice of sweet or hot).  To top it off, the sandwich comes with fries or tater tots...and who would ever choose fries over tots?  By the way when they say a side of tots...it's not really a side but rather another meal.  You will have tots for days!  

So not only is the food and service awesome, but they are also very accommodating which I can appreciate.  My friend wanted to order the meatballs but has aversions to many things one of them being ham, so they were able to prepare special meatballs for her that didn't include ham!  This was very kind of them and my friend was very pleased.  I definitely will be back so I can eat my way through the rest of their menu!  Don't judge me.

Loved it from the moment their olive oil dip had bacon in it and I opened the light up menu! Had the mojito. It hit the spot! Shared four tapas; burnt pasta, stuffed artichoke, the cheesie beef egg rolls, and eggplant parm. Liked the cheesie beef egg rolls the best. Our waitress was great! Vince even came by to see how our meal was. Would definitely go back to try some more things!
This place was great! Big yummy servings, the chef came the table to chat, and the menu lights up! Will come here again

This was our first time here and everything was great. The 4 cheese pasta was so good, my husband had the parmesan crusted filets and those tasted great, the bread and oil they give you is great. Our server Stephanie was wonderful, very friendly and on top of everything, even being on a busy Saturday night. The light up menu is also pretty cool. Can't wait to go back.

we were looking forward to our date night at Zeal but we were in for a major shock. The entire restaurant was filled with seniors, I am not kidding. So we felt a little out of place there for a date night. Our entire focus then was just on a quality service with good food but... First off, we were seated after a 7/10 mins wait and our server went missing for good 20 mins after giving us the menus. He seemed to be in some sort of hurry to just walk away from us. He better have us not ask any questions at all. By this time, we were completely deflated by our experience. Food arrived 40 mins later and was nothing spectacular(we had the four cheese pasta and the gnochi.). We kept waiting for dessert menu and our server was ready with the check. He was not so happy when we asked him for desert menu(weird). Well, we dived in for another not so good experience, a 10$ glass of gelato with gerret popcorn. How in the world can you mess this up? We got ICED up gelato with stale popcorn in it. Needless to say, we barely ate 1/4th of the disastrous 'desert'.  I felt responsible for wasting a date night at such a mediocre restaurant.** The one and only saving grace was the complimentary bread dip.**
Wasn't a huge fan. It took forever to get a table and then the food was just okay. Wouldn't go again, but the live music was nice.
The food is authentic and Huge..huge portions a bit pricey but well worth it..and you must  must have the carrot cake.if you do not believe in heaven  you will after having the cake

Good and bad news. The Italian dishes like the stuffed lasagna and eggplant rolls appetizer are out of this world great. They give you an olive oil and balsamic reduction for their bread dipping which is extremely good. However, the bread was stale. I got skirt steak with roasted potatoes and Brussels sprouts that were just awful. The steak was very salty and the potatoes and sprouts were raw. I expected better for $25. I hear the fish is good, but I've never had it. I've had their lamb osso bucco which was OK but fatty.

This is a very nice place... outside seating was good. Everyone was very friendly.
The beautiful Melinda and I shared (large) appetizers and some wine. Excellent.

Leave room and get the HUGE carrot cake. Jiminy jillikers, I think 4 people could share this thing and barely finish it. YUM YUM YUM!!!
yow, bill

I stopped here on a whim for dinner on the way to Chicago and was pleasantly surprised. I knew it was going to be a good dining experience when i walked in and said, "This is a carpeted restaurant - this is legit." 

First, the light up menus had my friends and i excited about our meal experience since it was so unexpected and so very entertaining - it's like we never dined out before haha. Our waitress was extremely friendly and warm. She patiently explained some of the entree items as well as the specials of the night. She sold my friends and i on almost all the specials.

Bread and olive oil dip (mixture of parmesan cheese, balsamic vinegar, and even more) is absolutely delicious AND you can have as much as you want! We couldn't stop eating it. For dinner, i ordered the Chilean sea bass over a bed of rice and vegetables. The sauce gave the sea bass so much flavor and the fish itself was cooked to perfection - melted in your mouth. The rice had plenty of vegetables and complemented the sea bass nicely. Only complaint is that i wish i had more of it!! 

To top it all off, the bathroom had a mouthwash dispenser! And fresh flowers. All in all, a great experience!

Tonight was my first time here. I've got an on the fence opinion of this place. I'm 50/50.
Most of the time your first experience anywhere seals your opinion of it. Buuuut, Given that it's SO close to Christmas (1 week away) and the location is right at the mall area make me want to give this place a second chance.
For a Thursday night this place was PACKED and overly busy. They probably shouldn't have taken my reservation because we were seated at a table with 2 normal wooden dining chairs and the rest of our fairly good sized party had FOLDING CHAIRS. Unacceptable.
We were reseated at a table after a party left with all normal chairs.
We got our drinks and appetizers after we were there over an hour.
We got our main courses after we were there over 2 hours.
I never got a drink refill. Nothing complicated about a ginger ale.
I know they were busy. Lots of holiday groups and shoppers. I try and be understanding to that but the other part of me says "no. This is a heavy trafficked area and should be able to accommodate and provide great and attentive service"... Come by the table and ask if you can get anything. Make sure glasses all around are full. Make yourself seen! If a customer needs some thing they can't even find you to wave you down or signal to you, that's kind of frustrating.
Service aside, food was pretty good. Our table tried tons of appetizers pretty much one of everything. We shared all our main dishes so we could take a taste of each. I really enjoyed my osso bucco but i really only ate the lamb shank. The meat was amazing. The orzo was salty or had nutmeg in it? Some thing i wasn't excited about but i ate all my lamb! Hubby had blackened sea bass and really liked it.
We were there for just over 3 hours. We exchanged gifts because it took that long between courses... So,
I think the downers were all due to the holidays. It was too busy. After the holidays on a less busy hour of the day I'd go again. Give them another try. I have a few menu items I'd like to try out.
I am hopefully for my next visit and updating my review to some thing better.

Went to Zeal for lunch, with two other couples.  Everyone enjoyed it.  I had the turkey breast sandwich, my husband had the Zeal salad.  Vince once again does a very creative and well done menu.  
True Chicagoan, featured "sliders on steroids".  Selections of Italian beef-traditional and others.  How about Pepper n/Eggs?  Now THAT'S Chicago!  
Doesn't seem to do a rubust lunch business.  Surprising, with all the offices and shops in that area.

I can't say enough good things about this place. We've followed Chef Vince at a few other restaurants and it's no surprise that this one is as good as it is. 

Excellent service, excellent atmosphere, excellent bread on the table and the chicken parm is out of this world but you have to get it with the suprema sauce. 

Eat here, eat here, eat here. No disappointments.
Great food, excellent service.  Give it a try
Great food, many options, pleasant fast, service. We both enjoyed our pasta and had enough to enjoy it the next night again!

We came to Zeal for my mom's birthday. I thought it was mediocre. 

We had various specials - seafood linguine, prime rib, meat stew, etc. Everything was just okay. I felt like everything was American with a hint of Italian, but nothing really had an identity. I'd rather go to a true Italian place to get better quality. 

However, I will say that their olive oil, balsamic and basil mix and pre-dinner bread was phenomenal. Probably the best part of the meal (which is not mockery because quality bread is important!)
Fabulous service, huge portions, creative menu and delicious!!!! Steak, pasta or pizza - every choice will be great!

I have been wanting to try Zeal for a while now, and finally got to try it! 

The atmosphere is casual, and at the same time your could get a little dressed up and come here for a romantic dinner. It is dimly lit, but the menus light up (I've never seen that before!). Very cool! They have a bar area that plays live music later on at night, but if you sit in the dining area you can't hear it. 

Our server was really nice, and overall attentive. They did get a little busier later, but she still came around. My friend had ordered the meatballs but forgot to ask for no sauce. Our server took them back and had them make more without sauce without any complaints!

The menu has quite the variety! There are small plates that you can share, or entrees that you can pig out on yourself. There is also a pizza/gluten free menu. They have a lot of items that I have not seen before, and some classics. We ordered the cheesy beef egg rolls, the lobster roll super sliders, Chef Lauren's stuffed meatballs, chicken parmesan, and the clam special. I was really impressed with everything I tried. It all had great flavor, was filling, and would be something I would order again. There were so many things on the menu that I wanted to order - I will definitely be back! The bread and olive oil/balsamic dipping mixture they give you is REALLY good. I could probably just have a meal of that. They also have a nice wine menu with a variety of prices and flavors.

I think that the prices are pretty decent for what you get. They have cheaper items and more expensive entrees, so there is really something for everyone. I thought it was typical pricing for an Italian restaurant, but better quality of food and more variety that other places I have been to.
Business dinner, great service, fantastic food, great value, and make sure you are hungry!

Was in the area today and checked yelp for dinning ideas.  Zeal came up and looked interesting.  I had the stuffed meatballs and polenta. Separate they were great, when sampled together,  they were amazing.  I also had an order of the Italian beef egg rolls.  They were unique and fantastic. Yet another great yelp recommendation.  I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

My previous review about this place was wrong so sorry about that , it was about wildfire. So my apologies zeal. But it was really nice. The ambiance was simple but eligant and the dinner was awesome besides the Alfredo I ordered. I'm
Sorry but it was the most boring Alfredo I ever had. The steak dish we ordered on the other hand was perfection. Also 3 stars because the service could have been better. 

Over all 3.5 and we will be going back.

I chose this place to host my wedding shower after meeting with Chef Vince. At the first meeting he was very accommodating to my must have sangria and lots of it request. I was also impressed with how personable he was and he even suggested that my fiance and I come in on a later date for a food tasting. 

After that tasting we were sold! The food was AMAZING! I mean, I was initially sold on the bread with olive oil/balsamic vinegar. I would definitely recommend the stuffed peppers app and anything with the suprema sauce. However, for the shower we decided on something lighter, the lemon chicken (which was delicious as well). 

When the shower day came we were a highly disappointed with the EXTREMELY slow start to the afternoon. My friend, who had planned everything, wanted pitchers of sangria and appetizers on each table right at the start of the event. So as people were walking in could they have a drink and something to nibble on. I am not kidding you when I say it took 45, FORTY FIVE minutes to get waters on the table. It's not like we came in unannounced. I have worked banquets before, you have the waters ready at least 20 minutes before the scheduled event. It's not like the ice will water it down. 

So, I'm the bride to be and I had to keep asking where the sangria was even after the waters came. (Keep in mind this is the main thing that Chef Vince and I spoke about on our initial meeting) When the pitchers came there was so much ice in them that we could only get 2, three if we were lucky, glasses per pitcher. They brought 4 pitchers for 25 people! I was embarrassed because I, of course, wanted everything to be perfect. It seemed to take forever for everyone to get a full glass of sangria. As soon as we all had full glasses and my sister made the toast it made a turn for the better. 

The mouth-watering food definitely made up for the slow service in the beginning. We all left with stuffed, happy bellies. And, bonus, I got the leftovers!

02/21/2016  -This was a great find!  Very interesting, eclectic menu (I'm a foodie).  We had the stuffed sausage peppers & the stuffed artichoke appetizers.  1/2 of their house salad, which was large enough for 4.  My sister & I had a 1/2 order of scallops encrusted with pinenuts, it was a huge portion & amazing!  My bil had prime rib & said it was the best prime rib he ever had.  For dessert we all shared a dessert of sea salt caramel ice cream with toffee popcorn, TO-DIE-FOR!!  We could not stop eating, everything we had was delicious.  Our server (Alex R) was prompt, polite & helpful with selections, even though she was really busy with a full station.  Chef Vince came out of the kitchen to visit tables & make sure people were satisfied, so refreshing!  Restaurant was easy to find & parking lot was plentiful.  We were a little chilly at first in our booth but as the room filled, the warmer it became & was quite comfortable.

Next, we went into the bar area to listen to the band, it was very lively & entertaining with music from the 50's on up to current, people were dancing & having fun.

Loved it!  We all can't wait to go back !!
I love their large selection and frequently they add delicious items to the menu. I would call their pizza more of the modern type.

Went to Zeal for dinner with my boyfriend and wasn't sure what to expect as I hadn't read many reviews. We were seated quickly and took our waitress (Natalie, I think) several minutes to even come to the table. We ordered the philly egg roll app which was pretty disgusting to be one of their "star" dishes they were kind of cold and covered in mozzarella. For dinner I ordered the special which was the short rib lasagna and was served to me COLD. I told the waitress and her response was, no joke, "what should I do?".....so I suggested she take it back and replace it with an actually microwaved dish since it's clearly not fresh. She brought me back another plate but at this point I was so disgusted I could barely eat. The dessert---ice cream with garretts popcorn was great. In closing, if you're looking to eat at Zeal....just skip the food and order the ice cream. You can't go wrong there. I work in a restaurant and I would be embarassed if my staff acted that clueless towards a guest. And our waitress did NOTHING to make it better, I paid full price for my cold entree. My advice. Save yourself $100 bucks on a cold dinner and go across the street to Meatheads....at least the food is warm and people are also.

My hubby and I came to this restaurant not knowing what to expect. Our greeting experience was not the greatest but that has nothing to do with the food. Our dinner started off with warm bread and oil that was absolutely amazing,  followed by these cheesy beef egg rolls with a side of peppers that was to our pleasing we both had the seafood rotolo as our entre which was fantastic.  This chef loves to feed you with large portions so be prepared. Another point that I would like to make is that our waitress continually checked on us and the Chef made it his priority to sit and mingle with all his dinner guests. Great food and experience this place is a must try!!!!

Loved it!   Had prime rib lasagna, and on a second trip the lamb shank osso bucco.  Chef Vince stopped and said hello and was excited to be doing what he does.  Love this place.  Can't wait to go back!

It's worth a shot....keep your standards to the stars. Good food, wine list is alright, good place to  go if you want to try something away from mainstream that is in the area. Portions are massive and I took the advice of other reviewers for food suggestion. They all were spot on!

Love this place!  In summary: fantastic food, great ambiance!

My first Zeal experience was when our office catered in lunch.  Everything I tried was delicious: a really fresh-tasting mediterranean style salad with tiny pasta noodles in it, cheesy delicious foccassia bread, and my absolute favorite was burnt pasta!!   We have some vegetarians (myself included) and gluten-free special diets in our office, and I was very impressed with the owners' and chef's ability and thoughtfulness in accommodating special diets.

I finally had the chance to visit the restaurant for a coworker's birthday celebration last week and was equally as impressed with my dine-in experience as I was with the catering.  The space is warm, yet spacious and well laid out.  You can tell a lot of thought was put into the design - so many cute details, from chalkboard walls to the light up menus!  It's an upscale bar and restaurant, but service is extremely friendly and fun.  There was live music and a small dance floor.  Our table ordered drinks and apps, and everything I tried was SO good: burnt pasta (just as good as I remember it being from the lunch), homemade gnocchi, stuffed artichoke.  Drinks were also great.  My fav was a fig flavored vodka and soda with orange in it.

The head chef and owners couldn't be nicer; they were mingling with the guests throughout the night.  Chef Vince brought dessert out to our table.

Overall I highly recommend!

Love love love.   Chef Vince is the best!  Yummy food so far everything I had for dinner is amazing 

Bar can be crowded and at times fun bands

This was our first visit to Zeal. We came with another couple to have dinner and to see the Friday night band, and were not disappointed. The food was excellent, with a number of fresh daily specials. The staff was courteous, efficient and friendly and everything came in a timely manner. They also  have great choices of beers and wines and we loved the light-up menus! After dinner, we joined the mostly older crowd to dance in the bar area, and enjoy some great people watching! We will definitely return again soon.

In short: friendly and prompt service, unique and classy interior, spectacular food with heaping portions. A must when visiting the Chicago area.

My parents and I were visiting from California. We decided we wanted Italian and settled on Zeal based on Yelp reviews and convenience of location. We called ahead and easily made a reservation same-day. We were greeted by smiling faces and immediately seated. Tim, our waiter, was knowledgeable and offered great insight on menu items. 

We ordered the Lobstercicle and Burnt Pasta to start with a bottle of Chardonnay. Lobstercicle had a great crunch and the Burnt Pasta was addicting. My mom and I shared the Zuppa de Peche and dad had the Lamb Shank. I'm not a big fan of lamb, but it was perfectly cooked - tender and delicious. Zuppa de Peche had a generous amount of seafood. 

And yes, they make Cannoli. This is the best overall meal I've had all year. The attention to detail that the staff have is unmatched, and I love the comfortable family-atmosphere. PS back lighted menus so you can leave your glasses at home :)

Each time I've came here good is hot, service is great and I try new things on the menu.
Last time I tried the chicken portobello it was ok ....not something like the apple walnut salad that I LOVE. I thought they would just grill it and lay it on the chicken.. but they chopped up the mushroom and i mean the sandwich wasn't all dry but.. needs work. 
Cheese fries-addicting!
Cheddar beef on croissant.. was good when I had it months ago.
