my sister got the strawberry short cake and tore it up so i believe its a great dessert how fast she murdered it!

I had ANOTHER bad drive thru experience here. I'm not sure why it was so slow. They had lots of people standing around outside and we ordered nothing special. We had about 6 cars in front of us and our food  was not ready when we got to the window. We had to pull into one the special spots for the drive thru and we counted 5 cars behind us getting their orders before us.

There is no replacement for Portillos but I have to want it pretty bad to put up with the wait!

This is Chicago-style food at its best (no pizza though). Every time I come in town it is a requirement to go to Portillo's at least 3 times (no matter the trip length haha).

The entire menu shines and I honestly have not had a bad thing yet. My go-to items are the hotdogs though, Chicago-style of course! But everything is good. I've had it all!

I will ALWAYS come back to Portillo's. Always.

I have never been disappointed in a Portillos and I think I have probably ate in a good majority of them in Chicagoland.  That really says a lot. I have never received a wrong order in the drive thru. Never. Not once. Now that's really saying a lot. I was afraid after Dick Portillo sold these excellent emporiums of cased meat and beef sandwiches it would go to hell in a hand basket. But the brand and the chain remains stellar in every way. I'm eating a Mediterranean salad from the Barnellis side of the house and it's outstanding.  Everything I have ever had at a Portillos is always outstanding. Every visit. Every location. Dick Portillo is my hero.  You know what else? Every Portillos restaurant I have ever been in has been super clean and the service outstanding. Best damned hot dogs, beefs and so much more!

LOVE THE FOOD! Great experience every time I walk in here. I always see the employees working hard. The food is outstanding, and they offer so many options. Tonight I had the classic hot dog with everything and cheese fries  yum!

We eat at Portillo's a couple times a week so we generally know what to expect but today's experience took the cake. I placed a phone order for pick up in the drive thru. I arrived at 4:56 to pick up my order that was supposed to be ready at 4:55. I estimate that I was about the 8th car in line. Normally that takes only 5 minutes to get through but today it took 20 minutes to get through. There were no drive-thru staff visible in the drive-thru line. Unfortunately I was sitting in the lane and could not pull out to run in for my order so I had to wait for my food. When I got to the front this sign was hanging there. Definitely not the right thing to have hanging up today. Why do restaurants insist on changing their shifts at 5:00???

I love Portillo's chopped salad. I always wat it dry and the flavor and texture in the salad is great. I don't know what it is. When I go to make the same chopped salad, it doesn't taste the same. That is my go-to dish. The staff is always patient and cheery. I like coming here. The service is really fast too. Lastly, this Portillo's has good parking as well.
Portillos is the best, but when I can't get a beer with my beef because the entire management doesn't know that Illinois changed their licenses, sucks. Do a little research people

Just like other reviewers i had a bad drive thru experience at this location. Took way too long for a one sandwich order. Lots of employees standing around talking it was 1030 almost closing time. Too slow service at the drive thru. Cmon now this is portillos after all ...
I was the only car in line infront or behind me. Ive had faster service when there are 10 cars in the drive thru. Slow drive thru service
Can't go wrong and always great service. The Barnelli's side is amazing too. Must try the ribs and they have a great to go option.

I've been a fan of Portillos charbroiled chicken sandwich for years. While people rave about their Italian beef I have always raved about their chicken sandwich. This past summer they stopped serving said sandwich and posted papers telling customers that it was temporary due to the vendor. I was pretty bummed. Finally after months of withdrawals they brought the sandwich back and I'm sad to say it's a huge disappointment. The flavor of the chicken is not the same and neither is the quality. I've had it 3 times from 3 different locations and it's been bad every time. Very sad . So now I have to find a new item to love. 
Besides the chicken sandwich my favorites are the crinkly fries, chocolate cake and the chopped salad. Portillos is always a good option for good tasting fast food. You can never go wrong with their hot dogs, well... Unless you go right before closing, they might be sold out by then. My boyfriend ordered their jumbo dog and after paying and waiting a few minutes he was told they were all out.

I forever love Portillos mmmmh. 

Italian beef combo will always be my favorite along with fries, onion rings and cheese dip!!!

What can you say, as Chicagoan's this place is in our blood now (or at least until it was until it was sold to a Boston company) :(  Anyway the food is still good.  

And this location is as good as any.


Have yet to have something I didn't like in 30 years. 

Go for the 
Italian Beefs
Burgers
Hot Dogs
This location has Barnelli's which makes GREAT pastas as well.


Everything is good.  Don't even know why I am reviewing this.

I've been a patron on Portillo's my entire life and always loved it.  Well last night my whole thoughts and feelings changed and not for the better. Everything on the menu has always been top notch and one of my favorite pastas is The Chicken Siciliano.  It's pasta with aioli, garlic, onion,pine nuts, broccoli, cheese and chicken.  Last night this dish was brought home for me and when I opened it the smell hit me first. It was LOADED with garlic.  Now I love garlic but this was like eating a jar of minced garlic.  No pine nuts. No cheese. I will never go back. The only thing that tastes good was the bread.  Very disappointing.
Maybe after reading some reviews my expectation for the Italian Beef was too high. It was very good, but not great or "life altering" as someone put it. That being said, I'll be back for more.

Ok so we don't eat here often...Yes, I am from Chicago, no I dont have a special place in my heart for portillos...

The food is always sub-par....The fries are cold, the dogs or soggy and the salads are soaked....No thanks

Seriously, there is nothing bad to say about Portillo's. I can pick anything on the menu and be completely happy. 

The jumbo chili cheese dog is amazing, the fries are incredible, the italian beef is out of this world (as long as its dipped with mozz and hot peppers lol), the salads are incredible, the soups are amazing, the pasta dishes are fresh, the ribs are fall off the bone tender, the chicken sandwich is a winner. 

Although my 2 favorite items are the chocolate cake shake and the burger. I get the cheeseburger with bacon and its chargrilled to perfection, the bun is soft, the bacon is crispy, it's just a classic burger. 

The chocolate cake shake is a MUST for anyone that has never had it. Please please please try it, you will not be disappointed.

Best fast food burger out there! I went just at the right time. I didn't have to wait in the usual long lines and hit every green light there and back. Portillos is a staple for any Chicagoan diet.  Thankfully there isn't one super close to my home or I would be morbidly obese.  They do a great job with the drive through. I always feel so bad for the people outside running from car to car but it definitely makes things go more smoothly.

This is not a four star restaurant by any stretch, it never has been & isn't currently. While the food is decent the service is lacking and the time it takes to prepare an order for a family of 3 is often way too long. When I get my food home, the bags are usually ripped open & falling apart because 
they're using cheap bags. You can't often read the register receipt because the heat from the food has lightened the ink, again using cheap material. (The bag & receipt problem is something I've experienced at every Portillo's I carried out food from over the years.) I thought the Portillo's name meant quality. Whatever corporation is running Portillo's now, needs to step up their game! It's unlikely that I'll visit this Portillo's again as they are out of chances. Fortunately there is a good Portillo's in Bloomingdale that is a lil further drive but worth it to get better service.

Always go here and get the italian beef and a cake shake. Its been my new love since ive moved here. A little on the cheap side too so thats always plus. The inside is awesome for kids or maybe a date. Good selection of food, drive thru csn be long at times but there are people outside taking orders also so it goes pretty fast. Never disappoint

Down the toilet. Like countless other kids growing up in the Chicago burbs with Portillos it is just Heartbreaking to watch this location go down the pooper. I can rate this honestly because we go every single week at various times. The drive thru at every location used to be run like a Swiss watch. Fast, friendly, and orders were accurate. Complete opposite now. The staffers are on some kinda work release program or act the part, it's all to common to hear "N" this and that, swearing all while your waiting and listening thru the window and your praying the orders right. Order a beef dipped hot with onion rings and coke, you get a chewy beef with stale bread thats been splashed with juice, a bag with three rings and a diet coke WTF... I've found myself wondering if it's because Mr Portillo doesn't visit and observe locations anymore. I've gone to Johnnys in Elmwood Park past couple times cause it's on my way home and I'm just tired of the people and hit or miss food nowadays at this location. It wasn't until Mr Portillo sold his hard earned franchise that I realized how hard he worked to ensure the people he hired and food he served was just as high quality as he was. Tell you right now, he'd fire everybody over there in a second.

What can anyone say about Portillo's? They have the best American fast food of anyone of course. Their prices are way too high but it doesn't seem to hurt their business. They are always crowded. I particularly like the fact that there is a Barnelli's there. So there is a huge variety overall to select from. The food at both places is great. One of my favorites is the chopped salad. I also crave the panini sandwiches they have. Both are good. On the Portillos side everything is good. Their ribs can't be beat and all the sandwiches are awesome. Service is usually professional and friendly but the food preparation is slow. I am a regular here so I must like it!
This place really doesn't need another review.  So this wont be a "review"...Just sayin the hamburger trumps their beef sandwich anyday......

More often than not I am pleased with this Portillos location. I grew up just down the street from the original location on North Ave in Villa Park, which the design of is awful, where this one has a great design, large and plenty of seating. Being paired with a Barnellis gives this location many extra items to choose from. I wish I could give half stars, this would be a 3.5 review.

Atmosphere- very nice, big and expansive, cool theme, comfortable, many tables and many booths, often crowded showing its popularity (stay away on friday nights)
Service- this is by far their fall down, when things are busy I expect things to be not as quick, but in some cases it takes forever, sometimes over 20 minutes and in one instance over a half hour for a hamburger and fries, my shake had completely melted. This isnt however my most common complaint. I could not even keep track of all the times they have messed up an order, busy or not. Cheeseburger with no cheese, missing an order of fries, missing hotdog, missing polish, wrong topping on the hot dog. This is by far the most common problem.
Food- Portillos is Portillos because of the food, the chicago style hot dog and the italian beef are by far the populars and their mainstays, but I must say, their burgers are probably my favorite menu item
Drink- i do not tend to get much to drink as I live close by, but I have never been disappointed by their shakes, the chocolate cake shake being the obvious must try option, yummm
Prices- some things are overpriced and some things are well priced
Hotdog and fries are tasteless, just not the same anymore  since being sold. Wish there was a superdawg locally.

To this day I dont believe I have ever had an Italian Beef sandwich better than Portillo's. I get it extra dipped wet juicy with sweet peppers. I love the Maxwell Street Polish with relish and extra onion. They have some of the best hot dogs ever but I do enjoy redhots as well. Burgers are very good. I love the chicken club sandwich. Ribs are very good but I dont love the sauce and Id prefer ribs from a legit BBQ place anyday but theyre good. Chopped salads are awesome as well as some other salads. I can go on forever. OH! Loves me a vanilla shake from Portillo's as well!
The food was amazing & the service was prompt! Can't beat the price for how good it was! I will definitely be returning!

First time being here and let me tell you that the customer service is great! The jumbo hot dog with everything on it is so filling. If you're a big appetite kind of person then get two. The onion rings are greasy and crunchy. Not bad for the price you pay. My friends got the burgers and fries. It's also filling. Unfortunately,  they found some hair in their fries. The chili is good and recommended.

Overall pretty good and affordable. Locals recommend the ribs. I'll try it out on my next visit.

This was my first time comming here and I have to mention Her because she made a perfect selection for me and gave me a cake Kristina you rock!! Ingot the Italian beef with frys it was delicious,  very well priced and I'm going back !!

My go to spot. Everything is good; etc. Burger, beefs, salads. Favs are the cheese fries, beef extra juicy with sweet peppers, and chopped salad. Have to try the cake shake! Amazing for that sweet tooth fix!

Definitely liked this place a lot. The lines were fast and the food was great. The atmosphere was awesome and unique. 

It was a bit crazy but that's all a part of the experience. The italian beef sandwich was spot on. It was just the meat but even that was super juicy!

I got the chocolate cake as well which was nice and moist. Will visit next time I'm back.

Portillo's hot dog is a neat experience in Chicago.  I liked the design of the building with the 60's theme.  I first ordered the portillo's hot dog chicago style, I shared one with my parents and it was so good we downed the hot dog in minutes.  The portillo hot dog has a juicy dog with pickles, tomato, hot pepper.  It was great!

Next, I tried the famous italian beef sandwhich.  The italian beef was dipped in gravy ( must do, so good!) and it came with hot peppers.  When I first saw the italian beef sandwhich and it was greasy, I knew it was going to be good.  The first bite into the dog was juicy, powerful flavor, and all around satisfying.  I could not wait to stuff down the dog, the beef tasted extra flavorful after being dipped in gravy, and hot peppers gave a nice kick to the beef.  The hot peppers were not too spicy, it was more of a medium spice.  If you like a little bit of spice in your food, def. get it.  All in all, I had a great experience in this place and would definitely come back if I am around the area again.
Can't go wrong here with the hot dogs and fries. The chocolate cake wasn't that great, not worth the calories.

Wonderful, polite and hardworking team of employees. Family friendly atmosphere with plenty of seating.  Love getting the Italian Beef kits to make at home...reasonably priced and delicious. Best chocolate cake you will ever eat! Drive-thru does a huge business so it is important to check your order to see if it is correct before pulling away, as we have had issues now and then with missing or incorrect orders.
Consistent food and a lively atmosphere whenever you're in town -- it's a great place to stop. Worth every bite.

There are dozens of good things to say about this location. First the parking is pretty big, it does get crowded at lunch time but thats to be expected. The dining room is huge with plenty of tables and booths to choose from. The bathrooms are always clean and stocked well. Theres no real point in mentioning the food other then they always get my order right, which is not surprising since they don't hire monkeys   To cook my food like Mcds next door.

I looooove Portillos. Something about Chicago dogs and cheese fries reminds me of childhood. Plus it's delicious.

We ate inside because we just purchased a new car and I didn't want that awesome new car smell to be replaced with whiffs of surprise meat. 

Service inside was mega friendly and fast. My husband and I split a Chicago hot dog, cheese fries and a chopped salad. This is the first time I've ordered a salad at Portillo's, but over the course of a month TWO random patients at my place of employment have asked me if I've tried it, so I had too. It's even more random considering the nearest Portillo's is over an hour away. Anyway, the chopped salad was awesome with pasta in it and very filling. Hot dog and cheese fries are amazing always.

The set-up is a little screwy, in my opinion. We had to order and pay for the salad at one counter and then order and pay for the hot dog and cheese fries at another. I tried to order coleslaw but was told I had to order it at the other counter but I already made two transactions so decided I didn't need coleslaw. It was comical when we tried to leave because we had to get drink refills at one counter and then got sent to the other for take-out boxes. In summary, make sure you look at the menus thoroughly so you can order at the appropriate counter.

We eat lunch at Portillos at least once a month..  It's typically had good food and solid service...

Over the past few months we've noticed the service steadily deline. They have forgotten items in our order, serviced cold food, etc.  

We tried lunch again today.  A few minutes after we arrived a high school girls team pulled in.  We placed our order long before the girls team arrived, but our order and the orders from two were lost in the chaos.  In the end it took almost 20 minutes to receive our food.  Once we receive our food I realied that our sack had been on the counter for 10 minutes and the food was cold.  When I complained to the manager he offered me a small fry...

It's a real shame to see the restaurant go down hill.  We'll try a compeitor over the next few months.
Love the food. Love the service. Love the atmosphere. I don't find anything wrong except the wait can be alittle long. Just alittle on the long side.

It's Portillos, how much can I say? Food is always good, customer service is ok depending on the day and who's working. It's always clean, and a good place to go, when I'm not in the mood to wait at a sit down restaurant. BTW: My favorite thing to get is their chocolate cake shake, it's like heaven on earth!

I was looking for an italian beef, and Portillo's was in the area, so I thought ' why not?'

I had fully planned on posting a review on how going through the drive through is like being waved to park on the grass at a concert, and how the lackluster italian beef I had doesn't deserve the Portillo's worship that so many people bow down for in the area.

Then yesterday afternoon I started feeling awful. Then really sick. Then I continued to spew up until the wee hours of the morning, when I finally ended up at the ER because things were just getting worse.


Thanks for the crappy sandwich and the hospital bill. I didn't even get a sponge bath from a hot nurse. It was probably because of the whole ' my body is trying to turn itself out through the mouth' thing i had going on. Which reminds me, wasn't inside out boy on liquid television?

What a painful reminder to stick to the small places in the area that have awesome food. Portillo's was on my way, and I was trying to save time. I CHOSE POORLY.

THE SERVICE ON THE DRIVE THRU SUCKs, if you aregoing to order make sure they got your order right, and check your ordersbefore leaving, i ordered 5 polish hotdogs with extra pickle each, when i got to the cashier they got it wrong and was charging me for 1 polish hotdog, so i clarified this and told them i want 5 polish hotdog. And reminded them i want 1 extra pickle for each. When they gave me my order they only give me 1 extra pickle. I had to cone in and ask for what i want and when i got home they gave me fFUCKING REGULAR HOT DOGS INSTEAD OF POLISH.

Yummy.   Beef with sweet peppers and rocking chocolate cake. The best food all around.But always check your bag when you drive thru 9/10 times they forget something or you end up with 6 extra hot dogs.  This happened twice.  Kind of funny.  We got home with 6 hot dogs once then 4 hot dogs second time.  Odd didnt even order a hot dog.. lol

Came here to grab dinner to go on the way to a friend's house in Bartlett. We ordered two salads and a cake shake. 

Upon arriving at our friends house to sit down and eat, we noticed that my fruit and poppy salad's dressing and the chopped salad's house dressing was nowhere to be found. We also noticed we receive no bread, but DID get four containers of Parmesan cheese. 

I called the restaurant and spoke with an associate who then directed me to Scott, the "manager". I explained the situation to Scott who lacks customer service skills. He made remarks like "And the meal was ruined because you didn't get the bread, right?" No, the meal is ruined because there's no dressing genius. 

He asked if we would be coming back to get the dressings, and I explained we weren't driving from Bartlett back to Glendale Heights for dressing for a salad. He asked for my address so he could send a voucher for two free salads, which was really nice...except that was three weeks ago and it never came. 

As a business owner myself I feel it's no surprise Portillo's is hurting and going to be under new management, especially if people like Scott are in charge of running their locations.

Italian Beef first and foremost! Try a hot dog if you have room. Add a combo (sausage+beef) if you're feeling adventurous.

The chocolate cake shake is delicious for the first portion, but make sure to split a small with at least two other people or you will get sick.

The staff already knows we are Wednesday night regulars.  I think they worry about us when we don't show up.  That's how awesome the staff is there.  We've had several family events there and we've always been treated so great by both Portillo's and Barnelli's staff.  The food is always on par everytime, but what brings us back is the kindness of the staff.  We were sad to find out Peggy (my daughter's favorite staff member at Portillo's) moved to another location, but wanted somehow to express our gratitude for the greatest service from her.  Eileen is also another staff member who never fails to say hello and catch up each time she's working and we are there.  Jason is a manager at Barnelli's and is always so helpful and kind when ever we are there.  And then there is Sergio, another staff member who always says hello to my kids when we are there and always makes sure to tell our little one to eat her food so she can grow up big and strong.  We literally have been going to this location almost every wednesday night for the past 10 years. These staff members I've mentioned and many others whom I don't remember their names at the moment are so great, that they feel like family.  Thank you Portillo's and Barnelli's staff for always being so great!
This is the best place for hot dogs and Italian beef period.
Great beef. Must recommend. Good service too. If you are in the area you should stop here. Go with the big beef though.

Chicago style hot dog. Not bad, not bad at all. All the toppings work very well together but it becomes more like a sandwich. As an East Coast guy I'll stick with Texas wieners. With that said, the chili cheese dog was a complete disappointment. The bun was the predominant taste and texture and that shouldn't be the case. 

The Italian beef sandwich on the other hand is legit. I could eat them all day! And the extra gravy made good, better. An absolutely messy eat, but that just added to the experience. 

In closing, the chocolate cake shake was heaven in a cup!
The workers are friendly, the few run ins with the managers, have not been pleasant in the pAst few months.

italian beef sandwich, chi-town dog, chocolate cake shake = game over !

I was staying at the Hilton resort in Bloomingdale and decided to splurge on some unhealthy chicago classic only going to get once food and it was by far the best hotdogs / beef sandwiches I've ever had !!!
They are always busy if you go in. Drive thru seems to be a faster options. I had then forget parts of my order twice but if you go back the will fix it. Over all place is clean and friendly
Italian beef with sweet peppers every time!! No complaints on any Portillo store. They always bring it on. Service and food! There is no food that is not good in Portillos. :D

Portillo's is a chicago institution. I know they are known for their beef, but I think they do everything else just as well.

My go to dishes: Bacon Chz Burger, Cheese Fries, and of course, the chocolate cake. Hard to mess up Choco cake, but theirs is AWESOME!!! I'd prefer to just have the slice instead of the shake, to be honest. I know people are huge fans of the latter, but I think the cake takes the cake!

Big fan of the Barnelli's as well. Awesome ribs and Pasta!

Finally, the decor of this place is awesome. I love the 20s gangster theme!

Don't go at peak hours, especially in the drive thru, because you'll be there forever!
Food is still good  but the rude people that work there makes me not want to go back  . Just horrible  costumer  service .

Was going to leave a good review but some lame "managers on the Barnelli's side saw me snapping some nice photos from my phone told me it was company policy that people couldn't take photos in their restaurants. Little did they know i was going to write up something real nice. Good food, just make sure you don't take photos they are allergic to cameras and start to cry.

Portillo's is my favorite fast food chain restaurant of all fast food chain restaurants in the history of fast food chain restaurants. This particular Portillo's is one of a select few in the chain that also has a Barnelli's inside, which sells ribs and pasta dishes like mostaccioli, that most of the regular Portillo's restaurants do not have. This place is basically a Portillo's on Steroids, and that's alright by me. The only thing I don't like about this particular Portillo's is the narrow drive thru--not b/c it actually dangerous but because the narrow margin of error doesn't allow me to drive hands free with my knees b/c one hand is probably holding a burger or a beef and the other hand is holding a Maxwell Street polish. Seems treacherous and inconvenient to me, so when I come here I tend to just partake in my piping hot goodies inside. Yummers.

The drive thru is a joke.  Extremely UNorganized.  Expect to spend at least 15 minutes waiting, even if you only plan on getting a shake.

The Elmhurst location as well as the Addison location have a much efficient drive-thru system.

The inside is nice, clean and the staff is friendly.

I've been going here since I was a kid and the dogs are as good now as they were then.  The chili cheese dog without onions is complete heaven.  I wish I could write about other food items but I have never ordered anything except this for the last twenty five years.  The best part about this specific location is their drive in.  They are efficient like none other.  Get in, get your dog, get out.  See you next time!

What can be said about portillos that hasn't been said already?  The place is a Chicago area institution. Comfort food I grew up on that can't be matched anywhere else in the country. I love coming here to pig out on food that's no good for me.  Indulgence can be bliss in moderation!

This is my favorite Portillo's location. I've been to quite a few, but this one takes the cake (have you had their chocolate cake? Yum!). Any Portillo's location that has a Barnelli's location is always better in my book, because you have so many more options. Do I feel like stuffing my face with a cheeseburger (which, if you haven't had, you must. They are cooked really well and don't look like those poor excuses for a hamburger that McD's tries to pass off.) or maybe a big Italian beef sammich or a dog. Or maybe I'll be classy and order some baked mostacholi (don't judge me on my definition of classy). 

They also have some really great salads. I'm not a salad person as I typically don't think of it as a full meal, but their options really could suffice as such. My mom and I are fans of the strawberry poppy-seed salad with chicken. That'll fill you up nice and good. It's really fresh. It's possible it's still high on calories, but the way I see it, I'm getting my fill of fruit, so where's the problem?

There is a lot of seating at this location and it's great for families, couples, or friends who might all want something different but can't agree on a place. I'm craving some Portillo's now. Almost time for dinner. Hmm...
Tonight  our 3 orders of fries were semi cold and half full..and again missed the cheese on my chicken

Excellent.  This location is just as good as the others.  I go for an Italian Beef, extra gravy, with hot peppers.  Love it.  Served hot and fresh.  Fries are good but generic, but are a must-have side, and complement the hot beef sammy.

This is a big location, so there is plenty of seating.

Probably the most efficient and well managed Portillo's of the group. If your lunch hour has time limits this is the place to go because they have their service down to a science. Highly recommend this Portillo's!

I make a point of eating at their Downers Grove location at least once each time I visit Chicago. I stopped at this one because it was near my hotel. The Italian Beef was ok, maybe a bit dry. The hot dog was under cooked and tasteless. I suggest driving the extra 5 minutes (or less) to their DG location.

Yum yum yum! We went here like 2 or 3 times on our quick weekend visit... I just can't get enough of Portillos. The drive thru line is like nothing you have ever seen before, it goes out into the street...  There are like 3 workers standing outside taking your order, taking your money, and moving along to the next car. It's insane... People in the area obviously knows where amazing food is, and it is totally worth the wait!

Italian beef & cheese croissant and a strawberry milkshake. Need I say anymore. Yummy.

I do not eat hot dogs, but I go to Portillos for hamburgers, beef sandwich's, the cob salad, but most of all the Chocolate cake.  I always request Portillos for my birthday and when employees have birthdays, I always offer to purchase them a chocolate cake to share with all of us. ;-)  I am writing this review because we went to our family's Christmas party and someone brought Portillos chocolate cake.  With all the Christmas desserts on the table, the chocolate cake was the hit.

Anyone who is visiting from out of town I send to Portillos if they ask about Chicago Style Hot Dogs.  They always have a positive experience.   I like that their food is consistently good.  There customer service is really good and the dinning environment is well decorated with antique decor.  I seem to find a different antique to catch my attention every time I go.

The only reason I have this as a 4 star and not a 5 star is the traffic and parking at this location is ridiculous.  The drive through takes 10-20 minutes during lunch.  I would go more often if they could solve the rush time hassles.

My boyfriend said that their Italian beef sandwich was life-altering, and I think he might be right. I got it with hot peppers, and as I opened the grease-soaked wrapper, my mouth started watering immediately. The first bite was so greasy, but so good. The beef and hot pepper combination is just too good. Their fries are also pretty amazing. Perfectly crisp on the outside and not mealy at all. Perfectly salted.

I eat a Portillo restaurants often and it is sometimes a good experience. Today if waited 20 minutes in the drive thru for lunch. They work hard at getting it right but they charged me for the car behind me, then came back in confusion charged me again for my order and were unsure about the first order that they "thought" was canceled. Majoring me wait to get clarification from a manager was a waste of time. He didn't bother to identify my concert before tonight off to get me a recipe for one of the charges. I told him that all I really needed was to be sure that I wasn't double billed. He said he was sure I hadn't but I wasn't convinced since he was too busy to actually check. I think they have focused so much on speed that they are missing the point of customer service.

My husband is from this area and he raves about Portillo's hot dogs all the time! So when we finally went back to his hometown for Christmas, Portillo was our 1st stop after we landed. 

They have different types of hot dogs you can order and they make it as orders come in, so you know it's fresh and hasn't been sitting there for hours waiting for someone to consume them. Needless to say I was hooked on them after my first bite. The hot dog is so juice and fresh and the poppyseed bun just completes it. 

I can see why my husband wishes there's a Portillo close to San Francisco because after my 1st Portillo's hot dogs I too wish there is a Portillo close by San Francisco.
Can't go wrong with the Italian beef, some mozzarella and spicy peppers! Deeeeelicious! Lemonade too. Get that.
Been on multiple occasions beef is good and the south west Chicken salad was geat and very big enough for 2.

Cheap and delicious. The ambience makes it feel as though you walked in an episode of Boardwalk Empire, looking at the photos of all the 20s/30s gangsters. The chili, cheese dog is delicious. My only complaint was that it wasn't served on a plate, but rather just messily wrapped up.

Don't go here for catering.  They will mess up the order (how can you forget to put rolls in the order for an Italian beef sandwich), well tell you that everything in the order is hot when it is not.

The service is slow (it should not take a half hour to pay and pickup an order), staff uninterested, and food mediocre.
Love this place. Sometimes you need a little patience with the younger staff - especially at a busy time. And they DO get very busy. Loved everything I've ever gotten from here!

I love Portillo's. There is one thing I love more than Portillo's: Barnelli's. The lemonades are addictive (I'm sure they're just Minute Maid), the fries are typically hot and crispy, and their pasta is amazing! Their baked mostacholli is phenomenal, and I always recommend the chicken parm sandwich. To die for!  I would give this location five stars if I didn't see someone who ordered five minutes after me get the same exact thing I ordered five minutes before me. Needless to say I was not happy.

Why I love Portillos? 
For Maxwell Polish (mustard pickle only)!
Why I love this location?
'cause this is a first place I had their fettuccine carbonarra!
FANTASTIC
I even start to make one, with same ingredients like dried tomato and parsley at home
I also had a pleasure to meet Mr Dick Portillo (I was his limo driver couple times) He really cares about quality of his places.  Sometimes he just check his restaurants service (in different location) by visited them surpricely :-)

Mmmmm! Love to get their tuna sandwich as they are the only place that I have found that has such a thing. Italian beef sandwiches are usually good, but I think there are better places to get a Chicago dog.

We try to stop in at a Portillos every time we are back in Chicago visiting. It's a tradition.

We come here quite a bit and are very happy with the quality of the food and the service we get.  The burgers are always outstanding and the chicken sandwiches are tasty as well.  We love their french fries, too. The  chicken pecan salad is also phenomenal, when trying for a somewhat healthier option.  

However, my one caveat about this location is that you can get screwed in the drive-though.  On 3 separate occasions, our order has been wrong coming home from the drive-through.  One time, we ordered cheese fries only to get home and discover they forgot to include the cheese.  Another time, we ordered caramel pecan cake and got home to find a slice of plain chocolate cake.  The last time we drove through, we ordered one of the combo meals, only to be told we didn't order the combo and the drink would be extra.  Given this history with them, I wouldn't recommend leaving the location without double checking your order before you pull away.  Otherwise, this is a fantastic restaurant with really high quality fast food.

An establishment like Portillo's makes me pretty damn proud to be a Chicagoan. You simply can't go wrong with any thing from here-Portillo's and Barnelli's!

Just thinking about a Beef n' Cheddar Croissant w/hot peppers and fries, or Baked Mostaccioli w/Garlic Bread, and omggg the.chocolate.cake.slice, makes me giddy.

Plus, this location is super cute with its vintage 'Prohibition' theme, and playing old tunes. The only downside is that it gets reallyyy hectic around lunchtime, and forget about the drive-thru...PACKED. I would steer clear if you are in a hurry, but recommend it for any other time!!!

This place is a Chicago staple!

Everytime I go visit, I stop at Portillo's for their Italian Beef and Chicago dogs.

The place looks like a chain and it is, but a small one. The buildings are large with lots of seating. At busy times, every seat it filled, but they open quickly. 

They have a variety of options to choose. You walk up to a counter and they write your order on a paper bag, then proceed down to the other end and enjoy the show. 

Most locations have a person at this point who get all the compents of your order together and then yells your numbers. You will usually get a notice like "Number 59, You're so fine!". 

This is a great place to go to for a quick bite of two Chicago classics.

Italian Beef - many ways to order. Variety of sizes also. You can go dry, wet (juice poured on), or dipped (dunked in the beef juice). With or without Gardiner (a hot pepper/celery mixture) and cheese (optional). I usually go with a dipped beef, gardiner, mozz . It's de-lish!

Now onto the dogs,

The Chicago Dog - It's looks like a crazy cluster f*** of an item but it works! Get one for yourself or to split, but get atleast one before you leave!

If you are one the floor immobilzed from the food, go back for some desert. Their chocolate cake is amazing, Very moist and great icing. If you like shakes, get the chocolate cake shake!

Whenever I come to Chicago, I make sure to stop at Portillo's.

Not even three hours before this experience I had food from another Portillo's in Naperville.

I went out to this one with a group of 12 and it was not hard to find seating which surprised me. There was plenty of space and the theme of this particular restaurant was a sort of speakeasy type thing. Since Portillo's doesn't necessarily appeal to the vegetarian persuasion there was a pasta place in the same building that my sister and a few cousins tried out. The food was exceptional as always. I wish California's fast food french fries came with cheese to dip! I got an Italian Sausage and a Chocolate Cake Shake. You cannot find the chocolate cake shake anywhere else so I would recommend it. They put a slice of chocolate cake into a blender and blend it up into the milkshake!

Plenty of parking.

So disappointed! Only the Villa Park location is worse, in my opinion. 

I love that they have a Barnelli's Pasta Bowl attached but unfortunately, my BF and I didn't go with the Barnelli's offering on our trip. 

We went after not being fulfilled at a Vietnamese restaurant across the street and just wanted to grab a quick bite in order to make it to the movies on time. Too bad the drive through was sooo backed up that you could barely turn in from the street. Inside was considerably less crowded and I attribute that to the raining buckets weather. My BF and I ordered. I got cheese fries and a chocolate cake slice, he got a hot dog with Ketchup, Mustard, and sport peppers (he's not a Chicago style dog guy :( ), fries, and a soda. Anyway, there were 31 employees in the Portillo's kitchen, which really impressed me with everyone working harmoniously in such close quarters, BUT we saw people who ordered way after us get there food ahead of us over and over as our bag (had our order number on it) sat under the fry heat lamps while my cake and bf's soda sat on a tray waiting. After 15 minutes of staring, finally, I see the manager yell to put our bag on the tray. We are thankful and race to the car to eat and drive to the movies. 

Sadly, the hot dog my bf got was either made incorrectly or not meant to be his dog and had onions (GROSS!) with no hot peppers. He scarfed it down anyway because we were both hungry and in a hurry. The chocolate cake was good but I think the slice was smaller than other Portillo's slices but the fries were downright awful. Obviously the fry bin left overs as they were all tiny little scrimpy fries and were so dried out that they were hollow, YES- hollow. I was quite sad. 

So because of this, I can only give this place 3 stars. If I were in the area, I'd go back on a less busy day or just go straight to the Barnelli's side.

My favorite location of one of my favorite restaurants.

Portillo's is the place that people from the Chicago burbs long for when they travel. Seriously, I did an internship in Ohio one summer and I would talk about Portillo's with the one other person from the Chicago area. So good.

This location is the best for several reasons:
-There's a Barnelli's pasta bowl attached, which has a great rigatoni a la vodka. Also, the ceasar salad. I love this salad. So. Much.
-They use real dishes (at Barnelli's) and give you a small side of bread with pastas and salads. They switched to a quarter loaf, but will usually give you two if you ask.
-The Portillo's side is delicious also. The best hamburgers and fries ever. Really good.
-I kinda love how crazy the decor is. Love the 20's theme. When I was a kid, I was really scared of the mannequin in the phone booth. Still weird, but now I miss it when I go to other Portillo's.

Stopped here on a trip to a family wedding - had a great Italian Beef and was impressed by the tamales, but the chocolate cake shake was the (diet crushing) fantastic reason for the four star review. Creamy vanilla and amazingly rich cake and fudgey frosting mixed in? Sold!

Please note my "Fan" review for the Chicago location. Went here 3/1 later afternoon through evening to visit a friend. All Portillo's are great meeting places for unrushed casual dining. Anyway, stopped to use restroom on my way out. A young female worker must have been in a hurry since she barely washed her hands. Seriously, maybe 5 seconds of water, no soap on her finder tips and then she patted down her hair. Ewwwwww. Manager - please teach your employees to sing the "ABC" song and use some soap before returning behind the counter. EVEN if she's a cashier giving our change, well, think about it. Ewwwwwww.
I love Portillo's - wish we had one in Phoenix. Whenever I'm in town, it's one of my must do things.

I've been going to Portillo's for years. I like the variety on the menu. What amazes me is the efficient way they manage their drive-thru service. There might be 20 cars in line at the drive-thru lane and yet I can order and pick-up my food in less than 5 or 10 minutes.  Whoever designed the process to manage orders should get a Nobel prize in customer service (if they had one).

BTW, the chocolate cake is wonderful.

Personally not a HUGE fan, but I had a friend coming in from SF and she wanted to go, so we did.  I like their hot dogs and cheese fries but I just don't know what all the fuss is about. I mean it's pretty much the same thing as any other hot dogs. 

Their chocolate cake is so moist but the frosting is way too sweet, and their strawberry shortcake.....well that was just disappointing. They used watered down strawberry jam....ugh!

But with the amount of staff they have on hand, why do you have to wait over 10 minutes for your food!? To me, it's just not worth it.

It's Portillo's...what more do you need? Consistently great food no matter what location. We need one out in Elgin please! Beef is one of the best in Chicago. Love their salads and pasta dishes as well.

Ordered for catering take out.  Picked up my food but didn't open what I thought was my cake.  Opened it during my party and it was something else.  They did not give me my cake!.  Called and they had "no one" right now to deliver the cake.  Spoke to the manager.  Asked for a credit and they said they could send me a gift card only because they had closed out their credit cards for the night.  What poor service.  Check your order carefully.  Don't trust them.  Complain to your credit card company.

Portillo's is a difficult place to rate, they have a wide variety of menu items and a lot of variables that go into your dining experience. 

On the plus side Portillo's uses excellent quality ingredients and doesn't skimp, their standard recipe are very solid as well. The downside to Portillo's is that the meal is generally more expensive than most Chicago style fast food places, and perhaps more importantly, because of the large number of employees that work in an average day, things are made slightly differently from person to person.

Moving on to the basics of Portillos, I'm going to go over two items. Their standard Hot Dog and Jumbo hot dog. The stock portillo's hot dog is thin and has a nice flavor, it generally has all the juices intact after cooking. How they're prepared varies greatly, I've seen hot dogs with just the right amount of mustard, relish and onion. I've also seen hot dogs with too much mustard, (or too little), too much relish (or too little) and every combination in-between. This leads to Portilo's visits often being a gamble if you want a great hot dog. Usually you get a good one, but often times you get one that's just a little off. I'm also not a fan of the giant pickle slice they include as it unbalances the hot dog flavor just a smidge. The jumbo hot dog suffers similar issues with condiment application, but is quite a bit thicker and the extra beef can balance out an over-saturated with mustard hot dog.

As far as their other menu items their burgers, Maxwell street polish's and fries are usually good, and have the tendency to be great, but it's a bit of a gamble.

Portillo's is a place capable of making five star food, but you don't get that experience every time. That's why I rate it four stars.
Just another portillos. The service at this one was a little slow but the food was the same as the others, mildly mediocre.

Best Portillo's location! They allowed us to open up the "private party/catering room" when our large party of 25 arrived so we were able to sit together without having to pull a million tables together. Very accomodating. My family is from out of town and Portillo's is a must-have when they come to visit! This is our spot, Glendale Heights Portillo's DOES take the cake! :)
Let's not count the times I hit Portillo's for an 'emergency' chopped salad on my way home from work. In all seriousness, though, this place handles huge drive-through lines with ease and efficiency.

Overall:  5/5
One of my favorite places to get pizza in the area.  We order here about twice a month.  Their thin crust is perfect size and perfect amount of ingredients.

Its a takeout place so there isn't much to say about decor or cleanliness.  I like the feel that its a family non-chain place and they don't ask you 5 questions about the coupon you are trying to use.

I don't know why I don't eat here more. I ate here for the second time and the pizza is really good!! It is always cooked perfectly and tastes great! I had the Italian salad with my pizza and it was yummy. The first time I ate here I had the buffalo chicken pizza, omg so good. This last time we had thin crust with sausage, onion, feta. This is going to be my new favorite pizza place.

I have been To old town and I have to say that this is the best pizza in town. I received a flyer in the mail for a free cheese pizza so I decided to give them a try and pick one up. I believe that the pizza might not have made it home to be honest. Pie was perfectly cooked crust was nice and crunchy sauce was perfect wasn't too sweet and it was just an overall well cooked pie cut into squares also I have to give them a 5/5 . I was settling with Pizza Hut but I have to give it to Mike and his crew there at Old Town Pizza doing their thing. Will definitely be going back. My new pizza place for sure

I paid $80 for a dry medium pepperoni pizza, dry crust dry cheese. Tasted like Aldi cheese! Way overcooked wings (25 of them) a teeny tiny slice of cheesecake a teeny tiny sliver of tiramisu and a dry funky brownie. The pasta was flavorless, sauce the only good thing ... I only ordered from there because I wanted some good authentic food, well Pizza Hut would have been 100 times better!!  Very very disappointed and I don't know how they stay in business!

Grubhub order. Delivery time was earlier than anticipated, and the delivery person was great. All the hot food was cold, but considering the temperature outside, I can understand that. It was packed inside an insulated bag, so there was nothing else they could do about that. I'm from the East Coast, and expected my pizza to be cut like a pizza, not like I was feeding a group of toddlers. No where on their menu do they state that their pizzas are cut into funny squares, rectangles and triangles. I complained to Grubhub about it, and they responded that the restaurant was not willing to give a refund or deliver a new pizza. So I tried calling the restaurant and was told it was my fault for not specifying I wanted my pizza cut like a pizza: no refund, no new pizza. While the guy was polite on the phone, what happened to the motto that the customer is always right? Replacing my pizza with one I would eat might have gotten them repeat business if the pizza tasted good. Wish I would have checked these reviews before ordering tonight. I see a lot of reviews from other unhappy customers here. I spent more than $20 on a pizza that I'm not going to eat. I posted it on my Facebook page: free to anyone that wants to come and get it. So far, no takers. How much would it have cost the business to make me a pizza cut the way I wanted? So they get to keep my money this time, but obviously they will never get any more of it. Very short-sighted way to run a business.

The prices on the menu board do not match what they actually change.  (Much higher) I quested them on this and it handed me a different menu and informed me the menu board is outdated. (this is after they took my money) .  Slow ... took over 30 mins for a chicken sandwich. 

Really a poor way to run a business to have a big menu board with pricing on it and then change a different price .  

Be careful of this place.  Shady.
The pizza is just average. We keep trying this place but is just average. It happens to be convenient. Next time We will try delivery as the pizza was cold by the time we got it home.

My review of this location is for delivery only- I used the Grubhub app, which was very convenient, to place an order for delivery. I was really pleased with the app, the service, and the food. The order was delivered 15 minutes before the set time, which I appreciated as I was hungry. I ordered the fried chicken plate- and it came with four pieces, french fries, garlic bread, and cole slaw- for me it was three meals (love leftovers). My husband ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich- and also enjoyed his meal. Overall, I was pleased with the quality of the food, and the entire delivery process. I've never been inside the restaurant itself so I can't comment about the location- but the food was definitely good.

Slow does not describe this place. Was a walk in and told 15-20 min for my pizza. Currently it has been 28 min and still no pizza. No wonder the poor reviews. Which I would have searched by name and not just pizza. $33.00 for a large and individual pizza hope they are better tasting and not raw or burned. Argh. Two thumbs down for customer service here.  Pizza wasn't that bad. 3 stars for pizza 1 for service so overall two
Love their pizza!  I stop in every couple of weeks or so and purchase a slice and a soda for less than $5!  The service at the store is always friendly as well!

I come in here once in a while for the special . A pop and a slice of pizza it was around 5 bucks which is a good deal. The pizza slices are always fresh and if the don't have pepperoni they usually make it fresh for you I don't mind waiting a couple minutes for it to be ready.
Let me start by saying my man is VERY picky when it comes to his pizza. And this is one of his top choices.. we order a few times a month. We love the double dough! It is always cooked to perfection.
Stopped in for a quick bite, $4 for a slice and can of soda.  The pizza was sauce less, almost dry and not worth finishing the slice.  If in the area again, may check out their pastas..

Wow, compliments are few and far between here. No wonder from an owner who doesnt know how to treat people. Doesnt honor his own coupons and talks to people like there his bowling buddies. Very disrespectful for a place that in my book has Pizza which is mediocre

Took my in-laws from out of town here yesterday to get a gyros.  Even though there was ten of us and it was 15 mins before closing they were welcoming.  Gyros are as good as any I've had in Greektown, fries cooked to perfection and my sons chicken tenders were the size of full chicken breast.  Cute interior, super clean and a great staff.  We ended up being 1/2 hr past closing and did not even feel pressured to get the heck out. Great Greek food and staff. Thanks

I would say pretty good, they make mistakes on orders but the gyro meat is the best and I would say there beefs are ok and there fries are ok. greek chop salad is good but the dressing willl make you go to the bath room
This place has the BEST gyros around.  I have eaten here about once a month for years and have never had a bad meal.  They are not inexpensive, but the portions are big.

Absolutely love eating here! The Gyros are fantastic, the beef sandwiches are fantastic, everything chicken is fantastic, and the cheeseburgers are fantastic!

I simply have a hard time figuring out what to eat. Love going there with family, because we can get one of everything and share.

The food and atmosphere is great, and they do a great job supporting our community. Stop by and grab something to eat, you won't be dissolved!
Nice little bit of American family dinning chilli was great and the ribs feel off the bone very tatsy
It's 4 stars because it gave the shits and has really dirty bathrooms, otherwise I love the vibe and it's really a great place

Decent food. I mean you'd have to be trying to F up... to F up this type of food. 

As with most places. The food does not take away from the royal bitch behind the register. She acts like like some diva who has to sign autographs. 

"Awwww, you have to deal with customers questions when they're ordering?" You poor poor piglet. 

If you absolutely need a Gyro... This place is fine. Otherwise... Pass.

Excellent place to eat girls are fasting mission to serve the food the food there is great One of the best places to eat in the area I can't say anymore because with all out of yelps guidelines in the yellow police will remove my listing what a joke

Kosta's Gyros is definitely a neighborhood hot spot. While I was in picking up my order, tons of locals came in including a lot of families just after a baseball game decked out in their gear. Aw, suburbia!

I walked in and was greeted by the young cashier. She was quick and accurate in my order and it only took a couple of minutes for my order to be ready. They had a lot that sounded good on their menu and I debated getting a salad or grilled chicken...something healthy. Indulgent gluttony won out - it usually does for me. I got the 2 Hot Dog Special which includes 2 hot dogs (surprise), fries and a fountain drink for $6.67 with tax.

Although not overly amazing, it was pretty good. The hot dogs were on poppy seed buns and with the real stuff - Vienna Beef. The krinkle cut french fries were served super crispy and I appreciated that. When it comes to krinkle cut, they need to be well cooked instead of mushy and soft. Overall had a decent dinner and would go back, no doubt. However, I'd probably try other menu items like their signature gyros.

Great food, portions and nice area. Didn't have anything I didn't like yet. 
Plenty of seating. Come at the right times and you don't have to wait in a long line!

I eat here often and have tried various dishes and most are excellent. The basic gyro is perfect. Exactly what you expect (probably more!). They give you so much meat it'll feed 2.  The Southwest Gyro is excellent. Jalapenos are awesome on that. The salads are also quite good and filling enough for a meal. I like the Greek salad. The cole slaw tastes good but is really stringy - not sure what they're chopping up the cabbage with. Its like trying to eat spaghetti. The rotisserie chicken is flavorful but was completely dry. It felt like eating chalk. It was probably really good about 3 hours earlier (this occasion was 5pm on a Sunday). Won't chance that again. Too bad because the flavor is good.
Service is pretty good. Its mostly younger kids college and high school age and they're quite friendly and helpful. There is one lady that gets a bit cranky. I got the impression she was maybe mgr/owner.

This is a great neighborhood gyro place. The gyro portions are above average and the crinkle cut fries are salted nicely.

The reason for three stars vs more is that it's not a place I can't live without. With so many competitors out there, it's really going to boil down to price and convenience.

Kosta's used to have a standard BOGO coupon on their website, which made for a killer deal, but it's gone for now. Every time I've gone, I've used that coupon. With two competitors closer to me with roughly the same cost and quality, I don't know how often I'll make it back to Kosta's.

We've had the Greek Chicken a couple of times (take out) and it's very good. Next time we plan on eating at the restaurant.

Tried their Italian Beefs last night and they were fantastic! The beef, au jus, sweet peppers and bread were perfect!

Definitely going back.

I've been eating for years at kostas at Algonquin they use nothing but the best quality and give you (((( plentiful food )))) the prices are very reasonable and the service I rate it to be number 1 the people at the front register will take you order they are the most cheerful and helpful staff I ever seen in a restaurant business I used to own my own business in a restaurant and I know quality service when I see me and my family will be going there for years to come the place is just great and we love their decoration jerseys on the walls great job.

Food was great ! Portions was large !
Great place to get something to eat. The gyros plate is a monster of meat.
If you are near by and hungry, check this place out !
You will not be disappointed !

The southwest gyros are to DIE FOR ! They literally give you so much meat u can order a extra pita and get two sandwiches from one. You might even be able to get three . The fries could be better I'm more of a fresh fry type of person but the gyro makes up for it , my daughter also had ice cream soft served & loved that too ! Would definitely recommend this place if your a gyro lover !

I love the Kostas in palatine and when I found out there was one in Algonquin I was thrilled since I live closer to Algonquin I no longer had to make the drive to palatine. I got the southwest chicken gyro and my favorite...Greek potatoes. Unfortunately the Greek potatoes were not as good as the Greek potatoes at the palatine location, which was upsetting since that's probably my favorite item on the menu. Looks like I'll have to keep making trips to the palatine location. The new Algonquin location is huge , very clean and comfortable. Staff is very friendly. I just wish the potatoes were the same.

So I had to change my previous review after I just had their Gyro. I've had a lot of Gyros around the area and Kostas is by the best I've ever had!!! Let me know if you guys need a Cary Grove Trojans hockey jersey to hang.

Extremely disappointed after having so looked forward to our meals. New York Steak sandwich was awful:  tough, gristly, flavorless strip steak on flimsy bread, with a soggy mosh of tomato slices, wilted lettuce, and limp, barely grilled onions that all fell out, needing a fork and napkins (none provided) to retrieve. Couldn't eat it (even after adding Lawry's seasoned salt to it at home), and too inconvenient to return it. So, $8.99 for that, plus $6 for a Tuscan Gyros Wrap with bone chips, plus $.79 for gyros sauce, plus $3 for a mediocre chili cheese dog that had to be entirely eaten with a spoon, plus $2.49 for barely a handful of limp onion rings, plus $.89 for a teensy cup of mushy cole slaw, plus unpleasant service, all add up to an inexcusable culinary experience. Won't be back.

Really good food, for a really good price. There's plenty of simple take-out & dine-in joints on Randall Road, but you really should drive 3 minutes West on Algonquin and go to Kosta's.  We love to cook so it is very very rare that we order out but Kosta's matched our home cooking.  We had Gyro, Italian Beef, 2/3rd lb. double cheese burger, curly fries.  We expected the burger to be huge, and it was, but the Gyro & Beef were big, delicious and better than average price.  It was Sunday, at 6:15 and the place was busy with families. Angie was doing a great job keep the staff moving.  We'll be back.
BB from Crystal Lake, IL
Food is very good. Unfortunately the service is very bad. Be prepared to wait 20 minutes for one sandwich and no sides. :(
Best gyros and very good beef.  The only reason I gave it a 4star is because of the lady behind the register, she could be a little nicer

Alright I did end up going back here.   Multiple times actually. I don't know if they read my review or it was just a bad first experience or what, but it's a solid gyro now. The gyro is my go to meal here and it is quite tasty. I'd recommend this place, and often do. If you've went and had a bad meal. Give it another shot. I did and was very pleased with the outcome.
I love your food so much, but tell your employees to be friendlier. Never have I gone in there and been greeted or treated the right way. Pains me to give you three stars, but service is important.

Chili here is the best if you like it spicy.  I won't even make my own anymore cuz I'd rather get a quart here.  Not a fan of the beef sandwiches there but the chili is great and the honey mustard they make for the chicken is the best.  Greek salads are super here.

There are only a few things that I go to Greek style gyro joints for, tonight we tried Kostas gyros for the second time, along with their chicken pita and a cheese dog. We decided to come back despite my previous experience with their uninspiring gyro, because the chicken souvlaki is actually pretty good. Tonight's experience was not what I had hoped for. Granted they were closing in only 20 min when I arrived, but the young guy who has been working the register both times I've been here is not very personable and rushes orders regardless of timing I think. The gyros were luke warm even though we were one of two sets of customers in the store. The chicken pita is essentially just a chicken breast with some lettuce and tomato but at least it wasn't too dry. Sadly the easiest thing to cook out of the bunch, the cheese dog, was a mediocre. All in all, the whole eating experience was pretty mundane. Probably a good place to grab something quick for lunch, but the pricing is a bit high for the quality of food that gets served here.
We love this place.  The gyros is my favorite and I love their fries.  W have never had bad food here and have ordered many items of the menu.  We usually order the food to go and it is quick.

My family has been coming to this place for 10+ years. What started out as a local favorite has degraded to a place that I wouldn't recommend to anyone. The customer service is horrible. I'm not sure if there was a change in management or ownership but after our last experience they lost a longtime customer.
Was told this place has best Gyros in the area..... They were correct! Loved it and great size plate! Im a regular now!

My first experience at Kosta's was a good one- but not a typical dining experience. We were at Kosta's for a school related meeting, so we booked the private room. The private room was very spacious, and set up perfectly for our event. The food provided included house salad, italian beef, herb chicken, and vegetarian mostaccioli! I tried all but the chicken, and everything was good. The bread for the italian beef was definitely fresh- and that was the only thing we ran out of- and they resupplied immediately. The students ate somewhere between 2-3 helpings each during the time we were there. The private room is also great because it has it's own self serve fountain machine for drinks- so you can truly have the room all to yourself. The restaurant seemed very clean, had numerous games for kids to play, and had all polite employees. If I lived closer I'd definitely come back and try some of their Greek fare, but I wasn't able to this time. I was glad we tried it for our meeting, and hope we host another meeting here again in the future- they were great to work with all around
Love the gyros.   Tons of meat.  The cream of chicken rice soup is delicious.  Always quick and always fresh

Normally very happy here, pickup gyros and rotisserie chickens at least once a month. This last time I was in, I ordered a half chicken and a chili.  The woman at the register asked the cooks to make sure there were enough chickens.  They didn't seem to really reply, so I think she assumed it was yes.  5 minutes later, she informs me they don't have chickens (after I already paid).  It was the whole point of me coming here, so I cancelled my order and got a refund.  It was a waste of 10 minutes of my time.

We got a beef sandwich and it was good. The thing that really bugs me is that they charge you for everything. When are you going to charge for Ketchup? Have you never heard that condiments are a cost of business? Will I go back, NO!!
They really have good food here. The chicken salad pita is really good. I'll be going back there..

I asked the lady at the counter about the tamales. I suppose I should be grateful she was honest: they buy them frozen at the grocery store and microwave them. The curly fries were decent and the gyros are huge. All in all a decent experience.
Been bere several times. Nice atmosohere, Pretty good food. Good portions. Nice family spot.

My dad and I wanted to go out for lunch, and he had a taste for a Greek salad or gyro. We ended up going to Kosta's. He got a Greek salad and had the gyro meat put on top! He loved it!!! I got the Italian beef with mozzarella and it was also very tasty. It's pretty good food. This place gets a 4-star because the guys up front taking the order were not really friendly, but they seem like kids. And kids will be kids. But all in all we were very satisfied with the food!

Went over here the other day to have a gyro...which was, uhm...large. Still, $7.69 for some freezer fries, fountain drink & a gyro...I dunno. Cost us $40+ for four of us to eat here. I guess if I wanted to save money I could have went to Tommy's right? 

Anyhow the decorations are nice, the place looks great. The party room...well it made me want to have a party in there. In fact someone was at the time we were there. Also a few arcade games for the kids next to the bathrooms so you can't miss them. 

Not bad overall...great atmosphere. As far as the food goes, I prefer the Kosta's on Dundee myself.

My family and i have been coming to this location for years.. Since the firdt week it opened.  We used to hold our Mustang Film nights at this location. Lately, the place has not been taken care of. Always dirty when u come in. The cashiers are always moody and they have an attitude when they take your order. The pictures at each booth have food on them which leads me to question what their food prep area looks like.  I wish the owner would get to cleaning bcz they do a lot of sponsoring for our pee wee teams and his restaurant is definitely a go to for team functions in this area.
Food is very good. Unfortunately the service is very bad. Be prepared to wait 20 minutes for one sandwich and no sides. :(
Best gyros and very good beef.  The only reason I gave it a 4star is because of the lady behind the register, she could be a little nicer

Alright I did end up going back here.   Multiple times actually. I don't know if they read my review or it was just a bad first experience or what, but it's a solid gyro now. The gyro is my go to meal here and it is quite tasty. I'd recommend this place, and often do. If you've went and had a bad meal. Give it another shot. I did and was very pleased with the outcome.
I love your food so much, but tell your employees to be friendlier. Never have I gone in there and been greeted or treated the right way. Pains me to give you three stars, but service is important.

Chili here is the best if you like it spicy.  I won't even make my own anymore cuz I'd rather get a quart here.  Not a fan of the beef sandwiches there but the chili is great and the honey mustard they make for the chicken is the best.  Greek salads are super here.

All in all, the whole eating experience was pretty mundane. Probably a good place to grab something quick for lunch, but the pricing is a bit high for the quality of food that gets served here.

I'm not sure if there was a change in management or ownership but after our last experience they lost a longtime customer.
