Like this place a lot. The inside is beautiful, I love the bar area and the restaurant is lovely. Always enjoyed the food and have rarely had anything but the best service. Burgers are really good, but then I have never had a had meal no matter what I have ordered. Highly recommend for a casual dining experience.

This place tried to pass off tomato soup for spaghetti sauce. When I asked the manager if they thought this was funny and the stunad laughed. So what did I do you ask? Friday night Frankie came out and I busted that little punks knee caps wit a sock filled with spoons. I then made the greasy meatball eat the entire plate of spaghetti off of my shoe. When the little weasel tried to run away Joey Boombots clubbed him over the head and loaded him into the trunk of his Cadillac. I went back to the bar and finished my glass of vino. I will not be going back, capish?

Despite being terribly located, this place is great. Their brews are top shelf! I love the Paddy's Pale Ale, and don't get me started on the Hopslayer... (Do. Do get me started. It's a super hoppy Double IPA, 8% alcohol and intensely good flavor.) It's also available in cans at some liquor stores who know their craft beers.
HUGE portion of Fish n Chips. HUGE. Literally 2 meals. The wings are fantastic, and the menu is varied, so far I haven't had anything I didn't like. Good for low-key live music on the weekends, acoustic kind of stuff. The place itself is really attractive, lots of nice woodworking and hefty high top tables in the bar area. They also have a HUGE banquet room in the back, perfect for private parties and events.
Terrific night! Great service, food and atmosphere! Would highly recommend it! We will be back.
Karen Swanson,  one of the bartender ' s is the best! Stop by and say hi to her! She is top shelf!

The Onion was on our list of Chicagoland breweries to check out so we schlepped it up to the edge of nowhere to check it out.  We won't be making a return trip.  If I could give half stars this place would be a 2.5.  It's just a little below average.  The beer was fine but nothing special.  We usually get a growler when we check out a new brewery but we didn't want more of the Onion's beer.  The food wasn't impressive either, we got an "Italian" grilled cheese and a Polish sausage sandwich.  The sausage was more than twice the length as the bun and very hard to eat.  And bland.  The grilled cheese was better but still not very memorable.  I could have done better at home.  The fries were very good though.  On the plus side the atmosphere was nice (lots of wood and a dome, or rather onion, shaped ceiling) and our waitress was friendly and attentive.

Get the flight of beer, it's around 10 or 11 samples (depending on the season and what's available), compared to other brewpubs usual 6 or so!

Their burgers are great, and come with fries, regular or sweet potato variety. I'm undecided on if the sweet potato fries are worth the up charge, but that's not a knock against them - it's only because their regular fries are equally as good.
I hadn't been here in years.  Yesterday I met a friend here for a late lunch. I had the best Reuben sandwich I may have ever had. I also liked their "atypical" coleslaw,  unique and delicious.
Burgers & fries - OK. No bad but definitely nothing special.  Very nice wait staff. Would give an extra 1/2 star for them.

Had our wedding and reception here for 100 guests. Things went fantastic! Jamie and Jody were great at communicating with us in the months leading up to the event which helped us be very prepared. Venue was fantastic and our guests loved it. Servers and bartenders were all great. Highly recommend for anyone considering a wedding there.

First-off this place is pretty gorgeous inside, the exterior is misleading because it looks small and cottage like. but inside it has beautiful woodwork and an airy feel to it. The service was very pleasant, the food though, to me and my wife was awesome. I had the Reuben piled high with homemade corned beef and just enough kraut for the bite and dressing to add a little sweet grilled on marble rye. The wife had the special of the bread bowl soup sampler with three small pretzel rolls each with  chili or soup which she really enjoyed which also came with three little pieces of the polish sausage they were delicious. The 2 beers I had were also excellent.  The dark ale and the stout. Well maybe it was 3 or 4.

I worked there for a year as a busboy during high school. The business was fun, though flawed, back then and has done nothing but improve. The atmosphere is wonderful, the location couldn't be better, and the selection of food is awesome. Very vegetarian-friendly without bragging about it too much.

Don't have to say anything about the beer selection because everyone knows its awesome. I highly recommend this place from an insider and customer experience.

I had their fried pickles, although there were very little pickles in the basket that was brought out to us. We did not order anything else as we were too grossed out at the place. As soon as we walked in there were a couple of napkins on the floor. ALL and I do me ALL their chairs have mystery stains on them. They need to be replaced ASAP! There were a couple of waitresses putting silverware in napkins and they were drinking and touching their hair while doing this. The whole experience was not good. We got out ASAP! I would not recommend.

There was a giant fox mural outside and cask-conditioned vanilla-infused pumpkin ale inside. 

Resistance was futile. 

In the words of the great Janet Jackson, 'Like a moth to the flame, burned by the fire, my love is blind, can't you see my desire?'

Once inside we were promptly greeted by what I would describe as a 'fancy rustic' vibe. What does that mean? Well, it means they've got wood... and lots of it. Oh, you know you like it. 

The belly-up area of the bar was full on this past Saturday afternoon, so we opted for a table along the outer rim of the walls. After a looong day of detours and a pretty hellish experience attempting to patronize Goebbert's Pumpkin Farm (and getting no further than the madhouse parking area) we decided to hit the road before ever even technically leaving the road and the safety of our vehicle, in search of beer, and lots of it and I was about to dedicate the next several minutes to perusing the chalkboard list of Onion Brewery beer while visualizing myself drinking draft pints of every.single.item on the menu. 

I decided on their special vanilla pumpkin beer on cask and my handsome steed got something dark and delicious, but my beer memory isn't so good these days so you'll have to go there to feel out the selection for yourself. My beer was fantastic, but I might even have favored the dark draft a bit better. It was flavorful and deceivingly light with the sad metallic and watery after-taste that poorly made dark brews sometimes have. 

I wasn't too terribly hungry and I'd already had my mind made up that I was there for the drinking, but my date talked some sense into me and we went ahead and ordered OP&B's veggie burger, though that wouldn't have been my first choice (I would've gone with nachos). I kind of expected it to be the boxed chipotle black bean burger that Costco sells based on it's description on the menu, and like I've said before, I overdosed on that brand a few years ago so I normally try to stay clear, but when my guy's hungry for something, it's really not worth devastating him by saying it might not be the best option, and even though it was the pre-made patties, it was dressed up really well with ciabatta bread and the standard burger fix-ins, though no mustard... which was kind of weird, because anyone who's even vaguely familiar with mass-produced veggie patties knows that you need all the extra condiments and flavor-helpers you can get, sadly. In the end, the burger was pretty tasty and the quality bread selection really made up for the lack-luster cruelty-free burger. Oh, and their fries were pretty great, too. 

Our tab ran a little over $20 and some change and filled us up in both the thirst and hunger department. We left in good spirits and also kind of kicking ourselves that we lived so close to Onion Pub for so long, yet never made the relatively short trip in. So many thirsty days and nights- wasted.

I love this place! Great food, great beer, great staff, all at a decent price. As a beer enthusiast and a food connoisseur, I couldn't have been more pleased! I plan to visit again and again for years to come! I'm itching to return soon just writing this review!

We drove 30 miles to try this place and it was worth it! Unfortunately they were out of Hop Slayer which really was the point of the journey. But that's ok. Instead we shared a flight. That's right. SHARED. A flight at the Onion Pub gets you 10, 5oz tastes. Have up our table when the hostess came around to side up at the bar and indulge in beer and a snack. The calamari? Ridiculously Good!!! That was all we could stuff in after all the beers. And our plan was to move on to another pub. Grabbed a 4 pack of Hop Slayer to go (to ease my sorrow of not being able to drink it there) and a growler for $15. That's what it should cost! Well played Onion Pub. Well played.

The food is really good.   Loved the ruben sandwich and the garlic mash.  They have a good variety of beers, the summer witt was my favorite. The service is great.   Its not the prettiest/elegant  banquet hall but its nice for a small wedding.

As part of my 2012 brewery tour I visited the Onion Pub and Brewery. I have had some of their beers in the past. In fact they were a featured flight in one of the beer tastings I hosted.  

The atmosphere is fantastic. Nice wood interior with a fireplace and vaulted ceilings. It's much nicer than most breweries and brewpubs I've visited. The large U shaped bar offers a lot of seating at the bar itself, and there are plenty of tables for small intimate meals or for larger groups. 

When my wife and I arrived we were promptly greeted and sat at a table for two in the bar area. The service was very slow from start to finish. I don't know why, as the room wasn't that busy. It took a good 10 minutes before someone came to get our drink order. Then when it was placed it took a while before we received them. We witnessed our waitress chatting with the bartender.  During our entire visit we would go lengths of time without seeing the server to get another drink.  

For an appetizer we had the hummus platter. It was good. It wasn't fantastic, but we enjoyed it.  For our main course my wife had the Crispy BBQ Glazed pork shanks. She wasn't impressed with them. She felt that they were kind of bland and needed something to help add some flavor. I had the Hopslayer beer steamed mussels. I thought they were fantastic.  They had a great flavor. I shared some with my wife and she was jealous that my meal was so much better than hers. 

Their beer is okay. It's not that great, but it's better than the mass produced products out there. I'm not going into a beer review here, but I will say that I am a little disappointed in the quality of some of their beers. Don't get me wrong, they are good, I've just had so much better.
Been here many times and the food and craft beers are always good! Highly recommended!

As usual, on Yelp, people are way way too critical, that being said, Onion Pub and Grill is AMAZING!!!!! Food was phenomenal, Ashley the bartender was great and their locally brewed beers are great! I feel Yelp is becoming a site for people to rant about a forgotten napkin!

Another day, another drive into the middle of nowhere to try some new Midwest microbrews.  I have tried both the Paddy Pale Ale and the Hop Slayer in cans from my local Binny's but wanted to get them straight from the source and also give more Wild Onion brews a try.  The sampler flight here is called "The Paddle" and has all 12 draft beers at 5 ounces a pour (if you can down these, I'm impressed with your alcoholism).  Considering I am the only one drinking however, I decided to go with the sample pours instead.  Each sample was a 5 ounce pour for $1.25 a piece.  

I tried 5 samples:

Chinwaggin Irish Red Ale- Decent red ale with a touch of nuttiness and light malt flavor, low on the hops (aroma and flavor), and pretty carbonated.  I'm not usually a red ale fan, but this one seemed on the "meh" end anyway.

Jack Stout- Nice strong coffee aroma and flavor.  

Drago (seasonal)- WHOA.  This reminds me of Old Rasputin.  Serious imperial stoutness with its heavy espresso aroma and flavor, lacy head, and smooth finish.  It almost has a bourbony quality to its mouthfeel as well.  

Paddy Pale Ale-  SO MUCH BETTER ON DRAFT.  In the can, this beer is alright.  On draft though, it is downright delicious.  It has a super citrusy hop aroma and a nice bitter finish.  YUM.

Hop Slayer- Very similar to what is in the can.  Hoppy with a nice malty backbone and a high abv.  The ushe for a double IPA.

We also ate some nachos and some burgers which were good.  All the ingredients seemed super fresh but the food was just "good" (which is the opposite of bad, but it's not mindblowing, if you needed further clarification).  The service was amazing and the place has really nice ambiance.  It's like a classy log cabin for craft beer snobs (picture a lot of wood, fireplaces, and beer prints on the walls).  If it were closer to home, I would definitely frequent this place.

This place has great beers and very good food. The atmosphere is very nice like an old English pub. Reasonably priced and excellent service. Seems like a strange location in a business park but definitely worth the visit.

food amazing! Beverage-outstanding! Service generally really nice and genuine. I think a couple years ago I would have said something different but now I love it! My favorite place to sit is in the pub area or at the bar! Good at big groups. I usually always go with about 5-10 people. 

We live down the street so it is really nice to have agood place close to home. However we will be moving soon so I will ahve to make a special trip to visit from Palatine! 

Atmosphere tops all!!

Onion pub is a testament to mediocrity.  They manage to do everything decent never bad,  but never great.  The food is so so,  I've never had anything bad and I would actually recommend them for a holiday brunch which are pretty good.  The atmosphere is fine as a restaurant but not so much for the bar.  I know it's Barrington but a brew pub, especially one than cans,  should have a good size bar with bar hours.  The bar holds maybe 10 at the bar with around two tables,  I think there's one TV.  I guess I just wish they would embrace more of the brewery side which they are so proud of.  You wanna sell beer get people in to drink not eat mediocre food.

Fun place!! Good burgers, good apps and good beers. Growlers available to take home. Would definitely recommend to go for a different dining experience. Party of 7 did not have to wait too long for a table on a Saturday.

Beer is good - that I'd give five stars. Solid variety and they do appear to take pride in their craft (pun intended).  

Food is what takes this down just a notch to four stars.  It's ok, but pricey and the menu is very limited.  Personally I'd come here to hang out at the bar, enjoy the beer and maybe order an appetizer with friends.  It wouldn't be my first choice for dinner, but I wouldn't be terribly bummed if we did end up there for dinner.  

The building itself is really good looking and I think it would be a really cool place to host a party or banquet.

No idea why I don't go here more often. The paddy pale ale draft is hands down one of the best pale ales I have had. Not too hoppy but a perfect balance of nutty and bitter taste with a nice amber color and head. The grilled sausage appetizer is my favorite served with a warmed mild sauerkraut loaded with bacon. Like being in a German br_ukeller . The beer cheese soup is also very good. Big place with lots of seats and good wait staff. Totally recommended.

We stopped in for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprises.

We had heard about the Onion Brewery, so when we were heading through Barrington last Saturday, we decided to check it out.

Definitely an interesting location.  It seems to be in an industrial park with a twist.  There is a very cool pond behind the pub.  They were setting up for a wedding so we didn't get a chance to sit out on terrace, but i imagine it is pretty nice.

Anyways, there was only one bad thing I can say about my experience.  When we were sat, we sat for quite a while before the waitress came over.  That is a huge pet peeve with me.  In fact, I have not gone back to restaurants for years because of bad service.  And if you are familiar with the Crystal Lake area where I live, there aren't many restaurants.  So not going back to one for years is a pretty big deal.  The waitress didn't apologize but she did make up for it by being extremely friendly.  In fact, she even held my 7 month old son who absolutely loved her.

I ordered the special of the day which was a wedge salad with fresh tomatoes, blue cheese crumbles, a wedge of lettuce, of course, and a strip of steak rubbed with cajun spices.  The salad was awesome!  It was fresh, the blue cheese salad dressing was delicious, and the steak was absolutely perfect.  It was cooked perfectly and very tender.  The combination of the blue cheese and the cajun spices made for a great combination.

My girlfriend got the fish and chips which was also excellent.  The batter on the fish was light and flaky, just the way we both like it.  Not greasy, kind of buttery.  Very good.

The steak salad was great but I think the highlight of the meal was the pumpkin ale.  Just the perfect blend of pumpkin spices.  I highly recommend it.  In fact, I had two pints and bought a six pack to bring home!  As a warning, I'm not a light weight, I can drink my fair share of beer, but the pumpkin ale was strong.  Which I  consider an extra bonus...but be warned I was pretty buzzed after two beers.  :)

All in all an excellent experience.  Great food, Great beer, our waitress was extremely friendly after the slow start.  I would definitely recommend Onion Pub and Brewery.  We plan on going back so we can sit over looking the pond and drink more pumpkin spice ale.

I went to a wedding at the Onion Pub this past weekend.  The wedding was wonderful and the staff were all very kind and helpful.  The space itself is gorgeous and the back patio overlooking the pond was really nice too.  Carla was one of the bartenders working the event and she was outstanding... as was everyone else, but I specifically got her name.  

The beer selections were all tasty, and I'd go back to drink more.  Onion Pub is out of the way for me, but I'd go back for dinner and drinks in the future.

Hadn't been to the OP&B for a couple years, due to the lackluster food on my first visit. Today, I decided to go super simple and do a beer and burger lunch. I was very pleasantly surprised with a delicious burger, which was cooked perfectly. I ended up going with the Oktoberfest, which also was delicious; however the very friendly and personable bartender let me taste a few other flavors on tap. 

This visit restored my interest in this brew pub and I will most definitely be returning!

Time to update my review and Rocco Vino's remains a 5-star favorite for the same reasons I outlined in 2014.  The baked clams are still big and delicious and the pasta dishes are excellent.  
I asked the manager what his favorite pasta dish is and he had some difficulty naming just one.  OK, I can appreciate that.  He suggested the Penne Speziato which comes with Italian sausage, baby pepperocini's , portobello mushrooms, roasted red peppers, red onions in a marinara sauce.  He suggested that I could drop the pepperocini's and substitute one of their other sauces. I took him up on this advice and substituted the tomato basil sauce.  It was excellent!  Without the heat of the pepperocini's, all of the ingredients shared equal billing in this terrific flavor profile.  It was truly enjoyable.
Emily was our friendly server who took good care of us.  All of the above added up to a 5-star meal.
Don't forget they have Happy Hour specials Mon-Fri from 4:00 to 6:00PM.

I have visited RoccoVino's three times, and unfortunately have never had a good meal. 
I really do not like to complain, but I will not be returning. 
The first time I visited I ordered the gluten free pasta with arrabbiata sauce and the pasta was over cooked and the meal doused in sauce. The second time I visited I ordered the gluten free pasta with the vodka sauce and my meal was over salted, the sauce watery and I did not finish nor wanted to take the food home. And this last time I ordered the gluten free pasta with fresh cut tomatoes, olive oil, fresh garlic and fresh basil. What I received was pasta with canned tomatoes wilted basil and large chunks of garlic. I did not finish nor take any food home and decided I would not come back. 
The wait staff has always been very nice at the restaurant though sometimes a bit absent minded, and the flowerless chocolate cake is always good. But I cannot recommend the food. Sorry but I have to give this place a thumbs down.

This place opened up by my place a while ago, and I've been meaning to come here. I still have not been inside, but I did order for delivery (they deliver!). Italian seemed like it would hit the spot for the day, and it ended up being a good choice. 

The delivery menu (and the menu in general) has expanded. I felt like a had more than enough choices! I ordered a half dozen of the baked clams, the Tortellini Veneto (comes with soup or salad), and the tiramisu. Like most Italian restaurants, I feel like it was over priced, but it was a lot of food for $32.

The food came quickly (they said an hour but it was definitely before that). I would definitely order the tiramisu and pasta again. Next time I would order the soup over the salad (the salad was boring and nothing to write home about), and I felt like the clams were bland and soggy. Maybe better in house and not delivery. But overall I was pleased.

I would order from them again and I want to try dine-in.

Came here with some friends. The food was good. Our friends had pasta dishes that looked really yummy. I had a pizza with artichoke, prosciutto and garlic which was excellent. My husband had pepperoni and sausage pizza which was fine but obviously nothing exciting. We had dessert. We split the Oreo cheesecake and it was not worth the calories- it was blah in my opinion. The service was good. We were probably at dinner for over 2 hours and never felt rushed or anything. I will say, I ordered a side salad...it was literally just lettuce- weird. I would really give this place 3.5 stars but I rounded up.

I've had Rocco Vino's growing up in Elk Grove and loved it. It seems like this is a new sit down location. Service is great and homey. Plenty of Italian fare other than just spaghetti to choose from and it tastes great. Complimentary warm bread on the house - the crust is a bit to dry and crunchy for me though. I got the Seafood pasta and all the seafood were clean and fresh and it was just the perfect amount to fill me up. Gelato is great for dessert and I think it was $3? Nonetheless, great choice for Italian food.

when reviewing a restaurant one must take in the totality of the experience. The food is key, but still only part of the equation.  Atmosphere, access, quality and value all play a role. When you figure that in, RoccoVino's makes the grade.

Easy to get to, plenty of parking and a relaxed atmosphere are a great start. Friendly and knowledgeable staff led by Alex paves the way to a nice evening. The food is excellent throughout, nice portion size and priced reasonably.

Pizza is terrific, nice chew to the crust and excellent sauce. Lasagna, a usual weakness at many places is marvelous in spite of a little fennel dominance. Huge portion could feed two.

Chicken and veal dishes first rate. Pasta served al dente'; good scratch sauces and they are justifiably proud of their vodka sauce. Nice carbonara as well.

They have specials, and the Tuesday half price pizza might be the steal of the century. A marvelous extra large 'Rocco's best' with sausage, pepperoni, bacon and Italian beef at $27 is a good buy.

For $13.50 it's a genuine steal. Beer and wine specials abound. While not exactly 'cheap'; one can spend a nice penny if you go after their best offerings, the value they do offer is off the charts good.

Overall, great Italian food served by friendly people with tons of value. What's not to like?...

We are visiting Chicago for business and decided to stop at RoccoVino's Italian Restaurant of Elk Grove Village for dinner. Very glad we did!

As soon as we walked in the door, we were instantly greeted with enthusiasm and were directed to a gentleman that would assist us with seating.  He was just as pleasant and lovely to speak with as he escorted us to our table.  As he was seating us, he thanked us for coming in and provided us with a feeling of excitement to see us, as if he knew us, which he did not (from my experience restaurants don't thank you upon your arrival, it was nice not to hear it half whimpered upon my departure).  The restaurant buzzed with excited energy and gave a very comfortable feel with seemingly satisfied patrons that also appeared to be regulars.  

We hadn't ordered yet or been greeted by our waitress during this short time, yet we felt so welcomed and was viewing what appeared to be surrounded by routine happy patrons. Both myself and my co-worker looked at each other and commented that we loved the atmosphere and joked that we hoped the food matched the good feelings. 

We ordered Strawberry Daiquiris, which wasn't on the menu, they were still eager to prepare for us and they were delish.  The bread brought out was warm and the salad cold and crisp!  For the main course, we decided to go with Chicken Fettucine Alfredo.  The food was hot, not warm. Alfredo was creamy and chicken moist (definitely didn't taste like it came from a jar by any means).  We loved the food.

There were a quite a few desserts, we went with "Death By Chocolate" to go.

Our waitress provided great service and made us feel just as welcome.  She happily answered all questions we had about the menu. She never disappeared and appropriately checked in on us making sure we weren't in need of anything. As we were wrapping up, she told us how great the people are in the bar area and we were welcome to stick around for a drink or just hang out and watch the game (Cubs was on). 

Though I would love to be selfish and keep this place all to myself, it is a restaurant too good to stay hidden for long. There's no doubt a table at RoccoVino's will quickly become a hot reservation in town if people that haven't visited RoccoVino's knew what they were missing out on.

This place has delicious food! Everything was top notch. I've eaten at a lot of Italian places, and tonight they topped it. I had their fresh delicious Minestrone soup with their fresh crusty bread and delicious olive oil. Them spinach linguini with meat sauce and meatballs- so good. I brought some home and I'm looking forward to having it for dinner tonite.
My only complaint was that it was a bit chilly in the restaurant, next time I'll bring a sweater. The owner is very nice and was very friendly with everyone- as was our waiter.   Molto bene!
I got the calamari and chicken parm to go. The breading for both was just so so. Not crispy, more like bread. Pasta was extremely over cooked. Not very impressed.

This is a great restaurant, food very good, drinks generous, service great, however, the only problem is this restaurant is so cold..Maybe it is to keep the kitchen cool .I have been there twice and both times brought a sweater but still freezing..The hostess asked the manager to turn the air down and he did..Don't know why it is so cold when you walk in...
GREAT PLACE!  Awesome food, fabulous management by Mike, and the most incredible service by our waiter Joe!!!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Since it is a Friday in Lent and we had an errand to run in the area, I suggested to my husband that we have a late lunch at Rocco Vino, because I knew they have many vegetarian or seafood menu options. Our server was attentive and efficient and the food was fantastic. We started with the bruschetta which was elegantly plated. Each of our entrees came with a starter. My husband loved his soup of the day, and I enjoyed the homemade dressing that accompanied my basic but fresh salad. My husband ordered a special of the day - orange roughy - and he said it was really delicious and moist, with a light egg coating on the outside and a pleasant lemon-butter sauce. I got the spicy tomato sauce on pasta - yum! If you like garlic and a little heat, give it a try! There are big slices of fresh garlic throughout the sauce so you can tell it's homemade. Save room for dessert, as, like the other items we tried, the desserts a delicious and plated to look as pretty as they taste. 

If you are in the area, it's a great lunch, dinner, or date night option. I hope to go back soon and try more items on the menu.

we went here for my fiance birthday in the beginning of the year and we loved it! the place is so cute and charming and we loved the food! the apps were Delicious the drinks were great ! the service was definitely very slow (which needs to be improved) but the food and the atmosphere we loved! the desert was soooo good, I literally cant not wait to come back soon! its wroth trying for sure! our daughter loved her kids Alfredo as well (which of course we tried and we loved it )
Is this even Italian food? I ordered the Rigatoni Vodka and it was very disappointing. The bruschetta was drenched in vinegar and the whole meal was just undesirable.

Good food... and I'll be back. Mike the owner was very nice and accommodating and had some nice recommendations... I ended up going with the Linguine with Clam Sauce and while it was good, it could've used a bit more in the seasoning department. Definitely worth checking out though... really nice and interesting dishes I want to try out next time!

I could eat at Rocco Vino's every day!!  I have always been seated quickly.  I have received service that was a little iffy, but just a little, and certainly not a reason to stop going,  98% of the time, the service is great.

Six words; Vodka sauce, Vodka sauce, Vodka sauce.  I get it on everything I can.  It is perfect. I've had it at other places and they put too much red pepper in it for me. This is simply delish! One of my other favorite things is the salad. They use a good selection of lettuces, but the balsamic dressing is awesome.

Don't ever close or I'll have to move out to Orland Park to go to the Rocco Vino's there!
The food is excellent and had exceeded my expectations!  Great neighborhood feel for this restaurant and the service was outstanding!

I order take out from this restaurant for my family and I when we feel like staying in.  Even for take out, this place is amazing.  I ordered a spinach pasta w/ shrimp (very large) and scallops, in a lemon cream sauce (which I requested instead of a basil tomato).  My husband got the linguine w/ clams in a white whine sauce, along w/ some bruschetta.  MUST TRY!  There are multiple locations, this one just happens to be in the neighborhood!  Give it a try!

Ordered 45 mins ago and still no food. Word is they are backed up due to 1/2 pizza night shift. By the time we eat, we'll be as old many of the people here   They probably came here in their 50s. 
Don't expect to get in and out here.
I hope I can figure out how to share my photo b/c my $30 pizza was burnt.

Unfortunately I had a bad experience that turned worse dealing with the owner.  I took a bite of their pizza and there were bone fragments in the sausage. 
I split my tooth in half all the way to the root.  Major pain and surgery. .

The owners gave me their insurance company...   after I spent thousands on bills..  they said we don't want to do anything for you , go ahead and sue our food manufacturer. 
* they still use them today. 

I called the owner and besides being very rude... horrible customer service,  she said I don't care , go ahead a sue us....   nice lady...

The others who ate pizza that day said it was ok.

The buffalo wings were not good either.


Be very careful eating there.. for your safety and for taste.  

Hope you have no issues to deal with owner.

From the places I've tried since moving to the area, this place stands out as the best. Ordered the Baked Mostaccioli and it was fantastic. Tried the Cheese Ravioli in Pesto sauce and it was also very good. Service wasn't bad but not outstanding either. Plenty of pre-dinner bread. Prices were about what I'd expect from a slightly nicer Italian restaurant.

Should have just stayed home.
I went there with my husband and two kids on a Saturday night as a way of doing something fun as a family. This restaurant was overall very well rated and recommended. We arrived at 7:30pm and were promptly seated by a friendly member of the staff. The interior decor was simple and not too fancy and there weren't very many people as I hadn't expected but whatever; Here is where the waiter entered the picture. His name is Tony. He's a dark-hair, average to tall in height and clearly overweight. It took him nearly half an hour to take our order. Our order consisted of one item from the specials, one item from the "chef's favorites" category and a butter salmon with the house salad and a simple moscato. Tony didn't like what we were ordering. He wanted us to order a different salmon. The salmon Tony wanted us to order has tarragon an a type of cream sauce. My husband doesn't like tarragon. After going on and on about how we REALLY SHOULD order the tarragon salmon and receiving no response from any of us he started with the next question asking how we would like to receive our food and I responded "as they come out". Tony's response was "all at the same time? ok." Then he started to walk away at which point he stopped to turn around and confirm that we were getting the tarragon salmon at which point I responded with a simple "no, just the butter salmon with the salad". His response is "oh, I already wrote down tarragon" as he spoke to me in a demeaning tone as if he was a parent who was very annoyed at a child.... and that look of disapproval :( I felt guilty and uncomfortable at that point but I didn't have the heart have my family walk out of the restaurant and start all over with finding a new restaurant and traveling there with the possibility to not like something again. So there I sat, and no one talked until Tony our waiter came back and asked what do you want the salmon with? To my shock and with utter disbelief in my eyes, I told him the salad. The look he gave me was of a total diva looking down on an outsider. Wow. This guy clearly didn't like me and when he asked with which sauce my husband chimed in and politely said with a smile that any will do and that we would definitely try the tarragon salmon the next time we come. 
SO, there we all sat in uncomfortable silence for nearly an hour before our food arrived and ALTOGETHER....so not the "as they come off the stove" type. So, we didn't end up sharing as much as we had planned to do so, no one was in the mood. Long story short, The food was great but the service spoke volumes as to why we were only one of 4 table here on a Saturday night with only our friend Tony to "wait" on everyone. Some tables seemed to get constant attention but the only attention we got was the water and plate guy. When our food did get here Tony took my clean silverware away seemingly on purpose to which I finally changed my tone and said, "so what, I don't get a fork now either?" He looked at me a bit confused and after a pause said that he would get another one. Over lunch the following day my husband expressed how he feels and thoroughly believes that we were discriminated against and to his credit we are not white. He also made it clear that unfortunately we won't be going back, irregardless of the food :( Thanks Tony.

We just ate Rocco Vinos for the first time. It was a PERFECT experience.  From the first hearty welcome to three people saying good bye at the end.  Our server was great.  She has obviously eaten there and loved it which is not the case at most places. The minestrone soup was terrific.  My veal limone was tender and seasoned just right.  My husband's lasagna was perfect and the sauce for the sausages was OBVIOUSLY home made.  

This place is a real keeper. The ambiance was not stale - we watched all the servers and they have obviously been schooled in their craft from napkin placement to how to make guests feel at home.  

This is more than just a pizza place.  The pizza is very good and they make it very available

But! 

There are very few places in our area that I would be so verbose about.  I hope they  don't lose that edge that makes guests feel so welcomed and offering fresh and home made food.  I hope after this I will be able to get a seat!!! 

Did I mention the tiramisu?

We stayed at the Westin, thought about Shula's, but I have a problem when you have to order sides. Service, aaaaaa, but here, 8oz filet with sides ( plural) was half as much money and twice the phenomenal service! Half price bots of wine and great service! Will be back!
Good food excellent service. Pizza is awesome but pasta selections are very tasty! Prices are reasonable and delivery was quick.

Friendly, nice atmosphere, good food. We had farfalle salsiccia and traditional spaghetti and meatballs, both were very good. Nice flavor, portions are large enough to split. Looking forward to coming back.

Came in for dinner and it was so delicious!!! Their bruschetta is bomb, the vodka sauce pasta is amazing and our waiter was great. Enjoyed the food so much I had them cater my next event. I highly recommend them.

Fabulous!  Can't wait to go back tonight. Had the Farfalle pasta with Rapini & Italian sausage. Delicious!  My friend had the risotto with chicken - perfectly prepared and equally delicious.  Give this place a chance. Well worth it. Welcoming decor and great service.   This ranks up there with the finer Italian dining restaurants with reasonable pricing.  
Really really good!
I ordered a panzoratti for delivery. I live  a block away and it took an hour and a half. The food was cold. This was the second time I was disappointed in the food. I will never eat here again.

Went here for Mother's Day, nice sized seating for approx 50-80 people...good food, fresh and seasoned well, nice small spot close to the house, kind management who handled some finicky guests at times! Recommend giving it a try!
Saw it driving by and decided to stop. Glad I did. Service was great and food was better. And as a bonus it was very reasonable. I'll be back

We've been ordering from RV for years, but today we stopped in for lunch at their new location.  The restaurant is decorated nicely and was very clean inside.  There's also a full service bar and 3 slot machines in the bar area.  As always, the food was good and reasonably priced.  The service was pretty good, but our waitress was wearing way too much perfume!!  It was also very unpleasant smelling and in a restaurant environment while you are eating food, that can be off-putting.  Their pizza's and pastas are delicious!  They also have a large selection of pasta sauces to choose from.  Otherwise, a pleasant experience and I would recommend this place for take-out or dining in.

Excellent pizza! If you like Barnaby's pizza you'll love the thin crust here too. They start the meal with a loaf of fresh warm delicious crispy crust bread and butter but there is also a bottle of olive oil on the table for dipping. Margaritas are pretty good too and offer both silver and gold cuervo tequila. Haven't had dessert yet but will add update if good.
Ordered a medium sausage, bacon, mushroom pizza that was delivered fast and extremely tasty.  Pizza was hot and dessert was great as well.

Very disappointed. 

The service was poor at best.

The food was terrible.

My wife's gnocchi was not as described by the menu or the waitress..

Our son's pasta was so bad he just left it and ate the bread.

I ordered the chicken parm which appeared to be a frozen chicken patty microwaved with watery noodles and bottled sauce poured over the mess.  

We couldn't get our waitresses attention for love nor money to let her know we weren't pleased with our food. After about thirty five minutes the waitress wander by so we could ask for the check. Seems she knew the food wasn't any good and didn't want to deal with it. The manager also worked the room but never once came by our table.

As we were walking out we saw the manager who actually went out of his way to avoid us. As we were walking towards the exit he turned away from us to make small talk with a couple waiting for their table, 

Needless to say $65 later we learned our lesson and will not return

I am thrilled that this place moved just a hop and skip away from my new digs. Service was great, portions were plentiful (and the leftovers reheated so well) and the atmosphere was nice. Honestly, my only complaint that it was a little chilly but that was most likely from the door constantly opening for new customers. Dinner for two with drinks was more than reasonable, under $70. Can't wait to go back.

Ok, I love their meatball sandwich, but they always and I mean always screw up the delivery order. They forget the Pop and charge you anyways, every time. And there's been a few occasions where the mess up the sandwich, ie leaving off the cheese or giardineria that I order. Good food, just wish they would step up their service.

Don't have any issue with the food. It was typically good Jimmy John's food. My comment refers to the staff. My team was performing detailed audits of operational activities in multiple cities around the state.  We're not paid by the hour so we're focused on the tasks at hand...  I've come to laugh at the clearly uneasy facial expressions I receive when visiting towns around the great state of Illinois and this visit was no exception.

"No, I'm not going to harm you. No, I'm not going to rape you. No, I'm not going to beat you" - Funny Vibe, Living Colours. 'nuff said....
Ordered and ate the tuna sub on May 22nd 2016 at 10:00am later felt sick puked up the sandwich later.

Freaky Slow!! Placed an order online for delivery. After an hour, I called and was told all sandwiches were on the road - it will be there shortly. After another half an hour, called again and was told they will re- make the order and send again. I asked for some compensation for my bad experience - the manager said he couldn't do anything but the other manager would call me. Sandwiches delivered 2 HOURS after order placed - dinner instead of lunch. Manager never called. Guess they don't want or need my business

The food was ok, but kinda low on the topings. The staff is horrible. I walk in and about 5 people are standing at the counter bullshitting around. They also dont wear hair nets or hats so it was kinda gross to see them around the open containers of fresh veggies on their counter. Not going there again ill go across the street to subway.

This Jimmy Johns deserves its low rating.  The sandwiches are always short on ingredients and slopped together like someone is in a very big hurry.  Even worse, the vegetables are never ripe and of questionable quality;  tomatoes should not be crunchy and lettuce is supposed to be green, not white.  Finally, accessing the store is really inconvenient.

I live just under a mile from the store, and ordered a sandwich for delivery (work from home), and had to wait an hour and a half for the driver to arrive with a soggy sandwich. Called and spoke with the General Manager who was completely unapologetic and refused to compensate with a coupon for next visit, or comping my meal, instead saying "all I can do is send a different driver out with another sandwich", and "we no longer advertise our service as being Freaky Fast". Needless to say, I will not be ordering from this restaurant again, nor will I recommend that anyone else order from this location.

This is the WORST Jimmy Johns I have ever been to. As a former Jimmy Johns employee myself, I know what I'm talking about. I live less than a mile away and they refuse to deliver. However, I offered a $10 tip once and they delivered. (total bs) The manager (sandi?) totally sucks too. She's really rude. I'll NEVER return to this particular location. Its worth the 5 minute drive up Randall to the other Jimmy Johns near LA Fitness. They're wonderful over there. Maybe Sandi (sp?) should re-do her training over there in regard to customer service.

I ordered an unwich veggie sandwich, I was at school and had it delivered. The service was great and fast, but when I unwrapped the sandwich there was a alive bug wrapped up in my sandwich... Disgusting! I usually love jimmy johns but this really made me want to take a break.

I was kind of leery using this location with the bad reviews but I have to say I had great customer service over the phone - very patient, placed three separate orders by cc. Added on another order a few min later and SUPER fast delivery! The store is under 2 miles and we got over food under 15 min of ordering!

I love Jimmy John's but will not visit this location again.  The first visit a month ago was "eh". The quality of sandwiches we received was not the best. Thought it was an off day for them so my husband tried again last week. He went by the drive thru and when he got back to work he opened his sandwich to find only meat... nothing else on the sandwich! I'm not sure what he paid $8 for. I called the store to speak with someone about it and get him an actual sandwich and was told the manager would call me back which of course never happened. They easily could have said sorry, come by and pick up a new sandwich. 1 star for quality and service.

What an amazing experience! We had the most wonderful anniversary dinner here. From the start our server was very knowledgeable and provided thoughtful recommendations. We had the grilled peach appetizer, ricotta gnudi, flat iron steak and peach hand pies - yum! To top it off Chef Juliette visited our table and the staff surprised us with a bouquet of flowers. We were floored! Cannot wait to go back & bring more friends! 

Run don't walk there!!

We happily stumbled upon this restaurant when looking for somewhere to eat in St. Charles while at the Q center. Luckily they were able to seat us without a problem (party of 7 can sometimes be tough) however I would recommend making a reservation at this restaurant. They have a range of items to chose on their menu.. I had a tough time deciding what to order as everything sounded appetizing. I started with a wedge salad, which had an interesting dressing on it. For dinner, I ended up ordering the perogies which I'm so happy I did because they were amazing!! They were cooked perfectly and the sauce that came with them was delicious. One of my friends ordered the lamb shank and it looked amazing - I'd prob recommend this just based on seeing it (he did say it was really good too). 

Overall, if I were back in St. Charles again I would definitely go here. Our waitress was really sweet and she put up with the poor jokes that my friends made with her which makes her like a saint! We had a great dinner and no complaints!

This restaurant recently opened up in St. Charles, and i'm glad that it did. Highly recommend it, the majority of the meal was absolutely fantastic.

The charcuterie board consisted of Point Reyes blue cheese, Hand dipped ricotta with local honey, Anabasque, House made Pork &Truffle terrine, Italian proscuitto di parma aged 600 days, and Mild Spanish chorizo. It's served with cinnamon raisin and sourdough toast points, pear puree, housemade stone ground mustard, and dill pickles. I'm a huge fan of adult lunchables ( Oh yeah, you know that's what that is :D), and these were amazing. The combinations were fantastic, and individually they were great on their own. My personal favorites were the blue cheese and the pork and truffle terrine. I would go back just for the charcuterie. 

The sumac lamb chop starter comes with sumac spice, quinoa cake, mint and orange gremolata, cipollini onions, and a cucumber creme. Both of us loved it, all of the elements really went well together and the lamb chops were perfectly cooked.

The wedge salad was ok, but the salad dressing is so strong it overpowers everything else. It's really spicy and peppery, you don't really get any blue cheese from it. We asked the waitress about it and she said that they add their house made mustard to it. If you dig spicy then go for it, but I would recommend not adding pepper to it, i'm glad we skipped out on that. We dig spicy so we were fine, but there's no mention on the menu of it being spicy, so if you're sensitive to spicy and peppery go with another salad, or maybe ask for the dressing on the side or sub with a different dressing?

For dinner I had the grilled Ahi Tuna. It comes with israeli couscous with scallions and basil, and roasted farm tomato eggplant. First off, that israeli couscous was awesome. I would divorce my husband and marry that couscous. Freaking loved it. The tuna was ok, but the couscous and eggplant were my favorite parts, they were so good.

The man had the flat iron steak, it comes with chimichurri, calabrese potatoes, watercress, pickled onion, and parmesan fondue. The steak was perfectly cooked, and he loved it. 

Dessert we went with churros, they come with chocolate ganache and strawberry creme. The churros were perfectly cooked, they were so good. 

Now onto BOOZE!!!
We did not have any of the wine, so I cannot attest to their wine selection. They have beer on tap from local breweries, including the session sour from Penrose brewery which I absolutely love. It can be hard to find a sour at restaurants sometimes. 

The man had a whiskey sour, which he was a fan of, even though the egg white threw him off at first. I had a perfectly made dirty martini with blue cheese olives. Is there anything better than vodka and blue cheese olives? Yes, the israeli couscous from here. That's it, there's nothing else. I also had the cucumber cocktail. It's presented with basil and mint leaves, and looks really pretty. I highly recommend ripping those leaves up and muddling them in the drink, it really helps bring out those flavors. Really refreshing drink for a hot summer night. 

TL;DR Overall we absolutely loved this place and plan on going back. The salad dressing for the wedge salad was really peppery, and the tuna was just ok, but everything else was awesome.

Best meal I've had in a long time!!! Great food, wonderful presentation, friendly staff
Reasonably priced! Loved it!!!!!!

So impressed with this place. We went during happy hour on Saturday & then again for Father's Day brunch. 

Pork confit was ridiculous, hollandaise wasn't heavy & the house-made muffin was to die for. Everyone agreed this was the best out of everything we ordered (which is saying a lot b/c everything was really good)

We've been back several times since & they're consistently fantastic. (Try the happy hour burger: grass-fed w/pineapple, cabbage slaw & garlic aioli or the cucumber/vodka/mint cocktail. Both amazing)

A well deserved 5 stars. Brunched here today & the experience was perfect. Celebrating husbands birthday weekend & after a series of blunders elsewhere yesterday, this place saved it all. Everything was on point: from the friendly service, to the decor, to the chill Sunday brunch background soundtrack & delish Bloody Mary's... And the food was stellar. Birthday boy said it was the best brunch he's ever had!
We can't wait to come back for dinner.

What can I say, only this place is world class. The bar is amazing and the food is excellent. I had the special craft beer and loved it. Also had the steak which was juicy and cooked to perfection. Everything here is farm to table. Great service, great atmosphere in a wonderful setting.

I ate there Friday night. The pheasant was amazing as was the flat iron steak. Both cooked to perfection. Service was outstanding. Loved it so much went back again Sunday. Very reasonably priced too. Highly recommended.
Amazing food, service and atmosphere! I had the pheasant which was absolutely perfect. The food was all things I hadn't tasted before but far from pretentious.

Outstanding farm to table cuisine in St. Charles, start to finish.  Their charcuterie boards are worth the trip alone.  Excellent wine list.  But the house made desserts steal the show.  Not to be missed.

I was here with my 3 of colleagues for dinner and had a plesant experience. I would have given 5stars but we waited 40mins for the main course to show up.

I had Fried artichokes boy they were delecious, thanks to previous yelpers for recommending these.

Another occasion i tried lamb chops which came out reall good.

Best dining experience in awhile!  We were a large group of 10 and it can be difficult to manage service or food quality but not here. We were actually able to make a last minute reservation on a Saturday night and behold, we were seated immediately upon arrival, very impressive! Our waiter was awesome, attentive and relaxed which made the night so enjoyable. Now the food!  Outstanding!  The combination of flavors and ingredients were perfect and so was the presentation. Kudos to the Chef. Every single thing we ordered was amazing. I can't even say which was my favorite because everything was that good. But here's a few must order:  lamb chops, Brussel sprouts, beet salad, country pheasant and panacotta. Need to keep coming back until I've tried everything on menu.

Happy Hour review here...we showed up at 3:30, they let us in, but FYI, the new hours are 4:00-5:00. We ordered the one app one special: fried artichoke hearts. They were delicious, they was huge and not overly fried. There is a spicy aioli and and sweet chutney, delish. 
Also, a few wines and all the tap beers are half off for happy hour. So, I ordered a Margarita. The Yelp reviews were too good to pass up, and the drink delivered. It was AWESOME. The foam on top is so tasty, it may be egg white something, but don't be discouraged, just try it. For $10, one was enough, but I wish I could have afforded three. I also got a beer, good too, but the margarita is a must. 
My trip made me want to go back. The service was perfect; they put out a disc for your fork and knife to rest on, so sanitary. I really enjoyed myself and will be back.

Our first time here and I can't give them five stars. The interior is very nice the wait staff did a great job. The food was acceptable not great but their selection of alcohol is not what you would expect, very poor. They are trying to be an upscale restaurant in a bad location. Parking is hard to get to and the gas station next door does not help. I wish them well but I doubt if we will be back.

Celebrated a special occasion recently that included dinner at the 
Finery. I must say, it was not up to the 4.5 stars reviewers gave it.  Here's a recap:

Pros:  good wine and beer selections.  Interesting menu with many items I  really like.  

Cons:  lamb shank had great flavor but wasn't falling off the bone as advertised.  Sides were not working well with this dish.  Spaetzle was overshadowed by squash and other ingredients - too busy.  My wife had salmon.  Undercooked to the point that it was mush in the middle.  Major turn off.  Service was off too.  Slow, and this was a week night where the restaurant was not busy at all.  

Overall, tried it but nothing special, which is what we wanted.  The floor plan is somewhat odd too, bar is separated from dining room.  Seems closed in, prefer an open, airy atmosphere.

I'd been wanting to try Finery next time I was out this way and it was terrific. It was a cool day so the beef barley soup was a great start. My wife got the grilled Caesar salad with a poached egg and lucky for me she shared it because it was outstanding. 
For entrees I had the pheasant, which you rarely see on menus. It is a signature dish and it was wonderful. In my youth I hunted with my Dad and pheasant was always our favorite. The breast was on a bed of risotto and truffles. The dark meat was like a duck confit but in a pastry pillow. Wow. My wife had the poached salmon which was ok. 
We finished with a banana bread pudding. 
It's well worth the stop if you're in the St. Charles area.

Great meal. You really have to watch carefully or you'll drive by it on Main like we did. Just park behind the Shell station and you're there. A great eclectic menu with specials written on the tile wall. We started with fried artichokes and a grilled Caesar salad, both marvelously delicious. In fact we all agreed that the Caesar was the best we've ever had. The wine special was a pleasant Barbera. 

There were lots of other specials but we stuck with the menu, beef cheek and flat iron steak. The beef cheek was fork tender and very tasty. It had a dark sauce with sp_tzle, turnips and parsnips (not my favorite veggies) but you couldn't tell that by my plate. My wife's flat iron was also tasty and rich. Our friends had flat iron and pheasant.  We finished with pound cake, white chocolate, raspberry martini and pana cotta. 

This is a new favorite for us. It's about a forty minute drive but well worth it. I marveled that we found this in St.  Charles and not downtown Chicago. Oh and don't miss Mario, the effervescent and jovial roving host.

It lives up to the hype. Our food (flat iron steak and sweet potato dumplings) were SO GOOD. I take all caps lightly. Delicious. Our cocktails were out of this world good, we could have tried them all (but had to save something for our next visit!). Jenna our waitress was attentive and didn't rush us at all, actually any staff we encountered during our visit was amazing. so glad to have a place like this close to home, cannot wait to go back! 


UPDATE Went back for our anniversary. Hands down best meal we have ever had. Hubs said flat iron steak was to die for and my ricotta gnudi was insane. Thank you so much for a wonderful dinner!!
Culinary paradise! Lovely small town atmosphere! Staff is sooo knowledgeable and very hospitable!
an incredible experience. we felt catered too and the food was beyond our expectations.

I have been here with my wife now 4 or 5 times and would like to say this is the best Chicagoland restaurant that we have been at! We decided to come about a month after opening last year and the food was absolutely amazing. With the servicers being wonderful and knowledgeable of the food, and the food being to die for, we decided to have our rehearsal dinner for our wedding here. 

David, the owner, worked with us on giving food recommendations, putting a menu together, and also was just someone who genuinely cared about the experience we were having. It was nice to see an owner of a restaurant doing whatever they could to make their customers experience the best it could be, and David did that for sure!  

We had nearly 75 people and rented out the restaurant area for our rehearsal. They brought in a very well designed curtain to separate the bar area from the dining area which looked really nice and gave us the privacy which is nice to have with a private event. I know I previously mentioned this, but the servers that you get at this place are truly amazing. They educate you on the food you are eating and know the food that is being served. If that isn't good enough, they also see when a glass is getting empty and bring over another glass of wine!

The food we had for our event was the country pheasant, flat iron steak, and the salmon. All three are fantastic options and I would recommend any of the three. The cheese and Charcuterie plate as an appetizer as well is a must every time we come here moving forward. We have now tried almost every appetizer and a majority of the main courses and have yet to have a meal we both haven't loved!

I can't say enough about this place and the experiences we have had here over the past year. If you are looking for a place to go have a nice date night, or just a great meal, this is without a doubt the place for you!

Thank you David and the Finery for everything and we will see you soon!!!!

BAR: Tiny. Don't expect to get a seat, especially not on a Friday night. We made a reservation and still had to wait 30 minutes which was annoying but understandable since there is limited seating.

FOOD: What everyone else said--GET THE PHEASANT! I've never tried it before but this place prepared it to be super tender and juicy. I ended up ordering the Flat Iron Steak which was also incredible with their chimichurri sauce. Another guest in our group ordered the Beef Cheek and was not entirely impressed. I love the Calabrese Potatoes but others in the group thought they tasted like dirt. We also ordered sides of the Romanesco (cross between broccoli & cauliflower) and Brussel Sprouts--both were a bit crunchy for my taste but flavorful.

VALUE: The beets were a joke for $9. There were maybe 4 slices and although they tasted great, it was hard to comprehend that we just paid more than $2 per tiny slice. I find it funny that they charge for bread especially at such a nice place where you know the avg bill for 2 is going to be around $60-75. The entrees were fairly priced because they were so delicious!

Overall, chic atmosphere (although I wish the crowd was a bit more mixed), drinks are creative, apps and sides were okay, entrees were awesome, bathrooms are clean. Would come back!

I've been to The Finery twice now- so I feel prepared to write a review. The Finery is definitely a new location, so they are working out a few kinks- but how they handled all minor issues is the reason I am still going with 5 stars. I have no doubt that they will be fully 5 stars with no issues in the future. Let's start with the great- the food. Everything I've tasted here has been excellent. The last time I went I was with a group of 9 people- and we all got different entrees (impressive I know)- and everyone loved their dishes. Several of us had leftovers, but not all. My husband enjoyed his pheasant, I loved my potato pancakes, and I loved the beef stroganoff when I ate their before. Everyone that had a meat free dish was raving about their food- so this might be a great spot for vegetarians!

Here are our minor issues and how they were handled:
One tap of beer not working on our first visit- free beer for the person who ordered it.
Reservation changed from 7-9 but they did not get the updated reservation. We had to wait a bit for the table- but they happily moved us and the owner came over to specifically chat with us.

Our service was excellent on both occasions- and I love the atmosphere and how everyone wants to go here right now! Special touch- we were out to celebrate my Mom's birthday the last time we went to The Finery and they brought her a beautiful bouquet of flowers.

I would definitely check this place out- and make a reservation in advance!

This restaurant has some amazing hits and misses.

First the restaurant itself is very comfortable, cozy and a great addition to the tri city area. Second the service was top notch and you can really tell they care about the restaurant and the food. Third the drinks wonderful and they have a decent wine list.

Now getting to the food itself, some of the meals are outstanding and some are just lacking something. Our party loved the pheasant, the bread and the deserts. Unfortunate we had some huge let downs with the beef tenderloin and the beef stroganoff. Our dinning partners agreed that the stroganoff was off this evening. The dish tasted bland and was very unappealing. After reading such rave reviews about this dish and our dinning partners insisting it was usually better than this, the beef stroganoff was a huge let down. Our waitress brought out a replacement meal without a problem and without really asking which meal we would like as a replacement. While this was nice we were then charged with the replacement that we didn't even choose. From such a fine establishment we would have never expected to be charged for a very expensive replacement meal that we didn't order. 

We ended the meal with the apple torte, which was amazing!!! This place should seriously look at selling their deserts at a bakery outpost because they are amazing.

Overall the pheasant and the deserts are amazing, and some other dishes seem to be hit or miss. With that said this is probably one of the best spots for a nicer night out in Saint Charles and we would recommend it.
We had a very delicious dinner in early July, 2016. Great wait staff, great atmosphere.  We will be back.

Wait staff was fantastic. Noise level however made it difficult to have conversation. Very high ceilings with nice decor. My husband had the Pheasant which he loved. Very tender and done just right. I had the cod. I forgot to order my side of potatoes and because we were on a tight timeframe I just skipped it. 
The brownie dessert was very good as were the chirros. We could have just ordered one dessert and split it. The coffee was just ordinary and we both commented it tasted like "wedding" coffee or something out of a big party 30 cup coffee pot. We expected a deeper taste rather than watered down. 
We will be back for the fall menu as we enjoyed but learned some lessons for next time. 
Give it a try. Eclectic and nice ambiance all in all.
Oh and Definitely try the bread with compound butter. Absolutely amazing.

Nothing short of amazing.  From walking in, having huge expectations from previous reviews, the Finery met them... 

Our waitress Audra was super excited to be there, and loved her job.  She was passionate about the restaurant and boasted not only of the food, but of the chefs and the family feel with her colleagues.  That in itself is fabulous to hear. 

The drink.  The drink.  One more time, THE DRINK... I took her recommendation and went with the jalapeo infused vodka, cilantro, ginger syrup martini.  Twice.  And the second one was twice as nice.  It was a drink different than any other I have had.  Flavorful and spicy.  

Our food, presentation, quality and flavors were awesome.  She said seasonally the menu will change which is nice to hear.  

Dessert. ... the best I ever had.  The apple tart thingy.....  to die for, I may stop in to just have that...not kidding.   

St Chas got a goody with this one!  Oh, and.... yes, the chef walked around to make sure expectations were met.  Ummm.... yea, I guess so.. ;)

Not much to look at on the outside, but the inside is absolutely gorgeous! The food was excellent, the staff was friendly and attentive, and the drink list was quite impressive. I would recommend this place to anyone, but keep in mind you'll pay $50-$70 for 2 people plus tip. Perfect place for a date night and you can make reservations quickly and easily with Open Table.
By far, the best restaurant in the area! Whenever I want to impress someone with an amazing food and service experience, I bring them here.

Five stars, no doubt.

Have gone two times now, and both visits were perfection.

Appetizers: 
Have had the charcuterie plate, peach & burrata salad, artisan bread and house-made butter, fried artichoke appetizers. All were fantastic and on point.  

Was surprised at how light the fried artichokes were, you could actually taste the artichoke. Loved the peach & burrata dish, have tried making it at home and it's no where near as good as from here.  Charcuterie is just straight up delish.  House made butters were very interesting and fun to try.

Main: 
Have had the trout and bouillabaisse.  Both were amazing, but the bouillabaisse stole the show.  The best I've ever had by far, get this dish!!  My family had pheasant (if you're a meat eater, try this for sure!  The truffle really compliments the dish, my husband let me have a couple tastes.  As well as the beef stroganoff (heard great things)).

Drinks:
Their beer list is good, tried their "The Spark" cocktail, very refreshing.

In Summation:
The chefs are clearly incredibly knowledgable and most importantly they're clearly very passionate.  I appreciate this, keep up the good work! Both times I went it was hopping which was fun to see.

No complaints with service. Very professional.

The GM stopped by to see how we were doing which was a nice touch.  I'm personally not offended that the chefs/owners did not stop by as I know how busy they were (Fri/Sat nights), and I feel that that's the managers job (unless maybe you're an uber regular and request to say "Hi" to the Chefs).

We will be back!

Great atmosphere.  Good to have a new place in town.  I hope it succeeds, but the chef must start to taste his food before it leaves the kitchen.  

Fried Artichoke Hearts - little to taste other than the crust - zero spices.  

Wedge Salad - good portion; blue cheese dressing would be a better choice for the wedge, not Kraft ranch dressing; added egg is a great choice. 

Bread - decent variety for 2 bucks.  

Salmon - this is where help is needed; the dill sauce added very little to the taste; the salmon was not fresh; not spiced and not cooked to perfection; should flake; garnishes were not correct choices.  

Flat Iron Steak - very good; someone knows how to prepare steak; garnish good, but potatoes so bland.  

Maybe would return - Shakou is better.  Good drink choices, but don't charge me extra for cubes on a rocks pour.  Servers need to learn the difference between bourbon and whiskey.  

These guys deserve to make it. Love the space and their attitude.  Training is needed. Music might be nice.

Excellent food and staff! Went here for my birthday. Greeted at the door and wished a happy birthday and then my husband was thanked for making a reservation. Server was extremely attentive but not over kill. The owner? (or manager) came by and checked on us and all tables at least 3 times throughout the meal. Again not over kill but just enough attention to make you feel like they were happy you were there and that they wanted to make sure you were happy too. 

Started with the Pheasant Pate that was excellent. I had the American bouillabaisse with perfectly cooked shrimp, prawn, mussels, white fish and scallops. My husband had the pheasant, which they are known for. After just one taste, without any black truffles, it was clear why! Both dishes were excellent, well prepared and served.

Dessert was the special banana bread pudding and almond pound cake. Both again were great and my dessert was on the house which was a pleasant surprise!

We loved this place so much my husband has asked to go back for his birthday in May and we most definitely will and we'll be asking for "our table" when we do

My husband and I were out in the St Charles area for the flea market and were looking for a place for a late lunch/early dinner. Thanks to using my Yelp app, I found this gem of a place. The Finery is a fairly new place in St Charles opening last July.  The restaurant has a small bar area with a few tables immediately when you walk in. The dining area isn't a large space, maybe 20-25 tables, and aesthetically pleasing with dark brown wood floors and tables, black chairs, exposed brick walls and high ceilings. The staff is extremely nice, especially our server Morgan. She was very knowledgeable about the menu, made great suggestions and was pleasant and friendly. Morgan provided great service. The gentleman who seated us and is the person who would work with you to pair wines with the food was very sweet as well.  My husband and I started with the charcuterie board consisting of blue cheese, ricotta and honey, goat cheddar, lamb terrine, prosciutto and goose salumi served with grilled sourdough and cinnamon toast, homemade plum jam, grainy mustard and pickles. It was fabulous!  We also ordered the bread with two butters, which consisted of four small rolls in different varieties with a caramel apple butter and a spicy mango butter. My husband ordered the cod for dinner, which was cooked to perfection with a crispy sear, moist and flaky and served on top of cauliflower pure. I had a half dozen oysters, which were very fresh served with salmon roe and cucumber ice, along with the grilled Caesar salad. The salad consisted of two halves of romaine hearts with homemade croutons, Parmesan, olive oil, anchovy and a poached egg. It was to me a deconstructed upscale Caesar salad. The husband and wife chefs are amazing and their food creations not only beautiful to look at, but full of flavor.  We ended our meal with the churros with strawberry and chocolate ganache dipping sauces. I enjoyed this neighborhood gem and will definitely be back to explore more of the menu. Great place!

Wow I'm impressed!!! This restaurant is really a gem in the St.Charles area. The space is beautifully designed with a gorgeous bar area and separate dining area. 

I choose to sit at the bar as I was dining alone and felt very welcomed immediately. The bar tender did an amazing job of tending to diners at the bar, the local regulars, and the dining room drink orders. After receiving an excellent wine recommendation, I ordered the bar "A Fine Burger" and I am very impressed by the quality in my dish. 

When I paid the bill, I was thanked by name which was impressive and gave this restaurant just a little extra in terms of personalized service. Very nicely done!!!!
Outstanding service, friendly staff and outstanding food, a favorite of mine is the salmon. Noticed Owners very hands on and  engaging. I Highly recommend.

Sunday Brunch on a snowy Valentine's Day was a hit!

This place is for you if you appreciate personal service, wonderfully crafted food and thoughtful service. Wonderful flavors all around! The portions are very appropriate, and that allows you to order a few different items and remain satisfied.

A gem in the suburbs and will be a staple for us to visit again. Highly recommended!

I wish I could have rated this a little higher. The food was good, but not outstanding. I had the special for the night ( a German chicken, sausage, & spaetzle mixture). It was good, but the chicken was a little tough. I did enjoy the spinach salad, although for $11 is was a bit small. However, the real problem was the length of time it took to receive or order. I think it must have gotten lost in the kitchen. People that came in long after us were served first. They did give us a free desert to make up for it, but I think they probably should have given us a free entree. Luckily, we weren't in a hurry to get anywhere. The other issue was I found the noise level high. They were playing some kind of a thumping base. Since we had to wait so long for our food, this constant thumping was getting very annoying. Also, it's right next to a gas station, and the headlights from the cars would occasionally shine in my eyes. The waitress was very nice. She apologized for the slow service, but probably the manager should have also done so.
Bartenders give great service. Only had cocktails, finely fashioned and cucumber fizz (wifey). No complaints. Nice atmosphere, more bar space would help. Very healthy wine selection.

David and Juliette Reyes have created a first class restaurant in St. Charles that is both unique and delicious! The food is creative. Absolutely the best charcuterie anywhere in the Chicago area. If you live in the Fox Valley there is no need for you to travel for great food. It is here, and The Finery is one of the best.

Had an excellent meal of salmon entree and cured salmon appetizer.  Staff is all friendly and attentive.  Passing thru on business I saw consistently high ratings and this gem did not disappoint -- even on a slow Wednesday evening.  Impressive wine list with some uncommon, high quality selections.  Overall a winner!
Great place, great experience.  Sat at the bar with my girlfriend, we had an amazing dinner, great drinks, great experience.  The staff are very friendly and attentive, the food - sublime.

Awesome!!! A beautiful place to spend quality time with family and friends. 

I am so surprised to find a place like this in the suburbs. The food and its presentation has an obvious heir of professional chefs. You can taste all of their expertise, atleast in the dishes I tried. I will definitely head out of the city again soon just to have another meal at this place.

I ordered the cheese plate which was a perfect way to get me started with some really delicious flavors. Plus, who doesn't love cheese... amiright?? :P I also shared a salad before my main dish with my friend. Extremely well prepped salad with plenty of flavors blended into a crisp and savory starter. We had the beet salad and wow... Even the salads are thought out in detail! You can really tell that whoever handles the salads knows what they're doing when it comes to fine dining. :------)

Anyway, I decided to go with the pheasant for my main dish and was truly impressed. I Haven't had an emotional experience with food for a very long time and THIS did it for me. What a perfectly cooked treat it was! Not too much but just enough of the dish before dessert!

The apple tart was on its way to end a perfect meal and man, was it DELISH. I've watched some fine dining food documentaries lately and this place really knows what they're doing. Trust me. 

Try it out. Definitely was worht it for me. Anyway.. goodnight yelp!
My wife had the fettuccine and I had the flat iron steak. Both were delicious. Great blend of subtle flavors. Service was friendly and prompt. We recommend it!

I brought my boyfriend here for his B-Day and I'm glad I did. The ambiance is great ,the waitress really knows her stuff and the food is amazing.  I had a steak and my boyfriend had the pheasant with risotto and we were very pleased. Everything was fresh and we'll prepared... We will go again and definitely recommend .

My wife and I were there last night for the first time.  The decor was nice and the wait staff was also nice.  The food was good but small portions and a little pricey.  The drinks were way over priced   I ordered my scotch on the rocks and then they add a $2.00 up charge for being on the rocks.  When I ask the waiters about it she said they added a little more scotch to the glass so there was an up charge.  Just figure it in the price in the price up front

My family and I have dined there three times in the last two months. Each time the meals were special for different reasons. The eclectic menu, the great service, the quality of food, the taste, the interaction you get with the owners and chefs all make this place very special. 

Any of their fish selections are great. The grilled Pear and cheese plate is incredible. My son ordered their steak and enjoyed it. I have been told their fancy take on a burger is a great choice as well. 

If you are looking for a nice meal in Downtown STC the Finery is one of the best! You can not go wrong.

Outstanding food and service. Highly recommend the Pheasant and any appetizer. The owner came out to chat and thank us for coming, which I absolutely love.
