If you are looking for a "city quality restaurant" but don't want to go all the way downtown, this is your place! Can't wait for their Geneva restaurant to open!

We made reservations for a Saturday night in early November. We had to wait about 20 minutes at the bar, where they didn't have enough servers, and the bartender ignored us. After 10-15 minutes one in our party finally made eye contact and  got a bartender to let us order a drink.

At least after that the service improved! Our waiter was very helpful and no problems there. 

We were asked if we wanted bread, we did, and were told there was a charge... The charge was very small I think $2.00. We got a plate of 4 different small rolls and on the side, what looked like a teaspoon or less of two different butters for 4 people. Geez..  It did have a nice presentation, but if your charging for bread and butter, at least provide enough butter for the rolls. 

There was 4 of us for dinner, and our meals ranged from fair to excellent. I had the beef stroganoff.. and I have to agree with Laura. H's review.. I love a good beef stroganoff, and this was this was not it.. it was very bland, I couldn't detect any sour cream in the sauce.. It was very fair. Another dining partner ordered the special for the night which was home made pierogi's. These were an expensive disappointment, It was like 28$ for 6-7 pierogi's. Now the guys chose better, one had the flat iron steak, which we did all try, it was cooked perfectly and excellent. My husband had the salmon which he thought was very good, but with it came brussel spouts that were burnt. 

Despite the expensive pierogis, the bill for the 4 of us with drinks was reasonable.  

There are so many options out there, but we might give this a 2nd try.

Went there on a whim with the wife.  I read the reviews before we went and I was thinking that something was fishy from all the 5 star reviews. 

Well I can tell you that they are true ratings.  My wife had the beef stroganoff which I tried a few bites and thought was excellent.  I had the seafood dish that I can not pronounce or spell.  It was a wonderful dish that had all of my favorite seafood, shrimp, scallops, fish, prawns, and mussels.  When we go back will order again.   

We had a dessert that was good as well.  

I thought the portions were perfect.  I like to eat and I went out satisfied.  Decorations are minimal but I am not there to stare at the walls, I am there to eat good food and for that they deliver.  

Side note my wife wanted a mojito and they do not serve them.  The waitress came back and said that they did have the ingredients to make one and would do so.  Bonus points from my wife.  

All in all good food.  My only negative was I can see how it could get quite loud from the acoustics of the building and that could turn some people off.

Great!!!!!! Service is excellent !!! Food is mind blowing!!! 
You will not find better tasting food ANY WHERE!!!

Excellent food and service. My wife and I visited for our one year anniversary. The service was prompt without being obtrusive, friendly without being overly familiar. And the food! My wife loved her gnocchi and I was in love with my pheasant. The risotto was creamy without losing the texture of the rice, and the flavors melded beautifully. I highly recommend The Finery.

This was a great find.  We had the marinated beets as an appetizer which was very good.  For out main course we had the flat iron steak which was amazing and the Opah fish special which was equally good!  Strawberry rhubarb crisp for desert was a perfect ending!  Sampled some beer which was fun to do!

Great customer service! Great cocktails! Great great GREAT food! Came here for brunch with my husband and daughter and was surprisingly impressed for a restaurant in the suburbs. I recently moved from my hometown NYC to Chicago, but staying in the suburbs with my husbands' family. This place made me feel like I was eating brunch in a fine NYC restaurant and not the crappy, greasy and just bad food that is prevalent in the suburbs. Can't wait to have a dinner date with my husband at this fine establishment! Try it, you will not be disappointment!
Awesome food. Great drinks. The staff is cool as the other side of the pillow. What more could you ask for???? A really great find in the burbs for a transplanted foodie from the city!

The cod, pheasant, and steak were perfect. Service was also very good. Located right on Main Street, so easy to find. If you want quiet dining, come early. Acoustic tiles were signs of ambient noise issues when crowded.

Our group stopped in tonight. Even though I believe it's their 4th day open, everything seemed to run smoothly. It did take a while to get out drinks(most likely still working out the kinks) but they were well worth it. I had a cucumber cocktail from their menu. It was amazing. No detail was forgotten, it even had what seemed to be a homemade cucumber ice cube in it. Our group had the following dishes, peach caprese salad, charcuterie platter, artesian bread, flat iron steak, pheasant, stroganoff, salmon and trout. For dessert, we had all of the desserts on the menu.. Chocolate fondant, panna cotta, cake, and beignets. Everyone was very happy with their dishes. The risotto that the pheasant rested on was super creamy and delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly and the chimichurri was the best I've had. The trout and salmon were too notch and cooked just right. The stroganoff was the best I've ever tasted. The flavors exploded in the sauce. Every bite was a joy. I was surprised to see romanesco on the plate with the salmon. What a great pairing! That's a vegetable that you don't usually see. The peach caprese was also something I had never seen before and it was delicious. Even the butter that came with the bread was custom. I believe it was infused with some sort of red pepper. I could of just eaten the butter by itself! I literally don't have anything negative to say. You should definitely give this place a try. I came all the way from Glenview, IL and I'll be back!
Braised beef cheek, incredibly good......practically melts in your mouth.   Also, the wine selection is huge but I went with the dirty martinis which don't disappoint.

I almost want to give four stars.... Almost. 
Restaurant is beautiful inside, hands down. Staff was quite attentive on a, probably slower Sunday morning. Quite friendly overall. 

My friends and I went for a nice brunch and heard it was fabulous. And some things were... It's a hit and miss thing. 

Her eggs Benedict, which I usually abhor, was amazing. The pork? Absolutely a wonderful addition and the egg was perfect. 
The beet and mozzarella app was good, some pepper helped. The sauce and candied nuts added that zing of flavor. It just needed something...a little...i don't know, something to kick the beet itself up to compete with the flavors on the plate. 
My French toast was... Ok. I should have known better, they only had a few "sweet" dishes on the menu. It just didn't live up to what I expected from this type of restaurant. And... Most disappointing...NOTHING came with it. Not even syrup. No bacon or sausage or nothing. And no syrup!

The most disappointing thing was the bottomless mimosas. 18$. Heck no. And that had to be the weakest champagne ever that they used in them. Truly the OJ gave all the zip... The cheap flavorless champagne just thinned it out. 

Lots of potential here. Needs a few tweaks.

Holy cow!!! The owners designed this place themselves - they nailed it. The food is super - and the wine list is broader than any other place around here, which is refreshing, especially if you appreciate more than just Californian. But, I could say the owners could do a better job establishing customer relationships. They were there when we ate, but never bothered saying hello or thank you. Seems small, but it goes a long way when you're new in town or are fighting competition down the road. 
It's a good place - salads seemed small for the price, but were delicious. Give it a go, it's a welcome addition to the sad STC bar scene.

This place is outstanding. The staff is great, the wine recommendation was perfect and the food was incredible. The whole experience was exactly what we were looking for on our anniversary. The timing of the service was interesting, the server let us enjoy our wine and gave us enough time to talk about the menu and make our choices. Then each course was served at just the right time. 

As our wine was being poured they brought a crab cake compliments of the kitchen. It was excellent and we knew we were in for a good night. 

We had the fried artichoke hearts to start and they were so good we could have made that our meal. 

I ordered the 8 oz tenderloin, cooked to a perfect medium, and it was one of the best I've had. The pure (parsnip I think) was very good too. My wife had the salmon, and I didn't even get to try it, but it looked delicious. I did have one of the potatoes that came with it though and it was awesome. 

The desert was good, but not great, which we were fine with because the rest of the meal was so good. We had the brownie and the pound cake. 

I cannot wait to return and try everything else on the menu.

We were excited about this place after hearing great things. After arriving at our reserved time we were seated promptly.it took quite awhile for the waiter to arrive and when he did he did not tell us anything about any specials and took our drink order as well as an appetizer order. He came by a whie later and apologized about how backed up the bar was. Our appetizer arrived and we asked a passing hostess if she could check out our drinks. She promptly delivered them as waiter again apologized for the bar. Hmmm...this waiter was obviously overwhelmed or very inexperienced . 30 minutes is too long to wait for mediocre drinks. We ate our appetizer and had to flag him down for the check just to get the heck out of there. Planned on a nice dinner but had to move on to Geneva for a great meal. Hope to try again. 
.

Excellent. Went there after we stopped by Francesca's and it was too packed to enjoy. Discovered the Finery 2 blocked away via Yelp, and made the 5 minute walk in 11 degree weather.  We got the last two seats at the small bar and immediately ordered a Sazerac and an Old Fashioned. Both very good. Bartender told us about the place and suggested we have dinner. Got a nice table in about 15 minutes. The chef immediately walked over and told us about a few things on the menu and made some wine suggestions. Very warm and friendly staff. The grilled Caesar salad was great. I ordered the flat iron steak and my wife got the bouillabaisse.  Both were wonderful. Very nice atmosphere and staff. We will be back.

This place just opened and I've already been there twice. And before I got the chance to go, people were already suggesting it. Food is flavorful and perfect proportions. The atmosphere is a romantic urban I need another whiskey feel:) Brought my picky chef friend along the second time around and she was pleased as well. SCORE 10 for this place.

Was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant, as its outside appearance was not a reflection of what was to come. The decor was casual but somewhat sophisticated in a sepia toned way with a hipster vibe. We were greeted by a charming host who explained there was a wine tasting dinner that had started , however we were welcome to sit in the dining room. We instead chose a high table in the bar where we had dinner and enjoyed the chill atmosphere. Our waiter was great, personable and welcoming. The menu was a little different in a refreshing way. Drinks spot on ...will be back and will bring some friends.

Really really love this place. Have been there three times now and it keeps getting better. My only complaint is the ambiance- when it's crowded the noise level is very high and when it's less crowded it could stand some ambient noise. Hopefully they can address that.   but the food! The food! The food is great. The drinks are too. I dream about the gin thingy.. Everything we've ordered has been perfectly prepared. Worth the splurge!

Food is Awesome, Wine is Yummy, wait staff is friendly and owner is very nice!!!

Great place - love going here!!

My husband took me here for my birthday, it was our first time. The restaurant itself is stunning. The hostess and server were extremely nice and helpful. The food is nothing short of incredible. We started with upscale cocktails that were very nice and reasonably priced. The roasted beet appetizer was to die for. I had the pheasant and my husband had the beef cheeks....I can't say which was better because they were both just incredible. Finished it off with the almond pound cake and our night couldn't have been any better. We will definitely be back to try more. Very highly recommend!!

Went there for breakfast - excellent food. There were 6 of us and we all very much enjoyed the food and atmosphere. However, the Bloody Mary's were so bad we sent them back twice and eventually switched to Mimosa. The mix they used was awful. Further, one of us drank iced tea and the waiter took the glass to get a refill and 10 minutes later had to ask to get it back. 
Despite the beverage issues the service was pretty good.  I'd recommend it for the food (Tortilla-egg Stack, Finery Breakfast, Sausage-polenta), which was ALL fresh and quite tasty.

Ok, went here last evening with the wife and I must say, it was AWESOME. They have a very unique cocktail list that will surely invite you in.   They come out with a nice palate cleanser before they begin.  We enjoyed the mushroom and goat cheese and the wedge salad, both tasted amazing, the salad had a wonderful dressing that ascended into your nasal pasages like a slight hint of horseradish, fresh bacon bits, and boiled egg wedges.  They also had a mushroom cream soup on special that was on point as well.  For dinner I had the pheasant on the truffle risotto, mind blowing stuff here.  The wife had the scallops and they had a nice sear on them.  The service was really good to. The cadence of the dinner was good.  We went really early without a reservation, it got busy fast.  Overall we would definitely recommend and will be back for more.

Fantastic service and amazing options. The beets with a switch from buffalo mozzarella to goat cheese is a fabulous choice with a unique twist of a celery pure.  The steak was a beautiful choice. Ambiance is a great craft cocktail feel.
Love the food, and love that the chef/owner takes the time to walk around and talk to each table and make recommendations.  The drinks are amazing.
This place is so bad I can not believe it. I  hope no one goes here it was a  waste of time.My Coke had chunks in it.a coke how do u mess up a coke.

This was our second visit and I'm happy to say that this place has hit its stride. On our first visit, the food was very good but the service needed definite work. 

Decided to give it another try and there were several noticeable changes, all for the better. We were warmly greeted at the host stand by a hostess and then the affable Mario took over and saw us to our table and repeatedly checked in with us throughout our meal. He was beyond friendly and made sure we were happy with everything. He is a great addition - he was seen chatting with each table and could also be seen consulting with and directing other staff and servers. 

Started with bread service with homemade butter - well worth the $2 charge - excellent variety and very tasty. Also shared a smoked acorn squash with goat cheese and arugula which was very unique and a great start.

We enjoyed an excellent whiskey sour and margarita from their imaginative cocktail list and will have to work our way through the rest of the list.

Next, our entrees arrived and were phenomenal - braised beef cheeks with spatzle. The beef was tender and deeply flavorful and the red wine and beef reduction was beyond good. The spatzle was the best I've ever had, as it was crispy but still toothsome. The mini pickled turnips were a wonderful citrus foil to the rich beef and sauce. The other entree was a special and consisted of a braised beef loin served atop velvety polenta - another home run.

Our server hit the right balance between being attentive and giving us time and space to enjoy our meal. Again, the service has undergone a transformation and turned this visit into a wonderful experience instead of just a good meal. The chef visited tables, including ours, several times to check on our experience and food. He is clearly passionate about pleasing people and is an extremely talented chef. As is his wife, who we did not meet but was apparently responsible for our sublime spatzle.

We shared a brownie for dessert, which was no ordinary brownie. It was topped with an orange cream and had pools of delicious raspberry sauce. The brownie had a crunchy base and was a very well-conceived dish. 

No peaks and valleys in the food or service - everything was spot-on. Fantastic visit and we were already plotting our next visit halfway through the meal! Best restaurant in the area, if not far beyond.

Went there for the first time last night. Our server was John. He was amazing! The service was better than I expected. The food is phenomenal! John was very attentive, new the menu very well and the wine list. Will definitely be going back many times!

Great cocktail list. Loved the Sazerac. Awesome scotch selection and wind selection. Great foodie place. Get the charcuterie. Salad to appetizer to entree was excellent. Audra my server was great. Highly recommended

I called tonight to see if there was availability for dinner. Mario answered the phone - and invited us to come in. As a quick note, Mario is fantastic. Incredible service and passion to make sure we had a great evening. It's hard to overstate the value that he provided to our dinner adventure. 

We were able to get a table immediately, as the restaurant was approximately half filled at the time. Interesting note, they had put together a table seating perhaps 14 people or more, so this place can handle good sized parties.

Anyways, we were seated a little ways from other guests which was nice as it allowed us to have a nice conversation. I feel that the restaurant handles sound well as when I stood up to leave I hadn't noticed it was completely full (on a Thursday night).

The waitress was great and on top of taking care of us. We had the cheese platter (delicious), I had a nice steak and my Dad who had joined me for dinner had the Salmon. The food was all very well done. The cheese and meat platter I highly recommend - you won't be disappointed in this. The steak and salmon were both perfectly cooked and had a nice bed of sauce that went along with each dish nicely.

I could go on about this place - but just go there and enjoy it instead. Mario was a fantastic host and it was a delight to get to chat with him a bit. If you have that opportunity, take it.

I'm taking my wife in a week or two when we get a date night. I'm excited for round 2!

Out standing food and service !!!! Out new go to location !!!
Drinks outstanding !!
Brussel Sprouts are unbelievable and the pheasant is to die for !!!!
Chef David is unbelievable and his dishes are fantastic !!!!!
Very nice quaint atmosphere .... All the drinks are amazing! And we love the variety of cuisine each week! It is a small place but very much worth the wait and or limited seating:) it's a must try!

Woohoo! St Charles has a place that can rival our neighboring cities fine list of restaurants! Great food, service, and drinks!

Pheasant, specials, salads, lamb chops, charcutterie, wine list, deserts- everything is damn good!

What a great find!  The charcuterie platter is an amazing taste sensation pairing various sweet & savory tastes with an outstanding bottle of recommended wine which would be enough but then - there are the specials!   We had trout off the menu (great) & beef bolognese from the special list I don't know that anyone could improve on that recipe. Even the pasta was hand made. 

And if you go, be sure to ask for Audra. She does a wonderful job!

The Finery has unbelievable food and we have eaten there, with large groups more than once. However I feel I must comment a recent experience. 
We dined on a weekday night and although the food was mostly up to its usual level, three of us ordered Cod and they were extremely salty,and the food came out unusually slow. Our waiter accidentally lost control of a glass of red wine which splashed all over my husband, me, into my purse in the floor and onto my phone, I felt so sorry for him and  I don't blame the waiter because he was new and did everything he could to make the situation better. Who I blame is the chef/owner who continued to sit at the back of the room, working on his laptop and talking to friends! We were practically the only table there and there's no way he didn't see what happened. Yet, he sat there and did nothing to help his staff or us. The waiter offered to pay our dry cleaning. We decided not to expect that of him because he tried to make our evening enjoyable. What should have happened is that  the chef should have come to the table and gave at least my husbands and my entrees for free. We had a table of 10 for goodness sakes. I'm very disappointed that the chef/owner didn't support his staff in any way or take better care of customers even on a SLOW night.
Barb V

An unexpected delight!  We are dyed in the wool foodies and The Finery & Blacksmith Bar does not disappoint.  The host and wait staff are knowledgeable and never overbearing.  The food is exemplary. We began with their meat and cheese selection with pickles, local honey and stone ground mustard - marvelous!  For entrees, I had the house specialty pheasant, which was exquisite.  The caesar salad was an unconventional but delicious composition with a nuanced dressing and a poached egg.  My fiance loved his skirt steak.  The desserts were sublime!  The buttermilk panna cotta with pine nuts, honey and blood orange may be the best dessert I have ever tasted.   The almond pound cake with home made ice cream was another winner.  We cannot wait to go back!

The owners ned to work with their waitstaff some more. We were being seated at the wrong table when the owner corrected the hostess so she started to seat us closer to the kitchen door. Ah, no thanks. We asked for a table further away and was accommodated. We must have sat there for 10-15 minutes before our waiter took our drink order. The room was buzzing with servers but not one stopped to ask if we needed anything. Our waiter did not explain the menu very well, we actually listened to another waiter at a nearby table who was very informative. We were wishing we had him to take care of us. The place is very noisy but very nice. If they could quiet it down a bit I think it would be a comfortable intimate dinner setting. Food was excellent and presented beautifully. Not sure of I'd go back but I'm hoping they make a go if it.

Double date night at The Finery & Blacksmith Bar. One of the best meals I've had in a while and that's saying quite a lot as I was in New Orleans last weekend eating at restaurants staffed by chefs from Top Chef on Bravo TV. The attention to detail was fantastic. From the beginning as we entered the restaurant and we were warmly welcomed, to the service and the tastiest food. We all started with something scrumptious. I had salmon poke inside of fried wonton sheets. They looked like 3 beautiful cornucopia. My husband had the beef barley soup, not a drop left in the bowl for me to try. He loved it that much. Our friends had fried artichokes with arugula and west coast oysters. Lots of smiles around the table. Then came dinner. Two of us had black ink pasta with shrimp and spring vegetables, one had pheasant and one had lamb shank with these amazing pickled onions over spetzel. I typically don't post reviews but I just needed to share. Honestly, I couldn't believe I was in St. Charles, IL. This was a meal that I would have expected in a downtown Chicago restaurant. The Finery exceeded all of my expectations. Well done!

Friday night 'let's get of the house' surprise. Same nite dinner  reservations 7 p - Best idea this month!
We went with other yelpers recommendations and we're not disappointed.
He- Pheasant on risotto with black truffle and pesto.
She- Flat Iron steak with watercress and the cutest teensy tasty potatoes on a parmesean garlic fondue. 
Both perfectly presented, and totally delicious.
Dessert? Um yeah- apple tart and almond pound cake. Not the usual which is why we did them.
Both quite good.
Our server Marissa was on the ball with  a beautiful smile and excellent service. The host? Mario- is charming and gracious , sitting with customers and chatting. He was actually part of our dinner experience:) We enjoy sharing our restaurant finds with family and friends.. And this will be top of our list to do. Total five star *****!

I was very excited to try this place, but unfortunately did not have the best experience when it comes to first impressions. My friend and I came in this past Wed evening to celebrate her birthday. When we walked it, the air was on full blast and it was freezing! (my friend had to get a sweater from her car). We were greeted a minutes later by our server who was pleasant. We we looking over the wine menu, when the the server suggested that we try a tasting of the cabernet we were contemplating on ordering. We said "sure", but then a few minutes later she came back and asked if we were ready to order our drinks. I guess she forget to bring us our tastings. We proceeded to order the wine anyway and it was delicious! 

I ordered the flank steak, medium. I asked for just a little pink...no blood. My friend ordered fish. When my steak came out, it was raw in the middle and my friend's fish was cold. We waited at least 15 minutes before the server finally came to check on us. During that time, we saw what looked like a tasty burger go by. We were curious as we never saw that they had burgers on the menu. When the server finally came by, my friend asked about changing her order since the cold fish grossed her out and wanted to know about the burger. They did in fact have a grass-fed burger that night as a special. We never knew about it because she failed to mention it at the beginning when she greeted us. It was disappointing that they didn't do anything for birthdays...even offer a free dessert with a candle. 

A short time afterwards, my steak returned prepared to my liking and it was very good. My friend enjoyed her burger/fries. The manager came over, apologized and bought us our wine. That was a nice gesture, but unfortunately with everything that had happened... it still put a damper on the first experience. 

I was also a little disappointed in the ambiance. It was the same layout as the previous restaurant. Sure, there are some cool light fixtures and wall paper but I thought they could have changed up the space a little and maybe had some fun music playing. The atmosphere that night was quiet and boring. I may try this place again, bring my husband and sit in the bar area (which is very small). However, it probably won't be any time soon.

The food and cocktails are excellent. The server that my fiance and I had was very pushy however and refused to accept the fact that we were only stopping in for a cocktail and an appetizer  (good for her for upelling) so we got 2 entrees and an app. So I definately recommend, however don't let them convince you that the servings are tiny.

Excellent. From service to presentation of each dish to taste. Wine list is plentiful and great. Had fried artichokes and mushroom appetizer. Salmon and pheasant entree and almond pound cake.  Will  definitely go back!!!

Great food and good atmosphere.  Wife and I went out for date night a couple weeks ago and stayed for 3+ hours between dinner and drinks.  I had the flatiron steak entree - it was cooked a perfect medium rare.  Had the grilled Caesar salad and it was a really interesting mix of flavors (if you hate smokey taste would not recommend).

Wife had an appetizer and the wedge salad as none of the entrees appealed to her.  It is a limited menu, with  about  one entree for each of pork, beef, poultry, and fish.

Very reasonable wine prices, especially by the bottle.  By the glass selections were well conceived and not the normal grocery store brands.

Service was good considering the restaurant was full.

My only complaint was the dessert we ordered - the brownie with gelato - it was minuscule and the brownie wasn't rich - it was pretty bland.  If you are going to size an dish that small it better be very rich.

So if they can add a couple more items for some less adventurous diners and work on the desserts, the finery could hit 5 stars.  Definitely a positive addition to the St. Charles dining scene.

First time visit and very impressed. Chef David menu is small but very innovative. Good quality ingredients and superb plating and presentation. Labor intensive shrimp cerviche and unique pheasant dish were the stars. Nice affordable wines and well shaken martinis. Staff was great, in particular our server Sarah who knew the menu and described the food very well. Even the bus person knew the right time to clear. Small but thoughtful touches such as tiles for utensil bases and daily board for charcuterie choices. After the dinner rush David walked the room and unlike many chef/owners was both gracious and humble in front of his customers.
Some less positive but minor observations - as it is an old building with high ceilings the place was noisy, the chairs are a bit hard and uncomfortable and the banquet high for some ladies - neither of these should deter a visit however. Rookie diners will not understand paying for bread but it worth the $2  -

We ate here on a Tuesday night. The chef went to every table to ask if there were any questions and then later to thank us for dining there. Staff was well trained, did not take the plates away until everyone was finished 

The food was really amazing...the fried artichokes, peach caprese, and berry salad were incredible. Pheasant with risotto, gnocchi, and even the hamburger all better than food served elsewhere. Homemade butter, homemade pickles...wow! 

We were very impressed and feel this may be the #1 restaurant in STC! 

They have a nice happy hour that we observed since we are early diners. They handled 3 parties over 5 while we were there with smooth, nonrushed service! 

Finally, a place that can do it all!
Oh my! From service to cocktails to the entrees, wonderful!  The best meal we've had in a while. What a great find.

A real find and home for foodies in the area.  After fried artichoke hearts and sunchoke salad we enjoyed poached salmon and American bouillibase. Superb wine suggestion. Service was outstanding.  Don't have a single adverse comment.  We'll be back
Great flavors! Great service. Great ambiance. I'll definitely be back. The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Cozy decor. It's like approachable upscale dining. Loved it!

This restaurant is PHE-NOM-IN-AL!!!!! I had the lamb shank that was very flavorful and fall off the bone tender. The pickled turnips gave the dish the right amount of tang which along with the Lima beans ans spatlze gave it an interesting twist both from a texture and flavor wise. I was surprised at how hearty of a meal it was. Come hungry and you will leave satisfied. Wonderful food. We will definitely be back.

Beautiful, modern, always neat and clean, nice atmosphere, and friendly staff. 
Most importantly everything is FRESH and TASTY...

LOVE their specialty cocktails.

My only complaint is that the prices are pretty expensive in comparison to other suburb sushi spots. Other than this, the restaurant had a nice loungey ambiance and great sushi. I ordered the seaweed salad and crazy roll. Though slightly disappointed by the sole 4 pieces of the $16 roll, it was still generously packed with fresh tasty fish. The salad portions at this place is also where it's at! My dad ordered the Jeffrey's special salad- which we should have gotten with the dressing on the side- but it was the same size as the house salad just without the sashimi. Come for great sushi but be prepared to leave a little hole in your wallet!
Still my favorite Sushi place ever! A great experience from the food, drinks and amazing staff!

Driving by and saw this place... looked intriguing so I looked it up. Good reviews. Bookmarked... and scheduled a GNO for Friday... now to make reservations...

RESERVATIONS / HOSTESS / CUSTOMER SERVICE
WTF. You call... If it's during reg business hours... And no one answers you're supposed to leave a message or try back later. Really? And if you want to make reservations just leave a message and they'll call you back... unless they get busy. Then they won't. 

And then when you call while on the way to meet your group... they don't have a clue and aren't taking reservations... too full... etc. Maybe you should respond with an apology and response like 'we will do our best to accommodate your party when you arrive? Pretty amateur... and seems like that level of service has happened to others.

Get on OpenTable or say you don't take reservations... but answer the phone. Seriously? 

AMBIANCE
Decor. Gorgeous. Love white and silver. Made me less irritated with the mom pop shop phone dealio. Lightning is perfect to make you want to chat and lounge... had to fix exposure on all the pics I took though. ;-)

SERVICE
Decent a little slow at times. Food seems to take forever but 2 hours isn't horrible if you're enjoying the convo. Busing the sushi bar (seated there after a 15m wait was fine...) seemed inconsistent. Putting the dishes on a nearby empty table seemed to help.

MENU / FOOD / DRINKS
It's a mystery... menu seemed more like an outline... is this to dodge promises you can't keep? Had to stick to well knowns or ask the disappearing waitstaff... so we stuck to favorites....sushi rolls overall (took a poll) were good but not amazing... dragon/spider/sapporo... presentation is better at Sushi Ai and Wildfish. 

Oh the Sapporo was a recommendation to me by the waitress... mediocre. :-/

Where this place shines is the appetizers and sauces. Seared Tuna was definitely delish. Crab cakes too. Fish Carpacchio... teriyaki sauce was light and not overly salty... 

The martinis tried were unanimously applauded as good and strong. Wine was also. My watery virgin Mai Tai was charged appropriately on the bill as "Orange juice." I should have asked for no ice and more cherries.

SUMMARY 
It's quality over quantity which I like... but I'm not gonna lie... the service needs to ramp up to justify $18 appetizers and $25-50 entrees. Pros are some of the menu items and interior... major cons are the poor customer service. 

Substance counts just as much as looks... imho.

Amazing fresh sushi and attentive wait staff!  Nothing comparable in the suburbs!

My favorite: Sapporo roll.  

Ahi tuna appetizer is so high quality, tender, incredible flavor.  Never had tuna so exquisite.

Best drinks in the area as well, experienced talented bartenders.

Really cool vibe inside this place and our food was decent with a unique presentation. However, the service was somewhat slow, we had to repeat a couple of things we ordered and it was a week night. (It made me wonder how bad a weekend night would be). I've had much better sushi, in the area, for much less money. We did enjoy the calamari tempura and Kamakazi Roll if you can handle a spicy tuna roll.

I'll admit, I was not thrilled to dine here to begin with - but this area didn't have a lot to choose from and we couldn't make it back to the city before I murdered people with my eyes due to hunger. 

It's another one of those surprises in a strip mall. Walking in - it looks straight out of an Ikea show room.  It's actually very modern and cute - almost all white with a huge glass bar. 

The drinks are very good. If you're going somewhere for just martinis, this is your place. Otherwise, head on down the street to another strip mall and take your chances. 

Most of the food we had was mediocre, the timing was terrible - either it came out too slow or some dishes came out way before the other person's. One of the dishes was supposed to be seafood and vegetables and was actually just a weird looking salad. It's actually fairly pricey too.

If they could step up their food game, this could be a promising place.

Bistro is a nice modern and classy Asian restaurant serving very good sushi dishes. I really like their take on the tempura calamari which are more thicker stalk like version than the calamari I'm used to. Their raspberry spicy shrimp is a great tasting appetizer. Their Maki are delicious but I've yet to try their sashimi to do a full review. Unfortunately their menu selection is not that large and the portion size follows the same path so it feels a bit overpriced however well made,  and it is, everything is. Still the good quality and how close it is to me make this a go to sushi place!
The food is always good Everytime I go.  The only reason it's not 5 stars is bc it is a bit pricey.  But that doesn't stop me from coming when I have some money saved up :)

Really good food and great drinks, a modern somewhat fancy place. 
We had kind of sassy waitress. Some people don't really want their waitress telling you what to order and disagreeing with your choice. Awesome food, just a little taken aback by the waitress.

For the love of all things, do not eat here. The only thing I hate more than crappy food is crappy, overpriced food.

The good:
When you pull up and see a strip mall, your heart will sink. But when you go inside, it's modern and bright. The hostess is very friendly. There are some minor design flaws that will probably only drive OCD suffers mad, such as the unevenly cut strips of felt material on the wall, but overall the room had a good vibe. There's a lively crowd. You will have higher hopes than when you got out of the car. 

Yes, as everyone said, the martinis are good. My pomegranate martini was fine, the pineapple upside down martini was above average. Go ahead and order a drink--you'll most likely enjoy it. 

The average:
The avocado and cucumber maki was fine, even if it took quite a long time to come out. You probably can't go wrong with simple maki. Order with moderate caution.

Oh my goodness, the bad:
Here's where it all fell apart. My dining companion ordered the chicken teriyaki dinner. It came out about 10 minutes before my entree. Very poor timing. And poorly executed. The chicken was bland and overcooked. (At least the broccoli and asparagus were good.)


Now for the pice de rsistance...the spicy chirashi. The menu said (I assumed chef's choice) sashimi & vegetables in spicy sauce with caviar over rice. All things I love. What could go wrong?

What I got (10 minutes after my friend's' cooked entree) was a bowl full of what was probably tobiko roe with rice (the two best parts, as they at least were true to the menu description), mixed greens (like you'd get out of a carton at Jewel), slathered in gooey sauce,  sprinkled with chopped up, unrecognizable chunks of raw fish, and topped with unidentifiable slices of something that may have been plain tofu.

The waiter didn't tell me what kind of "sashimi" was in the dish--as he seemed a little disorganized and rushed--but it *looked* like bits of tuna, salmon, and perhaps hamachi sliced up into nickle sized pieces. It *tasted* like disappointment and broken dreams.

This is not spicy chirashi with vegetables. This was a very bad $24 seafood salad. The above description does not fully describe how horrible this was. If only my phone wasn't dead I'd have taken a photo, as that would at least give you a visual representation of this culinary disaster. 

Summing up, if all you want is a martini, average maki, and/or broccoli and asparagus to snack on, you could come here in a moment of sheer desperation when you're stuck and starving in Hoffman Estates. Otherwise prepare for a $90+ letdown (including the tip--none of this was the fault of the poor guy slinging this garbage).

Nice to have great sushi so close! Good for carry out too.
The non-sushi family members like the chicken with black bean sauce.

Came here with a friend that use to bartend here and grabbed a couple drinks, rolls and ahi tuna.  It was really good and fresh and everyone that works here is really nice.. Had a blast and had great food and drinks!  Definitely recommend this place if you're around!

It's Friday night & I want sushi!

I had this place bookmarked for awhile & finally had a chance to try it. Aside from the location being hard to find on my iPhone, everything was great. Although on the smaller size and the fact that they were busy, we were seated quickly at the sushi bar. 

We shared 4 rolls between us, their special, the one with pico de galo, salmon, and a really amazing one I can't remember. All were great and tasted very fresh. 

Only peeve was that they didn't have a large variety of rolls to choose from & did not have descriptions. But it was a great dinner that ended up costing $20 a person.

Second time I've been there - equally good as the first.  This time, based on other reviews, I decided to try one of their "table-side martinis".  Wow!  A traditionalist, my typical order is a Gray Goose Vodka Martini, extra dry.  No foo-foo drinks for me.  But, I was intrigued by the "Saki Martini" they had listed on their menu.  And, it was amazing.  The taste was different from vermouth.  It had a slight sour taste to it.  Outstanding.

As for the Sushi, spectacular.  The only complaint I have is the price.  The service is great; the quality of the food wonderful; the ambiance is nice. The decor is Asian modern and very sparse.  The bar is all glass and quite beautiful.

Price-wise, I've had sushi as good as this in places much less expensive.  25 miles northwest of Chicago should have some price advantages, but this is even more highly priced than the best in the city.  But, as an advocate of local businesses, I will be back.  The bar is pretty cool.  Maybe next time I'll just go for the martinis...

Oh, Hoffman Estates, why are you so far away?

The decor is modern and chic. Like Kevin L. said the menu is lacking descriptions so it seems a little ... mysterious? The service was awkward but they were trying!

I really enjoyed our sushi rolls. Try the one with pico de gallo! Sounds so weird but I promise it's good. They've got some new and different rolls happening as well as the good standbys. I'd go back.

Went here for my birthday (valentines day) and had such a great time!!

the food here is fresh as can be, fileted per roll to order.
we sat at the sushi bar because I love watching them roll sushi
everything that we ordered was delish! I can't even decide what my favorite was, they all blew me away!

This is a great place but make sure to call and reserve a spot at the sushi bar, it's such a great seat!

If I were basing this review solely on decor they would get 4 stars.  Sleek & modern & gorgeous inside.  Their homey strip-mall location does not do them justice in this regard.  Because of their location I was expecting more of a casual sushi-joint, which is what we wanted, but I won't hold that against them.

However, service & food trump decor in my book, and that's what the 2 stars is based on.  As mentioned in other reviews, there isn't really much of a description, or no description at all, on their various offerings on the menu.  Maybe a sushi pro remembers what is in a Dragon Roll, but I do not.  The menu also does not list how many pieces any of the rolls are so we weren't sure how much food to pick out for 3 of us.  Some rolls came with 5 pieces and others arrived with more.

We came on a Friday night and business was steady, but they were by no means crazy busy.  You would think they were, however, based on the 2 servers rushing around & being inattentive and the fact they only had 2 people working the sushi bar so food took entirely too long to come out.  We ordered Shrimp Tempura to start (it was entirely too greasy & not great compared to what we've had at other sushi places), a Dragon Roll, the Bistro Wasabi Special roll, and the Philly.  We thought we might order more but the 3 of us decided to wait and see.  And we certainly waited...for even just the Shrimp Tempura to come out.  At one point our server came over to say that things had died down now & our order was up next so it shouldn't be too much longer (it was...and we still hadn't even received our Shrimp Tempura).  She said if we did want to order something else hot it would come out quickly.  Um...yeah, we ordered Shrimp Tempura ages ago & it's still not here so I don't think so.

The Dragon Roll & the Kamikaze Roll (which we ordered later as we wanted more food) were the only ones that were a manageable size to put in your mouth whole.  The Philly roll and especially the Bistro Wasabi Special roll were HUGE (just 5 pieces each but very big around).  Even for the guys those rolls were uncomfortably large to try and put it all in your mouth at once.  And, if you've ever had sushi, it's generally not a good idea to try and eat a slice of a roll in 2 bites because it's going to fall apart.  The rolls were all just "okay"...nothing spectacular.  The hot rolls actually seemed overcooked.

So, it wasn't terrible, but we wouldn't bother to go back.

So I'm no sushi expert...but man! This place is so delicious! & the service was outstanding! The beef asparagus rolls were so flavorful. The outside of the restaurant is not so appealing but once you step on the inside the atmosphere totally changes! It's incredible. Love the scene too.

I have had my last trip to this place for take out. I got home & discovered my order was not correct & when I called there was no apology, instead I felt like I was a problem. I drove all the back & they told me "that's how we make it" the girl was so condescending, I was shocked!  Anyway, I have been going for 7+yrs, I have to take this one off my 'go to' places, sorry to say. As far as the food, the fish is barely discoverable inside the rolls, it's like paying for a 70.00 salad in seaweed.

My boyfriend and I are always looking for new sushi places to try and we tried this location on a recommendation. Our server, Bianca, was awesome! She was very helpful in explaining food and drink options, as well as the current specials. Our sushi rolls took some extra time, (although we didn't notice), due to it being busy and she brought us free martini shots, which were fantastic. The sushi was fresh and the tempura vegetables had a great coating that wasn't greasy, as many other sushi restuarants serve them grease covered and with not good dipping sauces. We had asked about dessert and I had questions on the moochi flavors. Without asking, Bianca brought me the additional flavors of ice cream to try, for free.

All in all, it was a great experience and we will definitely be back for appetizers, sushi, ice cream, and drinks!

Clean, modern decor and a nice twist on several sushi favorites. Followed previous reviewers' advice and got the Baja roll with spicy tuna and pico de gallo. The spicy chirashi was a little confusing at first -- looked more like a huge salad with sushi on top than the traditional compact bowl -- but it was delicious. My colleague had the peppercorn ahi tuna entree, which was also outstanding. Ended the meal with the Godzilla roll, which was nearly as good to look at as it was to eat.
Go to Sushi Joint.  Always fresh sushi.  Great wine specials during the week.  Been there at least 50 times and have never been disappointed by the food.
Reliably great sushi every time that I have eaten at Bistro Wasabi!

The sushi is great, especially the spicy tuna, spicy salmon, cancun, and maki karai.  Anything with spicy tuna is actually amazing.  It's a small little place, and sometimes, the music and noise levels can be loud, but overall, the food quality is amazing considering that it is in the middle of Hoffman Estates. 
Calamari appetizer and agadashi tofu is THE BEST!!!

Disclaimer: I am not a huge sushi fan. It can be good, but it never leaves me feeling satisfied. I like my red meat and good old american fried food. 

That being said, this place was fantastic! I ordered the Sapporo roll (spicy crab and shrimp), crab cake and teriyaki sampler. The crab cake was wonderful, teriyaki chicken, beef and shrimp were exactly what teriyaki should be, and the sushi was perfect in every way - the texture, balance of flavors, presentation. 

I left full and satisfied - and that's really saying something.

Not much explanation needed here, one of the BEST sushi places I have been to.

Atmosphere is very modern and very clean.  Service was top notch.  

EVERYTHING we ordered tasted delicious and presentation was perfect.

The only downfall is the prices, we had a couple large beers each with our food and left satisfied (not stuffed) for about $60.00+ a person, including tip..

Will I be back, YES, but I will save it only for a special occasion.

BTW, they have the BEST DRAGON ROLL I have ever put in my mouth.

Just moved this way from downtown. After 4 mos I finally hound good sushi at Bistro Wasabi. All was good until my 3rd visit when I was told I couldn't sit at the 70% empty sushi bat because the waitresses were too busy?!? Huh? I can't get a drink at the bat and sit and wait at the sushi bat, I need to stand and wait at the front door? I don't think so.,.off I am to another restaurant and won't return here.

Not at all delicious sushi. Horrid, actually and incredibly overpriced. I've gone several times to see if maybe I've just caught them on a bad night, and the experience is always the same. It tries so hard to be modern and cool, almost too hard, that the staff has an air of snobbery about them. I ordered three rolls and the bill was more than $50. I didn't even order the specialty rolls or a drink! The bar is always packed, so maybe they have great drinks, but I didn't even bother. I will no longer waste time in this place, not worth it.

One of my favorite sushi spots and I'm so lucky its very close to our home! 

I used to loathe sushi before I came to bistro wasabi. This was partly due to my impression coming only from "happy hour" sushi at kona grill (gag). What, it's not normal to feel like you need to hurl after you finish a couple rolls?

The fish here has always been very fresh, no complaints whatsoever! I never thought I would be one to indulge in raw fish but the salmon nigiri is so delicious, i admit I am now a fan! The seared ahi tuna is also a wonderful appetizer - definetly recommended. 

Servers are polite and helpful. We have come here multiple times and never have had any issues. So treat yourself to a fancy meal and a French martini. You'll be glad you did!

I have to give it to Bistro Wasabi for trying to make amends with patrons who may not have had the best first impression of the restaurant. 

Jeff wrote me asking if I'd give BW another shot. I figured there wasn't much to lose and should give them one more shot. Finding a more upscale, yet delicious, sushi-centric restaurant nearby would be a great thing.

Not realizing they had a reservation ready for us and a fully seated dining area ahead of us, we took a chance sitting at the bar for our 2nd BW experience. We chose to not say that we were the less-than-pleased Yelpers until after food came out.

I'm really glad we didn't. 
Aside from the incredibly loud volume of the restaurant, everything was leaps and bounds better than our first experience.

I never thought about pico de gallo in my rolls and I have to say it's delicious. I can now, proudly, recommend the Cancun Roll. So good and very refreshing for summer. I also didn't know Bistro Wasabi offers 125 varieties of vodka (yum). Divine and Belvedere Intense are where it's at.

After our meal ended, we had a chance to meet one of the primary owners, Jeff. Great guy and good conversation. He's aware of some of the restaurants faults and is working to remedy them to change 2 and 3 star reviews to 4 and 5 star reviews. 

Had Bistro Wasabi not reached out to us we probably wouldn't have gone back. The second shot was worth the trip and the experience. Everything tasted great. The bartender, Andrea, was hilarious and incredibly knowledgeable. There's a reason she has hordes of regulars.

All in all - they deserve to move from a 2 star review up to a 4 star review. Even on another busy weekend night, the service was timed well, the drinks were delicious.

To get that last, elusive, 5th star - they'll need to implement their efforts to reduce the blaring volume and continue to refine who they are. If I'm going to pay $7-12 a sushi roll, it better be top notch. And it could sound silly, but they need dessert and to offer after-dinner options. Sometimes I like to sugar up before I head out.

I'd give a thumbs up to visit and give Bistro Wasabi. A lot of the "usual" items but they'll surprise you, at times, with some creativity. 
I wouldn't before but I'll go back now.
over price

This is a great sushi option if you are in the suburbs. The sushi is fresh and the rolls are different from ones you see at other sushi restaurants. Also, the sushi chefs usually make rolls that are not listed on the menu so be sure to ask if there are any specials. I know that they will often make a scallop roll yum! Also, the martinis are really good, especially the saketini.

The seared tuna appetizer is amazing and it is topped with a small seaweed salad (my favorite). It is a little on the expensive side ($16 dollars for an appetizer) but it is pretty big - I sometimes get it as my entree.

The food really is great here. My only complaints are that the sushi takes awhile to come out and it is a little on the expensive side. Other than that, the food deserves 5 stars!
Not only do they have some of the best sushi I have ever had, but their employees are very amicable as well. Plus, they make one of the best martinis I have ever had, the mango one!

As soon as you walk in, you can tell this is a modern place. Music is playing and the decor is very white and sleek.

We were promptly seated by a very nice and attentive waitress. I did notice it was quite loud from all the people, but it's a Friday night so it's to be expected.

We started out with a seafood ceviche and fried tortilla chips. The ceviche was delicious and had avacado, octopus, corn, tomato, and raw fish diced and placed on a plate with lime juice. With the crispy and not-too-salty chips, it was delicious. The ceviche is very fresh and the chips add earthiness as well as good crunch. The mix of a fresh acidic ceviche with warm, salty chips was great. Defintiely getting that again.

My father had a platter of sashimi (forget the exact name) for $30. You get about hte same number of cuts as you would at most any other restaurants. But two things stood out. First was the quality of the fish. The fish is the freshest I ahve had at any restaurant. Tasting it, you can taste the subtle flavors of each fish with a very clean taste. At other restaurants, the fish can taste less fresh and it destracts from the flavor. The second point is that the cuts are nice and thick. the chefs are not trying to steal money with this sashimi. This ended up being a very filling meal, something that does not occur at times with sashimi platters.

We also had the $23 Maki Karai plate. It has spicy tuna, spicy salmon, and Sapporo rolls. The spicy tuna and spicy salmon are unique in that the fish is not chopped completely like most places. Thus, as you eat these rolls, you can taste the flavor of the fish as opposed to the flavor being masked in other restaurants. The spicy flavor is a cleaner spicy as it's not from a cremay sauce or anything. The other roll was a mix of crab meat and shrimp (I think). It was good, but hte spicy slamon and tuna were the clear standouts.

Bistro Wasabi is pricy but it's worth it as the quality of the food is fantastic.

Not what I expected in a strip mall, great decor, great atmosphere.
I love the calamari appetizer and the chips and seafood mixture dip.

The service was just a bit slow, but other than that... WOW!!!

Since we waited a bit for our server to tend to us, the owner brought us a complimentary order of ceviche served with homemade chips.  It was like a lovely guacamole with shrimp. Perfect start.

Calamari tempura was AMAZING for an appetizer. I think I will be craving that for a while.
House salad with a beautiful light ginger dressing served on the side of fresh greens and long slices of cucumber.
Sushi that I had: Saporo maki which was crab & shrimp. Very fresh. sounds simple, but it was very tasty.
Phili maki:  TWO pieces of smoked salmon, cream cheese & avocado.
very fresh and only $7
Calamari tempura maki: large piece of calamari, roe, avocado, eel sauce drizzled over. SO fresh. only $7.  Could have easily been a $10 roll.

Great wine selection, martinis (although I don't like them) were interesting. Nice sake selection served in small carafe with glass ice ball floating in it to keep it cold.

Can't wait to bring more friends to share this little gem tucked away in a strip mall in hoffman estates.

LOVE this place! I've been here dozens of times and have never had bad service or a bad meal! Ive tried pretty much everything on the menu and the only thing i don't care for is the cheek??? (but it's a personal preference) Try the Crab Rangoon roll (its not on the menu but order it anyway) ----OMG you'll love it!   The service is always great,  efficient, the drinks are strong, well priced,  the sushi chefs are amazing to watch & the food is the crown!   Sashimi, rolls, salad, entrees, you can't go wrong! great for a first date! Very clean!  2 things that are a lil odd.... 1   = the bar stools have no back and that can be uncomfortable   2 = the toilets are some sort of steel or metal finish that shows every little smudge its a wierd thing to say but its a wierd thing to see as well. I say go GO GO! You won't regret it 
Bistro, keep doin what you're doin --  you've got me for life!

I'd heard great things about this place, and any place with Wasabi in its name sounds magical. I believe the hype killed it for me. Everything was good and i feel that the prices were fair, but something kept it from being super great. 

Side note, when are more sushi places going to offer brown rice or multigrain rice sushi?
I'm just saying, that could set a place like this apart.

Getting right to it, I really didn't like this place. 

First the environment which is trying to be Urban, I found to be cold, uninviting, and sterile in feeling. It didn't help the temperature in the place was cold and maybe it was just me but I also found the chairs to be surprisingly uncomfortable. The benches have little cushions so maybe those are better. 

Food-wise it was definitely hit or miss. The beef dumplings and age tofu were ... well ... pretty awful. I don't like to be negative but I actually haven't had much worse. The beef mix for the dumplings was bland and had a bad texture. The tofu was like rubber. The salmon on the other hand, though cut thin and a little strange, was actually very good as was the super white tuna. I had these nigiri style. For me, that's where it ended though. The California and Rainbow rolls ordered were just mediocre which was disappointing; especially for the Rainbow roll as it was not only fishy in parts but also expensive at $14. Now I don't have a problem with a roll being $14 or even more but it should be pretty darn good not sub-par a typical $5-6 roll. 

Service was slow as someone else writes but otherwise I liked the staff and thought they did a good to excellent job. 

In any event, I personally can't recommend this place. Instead drive 15 minutes South on the same road to Sakura (pretty good sushi but only OK decor) or 20-25 minutes North to Kaminari or the other Bistro Wasabi which I've "heard" many like better. While a bit further, Wild Fish in Arlington Heights might also serve as a great alternative for those looking for a good combination of decor, food, and chicness in the suburbs. 

Apparently some like this place though so if you do go just don't order the beef dumplings or age tofu no matter how tempting it may seem!

This is a  phenomenal sushi restaurant.  It's the type of place that makes you want to get all gussied up for a night out on the town.  Feels like downtown in the suburbs.  Delicious and creative dishes, out of this world drinks and classy atmosphere.  Glam it Up! :)

We went to Bistro Wasabi for dinner last night and really enjoyed it! The food was excellent (try the lobster roll...yum!) and the staff was super friendly. Sit at the sushi bar - the guys making the sushi are really friendly and funny! I'll definitely be back :)

This place confuses me. It' looks kind of upscale, but the people don't necessarily. It has a very modern decor with plain white walls. The most interesting piece of decor was the lights and the pretty comfy chairs.

My experience was OK. Nothing over the top, but nothing bad. It was so loud we could barely carry on a conversation. The sushi was good, but not the best I'd ever had. The presentation was nice and it was pretty cool to watch the sushi chefs do their thing. 

Service was a bit on the slow side, but it was a Friday night and our server was running around like crazy. All things considered, she did a pretty good job.

All in all, I suppose this place is forgettable and just OK. It won't be my usual sushi place, but I can't say I'd never go back if someone wanted to.

My wife and I really love this place. We live close by, so it makes it even better. The seared tuna appetizer has to be the best around - and believe me, we have tried it at every sushi restaurant and no one comes close to Bistro Wasabi. The rolls are delicious and the martinis are original. The ambience is great - the austere white decorating makes the place feel hip, especially for a suburban restaurant.  A little pricy for sure, but overall worth it. I would have given it 5 stars but we have noticed that the service has slipped over the years. I would like to see them improve that so I can give them the extra star.

Very good.  The Godzilla is excellent and the veriety is very good.  Service was a little slow, they were busy and should of had a third server in this small place.  Prices were average for the area. 

The menu is written for someone who understands Sushi, it does not say everything you will get in the rolls.

Specials on the rolls were very good and unique.

Found this place thanks to yelp after my husband & my favorite sushi place was "americanized"... Bistro was just what we needed. Sat at the sushi bar asthe dining room was pretty full (a good sign). Got a nice semi sweet bottle of sake. Watched the chef work his magic while we browsed the menu. Nice selection of appetizers & entrees but we went right for the sashimi & maki rollls. My better half got tuna & octopus & crab maki. I went with the philly, boston & shrimp/pico de gallo (cool idea). Everything was delicious. Fish was super fresh. Every ingredient in the rolls was tasted. Nothing bad about this place. A little pricier but it figures, you really do get what you pay for :) we definitely will be back. We found our new local spot!

I live super close to this Huntington Strip mall, so it's very convenient and maybe that's why it took so long for me to give it a try (there's no way something so close could be great).  However, I really enjoyed my experience there.  

They have fresh (as you can get in the midwest) sushi.  The selection isn't a long list, but they put a HUGE amount of sushi in there so I think for the price, it's worth it.  Unlike other sushi places that have more rice than sushi in their rolls, Bistro Wasabi makes sure you get the whole fish in your roll! (maybe not literally, but it's pretty big)

I had the sake, can't remember which one, but it was delicious.  Never had it, but it went down smooth yet burned like vodka.  Yum.

The space is very white, walls, decor.  I love white so I liked it.  I suppose it could look plain, but it looks like they were going for modern.  Very clean and attentive service.  Maybe I'll try again.

It's been a while since my last visit.  Fortunately, I'm happy I went back.  Bistro Wasabi has a great selection of sushi and a comfortable atmosphere as well.  I prefer sitting at the bar when there's room.  The bartender knew when to interject to provide well-rounded service.  I don't know why other raters feel the restaurant is overpriced; it's right on par with most other sushi restaurants in the area.
We just moved to the chicago area and found this wonderful gem. I dont want to forget about the bartenders at our new watering hole; always a lot of fun.

This is my girlfriend and mine's favorite sushi restaurant.  We always start out with a lemon drop martini that is probably the best I have had in the Chicago land area.  They fill the class to the brim (no skimping on drinks here).  The hostess is usually indifferent but the wait staff is consistently friendly and very attentive.  The sushi is fresh and flavorful.  I would consider it to be top notch and hard to top.  They have roll that I believe is called the Cancun Roll that is really very good.  It is a bit pricey but if you are looking for cheap sushi go find the day old sushi sale restaurants and take your chances!!!!! It is certainly worth the price you pay.  The atmosphere inside is great. Very trendy.  Great place.
Go there! Bianca & Brenne are awesome and very knowledgable. Food is awesome. The kamikaze is a must!

My husband and I have been wanting to try out Bistro Wasabi for quite awhile and visited on a Friday evening. I was surprised how many open tables were available on such a popular night. The service was so-so; the waitress was very friendly but food and drink was slow to arrive at our table. I ordered a martini, which was quite good, and my husband ordered a beer. We decided so split three sushi orders between us. They lost our order ticket, but quickly remedied their mistake when they realized what happened. The sushi was tasty, but certainly not out-of-the-ballpark amazing. One thing it definitely has going for them are reasonable prices.

The decor was modern. Rather contemporary with a lot of white but it was passable. My biggest complaint is the modern, techno music that they play entirely too loud. It definitely took away from the ambiance.

This place is really cool. They won't get all the stars because they're located in a strip mall - I usually don't do restaurants from strip malls. 

But the decor is SO COOL that you feel like you could be anywhere else in the world having great japanese food and mingling with some trendy people (REMEMBER: You're still in the burbs, so the trendy people cannot be guaranteed).

The greatest  sushi in Hoffman for sure! great sake . We made it our date night spot. Its very trendy and modern, chic!
The apple martini is terrific!!!! Its clean and the service was great. Will def be back!

Pretty much meh. They really didn't have any offerings that stood out from the menu, and I don't know how they can justify the price for food offerings that seem a wee bit too close to supermarket sushi. Our server was good, and the ambiance was chic in a way that seemed anomalous given the neighborhood.
Can't go wrong at this place grape martini is delicious had the maki akari to go along hit the spot great service and atmosphere ?

This is one of my favorite sushi places but the up and down reviews don't surprise me. The sushi is excellent although there are maybe only 10-15 choices for rolls. I recommend the calamari tempura and the spider. The prices are reasonable because each roll is humongous. It's actually a little embarrassing trying to stuff one in my mouth sometimes... and trying to bite them in half is always a disaster... Anyway, the drinks are awesome, I don't think I'm a lightweight but I usually have to limit myself to one if I'm driving. They're definitely not watered down but they aren't overpowering either. Personally I find it incredibly difficult to find a good stiff drink that doesn't taste like pure ethanol. 
The decor is a little bit obnoxious and the acoustics are terrible. Fortunately the past few times I've been there it hasn't been as crowded so I didn't have to lipread to have a conversation with my friends. But when it is crowded just forget it. I think a little padding on the walls might help... I'm not quite as bothered by the "cold' feel because I really don't care if they're trying to be upscale - it's in a strip mall in the suburbs so I'm going to walk in in shorts and flip-flops if I dang well please. 
And finally for the service... It seems like it's improving, but yes, it is terribly slow. Look over the menu as fast as you can and try to have your order ready before your waitress comes back so you don't starve to death before your food arrives. 
Overall this is a great choice if it's not your first time in a sushi restaurant and you want to have a slow - but delicious - dinner.

If you want excellent sushi at a decent price, you've arrived. Also, LOVE the swanky metro feel. Martinis are excellent. Don't be afraid to try their specials- that's where you'll find their best sushi. 
Not for an inexperienced sushi diner, as the menu is written more for someone well-versed in sushi dining. However, great for a first-time sushi dining experience if you're joining someone who can walk you through the menu. 
For the gentlemen- the atmosphere is just about as perfect as it gets if you're looking for a place to impress your date without breaking bank!

Very unexpected!  Tuesday night, great atmosphere, nice metro crowd.  Very good sushi, but a somewhat simple and limited menu.  Prices tend to indicate something located in the city, but regardless, aren't too outrageous.  Overall: surprised, pleased, recommend to friends and a repeat customer...
Great fun and great food!  I really enjoy eating and drinking here!  The bar staff are a blast!

Bistro Wasabi is solid sushi at decent price.  There is more than just sushi and the beef wrapped asparagus appetizer was very good.  Crunchy and flavorful.  The service was a bit slow and we were seated for about 10 minutes before the server came by.  There were empty tables and did not seem to be busy enough to warrant the rate.  Solid, but I think some of the city folk would find it lacking compared to other places in the city.

really great sushi here, inventive rolls. service is amazingly slow, but the atmosphere is nice, so we dont really care? definitely dont go if you are in a hurry, but if your on a date, or hanging out with a bunch, it doesnt matter how long it takes to get good food.  they have a wide variety of special martinis, a huge bar(selection, not space!), and planty of cooked food for those not into raw sushi.
Pineapple roll was tasty, but overall very expensive.  Not worth 100 for dinner for 2. Go down the road to sakura instead.

Sushi is delicious and fresh!  Tasty martinis shaken table-side that always hit their mark- never too sweet, perfectly strong enough and chilled to perfection. Food-wise , this is truly a hidden gem that is both in a strip mall and the burbs so there was some caution- HOWEVER- don't let that fool you, it really tops my list including those which I have been to in the city. My only complaint is that the servers do not seem well trained? While nice and pleasant, I never get the impression they are connecting with their tables. It does seem like they are always too short on wait staff and that they aren't quick or sharp enough in explaining the types of rolls or making you feel assured your food is coming. They are a bit slow in checking in on you also so sometimes you feel like you have to flag someone down. 
My only other issue is that they are pricey, however, the positive side on this is that you do get a LOT of fish in your sushi and the rolls are very big compared to some places that charge the same for bite sized rolls. The Crab Rangoon roll is not on the menu but I highly suggest it if you want to try something completely decadent full of tempura, fish, wasabi mayo, cream cheese, scallions, crab, anything else you can imagine...like heaven in your mouth! But I can imagine not very healthy :) One to be shared for certain! :))....Probably the tastiest roll I have ever experienced. Also try a Raspberry Sorbet martini...mama mia!

Food and Drinks are great the best around,   Cool atmosphere makes this still the best place to go if you want the only hip place in the area.  FYI the customers and the bartenders at this place are great.
I like the Lake in The Hills location better. The food is just as good but the restaurant is a bit smaller here. Good place to go when I can't head up further to the Hills.

OMG, the calamari appetizer is fantastic.  Theses are not your conventional deep fried hoops and bodies here... the calamari here must come from a gigantic squid cause the strips are huge!  They are literally served as thick strips arranged in a log cabin configuration.  The really meaty strips are lightly battered and covered is a tasty sweet teriyaki sauce that is amazing.  The rolls and nigiri are decent, but this place is getting five stars from me based on the calamari.  Amazing....

i have enjoyed bistro wasabi's fare since they opened. they are experienced fish cutters and their portions are larger than many.  the chefs are creative and they have added a number of client "specials" to the menu over the years.  the best part is that they that an outstanding bar and the best servers in the area, better than you will certainly find in any other sushi place.  highly recommended, come for the food, stay for the party.

Bistro Wasabi has an awesome atmosphere. The bar is really modern and eclectic and you feel like you're at a downtown restaurant in a neighborhood location. The food is great --a little pricey and a little spicy--but definitely worth a Saturday night dinner.

I wish I can give this place 10 stars!!!! The food is simply amazing, some of the best sushi I have ever had.  The Godzilla role is my fav, the drinks are delish, and the atmosphere is trendy, you feel like you are in the city.  Call ahead, because there will be a wait, which is well worth it BTW!

We went here last night and I was pleasantly surprised. The place was in an unassuming strip mall (like most everything in suburbia) but when you walk in it is so clean, modern, slick and really sophisticated - one might think you are in the city. Admittedly I only had 2 dishes here but I WILL venture back to try more things. I had Jay's special salad which was a bits of sashimi on a bed of lovely dark leafy greens a nice dressing (I think it was soy ginger based - not citrusy) and this gigantic maki roll with a mix of different sushi; salmon, eel, tuna, etc. They also had a good liquor selection too, lots of high end vodka which is my preference. The place had a young vibe to it but it remained comfortable. When I go back I will report on more yummy dishes I intend on indulging in. Worth the trek.
This is one of the best sushi places i have ever been... Perfect for a nice dinner with the family. Its clean and the services is great and, its perfect for having a few drinks at the bar as well.
This place is a good as it gets! frsh seafood good drinks

I loved this place. First time coming to Rascals and Geneva ever. Our waiter Vince was a very good server and provided us a great service. Food was delicious and the atmosphere of the place was awesome. Definitely would come back and recommend to everyone!

The food was great. Had the black and blue burger, cooked perfectly. Wine and then Angry Orchard. Both drinks were good. My sister had ordered the pot roast nachos, to which our waiter said "great choice" however we never got our nachos, nor were we charged for them. We thought, wasn't meant to be. She ordered the Garbage salad and was excited about the hearts of palm, yet there weren't any. The salad was still scrumptious. 

And yet our server didn't know the soup of the day, nor the price of Vodka. He forgot the box, we had to ask 2 times. Also, our check was forgotten, and we had to ask the bar back for our server. He never filled out waters either. 

The food was good, the service dismal. We liked the band too! And the place was really cute and clean. The service makes us think twice about returning.

Ordered the pot roast nachos. Cheese wasn't melted, pot roast was room temperature. Underneath the top layer were a bunch of dry tortilla chips. I say dry because I've had real nachos before and they have cheese on every layer. My wife and I thought we'd give the meatloaf sandwich a chance. BAD IDEA. It was like biting into a stiff sponge. No flavor and it smelled terrible. 

The best part about our experience? Leaving. Well, the televisions are nice but I have a nice one at home I can watch.

We'll never ever be back.

Sidebar:

Full Definition of rascal
1
:  a mean, unprincipled, or dishonest person
2
:  a mischievous person or animal

Consider a name change among other things.

Not sure what some of the other people were reviewing. This place is truly unbelievable. 

We went for lunch on Sunday at about 1230 the weekend before Christmas.

We made the mistake of ordering the pot roast nachos. I say mistake, because these could probably feed two for lunch quite nicely. And considering the size, the price is very reasonable. The chips in the nachos are made in house and nice and crisp (see pics.). The pot roast used, is tender and flavorful and the cheese is fantastic.

We should also comment on the service. Matt was our server and was at our table within 5 minutes, and drinks on table within 10. He was very helpful, and answered all our questions as well as being attentive to drink refills and anything else we needed during our meal.

For our meal, I ordered the jambalaya and my wife the Italian beef. She ordered hers dry, which at some restaurants can be short of a crap shoot. In this case however the meat was done almost perfectly and the meat juices still intact. She rated her sandwich very high, which for her is really saying something.

I can honestly say, the jambalaya is probably the only authentic jambalaya I have had in the area. I spend a lot of time down south and have had opportunities to try some that are considered the best and this holds its own. The shrimp are quite large and the sausage seasoned perfectly. Portion size is on large size, so if you try one of the appetizers, prepare to take home a doggie bag.

If I had any criticism, it would be the same for some others in the area: COKE PRODUCTS ARE YOUR FRIEND! No, Pepsi is not the same.

I really understand everyone's experience is different, but can't imagine anyone giving this less than a 4, much less lower than a 3. We will be back and bringing friends and family.

Not a bad family biz. Enjoyed the toasted ravioli, and the thin crust pizza was good, but not great. Too much grease. Service was excellent. Our server, Allie was warm and friendly. The outdoor music was extremely loud, so will only go back on nites without live music.
