Service was good. We all had the chili mac, coleslaw, pretzels and pork tenderloin. The coleslaw and pretzels were good. The pork was bland and generic tasting. The chili mac not so great. Barely any chili
Food was amazing! Awesome seating outside. Our server was super attentive and friendly. She checked on us often. Great place to eat in Geneva.

Mixed feelings on Rascals. I'm surprised people are complaining about the service. The staff was nice and accommodating. The restaurant was modern, put together, and clean. It's the food that the restaurant needs to work on considering the pricing. Rascals is trying to do too much. You can't be a great sandwich, burger, pasta, pizza, salad, dinner, and bar food / restaurant. 

To be frank, my BLT wasn't that good. It just wasn't and looks were deceiving. The bacon was greasy and not cooked as much as I would have hoped. My fries on the side were good, but perhaps overcooked a bit. The french fries left a crisp taste in my mouth which again was strange. French fries don't usually leave an aftertaste. The standard burger, for $11, is almost McDonalds level in terms of toppings (barebones). I'm sure it tasted better than McDonalds, but not worth the premium.

It's worth giving Rascals a shot if you haven't visited before. I'm assuming they're reading these reviews and genuinely trying to improve. They're new, and I hope to upgrade this review in the future, but as of now don't expect much. I've included photos of the menu, food, and interior.

If I could give this place no stars I would. The staff here is very unknowledgeable and their restaurant. I called two different times in two different weeks to ask about Mother's Day reservation the hostess told me two different times WE DONT TAKE RESERVATIONS BUT YOU WONT NEED THEM with plans to enjoy a nice Mother's Day dinner THEY FAILED TO TELL US THEY WERE GOING TO BE CLOSED!!!!!' with this place messing up the plans we had to search for others options and its was a challenge with it being Mother's Day and busy. If this place staff can't communicate well with their customers I can only imagine what their service and food is like I will never go back here this place was better when it was the grotto

Service seems to be pretty good here but I felt 15 years older than I am due to the bartender calling me 'sir' from the moment I arrived and even as I was finishing my meal and ordering a second beer. HA! 

Food is standard bar food. Sandwiches were a little underwhelming in size, especially when compared to the heaping amount of fries they give you, which were great! Good selection of beers/drinks. 

They seem to be going for a family atmosphere, above all else. You've been warned!
Great Food! Outdoor patio is perfect for enjoying the weather and people watching! Will be back. Diego Burger was delicious and believe it or not so was the Italian beef!

Our 1st time at Rascals was the evening of 7/11/15. Food was fabulous! They even made an extra special effort to make sure our daughter liked her homemade mac and cheese. Our server Elson was awesome, friendly and accommodating :-)

Our 2nd time at Rascals was last night 10/15/15. Ironically we were seated in the same booth :-) My husband and I both had the Reenies....FABULOUS with a nice kick! ;-) And naturally our little one enjoyed her Mac and Cheese. I don't know what they do but they have some of the best burgers!  :-) We will be back again soon!

Went here on a whim for some pre-dinner drinks with my wife.  The bar was surprisingly nice, more than expected, as we had not been to many places in Geneva yet.  The bar tender was attentive and quick to get our drinks.  My wife has an aversion to over pouring on mixed drinks, but here they were right in line with what she likes.  

As for the ambiance, it was a nice place to be, and we will definitely come back.  Another reason for our return in the future is the food smelled and looked good, and the menu we browsed showed that it was reasonably priced fare too.

We will be coming back to try the food, and I'll definitely update my review.

We have now been twice.  Once in the patio and once inside.  Service has been fine.  Location is great.  Decor is fine.  Atmosphere is about what you'd expect for a sports bar.  The real problem is the food.  It seems like the type of place that would be on Restaurant Impossible.  It has potential but the food is just not worth coming for.    The pizza cheese is poor.  The chop salad dressing is just not really seasoned.  The rest of the food was simply not good.  I want to like this place but it is just lacking.

Not sure how or why they thought a three man band that sing grossly off key would be a good fit for a dining experience on a beautiful Saturday evening... Food as bad as the music and now we have terrible headaches.  

Thankfully the band at the corner by the wine shop made up for the disaster at Rascals.

This is the first time we tried this place. Being a new place we did not know what to expect.  There are many different Taverns in downtown Geneva so we were curious how they were going to distinguish themselves from the others.

First of all the service was great.  When our server was busy others came around to refill our drinks and to see if we needed anything.  The manager also stopped by to make sure everything was good.  

I found the menu to have a good variety of not only basic pub food but other foods like pasta, Salmon and even Jambalaya.  There was so much to try from but I was in the mood for a good burger and they did not disappoint. It was done perfectly, juicy and tasted great!  We also sampled some starters which were great.  I am not big on Cheese Curds but these were the best I've had.  

The kicker was my little girl (10yrs) loved the place!  She loved everything she tried and said this place is AWESOME!  She has now found a new favorite eating spot.  

I would highly recommend this place.  It is definitely worth trying out.

This place reminded us of eating in a friends basement.  We started off with the cheese curds which were good then I had the best French onion soup I have ever had. The jambalaya was the main course. It was delicious. My wife and I will definitely return.

If I could of given no stars I would have.  This is the same bad food from the grotto.  All they did was  put up some tv' sand and take down some pictures. 

Some one mentioned new owners/ management. It's still the same family.  

Disgusting. 

What a shame it is a great location too bad some one who cares about quality of food didn't take over location. 

Waste of time and money.
Amazing food and great service! I had some pretzels that were  and then a chicken wrap and it was sooooo good  I am leaving very happy!

Today is the last day of restaurant week so we were told by ZAck who is our server! We ordered the $19 meal for all three and Donna of us which comes with apps main and desert which we all shared! Zack was very attentive and made sure we get the best service!!! Wings, cheese curds, hamburgers, Italian beef, fries, tater tots, carrot cakes....martinis wine and beers....we just hang out there and enjoyed each other's company!!! Need I say more!!! Definitely going back very soon!!!

I love this place.  Great service and servers. The best deal is the pizza.  It's great pizza.  Good bar as well.  Love the outside seating and a ton of TVs to watch sports.  Right on third street so in the middle of everything Geneva. I highly recommend.

I ate here last night with my husband.  The hostess was very friendly and accommodating when we asked if we could sit outside.  The patio is lovely and offers a great view of Third Street.  We decided to share a Garbage Salad and Chicken Sandwich.  We never told the waiter, a young man,, that we were going to share but talked about it amongst ourselves while ordering.  Our order arrived with the salad split on two plates and the chicken sandwich split on two plates.  This was such a nice gesture by the kitchen staff, as well as the waiter.  The food was wonderful, prepared perfectly and a decent price.  The waiter was AMAZING.  His customer service skills were top notch.  He kept checking on us and was always pleasant, friendly and courteous.  He gave us an appropriate amount of time to order, offered drink refreshes at the appropriate time and never forgot anything.  He made our visit even more pleasant.  This is a great place to go in Geneva when you are looking to share drinks and good food.

Gross!  In a party of seven, no one had good food!  I was told by the waitress that the Mediterranean chicken was a popular dish....ewww!!!!  And we calamari and it was chewy and knotted together!  Everything was undercooked and overrated!

I really wanted to love this new restaurant.  We loved the former restaurant-it was one of our "go to" spots.  I had to send my food back-terrible!! And then ordered a salad. It was just a bowl full of Spinach with nuts and apple bits on top.  At that point I thought "Seriously-is the best you can do?!"  Maybe this place should be a burger joint and nothing more.  Sorry we won't be back..felt as if no one cared we stopped in!
The fries are some of the best I have had in Chicago. We were recommended the pizza from a local genevan and my wife loved the cheese pizza (Friday during lent).

I've reviewed Rascal's previously but I am reviewing again after a much different experience.  Yesterday my husband and I and our 12 year old dog Sofie went to Rascal's for Sofie's "last dinner."  She was going to be crossing over the Rainbow Bridge later.  Geneva is dog-friendly but Geneva has been more vigilant in enforcing no dogs on outside patios at restaurants lately.  Rascal's made an exception for us yesterday because of the circumstances.  Sofie sat in her stroller on the patio and ate 1/2 a cheeseburger, fries, hush puppies, pretzels with cheese and they even brought her some ice cream.  Everything was delicious, the service and compassionate caring for our situation was outstanding and I take back my unfavorable previous comment.  Rascal's has my vote now for the compassion they showed us as we spoiled our girl one last time.  Thank you Rascals!  We will be back.
Sat outside here with my friend for a late lunch. The server was prompt and attentive. The food was good and the portions were large! The beer is always a good choice. good value I felt.

We sat down a manager checked on us to see if we had been helped yet.  We hadn't and she found our server quickly.  We told our server we had to be out in an hour as we were volunteering up the street.  He took our order and we had our food and drinks in 10 minutes.  The customer service was beyond expectations and the food followed in suit.  I had their BLT and would definitely come back again.  Top notch place for family, good food and drinks, and fun!  THUMBS UP!

Like others, took 15+ minutes to be acknowledged. Apps came faster than our drinks. Beer was warm and flat. Food was very below average..chicken tenders tasted like shrimp (dirty oil), pizza was bland (tons left and i didn't take it home...a first). Seems like everyone that works there knows the place wont be around for long. Apathy permeates.

We have been to this place many times in the past and have more often than not been happy with the experience. Last time and today though it was a bad experience. Food is below average and my father in law was put off eating anything when he found a hair in his salmon. Gross! My husband ordered Jambalaya and it looked as unappealing as it tasted bland.
The staff are very friendly and the chap who waited on us today was highly apologetic about the food. Not his fault at all! 
Sadly we won't be returning to Rascals when there are so many other places to enjoy a lovely meal.

I thought this might be a good place but after being seated and having no one acknowledge us for over 15 minutes, we got up and left.  Hostess seemed surprised.  I told her most people at least have someone take their drink order within 15 minutes of sitting down.  We won't be trying them again for quite a while.  There are other restaurants and bars in Geneva with much much much better service.
We visit on Mondays normally with our 7 year old, love our service from our favorite server Ali and the pot roast nachos are AMAZING!!! We will continue to go back

First of all the staff was good, but I felt sorry for our waitress coming back four different times to tell us that they were out of two different appetizers and out of two kinds of beer. It was 8 o'clock last Saturday night. The appetizers we did get weren't very good.

Jennifer; I happened to be there Saturday evening. The music was not why I went there again but I will agree with you on the music, at best ok. It's obvious you no little about food though . Couldn't disagree with you more on more. I have talked to quite a few people who have been to Rascals and we seem to have the same opinion, that Rascals has very good food, very large portions, at a very reasonable price. My suggestion to you is stay home and eat!!
Expensive for typical bar fare.  Food was just OK service was excellent though.
I have eaten here twice since it opened. Both times the food was very good and the service was excellent.

I thought I'd try the rascals grill. I had noticed it my last trip to downtown Geneva. I was greeted right away and seated at the bar as requested   The bartender Zack immediately suggested a beer that was delicious. He even offered a sample. I ordered chicken wings : BBQ sauce and a patty melt. They weren't very busy but steady. The wings took a little longer than expected actually Zack asked twice where they were but were served hot. The BBQ sauce was a little too spicy for me but great flavor. The patty melt with fries arrived right after I finished the wings I ordered it medium well but it was still a pink. That was a disappointment considering I asked for no pink. The rye bread need a little more toast   Fries were okay I like mine crispy. So 3 stars because the service was great need to do better on the food quality. I'll try them again

The tacos here were delicious. Fairly priced and well portioned. This will definitely be my go to restaurant for carna asada tacos. 

They have an authentic Mexican cilantro and onion topping option as well as an Americanized cheese and lettuce topping option. I had the cilantro and onion with my tacos. 

They give you free chips and salsa while you wait for the food. They also provide super hot sauce to put on the tacos (too hot for me!).
Solid Chicago-style Mexican fare.  Huge taco filling on small tortillas.

Best Chile Relleno Sope I have ever had.

This is my favorite place to get take out for lunch on special occasion with my co workers. 

Everything I have got there has been delicious and they give you lime and salsa with your order.

It is fairly spacious and very clean.
absolutely exceeded expectations! hidden gem! Spicy salsa and tacos are to die for!

Absolutely exceded my expectations.  I would only ding them because the kitchen is a little slow but the rest of the service was great.  Their mole was delicious.  Everyone else I was with were really happy with their meals too.  We will be back for sure.

The only thing good in that place is their sauces. Rice was oily meat was over cooked. They charges me 7 dollars tax for a 20 dollar bill. Went on cinco de mayo, that place was a ghost town. Now i know why.. never again.

Bad service !!! After over 15 min that we got there we got acknowledge after that they took another 15 min to ask us what we wanted to drink and not mention the time for our food to arrive ughhh took over 1 hr to finally eat during all that time no one bother to ask us if we needed drink refills or anything... Towards the end I took my son to the bathroom, bathrooms had no paper toilet and no napkins luckily I had my purse with my own tissue. Food is great no lie but hopefully they can improve their customer service!!!
Best Shrimp Fajitas I have ever had! Salsas are amazing! Micheladas are also amazing! Will definitely return!
Good tortas''..Kitchen to slow tough, it's busy on the weekends...
Food was fresh and delicious! The shrimp ceviche tostada was fantastic as well as the al pastor tacos. Margaritas were great too!!!

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in the area. Slow down when you get near or you might miss it!!! Burritos, enchiladas, and mole are amazing. I love them so I can't brave trying anything else. Staff is always fast and friendly. Prices are affordable for the great taste and quality. I miss their former salsa but the new ones are still delicious.
Very good al pastor and tacos.  Go there all the time when I want Mexican food
I love bringing friends here for their first time. They're always hesitant about trying out new foods, however, every single one of then falls in love with this restaurant. A gem in our community.

By far the best Mexican restaurant around. The food is authentic and their Micheladas are amazing.  They serve a variety of food from tacos to seafood.... Es el mejor restaurante mexicano. La comida es autentica y sus Micheladas son deliciosas. They also have live bands at night.  Tambien tienen musica en las noches.

What can I say.....the seafood here is incredible. I love that they make the shrimp cocktails right up front and prepare the Aguas prepradadas right in front of you as well....the one to try is the carbonated water, lime juice, salt and sugar mix.
If you are a drinker....try the micheladas....my dad's favorite when he comes up from Texas.

I was craving tacos yesterday and pulled out the trusty iphone to find a joint...urbanspoon is awesome.  Anyhow, it popped this place up and although they only had 6 people vote, all 6 stated they liked it - so I went.  
I am now the 7th person to like this place. The lady at the counter is pretty dumb but who cares, the tacos are good.  I had the steak taco for my first adventure here but now I'm dreaming about the other things I should of got.  I'll be going back soon. maybe again tonight!

PLEASE BE SEARIOUS when rating something!! I wish I knew what everybody else thats given it more than one star had to eat when they came to this place.. I ordered ceviche and it was a nightmare to have to eat it.. its like if they did it disgusting on purpose they don't give you any tostadas (are you supposed to eat it with a fork??) simply ridiculous, I had ordered the langostinos it was an even bigger nightmare like with Martha Stewart in it and I'm not kidding.. i had also ordered a beer and for a moment they made me think i was in England (warm as hell) THANKS TO ALL OF YOU THAT GAVE IT 5 STARS I TRUSTED YOU AND LOOK WHAT HAPPENED!!

horrible experience!!!!   had to wait for my food over 30 minutes and when we get it, it was cold!!!   the ice in my drink had mold!   disgusting !. besides the food I ordered two orange juices for my kids and they added water to it!!!   not worth the $4 per cup!   used to come often but after today never again. there is a better place just around the corner named Islas Maria's that deserves a chance.
Excellent deli! Great sandwiches and pasta dishes. Authentic Italian food. Would highly recommend. Great catering as well! My family has been coming here for years.

Review is just for the sub. It was sorely lacking in the meat quantity department as my picture shows. The bread was excellent. The sandwich was almost like eating a veggie sub bc of the skimpy meat portion. Very nice people. They offered me a piece of fresh mozzarella that they had just made. Any sub from a mom and pop joint like this is still better than the chain sub joints.

This place is a really small Italian deli just down the street from my work. When you walk in you could immediately tell that it was a family owned place and they made a lot of their items from scratch. Outside of the food they offer for lunch, they also sell various pastas and meats/cheeses to cook at home. 

I've tried both the sandwiches and pastas, both of which were very good. I got the Buon Appetito sandwich, which like your classic Italian sub. The meat had great bold flavors and the bread was really good too. They also offer a create your own pasta option. I chose the gnocchi with vodka sauce. You could tell it was fresh pasta and the vodka sauce had that great creaminess with the tomato flavor. 

My only complaint would be the portion size of the pasta, especially for the price. I could literally count how many gnocchi pieces were on the plate. I understand its homemade and higher quality, but I also want to feel satisfied and not still hungry when I go back to work. 

I usually pay cash since one time they said the only credit card they accept is American Express. I'm not sure if that's still the case.

Overall, it's a good small Italian place that has quality food, but with higher prices.

The sandwiches and Minestrone just didn't do it for me. in fact, threw away 1/2 the sandwich. They were friendly enough that I will most likely give it a second try and am hoping the pizza or pasta is a worth the effort. What may hold me back though is the clear sign on the front register that a $15 "Strict minimum" for credit card use. With the sandwiches already suspect, I can't believe the pizza or pasta is so earth shattering that I'd have to fall back to the inconvenience days of stopping to get cash just so a business in the year 2015 doesn't have to pay a credit card processing fee.
This is definitely my favorite place for Italian food! I'm in love with their subs!! They have great variety for deli meats and cheeses

I've had sandwiches for takeout and they are delicious. As a vegetarian, I've found that most places have just one sandwich option. This place has so many veggie choices, both warm and cold, and all that I've tried are great.  The ingredients seem very fresh. The only downside is getting in and out of the parking lot on busy Northwest Hwy.

Met a friend here for lunch.  My minestrone soup was so extremely watered down that the broth was practically clear, and my salad was hardly dressed and not very appetizing.  On the other hand, my friend very much liked her sandwich and has visited this location a few different times and seemed to enjoy their food.  Maybe I visited on an "off" day, or just didn't order something they make very well.

We were looking to eat somewhere for lunch that wasn't a chain and this little Italian deli and cafe was just what we were looking for.

The menu is pretty big for a small places- lots of different kinds of sandwiches and paninis to choose from.  They also had a case with salad items and meats and cheeses.  I opted to have the soup of the day as well, mushroom.

You get a lot of food for your money, and since it's not a chain, the prices are higher than Subway or Jimmy John's.  I could only eat half my sandwich and had to save the rest for later.  The ingredients were fresh and the sandwiches were prepared after you ordered.

For soup and a sandwich it was just over $10.

Frantonio's is a small quant deli/ caf with a good selection of homemade pastas, soups and sandwiches. They have homemade entrees in the refrigerated section that you can heat and serve at home. Food is fresh and delicious, its not a premium Italian restaurant but a great diversion from the run of the mill franchise sandwich shops. A friendly family owned shop that has now become our go to.

Frantonio's is one of the best places in the far northwestern Chicago suburbs to get a great sandwich.  The favorite in my house is the Garden of Eden.  From their perfectly crusted bread to the perfectly marinated veggies and fresh mozzarella, this sandwich has it all for me.  And the portion size makes it one of the best deals around.  I usually eat half right away and then then other half a few hours later.
Another winner at Frantonio's is their cannoli.  They are filled to order, making them the ideal texture.  The filling is nice and light with just enough sweetness to satisfy your sweet tooth.
Frantonio's is the kind of place that you go out of your way to eat their amazing food.  I'm not in Barrington often, but when I am I always swing by and pick up a couple of sandwiches for me and my husband.
I had the meatball sandwich, the meatballs were good size, but were dry and did not have much flavor. The marinara sauce was ok but only about 2 tablespoons were on it.
Everything I've ever had here has been great! The staff is always super friendly and helpful.

This is one of the best Italian restaurants in & around Barrington. I came in here the other day at around 4:40 pm.  I had no idea that they closed at 5 pm but it was a Monday so it was special hours.  They lady that took my order treated me really nice & didn't mention anything about how they were closing soon.  

I ordered Spaghetti & Meatballs along with Chicken Carbonara.  They prepared everything from scratch.  They lady even gave me a few slices of pizza to take home for free because they were closing soon.  I thought this was very generous.  The prices here were very good as well.  I paid about $8 less total for my meal than I would have at other Italian restaurants.  

When my food was ready I took it home & it was still pretty hot & it was very delicious.  It had been a few years since I had been to Frantonio's but I was not disappointed.  The food was so fresh & the staff there was very kind & polite.  I look forward to eating at Frantonio's again.

My favorite place to eat in the Barrington. They have a ton of options, and everything I've ordered so far has been fantastic! Bread is always incredibly fresh, and the sandwiches are made from scratch. My go to sandwich is the Franco, but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Save room they make great cannoli!

A few co workers and myself went there and all had the "lunch special" which was $5.95 pasta. The problem is that it was a side order portion. When we got the bill it was $27 for 3 small "specials" and 3 waters.....Doesn't a lb. of pasta cost $2 ?.. Thankfully it came with some bread. It might be time to change it from a $ category to a $$.
Won't be back.

If you have cash, this place is great.  As it stands right now, there is a $15 minimum on credit card/debit purchases.  (Visa and Mastercard wouldn't be too happy about that.  Legally, I believe they can only charge a $10 limit.)  They have great food, but I don't plan on going back. Having to buy unnecessary food items is a huge deterrent for me. Sorry, just lost a customer.
Great little family Italian deli.  Everything there is authentic and good.

So, after reading all of the reviews, I was excited to try this place.  I was disappointed.  We tried the delizioso (wrongly named), and the equivalent of an Italian sub - neither of which had much flavor.  The Caesar salad was good.  The bread was good, and the service was good, but our expectations proved to be more than the reality of the product.  
We will visit here again next time we visit Rainbow Records next door.  And, next time, we will try the pasta.  Hopefully, we will see the magic that my fellow Yelpers see in this place.

The service is a little slow, but everyone there is very pleasant. But it's the food that stands out. All four of the meatless sandwiches on the menu are frankly awesome. Fresh bread, fresh veggies, excellent cheese, and killer italian dressing make for some truly top notch comestibles. Additionally, the prices are fair and the portions are generous. Be sure and sample the huge collections of fun sides. Our last visit we ordered the roasted artichoke hearts--so good.
For an Italian Deli this place has it all. The manifesto and the meatball sandwich's are awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes their Italian sandwich traditional style.
A great friendly staff that treats you like family! The food is excellent!

We just got  the best pizza in the area last night - with onions, sausage, and roasted red - perfect crust for me, medium a bit  doughy.  I've had their sandwiches and soups too, all great.  I've introduced a few people to this place and they are all going back.
I usually get takeout for dinner, sit down for lunch.
YES, YES, YES!  A very good secret treasure of Barrington.  Boar's Head meats, great service, I'm hooked. Good family feel, Great homemade sauces! Does not disappoint.

You might miss this place, tucked in a little strip mall, cruising down Northwest Hwy, but it's worth a stop. It's a nice, cozy deli, and the food hits the spot. It's fun to say "Frantonio" so I ordered one.  I enjoyed it out on the patio during one of the few mild days this summer. I had to try a slice of cheese pizza, but wouldn't get it again unless I was desperate for pizza, which is more often than you would think.

This place is great! We came here for lunch on Saturday. For $7.99, they offer home made pasta with your choice of sauce, plus salad and bread. I had the gnocchi with vodka sauce, which was very tasty. My boyfriend had a prosciutto sandwich, which he also like a lot. (Full disclosure: he liked it because it didn't have too much prosciutto but had lots of mozzarella). 

As the name implies, it also has a deli, and all of their homemade pasta and sauce are also for sale frozen. 

For the price, this place was amazing, and I wish they had another location closer to where I live.
This is DEFINITELY the place to go if your in Barrington for lunch! Get the Magnifico w/roast beef xtra.... Tell frank I said hi!

I can't see what the hype is all about here.  The sandwich I ordered at Frantonio's was good, but sub par compared to other local sandwich places like Algonquin Sub Shop or Capri Deli in Palatine.  It was dry, and the bread didn't seem very fresh.

I went to Frantonio's for a working lunch, and I just about lost my mind from the music.  When I walked in, they were playing Christmas music (it's the middle of February!), then they switched to a track about some guy missing his dead mother (depressing!), then they switched to a track with the Chipmunks singing along (annoying!).

I wouldn't be opposed to trying Frantonio's again.  I don't like judging a place based on one visit.  However, I don't see it gaining 5 stars in my book.

Although my husband and I live in the city we knew we'd be spending the afternoon running errands in the Northwest suburbs. On the advice of another Yelper, we decided to try Frantonio's and couldn't have been happier with our lunch. 

They've got a terrific selection of Italian sandwiches (I had the cheese and roasted red pepper) and a wonderful selection of frozen pastas to take home. Although we sampled the deli offerings, the pizza looked amazing. 

I can't recommend it more highly. Shame on you if you're out in the Barrington area and choose to go anywhere else for lunch!

Frantonios is a great little deli to get a delicious sandwich from. Although it's a bit small inside, the food more than makes up for it. Service is very helpful and quick, fairly easy to get your eat on. I would advise to call your order in beforehand to avoid awkward cramped silence waiting for your food.

I used to work in barrington. And now any time I am in the area (and I mean a 20 mile radius) I definitely make a trip  I actually plan my work trips to areas like crystal lake so that I know I can get to frantonios for lunch. Andre's Squisto is all I ever order because it's to die for. The homemade pastas are also a great at-home treat.

Their chicken marsala is quite frankly the best I have ever had. Extremely tender chicken, rich fragrant wine based sauce.  Chicken marsala is my favorite Italian dish and I measure all other competitors to this restaurant.  It's that good.

Great sandwiches on gorgeous fresh bread. Inventive combinations with things like roasted peppers, artichokes and flavorful pesto. Delicious. And they have a deli and some grocery goods, so you can take extra goodies home.

Great beer selection  love the totchos yummy comfort food.. The 5.99 burger night on tuesday and half off tacos on wednesdays are great food specials for during the week nice and cheap :) not very knowlegeable on beer so i usually ask the bartenders who usually reccomend something tasty

Used to love this place. Not sure what's going on but they can't seem to keep an employee for more than a minute. The beer selection used to be fantastic. Great, new exciting craft beers from interesting breweries. Now they've sold out to Miller Coors. The craft beer selection is awful. No decent IPA's outside those crappy ones packaged by the mega breweries. There are millions of better options for both food and beer. If you're looking for a great place for craft beer, skip this and head to The House Pub, Geneva Ale House, Spotted Fox, Riverside Pizza and Pub just to name a few. 

Update to my previously crappy review. No one here tonight but the bartender is still the slowest thing on two legs. He thinks he is the coolest guy around. Just watched a customer go into the kitchen and scream at the cooks about something. Hot mess!

I visited this location a little after lunchtime during the week. The place is really big, but my son and I were he only ones there at the time. I'm sure it's more crowded at night and on the weekends.

Anytime I see Wisconsin Cheese Curds on the menu I have to order it. Just can't help myself. These were yummy. I was less impressed with the Crispy Shrimp Tacos. The rice and beans didn't have much flavor and the tacos were just ok.

Also, for being the only ones there at the time, I thought the service was way too slow and she just wasn't paying any attention to us.

This is the second location I have been to. 

The beer cheese soup was delicious! I highly recommend. 

I find there apps to be over priced $9-$13. I might as well just buy a meal. 

I split their root beer beef sandwich $13 with my mom. They put it on two plates for us precut which was very nice of them. Service was great!

The tator tots were very crispy. A lot of people like them this way but I prefer them on the lightly fried side. 

There weekday happy hours and daily specials were pretty good. I will definitely come back for that!

Called yesterday to inquire about their brunch.  Was told they start at 10 am.  I was sceptical because their sign states they open at  11am everyday...guess what.....the girl that answered the phone was misinformed....of course we went at 10am...and they were not open.   Went to Abby's instead.  Maybe the new staff comments are true...super disappointed.

Awesome food!  We were looking for fish fry since its Lent and the fried cod was very good. Instead of chips I ordered the veggies and was pleasantly  surprised it was so good, zucchini with olive oil and bit of garlic. The shrimp macaroni and cheese was so cheesy and creamy.  Good selection of beers too. They have Steigel.

I'll update my review.  I am crushin' on this joint down the street on Tuesday evenings... 5$ burger night.  ANY signature burger on their menu.  Shiii, you can't even get that at McD's (not that they EVEN compare) just sayin'! And beer ... You like beer?  They got beer.... About a mil' on tap.  Ok... Ok... Not a mil, but a plethora for any palette.   We prefer to take a seat at the bar, we feel service is better.  

My personal fav is the Farmer Burger, but the tipsy burger is a common favorite from other friends.  Hubby gets the blue cheese burger, always pleased.  The side salad is a fresh choice as your side, and really good.  All their salad dressings are homemade.  Not bad for a bar joint, right?  But... With that said.. The tots are the bomb.

See ya on Tuesday.... Gonna change my burger up next week!

I've been to the restaurant probably a dozen times and the service is always a problem. There's never enough servers; they're spread way too thin and they seem to disappear for long periods into the kitchen. The wait for service, a drink, the food, and then the bill takes way too long and its frustrating. If there's a problem, good luck getting your servers attention.  The food is usually okay, and I actually recommend using Tap House for carry-out, because it's good food with a nice selection, and the price is fair.  But the slow service ruins it for me.

An update to an already crappy review. I was going to give this place 2 stars, but based on my crappy time before (June 2015) we're going to knock it down to 1 star. 

We arrived at 8:30 pm on a Saturday (apparently that's the time I always go). I guess when you get to a bar on a Saturday night at 8:30 pm and the place is practically empty, maybe you should leave. We had a group of five. There were 3 groups of 2-3 and 2 people sitting at the bar. We sat around for 10 minutes before the server appeared. There appeared to be one bartender, 2 servers, and one cook (from what I could see) on a Saturday night. We found out later (after waiting for our food) that they thought it was going to be slow so they let a bunch of people go home. Well...it was slow. But, apparently busy by their terms. We ordered (a bunch of easy, fried foods) and received our food 35-40 minutes later. No one came out to help us in that time or explain why our food was taking so long. Also, all of our water or drink glasses were empty. When our food finally arrived, we only received an explanation after asking. No apology from the waiter. However, the manager/bartender came over and apologized, and gave us 50% off our order. And doughnuts. But kind of a late apology. Why not explain and apologize while we were waiting? Shouldn't 4 staff be enough to serve 15 people? 

The food is good, and other locations are normally great. But this location has almost exclusively poor service.

Great bar food.  At least 3 stars above Buffalo Wild Wings.  

Food- We started off with some nachos, which once we got past the top layer of lettuce, were actually quite good.  They had pulled pork on them which was cooked nicely.  For dinner I had 10 BBQ wings.  These are the best wings I've ever had besides melnicks in Chicago.  They had a lot of meat on them and the sauce tasted homemade.  The exotic sauce is the best wing sauce they have by far though.  I'd recommend this place any day over any other sports grill in town.  The root beer was draft too which tasted awesome.  

Service- Service was nice and we had a party of nine and they brought everything pretty fast.

Took off a star because I had the prime rib sliders and while the horseradish creme was amazing, the meat was really fatty and made the sandwich inedible.

Everytime I go to Tap House, the service is outstanding and the food is well presented and tasty. The steak and potatoes are a good choice if you want a hardy meal. I enjoyed the wings last time as well. The atmosphere is great for a Friday night and I will be back soon.

Highly recommend the Tipsy Stout Burger.
Stout glaze over Certified Angus Beef, covered with Merkts cheddar cheese and crispy haystack onions. Served on a pretzel roll.
I have tried almost every burger on the menu, and this one wins-hands down.
Leave room for dessert!
The Ten, Fresh-Sticky chocolate caramel doughnuts is a no brainer!!

A little disappointed with my meal at STC's Tap House Grill.

I've been to the Glen Ellyn location, which was okay, too. I don't think I put in a review for that one, but I ordered the same dish.

My group arrived 10 minutes before noon. We seated ourselves to a mostly empty restaurant and bar. They offer your standard bar fare: burgers, sandwiches, entrees, salads, and some specialties that didn't seem too special to me.

I went with the Kobe Burger (which probably wasn't Kobe; none in the U.S. really is really Kobe, but I have no idea) cooked medium along with a house salad. I ordered the balsamic on the side.

Our order was taken relatively quickly, but we didn't receive our food until about 12:30. The wait had to be between 20 and 30 minutes. I was surprised because the restaurant was empty (one big party had their food before we sat down). 

My burger was blah. Salad was okay; my co-workers ordered wraps, burgers, and sandwiches. My bill was 15.69; definitely not worth it. The burger tasted normal and needed lots of ketchup. I ordered it medium and it was medium well, almost well done.

I won't be returning; I'd prefer a McDonalds burger for taste, and more importantly, price.

Went here for dinner with the family! Had a wonderful meal and great attentive service. I got the apple walnut salad which was delicious. My husband had the steak and ale wedge salad. He said he would get it again in a heart beat. The steak was prepared wonderfully and seasoned to perfection. My kids had burgers and corn dogs and they enjoyed their food as well. I tried a Moscow Mule and that too was great. Tastes like a mojito and a vodka tonic had a baby. My husband enjoyed their Shiner Holiday Cheer beer. It had a grapefruit sweet taste. He really enjoyed it! Glad we went here tonight.

I ordered a Cuban sandwich.  The pork was so dry i could hardly chew it.  When I mentioned this to the waitress she offered to bring me some juice to soften it up!  My dog loved it!
My friend ordered a hamburger med well which was also dry and well done to the max.
Tues is not a good day to eat there. 
We will definitely try another restaurant for our next meeting.

Not what you'd expect for bar food been here several times and never had a bad meal. Tuesday's are half price burgers really like the Farmer Burger and of course you gotta have the tater tots. 

Huge drink menu for beer and mixed drinks so far enjoyed all but one and they offered to replace it no charge. Definitely a nice local pub to visit with friends and family. If you like whiskey and peach schnapps order the peach lightning it blends the two unlikely spirits with lemonade resulting in a great beverage.
Love this place! 40 beers on tap and all the bartenders are super friendly, highly recommend any beer lover try this place out! Their boneless exotic wings are an awesome choice with any beer.

Tap House Grill is another place I want to love, I just don't. The food is fine. The drink selection is good. The Specials are usually great, but the service kinda stinks. It's typically slow and unenthusiastic. This is fine for me because I'll just tip less, but I'm sure the appropriate tip aggravates the servers, which allows them to continue to be slow, no fun and not happy to be at work. 

As for the menu, the apps are all decent. I do really enjoy the nachos by comparison to other bar type places. I don't eat burgers, but I hear they are good. The salads are all good too. As for the beers, there is a good selection and usually something is on special. 

Side note: we went for the family NYE 2015 a we probably won't do that again. It's such a shame, because the concept was awesome, but the execution needs work. 

This location has been in business six years, or is it eight, I think six, they just had an anniversary week, but some attention to detail is going to be needed to make it another six. 

I'll definitely go back, it's close, big and convenient with kids, so I hope some improvements begin soon.
We come here about once a week. Bar area to watch a game and tables that are very family friendly. Good beer selection too.

Pretty nice place.  I don't know if it's because of the hidden location but it never seems real busy there even on Saturdays.  The Charlie Fox location next door seems to be the same way.  Anyways, I've been there twice and both times the service was on the slower side but the food was good.  The first time I had a burger which was good and the last time I went there I had the steak tacos.  I wasn't expecting much seeing as this is an American bar, but the tacos, black beans and rice tasted just as good as if they were made in an authentic Mexican restaurant.

Was here yesterday around lunchtime, for the first time since I was a kid. 

Unfortunately there was only one cook and they did tell us the kitchen is backed up. We decided to stay anyway.
It took our food at least 45 minutes to an hour before it was done. Stressful that we had to wait that long, I wasn't nearly as hungry as when we arrived, by the time they brought us the food. 
I did speak with the server, he said the restaurant was changing managers and that they had accidentally messed up the schedule. Poor employees, they were running around busting their asses (yet remained polite and kind all the while).

I ordered the tipsy stout burger. It was pretty good, a little sweet from the sauce.
Boyfriend ordered the farm burger (has an egg),said it was really good and it looked really good. 
I give this place a thumbs up for having Sprecher root beer on tap, and tater tots as a swappable side for the standard fries. 

-Will be giving it 3 stars, until I come back for next (and hopefully better) experience.

Not for Rum drinkers, mix drinks are inconsistent  ,food is ok but nothing to brag  about. Probably better for beer drinker, the highly praised donuts desert was good for kids but unless you like chocolate syrup stay away.

Very nice atmosphere. Dropped in and had a bowl of soup and deep fried bacon. The food was ok, but I gave 4 stars because of the super atmosphere and service. I plan on going back with friends (maybe after a rugby game) and trying their burgers.
Best boneless wings in St Charles!  Sundays they are $5.50 with fries and get the exotic sauce.  I will be back!   Cheese curds are good too, and kids eat free on Sundays.....Can't beat it!

There was a mess up on our pick up order and when I called to make note of it, management handled this issue in a very professional manner. So friendly I couldn't even be mad! Thanks for the great customer service!
Great beer selection, shrimp tacos were great. Lots of Tv's to watch your favorite game.

Case of the Mondays? All drafts are $3 on Mondays at Tap House. All your problems are solved.

Can't go out on Monday night because you have kids and they're hungry? No problem. Tell your wife to stop trippin'. Your kids can eat FREE on Mondays at Tap House. Didn't I just tell you all your problems were solved? I'm not talking fast, you're just listening slow. 

One time, I walked in here clean shaven and wore a Justin Bieber t-shirt. Then I tried to pass my beer off as apple juice. Just for some free food. But they didn't believe I was 7. It was worth a try.

Monday is by far the best day at Tap House. We had a group of four, and I swear we drank that entire pretentious beer menu at least 3 times, and it came out to about $25 a person. 

All my problems were solved. Until I woke up the next morning.

When you travel with a youth hockey team & their families, finishing a place capable of accommodating you is tough. 

This weekend we had some awful experiences from some very well known restaurants in the Chicago area. 

Tap House stands diametrically opposed to those other places. The restaurants sits on a quiet section of a country road. The place is quaint, but really inviting. The food was delicious -- like surprisingly innovative, yet accessible. You think, "oh, beer & burgers; where's the innovation?" I know... but the menu was really a treat. 

Speaking of treats, make sure you end on the homemade Kit Kat & the donuts. Both were great. 

Oh!! And "adult" root beer? Amazing. 

We loved this place, ate well, laughed a ton & were blown away by the service. 

Kudos, Tap House!

Beer selection is excellent and the staff is very friendly. However, Id say the food is good not great just typical bar fair. I'd recommend coming for some drinks and apps rather then a meal unless you want a very basic burger or sandwich.

Was here yesterday around lunchtime, for the first time since I was a kid. 

Unfortunately there was only one cook and they did tell us the kitchen is backed up. We decided to stay anyway.
It took our food at least 45 minutes to an hour before it was done. Stressful that we had to wait that long, I wasn't nearly as hungry as when we arrived, by the time they brought us the food. 
I did speak with the server, he said the restaurant was changing managers and that they had accidentally messed up the schedule. Poor employees, they were running around busting their asses (yet remained polite and kind all the while).

I ordered the tipsy stout burger. It was pretty good, a little sweet from the sauce.
Boyfriend ordered the farm burger (has an egg),said it was really good and it looked really good. 
I give this place a thumbs up for having Sprecher root beer on tap, and tater tots as a swappable side for the standard fries. 

-Will be giving it 3 stars, until I come back for next (and hopefully better) experience.

Not for Rum drinkers, mix drinks are inconsistent  ,food is ok but nothing to brag  about. Probably better for beer drinker, the highly praised donuts desert was good for kids but unless you like chocolate syrup stay away.

Very nice atmosphere. Dropped in and had a bowl of soup and deep fried bacon. The food was ok, but I gave 4 stars because of the super atmosphere and service. I plan on going back with friends (maybe after a rugby game) and trying their burgers.
Best boneless wings in St Charles!  Sundays they are $5.50 with fries and get the exotic sauce.  I will be back!   Cheese curds are good too, and kids eat free on Sundays.....Can't beat it!

There was a mess up on our pick up order and when I called to make note of it, management handled this issue in a very professional manner. So friendly I couldn't even be mad! Thanks for the great customer service!
Great beer selection, shrimp tacos were great. Lots of Tv's to watch your favorite game.

Can't go out on Monday night because you have kids and they're hungry? No problem. Tell your wife to stop trippin'. Your kids can eat FREE on Mondays at Tap House. Didn't I just tell you all your problems were solved? I'm not talking fast, you're just listening slow. 

One time, I walked in here clean shaven and wore a Justin Bieber t-shirt. Then I tried to pass my beer off as apple juice. Just for some free food. But they didn't believe I was 7. It was worth a try.

Monday is by far the best day at Tap House. We had a group of four, and I swear we drank that entire pretentious beer menu at least 3 times, and it came out to about $25 a person. 

All my problems were solved. Until I woke up the next morning.

When you travel with a youth hockey team & their families, finishing a place capable of accommodating you is tough. 

This weekend we had some awful experiences from some very well known restaurants in the Chicago area. 

Tap House stands diametrically opposed to those other places. The restaurants sits on a quiet section of a country road. The place is quaint, but really inviting. The food was delicious -- like surprisingly innovative, yet accessible. You think, "oh, beer & burgers; where's the innovation?" I know... but the menu was really a treat. 

Speaking of treats, make sure you end on the homemade Kit Kat & the donuts. Both were great. 

Oh!! And "adult" root beer? Amazing. 

We loved this place, ate well, laughed a ton & were blown away by the service. 

Kudos, Tap House!

Beer selection is excellent and the staff is very friendly. However, Id say the food is good not great just typical bar fair. I'd recommend coming for some drinks and apps rather then a meal unless you want a very basic burger or sandwich.

How can you miss with 40 beers on tap? Excellent food, great staff. We will be back sooner than later. My friend was disappointed on three things. 1. No NFL ticket, we could only watch the Bears game. 2. No Labatts. 3. No Bass to make a proper Black & Tan. BUT they do have Small Town Brewery's "Not your fathers root beer" beer on tap (10.5%, not the 19.5%, but thats ok)
Omg. Dog food !!!!  They run this place like morons! Go in there and try the old wings and never go back if you dare. The rest of the food just like I said. Alpo brand or chuck wagon.

I went here last night with a couple friends and it wasn't the best experience I've had at a restaurant. We came to get a couple drinks so our server did not seem pleased that we weren't ordering food. I got the sangria, which was pretty awful. I've never ordered sangria at a restaurant that I haven't liked. Then I got some dragon drink that was just pure sugar, which was also not the best 

The worst part was when we had paid and were sitting around, our server came by and took the umbrella out of our table while we were still sitting there! She almost hit me in the head collapsing it and again with the pole taking it out. She could not have been more rude or annoyed with us. I understand it was late and she probably wanted to go home but come on... That was just plain rude.

First I would like to explain how the last time I was here, I received a mysterious piece of metal in my sandwich. I let this slide after they apologized and comped the meal. Turns out it was a metal(brass) bristle from a brush they use to clean their grills. How the hell it ended up in my sandwich is the real mystery.   So, now I go there, deciding to give them a second chance and get some lunch. Their beer board is out of date and my girlfriend gets a burger with a chunk of frozen mystery meat on top as well as an egg that was meant to be running, but instead sat in a state of gelatinous stillness. The waitress was entirely unapologetic and didn't seem to care at all that we were not pleased with the meal, and just walked away after we brought it to her attention. This place has way too much mysterious stuff going on for my liking. Never going back. Good luck, wary traveller.

Great service, huge beer selection, excellent food and nice atmosphere, what else do you need?  The beer menu is huge, lots of micro brews and local beers on tap and the beer menu changes frequently.  They usually have about 30 different micro brews on tap at any given time, so it's easy to try new beers.  I've had the same server both times I've been here and she's been awesome both times.  Food is great, I've always enjoyed everything I've had here.  It has a nice English pub vibe, not too noisy and more of an adult setting, not a sports bar.   If you are in the area and you love a good micro brew, I would highly recommend checking it out.  If they would just put a Tap House near the Naperville/Aurora area I'd be even happier.  It's still worth the drive.

If I could give zero stars I would, wife spills her glass of wine because of a rickety table and you refuse to comp her? Been coming to this neighborhood bar weekly for 5 years now, apparently loyalty counts towards nothing. Thanks Nate (new GM) for nothing. As convenient as it may be to come back, we won't.

Great selection of beers and really nice pub style menu.  However, actual cooking of the menu fell short. Ordered a farm burger medium but it came out very red. I can live thru that with a nice cut of steak but a burger that red was sketchy. The kitchen was already running very slow as it was a sat night so I didn't say anything - my own fault. My wife ordered the shrimp tacos but the only flavor we tasted was lime. A lot of lime. 

Server was very nice and I like the atmosphere.  Kitchen is the only reason this is a three star and not five though.
Terrible service by servers that wanted to be anywhere else but there.  The food did not make up for it either.  Never, ever going back!!!
First time here.  Cheese curds were great.  Got the "house specialty" and it came out cold.  Sent back.  Overall taste was just ok which makes it over priced.
Average pub good; however, they have they have consistently slowest service off any restaurant ever...ever. I mean ever.
Update on my last review -- customer service at the bar has dramatically improved. Nice job!!

Called in ahead of time to see if they would have a game on TV and the girl who answered the phone confirmed that they would. Showed up that night during a hockey final and they refused to change the channel for us. The server was very rude so we walked out before ordering anything. Very unprofessional.

I went to the Glen Ellyn location before this one so I'm not comparing the two or anything.  I had a good experience there, love the extensive menu AND by signing up on their email list I received a coupon for $10 off $25 around the holidays.  Score!  

I couldn't really get past the appetizers because I wanted to order one of each so instead of setting ourselves up for a food coma of appetizer or appetizers plus meal we decided to just get a few appetizers.  Although I'm not sure I want to admit this but we ordered the "heart attack on a plate" and being their deep friend bacon...yes, you only live once so why not chow down on something you don't see on every menu, right??? Yes, so we ordered that, and well... yeah, it was a plate of breaded goodness, but not greasy or anything.  We also got mini pigs in a blanket, and chili cheese nacho tater tots which were good, but because of the toppings, they got a little soggy but that was expected.  Our server, Breanna was great and overall great experience...and most of all cheap thanks to Tap House Grill sending that great coupon!

There are several locations of this place so if you're near one of them, hit them up!

I was looking for someplace different before going to a movie at Charlestown and happened upon this place via google search.  Reviews were pretty good and the beer selection sounded awesome, so a friend and I chanced it.

We sat at the bar (a very large, wooden, comfortable bar with good views of all the taps) and were greated by a very friendly Andrea.  She was very informative and attentive.  The tap beer list is quite extensive, and after decididng on one, she came back with a half full glass and indicated that was the last of that particular beer.  I could have that beer at no charge.  

Andrea dissappeared for a bit and we had another bartender who really wasnt very friendly - we were happy when Andrea returned to take our beer and food order.  The beers came right up and our food shortly after.

My friend had the beer root beer (Old Town?), which was very tasty!  It is 10% ABV so be careful.  THere were so many good beers on tap to choose from, I had a hard time picking just one.  I ended up with Leinies Snowdrift Vanilla Porter which I've never seen on tap anywhere before.  Very good also.  

We ordered the WIld Mushroom and Brie Chicken sandwich to split.  It came out piping hot on two plates with the sandwhich and tots presplit for us.  We though this was an extra nice touch.  The sandwich was good, especially when dipping in their truffle aioli sauce (we ordered it on the side), as were the tots.  Cooked to perfection.

We had to leave in a hurry to make it to our movie on time, and Andrea was quick to clear our plates, get us our check and process it.  

All in all a very good experience, and we will return in the future for more beer and food tastings.  I beleive you can sample any beer for $1, which is a very nice option to have.
My husband and I visited last night. Food was great (I had the Kobe sliders) but service was slower than we expected. Definitely go as long as you don't have time constraints.

Great place for a beer and a burger. On tap as well as bottled beer list is great. Lots of yummy drinks and of course a good Bloody Mary. (Wouldn't be Sunday if I didn't get one of those). We sat at the bar and were served immediately, it was a Sunday morning and no matter where we sat we would have been served in a timely matter because it wasn't crowded. We ordered the Drunken Shrimp to start, they were great. Spicy and fresh! Not a heavy appetizer which I like. My boyfriend ordered the stuffed burger, a hamburger patty stuffed with jalepano, cheese and bacon on a pretzel bun, we loved it. The fries were great too. I ordered the Exotic wings, Siracha and sweet chili sauce, they were excellent, but not spicy which was disappointing for me but otherwise they were good. I also ordered the beer cheese soup, which was good but not my favorite! I will definitely be back here for the wings and when I'm craving a sandwich. They have a lot of beer and liquor based sauces as well which is unique. The menu is Huge too! Something for everyone! Enjoy!

A family favorite.  In fact, when we went on a Saturday night, I was shocked to see how many other families were there as well.  And, it's on Sundays that kids eat free, so that was part of my shock.  The good thing is that even with so many kids in the place, it didn't sound like Chucky Cheese's.  
For the review, I am going to cut to the chase.  I loved my salad!  It was the kind of salad I would make for myself with tons of veggies.  Plus, the server suggested that I put shrimp on it.  I worried about that b/c I ordered Balsamic dressing, but she said it was "herby", so I trusted her.  So glad that I did.  It was a White Balsamic and it did not overpower the salad.  
We also had an appetizer of cheese curds, yummy, but a little on the salty side.  My husband and youngest shared BBQ wings which they said were better than most places.   And another son had the two mini burgers.  
Lastly, for the beer- all yummy.  And the DH was happy to find Rogue's Dead Guy beer there.

Tap House grill has a lot more space than when they first opened, which I definitely enjoy. The beer list is great- I never have to repeat a beverage because there are so many delicious things to try. I have not tried too many items on their food list- but the chocolate cake was delicious. Service is a bit hit or miss- when they are busy we sometimes sit for awhile with empty beverages- this past time when we were there though our server was very attentive and had great suggestions. I think if there were a few small tweaks this place could be excellent.

Let me preface that I hate people who write overly dramatic reviews but...Nightmare!!!!!  Third try and if it's not last I was kidnapped and held hostage here.  Waited and hour for cold food and actually felt bad for the server who was helping us.  Not her fault she works at this train wreck!
It has always baffled me that the Tap House in Glen Ellyn is so spot on and thiamine just can't get it together.

Can't believe the 3 star rating. Service is fast and friendly. Burgers are some of the best around. Appetizers are creative and excellent. Prices are just fine. Been here a few times now and it's awesome.

Called in ahead of time to see if they would have a game on TV and the girl who answered the phone confirmed that they would. Showed up that night during a hockey final and they refused to change the channel for us. The server was very rude so we walked out before ordering anything. Very unprofessional.

Yes, so we ordered that, and well... yeah, it was a plate of breaded goodness, but not greasy or anything.  We also got mini pigs in a blanket, and chili cheese nacho tater tots which were good, but because of the toppings, they got a little soggy but that was expected.  Our server, Breanna was great and overall great experience...and most of all cheap thanks to Tap House Grill sending that great coupon!
