It has always baffled me that the Tap House in Glen Ellyn is so spot on and thiamine just can't get it together.

Can't believe the 3 star rating. Service is fast and friendly. Burgers are some of the best around. Appetizers are creative and excellent. Prices are just fine. Been here a few times now and it's awesome.

I've visited Tap House on three occasions. Every visit brings mixed reviews. Lets talk beer. Tap beer should be served cold. Beer here is barely cold. Not much head and doesn't flow down the glass as expected. Food is also hit or miss. Being on the mailing list I've received half dozen mailings touting St. Patrick days specials. However their advertising is deceptive. " Shrimp and Scallops, macaroni turns out to be a mixed up mess, not separate shrimp and scallops. Not wanting the unappetizing dish my wife ordered a pot pie.  What was served wasn't a pot pie. It was a thick semi tasteless chicken and peas in a white gravy served in a soup bowl with a puff pastry thrown in the middle. Not what you'd expect ordering a pot pie.  On previous visits I've had the chicken tenders and hamburgers and both were pretty good. I had the fish fry and it likewise was good. But something we ate gave me great stomach distress for most of the next day. I think it was the tarter sauce. Any bar that serves 30 beers on tap should sell cold beer. Service was good with friendly attitudes. But I don't trust any place that has the miss steps this place does at above average prices.

Went to the one in St. Charles.  Had a good, but not awesome, Tap House burger.  Soft pretzel appetizer was really good.  The fried bacon was breaded and disgusting; never thought I'd say bacon was disgusting.  

Beer selection was good though.

No, just no. I wanted to like this place, I really did. My boyfriend and I have been here a number of times and no experience was good. I still cant figure out why we kept coming back again and again. 

Lets start from the top:

1) The customer service her is AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!!! Every single time we've visited this location it takes, no joke, 20 minutes to get JUST our drinks!!! They try to give you excuses that it's super busy but it never is. It's just pure laziness! and they ALWAYS double charge on drinks and instead of clearing it up so you don't pay, they give you a card for a free drink the next time you come in...are you freaking kidding me?! AND they are completely rude when you do tell them that there was a double charge! I think the staff at this location needs a lot of training or they need to just clean house and start over again! 

2) The food is really not that great. I think I've only has one item on the menu that was decent and it was the Chicken Caesar Panini. The other items I've had there like loaded tater "totchos", Kobe Sliders and the Pesto Chicken and Bacon Wrap were super bland but the Salmon was WAY too salty. 

3)They has a large list of beer but almost all of them are always sold out. I think they need to learn how to keep their beers in stock since they are a Tap House!

We will not be returning to this location. I suggest going to the Geneva Tap House instead. MUCH better customer service and food!

Food is mediocre, except for the tots, I like when restaurants offer tots. The service is horrible. Had to ask for all my refills instead of just being given one when the cup was low  The chicken beast in my sandwich was dry. My daughter disliked the chicken fingers, and that is her food of choice when eating out. Kids eat free on Sundays, but not if you also order the boneless wing special, would have been nice to know ahead of time. After waiting for our food for 20 minutes we were then informed one of our dishes was out of ingredients, this should have been addressed when the order was put in. One of our dishes was also brought out about 5 minutes after everyone else, and 3 of us ordered it, so it should not have been and issue, and when it did come out the tots were missing. Not sure I'll give them another chance.

The TAP House was a second choice as another, nearby haunt was too full. Parking was perfect and there is open air seating in pleasant weather. Upon entering, three of us sat at the elevated floor area and shorter chairs. Not many people, so seating was easy. Here are things I see right away. Lots of TVs with different sports. A large chalk board with TAP beers. A large U-shaped bar.Centralized bathrooms.  Lots of waiters. 
     So, the bartender checks on me as I peruse the TAP list on the chalkboard. She gives me a printout to explain each beer; name, brewery, ABV, size of glass, cost. I asked for a sample of a Scotch Ale and it was free, all done with a smile.
     I returned to my friends and explained the beers as they are not beer snobs. Almost half of their beers are from Founders in Grand Rapids, MI. ..... a fantastic brewery. There are local beers too. There are 30 - 40 bottle beers as well. We ordered Porters and Stouts, they were all malty delicious with good ABV.  
I went to the restroom. It was large, clean and easy to use.
I ordered the Tasty Burger, a house specialty. Fast service.  It was cooked with beer and covered with onion strings, lettuce, pickles, all on a pretzel roll. It was good but not outrageous or anything. The roll was dense and could stand up to anything, nice and chewy too. The burger was good but a shade bland. The pickles............AWESOME PICKLES. I wanted a bowl of them. The tater tots were great too. My friends liked their burgers. One was stuffed with cheese and jalapenos.  The other was a blue cheese burger, always good. 
     The mark of a real TAP house isn't the faux kilts, a beer list with Blue Moon or clad with a Guinness mirror. It should have open space to move, be inviting, a great selection of micro brews, including some locals, regional and nationals, It should have some Industrial Swill (Bud, Miller) for the uncultured. It should have a traditional game or two like darts.. 
     However, it should say Beer Snob! The TAP House achieves this with The Periodic Table of Beers. Harken back to high school and your chemistry class. It had a periodic table of elements, Pb, O, Au, Ag, etc.....molecular weights, etc.... Well The Periodic Table of Beers categorizes all types of beer in a similar manner; styles, ABV, gravity, etc... So, if you are a beer snob, hit the TAP House; good food, great beers and a nice "BEER" place.
      If your are just a snob, go someplace else; order your foie gras, bitch about waiting for 10 minutes and use your credit card too.

username: R I C K Y B O B B Y.
review_text:
Have to admit, I am kind of surprised by the negative reviews.  My family and I have been here no less than 10 times, and we have never had the problems as described by others.  Staff has always been very helpful and accommodating to us (we have three kids under 5).  I have had numerous things on the menu and have not been disappointed by any.  My personal favorites are the burgers.  The steak tacos are excellent though, and the chicken fingers, are a hidden secret.  My kids "order" them, but I end up "eating" them.  My favorite aspect of THG though is the beer menu and the $1 taster drinks you can get.  I am starting to learn more and more what I do like and don't in terms of beers, but I am no expert by any means.  Add to it, that I love to try new beers and the $1 tasters are perfect for me.  I will usually order one beer that I know I will enjoy and then 2-3 tasters to see if I find a new one to try out next time I am in.

Kids eat free on Monday's if families are interested.  There is plenty of "dining room" area away from the bar, so don't worry about your kids being in a bar atmosphere.

I will be back soon!

While the waitress we had was friendly, there was another waitress working in a different area who seemed quite unhappy. Every time I saw her she seemed to be making a rather disgusted face, as if serving her tables was beneath her. This location had an excellent selection of dark beers on nitro, which greatly appealed to me. I tried the chicken caesar press. It was kind of bland, not much of a caesar taste to it. One of my friends had the pretzel prime rib dip and didn't think too highly of it. The other tried the braised beef and gouda. Again, not a knockout. If you go, I guess stick to the Kobe burger as they seem to do a good job with that at least.
Great beer selection. Very friendly staff. I had the Kobe burger, delicious cooked perfectly. The pretzel appetizer and fried pickles weren't very good. We will be back to try some more!

The food here has really gone downhill. The last time I was here, I ordered the fish and chips, which used to be awesome-big pieces of cod that were perfectly fried and served on a mountain of fries. Now, the fish and chips is a sad little collection of greasy fish sticks and a handful of fries. I was willing to chalk that up to one bad visit, but when we went back for dinner today, the food had slipped downhill even further. We ordered their fried pickles for $10, and got about 12 slightly burned, super greasy pickle chips served on a bed of wilted salad greens. We didn't even finish the meager portion because they weren't worth it, but even though we told the waitress we weren't fans when she checked in, nobody offered to comp the bad app for us. Service was underwhelming. I was served a pumpkin ale instead of the tripel I had ordered. The rest of our food was...meh. I won't be back, which is a shame-at one point, this place used to be good.

Beer selection outstanding! Wings are very good. I like the beer pairings with the different entrees.

Service is good as I think the bartender is involved with ownership.

I want this place to be good because it's right next to my house. But every time they're under staffed and service is so slow. The food is good. But if you don't have an hour or more to kill it, I suggest going somewhere else.

Still a great neighborhood bar. Beer selection was a little weak this week, but we split a kobe burger and man was it excellent! We substituted a salad for the fries and the kitchen did a great job of splitting the burger and salad and plating it for us. Nice!

BLAHHH!! The only reason I came here is because I accidently ordered restaurant.com coupons for the wrong place. The only good thing about this place was the coke. hahaha We had some queso dip that yea, tasted like Velveeta mixed with salsa. It came with the chips and bread. When we ordered more chips the waitress said it would be a while because they fry them to order, umm...where? the next town over? because when we got them they were not warm and tasted like they came right out of a bag, not a fryer. 

The Taphouse Stuffed burger sounded so delicious (Stuffed with jalapeno, bacon, and cheese I think), so I said ok, I'll be spontaneous and order it, bad choice. The burger was SOOO pink inside I could not finish it. I bit off the cooked pieces and tried dipping it into the "stuffing". Never again. 

Drinks here is the only thing I'd recommend. Sorry. ; )

We had gone here several times and before would have rated it very high. The burgers used to be awesome but sometime after they remodeled the site in STC they switched the burgers to some cheap frozen patty. And also switched the buns to some terrible one.

Will probably give them one more chance and if they have not brought back the original quality burger they will never see us again. Which is a shame because the old burger was maybe the best around.

Wife and I went here for beers and appetizers and were not disappointed.  If you're a beer drinker, you will enjoy this place.  A huge number of unique beers on tap!  Good atmosphere and the bartender was very attentive and knew her beers.  We also had the fried cheese curds and were quite good but a bit salty for my taste.  Overall, will definitely come back when in the area!

Beer selection is (usually) supurb--- am a huge fan of their monthly beer specials, a couple months back it was my favorite Stone IPA for $3.50 a draft.. can't beat that!

The food is "meh" -- typical bar food, not bad, but nothing worth mentioning.  The service is also so so... (I'd suggest heading here for drinks and then grabbing dinner elsewhere.)

Tip:  Stop by a night when they have trivia!  Always a good time.
This is my wife's favorite haunt! The stuffed burger and tots are amazing. 40 beers on tap and close to home. Who could complain?

Staff and food are AMAZING!!!!!! Had a small disrepancy with my order and not only did the cook AND manager come out to apologize they bought my meal,a dessert of my choice AND the cook wrote down their hummus recipe for me to take home. This place is top notch. Its my new favorite spot!!!!
Horrible service, and just when you think it cant get worse the server finds a way to suck as much as the menu.  Bland and nasty.  Dont make this mistake. Why cant i give no stars?

Only two stars because I've experienced better here before.  This used to be our go-to place, but over the last couple months things have been going downhill.  The chili is soup-like, with more beans than beef.  The fish and chips dinner is down to two pieces of cod.  My beef-and-gouda sandwich was a shadow of its former self, and even lacked any gouda (making it more like beefy stew on Italian bread).  Even the pickles used for the garnish seem more thinly sliced than usual.  The burgers are still okay, although I question why they put "Tipsy Stout" sauce on both sides of the bun, making it a mess to eat.  Service, while friendly, is always hit-and-miss, anyway.  And while the crowds still come (more families than before), I think we'll try some other places for a few months to see if things get better.

Still a great neighborhood bar. Beer selection was a little weak this week, but we split a kobe burger and man was it excellent! We substituted a salad for the fries and the kitchen did a great job of splitting the burger and salad and plating it for us. Nice!

BLAHHH!! The only reason I came here is because I accidently ordered restaurant.com coupons for the wrong place. The only good thing about this place was the coke. hahaha We had some queso dip that yea, tasted like Velveeta mixed with salsa. It came with the chips and bread. When we ordered more chips the waitress said it would be a while because they fry them to order, umm...where? the next town over? because when we got them they were not warm and tasted like they came right out of a bag, not a fryer. 

The Taphouse Stuffed burger sounded so delicious (Stuffed with jalapeno, bacon, and cheese I think), so I said ok, I'll be spontaneous and order it, bad choice. The burger was SOOO pink inside I could not finish it. I bit off the cooked pieces and tried dipping it into the "stuffing". Never again. 

Drinks here is the only thing I'd recommend. Sorry. ; )

We had gone here several times and before would have rated it very high. The burgers used to be awesome but sometime after they remodeled the site in STC they switched the burgers to some cheap frozen patty. And also switched the buns to some terrible one.

Will probably give them one more chance and if they have not brought back the original quality burger they will never see us again. Which is a shame because the old burger was maybe the best around.

Wife and I went here for beers and appetizers and were not disappointed.  If you're a beer drinker, you will enjoy this place.  A huge number of unique beers on tap!  Good atmosphere and the bartender was very attentive and knew her beers.  We also had the fried cheese curds and were quite good but a bit salty for my taste.  Overall, will definitely come back when in the area!

Beer selection is (usually) supurb--- am a huge fan of their monthly beer specials, a couple months back it was my favorite Stone IPA for $3.50 a draft.. can't beat that!

The food is "meh" -- typical bar food, not bad, but nothing worth mentioning.  The service is also so so... (I'd suggest heading here for drinks and then grabbing dinner elsewhere.)

Tip:  Stop by a night when they have trivia!  Always a good time.
This is my wife's favorite haunt! The stuffed burger and tots are amazing. 40 beers on tap and close to home. Who could complain?

Staff and food are AMAZING!!!!!! Had a small disrepancy with my order and not only did the cook AND manager come out to apologize they bought my meal,a dessert of my choice AND the cook wrote down their hummus recipe for me to take home. This place is top notch. Its my new favorite spot!!!!
Horrible service, and just when you think it cant get worse the server finds a way to suck as much as the menu.  Bland and nasty.  Dont make this mistake. Why cant i give no stars?

Only two stars because I've experienced better here before.  This used to be our go-to place, but over the last couple months things have been going downhill.  The chili is soup-like, with more beans than beef.  The fish and chips dinner is down to two pieces of cod.  My beef-and-gouda sandwich was a shadow of its former self, and even lacked any gouda (making it more like beefy stew on Italian bread).  Even the pickles used for the garnish seem more thinly sliced than usual.  The burgers are still okay, although I question why they put "Tipsy Stout" sauce on both sides of the bun, making it a mess to eat.  Service, while friendly, is always hit-and-miss, anyway.  And while the crowds still come (more families than before), I think we'll try some other places for a few months to see if things get better.

We came here for the large beer selection, and the interesting menu.  
We had the fried cheese curds, which were pretty good. It appears they are battered and fried on site, unlike some pre-made ones I have had at other places. 

I had the special, which was a blue cheese burger with onions and hot sauce.  The burger was way overcooked and kind of dry.  I ate it anyways, since I really don't like to complain about things at restaurants. 

I might return for the beer menu, and to have a meal that isn't as sensitive to being cooked too long.

We came here for dinner because we were given a gift card. We didn't realize it was kids eat free night or dollar drafts, both nice surprises. The food was just ok, beer selection good, but I do not recommend bringing kids- even at 5 pm on a Monday there were clearly drunk and very rude people at the table next to us who were trying to pick a fight. The topper was the server said she couldn't get our brand new, perfectly good gift card to work so we had to use another payment. The manager was consulted and he said their "server was down" so they couldn't take gift cards! (it was working fine for our debit card however). Overall, it was an awful experience and we will not be back, not even to use the gift card that they may or may not accept. I gave 2 stars for the food and beer.

If at all possible, skip this location.  I had been to a different Tap House Grill the night before and LOVED it, so when asked, my friend wanted to go, too.  Especially after I raved about the food and she saw the online menu.  So we decided to go to this location in St. Charles because it was closer--BIG mistake.

The hours say they open at 11.  We got there at 11:05, walked in, and there was nobody there.  Not just no patrons, but no bartender, no waitress, no hostess.  We sat there for a while waiting patiently, and then started to call out "hello??".  About 3 minutes later, the bartender comes out and says "oh, we didn't know you were here--technically we're not open".  Ok, lady, then you probably shouldn't have your hours listed as 11 am and your door unlocked...

So anyway, our server was Ashley.  She.was.awful.  She gave attitude about everything, she rushed us through looking at the menu, and our drinks were empty for about 15 minutes every time before we had to ask her to refill them.

Plus, about 20 minutes after we ordered (so we should have been getting our food anytime...) the waitress comes out and says to my friend who ordered a burger "we don't have any meat--someone forgot to take it out of the freezer last night".  OK, first of all, what??  And second of all, it took them over 20 minutes to realize this and try to fix it?  So they made my friend rush and pick something else while she hovered over us, and my friend hated what she had.

Plus, I ordered the homemade kit kats for dessert, and they were HALF the size they were at the Glen Ellyn location the night before.

Good points--the chicken and mushroom panini and the jalapeno macaroni and cheese.

Bad points--everything else

Avoid this location at all costs!!

if i would have written this review about a year ago it would have gotten another star. food used to be good and all the sudden the quality went down. they swapped out the   bread on my fav sandwiches and almost seemed to start caring less about the food in general.
Great beer.  Good food.  Good service.  I love bringing my family that includes 2 school-aged children to this place.  In fact, on Monday nights, they eat free.

This unassuming place looks like so many others where you get the usual "pub grub" BUT not so! The owner is a classically trained chef who brought the family to the suburbs a few years ago, and put a definite culinary flair on his menu. Yes, you got your cheeseburgers, fries and the like, but where can you find freshly fried tater tots, and they even take those and make them into tater-totchos   -yumm!

The blue cheese mushroom flatbread is to die, along with a brilliant flatbread with apples, brie and homemade caramel sauce. Everything there is MADE THERE! Even the salad dressings. The other thing they do that is great is they offer different sides, like a salad instead of fries or tots, but a NICE salad. Hubby loves the wings, they are more like mini drumsticks. Very meaty and 5 different hotnesses (Is that a word??)

Beer pairings are always mouthwatering too, they do those about once a month.

This place is definatley our default "Where do you wanna go tonight" place. Always good.

The only caution I have is when they say spicy, they mean it! If you are spicy-phobic, stay away from those items........
Nice beer selection, good service!

Unfortunately had I had yelp
2+ yrs ago when I discovered this place, it probably would have been a 5 star rating. Sadly tho, a former fav of mine is sliding down hill on my statute of favorites. There food is great and probably their granite cornerstone, their service is the weak ankle keeping this place from becoming a marathon winner. Slow re-fills, slow/inaccurate order taking, slow turn around times for food on perceivably slow days. I know it's not BK, but still...  Great beer and wine selection. 20 on tap and always changing. Better place fit late night apps and drinks really.

So yeah...tried this place with some friends for dinner and all I can say is...blah!  We started off with the Cheddar Ale dip that came with "homemade" chips and multigrain toast points?...  So the dip was just like a Velveeta with salsa dip, and not even very warm, the "toast points" were half slices of a multigrain bread that tasted pretty much just like rye and didn't go very well with the dip.  And the "homemade" chips could have been homemade but definitely not to order like most places, they were not warm and greasy like you would expect, instead they were cold and just okay.  **And we asked for more chips cause we were famished and there was definitely not enough on the plate for the dip, and they charged us $.50...how ridiculous is that?!?!**

So after waiting what felt like forever to get our appetizer, we got our food a good while after that!  Three of us had the stuffed burger and our other friend had the Cuban.  The one thing I liked was that they offered tater tots as a side option...and let me tell you...if you offer tater tots, I am FOR SURE gonna get them!!!  And they were very good.  But the rest of the food was just okay.  We weren't asked how we wanted our burgers and they came very pink inside which wasn't a good thing for O or myself (since I am trying to get pregnant and all).  The burgers tasted pretty good, but definitely not anything that I would HAVE to have at a later date.  

We were given our bill soon after we were finished eating which was a shock since service had otherwise been very slow.  But then I had to track someone down to take our bill cause our waitress went MIA!  And after the bill was taken, there was some BS about our Restaurant.com coupons that took an extra like 15 minutes!!!!!!!!  So...seriously...this place is just NOT that good.  Maybe it would be a nice spot to just stop in for some drinks but definitely not for a decent dining experience!

And PS...the food is described on here as American (Traditional)...def not!  It is bar food at best!

I'm a musician and went here to do a show with my band on a Saturday night.  Granted they are not necessarily set up for live music, but the setup  area was a nightmare. 

Besides that, the servers here are terrible, one in particular who made it seem we were wasting her time asking about beer specials and food details.  Another, the one who rang us up, took our card and disappeared, we had to walk over and ask them where my card was and they were not very serious about finding it. Come to find out she also charged my card twice, bit i didn't find out til i checked my bank statement. 

Overall, the food was just ok and the waitresses were just plain bitchy, rude and not properly trained.

The beer list here is stellar and constantly changing, which I think is great.  There is always enough choices that it can be tricky making a decision of where to start.  Service tends to be friendly without being overbearing.  My only beef is that they call themselves a gastropub.  No. They are pub-ish.  No gastro about it.  The food is greasy and tasty, but nothing different from other bars.  Wings, burgers, fried bacon, salads and wraps, all of which are...okay.  But if you want to call yourself a gastropub, make your menu a notch better than standard pub grub.

We have gone to this place 4x. Not for the food but for the superb beer selection. Where else can you get Sucks and Hopslam on tap?!?!  The food is meh.  The one bartender is quite funny because I sat at the bar and watched him poor three riduculous, drunk (annoying, loud, over served) chicks a bunch of free Irish car bombs.  I know they were free bc he said "they're on me".  Then he left us waiting to pay our bill while he went out and smoked with the ubber drunk girls. Awesome. I think that my tip for this place is to go:  order an awesome beer,  drink it, order the chicken fingers and tots, eat it, order another tasty beer AND nothing else.  You will enjoy your experience if you follow my instructions closely.  Order the shrimp and expect to grab a seat on the toilet for a looooooong time. Just saying. I believe we will see this joint in bar rescue in a couple years!

I was told this place was great. We went Sat. for lunch. The service was great, that's why I gave it any stars. We started with the cheese curds buffalo style. They were cold and over salted by a lot. The beer was so good, ice cold and it was a hot day. We got the tacos. My wife got the tilapia and I got the shrimp. I tried the fish taco and had a hard time getting it down. The shrimp taco was just ok. I will not be back for food maybe a beer.

Great: Best Bloody Mary (pricey), Beer selection and atmosphere. OPEN LATE FOR DINNER. When the restaurants close in downtown St. Charles, this place is open.
Food: Lots of choices but I haven't really enjoyed anything much during my last 3 visits. I keep trying something new. Besides the food, the service is also hit or miss.
They used to have the best chicken tenders ever. Now they changed to a beer batted and there just like everyone else. I can't understand why they would do that?!!!

Word to the wise- don't go out to eat the day after a holiday. Especially don't order fish the day after a holiday-you will be disappointed. I usually get the best food & service at this location but not today. I stood & waited for a while as who I thought was the hostess but was'nt  sure put on jacket & wisked outside leaving me standing there. Probably having a smoke came back in & snuck behind the bar like I would'nt think that was the same person. Finally got my waiter & my food & I'm off. I 've had great food & service here before by the very SAME staff. I won't be bothering to drive out to the edges of 64 for rude service & awful food again.

Finding a tasty burger is always a big find for me and so it is Tap House Grill delivers that big find.

I've tried the Kobe burger and that Black Angus and for me there is a noticeable difference I rate the Kobe as Very Good and the Angus as GOOD. One of the things that both deliver is a well toasted bun, which for me is a big plus when it comes to rating burgers

Both burgers are very juicy and respectable in size

Another big hit for THG is they have my favorite root beer Specher's on tap. It is a bit pricy at $3 a glass and if it was a bottomless glass at $3  THG would get 5 stars.

My wife had the house salad on her 1st visit w/Kobe burger and enjoyed the salad so much on our second visit, she went with the salad only. She preceded it with the hummus appetizer and she said it was very good, quite good tasty.

Both visits are server was Theresa and she was very friendly, the restaurant is quite clean. I have not really study the selection of beers (yet), but there seems to be an good selection. Several TV's tuned to mostly sports stations add a plus if you are a sports fan. Both visits were during the day and the patrons were quiet, but I can't assure that is the case during a Hawks game or night time visit.


In short as the star rating says I'm a fan
Not bar food!  Unique and delicious food.  Always something different and tasty.    Cuban sandwich is outstanding .

I have been to this location many times, as well as the Oswego location. I love their food - very different than your average bar food and lots of options for a vegetarian. 
However, I am afraid this location has gone down hill. My bf and I went there on a Saturday night, tables were open and we got a seat right away. Shortly after we were seated 3 tables around us were seated as well. After 15 minutes, a waitress took drink orders from the surrounding tables but did not greet us (just acknowledge I'm there! Please). After waiting an additional 10 minutes - now 25 minutes in - and still not waitress we left. I was very disappointed, I was really looking forward to a beer and good food. 
It was not always this way, but I doubt I will be able to convince my bf to try it again.
Had some really good food and beer at this location.  The food and beer pairings on Wednesday's are a lot of fun.

We have gone to this place 4x. Not for the food but for the superb beer selection. Where else can you get Sucks and Hopslam on tap?!?!  The food is meh.  The one bartender is quite funny because I sat at the bar and watched him poor three riduculous, drunk (annoying, loud, over served) chicks a bunch of free Irish car bombs.  I know they were free bc he said "they're on me".  Then he left us waiting to pay our bill while he went out and smoked with the ubber drunk girls. Awesome. I think that my tip for this place is to go:  order an awesome beer,  drink it, order the chicken fingers and tots, eat it, order another tasty beer AND nothing else.  You will enjoy your experience if you follow my instructions closely.  Order the shrimp and expect to grab a seat on the toilet for a looooooong time. Just saying. I believe we will see this joint in bar rescue in a couple years!

They were cold and over salted by a lot. The beer was so good, ice cold and it was a hot day. We got the tacos. My wife got the tilapia and I got the shrimp. I tried the fish taco and had a hard time getting it down. The shrimp taco was just ok. I will not be back for food maybe a beer.

Food: Lots of choices but I haven't really enjoyed anything much during my last 3 visits. I keep trying something new. Besides the food, the service is also hit or miss.
They used to have the best chicken tenders ever. Now they changed to a beer batted and there just like everyone else. I can't understand why they would do that?!!!

Not bar food!  Unique and delicious food.  Always something different and tasty.    Cuban sandwich is outstanding .

However, I am afraid this location has gone down hill. My bf and I went there on a Saturday night, tables were open and we got a seat right away. Please). After waiting an additional 10 minutes - now 25 minutes in - and still not waitress we left. I was very disappointed, I was really looking forward to a beer and good food. 
It was not always this way, but I doubt I will be able to convince my bf to try it again.
Had some really good food and beer at this location.  The food and beer pairings on Wednesday's are a lot of fun.

A hidden Jem,most Saturday afternoons rather quiet but food speaks for it self.
Drunken shrimp, The Bomb!!!
I go often because everything is to die for.
Order 3 appts.w/guest, you get to try more.
Only drawback....pay attention to your bill they seem to misprice drink specials
I will be back

We came here to check the potential for a rehearsal dinner location.  They unfortunately don't have a party room but the manager (?) is SO nice and is completely willing to push tables together for us and offered to buy us dinner so we could check out the food.  How can we say no to free dinner?  (Lest it influences my review, we did end up paying only because we wanted to, not because he didn't live up to the bargain.  He was actually upset with us that we grabbed the check.)
Anyway, I had the Cuban sandwich and Honey had the pulled pork sliders.  He loved his sliders and I thought the cuban was pretty good.  I thought it was missing the mustard component to give it that "tang" and the pickles were more bread and butter than dill (I don't know what a traditional Cuban is supposed to have on it but I much prefer dill pickles).  Had the fries too and they were just fine.  The Mac and Cheese varieties look very good as do most of the meat sandwiches (lots of glazes and stuff).  Actually, the whole menu looks pretty good!
We're undecided about the rehearsal dinner but we had a good time with some good food.
Note: the place does get pretty loud around dinner time.  We were there from 5-6pm and the noise level only grew.  That would be one drawback to the party.

We headed up here on one of those bitter cold days (01/17/09) and were really happy we did.  Although we had to park pretty far away from the door, it was worth it.

We were seated quickly and ordered up some drinks.  We also ordered up some starters, the Pulled Pork Sliders and the Cheddar & Ale dip.  Wow, both were fabulous.  It had us both thinking about ordering the Pulled Pork dinner but we didn't but will when we go again.

MK ordered the Chicken Wrap and was pleased, I the Jerk Chicken Sandwich.  It was the perfect Jerk seasoning (well, in my mind it was) and we were really pleased with dinner as well.  Waitress was even kind enough to get us some fruit for Aidan since he had already burned through the food we brought for him and seemed to be wanting a lot more.

We were too full for dessert but we will have to do that when we go again.  I love any place that has Sprecher Root Beer on tap as well.  That's some really wonderful stuff .

Can't wait to go again.

Tried to go here for an early dinner on Mother's Day. I was very excited for the build your own Bloody Mary Bar. We walked in and a server told us the hostess would seat us, it was not busy at all, bar was about a quarter full, seating area was no where near full, maybe 4 other families.  We sat down and waited while servers took other tables orders, and ignored us. waited a few min, and got up and left, THEN the hostess thanked us for coming.   LACK of service, no one paying attention...really dissapointed. Walked down to Charlie Foxes and had pizza and beer instead!!

This place doesn't look like much when you pull up. It's in a strip mall with windows full of generic neon beer signs. However, the food was surprisingly good. The atmosphere inside was a little too much of a rowdy sports bar for me, especially when you are spending a little bit more for a nicer meal. The music was so loud my friend and I had to shout to hear each other. There were lots of rowdy, drunk patrons yell at the sporting events on the jumbo screens. Also, the beer and wine menu on the table was completely out of date. It took 3 orders before I was able to find a drink that they actually still had. I think if you were looking to go out and watch sports and drink beer then this place would be a nice spot, with the added bonus of good food. The good food doesn't really outweigh all the negatives for me however.

Sorry folks, bad experience with our waitress here tonight.
And let me preface that by saying I am a former bartender and make friends with our servers almost everywhere we go out!
No complaints with the food, although I give the salsa about a 1.5 on a scale of 0-5.  It was fresh, but not my favorite.
Tuesday night burger night.  Kind of a create your own burger. Burgers were great, decent beer selection, and along with everybody else, love the tots.
Service was another issue.  Our server Rachel seemed to have a chip on her shoulder from the moment we sat down.  Perhaps it's because we had the girls with us (a 9 year old and the birthday of our 6 year old).   Hard to pinpoint one exact moment that put us over.  I'd say her attitude was bad and only got cumulatively worse.  Up to the point where everyone at the table heard our friend (adult friend) order fish tacos.  When the food came the server asked if we had everything and when we said no, we need fish tacos she responded with "no, fish and chips".  And we all said "no, fish tacos" and she responded bitterly with "well I heard fish and chips".  
Too much to go into, but an overall b...h.  We'll go back but if we have her, we'll request a different server.
As a side note:  when we left, my buddy Jason went to the manager and complained.  The manager thanked him for letting him know, stating people never say anything.  So if you have bad service, let someone know.  Perhaps they just don't know there is an issue.

I want to like this place. We live right by it and it's very easy to get  take put from here. Its just very hit or miss when you get takeout. My husband cheese is usually missing from his beef and Gouda and today my jerk fish sandwich was chicken. When you eat in the beer selection is awesome and the food and appetizers are great. Just maybe don't get takeout.

This was our second time here.  The first time was okay, not anything impressive.  I wouldn't have come again, but my son chose to go there for his birthday.  He got the pulled pork sandwich (again) which he liked.

Here's the rest...the food is terrrible.  Calamari: so salty, couldn't stand it.  Side salad with Bleu cheese dressing: tasted like no dressing, there was something white on there and there were some croutons that were extremely burnt (black).  Thought they were pumpernickel until I ate one and spit it out.  Child's pizza: soggy pita bread with sauce and cheese; obviously not eaten by my son.  Ordered another kids item instead.  Mac & cheese.  Seriously, you can't do that wrong.  Apparently you can.  He wouldn't eat that.  

Daughter's $11.99 5 cheese mac and cheese: soupy mess with too much bread crumbs.  She ate maybe a third of it.  Said it was bad.  And, really, $11.99?  It's pasta and what looked like some sauce made with Velveeta.  Meatball Panini: sounded good.  Tasted terrible.  I was hungry and could only manage to choke down 1/3 of it.  They were served with super salty tater tots.

Stay away from this place unless you just plan on having beer.  That was fine and their $2.49 bottomless sodas.  You need a lot of soda because of the salt overload and to wash down tasteless and disgusting food.

4.45 Stars.
Really dug this place. Had the corndog-scalops, pulled pork sliders, and the chopped chicken salad. The food was tastey my favorite was the scalops. The menu was inventive, unique, and playful... a rariety in the suburbs where many bars have play it safe menus catering to the conservative tastebuds of the republicans who live in places like Saint Charles. I digress... We had a couple Two Brothers Domane Dupage which was on draft, that is until one round came with an Oberon glass... apon further investigation we found they had it draft, what a wonderful discovery in such a dreadful town....
I would have given the 5 but for being called the "taphouse" their 20 drafts were not that impressive, sure they have to cater to the locals, but I would have liked to see some more interesting stuff. Glassware is an issue, the Oberon came in a pint glass which is not how it should be served.

My husband and I went in for lunch early on a Saturday afternoon, and there was a decent crowd.  Maybe a total of 8 tables, including ours.  The food was just plain sub par.  My husband ordered the stuffed burger, which he said was bland.  But the worst part was that the bottom of the burger had this thick layer of burnt grease.  At least, that's what I assume it was, but it was gross.  I ordered the chicken chipotle salad.  The chicken tenders were cold and soggy, but had certain areas where the breading was very crunchy - and not in a good way.  It led me to believe that they were cooked the day before, and then taken out of the fridge, drenched in sauce and thrown in my salad.  The lettuce was also incredibly soggy.  The service was great though, and our waitress was very nice.  But I don't think we will be going back - Tuesdays they have cheap burgers, and if we are in the area MAYBE we will drop in - but it's certainly not worth paying full price.
We drove by this place a million times and only stopped because we met up with a friend. It was great. Food was excellent. Slightly more $ than average but good specials. I can't wait to go back.

The Taphouse is a pretty nice place with classier decor and friendly staff.  The strawberry martinis are fantastic (made with strawberry puree) and the drinks are reasonably priced.  I'm a big fan of the cheesy crab bread and the flatbread, but there was not much else I found appealing.  Although it's called the Taphouse, the beer selection isn't that varied (if you're looking for more draft beers head to Alley 64).  I really like how it's kind of tucked away, definitely a good chill spot if you're just getting a couple drinks with friends or a quick bite to eat.

My husband and I just ate at the Tap House this afternoon. We must of had the same bartender as Blaine H., I wish I'd gotten her name. I had the Cuban sandwich with tater tots and my husband had the calamari appetizer. My sandwich wasn't bad and the tots were quite good but who can't cook them as long as you have an oven. The calamari however were another story, painfully undercooked and downright nasty. We told the really unfriendly bartender who said she'd take it off the bill but never said how sorry she was and that she hoped we'd come back again soon and try something else.
Most disappointing was the bartender who spent most of her time behind the wall I assume in the kitchen doing something. She had a great opportunity to turn our bad experience into a good one if she had a MUCH better attitude. I'm pretty sure I've run into her evil twin at a different location in St C, but I'll be nice and not mention her name.

The food is really outstanding, especially for a pub and there's some different fare on a decent-sized menu.  I really want to give this place a higher review, but you just can't go there when you're in a hurry, and since I work in St. Charles and basically only ever want to go there for lunch, the service element is a huge pain.  In their defense, our waitresses have always been nice, but the place is clearly understaffed and they are always working their butts off and struggling to keep up.  The food comes out slowly, so I assume it's the same situation in the kitchen.  It's a shame that they aren't quicker because it's a cute place (the interior REALLY looks like it doesn't belong in a strip mall, which is where the Taphouse is located) and not very crowded since it's somewhat isolated, but the food is so good that chances are, I'll suck it up and deal with it again one of these days.
Great food/chef. Service excellent. Laid back environment and plenty of sports on the tv's.  Love the complimentary wi-fi.

Great food! We ordered the crab-creamcheese appetizers and they were amazing. I also ordered the bbq beef sandwich and it's been the best out of many restaurants that I've tried! We also tried the bacon burger and enjoyed it as well. We will definitely go back!

We had the cheese dip to start and wow it was great!  I had the veggies with goat cheese and am drooling thinking about it again!  The best meal hands down during my trip.  I ended with the Kit Kat (which was a little to rich for me)!  What a way to end a trip!

Went with a couple friends on a friday night...cute little place surprisingly located in a strip mall, I thought it would have been inthe downtown near the other bars. Nonetheless we had great service - our waitress even knew how to correctly pour a beer-my boyfriend ordered a hacker pschorr and was very impressed. Wings were very good-they have a sampler of 3 wings for $3.00 - so we tried 2 different kinds-Garlic & Chipotle-both very tasty. We also had the Cheddar Ale dip for an appetizer - the homemade tortilla chips were out of this world along with the garlic bread for dipping. The Chicken Caeser panini was HUGE and was outstanding! I was disappointed in the Adobe Chicken Wrap that I ordered (too watery/no flavor) so I traded with the bf for the panini..much better! One of the guys ordered the Bleu Cheese Burger and he said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had! Nice little secret hangout place! We will definitely be back to try out their outside patio area - when its not raining!

Warning : After 35+ years of sampling and searching, this family's deep dish is my favorite of all the world's deep dishes. If you disagree then stop reading.

I was a little shocked to see that I haven't checked in at this location until today. I've been eating at this for years and I have had nothing but great experiences. Overall, I have been eating Lou Malnati's pizza since since the 80's and can remember a birthday party or two spent in the Schaumburg location on Roselle and Schaumburg.

Living out here in Lake in the Hills, this is the closest location and one of my favorites. Since you know I'm a lifelong fan of Lou's, let's get food out of the way. Nothing beats the combination of the sausage, mixed with my all time favorite tomato sauce (it's the wine and the crushed tomatoes!), and finished with the sweet butter crust. Simply the best. The chopped salad and the thin crust are easily on my top lists as well.

The location itself has a barn/farm theme which seems out of place for a pizza restaurant, but then eventually the warmth and coziness (is that really a word?) take over and you feel right at home. The theme does make sense in that the building is shaped like a barn, but I'm not sure if it was converted or built with that intention.

If you live out this way, and you love the deep dish, this is the place. Allow time for the baking (40 minutes for a large), and enjoy!

Make sure you know what you're ordering online - 
What I received sure didn't seem to be what was represented in the menu and pictures, "Chicago Classic" - this is a sausage pizza: Lou's crust and the rest sausage, solid sausage. 
I missed the good stuff!

We've been to several locations and we're never disappointed. Every time we're in Illinois we make it a point to stop at one. We always get the classic deep dish but we switch up the appetizers. This time we got calamari and the pizza chips and dips. They were amazing. Can't wait to stop again.

Very tasty gluten free pizza. Only downfall it's personal size. The gluten free crust is good and better then the crust less (with is just a sausage patty)
The house salad is basic if looking for gluten free tell the server when you order no croutons.

Best Chicago Deep Dish Pizza around. They have plenty of options, as well as thin crust choices, appetizers, salads, etc. 

This is a must try if you haven't already. We always order a deep dish with buttercrust, half cheese and half sausage. Delicious!!

I've also had the mozzarella sticks and 5 cheese bread. Both are great. Though I would recommend trying the 5 cheese bread! 

The Lou Salad is also very good. Served with some type of vingette dressing. It's a combination of greens, tomatoes, cheese crumbles, salami bites, olives and mushrooms. I'm typically not a fan of olives or mushrooms but the combo in this salad is great! 

This location also makes great cocktails. We've ordered carry out here, we've dined in, just sat at the bar. Also you can take Lou's home with their select frozen pizza ans salads.

Best pizza I've ever had! 

Ok so maybe that doesn't have as much weight behind it. I'm from Montana, we aren't exactly known for our Pizzas... But wow this place was on point. It was my first experience with Chicago style deep dish outside of Little Caesars (don't judge) and it could not have been better. Big fan of the sauuce. 4.5 stars easy!

I've been eating Lou's pizza for 30+ years and it's a little hard finding a consistently good location.  Lakewood is it!  We have had many deliveries in the last two years from Lakewood and have only had two mistakes.  The first time we got someone else's pizza so I called and the mgr was extremely polite and gave us our next pizza for free.  The second mistake was last night.  The delivery driver Mike M. called to let us know that he accidentally grabbed the wrong order and that he would be late.  He was extremely professional and polite.  I found it amazing that he actually called to let us know what happened because he could have easily just showed up late without calling.  Their pizzas are always hot and well made.  Thanks Lakewood Lou's!
Nothing more to say the name says it all... Pizza Perfection :)
For thin crust pizza, my favorite place is Aurelio's. However, if you want the best deep dish that the Chicago area has to offer,  then this is the place! Love it!!

So.. after my initial review  management reached out to me and expressed their concern in regards to my review and the experience I had. 

I never asked to be compensated for the mishap that took place but the manager was more than willing to resolve the issue. This tells me this was an isolated incident and/or he handled the situation with his staff.

Thanks Matt!  I appreciate it. So, the review was for the visit so I still dont think I should change the rating.. but if there were an option for issue resolution; management would receive 5 stars!

See ya next time iam in town!

Being an avid fan of the Chicago deep dish, I have tried many places over the years and have left feeling disappointed. This is not the case at the local Lou's. Sure, it gets busy, but why not? The atmosphere is inviting, the staff is friendly, and the prices are fair. 

The pizza is amazing! Absolutely hands down the best around. The buttery crust is delicious, the sauce is hand crafted to perfection. The cheese is fresh and chewy, a sign of fresh mozzarella. 

Quite honestly, its difficult to have a bad experience here unless you are one of those entitled, impossible to please, types. Ignore the low reviews for Lou's. This place is perfect if you want a great deep dish pizza in a family friendly atmosphere!

Every time we order an extra side of anything, it is NEVER included. Something as simple as a side of ranch with the cheddar cubes, they always forget to include it with the order. Ordered a bbq chicken salad, it was ridiculous. The lettuce was almost entirely the crap white part of the lettuce! It tasted like eating cardboard rabbit food. I'm so pissed I'm including a photo. Don't get me wrong, the pizza is fantastic, but don't dare order anything else. Guaranteed they will forget something from the order. Very sick of being disappointed with this Lou's.
I've gotten sick every time I've had the sausage pizza from here. I will never eat here again and strongly suggest everyone do the same
Deep dish? Barely half the depth of the pan (see photo). Pretty disappointed & pretty sure that was our last visit.

So delicious! Our family loves Lou's. My son's favorite is the cookie pizza and of course the deep dish. Pricing is spot on for the quality.
Highly recommended.

Went here twice with family while on our vacation.  The pizza is great.  Love the deep dish Lou's traditional sausage.  1 piece, maybe 2 and you are full. The building and dcor on this location is a bit weird.  Cold inside the restaurant both times. But, we love the pizza, and it goes a long way!  Our service was pretty good both times.  They could be a bit better about picking up the dead plates and glasses, but I guess this isn't the Ritz! We also ordered a Caesar on both occasions, and enjoyed that.  They put chopped tomatoes in their Caesar- a bit out of the ordinary, but I thought it was a tasty addition.

Great service great food. The deep dish is my favorite. Kids love the thin crust. The Lou's salad is great as well.  Air conditioning is the summer is awesome if you are one to open the windows in the Chicagoland winter! Kids came out of the pool so there were chilly. Till the pizza came!  Kinda off the beaten path of Randall road. Come early its get crowed for dinner. In all, it Lou's. The Best. period
BEST PIZZA EVER! You cannot go here and get a thin crust pizza, you have to get the deep dish! I love this place! Their employees are always so nice too, but the food is just wow!
Always great food. Food is always the same as the last time- you know what to expect.  always a great choice for pizza.

Never have I been disappointed with this place! The pizza,salad, and cookie pizza is outstanding and every word that describes great food in the English language. Definitely would come her everyday of my life if I could!
You never go wrong with Lou's

My favorite memory of Chicagoland in general, but especially Crystal Lake, aside from the fall, the first snowfall, and leaving, was Lou Malnati's.  I really hadn't found a pizza that I could truly fall in love with until my then wife took me to Lou Malnati's in Buffalo Grove.  I was so excited when it came to Crystal Lake, and it didn't dissappoint.

It is definitely a more expensive outing, or even take out/delivery, but it's worth it, as mouth watering as it is, and I do mean it when I say mouth watering...

I haven't tried ordering it online to be shipped to Austin, but I will have to do that to let the family get the best taste of Chicago!

Great Chicago style pizza. Great place to enjoy a meal with family and friends. Now locations are everywhere throughout the Chicagoland area so it takes the guess work out of finding a delicious pie in the burbs.
Decently priced and nice atmosphere. Family place. Pizza is great.
Glad to have close to home!  Great pizza!  Wife loves the Lou.  Started offering turkey sausage as an alternative too!  Keep up the good work Mark/Lou!

Best.......pizza........ever! I don't like that you can't make a reservation but you can call ahead to order a pizza so you don't have to wait as long at the table. Always friendly staff and great food.

Love the food! Pizza is awesome! 
Only reason for 3 stars is due to service. Not friendly and majority of staff is always chatting with eachother instead of paying more attention to clients. Everytime I visit this location its the same thing.
If you hate your job quit.

Ah Lou's.  There is a reason they keep winning best pizza in Chicago. 

Beautiful nice new location here in Lakewood.  

Simply up there with the best of the best.  They have a great thin or deep dish variety. 

If you are a sausage fan you have reached nirvana.  Otherwise ask for broken sausage or you get a whole slab covering the pizza.  

They even have gluten free crust now for those who are sensitive. 

A must visit if you are in Chicago and a regular with our family.  It can get a bit pricey but when you are the best you can usually get away with it.  

Seriously a must visit if your relatives need to sample the best of Chicago Pizza.

I had the stuffed spinach bread appetizer and a thin crust pizza. The plus: Everything was hot out of the oven, the crust was crisp just the way I like it, the exterior of the restaurant was unique and the service was okay butterum this was my second time ordering pizza from Lou Malnati's and I am not that impressed, but it could've been my choice of toppings. Either way I've had better, but don't take my word for it. You may enjoy it.

My family of 9 just ate at Lou's. As always it's a family friendly restaurant that has many types of deep dish Chicago pizza. My family loved the "Lou's". The "Lou's" is the specialty pizza at this restaurant and is fantastic. Also large parties get to stay in a private silo dinning room. A huge round table allows conversation which for my family is huge. There is also a "Lazy Susan" in the middle of the table, allowing easy passing of dishes and a place to place the pizzas. The only reason I didn't give a 5 is because it was a bit drafty as well as slow down on no refills. Other wise than that the food was a 5/5. I highly recommend the house salad too, it was a favorite of mine.

My second favorite Lou's! (the one in Skokie is my favorite) 
Great pizza! Great Appetizers! Great Service! 
Always a relaxing experience... Not sure what else to say :)

Since I reviewed this restaurant they have really worked hard to improve on the negative comments that I have posted they've tried really hard to make sure the pizzas are sent correct and they've gotten a little bit more aware the putting people on hold for extended periods of time can be frustrating for the customer and irritating they still do it But that's the nature of the game when you're good restaurant and you get a lot of calls thank you for making a conscious effort to improve your business you don't see that too often that a business cares enough to take immediate and concise action to improve their product and service therefore right now give you five stars congratulations on a five star rating

Since my wife and I are gluten-free (sensitive, not allergic) this has been our "go-to" place for g/f pizza!
This is easily the BEST g/f crust we have ever had, hands-down.
We come in "for the usual."
Mine: Garlic, green pepper and sausage.
My wife: Hot giardiniera and sausage.
We both just love their flavorful, almost cracker-like crust.  Most places try to make their g/f crust similar to the regular "high-gluten" flour traditional dough.  Can't be done and seems to pretty much always come out flavorless.
Malnati's has decided to make it as it is--crispy and nice.
Now don't get me wrong we BOTH love(d) their butter crust when we ate gluten, but this dough is pretty spectacular!
Happy Eating!
--Chef JB
Come on, it's Lou's. Keep the San Marzano tomatoes coming...

Have both dined in and carried out - the pizza is so amazing! Service is great.

One of our faves in the area - definitely our #1 choice for Chicago style deep dish!
Our fave pizza place if they could just bake their pies with consistency!  Often travel to other locations to get it baked correctly. When it's done right, they are a 5 STAR all the way.

Lou Malnati's was a wonderful location for our rehearsal dinner, besides the fact that it's our favorite pizza, the staff and team and Lou Malnati's was a pleasure to work with. I reached out many months before our wedding and all they required was a $50 deposit. Final head-count and food choices were made 48 hours in advance, and they also allowed us to bring in our own dessert. 

We ended up showing up a little early because rehearsal got over quicker than expected, and they were able to accommodate to us and get us to our private party room shortly after arriving. We appreciate the hard work and help they provided us for our rehearsal dinner, it turned out to be wonderful and as always amazing food!

Ordered carry out tonight. My BF stated the thin crust he ordered was OK.  However, I was in the mood for pasta thinking how could an ITALIAN restaurant screw up pasta, they did. If you like the taste of wet noodles under mozzarella then order their penne ala malnatis pasta. No seasoning, no garlic, no taste, just wet noodles. The problem is, there really isn't any good carry out in the LITH area and they all know it so its now about who can deliver SHIT food the fastest. Our delivery was quite quick. Nuff said. Save your cash and boil your own tasteless noodles and pour some Prego or Ragu over it and at least you'll taste something.

First time in Illinois, and this is where everyone told me to go.  Thank you!  The butter crust was phenomenal, and the pizza was better than any of the deep dish I've experienced in California.  Prices were reasonable, and we had plenty to take home and eat later.  Not sure about the gluten-free pizza - someone at our table ordered it, but wasn't jumping up and down excited about it.  Definitely go for the deep dish!
Can't wait for my pizza to come! Ordered the Classic! Had the cheese cubes for an appetizer.... AMAZING!!! Can't wait to see how my boyfriend likes it as he's nevere been here before!!!!
Hi my mom and i were just there we've never had a good experience we always asked for a well done 45 minute pizza but it has never done correctly.

There are some positives and negatives to this place. There deep dish pizza is one of a kind. The sauce is so delicious, although for some reason the thin crust has never lived up to expectations. Never have I had a bad experience with the waiters / waitresses although I feel like sometimes the pizza is a little cold. Other than the thin crust never have I had anything that isn't good from Lou Malnati's. After having some experience with the manager he is very understanding about everything.
Resturant was so cold we took pizza carryout.had to go outside to warm up..ruined the night for me.

Lou Malnatis pizza almost never disappoints.  I've been particularly impressed with this location and how their manager, "Mike" handles customer service issues .  Every single time we have out of town guests who are looking for the Chicago pizza experience, we either take them to Lou's or order delivery from Lou's . Even when delivered it comes piping hot.

Over the years, only two different times the pizza either came a bit differently than ordered, or wasn't up to Lou's usual amazing standard.  Immediately, each time the manager was quick to offer a replacement to make it better.  

On a previous occasion I called ahead to arrange a surprise birthday party for my daughter --the staff was amazing at arranging the upper level for us so we could pull it off.  It went so well, some friends who attended later used This location for their surprise party they were planning.  

Thanks Lou Malnatis / Lakewood---you would make Lou proud!!
Stuffed crusted with the sausage patty is a must try! Sausage in every bite! What diabolical being created this???? My wife and I went with Lou's the other day. We are attemping to try all the

Wait time for seating can be a bit long, but It's worth it. This is real Chicago pizza, it's hard to imagine better pizza than Lou's. I don't like to add too many ingredients, a simple cheese, or sausage pizza is hard to beat. The dinner salads are fresh, and I highly recommend the calamari. Great place to go with friends. Fun atmosphere, a little loud but still a good place to take the family.

Yesterday (Monday, March 23rd, 2015) I ordered in from Lou's. I didn't feel so hot, probably looked like a crazy homeless person living in a bush, but nevertheless, the lovely delivery guy was so sweet and kind. He literally came to the door-this adorable guy and said "I brought dinner." I mean...that right there really warrants this five star review. Am I right? Our short exchange totally made a crappy day 100% better. That sort of respectfulness, kindness and ability to read people is sorely lacking in today's world, so thank you, awesome delivery guy who's name I should've asked for (and I may call to find out later on so that they can pass on the appropriate props for me), for making my day that much better-and for not being like ew when you saw me, because seriously, I looked rough. Like...ROUGH. 
 Now, let's talk about the pizza, k? The pizza here is extraordinary-and that means something coming from a Chicagoland/Chicago native. Their pizza is top notch. It truly is deep dish. Not only is their sauce just the right consistency, but they actually layer tomatoes on top of it. The vegetables on my vegetable pizza were cooked just right (it seems like they may have been sauted in olive oil or something), the cheese wasn't so cheesy as to choke you, the crust is perfectly crisp-not well-done, not doughy, which is actually due to the several options you are given when ordering your pizza-they're serious about crust over at Lou's! The sauce wasn't overly saturated in oregano, nor was it saturated in salt. The entire pizza was made to perfection! Can't say enough about Lou's!

Love their pizza. Whether it's thin crust or deep dish. Their Lou's salad is also AWESOME! Better than Portillo's chopped salad. Tried their wings for the first time not too long ago and they weren't that bad. They also deliver to LITH if interested.
Amazing crust and great service. Always know what I am getting when I come to Lou's. Cannot go wrong with "The Lou" with sausage. Family style atmosphere.
Incredible pizza and the wait staff has always been super friendly and attentive!  They have a small game area for the kids which is nice.  Ideal for any size of group.

3 strikes Lou.  Of our last 4 visits, 3 have been bad.  The most recent visit had the typical horrible service we are used to at this location.  Our server took our order and NEVER came back to the table even though he was taking care of a bunch of tables around us.  It was not overly busy with open tables that night.  Prior to this visit we had a server completely ignore us while talking nonsense to the table next to us endlessly.  It felt we were interrupting her to place an order for drinks, get refills, order food, etc.  The other bad service visit was on a packed night.  We ordered our food while waiting over 30 minutes for a tables.  After we sat down our server was no where to be found.  A table near us was seated 15 minutes after us, ordering their food from the table.  Here comes their food, 15 minutes before ours even though we ordered 45 minutes before they did.  Again, no server to be found.  I will not return to this location after 3 out of 4 visits of horrendous service.

MUST READ!!! Lakewood Lou's is Amazing! I don't even know where to start here to describe how truly awesome the staff here is. Matt the manager turned our entire night around! He somehow found a way to accommodate 30 people mainly kids (almost an entire pre-teen football team) on a Saturday night with like maybe 2 hours notice! And we were all so thankful! Can't beat Lou's food but then our servers Nikki and Cayla among others were phenomenal and didn't miss a single thing! They all went above and beyond to make our night awesome and left everyone more than happy! It was one of the most enjoyable nights we have all gotten to spend together. They were really beyond wonderful and on this night the service actually surpassed the greatness of the food! Thanks everyone you ROCK! And this review just doesn't do you justice or express what that type of customer service means these days! Bravo!
Out of all the pizza restaurants around no one can out beat Lous Pizza. Everything on their menu is out of this world. Never a disappointment!
The best deep dish.  The sauce is great and I love the Malnati's salad.  Yum.  Love that the crust is always crispy.  One of my "go to" pizza places

So good, if you don't like deep dish pizza now, you will after eating here. I would eat here several times a week if my skinny jeans would let me. Nice atmosphere too, good for groups or for a date. I've had a birthday party and my rehearsal dinner here. Both were great, very attentive servers and consistently good food.

Three Cheese garlic bread was wonderful! Service was impeccable! The Chicago style pizza could have had more flavor. I found the sausage to be bland as well as the sauce. The crust had an awesome crunch to it though. So for me, it was just ok. Fun atmosphere though!

Always a fan of Lou Malnati's in any form and any location.

But I have to say this particular location is kind of weird for a Lou Malnati's. It's a totally fine restaurant -- nice and spacious, well laid-out, well staffed. But it seems a little too corporate franchise for my taste and very unlike their older, more authentic pizza parlors in other parts of the Chicago area. Maybe it's the proximity to the golf course. Who knows? But this particular store seems to be a little overdesigned -- more like a TGI Fridays or other type chain where you have the same kitchy decorations that come out of a warehouse somewhere and are shipped to stores nationwide.

At any rate, it doesn't affect the food. That is still the same -- everything from the buttery deep dish I have come to love to the chocolate chip cookie dessert that is so totally worth it. Our waitress was awesome, and not just because she gave me the biggest piece of pizza! Sure we will  be back if we are in the area. Also dug the to-go frozen cooler by the door!
Ordered medium thin cheese pizza for delivery. Pizza was cold and crust was hard. harder than a cracker. Quality was very poor and afraid ordering again is questionable.

Went here the other night to celebrate a friends birthday. We were seated right away but took awhile for a server to reach our table. We ordered two deep dish pizzas knowing it would take around 45 mins. About 20 minutes after ordering our server came back and told us she forgot to put our pizzas in... She then asked if we wanted an appetizer while we wait so we asked for the mozzarella sticks. After about another hour our pizzas finally arrived. She never apologized for the delay in our pizzas. When we received the check we noticed we were charged for the mozzarella sticks. We assumed she would take care of the appetizer since she forgot to put our pizzas in. She then came back with a new receipt and took off both of the pizzas so we were left paying for our drinks, appetizer and the birthday dessert and for some reason split our check into two bills. When we gave her money to pay she first took the debit card then came back and then grabbed cash from the other even though they were both ready to pay at the same time. She also never asked if we needed change and assumed it was all her tip. Very odd, rude, waitress.

Absolutely like no other - I've eaten lots of Lou's pizzas, and the quality for over 20 years has always been consistently excellent.

My favorite is the deluxe pizza - they took it off the menu, but just ask and you will receive! Deluxe is deep dish sausage, onions, green peppers, and mushrooms. They use wine in the sauce. It's light with large pieces of crushed tomatoes. 

Today's visit as a party of 7. Our sever was attentive and very pleasant. She appeared a bit busy and we had to ask for water and drink refills. Poor support from the buss staff - instead of waiting to set the next table, they could have removed dirty plates and filled water. I'll leave it to management to think about how to improve teamwork.

Meanwhile it was an awesome dinner and we took home left overs to freeze and enjoy another day.

I am not a huge fan of pizza. We ate it a lot when I was a kid... I have gone years without eating it.

However, Lou's (and Nick's) is/are the only pizza I like. Wait, strike that, love. 

My favorite is the deep dish sausage. The cheese is always perfectly cooked, the sauce is perfectly tomato-y and the crust is buttery good. The Lou's is also amazing... always cooked right.

The Malnati's Salad might be the best salad around. 

We have never had a bad meal here and we have always had outstanding service!
Favorite pizza of all time!!! Have been to quite a few of their locations... all are equally good! I could eat Lou's pizza daily... i am glad there isnt a location closer!

Extremely slow. Waited 50% longer than I was told for the pickup order.the small pizza had a soggy crusy in the middle and the top had started to burn. Manager offered a free can of soda to compensate.

THIS is the place to get Chicago pizza. Born and raised in the area I've tried all the Chicago pizza restaurants and this one is by far my favorite. Staff is great always accommodating even to my crazy family. Food is outstanding!! I recommend the house salad and then for pizza our favorite is tomato garlic sure sounds weird but give it a shot it's wonderful!! Make sure to get deep dish butter crust. Yummmm!!! I'm salivating just thinking about it.

Just love the pizza here. Was going to dine in by myself but decided to just grab a Lou-To-Go Sausage pizza and have it at home to share with my better 1/2. It's quick and easy to just grab it out of their freezer in the carryout section. The only downside to this is oven heating time plus 45 min. cook time (well worth it). I do enjoy eating in as well as the convenience of the carry out.

I'm not the biggest fan of Malnati's but my husband loves it and so does my mother-in-law so it's a regular "birthday" place. The reason for the 5 stars is because we have had ANDREW as our server twice now, and I can only say what great server he is. Attentive, friendly, and willing to go the extra mile. I hope the management appreciates him!
Great pizzeria with a lot of choices for everyone.  If you don't like Deep Dish, you can get normal thin crust pizza.

I was so happy when Lou's open near us, they never disappoint!  Not only is the pizza delicious and consistently perfect, the assistants who take your order over the phone are nice and professional.   Now I'm able to order online it's even better!  Than you for always being The Best!

Great pizza.  While Lou is famous for deep dish, and deep dish is the way to go here, I just don't like it.  Thin crust is available and very good - I like it better than 90% of other thin crust out there.  The other 5 people with me devoured multiple deep dishes and enthusiastically packed up the leftovers to take home.  Family size salad to share was a great deal.  We got an order of garlic bread - nothing to get excited about but the dipping sauce was tasty - the red sauce from the pizza.

The barn decor is very cute and makes this location quite distinctive from the clubby feel of the older locations.  The place is literally as huge as a barn and there is plenty of seating, we had a party of 6 and got seated immediately at 5 pm but it got crowded as the evening got later.

We have been loyal Lou customers for a long time.  Our pizza yesterday was disappointing.  The deep dish was not truly a deep dish, and the large thin crust was the size of a medium at best.  One of the pizza's was burnt on the top, and the crust was over baked and impossible to eat.  We paid a lot of money for what is usually a good pizza.  Something has changed.
If you're looking for the best deepdish around, look no further! The ingredients are fresh, the staff is wonderful & the atmosphere is super fun. Try the LOU specialty pizza!

My boyfriend took me out to Lou's tonight... My first time! He had a side salad, we shared the dip trip app witch was delicious (I'm going to attempt to replicate the garlic dip at home) and we had a medium pan pizza with all my favorite toppings. Superb!

Our server was ok, I have pretty high standards for servers though, but she certainly took good care of us.

We had a reservation, but still had to wait 10 minutes or so for our table. So I would recommend having a reservation on a busy Saturday night. We also per-ordered our pizza. My boyfriend said the pans can take a long time to cook, so per ordering cut out some of the wait.

Too good!
Not a huge fan of that style pizza.
Amazing! The best pizza I've had in Chicago! I love their thin crust and the Crustless pizza option! Always a treat when I'm visiting!

This is the closest pizza place to our house and we love it. It's in a big red barn with a separate carry out entrance similar to other Lou's. The quality of pizza and experience is similar to other Lou locations and there always seems to be pizza samples in the carry out area on Friday evenings. When you call they can tell you what you ordered last which is helpful. We go here regularly for carry out but sometimes dine in and it's always consistent for food and service.

Grossed out and disappointed!!! We usually do to-go orders, but I decided to dine in with my family this weekend. Service was ok... but was grossed out that most servers had the pizza holder hanging from their apron. Some actually had what looked to be duck tape wrapped around it! This makes me to think that the same dirty holder is being used over and over again. Good thing I'm not a vegetarian, I bet the people served before us ordered a pizza with meat on it! Hope you change your policy on that soon or we will not be back!!
A must stop returning to Chicago area! Great deep dish, salad with Gorgonzola dressing and attentive, polite service. Worth going out of the way for any Lou's.

Wow, what a great place and the service was wayyyyy great!  We were a group of Snap On Rock N Rollers and we were treated like royalty here.  The salad is to die for!  The pizza is really good.  I'm personally a thin crust guy but since this was my first time having real Chicago Deep Dish Pizza, I was impressed.
I wish I could remember our waitresses name, she was a fabulous server.  Great enthusiasm, wonderful attitude and really kept up with this demanding groups needs.  She is from Sacramento so she's a real California girl at heart... Thank you!  Lou, you have a real gem in her......

Once again I leave here PERFECTLY satisfied.  Definitely #1 in my book still.

2 tap blue moons and a large deep dish for $30, I'll graciously spend that every time for ma when it's tourney time and she comes into town!

Thanks again Uncle Lou, nothing compares.
I would say if you want a vegetarian thin crust pizza without cheese, you are at the wrong location. Lou's is known for deep dish with CHEESE. Please. For the love of God, don't mess with perfection.

Everyone knows the pizza is famous and unbeatable....

My review is about the service we received tonight on a delivery order.  There was a confusion on our order that could easily have been our fault.  We received thin crust on our order instead of deep dish.  The manager Mike listen to our issue confirmed the order on his side that thin crust was ordered.  Then to my surprise without missing a beat tells me our deep dish pizza is going in the oven at no charge and being deliver ASAP.  Thanks Mike for your understanding, top notch resolution.
