Great location, great service, great food.  We have gone a few times and can't complain.  Glad that they brought this location out to the NW burbs.  Definitely the best deep dish pizza anywhere.  Love the malnati's salad as a starter.  This location has carry out as well as frozen pizza to go.
I can't go one week without a slice! Thank you Lou, thank you for coming to Lakewood.  Please don't ever leave. Will you marry me?

The classic Lou's pizza, much closer to home. 

Clean, friendly service; you do have to wait a bit, but it's only because your pizza is made to order. I don't recommend ordering a personal pan, because the crust-to-goodies ratio is too high, and trust me, you'll want the leftovers the next day. Cold Lou's pizza makes a wonderful breakfast!

Their salads are great, too, but be warned that they really are HUGE. A medium is plenty for two people and make sure to ask for the dressing on the side - they tend to drown it.
Great deep dish pizza

This was my first visit to the location in Lakewood, which is nestled between Crystal Lake and Lake in the Hills.  It's a nice, newer location built maybe two years ago.  

We had deep dish pizza, cheese and pepperoni.  For starters we had some appetizers, consisting of fried cheese cubes, calamari frite, and fried zucchini.  All of them were very good, but I have had better calamari elsewhere, it could have been crispier.  The zucchini was served with ranch dressing and the calamari was served with marinara.  

The pizza was great, as one would expect from Lou's. They've got a great recipe and the consistency from one location to another shouldn't vary.  The cheese was nice and thick and gooey, and the pepperoni was great and not greasy.  We opted for the butter crust and it tastes really good. 

The service was good, we were there celebrating a birthday and they had us in small room to ourselves, which was nice for our group. 
We've ordered delivery from here before so we knew it was good, but eating in is always better in my opinion.  We'll be back to this one for sure.

They don't take reservations per se, but if you order ahead they will seat you a little faster.

I have been a faithful Lou Malnati's customer for over 20 years and when we moved to Crystal Lake 8 years ago we were worried it was going to be too far away.  We were so very excited to see the sign go up for a location near us!  We have not been disappointed.  The service, management, and food have all been 5 stars!  Each time we visit, take someone in for the first time, pick up or have it delivered I have been made to feel like I am the only customer.  Thank you Lou's for such a great team from phone orders to table service and everything in between.  You go above and beyond! - Deedee

Been eating Lou Malnati's in Elk Grove and Lincolnwood for over 30 years,  was happy to hear that one was opening in the area. tried them and had to give them 4 instead of 5 stars because I think the Elk Grove location's  pizza  tasted better. when i  told that to the waited he related many people tell him that their location taste different than the others. i asked why and he said that the new pans are not seasoned yet...

Reliably excellent food & service each and every time!  When coming from Randall on Ackman Rd, the sign needs to be bigger and closer to the street you actually turn onto, otherwise you can drive right past Redtail and have to turn around down the road.  

Food is excellent whether you eat in the restaurant, do carry out or have it delivered.  The staff is always friendly.  We have had it delivered a few times and they are always there in the amount of time they quote you!
The cheddar cubes are awesome!

Best pizza in Chicago! Deep dish with sausage patty and lou malnati's salad...serve on the same plate so the salad dressing soaks into the crust...O. M. G....not an everyday meal...but perfect for a celebration! :)
Love this pizza !!!   The best deep dish !!!  First time at this location, very nice.  Staff was very nice.

As I have said in other reviews, Lou Malnatti's is the standard by which I judge other pizza places for "Chicago style" deep pan pizza.

A friend of mine and I have eaten there several times, in fact 3 times out of the last 4 weeks.  We volunteer at the Illinois Railway Museum, in Union, and the museum had been holding a Halloween event during, the month of October called "Terror on the Railroad that started at 7PM on Friday and Saturday nights.  So, since Lou's in Lakewood is sort of on the way, we go there for supper.

This past Friday, Oct 29, we were there, and ordered our usual medium Malnatti's house salad (which is always excellent), and a medium deep pan pepperoni and mushroom pizza.  

About the time we finished our salad, the wait person brought our pizza to the table and served it.  As usual, the taste was excellent but the central part of the crust was rather of soggy - not good!

We signaled for our wait person and asked her if she could take the pizza back and put it in the oven for another 5 -10 minutes, which she immediately did.  While we were waiting, a gentleman, whom I surmised was the manager, came to our table to appologize for the unsatisfactory pizza and said he was making us a new one.  

In the mean time, the wait person brought our original pizza back and served it.  It was JUST FINE!

When we finished, and asked for the check, she told us our other (no charge) pizza was ready.  We asked her to cut it in half  and put it in two separate boxes, which she did.  

When we looked at the check, I saw that we had been charged for the salad and soft drinks only.

WOW!!!!!! That's customer service!  No charge for two pizzas.  We left a 150% tip based on the check, and at this writing, I'm just about ready to pop my half-pizza into the oven for supper tonight.  DarnI If I just had a bowl of that house salad it would be perfect, along with my martini.

Anyway no matter the fact that the pizza is good, that was the best service I have ever had at any restaurant!  Will we be back?  Count on it!

Horrible service tonight we will no longer be dining at your restaurants. We waited over 45 minutes for a kids meal even though we asked to have it come out as soon as possible. We were told the fryer was down even though all the food coming out was fried. We were avoided the whole night. We took our food to go and to top it off the kids meal that should have had fruit had fries. The waitress at the end was quick to try and take the check from me. The whole time also even though the place was very slow no one even came around. Thank you for making the choice to never come back an easy one. Worst part is I love your pizza but will not pay for service like that. Hope someone sees this and fixes thing there.

Excellent deep dish za!  Love their Lou's salad too.  3 *s because my husband is very allergic to gluten and he ordered the g free za and got a regular thin crust.. making him sick later.  We appreciate the availability of g-free crust but need restaurants to be absolutely sure they are g-free if they are going to advertise themselves as such.
good but greasy. pizza puffs are very greasy to eat. but burgers are pretty good.

Dog tracks has gone back and forth in terms of owners, but I'd never gone until recently (despite the fact I grew up in Barrington and went to BHS). 

I love their Gyros, I get one almost every time I'm in. The fries are perfectly cooked and salted. My boyfriend loves getting the Chicago dog, and they make a great bacon cheese dog. 

I think that Dog Tracks manages to have great "fast food," well-cooked and seasoned. The people who work there are always incredibly nice and friendly. They do have a TV, but it's usually on Spanish language TV (this doesn't bother me). 

When there was a downed power line a week or two ago, the owner? reassured people that were not able to drive to their home due to police barricade, that yes, they could park at Dog Tracks. I believe the exact words were "We're closing in 10 minutes, don't worry about. Have a great night!" I think that it says a lot that they were letting people fill up their parking lot starting around 5, because these people didn't have anywhere else to park. Great food and great people?! I'm a fan.
Bought hotdog and fries. Hotdog was warm. Wish it was hotter. Hot dog buns pretty plain. Fries were hot.
Everytime I'm near this place for lunch I always stop.  The food is always good, has been always good since day one.  Everyone is friendly and you get your food fast.

Loved this place. It's small but comfortable. The staff is very friendly. I love their tacos al pastor. Usually to get good tacos, you have to go to the city, I'm happy to have found some place nearby!

The Dog Tracks has had a few owner changes recently.   A while back when some new  owners came in, the quality of hot dogs was the worst I have eaten.  Trying to eat your way through the casing was impossible.  No jumbo dogs, we were just given two smaller dogs instead.   Not good.  It appears that whoever is the now new owner is making nice changes to the exterior.  I decided to give it a try after a long period of avoiding them.  Good quality of hot dogs, really clean interior, lots of frys in the order.  I think they are finally back on track.

We both got the stuffed potato pancakes - stuffed with eggs, cheese, sausage and bacon and then smothered in sausage gravy. Delicious.

Service was fast and extremely friendly.

We enjoyed eating on the new outside patio.

This was an extremely enjoyable meal. I would come back.

We must have found a different Tony's Cafe as I am shocked by the great reviews.  Aside from the delicious vegetable soup, the Tony's Cafe I found on McHenry Ave in Crystal Lake lacked anything special, and the lunches were not good.  I disliked the fact that at 1:30pm, they were cleaning up, including vacuuming next to the table I occupied while I was eating my food.   I felt that was incredibly rude.  My meal was not as described on the menu but the server never came by again until she asked if we wanted boxes, and by then, I had to leave as my lunch hour was over.

Maybe breakfast is better but I won't be back to find out.   Truly a shame that I encountered the wrong Tony's Cafe.

I have been wanting to come for breakfast since I ate lunch here. Good breakfast but I like George's off Randall better for breakfast. I have their half-order if biscuits and gravy and the biscuit was good and the gravy good, but neither was great. I make a home made sausage gravy that is way better and, honestly, Bisquick biscuits are better. My wife liked her bacon waffle and my son his pancakes; but both felt George's is a bit better. 

I think their lunches are awesome. Best homemade soups and sandwiches.

Lived here 14 years and finally stepped foot inside thanks to all the Yelp recommendations. Wow, soups are freshly made daily and taste just like someone spent 10 hours in the kitchen stirring the pot.  Hubby ordered a chicken wrap with side of chicken noodle soup. Both delicious. Son ordered bacon cheeseburger which was bigger than his head!  I ordered the chili con queso which is chili served in a small crock with cheddar cheese baked on top!!  
Talked briefly with the owner at the checkout. He mentioned the different soups made each day of the week. Hmm, gonna need to try them all!

I had really high hopes and was sadly disappointed!  I love a great breakfast (my favorite food). I unfortunately didn't get it here. I got pancakes that were flat and not quite cooked in the center.  I got a waitress who couldn't be bothered with us and when she did stop was very abrupt.  After waiting forever for her to come to our area so I could ask for the check she actrd like I was bothering her. She actually cashed us out and when I said have a nice day and walked away my husband said she started mumbling and laughing with the other hostess.  Can only assume the worse.  But back to the food; it was mediocre at best.

For my daughter's birthday, we decided that it would be nice to walk to a local establishment and celebrate. We ordered a small side of cottage cheese for her, a Southwest chicken wrap for me, and my husband had a chorizo omelette. What's great is that lunch entrees come with additional sides, and I tried the homemade vegetable soup. I could tell how fresh all the ingredients were, which made it extremely tasty. We also got a bread basket, which was a nice complement to our meal. I will head down here more often.
Totally great service. Met some friends there. I was totally running late. No issues serving me after the others had been served. Food was good. The service though was amazing!!

Small, hometown dinner, with an extensive menu and friendly staff.  We first discovered this delight a few months ago.  We had the Steak sandwich which had us hooked.

The food is breakfast oriented, mostly, but they do have a lunch menu as well.  Much like other brunch places it's quick and easy, only Tony's Cafe the food seems... more 'real'...

The only downside would be, it's small, and because they are so popular they are trying to accommodate as many people as possible, which leaves little free space around you.  The materials are a bit outdated, and the joint could use a sprucing up.  That of course doesn't affect how decent a place this is to visit though.

Stop in; Tony will surely recommend the Stuffed Potato Pancakes, and one day I'll take him up on that offer.

Honestly? I don't get it.

Figured we would try this, as all the review seemed to be raves. We got seated right away, which was nice. The noise level was horrendous.  I'm not sure if there is any way to dampen the sound, but I needed to lean over and have my wife speak nearly directly into my ear to hold a conversation. The place could probably do with a few less tables, as it has a crowded feel, and it's virtually impossible not to eavesdrop on neighboring parties.

I ordered the stuffed potato pancakes. They were interesting,  but my eggs were supposed to be poached HARD, and still had runny yolks. The "more must be better" theory seems to have been applied to the sausage gravy, because the dish was swimming in it.  I'm not sure if my wife's french toast was the victim of over beaten eggs, or what, but she did not enjoy it, and had to pick leaves off of her strawberries.  My sister-in-law had better luck, as she just went with eggs, sausage links, and hash browns.

Pro tip: I  get that you're tall, and it saves time, but just because you CAN lean all the way across the table to refill my coffee doesn't mean that you SHOULD.

Love this place.   I am literally here once a week.   It's a cute diner by the high school.   They have a nice variety and everyone there is so friendly.  You have to try the Duke, soooo good, my fave.

Love Tony's! We have been coming here for 7 years and it just keeps getting better. Love the new changes and the outdoor seating! Always quick and friendly service. Has definitely become a family tradition to eat here on the weekends at least once a month.

I have been going to Tony's for quite some time.  It is a great place to grab breakfast any time of the day. 

What really makes Tony's special is Tony and his girls (waitresses).  Tony is usually there greeting folks, checking on how you are doing, and even sometimes cooking in the back.

And the wait staff is always friendly and consistent.. meaning the same girls have been working there forever.

I love Tony's and will keep going there as long as Tony will let me.

For us, there is no better go-to in the County. These people are businesslike and so pleasant. Anytime you want a meal that is completely affordable, comfortingly tasty, and yields leftovers to take home, this is it. Their burgers rival Tracks and Red Robin for a better price and every bit as good. Their meal plates are always delicious and they have the nicest produce I've ever seen. Soups are terrific. Salads are top-rate. Breakfast is unbelievably good, quick, and affordable. It's like eating outstanding home cooking, but you don't have to lift a finger. In nice weather, I love how restful and pretty the patio is.

I went in here with a friend a week ago for breakfast and I am now a fan.  The staff sat us down immediately and instantly provided menus. Coffee, water and orange juice were immediately offered. I always like to have an omelet for breakfast, and I ordered a ham and cheese one which came out to perfection.  My friend got steak and eggs which looked mouth watering.  The waitress came by solicitously through our meal to make sure that we had everything we needed.  The price was reasonable.  What more can you ask?

This is a no-frills diner with fantastic food and a friendly staff.  

If you're looking for a fancy brunch joint, this isn't it.  

Hands down best sausage gravy ever!! Better than mine. And that's saying a lot.

Get the stuffed potato pancakes. Just do it. So good. Seriously the most amazing diner breakfast I've ever had.

Diet starts Monday.

I've eaten out from this place quite a few times now for breakfast. Prices great, only down fall no menu to look at or take home. So I am posting copies that I took with my camera to help others who want to order a to-go order.

Decided to try Tony's due to the positive Yelp reviews on a whim, and was not disappointed! The service was good, including being seating promptly upon arrival. I had a skillet, which was very good and not piled on a huge bed of potatoes. Very happy we decided to give it a try, we'll be back!
I always enjoy the food and service is top-notch!! I have a particular weakness for their skillets and their sausage gravy!!
average breakfast joint, nothing special. Not worth my drive of 25 minutes. Disappointed at the yelp rating

Great diner food. Friendly service. 

The fish fry on Fridays is one of my favorites.
Great food, friendly staff and equally important very clean!!!

Visited twice - good service and good food. My husband loves their biscuits and gravy. I've had their banana bread French toast - really decadent and I'll definitely get it again. I also tried their glazed blueberry pancakes - really can't go wrong with those although I wish mine came with a dusting of powdered sugar on top (got it to-go). One small complaint is that the business has no website - it's a personal pet peeve as I'd like to be able to see the full menu, etc.

Definitely my favorite breakfast place in Crystal Lake. The biscuits and gravy are awesome and the chicken noodle soup is better than homemade. Bacon ordered crispy is always cooked to perfection. Still sitting at our table but I had to write a review asap because our server Erinn is so amazing!! Hilarious and attentive and we got our food SO fast (shouts out to the kitchen staff too). Had to ask her for her name so I know whose section to request next time I come here.

Tony's is a family style restaurant. Casual dining & atmosphere. Food is good...nothing fancy or spectacular to rave about. However, nothing to complain about either. I'd return for a quick breakfast bite.

Love this place. Old time-y feel with amazing food and great service. Kind of an odd location but absolutely worth a visit. 
Bathrooms could stand a renovation and I feel that single stall bathrooms aren't really appropriate for a restaurant this size, but aside from that, this is a new favorite of ours and we can't wait to go back. Banana bread french toast is the most delicious thing ever.

I have been to Tony's a few times.  The service, the ambiance and food are worthy of this review.  If you haven't been for a while, I suggest going soon as the food seems to have gotten better- try the new ham off the bone with your eggs for breakfast.

I stopped in with my wife and father this past Friday evening for the Friday night fish fry.  It's the best fish fry I've had in Crystal Lake.  I was very impressed with the service this evening, I wish I would of grabbed our waitress' name, but it just hasn't hit me.  

It's nice to be at a family run restaurant where they make you feel you are welcome every time you walk in.
Tony's is a nice, friendly neighborhood restaurant.  They are a lunch and breakfast place and most times you can actually talk to Tony because he's working around the restaurant.
Really nice place to eat.  Coffee was great, and it kept coming.  Service is good.. I'm  definatly going back.
Best breakfast!!!! Server had a great sense of humor and was great. Everything I ate was awesome! Ill be back. Best steak and eggs

We come here for breakfast a couple times a month.  The waitstaff is excellent - very nice down to earth girls providing great service.  Can't say enough about the great service.  Biscuits and gravy are solid, the skillets are tasty, plenty of options on the menu for dieters and kids.  My only gripe with the place is consistency; over easy eggs should not have 'wet whites' - the white needs to be cooked through and only the yolk should run.  Half the time I order over easy the whites are wet and runny and I hate them that way.  Order your hash browns and toast well done or they come limp and warm not crusty/crispy like toast and hash browns should be.  Have come for Friday night fish fry and that's great too.  Fix the consistency/under 'doneness' of the eggs/toast/hash browns and this would be a 5 star gem.

Love Tony's! New owners have done a masterful job of giving the place a slight facelift from the classic Greek diner look (not that that was bad!)! Food is still great! Family feel. One of our favorites! Wish they had a little patio for outdoor seating though!!!

Was looking for a good hearty breakfast after a long night out. I would say the food is very good, but typical, diner food. With that being said, it was cozy, the waitress we had was extremely nice and responsive.  Great little diner here, we will be back.

Great place and yummy food! My mom and I came here  for lunch after doing the vehicle emission testing (ugh... Lol) based totally on the yelp reviews!

We were greeted warmly and had our choice of sitting. My mom had the clam chowder and a egg salad sandwich.  I had a ham and egg sandwich.  We both had fruit on the side. There was plenty of food and everything was DELICIOUS!!

This place is wonderful and it deserves each of the 5 stars I am giving it.

Family owned breakfast and lunch restaurant (along with Friday night fish fry) with a extensive menu including at least 6 meat/potato skillets and 6 different eggs Benedict options. Everything our table got tasted/looked good. I had a chicken, avocado, bacon, cheese, hash brown and scrambled egg skillet. I added salsa which I felt made it perfect. My husband liked his chorizo skillet and my uncle his Santa Fe skillet. My 2 year old cousin's children's pancakes were 2 hot cakes nearly the size of the dinner plate. It was getting busy around 9am Sunday when we were leaving and it only holds about 50-70 people so on the weekend plan for the church crowd/be prepared to wait. Also each meal comes with a small frosted cinnamon roll which is a nice way to top off breakfast. 
My uncle and his family have made this restaurant their Sunday morning tradition and I could see giving this place similar devotion if we lived nearby.

Food was good, service was okay. We went for lunch and everything was pretty great except we didn't really have much attention paid to us... Took forever to get the bill and during check out she didn't say a word to us because she was conversing with someone who must be a regular. Would definitely try again, but maybe at a busier hour

Just had breakfast here for the first time and really enjoyed it.  I have seen the place probably a couple hundred times before but never considered stopping... today, starving and in dire need of coffee... I broke down and tried it!  I'm Glad I did.

You can describe Tony's as a nice little breakfast/lunch place.  It is very clean, the waitress was really friendly and very attentive, and the food was very good.

What I liked most about the place was you could tell the folks that worked there really cared.  From the greeter who sat us, to our waitress, to the bus boy, to the man walking from table to table talking to patrons (I am assuming this was Tony himself). 

Very nice place with a good warm feeling.  There is nothing fancy about Tony's, just good old fashion comfort food and great folks serving it up.
A very friendly quiet place to have a cup of coffee,  parmesan  pasta was amaizing, love the location,  staff friendly,  I really  liked it. I'll  bring family  Sunday.

Came here late Sunday morning. We were lucky and got a table for 5. Kids chocolate chip pancakes are awesome. The Popeye Benedict and Country Fried steak were great as well. Only downside is I ran into people I knew got to chattin and got less time for a nap!
For a little breakfast joint it's was quite satisfying. I really enjoyed the Orange Juice and the pancakes were great, freindly people and nice clean place!

Stopped here for breakfast with my wife yesterday since it's so highly rated on yelp. I had the spinach and feta omelette with onions and tomatoes added. The eggs were very fluffy and overall the omelette was 5 stars. The hash browns were also done perfectly with plenty of crispness. The raisin toast was slightly over toasted. My wife had the country special which was a couple of poached eggs on an English muffin with sausage and gravy. She said it was good and she enjoyed it, just not extraordinary. The coffee was good, but not noteworthy. There were only a few other customers in there but only one server so the service could have been slightly improved.

Tonys Cafe my
Favorite breakfast place! The chicken soup on Sundays is the best :) had the Sante fe skillet it was delicious! New owner is making the place take on a fresh look and will go above and beyond to make you happy with your experience ! Waitresses and friendly and speedy !
Excellent food and service. When we ask the kids "What's for breakfast?" They all yell TONYS!

Great diner for Sunday mornings with a newspaper section, coffee with some depth and great Eggs Benedict!  Proprietor, Tony,is always around and checks in with every customer!  Recommend their whole breakfast menu-everything made fresh to order.  Never any complaint!   Oh, it can be a bit busy and loud; so, the earlier,the better!!!!!

No wait, fast service, extremely friendly, excellent breakfast selection - so many good choices it's hard to pick. I can vouch for the cinnamon raisin French toast and biscuits and gravy. Both were perfect.  My family enjoyed it. Even free cinnamon rolls to go. Tony, you got a great place here!
Food is average.  Service sucks and the attitude of the bald guy behind the register is horrible haha.  Really man?  The guy should not work anywhere that requires costumer service

This place is filled with friendly staff and it starts with the owner Tony. From the first visit I felt at home. 
Tony's for breakfast? Absolutely. My wife is a fan of their omelets, I like the skillets, but everything that goes by the table looks great. 
The lesser known is that Tony's has great dinner too. I had ribs tonight (a special that's not on the regular menu). They were not your typical heat up and dump sauce ribs that so many places serve. The ribs were tender, the sauce cooked into the ribs not just dumped on. I was surprised and impressed. The dinner salad served before the entree was fresh green romaine a few spring greens, cucumber slices and firm ripe tomatoes cut in quarters. Served cold as it should be, and accompanied by a warm crusty roll. 
I rarely have dessert, I just get too full before dessert time. However, Tony made fresh peach cobbler, nothing canned, no corners cut. This was as good as any homemade cobbler I've ever had. 
I have lived in the area 20 years and never tried Tony's until I read the yelp reviews. 
Try Tony's, you'll be glad.

You just can't beat Tony's for breakfast and service. Big fan of the biscuits and gravy and basic eggs, bacon, pancake breakfast. They are open later on Friday's and have the best fish fry in town. Def the best place for breakfast in the burbs.
Great service!! Servers always nice and outgoing:) food is amazing and always leave with a full satisfied tummy
Love this place, The staff is awesome, the food delicious and I love that they add a mini homemade cinnamon roll  to your plate... Would recommend this place to everyone
Staff was very friendly and the service was quick, which was good because I was in a rush. Country Fried steak was awesome. The new owner put a fresh new look on the place. Very reasonable prices.

Tony's is amazing!! They accommodated our party of 20 soccer players and parents in between our semi-final and championship games on 10 minutes notice - and the service was absolutely incredible!! The waitstaff team darted around making sure everyone's meal was perfect and every cup was filled. The food was very good - large portions and well prepared. We'll look forward to a return trip the next time we're in Crystal Lake.

Had a late breakfast this morning at Tonys Cafe and it was hopping. Place was full,  The new owners who took over from the previous owner that just retired are John and Bobbi. They were very accommodating, pleasant and the food was excellent. We had a  Mexican omelette and a Chicken wrap and both were delicious. The cooks were on top of their game getting orders out quickly that kept the waitresses really on their toes. Great Mom and Pop comfort food joint that makes you want to come  back. Definitely give it a try.
Quality everything. Enjoy the excellent service while eating exceptional food. Biscuits and gravy can't disappoint.

So sorry to have to down grade my prior review.  We went this morning, nice and early.  My husband ordered well down corned beef hash that came out warm, not crispy. His eggs were to be easy over and they were hard cooked. I ordered a special of chorizo and avocado skillet.  It was delicious but didn't have any avocado.  The waitress was fabulous and certainly not her fault.   Just wish the cooks were more consistent.

Delicious breakfast! Not only is the food super good but the employees are incredibly friendly! Everyone asked how we were doing and how our food tasted. My fresh omelette was made super fast and tasted AMAZING.
Tasty breakfast every time! The breakfast quesadilla was excellent! Love the new look inside!

My wife and I have been coming to Tony's Cafe for five years.  We keeping coming back because the food is great, the service is outstanding and Bobby and John are the perfect hosts.  Tony's Cafe is by far the best cafe around!

This is a small independent breakfast and lunch restaurant, located in a small shopping center.  I decided to try it this weekend while in the area - it was a pleasant experience.  The smoked bacon was very good and I love Superior brand coffee.  I sat at the counter and got speedy service.  Everything was good.   Met the owner.  'Nuff said!

We stopped here on the way to my son's football game.  Food is great, and the service is even better.  Super clean, tidy, and well-run.  The only bad critique I can give is that it's not close enough to our home town for us to go more often!

I love this place. Great food, ambiance, prices, staff and owners. I wish I lived closer, as this would absolutely be my place to go on a regular basis. Friday night, all you can eat fish fry is a must.

First time. This is what breakfast with places used to be like. A staff that actually cares, good food, and good atmosphere. Not a chain overly mechanized cookie cutter place here. This is what breakfast should be like. The staff is great, and so is the food. From the door to the line cooks, you can tell these people care.

Went there 8/5/15 for breakfast. Had been there before. This time waitress Debi could not keep orders straight. Did not serve chocolate milk to my granddaughter in a reasonable amount of time. She passed that task on to someone else and it never got done. She put the blame elsewhere. Wife and granddaughter both had two fried eggs w/ bacon no potatoes. Easy enough. One order came with three bacon strips and one with two. I think the norm there is three strips. Waitress neglected to catch that as well. Bickering could be heard between waitress and staff over help on the floor. She was the only one on the floor, but there where only six tables occupied in the entire place. Not a monolithic task. She took more interest in babbling with customers than attending to tables and orders. Finally got a look at the kitchen as we sat there and it looked like it needs a health inspection. Won't go there again, ever. Don't waist your time. Spend a little more elsewhere and get a quality breakfast.

I have drove by this place a million and one times and had to try it.  I have my favorite breakfast place that I compare all others too.  The food here was good, the noise level was pretty high though.  Service was excellent and I would and will come back again.

Very nice place and a good find! Clean, great service and a yummy breakfast!  Had the vegetable skillet and my son had the two egg with bacon breakfast.  We are both pleased to have tried Tony's Cafe!  We will be back!
What a GREAT place.  If your looking for home cooked food, great service  & a full stomach....THIS IS YOUR PLACE! Super nice owners.  Will definitely be back.

Went for the all you can eat Friday Fish Fry.  Everything was delicious!  I was pleasantly surprised to find broiled fish as an alternative to the fried fish.  We had a large party and were greeted immediately.  The service was friendly, helpful, and very accommodating.  I would definitely go back! Looking forward to trying their breakfast/lunch menu.
Best breakfast ever. Go every Sunday after church. Crepes with lingonberries or cherries with cream cheese are so delicioussss!!!!

Just moved to Mchenry and was told about Tonys Cafe so me and the family had to take the short drive to see what all the buzz was about. First impressions was a clean environment and great customer service. Kids loved the pancakes. Are server was named Bobbie and she was great. Food was hot fresh and fast. Can not wait to come back this weekend!!!

I have been going to Tony's for a minimum of 10 years now and they have the best breakfast dish I have ever had.  It is a little pricey but it is a high quality place and worth every penny.  And the dish is the "Santa Fe Skillet".
Love love love Tony's Cafe! Best breakfast and the staff are very kind and attentive. Tony is usually there!! Very comfortable atmosphere!! I just love this place!!

Great place. I have been coming here for the better part of ten years. Tony is a dynamite guy as well as his staff who has been with him for most of it. Great food, good prices, good small dinner. His staff is great even when Tony is not their . Very great place I would highly recommend.

Here for the first time to celebrate my husband's birthday.  Warm inviting atmosphere with welcoming staff.  The fried calamari apetizer was creative with lemon, olives and jalapeos.  My duck entre was one of the best duck dishes that I ever had.  It was served with crispy Brussels sprouts and fresh blueberries which had my mouth singing.
My groom had gaucho lasagna which he enjoyed immensely.
We are about to see the desert menu which I am sure will not disappoint.

Yelpers you steered me wrong with this one. Oy vey, first time I'm writing a review while at the table. This place is god awful. Please do not go here. 

Soooooo expensive and overpriced for below terrible food. 

My tongue is numb from the prime rib pizza. And my taste buds are shot from the oversalted food. 

We ordered 1 app, 1 side and 2 pizzas 4 beers total for a total price tag of $90. Ridiculous especially since we only tried 1 piece of pizza from each. (The lamb pizza is salvageable). Couldn't even stomach anything more. 

How is a place like this still open? It's absurd. 

Our server was a joke. Only saving grace is the people that brought out our food. 

Sorry y'all but this is a HARD PASS. Save yourself some $$ and your taste buds. 

Now off to get some real food.....

First timer here, and it was pretty good--just a few pros & cons. 

Cons: the bartender who looks like a cross breed of Justin Bieber and Just Timberlake, looks like about 18., very clumsy and slow, I believe his hair doesn't allow him to manoeuvre well while making drinks--and it's long, therefore it could cause a loose hair and into the drinks. He's a good kid, just needs to be more attentive. Secondly servers are kinda in the blank, except the server I had--she's well alert and very knowledgeable--Megan is her name and I recommend her. 

Pros: the food is delicious, I had the Duck and it's one of most delicious Ducks I've had., and the food selection is pretty good, not a lot but good. Now the area is very clean and the bathrooms are clean too--which is important.

I REALLY wanted to like this place...   Saddle Room did some things exceptionally well but where it failed it REALLY failed.   


Let me break it down for you:

=== Atmosphere and Originality *****: unique upscale western theme in a somewhat tucked away area which is great!   Makes for a nice escape from the mundane feel of the the burbs and over abundance of restaurant chains. The outdoor patio and bar equipped with wood burning fireplaces are but just a couple of many details worthy of being pointed out.

=== Menu ***:  huge variety with lots of  not-your-typical suburban food choices. I'm a fan of variety but in this case Saddle Room is trying to be too many things.     If you're a steak house sure have lots of steak choices.  Italian.. bring on a menu full of pasta choices.  But if you want to be a variety place, at least of the higher-end sort,  better to focus on a smaller number of options and just do those exceptionally well.  

As is for an example, the dinner menu has 14 appetizers and 11 salads!    ...and I'm not even including the mini sandwiches in the appetizer count!

=== Food and Taste **: A nearly complete miss.   This was my first time and with such an extensive menu, i certainly haven't tried most of the menu so perhaps I just didn't choose wisely.   My server said the dishes I selected would be outstanding; one supposedly even being the best item on the menu.  Presentation was innovative and I'd at least give them an 'A' for effort but in result ranged from reasonably impressive (the lobster corn dogs) to average (duck / sides) to fail (the Tuna Mojo which should more appropriately have been called the massive mound of couscous).    As for taste, every one of the dishes failed to impress with the exception of possibly the Tuna Mojo.   The Duck was fresh but not nearly as good as the one I had at Beautique in NYC the week prior; let's call it average.  That said the brussels sprout leaves accompanying the Duck where probably the best thing I had this evening.   The Tuna Mojo gets points for being super fresh but again didn't really challenge the tuna at say Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House downtown for example.     The Lobster Corn Dogs, Brussels Sprouts [side], and Mexican Jumping Green Beans all sounded great but failed to have any synergy with their ingredients.   If you do go to the Saddle Room definitely take a pass on these last three.

=== Drinks ****: Had one: The Mommy Dearest.  I'm more of a straight-up kind-of-guy these days but this drink was definitely decent though I have had several drinks at other places in the past recent days that were better.  Props for the little hanger on the side.  Based on this one drink and the atmosphere, I would definitely recommend this place for drinks.

=== Price and Value *: I'm usually the one saying "Expensive?  What are you talking about???". However this place really can be ...for what you get.   Value is definitely relative.   I've been at places that run $300 for dinner/drinks per person and thought it was of great value.   $150 for what I ordered at Saddle Room and not being even slightly impressed, NOT.  The main culprits were the Lobster Corn Dogs and sides.  The Lobster Corn Dogs ...mostly bread, hardly any lobster $16.95.The sides: Brussels Sprouts $12.95 and Mexican Jumping Green Beans $9.95.   Given the lobster corn dogs and merlot ketchup did not harmonize and overall was just OK at best, save $10.50 and get the mini corn dogs from Buffalo Wild Wings just down the road that funny enough blow these away.   They won't come on sticks but hey...    As for the sides, again fancy prep, which I am definitely for, but it just doesn't come together.    Even if it did, at these prices, the cost of the sides at Saddle Room are on par or more than the best places in all of Chicago.  Sides at Maple and Ash in the Gold Coast, Chicago's hottest steak house right now, range from $8-$15 but are amazing.  M&A's Creamed Spinach and the Brococolini, Pickled Peppers & Pine Nuts -for example- are both only $8 and M&A is approaching the high-end; several steps up from The Saddle Room.

BTW Saddle Room, not that I'm a spelling-bee champion by any means but Corn Dogs is spelled with a space and Brussels with an 's'.

=== Service ***:  Friendly and fairly reasonable.  Was off with the recommendations but no major complaints.  Could have been more attentive if anything and when I dropped some hints that the food was off should have inquired more or at least asked about those specific things again later.   They did ask in general if everything was OK which I quite frankly didn't feel like getting into at that moment.   

Summary: I'll likely come back to try some of the other menu items but for now I can only recommend The Saddle Room for drinks and light food;  skip for a full out dinner.

Got dropped off by a cool Mongolian cab driver who literally looked Korean. It's located in a "not-much is happening" neighborhood. Had a chicken cobb salad. The dish was perfectly laid out, but it didn't taste as perfect as it looked. Nonetheless, the place was great for a quick lunch meeting.

Was I lost?  What was I doing way out here having dinner?  Well, go where the locals go, I always say so when a friend of mine who lives out this way suggested the Saddle room for dinner, I gassed up the car and headed out.

The Saddle Room is interesting, especially if you are a horse lover as this place is everything horses, including you can do some Off Track Betting if you so desire.  Given it was a great night, we sat outside overlooking the marsh to enjoy the weather.

I ordered a Moscow Mule to drink and was disappointed that it didn't come in the more traditional copper cup.  I don't know why I think it tastes better in those but I do.

For our appetizers, we ordered the tuna tartar and bruschetta.  The server quickly came back to tell us that they had no "fresh fish" that night so no tuna or salmon requests could be accommodated.  Really?

Oh well.  So the bruschetta was interesting, served with plenty of mustard seeds and a bit unlike any I had ever had.  And since the menu wasn't really calling out to me, I asked for the after hours menu which had a build your own kobe burger on it which seemed like a better choice.

The food was really slow to come up which was surprising as it wasn't that busy.  And drinks were even slower as the server said she "had to get them all the way from inside".  Odd given there was a bar out on the patio but it wasn't manned.

Our final disappointment came with dessert.  Our server suggested the "cookie flight" which were 4 different kinds of cookies.  They weren't good.  One was a burnt s'more.  One was a jelly like thing with a weird mouth feel.  One was a chocolate thing and the best was s peanut butter cookie.  Not worth ordering.

My favorite part of the place?  The women's bathrooms.  They are like individual horse stalls each with a horse name on them and are really clever.

All in all, it was okay.  I was expecting more given the way my friends talk about the place.

Two stars for the atmosphere. No stars for the food. I'm sorry, I can't. I've been sick now twice from coming here. Maybe the food is too rich and I just cannot stomach it. The gaucho lasagna was dry, had no tasted and $30!!!! My husbands ribeye was full of fat, and his potatoes had no flavor and were dry. The kitchen sink dessert was so dry, the chocolate cake portion, accompanied by an overwhelming amount of potato chips drizzles in chocolate. Our bill was 153 dollars. This included two drinks each. I'm happy to spend this much money on innovative, non-chain restaurants. You have got to get someone in here that knows how to cook however.... would love to see this place succeed.

Top marks! We held an 'Irish wake' for a family member for about 50 people, involving lots of logistics and special food needs. The staff was on top of every detail, providing some of the best service I've experienced. The food was fresh, tasty, and replenished as needed. The manager, Jay, went above and beyond in every way. We were somewhat scattered and emotional, having to put this all together due to an unexpected death, and he flowed with us, answering all questions and situations with thoughtfulness and kindness.
I believe that the day will result in many new patrons - so many in our group commented that they didn't know this place existed (its tucked away, not on a main road) and that they want to return to sample other dishes.
Well deserved 5 stars on all counts!
Went here today after visiting Goebberts farm with friends . The staff was great , cocktails and wine selection were fantastic and the food was to die for .   Would recommend this place to anyone .

My husband and i had our first meal here today and it wont be the last. jay goldberg was 
exceptionally helpful and a gracious host. my husband had the duck with fried brussel sprout
leaves in a blueberry onion relish. can't believe anyone wouldnt be wowed with this dish. i had
the gnocchi with carnitas was great !! nice spin on a pasta dish .dessert was rasberry struesel 
with a sour apple sorbet. soooo glad i tasted it .. will say its very hard to decide what to choose off the great menu but so far everything we tried was worth another trip and we live on the far south side of chicago.  pls keep up the fabulous cooking and we will be back.
love the menu, ambience and overall vibe in this place!  nice afternoon outside by the fire or cozy night eating some awesome appetizers.  Definitely, will make this a regular spot!
Samantha behind the bar is awesome!  Ask for her!  We had reservations for the dining room but ate at the bar thanks to Samantha!  The duck and the chicken were great!

I had my birthday dinner with 8 friends here and it was wonderful. 

The drinks are perfectly crafted, food is delicious- though some portions are small (mainly their steaks). But the outdoor area is great minus the pesky mosquitos. I was one of two people celebrating birthdays in our group and they provided us both with complimentary dessert. Not a lot of places do that so it was much appreciated. They also split the check between 5 different couples.

Hands down one of the best restaurants in the Northwest suburbs! Fit for Foodies, Romantic with a scenic view!

Ambiance: Warm, cabin like feel with an incredible wood burning fireplace for those cold fall/winter evenings. Back dining room has an impressive wine wall that adds to the ambiance. I like low lighting unlike some places where the lights are turned up so high you need to have sunglasses just to read the menu ;)

Bathrooms: Horse stalls, what great concept, love it!

Outdoor Patio: Really enjoy their outdoor patio, it also has a wood burning fireplace to enjoy cocktails or snuggle by with your significant other. 

Food: Hats off to the Chef! They have an eclectic menu and some items do change regularly which I like. This is not your average menu so if you're not adventuress or a foodie like myself you may opt out for a place like Weber Grill.  If you're a cheese lover then try their every changing selection of cheeses paired with marcona almonds, olives and artisan jams. Steak and Eggs Carpaccio is also one of my favorites. For dinner I like their Duck or fish of the week.

Desert: If you're a coffee lover the Cappuccino is a must try! They roast their own coffee beans and the taste and smell if wonderful. If you're use to Starbucks bitter ass coffee then you're in for a treat here.   The desert menu changes often as well, some of my favorites were the; Avocado cake, Terrarium,, and Manhattan square.

The owners of Saddle Room just opened up a new Gastro pub concept called "Hardware" in North Aurora which is Amazzzinnn!!!!

I've come here a few times because it's close to my office. They have VERY strict rules about their happy hour. I've come with a large group of my coworkers many times, and if we're ever outside of the small box area that allows happy hour, they absolutely make no exceptions to honor it. I understand them not wanting to give everyone special treatment, but because of their strict rules, we opt not to order food/minimal drinks/go somewhere else altogether. I think it's a bit ridiculous for them to turn away business from a large party of 10+.

On top of that, service is always slow. Either that or the waiters constantly seemed burdened by our requests. 

The drinks are good, but they're overpriced and I've tried several food items here, nothing is bad but nothing is memorable either. I will admit that the kobe burger is quite good here, and is probably the only redeeming quality about this establishment. If I'm in a mood for a burger, or my coworkers don't want to venture too far, I'll suck it up and make my way here.

Awesome atmosphere and staff. Awesome beverage choices. Unfortunately they need to look at their chef. While the menu looks great, everything is overly greasy and over seasoned. Some tweaks to the preparation will make this a sure 5.

Been here a few times now, mostly for drinks after work. The beers are good, service is a little slow. Today came with my wife and sat outside. Ordered apps of flatbread and tuna tartare. Flatbread was a little salty and the tuna was ok. Beers were good and my wife enjoyed her blueberry mojito.

This was my first time at the Saddle Room, and it most assuredly will NOT be the last.  My companion wanted to go there and it was going to be her treat.  That was icing on the cake.

We went there for dinner on Easter. The place was rather empty, of course, most folks do brunch as the meal of the day on Easter.


The menu was quite eclectic.  We decided to split an appetizer and a dinner salad.  For an entree, I had duck breast served medium rare with an excellent blueberry sauce on a bed of sauteed brussels sprout leaves.  When the wait-person described how it was prepared, I was a bit skeptical, but went ahead with it any way.  It was nicely presented, and after the first bite of the medium-rare duck, I was awed!  Needless to say, I had never had sauteed brussels sprout leaves before either, but they too were delicious.   My companion had a seafood dish, which she said was excellent, too.

We ordered a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon (Louis Martini) for $49, which I thought was pricey even in an upscale restaurant.  The wine list was one of the longest I've seen, and the high-end prices were out in the upper atmosphere.

We shared a very good mouse-based dessert.  During coffee and dessert. the manager came to our table to inquire as to our satisfaction with every thing.  We asked about the Chef, and the manager told  us her name,  (which I can't remenber at this time), but told us that she had worked with the well-known
Chef Rick Bayles.  .

I'm anxious to go there again s oon, and while I would love to have the duck breast again, I probably owe it to myself to try other entrees.  

The service was very good, and the restaurant layout and decor was very nice.  Our booth was close to a large fireplace, which was quite welcome on a rainy Easter evening.

One star for the beer selection, another for the filet. That's about where it ends. Super slow service, overcooked 60 dollar strip steak, and again slooow service when there was hardly anyone in the place. Oh, and messy bathrooms. Just disappointing overall for that calibre of restaurant.

The best cocktail place in the northwest suburbs. Some of the martinis can be a little on the sweet side but all are creative and taste great. The ambiance in this dark and rustic. Great for dates. The patios have wood burning fireplaces going at night that look over natural wetlands. Awesome place for watching the sun set.  All the food I have had has been really good also, so maybe I just picked the good stuff off the menu. Tuna tar tar was amazing, the roasted pear salad I cleaned my plate and my dates plates leftovers. The filet and duck were both great. This place is officially my new favorite suburb place. Never crowded and great friendly service!

Our second time at the Saddle Room and it was just as good as the first . Placed pear salad is  superb. If you order the grilled Caesar salad make sure to ask for additional dressing . We had the Filet and Salmon . The Filet was perfect and the "Sushi grade" Salmon was delicate and tasty. Great place for a special occasion or a night out,. Great bar and OTB for entertainment after dinner. Great  ambiance  great service.

I love the smell of a fireplace with real wood burning especially on a cold November night.   The calamari was really fresh and we tried the Poblano Picasso salad and I have to say it was really good.  What a different taste for a salad.  We had the Thanksgiving special and they were really nice and split the plate between the two of us, since our eyes were bigger than out stomachs.  The split portion was very adequate.

Our server was great--she offered suggestions and was always checking our drinks and satisfaction.

This place is easy to miss.  If you are not familiar with the area, you wouldn't even notice it.  Cabala's is at the other end of the parking lot so look for their sign!

I have visited the Saddle Room several times now and I love everything about this place. I am an equestrian and adore the horse decor right down to the horse stalls for the restrooms. They did a great job of setting up the restaurant with keeping the off track betting in the back and separate from the regular bar and dining areas. 

My favorite part about this place are the fire pit areas. It's so nice to relax with friends around the fire on the couches and have a few drinks. You can even have dinner at a table and then move down to the fire pit for some after dinner drinks or dessert. I have not been there in the summer time yet, but will definitely go to enjoy their great outdoor patio with outdoor fire places. 

The food is fantastic. I tried the meat board which is delicious especially the duck bacon and the sun dried tomato spread with the toasts. I had never tried duck before and can't believe what I was missing. The short rib, skirt steak (probably my favorite dish there, can't believe it's skirt steak), duck and the coffee rubbed prime ribeye are all phenomenal dishes. 

The drinks have fun names and are a refreshing change from the usual bar drinks. They have a great wine list too. The espresso is fantastic as well. Pour some over their vanilla ice cream for a delicious dessert! 

Although its a little pricey I feel I get my money's worth there between the fabulous service and the great ambiance. I definitely look forward to many future visits and highly recommend this place.

Came here on the 4th of July (unplanned) and it was my first time there. I hadn't heard anything about the place but we were so happy we came. Very good service, good menu choices and the food was super tasty. Wasn't overly expensive either. We sat outside and it was really chic but cozy all in one. Nice atmosphere. 
Looking forward to coming back again.

So apparently reservations don't mean anything is reserved here..I dropped off my girlfriend to check in so I could go park in the Cabela's parking lot and walk to the restaurant...and once I got there we informed the host that our entire party was here.  He toddled off to check on our table only to come back and say that they had seated someone else there, so would we mind waiting 30 minutes while they got us a table...umm no tiddlywink, why wouldn't you move the people that you just sat at the RESERVED table and have them wait 30 minutes.

Piss poor customer service and I will not be back.

A very confusing establishment. Is it an OTB sports bar? An ultra lounge restaurant? A country western themed bar and grill? An over-priced experience? 
Pros: nice selection of local craft beers, very delicious food options, good presentation for both cocktails and food.
Cons: service can be hit or miss, very pricey menu options.

My wife and I stopped in after visiting Cabela's. We were drawn inside by the smell of smoke coming from the cookers.

I loved the rustic look, the fireplaces both inside and outside, and the general dcor of this place. We were seated promptly, and the staff appeared to be very attentive.

We asked for suggestions from our server, and he was very helpful. When we asked about the asparagus side dish, he told us that it was a cold dish, and that it was excellent, but most people are wanting a warm side dish. His other suggestions were also very helpful.

We ate lots of their fresh bread with their signature herbed sweet butter. I ate too much.

I decided to order the Lasagna, and was not disappointed. It is not your normal lasagna. It was filled with wonderful flavors and things you don't normally get in a lasagna, like mushrooms! Love it! And the sauce was not your normal marinara. It was green! And so scrumptious.

The only complaint I had was the service. I mentioned that our server was very attentive, but that was only before we placed our order. After that we hardly saw him. We had to flag him down to get water refills, and to get our check.

All-in-all it was a good meal. We would not drive the 25 miles from our home to visit again, but if we are at Cabela's again we might stop in.

We certainly enjoyed previous visits, but the dishes have started to taste the same after a few times.  Tonight was the 5th time and most certainly the most disappointing.  We told the waiter we had been to the Saddle Room before and maybe that was our mistake. Drinks are good, if expensive.  
But the most disappointing is the calamari appetizer.  It was the highlight of the meal the other times, but tonight it seemed the deep fryer wasn't hot enough because everything was mushy instead of crispy.  I'm just glad we didn't bring guests because that would have been embarrassing.  
My husband always gets the flat iron steak and loves it.  I've tried various dishes including the duck, salmon, trout and tuna.  The duck and waffle dish is good if a bit cloying.  I found the taste of the dish lasted a few hours after dinner which lessened my enjoyment of it.
Tonight I had the smoked trout which had many flavor components one of which was a balsamic reduction.  But the glaze was just a decorative drizzle which didn't impact the dish at all.  I happen to love balsamic reductions, if I can actually sample them.
Maybe they were off their game tonight.  But I'm not one to give restaurants too many chances especially when they're twice as much money as restaurants with better food.
My tip ... don't tell the waiter you've ever been there before no matter what.  I think they try to impress newbies.
Our waiters and waitresses have always been very friendly and the restaurant is very inviting.  It's mainly the food that is hit or miss.

Came here for my birthday a few weeks ago. I have been here before and I have been pleased every time. The food is always quality and top notch and the service is never lacking. The interior has quality decor, the indoor fireplace is awesome and the betting area is really cool as well. I never bet here, just come for the food and drinks but I really like this place. The only negative is that the food always seems like it takes a while to come out, but it always comes out great and I always enjoy it.

One of the few restaurants around that matches  perfect atmosphere partnered with a simple delectable menu. From the minute you walk into this place it feels warm. The bar scene is great, next to a cozy open four sided fireplace. After a few drinks for certain you will find yourself traveling to there OTB Pony racing area. I for one have bought dinner twice with my winnings. Also the outside patio is amazing, which is a huge plus.

First time there, not really that impressed to be honest with you.  I couldn't find anything on the menu that really jumped out at me that I thought I'd like to eat.  I did however notice that they had a Late Night Hamburger Menu available upon request, on that menu was food that I was more interested in.

I ordered a Cheeseburger, which I must say was really tasty, no complaints there.  The home made chips were also very good.

My wife ordered The Filo with Pork & Chicken, see was not that impressed with it at all.

I found the ambience not so much to my liking though, but that is a personal choice on my part, I am sure others would like it perhaps.  It was very dark, cold & I thought that the volume of the music to be too loud.  I did like the type of music that they played, but I would of enjoyed it at lower volume.  I found it difficult for us at the table to carry on with our conversation.

I found this restaurant to be too pricey for my taste.  I do not mind paying a premium price for premium food, but I do not fully feel that the cost of the food matched the quality of the food.

To be honest, I will not be going back there again.

First Time, Last Time
Food was OK but served lukewarm. Very pricey for what we got. Service was terrible. Waitress came around every 15-20 minutes. Had to actually grab a water pitcher at the waitress station to refill our glasses. Ordered a drink but was told they couldn't make it because the blender was broken. Was then charged for it. The managers response was they were short-handed. No offer to make it right. Wife liked the outdoor dining. Could have got better meal (x2) at Outback.

To start, Finding the place was a bit tough because it's a bit hidden back and there and no directional signs like there are for other places. 

I liked the all wood yeh-ha atmosphere, but I wish I could have been able to see better. I felt like I was inside the cow looking out with how dark it was in there. 

Our server was nice and informative. Drinks were good- with my dates sangria being spot on great. The food was a big miss for us however. I felt like the menu was trying to be hip, but the actual food just missed by a mile. My date got the strip steak in  chimichurri and he ate two bites and stopped. I got the prime pizza and was excited when it came out because it looked beautiful, but fell flat on it's face when I ate just one piece. The flavors just didn't come together for me.

Came in for birthday party, service was slow, way over priced drinks and food. We ordered off the "secret menu" still over priced. Turkey burger came out raw. " chef stated was the salt on it" but other turkey burger was not pink in the middle.  Staff was very under dressed for the environment they were try to portray. Bathrooms were gross. All and all could think of 20 other places to go with better service and better quilty of food.  Do not recommend this establishment!!  Don't waste your time lots of other places to choose from in the surrounding area!!!!!

Atmosphere was really nice and service was prompt but it seemed like they had the second string kitchen on staff. Ordered lobster corn dogs and they were slightly burnt. Ribeye ordered medium and it was extra rare with way way too much coffee spice. Could barely make out it was a steak it was so black. Salad was wilted was well. Bummer, as they have a very creative menu. Service was prompt though........

This place is awesome!  The atmosphere (inside and out) is what I love about this place the most, with fireplaces inside and out...very cozy.  The food is great and has unique ingredients and flavoring (although a coworker of mine tried to order a menu item to his liking and the chef refused to cater to his liking, which was kind of odd).  The betting is fun, especially when going for a night out with friends.  The cocktails were very good as well.  My only complaint would probably be pricing, just because it's a little steep, which can sometimes make it hard convincing a whole group to go out, but all in all, love this place and definitely consider it 5 stars!  Can't wait to go again!

I went here on a recommendation from several friends.  The consistent message was that their patio was awesome.  Overall our experience was ok, not great.  

Everything was very pricey compared to other similar places in the area.  Service was on the slower side (slow to deliver after ordering and never came back to ask if we wanted to buy another round), but that was ok since we were enjoying relaxing with drinks and appetizers on their patio.

The prime rib pizza was to die for. Such an interesting combination with the egg, but so delicious. Would HIGHLY recommend this pizza. Split that with 2 desserts and drinks, it was the perfect meal. Definitely recommend the peach sangria and cognac square (cheesecake) for dessert was to die for. I'm a huge chocolate person but so glad my boyfriend convinced us otherwise because it was amazing. Definitely sit outside and go around sunset, as it's very peaceful and pretty.

Nice bar for OTB. I was visiting shortly after the doors opened because of horse racing so this review is "day time on the OTB side."  

I've been at the owner's other location in Aurora with my friend and we enjoyed good cocktails, mini burger appetizer and had a nice time, I would  go there again...This place is similar but the OTB side has a bigger bar and seating area for betting that includes booths for larger parties. 

Today was Louisiana Derby Day, Florida Derby and Dubai, the richest, this weekend is what starts racing Stateside for me. I was pleasantly surprised with the comradery of fellow gamblers and the cheering that occurs as the horses near the finish!. The bartenders watch out for people on the OTB side but tend to stay on the restaurant side during the day. They simply float through to refresh a drink and make a quick chat with the people around the bar watching the races. 

I can't say anything about the dining side or the night crowd, however I heard nothing but great things concerning the food and the bar has an amazing Scotch selection.

If you want to get out, have a drink, play the slots and watch the races...this is a nice location.

Went around 10pm on a weekday and we were the only table in the whole restaurant till close. I understand the location but it felt kinda odd.

Building/decor - inside and out the restaurant looks great. The outdoor patio looked fun and I would like to go back for that.

Service - Average, with a "fancy" menu, servers should explain some things on the menu. Nothing too special.

Food - The restaurant likes to deal with duck so heads up on that. Calamari was good but other than that everything else was average which is disappointing. Most dishes were "I don't hate it, but I don't love it".

I would most likely come back to this place mainly to drink and maybe grab an app. Other than that, I will avoid being hungry and eating there.

No need to bring your own sewage, it's here!  I have been here many times and was super disappointed yesterday when I went into the bathroom and stepped in sewage. All of the stalls were filled with it and needless to say it smelled rancid. I was disheartened when the manager said "oh I thought I had gotten it all up"... Well you missed a spot, actually the whole floor.  I really feel the the entire restaurant should have been shut down for the day it was so bad.

When there aren't plumbing issues, this is a nice place to eat. Especially at night when the fire is a roarin, or in the summer on the beautiful patio.

We went for an early dinner on a Sunday night. Been there before awhile back and had a great time with some friends for a Sunday Brunch. Well, this was a complete reversal. Late Sunday afternoon, not crowded at all. Sat outside, service was mediocre had to wait more than enjoy cocktails or food. The menu is very marginal. Not many options and what options they have are extremely pricey for what you get. On top of that we expected at least a decent meal for the price. Failed on that one too. Even at the high prices the food was not worth it. Here's the topping on the cake. As I mentioned very slow for a Sunday afternoon. Yet all the employees and staff were there. BATHROOMS WERE DISGUSTING. Garbage cans full, smelly and just plane dirty. No excuses for that. Unfortunately we won't be back. Not afraid to pay for good food and service, but not willing to pay for mediocre food, mediocre service  and dirty bathrooms.

My family and I spent the 4th on the patio to enjoy the fireworks and let me tell you we enjoyed more then that! Our Bartender Patrick was super awesome! He made my sis-in-law the BEST ever virgin drink (she is prego) she said it was the first time she felt like she could join in on the celebration with a yummy drink. Our server Tiffany was very helpful with any questions you had on the menu and made sure there wasn't an empty glass at the table. Our meals were awesome! My husband had the filet and I had the tortellini (Tiffany's suggestion) we were both very satisfied! If anybody ever says "hey want to go to the saddle room" DO NOT PASS IT UP!
:)

Pro: Nice ambience and great service. Our waitress was very attentive, but not overbearing. Nice selection of wine and other drinks to select from. 

Con: Jerk flatbread and Jambalaya was not flavorful as I would expect for these two dishes. Very noisy dining area. Wooden tables and chairs are not very comfortable and a little best up. 

Overall: Great location to enjoy with friends and co-workers in a casual setting.  Have a nice size bar and outdoor area to relax and enjoy.

Since I work very close to this place, I've been here a ton since it opened. I've been there for happy hour drinks, numerous work dinners in groups of 4-10, and held a large group dinner in the back room. There is only one thing that keeps me from rating it 5 stars is that the food and drinks are a little over-priced for what you get. I have 0 complaints about the service, food quality, and drink quality and selection. I really like the OTB section too. Everyone is laid back and when you show up with a winning ticket, they seem genuinely happy for you. This is definitely not the case at Arlington race track.

Ok....great atmosphere. Really nice fire pit. Food is just on. Service is really good. Don't order the lobster corn dogs. Sounds good but not really. Skirt steak was good. Duck legs were really good. Overall good place. Just a little pricy for taste of food.
Wish I could review the food but after waiting 30 minutes for our drinks, we left. Waitress was unapologetic. Place was not very busy so there's no excuse. Stay away.

The drinks were great and the calamari was some of the best I've had.  The restaurant has a fireplace in it and it was going. That sounds romantic but the whole place wreaked of a bonfire.  It ruined the atmosphere because it was so smokey it was nauseating.  It also left that wonderful bonfire smell on our clothes.  Good thing we we weren't planning to go out afterwards or we would have needed to change and shower first. 

I had a steak which was cooked well done when I ordered medium rare.  I didn't send it back.  (Im not that kind of guy) I'm sure they would have corrected it if I would have.  I regret not saying anything because it ended up being very leather like. (Was that on purpose to remind me of a leather saddle? Lol)  I also ordered the Brussel sprouts that the waitress recommended.  They were very charred almost black so much of the flavor of vegetables were masked by the char flavor.    My wife said her meal was delicious. It was a fish dish.  I would give them one star based on my smokey, charred, and over cooked dining experience but since the apps, drinks, and my wife's experience were good I'm going to give them three stars and I will go back another time to see if I just had a one time bad experience.

Went here for the first time last night with my boyfriend and we both absolutely loved it! The food was amazing and the staff was awesome! I was a restaurant manager for a while so I know what good customer service should be like and let me tell you, they definitely have it! We will definitely recommend this place and we will be back!

I frequent the Saddle Room  a few times a month for lunch,  good menu and drinks, the building is very unique and the scent of wood burning relaxes me, the staff is friendly, attentive and unpretentious.

Maybe it was because it was the day of the Kentucky Derby party but it was so busy our dinner took more than an hour to get to our table. Or maybe we were forgotten? Props for original cocktails though. The service was terribly slow and the noise level was over the top. Our table agreed that we wouldn't be back. We were sorry to say that since it was on our dining bucket list for over a year.

Its a cool place inside and the food is great! I usually go there around 1030 pm when I get off of work for food and drinks. The foods always on point even though it's late and the service is good. Highly recommended

I had dinner here last night with my husband and mother in law,for my husband's bday.  It was our first time here I loved every thing about it.  From the food,service,atmosphere,drinks. It was awesome. Food does take a bit but for us we don't mind. I feel when you go out or on a date night that's what conversation is for. To take advantage of your time together. Can't wait to return when the weather is nicer to enjoy the patio.

Highly recommend this restaurant.  Imaginative food and drink menu.  Warm interesting dcor.  Great service.  Our steaks were prepared perfectly.  The outdoor area looks great, unfortunately February is not the best month to enjoy it.  Will go again.
Dan

Hidden suburban spot.
So impressed with this recommendation I received from my hair stylist. The best time to come is happy hour. The prices are good and the food quality can't be beat especially at that price!!

Over priced Prime Rib, & New York Strip steak.  They served a so called "pizza" ,  you could have blindfolfed me, and I never would have been able to tell you it was any kind of pizza.  It was a odd dough , with some kind of cheese, and 3 sunny side fried eggs.  OMG. Seriously ? The menu is bizzarre !  Very little here is even close to normal. I love different things, but this menu is from another planet. $ 36.00 for short ribs, really?   Not my cup of tea.

Burn the menu.... Re-Train the help .... & Call Gordon Ramsey ..... This Place must be a tax write off for somebody OMG!     And what the hell was with that little spoonful of a tasting? Couscous with balsamic reduction weak at best... Our appetizer came before we got to give her a drink order.  Oh my goodness the mini mussles & pork sausage ..... to die for ..... Literally upset my stomach..

A cool looking environment alone does not make a bar.  Love the "horse stalls" as bathrooms yet they seemed to trap the smell of piss.  My first martini was all right.  Pretty strong and not overly sweet.  My peach sangria- what a joke!  This place has NO BUSINESS serving that nastiness.  I couldn't even drink it.  It tasted like the cheapest tasting toilet water wine.  Luckily I was not charged.  Another ho hum, too quiet, boring suburban bar.

We had a terrible experience at Turf Room, their sister restaurant. We decided to call and see if Saddle Room had any availability, which they did. When we arrived, the service was amazing! Jay, the manager was welcoming, found us better seating, and wanted to ensure we had a great experience. Then our waiter Steve was wonderful too! We will definitely take the longer drive to go to the Saddle Room (where the manager, staff, even the bus staff are excellent and have gone above and beyond), rather than the Turf Room (where it was clear that our business was not important to the staff). Thanks Jay and Steve (and bussers) for caring about our date night!!!

Drinks here are delicious, and a bit off-the-wall, which I like.  The food was also good (had the happy hour apps).  Drinks are a bit pricey, I would expect those prices in the city, but not out in the suburbs, though the happy hour special for food was good.

I've only been once, and sat at the bar, would like to go back and explore the other rooms as I've heard they're nice, too.

The only downside: service was slow (it wasn't that busy, only a few other people at the bar).  We got our first drinks and food right away, then were waiting to get second drinks (we had finished our first), and no one was around.  Finally we were tired of waiting, asked for the bill, then someone came around and asked if we wanted another drink.  Too late.

This place has been on my radar for a little while since I saw it under hot new businesses.  My boyfriend and I wanted to enjoy a nice midweek dinner, so on Wednesday around 7 pm, we headed over to the Saddle Room.  It is hidden back by Cabala's and I never would have found it if I didn't see it on Yelp first.

We were greeted and seated promptly.  Our waiter was super friendly and helpful.  I ordered the Seedless Martini which was a bit strong for my taste, but delicious nonetheless.  Our waiter advised us to try the calamari appetizer which is cut fresh upon ordering it, so we couldn't pass up that opportunity!  It was good, but a tiny portion for the price.  It was fried calamari with fries green olives, sliced jalapenos and lemon mixed in.  Besides it being a small portion, I felt like the ratio of calamari to other fried objects was minimal.  Also, the fried lemon was just gross, super bitter and not enjoyable.

For dinner, everything looked good, so we decided to split a couple things on the menu.  We had tortellini, Prime Pizza and a side of Mac and Cheese (with poblano peppers!).  If you know me at all, you know that when I see Mac and Cheese on the menu I have to order it.  Everything was really good, but again a bit pricey for what you actually get.  

We did have enough food for me to take leftovers to work for lunch.  apparently my coworkers really like The Saddle Room too because a discussion ensued over my leftovers!   Oh, and they have awesome carry out boxes with separate compartments for different foods!  Awesome!

I also loved the ambiance.  The wooden tables and fireplace made the restaurant seem very homey.  I want to go back in the summer when it is warm enough to dine on the patio!
I loved the cocktails, the pizza,  the German potatoes and the chimichurri skirt steak. The location is beautiful too.

$3 for an extra piece of toast for an appetizer.

$1.50 for cheese for your cheesburger

Manager's attitude was "oh, well."

$50 for 4 bourbons, 2 of which we watched the bartender sit on for 30 minutes.

Too bad. The food is good, and the atmosphere is nice. 

Won't be back.

Took the GF here for NYE. Was a fantastic time.

Service was prompt and kind. 

The food here was amazing. The duck and kale salad was out of this world.
