The thing to take away from this place is when they serve you a cocktail they serve you a cocktail. You get your moneys worth here for drinks. They fill it to the brim. They are all fantastic and make the meal that muchbetter

I wanted to adore this place. I really did, and so I had fairly high expectation for the creative menu and impressive space. Unfortunately the food and service fell short of what I was hoping for. It was just ok. Not good. Not bad, just at par. *Cue sad violin*

The space itself is snazzy - lots of (as expected) horse references like cool individual stall restrooms with kitschy names, dark tones, and, of course, off track betting if that's your thing. Once we were seated I was quite taken by their cocktail menu, which was the star of the night. The Indie Wild Mule is refreshing and flavorful, a big ole combination of booze, fresh juice, ginger beer, mint and cilantro. Party in my glass. 

The service during our evening was polite but pretty short, it felt a bit like our server was rushed and didn't really care to spend too much time walking us through their deep menu. We ended up ordering a two appetizers and an entree each...

Curry croquettes: 3/5: Flavor wise, this was the boldest item I sampled all night. Texture, though, was a bit of a mess. The outside was oily and thinly crispy, the interior super soft and mushy. 

White bean toast: 2/5: A trough size dish filled with a thick white bean and vegetable medley paired with toast points. I give them credit for the size of the dish, but was very disappointed with the heavy flavor of the bean dip and even more disenchanted that we were charged for additional bread when only two toast points accompanied the giant bowl of beans. 

Filo chicken: 3/5: This item absolutely thrilled me on paper - everything sounded super delicious. Once it came out though, not only was it heavy, it was dull. The apple flavor was buried by the pool of brie and heavy filo. The veggies weren't bright and it took quite a bit of salt and pepper to give the dish some flavor. 

It's a bummer when you spend $100+ on dinner (date night) to leave pretty unsatisfied. I'm not saying my meal was bad at Saddle Room, but I'm certainly not running back here to drop another benjamin.

Different and cool Atmosphere, but just ok food.  I took my girlfriend here to celebrate her b-day as I found it walking one day on the prairie path while my daughter was in tennis lessons at Prairie Stone (otherwise it's a hard to find restaurant).  It looked really cool on the outside - the outside patio and wanted to check out the inside.

Pros
Very cool and different ambiance - darker, cozy feeling (some tables may be in areas too dark due to lack of window spacing).  I've never seen a restaurant with this setup, warm and cozy stone sunken fireplace sitting area with leather sofas surrounding and fun "tree" chairs.

Areas of Improvement
- Food - my girlfriend ordered the tuna provencal salad and the salad had no taste to it - the tuna was fine, but was very bizarre receiving a plain green lettuce salad - especially at $18.95.  I ordered the turkey burger and was fine - not great, but not bad and the potato fries (per our waitress recommendation - shouldn't have listened to our waitress - they were not good - came in a cute "can", but had way too much artificial seasoning on them.
- Drinks - we ordered kir royales to celebrate her b-day - they were way too sweet
- Service - ok - sometimes she disappeared for awhile (and it wasn't busy) and I was disappointed she didn't bring a candle for my girlfriend's b-day dessert. 

I was really hoping to like the food as it's a really cool atmosphere - may give it another try.
Amazing ambiance and beautiful decor. Very cool place for a dinner date or gathering. Menu is eclectic with choices like duck, short ribs, and pork steak. Highly recommend

They have a wonderful gluten free/ paleo selection of meals. The root beer cookies were wonderful! They need to progress the dessert menu to a few more paleo/ gluten free options. It is comfortable seating, in a casual atmosphere. The waiters are very attentive to every need.

First time eating here; a bit dark inside but really loved the fireplace and atmosphere. Waitress was awesome; she knew the menu in detail and shared her personal knowledge with the entrees. Food was really good, really enjoyed my lunch here! I'd go back if in the area.

Went for the brunch buffet on Sunday.   Service was prompt and friendly.  Three egg options to choose from plus an omlette station. Bacon & sausage  & ham .  The waffles were really good.   They also had  prime rib, cheeses and fruits.   Muffins and breads.  Desserts too!   I found it to be a little on the pricey side $23 per person. But it was good.
Will probably return.
Amazing service! GM is professional & very helpful. Ambiance is incredible & all around great experience! A must visit restaurant.

Went on a Friday night.  Had a reservation and it didn't seem very busy.  We didn't get our food until we'd been seated for 2 hours.   I could have forgiven the slow service if they had been friendly, but they weren't.

I have been here twice now and each time I fall more in love with this place. The first time I was here I came with friends as a part of a memorial benefit. My most recent visit was because of that first visit. I recently was put in charge of organizing all of our corporate events at work and many of my co-workers are more difficult to please but our Holiday Event at the Saddle Room hit it out of the park. 

 For our company event we had the back two rooms enough space for everyone to enjoy themselves. We had more than adequate wait staff taking care of us and the food was once again amazing!

I look forward to coming back for my graduation in a few weeks!

This place is so cool  and the food and drinks are amazing.  We come here once a month but seem to keep having problems with the staff.  Our waitress in particular this time was simply downright rude and it is really to bad as the food and drinks are good. This is not the first time we have had a not so pleasant experience. Very disappointed.
Great specialty martini, great service, horrible atmosphere. Or maybe I'm just not from Barrington...

Been there twice now, and though the atmosphere is amazing, food is mediocre. First visit had the young chicken, and it was beyond salty. Second visit had a risotto, and it was pretty bland. I had high hopes, and maybe next time I would try the steak. This would be an amazing place to have some drinks though.

I was part of a group of 7 this past week for a birthday dinner. I have nothing but good things to say about the service, but if you're looking for a FULL, delicious meal, I advise going elsewhere. The visual presentation of each plate was on point. 

There were also a couple inconsistencies in the food. I had ordered a medium well butterflied filet. I realize that's an odd request, but in order to make it medium well perfectly, butterflying it usually gives the best result. Well, it was medium. I ate it without complaining, but it wasn't what I expected. 2 of the people at the party had ordered Waloo. One came cold and one came warm. One came cooked and one came uncooked. Though it had gotten eaten, the consistency of the meals was off. 

Like I said, I have no complaints about the service. The bartenders were very nice and kept us well served and our waitress was very sweet and helpful.

This is our second time here.  The place is beautiful, extremely cozy with the brick fireplace in the middle of the restaurant and couches around it where you can have a drink and sit by the fire.  We were here last night on new years eve and the food and service as always was excellent.  We had the apple salad as an appetizer as they provide a very warm crusty bread with whipped butter and it goes well with a simple salad.  For entre we ordered the salmon with leek mashed potatoes and skirt steak with roasted round potatoes (delicious) and for dessert the root beer cookies which were incredible!  We ordered the warm winter cider drink and truly does warm you up, it was definitely a good choice on a cold night.  I hope this place sticks around as its definitely an upscale very cozy restaurant with really great food.

Ive been here several times and have nothing but good things to say. In warm weather the outdoor deck is delightful. In cold weather, grab a seat around the fireplace and have one of their awesome drinks. The tortellini is awesome. It is topped with yummy goat cheese. The flatbreads are all good, as are the beef short ribs. Some of the menu items are described in very flowery terms but fret not.. the servers are very knowledgeable and great at making recommendations. Definitely for adults! It is also an off track betting facility. I don't gamble but its no big deal because its very seperate.

We went here with some friends to celebrate my husbands birthday. As a gluten free girl, I asked while making reservations if there was a gf menu. They told me no, but assured me that the wait staff would guide me through the menu and assured I could eat safely.   

We showed up a few minutes early for our reservation and I was surprised at how empty it was for a Friday night. Eh, that's fine with me though because  we were seated right away. I again asked the hostess about the gluten free options and she said to ask the waitress.  Well, this was an interesting experience as when I asked she said 'uh, I don't know, I don't even really know how to cook.  There's so many ingredients in our things I could never guess what is or what isn't.'   

Great.  

She told me to pick something and she would ask the cooks to make sure.  I went with a steak, hoping that the sauce would be gf.  Anyways, she did come back and assured me it was gf.  At other establishments, in my case, the manager or chef would come out to double assure me that I could eat safely.  No one ever came out to check.  Even during dinner, they brought out an in between palette cleanser.  I asked the server of this if it was gf and he (he was dressed nicer too, so I wasn't sure if he was a manager or not)  said probably not. 

The drinks were good, I loved the fire wood burning smell and I liked the feel of the place.  I was just a little disappointed that my need for gluten free food was not taken too seriously (or that's how I felt).  Especially for being a place that was this expensive. 

I'm not a gluten free person by choice. Believe me, I'd love to enjoy a great pizza again.  I guess the good thing was that I didn't get sick, so it must've been a safe meal.

There on a Thursday night and did not enjoy the experience. Found the washrooms to be dirty and overflowing with paper towels all over the floor.  Service staffer was distant and NOT customer friendly.  Food was mediocre at best.  Felt like this place was run by absentee owners/managers.  Unfortunately, such a nice looking place has gone to the dogs (instead of the horses!)

The BEST!  Have dined here many times - bridal shower, mother's day, with friends  .. food is interesting and yummy, service is terrific and the front desk attentive, helpful and always accommodating!  Don't MISS this one!

The Saddle Room is a hidden gem in the NW suburbs...Western themed the food is great and the service is knowledgable and friendly. (I recommend Roberto!)   Love the Duck confit & fig Flatbread and yummy Calamari.  We love the back deck. Great view, fireplaces, and great blues music.  Plus it's an OTB, so you can play the ponies if you so desire.  I don't understand the negative reviews, but do understand some people need medication.  Every experience is different.  Anyway, The Saddle Room is highly recommended!

I'm a fan of The Turf Room, in N. Aurora, which is the sister restaurant.  The menu and atmosphere are nearly identical, but the service at The Turf Room is consistently better.

The most recent experience, which helped me commit to a mere 2 stars, involves what I can only describe as tepid lunch service at the bar.  The bartender, (his name I cannot recall, but he had a shaved head and a long, scruffy black beard) had no discernable enthusiasm, with me or any of the other bar patrons.  He simply moved about, seemingly avoiding eye contact, preferring to look about for napkin rolls or checking the inventory of the Heinekens (twice in an hour...there was a least a case in there).  He did not interact with any customers beyond printing a tab or taking an order, the latter of which he did only after myself and the other customers called out to him.  

Perhaps he was too busy, you might suggest!  If that were the case, it would be understandable, but its the day after Christmas, 1:00 in the afternoon, and the Saddle Room was far from busy.  Maybe he was filling in for someone.  Maybe he's nursing an egg nog hangover.  But whatever he was, he was not engaging or interested in his occupation.  

I'm not expecting my bartenders to entertain me, but at least have the courtesy to offer me a menu and see if I wanted to order food.
Loved it! Drinks were strong and complemented perfectly! Tuna bbq was flawless and the polenta, wow speechless.

The Saddle Room is one of my favorite restaurants. I love the ambiance inside, and recently was able to have dinner outside, which was great!  The only downside was once the sun set the Mosquitos were terrible. The food is always delicious, and they have the best cocktails. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that the portions are a little on the small side.
Went to celebrate a birthday and we were very pleased. We were a small group but the did have large groups there.

Omg... Best food I've ever had in the suburbs! Service was excellent, although the bartender was way too busy making all sorts of juices that she didn't even notice us for a while. She politely apologized and was excellent after that explaining how the bar has to do so much prep. They really work very hard there. 
I had the best martini of my life here too, it's called comfortably numb, JUST TRY IT! Melon salad was amazing and everything my friends had tasted really fresh.

This was our second visit to the Saddle Room. As before, we were warmly greeted by the hostess and opted to sit at the bar. 

As this was the day after Christmas, the bar area was not terribly busy and we easily found seating. We were quickly greeted by our bartender who introduced himself as Ed and asked for our names, too, which was a nice touch. Despite what Aoife Z. / Anne L. [or whichever moniker she is using] stated in her review, Ed was considerate and low-key. He was attentive to us and the other patrons sitting in our vicinity.

For drinks, my wife enjoyed a Maryhill viognier, while I tried a farmhouse Belgian ale. 

We preferred to sample the following appetizers for this visit: whites beans seasoned with rosemary; tuna tartare blended with cucumber; and falafel croquettes served cranberry chutney...an eclectic sampling which was delicious. Each plate was presented with an explanation of the ingredients and preparation. After eating for a few minutes, Ed checked on us to ensure we enjoyed our food and asked if there was anything we needed. From my perspective, everything hit the mark.

All in all, our experience was pleasant. The service was just right. The food and drink were delightfully appetizing. ...and as we left, the hostess pleasantly wished us a nice day.

We will gladly return to explore more of the menu and drink offerings.

This is our go to spot!!! My husband and I love the Saddle Room. The ambiance and the carefully crafted dishes make for an enjoyable night! Steve has been our waiter the past couple of times and his service was top notch! He gave great explanations of the new dishes, answered our questions with care, and really made it a special evening for us. We have even been here for their Sunday brunch and we were equally pleased.
Awesome!! So many gluten free choices!!! Loved the outdoor seating. Loved the menu!! Great service too.
Great food, great atmosphere!  I've been a handful of times and haven't been disappointed yet!

Unfortunately, we were not prepared for the cost and limited portions!!! Atmosphere was fantastic, food was very tasty, however, the portions verses the cost was ridiculous...I ordered a skirt steak for $28 and the portion wouldn't fit on a McDonalds Happy Meal burger bun!!! Would not recommend eating there, # on my way to Burger King!!!

This place is very confusing...I enjoy innovative upscale dining but this restaurant/bar/OTB is just all over the place! 

The good: 
Went for my mom's birthday and had a fun time. The restaurant is gorgeous as is the patio. The horse betting onsite is fun and something different to do! Hostess was pleasant but could do a better job explaining the layout and offerings.
The bad:
Way overpriced for Hoffman Estates. Wine by the glass averaged over $15 which is about $5 too much for the suburbs. Entrees are super pricey too and there weren't any mid priced options. Food was ok, but nowhere near memorable in relation to the cost. The music was way too loud and the AC way too cold. 
The ugly:
The menu options are downright crazy. There aren't any basic options if you aren't feeling something creative. Service was friendly but very basic. The facial piercings are so distracting and just not a good look for those in the service business. 

All in all the place has so much potential but needs to get their employees polished and poised to sell the concept. The menu needs some editing as well. Maybe John Taffer could help get this place off the ground?!

Best burgers and fries around.  Period. Go here, and go often.  That's my advice.  
Fish fry, chicken, it's all good.  
It's basically a bar, so the atmosphere is what it is.  But that's not the reason you go here, you go here for their massive, fresh, delicious burgers.  In fact, why are you still reading this and not your way to Tracks now????  Get going!

A group of myself and 5 family members ate here for a birthday dinner and have mixed feelings about the place. We came (unknowingly) on cruise night, which was a Wednesday, but the place was still absolutely packed. We figured that, though, because it was also $1 beer night.

We went in to get seated and kind of just wandered through heaps of people until we found someone who appeared to work there. She told us it would be a 40 minute wait for a table, inside or outside. She seemed very flustered and not super friendly, so we kept checking to see if our table opened up so she wouldn't forget about us. I understand it was probably annoying, but seating guests was clearly not a priority. 
Luckily it did not take the full 40 minutes to be seated, and since it was cruise night, we looked at cool cars while we waited. 

I would highly recommend sitting outside if weather permits. The inside is tiny and everyone is packed like sardines and there is a constant flow of frantic workers and random people walking around. My 2 year old was with us, and she definitely would not have faired well inside. The place isn't super kid-friendly...which I understand because it's partially a bar, but they advertise as a bar AND grille, so the grille part could be more kid friendly. 

Right off the bat, they didn't have any drinks for kids besides a couple fruit juices that they use to mix alcoholic drinks. I got her orange juice. One of us ordered a CC and 7, but they were out of CC but she would have someone check for a bottle. My mom asked about martinis but the waitress said they didn't really do that, so she mixed her a simple vodka and fruit juice drink, which wasn't great. After waiting 20 or so minutes, she brought a water and apologized for not having CC. After another 15 minutes, she brought out a CC and 7 and said she made someone go buy a bottle because she felt bad! She didn't charge for it, which was awesome. I wish I remembered her name, because she was really good and attentive even though it was super busy. Now onto the food.

Cheese curds: I thought they were decent, Culver's has better ones. Cheese tasted fake but breading had good flavor. 
Fried pickles: delish! Slightly spicy and perfect amount of breading. Sauce was really good. 
Maui Wowi burger: delish! The quality of their beef is awesome and it was cooked perfectly. French fries are good too. 
Mac and cheese burger: way too much nacho cheese all over it, still good flavor. 
Big bacon burger: lots of bacon. Delish. 
Bucket of burgers: cute, yummy sliders!
Black and blue burger: way too much bleu cheese, but overall great flavor. 

We will probably come back again, on a slower day. Average prices, lots of food. The bucket of burgers would be perfect if you and a date just came for a few drinks and wanted to snack on something.

Cary had their Main Street festival today.  We're not into foodstand food so we ate lunch on the patio of The Tracks.  They used the best ground beef for their burgers!  But be warned, they are HUGE!.  Neither one of us were able to finish our burgers.  We did make a point to finish their homemade chips while we sat and enjoyed our beers and the live music right outside their patio.

I'm obsessed with Tracks food, so glad i saw them on tv! The burgers are outstanding and they offer so many different choices. The Kaboom burger is definitely my favorite. I havent tried much else but their italian beef is also amazing. The gentleman i usually get served by is always very nice. Some of the other wait staff are questionable. Going here on a Tuesday for $2 burgers and $2 tall boy high life is now my group of friends' thing. If only this place did pick up orders.

I've been here 3 times now. Really good food. I've had their burgers and their chili. Both of which have been home runs. My son loves the mac n cheese bites. It can be a bit loud but hey it's a bar/grill. The staff is has been very friendly and accommodating. Friendly and fun atmosphere. Lots of TV's usually with sports. It's great food and good service, what else is there to say?

Who knew it was going to be $2 burger day when I met three friends at Tracks on a random Tuesday for lunch. Three of us ordered the burgers (with drink of course). The fourth ordered a salad since she was getting married in less than a week. The salad was huge and looked delicious. My burger was done perfectly. The waiter was very attentive and kept our sodas full. My only complaint was that they need a better process of organizing how people are seated during busier times.

On Track

Food has been great here every time I've come (about five times in the last couple of months). I would give it a five-star rating for food - both taste and portion size. Service varies from efficient and friendly to slow and I-don't-really-care-that-your-glass-has-been-empty-for-20-minutes. 

Larger room is crazy-noisy, so try not to sit in there unless you're prepared to hear nothing and to scream your conversation to your friends. Bar is better, decible-wise, and you can get full service there too. 

Expect a crowd and a possible wait (especially on weekends and at dinner), and be prepared to find street parking as their lot has (literally) about four parking places.  

Also a note, all the seating is high top (bar stools). If you plan to bring: short people, children, older people, people in wheelchairs, people w bad backs or people who can't maneuver onto a tall seat, keep in mind the tables are tall and the "chairs" are backless bar stools.

Bottom line: bring earplugs, your elevator shoes and an appetite!

This is bar none, the best burger joint I have ever gone to.  I have had a few burger options here and my, by a long shot, favorite is the Kaboom Burger.  I have lately been cutting it in half and ether sharing it or taking home the other half so I don't feel guilty eating here.  This has become almost a regular stop for me, because the taste of these hamburgers are so good, they are addicting.

Because the menu of burger options is so vast, this is a great place to bring friends and family.  They are bound to find a burger that they will like.  The first thing you will notice, is they have a whole heck of a lot of burgers to choose from.  The entire menu is great, so don't be afraid to try something new.

Tracks is a great place to eat and have a drink! Bartenders and Waiters are all very friendly. Food is excellent, Rubens are the best, Monday night duel Pork Chop special is delicious, Burgers are really large and always the best you had( Blue Cheese is my favorite). Instead of fries I suggest their Chips. And the prices are always Low, check out all the daily specials, each is worth the trip. This is a local favorite!

I'm still dreaming about the food that I had at Tracks. Their mozzarella sticks were good, their fried pickles were also great (a big portion so you'll need to share with 2 other people, unless you like fried pickles that much). They have a huge list of burgers, it's a bit overwhelming but definitely nice to have variety. Their burgers were great, one of the best we've had. You will for sure find something you will like here. They have homemade chips or home cut fries and we were a bigger fan of the fries.

We came here on a Saturday at 5 with a group of 4 adults and 2 children. We had to wait about 45 minutes so get here early if you want to find a seat. Probably not the best place to come with young children but we made it work. They don't have regular sized tables and everything is in stools so you want to ensure your kids are big enough to sit in high stools if you want to eat in.

I'm good with this place. Been there twice now and both times my medium rare ordered burger came out as ordered. Burgers are huge as noted and along with the fries are a good value. The one thing is though... I'm more of a char-broiled burger fan, but Tracks seems to cook theirs on a griddle or in a pan. Nothing wrong with that - more of a case of personal preference than anything else.

Service was fine on both my trips - the last time I was there it was windy outside and with the way they had their windows open it was windy inside as well. One of these days I'll try something other than a burger there.
The best burgers i have ever had . Its fresh and delicious.  Fantastic place. Great service
great food again!bartender B was terrific as usual made sure i was well lubricated,,,,very good conversationalist! been coming here for 24 years!

I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. The burgers are absolutely out of this world and so creative. There's a huuuuge variety of beer and spirits too. The atmosphere is cramped and loud at night but the food is so worth it. If you're into sports, there's always something being featured on the wall-to-wall TVs. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, and quite frankly, I applaud them for doing their jobs amongst rowdy people with little elbow room. Waiting times can get ridiculous as well. Been there, done that way too many times. Alcohol is pretty average-priced, but the food is a touch more expensive than something like Culver's, for example. Mine and my boyfriend's last bill at Tracks was somewhere around $30-40 and consisted of fried cheese cubes (DO IT), a specialty burger, a smaller burger for me, two Cokes, and one beer (all without tip). Bottom line, you'll love Tracks.
Great hamburgers with 40 different hamburger selections.  Juicy and greasy!  The $10 Sunday bloody mary is a must!  Warm and friendly atmosphere.  Highly recommended.....

Have been here many times and unfortunately will not be going back. Went in on 10/23/16 and sat in the bar area. Received our drinks right away and then took forever to order because our waitress never came back. Then finally after ordering, never saw our waitress again. Someone else brought our food out and one burger did not come out on a pretzel bun as usual and the other burger was supposed to come on Texas Toast but was on regular burnt toast. We waited to say something to a server but no one came by so we tried our food. The quality was poor and we just wanted to leave and didn't finish our food. Another waiter had just come on shift and we had to ask him to grab our check because we still had not seen our server and it was not even busy. Will never go back.

Ordered the Pino burger. 10oz fresh, never frozen patty, thick bacon, grilled onions, sauted mushrooms, cheddar cheese (but I substituted American) and fresh sliced jalapeo. It was served on a very fresh, brioche style bun, lightly toasted. I ordered it med-rare and they nailed it. Not too many places will cook ground beef to order. Many are afraid of the risks involved but honestly, if you're serving very fresh product, what are you worried about? The confidence in The Tracks beef really showed. Some people would say their burgers are greasy but it was just very delicious 80/20 fresh ground beef, the way a burger should be. Plate was garnished with a thick pickle slice, tomato and lettuce. French fries were not fresh cut but very decent quality.

Service was fast and friendly. Server made one small mistake on the bill but she was in training. Great job guys. 

The only reason I gave 4 stars is, they don't brew their own iced tea. Fountain iced tea is horrible.

Really good food!  I go to tracks a few times a month for lunch.  On tuesday they have $2 burgers but everything on the menu is good.

They especially have really good burgers and salads.  Stop in for lunch you won't regret it.  Tuesday might be a little crowded.
Really good! great neighborhood bar. Awesome food and the service was great.

Visiting in Barrington and researching local hot spots with above average reviews I happened upon "The Tracks".  This place met and exceeded my expectations. The people there are great and the food is over the top. I look forward to visiting the area again. Hats off to "The Tracks".

The Tracks is one of my favorite local restaurants to go to. The service and food is excellent (my favorite is the San Francisco burger or the Tuscan grilled chicken as you can choose either a burger or chicken). Yes this is a local bar but every time I go there they do not disappoint!

The only reason I gave the Tracks 4 stars is because it can get a bit loud in there (especially on Tuesday nights). The best time to go is in the summer when you can sit outside.

I've been to a lot of burger places, both in the city and Chicago suburbs, and I'd still rank Tracks among the best burgers I've ever eaten. First of all, you could tell they make their burgers by hand and the patties are not frozen. The burger patties are juicy as hell and literally fall apart because its so tender. On top of that, they have a ton of different varieties of gourmet burgers. I've tried a bunch of different burgers that they offer but one of my favorites is the Chicago heat burger. You can never go wrong when you put bacon, special sauce, and onion strings on a burger.

The most mind blowing part about tracks is the price. Pretty much all of their burgers are around $8 or $9. That's honestly not much more expensive than a value meal at a fast food place, and you're getting a massive, delicious gourmet burger. I've never left this place without feeling fully satisfied and wanting a nap. The service could be hit or miss depending on how busy it is and how big your group is. Most of the time we're in and out easily within our work lunch hour.

Overall, Tracks offers fresh, huge, delicious burgers with a ton of varieties to choose from, for literally a dollar or two more than my work's crappy cafeteria.
Such a great local gem. The burgers are excellent and so reasonably priced. We've been 3 times now and had a great experience each time.

Truly excellent, all around. We told our server, Jammie, that we were new to the area and had never been to the restaurant before, and we then received some of the friendliest service we've ever gotten. The burgers were HUGE and delicious, especially the Black and Blue, and both the homemade chips and the fries were hot, fresh, and crispy. We still can't get over the fact that we got 2 giant meals (neither of us could finish and we could have easily shared) and 2 mixed drinks each (with good liquor) for $44! Having moved from Chicago, you really can't beat that. All that combined with Jammie's truly hospitable and exceptional service will definitely have us back very soon!

Food's legit! Make a hell of a burger and many kinds to choose from. My only gripe is the service can be slow. But if you've got nowhere to be, than enjoy a beer on the deck while you watch the game and chow down on a messy but solid burger!

The overall environment seemed a little dirty to me. I ordered the loaded bloody Mary and it was amazing. The burgers seemed average to me. The meat was a good quality but was not seasoned enough. Do not go there and expect a healthy meal. The burgers were pretty greasy.

I was heading out to Woodstock, and a pal said, 'since you're headed that way, stop at the Tracks Bar and Grill in Cary, and try the burgers.

It doesn't take much persuading when somebody I trust makes a suggestion like that.

Apparently, everybody in the world knows about this place, except me - it has been around for more than thirty years and year after year gets voted as the best burger in McHenry County.

Well deserved, I say.

I went with the Black and Blue, Cajun seasoning and AMPLE blue cheese chunks, not some wimpy, watery salad dressing. These are monster burgers, ten ounces of CERTIFIED Angus beef (if you just see "we serve Angus beef" on a menu - complete b.s., as 80% of the cows in America are Angus - but CERTIFIED Angus, that IS a big deal).

Anyway, the beef was great, impressive blue cheese, house-made onion straws and chips (the latter are damned hard to make, so kudos to Chef), and one of the finest pickles ever served anywhere. Truly. I ordered my "Black and Blue" prepared "bleu" and it came as ordered. Perfection.

As with most places in the area, they have a Friday night fish fry which is highly touted, and nightly specials, too.

Recommended numerous times by good friends. We all sat here one Sunday after a long day of autocrossing. 

The place is a sports bar and grill, with the vibe of a local dive or hole-in-the-wall. We got a table instead of sitting at the bar. When we arrived as a party of six, there was a 20 minute wait for a table. The plan was to sit outside but it had started to pour. We were seated in 15 minutes. 

It's clean, with plenty of huge flat screens showing any of the games happening at the time. I watched Montreal allow three goals by Tampa Bay. 

I ordered the Sunrise Burger (egg, lettuce, tomato, cheddar) and asked to have jalapeos. Fresh, sliced jalapeos were piled on top. No pickled jalapeos here. I also ordered a glass of Revolution Brewing's Anti Hero. 

The burger is massive. It had to be at least a half pound patty. The egg was an almost perfectly circular sunny side up. It was served alongside a very good helping of fries (which are plain, so you can salt to taste). I asked for my patty medium rare and was not disappointed. 

Wow. This was a lot of food. The picture doesn't do justice. Delicious, not too greasy, and good beer. I will definitely come back.
Pretty good burger. Meat was nothing like I've ever had before. Super greasy but that's the way a damn good burger should be. Fries are pretty solid too. I'd easily come back here again.

So far, cute place.

Had the Big Bang shrimp appetizer (not memorable)
Came here for Friday fish fry... It's 3:51pm and it starts at 4pm.  They won't let us order the Friday fish fry.. Really?  9 minutes... It will take that long to make the fish. Sooo. Waiting till the full 9 minutes is up so we can order . Rules are rules, right?

People are friendly, it seems people will talk to neighboring tables.  That's fun!  

Hubby ordered fish fry, since it's all you can eat I ordered a burger so we can share (in case he eats all the fish). I've heard amazing things about the fish fry and am excited to try it.  But, the burgers look amazing!  There appears to be over 20 different ones on the menu.  I ordered the caprese burger with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, pesto and fresh spinach with garlic mayo.

(This review is a work in progress as we wait for our dinner)

Lots of tv's with sports on them (each a different channel).  Definitely a bar but with the added amazing food benefit.

Ok, now for the food review:  
Fish fry AMAZING 
Burger/ so glad we came here!!!!!

You'll love it here!!!!!
Top notch food, service and atmosphere. Burgers are best in McHenry County without a doubt. And Sunday Bloody Mary's are over the top! Owner seems like a good man who treats his employees well.

Okay so I gotta say, I grow up in Cary and I have always hated this place. I almost want to say two stars, but I have recently found a new kinda love for food and have to give this place props.. the bang bang shrimp were pretty good here. No like bonefish though. The cheese balls were good but you can get those any where for the most part.. Tuesday  $2 burgers make this place a good choice however they're tiny burger and you have to pay for the bun, cheese or other extras.. last time I went I got a Chicago style dog with fries and though I could have made it myself at home, it was good. But that's how I would describe this food -GOOD. 

The drinks on the other hand are some of the worst I've ever had.. not one drink I habe ever enjoyed at this place! But... I don't like or drink beer.

I love this place.   They have the best burgers.   My husband had a burger that had two grilled cheese sandwiches for the buns.   He could hardly finish it.  
I like that they offer a chicken substitute for any burger which I always order.  We usually order the spinach artichoke dip.   It comes in a huge garlic loaf and is enough for 6 people!!!!   The only problem is that you may have to wait for a table.  There isn't a lot of room to stand in line for a table.  Nice outdoor eating area.

I went here today with high expectations because of the reviews and pictures.
I got the Tuscany burger, it was ok. It wasn't seasoned at all and the fries were soggy and not seasoned either. 
Was it worth the trip? I have had better... 
If you want an unseasoned burger and soggy fries, then be my guest! 
I will continue my search for that perfect burger!
Burgers, burgers, burgers - so much choice and all sound great. Final chose one and was lovely. Homemade and gorgeous. Also had the homemade chips - ace

Love this place, every time I go the food is awesome! And when family visits I insist we all go!!! A little bummed that they no longer serve chili cup size. Looks like i'll have to skip it to save more room for the yummy burgers!!
This place is great. The staff are really friendly, food is good and well priced. They have a nice garden. The bucket of sliders are some of the best burgers I have ever eaten.
Great burgers with a loud and busy atmosphere. Get there with time or you are going to have to wait. And not a ton of sitting space.

We have gone here a couple times to see if our first impression was wrong, unfortunately it wasn't.  The place is always packed, so some people must like them, though.  Both times we have been there they overcooked our burgers and I feel they they try to get overly 'fussy' with them, plus they are so huge, my wife had to 'knife and fork' eat them because they were so messy and it was impossible for her to take a bite it was stacked so high.

There are plenty of places that serve much better burgers, that we will not be returning here.

This is one of our favorite places when we're in the mood for a solid burger and homemade chips. They have a nice selection of burgers, and they're solid. Sometimes i don't even touch the burger  (save it for lunch the next day) and just have an all-chip dinner. I'm not proud, but i just have to own that.

If you want to beat the crowds, find your inner senior citizen and go early.

Pretty good fish fry that they say they catch wild, so that is hard to beat. The Bloody Mary's were good as well; they serve theres with a salt rim, a pickle, olive, and celery for garnish and I have to say, that pickle makes the Bloddy Mary. I have never had that before. It was a good, huge, burger as well and I couldn't even finish it all there, which was a good thing for later when i sent somewhere else to keep drinking. Overall, a great experience.  My only con, was that they didn't have a couple beers they promoted on the menu, and it was mostly domestic.

Heard of this place from yelp and it surely didn't disappoint. Came in for a good burger and the bar tender recommended me to the Elvis burger with peanut butter. Never would have thought its be good but I was wrong! Best burger I've ever had! Drive almost an hour to get there and I'm thinking about going back later this week! Very fast! Great staff! Keep up the great work!

I started working at the Tracks when I was 18 and although I left for school it will always be my second home. What makes the Tracks unique is NOT ONLY the irreplicable burgers or that each order is enough food for 3 meals at the price of one. It's the staff and amazing customers that have been loyal to the restaurant for years. 
That being said, when you come to the Tracks on a Friday night, don't put up a fit when you see there is an hour wait because everyone knows how amazing the "All You Can Eat Fish Fry" is. Also if your food takes more than 10 minutes in the kitchen, be assured it will be well worth your wait and a plate of edible awesome is on its way.
**My recommendation** 
-Come before 6 pm on the weekend
-Always have the tavern pickles as an appetizer
-The Homemade Chips make the best side
-Try the "Steph's To Die For" burger. It would easily be my first choice if I were to choose my   last meal

What happened to this place!? We used to love it.  But, we gave it a third and final try today.  The food is not what it used to be.  The location is still great and so is the outdoor seating.  But the food and service are lacking. My salad had almost no lettuce.  Last time, we asked for a medium rare burger, it came out well done, we sent it back and it came back rare.  Every time it seems as though they are out of one ingredient or another.

It is just a shame because this place used to be great and there are no others like it in the area.  Hopefully, they step up their game again-- with food and service.

Dropping my review to 4 stars after trying the fish fry. Burgers are amazing. So are the cheese balls--best I've had outside of Wisconsin.

The fish fry was super disappointing. The fish is incredibly under-seasoned. I don't think they use any seasoning on the fish or in the batter--maybe a tiny pinch of salt, but nothing else. After several heavy shakes of pepper, a big squirt of lemon and a lot of tartar sauce, it still wasn't gety good. The corn they serve is a joke--why even put that tasteless, frozen corn on the plate?? The potato pancakes I got were not hot, they were over cooked, but not burned, and again, lacked seasoning. 

I'll be back again and again, but never again for the fish fry.

If your prototypical burger is thick, juicy, and generally-speaking glorious, you'll find yourself at home at the Tracks. If you like having ample air to breathe or a staff that doesn't seem overworked and a little edgy at times,  you might want to reconsider. 

You don't come to the tin can that is the Tracks for the hospitality or aesthetic -- you come for a good ol' fashioned, mighty fine burger. The variety of burgers is unbeatable, and their Mac and Cheese Burger is still the best I've ever had. If you have an animalistic craving for meat and want it sated right,  come on down to the Tracks; just don't expect to be blown away by the service.

So awesome.  I'm not even a huge burger person but I'm so glad I tried one here.  I got the Lil Trackster(haha) the small one here and added bacon and it was still HUGE.  I don't know how anyone could get the normal size one.  And it was seriously the best burger I have ever had.  It was so juicy and flavorful.  The bartender was super nice.  The only reason for not 5 stars is they forgot the bacon on my burger so I had to send it back to get it and they charged for a side of plain old siracha sauce, they just squeezed it right out of the bottle but charged me for it.  I would understand if they did something different to it or something.  But anyway, GO HERE and GET A BURGER!
Amazing ! I just had the reintroduced Italiano and by some grace of God was able to finish it! A flavor dream! Hurry in and get one and bring your Fred Flintstone appetite,  this baby's a monster!

We love the burgers at tracks! I had the italiano burger and my wife got a cheeseburger. Both were delicious. If you've really hungry, try the double down burger. The burgers are juicy and you won't leave hungry.
The burgers are tasty, and they have a huge variety. The noise level is pretty high, and its not a good place to take kids, but otherwise, a good place to get a good burger.
Classic, simple, delicious bar food. Cheap drinks, great food. Good place to eat outside in the summer. $2 burger Tuesday is a great deal. Servers are nice, quick, and super accommodating.
This was my first visit. Came with a group of friends. I had the big bang shrimp and they are a must try! I came after dinner, so I plan to go again and have another go at the menu.

Best Bloody Mary ever!!  Burger was very good and fresh! Been wanting to try this place for months and glad I did!! Good for kids, they have high back chairs for the little ones if a family is looking to go here for an afternoon lunch outing!!

I was greeted when I got in, and promptly given a menu and the specials for the day.  Ordered the black and blue burger which was excellent!  The service was friendly, and the food was great.  Everybody had a great attitude here.  Really enjoyed it .  Thank you.

So this place is the shit! Huge portions and delicious food for a reasonable price. Bloodys are pretty decent too and they had $1 drafts which was awesome (not those little 6-8oz drafts). 

I walked out paying $17.30 for my big ass, awesome burger, Bloody mary, and beer. 

Service was fantastic! Very nice, very polite, and helpful gals.

There is a huge selection of burgers and i will most definitely be back to try them all! Also its a pretty decent ride around town so bikers come on by.

Not sure why this place gets so many good reviews.I have tried this place many times and never had a great meal. But, my husband wanted to go there. I havent been there in awhile and was hoping it would be good.Today I got a wrap with chicken that tasted like it was fried in old oil nasty taste. Barely any tomato, was suppose to have avocado in it there wasn't had to ask on the side. And there was suppose to have tortilla strips in it saw a couple little pieces and sour cream tasted odd. I have ordered salads before where same thing happens they always forget to put something in it.  Homemade chips very bland and odd taste. Wrap was barely wrapped. My stomach hurt for 2 hours after. I have gotten burgers there too. Bigger is not better if the burger isn't cooked and seasoned right doesn't matter how much stuff you put on it, it still isn't good.

 It is way to loud and dark inside. Not sure why there is hardly any lights can barely see the menu. The outdoor patio is nice.

Update: the owner of this establishment contacted me regarding my review and had asked his employees when this happened. I had informed him that the correct date on when this occurred was July 3 of this year. I do not know if this is ever happened before but I do not plan on finding out. I do however commend this place for being diligent on Yelp as well as questioning their employees. That is why I will rate them 2 stars and not 1.

Original review: Their power was out and they had no other suggestions of when or how it would be turned back on. They seemed annoyed with us that we were coming up to eat. It made me really sad because I had heard a lot on Yelp about how great this places. Maybe next time will be more courteous to the people in the want to come back I however do not.
From the time we walked in until the time we left The service was great. My food was delivered quickly and fresh. The menu has a good variety. A nice place to take the family. We'll be back.
The food here is amazing. Never had a bad meal yet. The salads are great. Huge enough for almost 2 meals. Italian beef is very good.  Service has always been good. Sometimes they can be very busy.

It was my first visit on Friday.  We heard so many good things about this place and it's been on our list to try for awhile.  I think we arrived at the perfect time since we didn't have to wait for a table and we're seated right away!  Very friendly service.. we had the cheese balls for appetizer and they were pretty good! I ordered the mac and cheese burger and my husband ordered the fire jack burger which were both very tasty.  One thing I do want to point out that it took a long time to get our burgers.  Since it was our first time, we weren't sure what the appropriate wait time from ordering to table.... maybe it was because it was getting busy?  Overall a great place for burgers and beers :)
Not very good. Had a cheeseburger it was horrible. Cold fries, bad service. Bartender took forever with order.

Tracks is one of my favorite parts about coming home to Cary. Lets start with the burgers... with over 30 types of burgers on the menu, there is something for everyone. Its a sin to stick to just one, so you are lucky if you are from the area and can come back once in a while to to try more! The food and the drinks are both reasonably priced. I always enjoy the cheese curds to start my meal.

The wait staff is always quick and never lets you go thirsty. They take care of the customers. I love that my glass never quite gets to empty, especially if I am having a spicy burger like the Chicago Heat... 

If you are just visiting Cary, make sure you get to Tracks and if you are a local, well then I have probably seen you there! This is the perfect place to get together with friends in Cary for a casual drink and a good meal!

I've lived in LA for 16 years, so imagine my surprise to discover that one of the most delicious burgers is being created in the kitchen of a trackside bar in the unassuming suburb where I grew up.

I read the reviews beforehand, and being the skeptical west coast foodie that I have become, figured that maybe the reviewers hadn't had the same type of "gourmet" burgers that are found in abundance out here in the land of Umami Burger, Father's Office, Plan Check, Pono Burger, The Counter...the list could go on and on. I am so fortunate to have had my doubts proven wrong! 

First pleasant surprise: Magic Hat #9 on tap. An occurrence so shocking it's worth repeating, ON TAP. And for what a west coaster considers a happy hour price. 

Huge list of burger options (there's plenty of other menu choices, too, but c'mon get real, why bother), perfectly prepared, and so juicy they literally drip down your hands. If you happen to find yourself passing through Cary, get off the train, walk over to The Tracks, and thank me later.

Food is good. Large selection of burgers. Every time I come here they are always out of something. Today it was onion rings and homemade chips. We were told that they only get shipments once per week. How can a restaurant only have one food delivery per week, and consistently be running out of things for years?

Our server Dixie was inattentive throughout the entire night. We asked several times for refills, she forgot items we asked for--ranch, water, etc. Once the bills came we were still charged for the onion rings and had to ask for this to be corrected. It wasn't busy in the restaurant so there was no excuse as to why the service was as been as bad as it was. It was clear she was doing her closing routine to try and get out of there which I felt distracted her.

A hidden gem in downtown Cary. Well maybe not as hidden as I would wish for, but it still has a neighborhood pub atmosphere. I can't think of anything to criticize on the menu. Every menu item, whether it's an appetizer, salad, sandwich or entre is prepared to perfection. The burger menu is as huge as the burgers themselves. I will agree with one of the negative reviews where they say that some of the burgers are too big to eat with your hands, but I would not consider that an entirely bad thing. If I recall correctly, any burger can be substituted for grilled chicken if that's your style. Even the eclectic menu items are prepared as if it came from an upscale kitchen (when have you had seared tuna tacos in a pub?). What's definitely not upscale are the prices. I am regularly surprised how low my check is at the end of the meal.

Downtown Cary is not the most convenient place to venture out to, but if you are in the neighborhood, it's definitely worth navigating yourself to The Tracks.

Really good food and a good price. I didn't drink but they seemed to have a good selection on tap. Waitress was a little less attentive than I would have liked but overall was a good experience. I would definitely recommend this place to friends that are visiting the area.

The Tracks never disappoint, top notch burgers and service every time I visit.  The fish fry is just as good as  well.  The variety of burger recipes is second to none... If you want a no bs thick juicy burger you need to check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

Not sure why this place has such good reviews -- overpriced, mediocre food that takes forever. Burgers are so not worthy of their hype.  I feel bad for the staff because you can tell they really are trying, and they are usually friendly, but this is just a pretty poorly run joint. It's kind of a cult favorite in Cary, I suppose, but I wouldn't put too much stock in that accolade.

I need to comment on the comment made by Allison about 7 hours ago about Traks. She is lying. I happened to be standing in back of this group and the owner was not rude nor did he walk away. He simply explained that this was a Bears bar and has been that way for 35 years. As for saying the Lions pregame  was on one of the tv's again wrong. The tv was on Fox and they were going to all the games that were on at noon. Perhaps they looked up when they were at Detroit because every tv in the place had the Bears game on. It really is not cool to post lies on this site. I have been in Traks many times and everyone there is always very friendly but it is a Bears Bar. Perhaps you should remember that and only go there when the Bears are not playing.

This place is AWESOME!!!
went here for the first time Saturday with my family.  Oh my god I am in love.  Everyone was so stuffed.  The burgers are amazing.  My wife had the blues burger just loved it and the pretzel roll is to die for.  The staff was amazing helped us out with what to order and very accommodating to our needs.  We will be bringing our friends back here next weekend..
I'm giving them 5 stars because the burgers are THAT great.  Service is hit and miss - but the Burgers... shut up! Like I died and went to burger heaven.

Great burgers at Tracks! Some of the best around.  Wish they had some better beers to go along with the burgers, but at least there's always Cary Ale House for that. Place get's PACKED, so get there early or send a friend in to get in line.
Best place to in Cary hands down, burgers are great so much variety. Never disappointed by the fantastic staff, home made chips are to die for.

Stop monkeying around and just go here if you want the best burger in a 25 mile radius. Forget the vibes, or sides, or the bar (which are all great) - the 5 star review is for the burgers. All the burgers here are on point, but my favorites are the Pino Burger (loaded with MF'n bacon, peppers, mushroom, grilled onions, cheese) and 'The French Burger'. I won't tell you what's on it, you'll have to go find out for yourself.
One of those 'best kept secret' places. Now leave me alone.

We had a very poor experience overall when we ate here for our first and last time last week. 
We were seated and greeted promptly by our server.  Everything was fine up until we places our order and things went downhill from there. 
After about 30 minutes we noticed people around us that arrived after us started receiving their food. The waitress also realized this and came to our table and explained that there was a delay in the preparation of my chicken wrap. She apologized and we were understanding. 
Eventually the food came. My wrap was bland and my wife's burger and fries was cold. Ice cold to the point it was not enjoyable. I can only assume the burger was sitting out for awhile when they were chasing the chicken for my wrap. 
I decided to tell the waitress we weren't happy with our experience, citing the long wait for food, the bland chicken wrap and my wife's cold burger. 
She was very apologetic, going as far as saying she would feel the same way if she were in our shoes.  She said there was nothing she was able to do and encouraged us to complete a comment card. We did and never heard anything back. 
I interpret my experience as a place that doesn't care about their customers or the quality of their food. The only thing not well below average about this place was our waitress.

The one time I had come to this location several months ago, I went with a group for lunch. One of the patrons was so obliterated that she fell on her face, got into a fight with her husband and had the police called, all before we even ordered our food. This was at 1:30 PM.

Probably not a location that is worth the time when you can't take anyone you care about there.

LOVE everything they serve! Can't say a bad word about this place's food! Service is always fantastic! Rob is the best server there is! The burgers are fabulous, but the fish fry and breasted chicken are also to die for!

Awesome Burgers, great atmosphere, and the service is golden!  No complaints 

My favorite is the Chicago fire burger.  The house made chips are fantastic

My first time going there was tonight and it was amazing. I got the pizza burger substituted the beef for grilled chicken and it was the best. They had the cubs game on and even though they lost it was still a fun environment with great food and awesome staff.

I love the food here - LOVE. And if I were judging on food alone, this would be a 5 star review, but, other factors contribute to the three stars. 

First, every time I come here everyone working seems confused and disorganized. A few months ago I was playing on the slot machines while waiting to be seated and I got carded 4 times. This is petty, but c'mon, communicate a little. 

What really led me to offer this review was mine and my boyfriends visit yesterday. The service was, in no way, terrible - but it wasn't great (or even good). We sat at the bar and everyone behind the bar seemed SO lost. There was no organization or method to the madness - which I'd get if it were busy but it was a very average sized crowd which shouldn't have created such disorder. Whatever, we got our drinks and everything was going good. We ordered our appetizer (the spinach dip that we LOVE), a cup of soup, and our entrees. 

The Spinach Dip, which usually comes in a bread bowl, came in a normal bowl with a very small side of chips to dip in. I normally don't mind paying the 9.99 for this appetizer because it's worth it with the bread bowl, but with just chips, it wasn't. I would suggest that in the future you inform your customers when there is a change in a dish. If I would have known that I'd be getting a lesser quality dish than I expect, and pay the same price, I would not have ordered this as an appetizer. 

A few other small problems: 
1. My soup came out after my entre, at this point I didn't even want it anymore. I guess some places serve their soups with the entree's, but most times when I've gone out to eat these places have asked if I'd like it with the entre or beforehand. 
2. When we ordered our appetizer and the waitress (bartender) assumed we were done ordering and we added that we'd like an entre she responded "have you SEEN the size of our spinach dip?". Like, what? I'll order thirty of those and twenty burgers if I want to, and if I'm paying for all of it, what does it matter if I don't finish? When I asked to take my salad to go she even stopped by and was like "full, huh?", in an almost condescending tone. Kinda annoyed me. She did seem nice enough but she was continuously rattled and I feel like she just needed to sit down and take a deep breath. She was stressing me out watching her. 
3. A girl that I assume was a shift manager was scolding two other waitresses in the middle of the walk way between the restaurant portion and the bar. I had to walk around them to go to the restroom and again walking back. This just seems tacky and unprofessional to me. If you need to discuss problems with your staff, that's fine. But don't do it in the middle of the restaurant. 

I don't intend to write this review to deter others from going to Tracks because the food really is REALLY REALLY good. My intent is for a manager sees this and it can be used to better the place and turn it into 3 starts to 5. I will be back, because yum, and hope that the staff can get their act together between now and then.

Excellent burgers and service! I've never had a bad experience here and if anything was even remotely wrong this amazing staff would do anything they could to make your experience a great one! Honestly, you should try the whole menu here because it's hard for me to even pick a favorite! 

P.s. Stop in there on Sunday's for fully loaded bloody Mary's! Or $2 burger Tuesday's!

Stock is rising. Although we ate at 4:30 on a Tuesday, an off peak time, the French fries didn't taste like fish. My wife's burger was undercooked. We ate outside. The tables are in desperate need of being moved and the patio underneath and around the umbrella bases need power washing. It's sticky with food and grease.
Definitely an upgrade after my 2 year boycott. Our server was AWESOME.
Best burgers around! Love all the toppings.. Cheese curds are awesome! Onion rings are so good! The spinach artichoke dip is so good! Would highly recommend trying Tracks you won't be disappointed

My suspicion is that Tracks started as a bar with food as an afterthought. However, I also suspect the food is now the primary driver of the business. 

The quality of the food is a notch above standard pub grub. The burgers are tops -- large, juicy, and delicious. The broasted chicken is also fantastic.

Prices are very reasonable. Service has always been friendly and attentive. It is surprisingly family friendly despite it's bar-like feel; grandmothers and little leaguers seem equally at ease.  

You'll be hard pressed to find a better burger in the McHenry county area.
Been going to this restaurant for many many years...and not once was the food anything but excellent and staff very personable and good with service. If I could I would give the tracks 100 stars!
Seriously awesome burgers! Must try in Mchenry County if you're looking for a great burger and a cold beer to go with it.

I ate here with my wife and two friends.  My wife and I each had a burger.  It was very good, definitely above average.  The French fries were ok,  nothing great.  My friend ordered pretzel sticks as an appetizer and they were great!   The big downside was the number of people in the bar area made it very loud and hard to leave.

Whenever I'm in town, I try to make a trip to Tracks!  The food is amazing, especially for the prices!  The burgers are delicious-  love the Pretzel buns, and all of the different "specialty" burgers!  Their salads are enormous.  I've gone in and shared 1 salad with a friend, and had more than enough!  I always ask for Kelly as our server.  She's a doll and not only gives great service, but makes everyone's evening enjoyable with her great attitude. 

I've had to occasionally wait for a table, Friday nights are usually packed.  When I do, the bar area makes me think of "Cheers"- with a lot of locals always there who seem to know each other.

Tracks is definitely worth a stop when you are looking for a casual, but tasty meal!
Does not allow take outs. Very rude on the phone...if the company does not allow it that's fine, but we shouldn't have been hung up on with no explanation.

Wow!  Burgers are amazing - and a huge range of options - something for everyone.  Service was solid - we sat on the patio right before a Blackhawks playoff game.

I had the Chicago Heat burger with bacon, onion straws, pepper jack cheese and their special sauce on a pretzel bun. Mine was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing.

My wife had the Stephanie burger. It came out undercooked, but the server took care of it.  It was perfect on round two (Which took me off five stars).

Service was solid.  Atmosphere was good - especially on the patio.  Food was great.  We'll be back for sure.

Moved to the suburbs from the city last June, still looking for my "Burger, Go To Place" (sorry no chain restaurants). Upon a recommendation from my son's Kindergarten Teacher (Thanks! Mrs. P.), she recommended "The Tracks". 
We went last Monday night Mar 30. 
Walked in, strolled through bar (wife and kid following) found plenty of seating in the back. There were other families with kids, (("kid friendly, (however they must be able to sit on a bar stool)) and our server Rob greeted us promptly with menus and didn't grimace when I asked for 3-waters and the cheapest beer in the menu. They had a Corona special, but I chose a PBR Tallboy. I will note they had an excellent selection of beers. 
We shared a wedgie salad which was pretty good. The house dressing was excellent. 
(We will talk about their dressings and toppings later). 
For the main course we ordered burgers. 
My wife ordered a medium burger with cheddar, avocado, roasted red peppers and their Amazing Chipotle topping. 
I had a medium well burger with a creamy cheddar and fried onions. 
I would like to give extra props for actually knowing the difference between medium and medium well and executing it to perfection. 
Tip #1 cut the burger in 1/2 easier to eat with the generous outstanding toppings. 
Tip #2 they are generous with their toppings. 
Myself, the more the better. 
My wife, should have ordered the Chipotle topping on the side. (I would have been happy) 
Fries were generous and very good. 
Burgers are great size 10 oz. 
Excellent value for the price especially with the DYNAMITE Toppings which they don't scrimp on.  
Food was served HOT, *VERY IMPORTANT. 
(I automatically deduct 1-2 stars for warm/cold food in a restaurant and hate a tepid burger held up for my fries or vice/versa). 
Will definitely be back. Best burger in the north/west suburbs I have eaten to date. 
Look forward to trying their Fish Fry some time. 
Rob, thanks again for your attentiveness 
and hospitality. You definitely helped The Tracks get this 5-Star review.
Forgot to mention they had the right games televised for our enjoyment.
After you come here, you can never enjoy a hamburger anywhere else since nothing compares. Great food. Great atmosphere. Love this place.

Great for burgers, weak on vegetarian options. Service is decent but not a ton of seating and they don't do takeout, which is tough when you have a toddler cause it's not a good place for kids. Great burgers though and solid place to grab a bite.

Born and raised in Cary, I love the historic downtown and the potential it has. I've been to Track over 100 times whether they are busy or slow there is no consistency. I ordered the caprese burger. I normally order my burgers medium rare but I've found that when I order them here they come out rare. So I ordered it medium, it then came out rare. On the first bite all I could concentrate on was still cold slices on mozzarella. My bun was soaked from the rare burger so I had to then eat it with a fork. I will say their ticket times are amazing possible due to undercooking of burgers. It's wasn't busy that late after noon, we got our food in a matter of 11 minutes. 

A few weeks prior I had the same experience with a to-go order, under cooked and this time it was all just slammed into the container ingredients all over like they had shaken it before giving it to me. Which I do understand it was a Friday which is their busiest night with fish fry and such but I would have waited another 10 minutes to know that I got what I ordered and that is was taken care of.
Great bar, but limited seating, burgers are the best, great prices, big portion sizes!

This is an update to my original post because I love this place so much.

I just came here after not being here in two years because I moved out of state. I think this place actually got better. The owner (I assume) makes you feel like you're walking into a family member's house. The service is quick, the food is perfectly delicious, and the atmosphere is just right (what can I say, I hate restaurants that make me wish I had a winter coat the whole time).

I will begin by saying that I really wanted to like this place.  My fianc and I go out to eat breakfast every weekend, and this would be the closest, and most convenient place for us.  I was instantly turned off when walking in when I saw that their tables and chairs were plastic with what looked like plastic garbage bags taped on as tablecloths.  We still sat down and gave the place the benefit of the doubt.  The workers seemed friendly, it couldn't be that bad could it???  Well upon looking at the menu, I saw that everything was about a dollar or so more expensive than their menu stated online.  This really frustrated me, it does not cost you anything but time to update you menu online, and in this day and age, that is totally unexcusable and misleads you customers.  Yet once again, we tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and continued our breakfast.  We both ordered the country fried steak meal.  I ordered my eggs sunny side up (which shouldn't be a problem at any breakfast place), I splurged and got the extra egg. 

The food arrived fairly quickly, but we were both turned off to see our eggs laid on top of our country fried steak.  I'm totally a person who does not want my gravy and eggs to cross.  To top it off one of my eggs was broken and my eggs were very overcooked.  Eggs shouldn't be something that a breakfast place has issues with...  The toast was well cooked and buttered though.  Sadly the toast was the highlight of my meal.  The country fried steak was okay, nothing memorable or that would make me come back.  We have ordered the same meal at multiple locations around the area, and our tab is usually right about $25 +/- $1.  Our tab at Gus's was $30 and change.  

Long story short Gus' is overpriced to the area, and the food is only average at best.  Tables/seating disappointing, but the people seemed okay.  I personally wouldn't recommend it as there are multiple better options that are close.

I.LOVE.THIS.PLACE!

This is not your average hole in the wall diner. Gus is a younger guy who has created quite flashback in time. His diner is simple and affordable and has the most delicious biscuits and gravy in town! I love the customer service and you will most likely not leave without Gus himself greeting you or telling you thank you.

Great food. Great service. I am never disappointed.  Yelp wants me to keep writing...  
I have been to gus diner half dozen times and I always leave happy.  Food is tasty. Prices are reasonable.  Menu offers tons of delicious options. Servers are super friendly and upbeat.  Great family environment.

Had a late breakfast here last week. It was my first time here. I picked it after reading all the good reviews on Yelp. Now I'm adding my own. I had a great, simple meal--one of the scrambler plates, which came with delicious potatoes and toast or pancakes; I opted for the pancakes and I'm so glad I did. They were so yummy--light, fluffy and flavorful. I asked for a biscuit on the side just because I've been on something of a personal quest for years to find the best biscuits in the Chicago metro area. Gus's diner's biscuits make my list! It was a really good biscuit. I was really hungry when I walked in, and loved everything. Good coffee, too. Not only is it good food at good prices, it's also a friendly place with welcoming, attentive staff, including Gus. The decor is fun and very nostalgic. I'm new to the area, so I'll be going back. In fact, I'll probably become a regular.

Lets start out with my first impression here, it's a small strip mall restaurant crowded with cheesy Applebee's-style 50's memorabilia.  We had to wait 25 minutes for seats while three empty booths were left unattended covered in filth and dirty dishes.  One of the first things you'll notice once you walk into Gus' is that half of the tables are just outdoor tables covered with plastic sheets for "easy cleanup" though they just wipe them with napkins between patrons...

While waiting we stood around with 15+ people, all gawking at the empty booths and tables trying to figure out if we should just take seats and ask for them to be bussed while we sat. Finally a waitress announced our name and pointed to a pile of dishes on top of a round plastic table.  We shuffled toward the table, wondering if someone was going to bus it while we were approaching.  We sat and waited...  and waited...  and waited... Finally a waitress came to our table and asked if we'd like something to drink, I pointed to the dishes and asked her to clear them, she just said, "Oh yeah, we'll have someone come get those.".   The coffee was bland, okay for a cheap diner but it was $4.50 here....  Even with 2 refills that's not a good deal.  

I had the lumberjack skillet.  It was literally just a mound of mushy potatoes and a half pound of cheese slathered with a half can of Hormel brand corned beef hash with two overcooked eggs slapped on top to cover the cook's embarrassment (I can only imagine this is the cook's rationale... I would be embarrassed if I served this to another person...).  

My brother had a hamburger.  It was a from-frozen tough slab of overcooked crud.  It wasn't any better than what you'd get from Burger King... for about twice the price.  The fries were crinkle-cut frozen bland mush.

A point to cap off this terrible adventure is that in total for three people to eat cheap brunch was over $40 without tip.  I can't imagine coming back here.

TL;DR: Terrible staff, bad food, way overpriced.

The owner, Gus, greats every guest and makes them feel so welcome. This was my second time here for breakfast and it was as good as the first time. Good strong hot coffee is a great way to start your day and Gus serves it. Food portions are very generous so don't be surprised if you find yourself not finishing your meal and taking some home with you. The restaurant has the vibe of a 50's diner yet they play a Metal on Pandora. They tend to get busy on the weekends so you may face a wait to get a table, but the wait is worth it.

Great omelet. Service is good. The tables have some strange black shower curtain looking cover on them.  Over all a great breakfast place. Over priced on the coffee. Gus is very friendly. I will go back. Maybe bring my own coffee lol.

The toast is like eating cardboard.  The coffee is like drinking millstone coffee brand or an analogy would be mix dirt with water.  Hash browns ..they need a lot of work.

I judge a breakfast diner by their coffee, toast, and hash.  They are all the cheapest garbage you could eat.  

Get decent bread.  But good beans (no not Starbucks, no not Intelligensia, no not metropolis).  Buy beans from dark matter, gaslight, la columbe, or Cameron's.

I have been to cheap diners that have toast and coffee you can tolerate before.

First time here for breakfast today.  Gus was an awesome friendly guy that you could tell really cares about the customers happiness.  The food was delicious and very reasonably priced.  I will def be going back again

My ham and Swiss cheese Club sandwich served  with French fries was spot on good. The ingrediants were very fresh and made for a very pleasing meal. The sandwich was a10 out of 10!!!

I was disappointment in the lack of attention  I received during my dinning experience.  The waitresses were having  a social gathering by the kitchen counter. My severe was eating from a bowl of food as my food sat waiting to be served.

I drank water with my meal, are least 3 times my waitress walked by my table. She did not check on me or offer to refill my water glass. I would understand if the dinner was packed with customers.  Service...5 out 10.

Over all score.....7.5 out of 10.

By far the best breakfast place in the area. First time we came here we were treated like family. Gus the waitresses are very nice and personable. We love it here and have been back atleast once a week for a month.

I've been to Gus' several times now, each time for breakfast.  To be honest, it's hard to differentiate between one place and another when eating this meal.  That being said, this may be my favorite breakfast joint.  

Hey, t's a DINER: you will find chrome, James Dean, John Wayne & Marilyn Monroe etc...  I like it.   The staff is very friendly and efficient.  I keep expecting the waitress to ask "What'll you have, hon."  (they haven't used that exact phrase yet).  It's a very down-home, comfortable place, though - and spotlessly clean.  The only downside is that the strip mall it's in feels a bit careworn.

So, besides the standard "ambiance", the kicker for me is the skillet.  I love a good skillet.  The key to a good skillet is the balance between the ingredients.  Here, they get it perfect.  I mean - a goodly portion of meat to give it heartiness, not too much potato, and plenty of veggies.  Pancakes or toast on the side...what else could you ask for?

I keep looking for excuses to grab a full and satisfying breakfast there.  Stop reading this and just go to Gus'.

I've eaten their twice now and each time I walk in the door Gus the owner (yes, there is a real Gus who owns the place) greeted me. Food is outstanding and arrived quickly. Wait staff is friendly and makes sure you are taken care of.

Great place to go for lunch!

Only have been here a couple times, but I can see myself finding a reason to visit Rolling Meadows more often. Actually on the proper day, traffic isn't bad from Naperville. 

I love Gus' philosophy to enter as strangers and leave as friends. I often wish we lived in the days of the fifties and things were simple and everyone was friendly. You definitely have that feeling here. I was raised in a small town so I always love diners.

You have to try the house speciality, made from scratch banana bread french toast. Covered with pecans and bananas too. Come hungry or just plan on leftovers,  as I do.

Need to check out their lunch menu. Step inside and feel the magic, you'll crave a return visit and soon be a regular. @dinewithgus #gusdiner
Super nice people working here,greatfamily atmosphere. They even play fun 80s videos. Food is good too! Will be coming back for sure

Very nice place, my family and I felt welcome the minute we walked in, the owner Gus welcomes you right away, he even talks to you and makes sure you are being taken care of. Such a great experience for breakfast. I just moved in the area and I think I found my breakfast spot.
