I was almost about to leave this place just because of the service was 'Little' late. But thanks to the guy who got me a water right after I sat and the other one who greeted me even though he was not my server. 

One senior guy, who came after me, left because no one attended him on time. I think they were short on staff on a busy saturday. There were only 4 people in the dining area.

But anyways, after that moment, I had a really good service and food. It seems like all 4 of them were serving everyone. One guy greeted me, the other guy brought water, a woman took my order and coffee and the other lady brought my food! 

They were all nice and happy people. I had a Diner experience just how I wanted, like how they are all friendly and fun, cool local people hanging out and involving you in the conversation! I liked those locals and all the servers!

Atleast three of them came and informed me and kept me updated on why my pancake is late. Excellent food by the way. Service could be a little better. But it is NOT bad. Please check out this place

Not a bad place, but definitely not up to the Chicago's best hype. The banana bread french toast was okay but nothing too spectacular compared to other Diner type places for breakfast. This place does not even compare. The prices also are not expensive but a few dollars more then most diners and I recommend going somewhere else. (Mr a's)

I came here with my son for the first time. My son tried the cinnamon swirl french toast and said it was the best of his life, which in our food e household we call BOML. I felt the same way about my egg white omelet. I don't think I've ever had a better omelette. My son's  french toast came with cinnamon pecans sprinkled all over, which looked delicious, but he is not a nut guy. He wasn't going to say anything, but the attentive waitress assured him that it was trying to take them back and try it again. His bacon with cooked to perfection, the hash browns were just darn good hash browns, and the pancakes were light and fluffy. I didn't notice that Gus's Diner with more expensive than other breakfast places, especially since the food is as good as it is, and the people are very nice. I'm looking forward to my next trip here.

Man this place sure is a "GREASY" spoon!  And not in the good way either!  Much of the furniture is outdoor party furniture with garbage bags as the table cloths for easy cleaning.  The walls are covered with FYE 1950's pictures of James Dean and Marylin Monroe (Not very creative or pretty!).   The waitresses were hurried, place was crowded and unorganized.  They did not take names at the front so seating became a free for all with guests seating themselves, and cutting in front of us to steal booths.   My food was incredibly greasy and not tasty at all, unless you like the taste of crisco!   The bun was good though.  I got a ham / egg / n cheese on a croissant with crispy hash browns.  The hash browns were just potato shavings soaked in cooking grease, the eggs were greasy, ham was diced so I coudln't tell if it was a decent ham steak or not, and the croissant was pretty good actually.  When they poured my iced tea, I got a splash of tea with a mound of ice which wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't next to impossible to get a refill.  

I would not reccomend.
clean, beautiful and retro decor. .Gus was amazing and the service was spot on. got steak and eggs with fruit. steak was prepared perfectly and the eggs and fruit were  delicious.....

We went here the first time this past weekend since our friends have been telling us to go for so long. There was no wait on a Sunday around 10. However, we were seated by the window, and it was really cold. 

The food it SO good! We had eggs, hash browns, fresh fruit, a skillet, and a belgian waffle. Everything was DELICIOUS. The service was quite slow. We were not checked in with after we received our food. Would have been nice to have the opportunity to request more water. We met Gus on the way out. We will definitely be back.The YUMMY food is worth it.

Clean restaurant,  we were sat quickly on a Sunday morning.  Ordered hash and eggs.  The eggs were cooked properly.  The hash was of the canned variety and not cooked crispy on the outside.  The reason for two stars you ask? 
 The coffee.  I judge a breakfast restaurant that feels comfortable charging $10. To $12 per person for breakfast by their coffee.  They should serve and brew an excellent cup of rich coffee.  Gus's coffee had a burnt flavor and was weak.

I love diners!  One of my favorite Sunday morning spots is a divey diner that oozes with charm. 

We should have gone there. 

Gus' Diner is conveniently located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. My husband joked as we walked up about the folding chairs and tables.  I saw the retro booths and figured that they must be so good that they've thrown in some additional seating to accommodate more guests. 

We walked in to an upbeat, clean restaurant loaded with people. Gus himself seats us in one of those red totally retro booths and we are off on our adventure. 

We wait a few minutes and a waitress comes over to collect her tip from the last guests. She informs us that they are switching sections and that our waitress will be over momentarily. She proceeds to count her tip in front of us, tell us that this is her favorite part and walks away. Odd. Later during our visit, I heard her telling another guest that it's been a great week and now she can afford to make multiple car payments. I was so put off. 

We meet our server a couple minutes later and order a soda and a cup of coffee. The server offers to refill my soda at the end of the meal and never tends to my husband's coffee. She didn't fill the cup once even though it sat empty on the edge of the table every time she walked on by. When he was halfway done with breakfast, we got a busboy to fill the coffee cup and bring over some creamer. 

He chose a Denver omelet with hash browns. It also came with pancakes or toast. He chose the pancakes. I went with a French dip, fries and the cream of chicken and rice soup. My soup took forever to come out. The server did apologize for the delay when she delivered it. It had a layer of thick film on part of it. I scooped that off and ate a few bites. It wasn't piping hot (chilly soup is a pet peeve) and it wasn't very tasty. That sat at the edge of the table until after we left. 

The omelet arrived and it must have been okay because he ate half, but his hash browns were a little too blackened for my liking. My French dip arrived with a pickle that I requested not to have on my plate (I don't like pickle juice making the bun soggy). The check did clearly say 'NO PICKLE' but no one bothered to read that detail. My fries were lukewarm and not evenly cooked. Some were burnt and some were almost raw. None were seasoned. The sandwich itself came on a nice roll, but the meat was not only very minimal but also gristly and overcooked in some areas. 

Of course, we found that the coffee spoon was dirty with a chunk of something on it toward the end of the meal which promptly brought our meal to a close. 

So for $26 and change with our tip, it was a very disappointing trip. The look of the diner was very cute. I love the paint colors, the wall decor and the booths. The counters with stools looked cute as well. You can tell that some good money went into making this diner a cute spot. But, I think that some re-training with the primary focus on attention to detail is in order here. I just don't think that we'll be back to check it out again.
I am a huge breakfast food fanatic and this is place has it all.  Fast friendly service and the food is great.

Always a friendly smile to greet you and a delicious meal to enjoy.  Worth your trip and time.  Atmosphere is lively, and happy.  Great Family restaurant with excellent menu choices.  Stop once, you'll return often.

We walked in and we're not greeted by anyone. We didn't know if we should just take a seat or stand there.  We finally asked somebody.   Once we say it took 10 minutes to get a menu. Then they asked me and my boyfriend if we wanted something to drink but didn't ask his son

We finally placed our order and I can say the pancakes were yummy but the ham and cheese omelet was nothing to write home about. The cinnamon French toast was yummy but too sweet to eat all of it

The reason I gave this only 3 stars was the cost. It was $45 for 2 eggs, French toast, omelet, 1 hot tea, 1 cup of coffee and a chocolate milk

Could have gone to Ellys or teddys or checkers or uncle bills. Had the same quality food but for much less 

I don't think we will be returning.  The food was good just not good enough for the price
The service is really good but the food is really just okay. I've had the buffalo chicken wrap and a skillet and wasn't impressed with either.

This is one of those places that you say " I won't be back" as you are leaving. Then you come back and say it again and again. The food is plain and simple at best. The service is fair on a good day and awful most of the time. Surprising with the choices in the area why they are still in business.

My daughter and I were in town for a volleyball tournament. Decided to try a local place and saw the good reviews on YELP.   It was crowded but we were seated immediately.  We told the server we were from out of town and asked what she recommended. She called for the owner and Gus came over and introduced himself. He recommended one of the skillets (I got the lumberjack skillet) and my daughter got the southern Benedict. Everything we got was excellent and we will definitely be back next time we are in town.
Great food, great service, great people. What else do you need?? The best thing you can do is go there, you won't be disappointed.
Gus's has never disappointed.  Great service and food.  Traditionally went their for breakfast, but lunch menu is equally fantastic!
Was driving by, found this place with the Around Me app. Very pleased with the food and amazing service. The place is very clean and comfortable. Next time we are in town, Gus, we will be back! N

I love Gus's Diner. Their slogan is 'Come as Strangers, Leave as Friends.' It's a bit dangerous having such a cute diner right across from home but somehow I will have to resist going here for breakfast every single morning!

On my latest visit I had the Florence Benedict for $8.95 which is a toasted English muffin topped with Canadian Bacon, Baby Spinach, two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. I absolutely loved this dish - everything went so well together. The eggs were cooked perfectly, sauce delicious, and the spinach was super fresh, cooked to just the right degree. Plus it comes with hashbrowns on the side which were perfect when they had the hollandaise all soaked in! I've had pancakes here, as well, and found them to be perfect also! Their skillets sound sooooo good - they're next on my to do list here.

Gus's is open from 7 to 2 every day, they do take out and have a pretty huge menu with an array of choices to dine on. Service is better than average diner treatment with the staff all being very attentive and friendly. Gus himself with awesome sleeve tattoos is usually in the cash register (I know this because I matched his pic from a charity photo next to the register to his live & in person face).

Gus's is decorated with rock & roll memorabilia and bright colors adorning the walls. Tons of tables or you can take a old school seat at the counter to dine. Love it!

I need to go with someone's child so I can see what exactly their Mickey Mouse pancakes on the Gus' Gang Kids Menu entails! :)
Amazing ambience. Great food. Huge portions. Gus walks around busing tables and refreshing coffee. Don't miss this little gem!!!!

This was my first visit and I will be back.  We were greeted and seated at a booth almost immediately.  Our server was very pleasant and attentive.  The food was good and we received it quickly.  The only thing keeping this from a five star review was the cost.  The prices are slightly elevated but overall a positive experience.
Gus' diner never fails to satisfy. Been here a handful of times and the staff, owner and food are always great.

My dining companion loves the place.  Always good hot food.  Since I have a temperamental digestive system, I tend to get cheese omelets for breakfast, which is really nothing special.  Service is awesome, and it is very clean.
Solid breakfast joint.  The decor and theme of the restaurant is fun.  The food was good, a little greasy, but what you would expect.  I thought the prices were slightly steep. Good service.

I certainly want to like this place and there are things to like. Gus is always nice if you happen to  catch him and say hello while paying. The service has mostly been good and fairly prompt as well. Some waitresses are particularly nice and outgoing. We have been here several times, mainly for breakfast, but also for dinner. The prices are pretty good too comparatively. 

But the number one reason we go out for a meal is the food (and the experience as a whole), which brings down the rating. The experience is fine, although the settings are what my father used to call 'plain pipe rack' to describe a very plain decor. But that is fine - it is a diner after all. But the food is very plain. In our experience (probably a half dozen visits), there is no attempt at seasoning or flavors. Possibly if you ask for and add your own seasonings. If they change that (or change cooks), we would be happy to try it again. As it is, we have not been there in over a year as we pay a bit more to go to breakfast elsewhere, where they add seasonings and cheeses etc. Clearly my wife and I must have different palates from all the other reviews, but good for them and good for Gus! So, if you are fine with the plain food and diner, everything else is okay or better - from service to prices.

Spent last weekend in Chicago with my wife for our anniversary and decided to skip the hotel's breakfast and venture out in search of a local diner and found Gus' Diner nearby.

We were met by Gus himself when we entered and immediately felt right at home when Gus told us he wasn't 100% awake after surviving christmas!

Very nice place with extremely friendly owner and staff and excellent breakfast. We wouldn't hesitate in eating here again when we return to the area.
This place is awsome. Has the old school diner theme and has great food and service. I love their BLT I would most deff recommend gus's for sure if you have never been
Friendly atmosphere. Gus greets all of his guests and gets to know them. The food is excellent. I enjoy the atmosphere and the hometown feel. This is one of my favorite places.

I have been here several times and will keep coming when in the area.  The staff and Gus are very friendly. I love their grilled cheese.   They also make great eggs any style where some diners can mess those up. I have been to many diners and compare to most they are very nice to you. Every diner has a theme and his is 1950's and there is nothing wrong with that. All I care about is the food. Like they say... enter as strangers and leave as friends. Enjoy!

There is room for Red Apple and Gus's Diner kind of across the street from each other in Palatine & Rolling Meadows.

Gus's is a very well lit, shiny 50's diner motif with very low curb appeal in a strip mall on Plum Grove Road.  We prefer Red Apples baked omelettes over Gus's tasty layered crepe omelettes but both are good. Both have excellent skillets, pancakes, and adult experienced servers. 

Gus's also has a very handy bar counter for when you are traveling without your entourage, and longer hours. The counter can be pretty fun, they make you feel like you DO have an entourage there.

Maybe I could eat one of Red Apple's fantastic baked omelettes AT Gus's the next dark Winter day?  We prefer the brighter lighting and initially funner aspect of Gus's but have also gotten to know, and really like, the owners at Red Apple that has become our regular late brunch spot.

Everyone was so friendly. I immediately felt comfortable and welcomed with open arms. 

The food was delicious, it's a perfect place for people who enjoy breakfast dine ins.

I absolutely love it here! My friend and I have gone multiple times before school and every time we love our food. There is a great vibe and everyone is very friendly. I would absolutely recommend the lumberjack skillet and the banana bread French toast, both amazing!

We just left here. We waited 10 minutes to order. Then another 44 minutes for the food to get to us. At no time while we were waiting did anyone come to apologize or let us know what was going on. So taking the giant leap that is normal service.  Even my 12 year old was asking if we could just leave.  The food was average. It was at least hot.
Food was decent but overpriced.  Service was lacking.  They seemed more interested in watching TV.

I LOVE GUS' DINER!

My boyfriend and I stopped in here several months ago now, though I'm sad that I've wait so many years to experience the awesomeness that this place has to offer.

It's 50's style decor gives it so much charm, and the staff is simply the best! We are always welcomed with huge smiles and they pretty much treat us like family. 

The prices are very good, and the food is phenomenal.

Gus makes the best soup I have ever had in my life, I am not joking. I am a total soup freak and even if I get breakfast food, my girls know to bring me soup!

I have never had a meal I didn't like from Gus's . I have had both breakfast and lunch meals numerous times, I've probably tried over a dozen things and have never been disappointed. Everything from french toast, to their burgers (magnificent) to the paninis & the omelets, there is not one dish I wouldn't rave about to a friend. I have a hard time choosing when I go there, but I know whatever I choose, I am going to be a full and happy girl!

If you are a breakfast lover, go for the pancakes. They are absolutely perfect! Simple, but amazing and super delicious! (Still not better than the soup though!)

I always have a wonderful time when I go here and you feel right at home. They never rush you and are always happy to give you suggestions of great food to try,

Gus is in house almost all the time, and that speaks to the pride he takes in his restaurant & the value he has for his customers. The whole staff is wonderful, and Liz & Debbie are so much fun! I affectionately refer to them as my  " Gus's mommies" . 

If you are looking for a great local place to have a wonderful meal , surrounded by the sweetest people you'll ever meet, give Gus' a try.

Keep in mind you only have between the hours of 7am-2pm each day to experience this magic, but I promise, once you've been there, you won't be able to stay away!

I look forward to coming here on the weekends.  I love they have grits on their menu and their omelets are made perfectly.  Gus the owner is so friendly and the entire staff makes you feel very welcome and not rushed.  I also love the 50s dcor.  It could be a little warmer in there for me so if you get cold easy, I would bring a sweater.

Best breakfast diner I have ever been to! I stopped in one day while working on a home in town and now I drive all the way out from the city as often as possible. 

Best pancakes in the world! (... And I don't even like pancakes)

I wish I could give this place 6 stars. If I could, I would. Everybody is so nice and friendly. The owner Gus has a great personality that makes you want to keep coming here time after time. The food is really good. If I lived closer, I would be here more often. Great job to Gus and his staff. I would highly recommend going to Gus's diner!!!!
A fun place for breakfast. I manage find time to go to Gus' Diner every couple of weeks. Very friendly staff.  Food tastes good and fresh.  Give Gus a try,  you will be glad you did.
What a great place. Good food, friendly and fast service, and the atmosphere is fantastic. Had the Country Fried Steak. Yummmmmo
bee there a few times- my husband went crazy or the skirt steak- owner is on premises and very personable- waitress looked a little miserable but the food was excellent
Love this place! My wife and I come here all the time for breakfast. Great atmosphere, friendly wait staff and Gus is always fun to talk to. Food is consistently good. Definitely worth a try!

A suggestion to Yelp, allow a 6 star review because Gus's would get it! Went here for the first time today and absolutely loved it. The atmosphere was perfect a 50's diner with 50's decor, exactly what a diner should be. The owner, Gus greeted us and sat us to our table. Our waitress was awesome, super friendly, knew her job very well gVe us the right amount of attention as well as enough privacy. They were not rushing us to get out so they could turn the table over, gave us all the time it he world. And last but not least the food was great. You can tell it is homemade. 

Long story short, the perfect diner experience. Highly recommended. Will probably make this a regular brunch place for us.

The service, menu, food and atmosphere are all well above average at Gus'. It is one of my regular breakfast spots and I've never been disappointed. And there is a Gus, and he is very friendly and attentive.
Very good breakfast place.  Been there quite a few times now.  The omelettes and pancakes are delicious.

A very friendly diner with delicious food.  By far the best diner/breakfast restaurant in the area.  Having courteous staff and an owner who actually appreciates your patronage is a huge plus.  I'm done with places like Apple House and Palatine Inn where you are made to feel like they are doing you a favor by taking your money.

Crinkle cut fries rule!!!  Get the corned beef and swiss for lunch, it's pure awesomeness.
This place is AWESOME !! Great food, great service. Fair prices. I can see car and bike shows here

Great fresh decor with a clean and tidy setup. The menu is quite diverse and has plenty of choices for everybody. The prices are just right and their portion size is more than plentiful. 

I had the Athenian Hot Rod Skillet, which has onions feta cheese tomatoes eggs (I opted for fried hard) and potatoes with two more toasts (just on case your carb count is running low) . It was awesome!

Cute little retro diner. Everyone is super friendly. Awesome brunch. Seriously that banana bread french toast, omg.But what really won me over is that they had a young special needs woman working, with assistance, at the diner. Clearing off tables and what not. As someone who has a special needs sibling this just melts my heart. This is what a sweet little diner should be! Good food, good people. I'll definitely be back! After all, I gotta try their lunch :-)
Had the minced ham and egg breakfast. The hashbrowns were bland and the eggs were cold.
My wife and I have made this our go to breakfast place. You can't do any better, great service, great coffee, great food.

Gus is great, very nice staff, fresh hot food. All at a pretty good price point.
The establishment is neat and clean and seems to work very well with moderately sized groups too. Consistently good.

Love this place! We have been living down the street for the past three years and never tried it until recently. Food is always really good, coffee is great and what makes it all better is the owner/staff actually appricate your buisness. 

Love this place!

First time at Gus's and we were thoroughly impressed! Classic retro diner atmosphere and food (which is absolutely delicious)! Gus greeted us as soon as we walked in the door and our waitress was great! Looks like we just found our new breakfast spot!
The food is good. The people are outstanding. It is an awesome 50's styled diner. The customers are all regulars and you can't help but make it a regular breakfast or lunch stop.

One of the most blah restaurants I've ever been to in my lifetime. Sure the atmosphere of 50's diner is kitschy, but beyond that, nothing special.

Food was fair and service was kind of slow. And I was sitting alone at the counter, not hard to serve there. A hodge-podge of stuff in the coolers behind the counter made me wonder if staff even knew some food was there - and if they didn't, who knows how old it might be by the time it is served to customers.

Mediocre at best. No reason to return.

The first time I stopped by Gus's, it was just after they had moved to their current location.  Nothing about it really stood out to me, so about a week ago I came in with a buddy to help cure my hangover from the night before & give Gus's another try.  I ordered my standard 2 eggs, hash browns & toast.  Not 1 single crumb remained when I was done & my hangover was manageable for the rest of the day.  The price of my meal was comparable to my other go-to breakfast spots & quality was right up there too.  Now that I have a good memory of the place, I will keep Gus's in mind when deciding on a place to have a good, quick & tasty breakfast.

i don't come to gus' that often, but when i do i get their athenian skilet, hashbrowns, onions tomatoes gyro meat and the kicker, FETA CHEESE.
it's so good, i always forget how much i love feta until i have a dish that has feta in it.

Ate breakfast at Gus's this weekend before golfing. Every worker in the place said "good morning" to us - so friendly! Service was courteous and fast and the food was great at a fair price! I recommend the lumber jack skillet - yummy corned beef hash with a couple fried eggs on top and lots of melted cheese. Didn't have to eat again til dinner!

I love this place. I've been looking for an old timey diner in the area, but only two or so out of the many that claim to be diners really had the right feel I was looking for. Super rad decor, lots of seating, good food, generous servings at a reasonable price, AND there's a counter. It's weird to think about how long the area has been developed, and how there's almost no establishments that have stood the test of time, especially knowing how many people have owned the properties in the area since their house was first built. I love old school Americana, and this place gives of just that same vibe. It's rare that you ever get greeted by the owner of a restaurant nowadays, but Gus himself seated us, he introduced himself, and we introduced ourselves, and he shook our hands, good handshake, good guy, great place. I had the breakfast burrito and a short stack, both of which were good. I'm not very picky about my flapjacks, they were tasty, but I wasn't about to write home about them. But I sure do love me a good breakfast burrito, and this place has it on point. the sauce on top is really good, but it made me eat the burrito with a knife and fork, so next time i'll just ask for it on the side. This spot is definitely worth trying again, and again, and again.

And again.
So yummy!! Stopped in after a shopping excursion and the food was great!! The owner was amazing!! Definitely will be back next time we are in the area!!

This is a standard diner and with standard diner prices. There was nothing exceptional or disappointing during our visit; though, it did take a really long time to get our check even though there only a handful of people in the restaurant. If the kitschy, "old school" feel does something for you, feel free to add another star to my review.
It's a reasonably priced local diner. The food is pretty good.
Delicious, abundant food.
Good and staff are always top shelf. Gus makes you feel welcome. Atmosphere and price are great! Love this place!

I've lived in the neighborhood for a couple of years and today was my first time at Gus's. 
What the hell was I waiting for??? It' an old school diner in a new space. The waitstaff was friendly and the food was very good and satisfying. They have your typical diner food, lots of choices for breakfast or lunch. No dinner hours! 
It's definitely a perfect place to eat if you're looking for the perfect hangover cure! 
You can't go wrong...

This place rates a C- for me. The decor was set 50's style and to me, if you have a theme it's to try and distract from sub-par service, sub-par food or both. The service wasn't bad, but it was slow. It was only half packed on a Saturday at 11am. When I go out for breakfast somewhere new I order the same thing, 2 eggs over medium (that means runny yolks not whites) hash browns, bacon, rye toast buttered and coffee. 

The coffee was crap, it was brown water: fail. You would need to drink 15 cups to match a normal cup of coffee. Fortunately when we said something they decided not to charge us.

The eggs had runny whites: fail.

Only 3 thin strips of bacon: fail.

Large pieces of rye bread: pass.

Hash browns: bland.

This is only a place to come if you like the kitch of 50's era. As for me, I'll stick to TNT up the road.
Simply put, good coffee and good breakfast and lunch selections. Big portions that are priced right. My new go to neighborhood place!
Great homemade cream of mushroom soup !!  The staff is so friendly!!

An alright restaurant. It's fairly average in all aspects - food, service, decor, and price. It's alright to go to if you're passing by the area since it has a pretty complete menu and fairly long hours.

This is a real authentic greasy spoon of a place. It's affordable. The food is consistently good. We went for breakfast. The owner was working the register and was super nice! Would like to come back for lunch to see how that is. All in all, a great greasy spoon with appropriate greasy spoon atmosphere.

I wrote in an earlier review that Gus' Diner was closed. They have reopened according to their Facebook page. 

Unless their hours changed, I don't like that they are not open for dinner. I hope it is due to a lack of employees and time rather than a lack of business.

So Dad, my son and I went last night because I had a Resturant.com coupon.  for $25.00 when I spend $35 which includes 18% gratuity.  

I had the bacon and onion skillet with pancakes.  YUM My son had the Mickey Mouse pancakes and chocolate milk.  My Dad had chicken parm.  

I think I would probably return but only for breakfast. The big GUS tattooed guy is hilarious and very friendly.  Our server wasn't very attentive however, no refills on my pop and had to ask for boxes and our check.  

It's been in the strip mall for 2 years and only noticed it recently!

Good food and very reasonably priced I have been here a few times.  The owner is very nice and asks every customer(or table) how everything.  The place has a cool 1950's hot rod dinner vibe.  Everything i have ever had here has been exceptional.  Get the Belgium waffle it is epic.

When you see the word "Diner", you should not be expecting anything fancy in the way of decor. Diner's are basic food service experiences and in my opinion Gus is top notch in the Diner business and I have been to ALOT of diners all over the country. I was introduced to this place by friends about three weeks ago and they have been coming for 15 years???

The food is simple and good. If you want fancy food or cushioned seats go to Walker Brothers, wait in line for an hour and overpay for your food. 

And don't be stupid and ask for 4 separate tabs or make stupid jokes about the furniture cause you underdressed for fall weather in Chicago.  Get one check and figure it out amongst yourselves or go eat lunch alone. People who do that really irritate me. 

Oh and Our waitress was great and I will certainly be back.

went here for breakfast this am. my hubby and i tend to split a meal. not a problem here, which is not the case in every restaurant. VERY friendly place. service is great and the food is even better. Had french toast and ham off the bone. Delicious!! Only reason not giving 5 stars is sewer smell in back of restaurant by bathroom. Otherwise, best place ever. Will be back. Just will not drink so much of the tasty coffee.

You cannot do much better for the price.   Great breakfast, very nice owner and staff, easy to park, and they can handle a busy day.    Just a good old fashioned excellent breakfast place.    Always a good crowd too, young and old, affluent to working class, all just enjoying their food.   Top notch and a good buy.

Another great Yelp find while traveling. excellent food and service. Very friendly and fast. Bacon & eggs with whole wheat toast & coffee. was $4.99. I was surprised to see the Tax charge. almost 11% with the added Rolling Meadow 3% add on. Went a second time. Hash & eggs with a side of pancakes & coffee came out to over $12.00 but everything was done right.

Great neighborhood diner. Friendly service and solid diner food. I love their corned beef hash. Get it with two eggs sunny-side up, smash it all together and throw it on some wheat toast. Joy. Hash browns are always perfect.

I read Yelp reviews that ran the gamut, so I had to find out for myself. DH and I had a fantastic lunch at Thai House on Saturday. 

We ordered 2 small soups and shared: tom yum shrimp (excellent) and tom kha chicken (maybe even better). The crab rangoon was delicious and not greasy or chewy. Husband had chicken rama noodles for his main (reported enjoying). I chose chicken green curry, medium (plenty spicy for me, a spice lover; would be way too spicy for most of my friends). I had leftovers for lunch today--just as delicious!

The service was very friendly. The food was excellent. The prices seemed appropriate. We'll definitely go back!

Worst pad thai ive ever had:
Soggy over cooked noodles.
Tasted like mush.
No distinctive sweet spicy citrus.
No fresh peanuts.
No fresh bean sprout.
Shrimp were so over cooked they were uneditable. 
Shrimp not fresh.

I would bot recommend this place to anyone.  

I wish i could find good pad thai in Illinois.

Went to Thai house with 2 of my friends on a Friday night. 

The place wasn't packed and it was pretty small. You can see the chefs cooking in the back which is pretty entertaining while you wait for your food. 

The service was great. Someone came up to us right when we walked into the restaurant and was seated right away. It's pretty chilly at the restaurant though if they don't turn on the fireplace. Our server kept checking up on us and also came to refill our drinks.

We ordered Chicken potstickers, shrimp tom-yum soup (small), panang curry chicken, chicken red curry, and pad thai with fat noodles instead. The food came out in good timing and didn't have to wait that long. The portions are pretty good for the prices. Shrimp tom-yum was really delicious and I wish I got the bigger bowl instead. The panang was a good portion as well and had great flavor to it. My friends enjoyed their dishes as well. 

I would go back here if I don't want to drive too far for some good thai food.

The food is good, and they have a nice variety of options to tickle your taste buds. This place does not lose any stars for taste, but for service. 
My boyfriend and I went here for lunch, and while there were people in there, it wasn't crowded, but you would have thought that by the way the workers were acting. They have two cooks, one server, and one guy who I think might have been the owner. He was the main problem; he was micromanaging every other job. It took them about 15 minutes just to get us water...
Honestly, if they had more people working, and a better system, this place would be a five star place. 

Now on to the food....I had the Pad Thai with shrimp, and it was seasoned well, and not spicy. The shrimp was cooked...I believe, there was one piece that seemed a little cold, but looked cooked. Since we both had lunch specials, we got a cup of their house soup, and a plate of crab rangoon . The soup was delicious and light, and the rangoon was crispy, but still light and not greasy. 
Overall, as I said earlier, if you want to wait three moon cycles to get a sip of water, then this is the place for you. Maybe try delivery or carry out for quicker service.

Pretty Average place with pretty average food. 

The is food is not bad but there are million other Thai places with better food in the vicinity.

So this is a new Thai spot but it is in the old Caribou Coffee, the decor is the same except they put up some Thai decorations. Thai House must have had a different location because the menus are old and beat up. The layout for a restaurant is pretty bad as 50% of the space is kitchen or an eyesore. 

The food is average at best from what I had. The spring rolls had dry and chewy fried tofu inside and a giant dried out green onion on top. The Tom Yum was ok but had zero heat to it, odd as it's supposed to be a spicy soup. The Pad Thai had the slightly wider noodles which I like but it was oversauced and sort of gummy, flavor was ok. Also tried the mixed seafood, a sweet but bland sauce. This was also supposed to be spicy and was not. 

Out of 4 items not one stood out as great, average at best (the Pad Thai). Everything seemed cooked properly but that only gets you so far. Portion size is also less than what I get at other places. I am not sure if I'd go back to try other things (I know I should and probably will) which is too bad as it's the closest Thai spot to home...YMMV

Tum Kai OUTSTANDING! 

Brown rice is excellent. Veggies are fresh and seasoned with a lot of flavor. 

Portions are great. 

Customer service is superb.
I wished I'd known about this place sooner! What a great lunch special with one of the best pad thai dishes I've had the pleasure of eating! The wait staff was great too.

A new Thai restaurant that offers delicious dishes! I love Thai food as an alternative to Chinese because I believe it is much lighter. Thai House has a nice decor with a beautiful multi-level waterfall just inside the entrance and a fireplace. After an appetizer of spring rolls, I chose the Pa-Nang Curry with Chicken for my entree. I was worried that the curry would be too spicy for me but it was just right and delicious. It was served with white rice. My wife enjoyed her meal as well. It was a bit hard to communicate with the hostess because she didn't have a firm grasp on the english language yet but I won't let that keep me from going back.

The staff was really nice.  However, the food was not good.  I got the broccoli rice.  That is all it was.  Rice, egg and broccoli.  The broccoli was microwaved as it was not crisp.   It was chewy.  Also, the spring roll I got was not fried.  I missed carrots, peas and bean sprouts.  My first and last time.  Again, the staff was really nice.  I wish the food was as well.

Just tried this restaurant. 
And I must admit I was amazed. I had the shrimp Pad Thai and it was very flavorful.
I ordered an extra peanut sauce because I am a feen for good peanut sauce and again the sauce was great. I will be returning early next week for another round.

The Yelp reviews of this restaurant were so mixed that I felt like I was researching a term paper to figure out if I should order lunch from here. I ordered chicken Pad Thai and crab rangoon, and both were fantastic. I would take a photo, but I already ate it. 

The food is most certainly delicious. It's a cut above the other Thai options in the area. I will definitely be ordering again. I can only vouch for the two menu items I tried, but they were both great. Everything seemed very fresh. The delivery was speedier than expected too. (Thai delivery in Palatine. Who knew?)

Thai food is usually terrible in the suburbs. This place is Chicago-worthy. The food is great.

I came here the other day and wanted to try their lunch special. They don't have a website out since they're new so I had to call. I wanted to place a to go order since that's faster for me. I wanted a lunch special tofu pad Thai easy on the tofu but the girl who was taking my order didn't seem to understand me very well but maybe it's because we were talking on the phone and not in person. I also asked how much it is and its $7.25 plus tax which includes your portion plus an appetizer. No one asked me which appetizer I would prefer so I guess I was hoping they would still put something in.

Upon arrival, the people working here seem to be very nice and the place looks cozy. But they do have an open floor kitchen which isn't the best thing for a casual Thai place but that's just my opinion. I came home and checked out my entree. I know it was a lunch portion but the pad Thai was tiny. Im not expecting too much but this was definitely smaller than I'm used to and it didn't even fill up the container part. They did include two Thai egg rolls which were very tasty so that was at least nice of them. The pad Thai itself was delicious and I would definitely try them again if I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit them again. They have nice people, and tasty food but the lunch to go portion was tiny in my opinion. 

I hope they do well and if you live by and maybe if you eat in you will have a better experience.

Delicious food, fast service and friendly staff.
Wide selection of authentic Thai food.
Probably the only place that serves crab fried rice.
This is an impressive Thai restaurant , I've been to several Thai restaurants and this has been by far the best and have met my standards. Service is excellent! Worth the drive.

We saw this place by chance while driving by. It's in a nondescript strip mall and the exterior doesn't exactly make you think delicious food inside. This place however has amazing Thai food. The Khao Soi is the best I've had outside of Chang Mai and everything else was fantastic too.

All of the staff are extremely friendly and smiley. Not something you get much of in restaurants up here.
Could certainly have been worse, but the scallops in the scallop pad Thai did not taste okay.  They weren't horrible, but definitely were a bit off.

This is for what I had for lunch today. Spicy beef salad, papaya salad, sticky rice. Ended with banana sticky rice as dessert. It's not just good; it's AUTHENTICALLY good. Based on earlier experience with basil chicken and pad thai, they tend to make it a little sweet (cater to locals' taste?). But I think you can ask them to just drop the sugar and choose your own spiciness level.

Tried this place after getting a massage nearby. Ambiance was nice, tiny restaurant.. Takes a little long for the order to be prepared. Must say i loved their tom yum soup and thai tea. Hawaiian rice was good too but the spicy beef, i feel like the veggies were sliced too big and undercooked.. Would still comeback tho and try other food in their menu.

It's a solid Meh from me. It is obvious that they use fresh ingredients, but I was just not impressed. Skip the fried rice, it was bland bland bland. I was really turned off by the tiny portion sizes. It seemed that the more expensive the dish, the smaller portion they gave us. The potstickers we ordered were delivered ice cold. Disappointing to say the least.

We have ordered to-go 2x. Delivery is decent. Meals are very fresh and flavorful. My favorite is the green chicken curry. It's very spicy, but oh-so-flavorful. Dishes are on the small side, but that's OK with me since I prefer meals to be healthy rather than over-the-top.

So happy there's now Thai delivery in Palatine!!!

We went for a family dinner on 8/26. It took 15 minutes for the waiter to address our table. Another 30 minutes to serve food. No plates were served with appetizers, resulting us to pick up from the main serving plate and eat. We had to request condiments and the jasmine tea that my son ordered never came although we were billed for it along with a Coke that we never ordered was also billed. The food was nothing great but just OK. We eat at a lot of restaurants and are definitely supportive of our local neighborhood restaurants. I want them to thrive. This attracts people and trade. But I am sorry we had the worse experience of our lives eating at this place. I am not going back.

Awesome little place!  Ordered up their Thai Pad with beef and Vietnamese rolls and let just say if I am in the area again I will be back. Actually recommended to the folks in the office I came here to visit, they haven't been yet.
I ordered via the yelp app and the food was ready when I arrived. The proportions were perfect and full of flavor but next time I will order medium and not spicy, they like their heat here. Back home spicy is usually just right.
Super good for s great price. I had the basil chicken and my dad had the chicken mushroom. They were both delicious. The environment is okay, but for the price well worth it.

This is a new place and I have to say although a little on the expensive side it is the best Thai I Have had in the suburbs. The beef was especially good. We picked up but the inside looked pretty nice with a big stone fireplace.

This restaurant gets 2 stars instead of 1 only because the Tom Yum soup and Yum Von Sen had nice flavor. But don't come here if you have to catch a movie or have somewhere to go, because you WILL miss it or be late.  The waitress took 15 mins to take our order, it took 40 minutes to get the appetizer, and 25 more minutes to get the main dish.  And of course, they forgot my food, so my dinner mate was done and picking his teeth by time I received mine.  Also, don't come here if you're hungry, because you'll leave hungry.  I literally finished my food in 4 minutes. FOUR MINUTES! And I don't eat particularly fast, but I was bloody starving! 

There's definite potential here, and if I have a few more experiences that are better I'll certainly update my review.  But for now, 2/5 is GENEROUS and based on flavor only.

I went in for lunch, hoping to find a hidden gem. What I got, was disappointed.
I ordered the lunch portion of Thai Cashew Chicken, preceeded by a spring roll. I was served a small portion of noodle soup that tasted like canned chicken broth. No flavor at all. The spring roll was also completely void of flavor. Tasteless.  When the entree showed up I was hoping for something with flavor.
What I got was the saltiest chicken dish I've ever eaten in ANY Asian restaurant. It was so over salted it was inedible PLUS the rice was cold.  The waitress told me they could make another, but what I had tasted left me with no appetite. They had the nerve to charge for a terrible, uneaten meal. Thai House will never have my business again, and with food that bad should be gone soon.

Few months back this Thai place opened close to my house- on first I was little iffy on trying it as they have no internet presence but then I tried it; one of the best Thai food in northwest suburb. Amazing food: loved crab rangoons and Penang curry, not big fan of their pad Thai but their curries are very very Gud. I will definitely recommend this to anyone who loves Thai.

Talk about a hole in a wall in not a positive way. The waitresses that work here doesn't give any service.  I keep on waving them down and they still ignored us.  One of them actual told us to go else where if we don't like her service. When you pay $10/Entree you expect a decent amount of food portion. To my surprise ! It was same size as kid size portion. I mean seriously !!! I finally get over the bad service, low food quality and less portion and request my check. We were 3 people and when we checked our bill (I love this part) I found an extra charge of $10 for an entree !!! I kept my calm and request a waitress to remove the charge since, we didn't order 3 entrees. She brought the check back and I noticed another mistake .. For $30 bill they charge $5 Service fee !! Service Fee for what !! bad service, low food quality or less Portion  ???!!  I asked what the service fee is and the waitress have no idea of the service charge.. For God Sake, you Work there !! If you think about, How many times these people charge innocent people with extra service charge fees or extra entree fees !! 

I wouldn't suggest anyone going to this place and get rip off with food and money ! I have attached my receipt copy so, everyone can see what kind of  secret charges they charge to innocent people

My favorite Thai place, hands down. Generous portions, excellent food, super fast take-out. I love these guys!!!!! (I've only really ever had take-out and haven't had the chance to dine in, but I'm looking forward to it!) Only real con I can think of is that it's just a bit pricey, but woah, is it worth it!
Good Thai food in northwest suburbs. Ordered take out food, tasted great, whole family enjoyed it. Will order again in the future.

Yummy Pad Thai and Vietnamese Rolls! This place is very reasonably priced, under $15 for both appetizer and entre. They have generously sized portions, and for vegetarians/vegans like myself, the tofu is delish. Many different meal options and a nice environment. New favorite.

I'm not sure why other people are complaining about this place.  Because I've been about 7 x already.  Thanks to this delicious affordable Thai place near my house-- I make less dinner.  

Price: very affordable.  People who complain probably only eat Fast Food.  Cheaper than Siri.

Diet:
My boyfriend and I are vegan/vegetarian glutenfree.

Food:
Excellent.
Moving to palatine from being spoiled by the many amazing diverse ethnic restaurants in Skokie/Evanston before, has been hard.  The food here has delicious and original and addicting flavors I've never tasted.  I've had Thai food all across the country, and this place is an authentic gem-- that is distinguished.

Vegetarian bonus points:
They make their food from scratch not prepackaged like the other places, and don't lie about fish sauce, like the other Siri Thai places in town.  They're willing and happy to cater to your needs and requests--not many places do the way they do.  Their food is authentic and flavorful--just how it would taste in Thailand.  

Favorites meals:
Panang, Pad Thai, crispy noodles!  I honestly couldn't have pad Thai at other places because of their use of eggs, but these guys make it delicious with a flavor I've never tasted before.  Crispy noodles are just as good as Thai Garden in Schaumburg.

Extremely thoughtful:
They are the only Thai Restaurant that uses special cookware and serve with separate utensils and dishware for vegetarians.  

About the owner:
They're a small business owner family, that's there every single day, with smiles on their faces that greet everyone genuinely.  Ask the owner his story.  And he's open for suggestions on improving.

Patience: 
Have some, they're new and figuring things out and becoming more coordinated each time! They're a little understaffed but awesome.  

Ambiance:
My boyfriend and I love it.  There is a cheery vibe, and the fireplace in the cold is awesome!!!!!
Best Thai food in the burbs.  So glad they opened.  Give them business so they stay around!
Loved it, had shrimp and chicken pad Thai which was very good, and the Tom yum soup was great as well, service was very good as well.  I will defiantly go there again to try the other dishes

Stopped into Thai House for a late lunch and was impressed with the service as well as the food. Not sure why there have been reviews calling this place pricey as I thought the prices were more than reasonable! My dinner-size crazy noodles (delicious and spicy) with chicken was $8.25; Thai iced coffee was $2.75. Both were excellent and were served to me within minutes. Definitely coming here again!
If you love Thai, this is the place folks. The food is awesome and the service is great. Very appealing! The prices are reasonable as well. I definitely recommend this place :-)

Last night my family and I decided check out this new Thai restaurant that is close to home.  The restaurant was pretty busy and very chaotic.  Although we were seated right away in the back of the restaurant near the kitchen I am very disappointment with their service. I couldn't help but to sit and watch employees running around because they were very short staff on a busy Friday night.  It took a waitress 20 minute to notice us sitting in the back of the restaurant..We waited patiently...We lost it after waiting 25 minutes and WALKED OUT! Based on other Yelpers review. I will NOT go back to try their bland food. I will take my business elsewhere.

Really wanted to love the place.  Been looking for great Thai ever since I Am Siam closed.

The food was mostly bland.  Do not know if it was an off night as others seem to rave about this place.  Panda Express has more flavor - I expect depth and complexity from good Thai food.

Portions were meh - suppose that was a good thing as nothing really demanded to be saved for lunch tomorrow.  For sure not a value buy.  3 pieces of overcooked shrimp in a dish we paid over $12 for - come on.  Spicy beef looked/seemed boiled (looked very pale) - not stir fried and there was ZERO spice to the SPICY beef!

I may try them again - will try the new Thai place over in BG first and see where to go.

Their food has rich flavor from what I've tried. The curry is so bomb. Highly recommend the curries, crab rangoons, lychee bubble tea, crispy chicken, satay. I do admit that the seating and decor of the actual restaurant is a bit awkward and the portions can be small for the amount that you pay; however, I truly believe that the food makes up for it. So, get your food delivered or place a carry out order :) This is the type of food I would lick stray sauce off a plate when finished. I really want this place to stay and do well.

The tom yum soup was delicious as were the crazy noodles.  It wasn't as spicy as I hoped but great regardless.  The layout is a bit cramped/strange, but the decor is nice.  As this is a new restaurant, the growing pains are a obvious.  They were understaffed and a little slow, but they had help wanted signs displayed prominently.  So this will resolve itself.  

Most importantly, the food and prices were great.  The staff was very polite despite being overwhelmed by Friday night rush.  I think this is a great spot for takeout.

Not sure what people are complaining about, I grew up in Palatine and eating at the local Thai places, Siri Thai is overpriced and tastes the same as The Thai House.  Since i saw it has opened I have ordered from The Thai House and have never been disappointed.  Great food, perfect for carry out, very nice people.
My wife was craving thai food so we tried Thai House. The Ginger Chicken and Pad Thai Chicken are a home run. We will be back
Worst Thai food I have ever tasted. Verry blend. I can just tell that they use bad quality meats.

Placed  order for work, the food was good, but portions are TINY!!! Not worth the money, very little food for the lunch special, all the other Thai places that I have been to, give you a lot more food. Very dissapointing

We've tried numerous Thai places in the palatine/Arlington heights area and this one is by far the best. Yes, the decor isn't great and it's not the most appealing to the eye, but the food is fabulous! I love the tom kha coconut soup with thin sliced chicken. We also always order the panang curry with beef and the basil chicken. Both are so flavorful. We also recently had the spicy glass noodle chicken which was delicious. Overall, we don't go for the ambiance, but we go because it's the best Thai food around!

I ate there for the first time today.  Ordered it to go and only took about 10 minutes to get my food. I thought it was really good! I had the chicken pad thai and they gave me a container of the thai chili sauce so I could make it my own heat level.  I thought the portion was OK for lunch.  But for dinner, it probably could be bigger than it was.  I also ordered the Golden Triangle appetizer.  The filling was tasty from what I could tell, but there was so little of it in the wanton it was hard to really say for sure!  So, food was good, but 4 stars for portions and I felt pretty ripped off by the app, actually.  Plus, there was NO air conditioning - it was absolutely sweltering in there; I don't see how anyone could dine in.

This is new in town right by the Target/Jewel strip mall on Hicks and Dundee. Excellent Thai food! I had it delivered through Grub Hub (wish they delivered on their own) and was very pleased!! Very fast delivery! My only issue is that I paid and tipped ahead of time and   asked to have the food left on my porch because I have two very loud dogs that are difficult to calm down and he not only rang my doorbell, he also went around back to my sliding glass door and knocked on that door before I even had a chance to answer my front door! Excellent shrimp yellow curry and shumai. Generous portion sizes! The yellow curry was one of the best I've ever had, and that is what I ALWAYS order for Thai food so I've had it tons of places. I also had the Rama noodle, but probably wouldn't order it again. It wasn't bad at all, just a bit rich and creamy for my specific taste and I would like to try their other noodle dishes. If you like a creamy and peanuty (not a word lol) sauce, you'd probably love this. I had it with chicken, and it also has big broccoli florets. I thought the prices were very reasonable and on point with other Thai places. Very happy they are open and love having a local Thai place!! Definitely would recommend to anyone! Excited to try other dishes from them and I will definitely be ordering regularly and hope to dine in soon. Yum!

Saw this place as we were driving by discussing lunch and decided to check it out.  Didn't realize how new it was.  The decor needs some work, but the food was just fantastic.  It may be the best Thai food I've had, certainly the best in the suburbs.  My daughter had Pad Thai and I had Panang Curry.  Both had lots of good complex flavor - I never order Pad Thai because it tends to taste sugary - this did not.  The Crab Rangoon and Spring Rolls were also great.  And the prices on the lunch special were perfect :)  I can't wait to go back!
Thanks Yelp!! This was a great place!! The Arabe tacos where really good and you can't beat the price

This is a neat little Mexican joint tucked away near the Fox River in North Aurora. The waitress was very nice and soft spoken. The cooks in the back seemed to be having a blast! Our food came out very fast and was delicious. We had chicken & pastor tacos, Mexican style. The complimentary chips and salsa were good and I would say the salsa was a medium heat. Of course no taco dinner is complete without Jarritos and they had my favorite flavor, Mandarin. If you're in the area give them a try. I'll definitely be returning to try the Elotes and churros!

Peace!
T

I'm not sure where to start this review. The service? The food? The friendliness of staff? I could sum it all up by just saying "Great!", but I'll continue. 
I've been here a few times now, and overtime I was greeted warmly and almost like a long time customer. In fact, last time I was there the (owner?) even recognized me after I had posted a couple of pictures from a previous visit. This tells you that he does take the time to look at his reviews and cares what his customers are saying, something not found nearly often enough. 
Let's move on the the food. It's all very fresh and made however you want it. I ask for cilantro instead of lettuce? Boom! Not a shred of lettuce and wonderful green cilantro in its place. Some extra jalapeos? Do you want whole, diced, fresh, or pickled? The prices are as perfect as the food and the service. All on point. The pastor stands out, especially when mixed with the chorizo in one of their "special" burritos. 
If I were able to change one thing, it would only be that I would've discovered it earlier. I'll be back the next time I hear a burrito calling my name. Keep up the good work, Juquilitas.

Everything we ate here was excellent.  I really liked the steak and pork tacos, and the salsas are equally good.  The green sauce had just the right amount of heat.  The horchata was also good.  

Juqilita would be my go-to taco joint if I lived in North Aurora.  Out of the 597126846 taco joints in the Aurora vicinity, Juquilita isn't my favorite, or the most convenient, but they still make damn good food.  I'm spoiled with great Mexican food living in Aurora - Juquilita's is better than anything you'll find in neighboring suburbs like Naperville or Plainfield, but it doesn't take the #1 or even #2 spot for my favorites in Aurora.

There is plenty of seating and a parking lot at the side of the building.

Omg- asked for water and was served actual warm water ( obviously no ice), then ordered pastor tacos and was told they didn't have any pork at all that day. ??? The guacamole was extremely heavy with lime. My wife ordered a veggie taco and it came with just rice, lettuce and a tomato, then went to pay at register and I look into kitchen and there are 4 bags of tortilla chips, the same ones we see at grocery store. Then I look at kitchen and it is so very dirty I had to do a double take cause I just didn't want to believe a restaurants kitchen could actually look like that. 
There are so many Mexican restaurants around I will definitely not go back to this one. Dirty dirty dirty.

Thanks to Yelp! I am always able to find the best/authentic food in town! Food were really good, ppl there were nice and prices so reasonable. I ordered two tacos at first: steak and Mexican sausage. They were both good! I liked the steak one more - more juicy. Then I decided to order a shrimp taco and something for diner to go. The guy mentioned tamales, cuz you don't have to worry reheat it. I said I don't know what it is. He gave me a free one to try! I realized I had frozen tamales before but it's the first time to have fresh one. Really good! I just ordered two more!

Tamales...I come from Latin background so I know tamales. I give them 5 stars!  I had the enchiladas red sauce and they were excellent also.  I will add more as I taste. The place needs better ambiance.

My wife and I went here on a Saturday evening after reading the great reviews. We never actually got our food. The waitress/cashier took 20 minutes to get around to our table. We ordered food and waited another 40 minutes for it to arrive. We finally gave up, paid for our sodas, and left. Not a hint of remorse from the staff. The kitchen seemed to be in complete disarray and there was only one person to wait 15 tables and service the take out customers. Hopefully they were just having a bad night and it's not like this all the time.

Side note - the place was filthy. If the food was really good, I'd happily overlook that. But seeing as we never got our food, I have to point out that this place would have absolutely flunked a health inspection.

This place makes hands down the best Mexican food I've ever eaten. Tonight is my third time here this week, and I don't do that with almost any restaurant. The owners are super friendly and the ingredients in every dish are among the freshest I have ever tasted. The location may seem discouraging for some (located near the corner of Route 31/Lake Street and Route 56/Butterfield Road/the bridge connecting Aurora and North Aurora), but DO NOT BE DECEIVED. There's ample parking adjacent on the south side of the bridge (same side of the street as the restaurant) so that's not an issue. The location is super cozy and has a warm decor, but lacks central air conditioning so summer visits can be a bit on the warm side for some. The servers I've had, I believe, are both the owners' children and do a fine job. The young man is particularly funny as well as dutiful in his job.

The table salsa can range from "delightfully spicy" to "oh my gosh my mouth is on fire but this is too tasty to miss;" the horchata is authentic (not a mix like too many taquerias in the area); the guacamole is creamy and cooling with the right amount of lime; the chicken burritos have more chicken in them than most chicken dinners you get at any given restaurant, and the pastor tacos are the most delicious I've had in the United States. Do yourself a favor and stop in.

One warning: when ordering takeout at a dinner rush hour you may be waiting upwards of 40 minutes for 6 tacos and 2 tortas, which would be fine if the girl taking the order on the phone didn't quote a time of 20-25 minutes.

Side note: the owner told me last night bag they offer catering services for weddings/parties/any night you don't want to make your own meal. Their cook will literally make everything on the spot for everyone fresh, not simply buffet-style. How cool is that?

Oh NO! NOT JERRY SPRINGER/Cheaters! I'm not a fan of the daily TV programs. No biggie, as they serve up a very tasty Torta. They can get a surge right at noon, so come early. #TacoTuesday

Chips and fantstic salsa when you dine-in, above average level of heat. Great chicken tacos. Steak and pork good too. If you want good service, you need to be a regular it seems.
The Mario Especial burrito was delicious. Very friendly staff. They're celebrating the 5 year anniversary this weekend... $1 tacos! I will definitely be back.
Sweet, smiling lady working. Reasonable prices, excellent food. Best shredded beef taco I've had. Hubby had the steak burrito - said it had great flavor, nice soft tortilla. Will be back.

Basic Mexican food but done well
Guacamole excellent
Shrimp cocktail excellent
Torta excellent 
Sangria bottled soft drink yummy
Friendly service
Slow pace

This is a quality Mexican joint. Great food, fun and interesting monthly specials, very good prices, and friendly staff. My family has been going here since it opened a few years ago and have never been disappointed in the food. It's pretty much a small, family-run business so if one person misses a shift the wait and service times can climb a bit, but this doesn't happen often.
For two Tortas, taco and a burrito we only paid $17.71! This place was delicious! We complained about the horchata tasting funny and we replaced it with water and didn't get charged.
The smell of oil absorbed into the walls hits you a bit hard when you first walk in. The food was sub-par. Not the best place if you want Lengua tacos.

Sometimes you see those small restaurants that look like a hole in the wall so you pass right by. I've driven by this place a million times and never gave it a second thought until today. It was a wise choice to stop in. Their food is authentic Mexican and you won't find better. I only tried their ground beef tacos and guacamole but both were still lingering on my taste  buds an hour later. I'll be back..no doubt about it. 
Cheers!
Great taco joint.  Food was served quick and was hot, everything tasted great.  Will definately be back.

Excellent!!! And we agree the pastor tacos are the best we've ever had :) Their hand made tamales are great, and we got a nice surprise when we ordered elotes and got a choice of on the cob or mixed up with the classic ingredients in a bowl. We are fussy about Mexican food, and this has become our favorite go-to place
Great food and a great price! Our go to for Mexican in the area.

The best "hole in the wall" around. The chicken tacos are the bomb. I get the chips and guacamole to go and it's awesome every time --not too much salt and a huge serving. Prices are reasonable. We go there at least once a week!
Every time we've been here for dinner, no matter the day, the food is always fresh, great tasting, and of great quality. On top of that, the service is outstanding!
Awesome food! Steak Tacos are delicious! Homemade Tamales, guacamole, and their hot sauces are very tasty and not excessively spicy!
Best authentic Mexican food for miles!!!  I'm a big fan of Mexican food and have tried most in the area and none can compare to Juquilta's!!!  Great family owned place!

This place is literally a hole in the wall. But the food is authentic and delicious. Their homemade salsa is just a little heat with sweetness from mangos. The portions are large and the prices are inexpensive. The staff is so nice and warm and welcoming.
Authentic food. Chips and salsa are home made.  Agua de Jamaica (habiscus tea) is not too sweet not too bitter...It's just delicious.

A visual masterpiece with AUTHENTIC Mexican cuisine. Very casual atmosphere that's entirely fun and a true culture experience. Spectacular value and open to great conversation and a fun filled laughs. Everything is fresh and served to perfection. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Pure fun, Fantastic Flavor, wonderful value that will ignite your taste buds.

All Mexican joints in Aurora serve these tiny tacos on 3" diameter shells. Dont know whats up with that.

But, this place has the best.

My coworker told me about this place and it's conveniently around the corner from my job so I try to go at least once a month for lunch. I always feel like I have to be rolled out the door once I'm done. Everything here is so good! I love the fish tacos, shrimp tacos and veggie tacos and my absolute favorite are the chicken flautas. Perfectly seasoned! They just got new booths which makes it even more comfortable and you can bring a nice size group to have lunch or dinner. 
If they were open for breakfast, I'd stop there in the morning! Don't pass this hole in the wall by, stop in and experience them for yourself!

The best "hole in the wall" around. The chicken tacos are the bomb. I get the chips and guacamole to go and it's awesome every time --not too much salt and a huge serving. Prices are reasonable. We go there at least once a week!
Every time we've been here for dinner, no matter the day, the food is always fresh, great tasting, and of great quality. On top of that, the service is outstanding!
Awesome food! Steak Tacos are delicious! Homemade Tamales, guacamole, and their hot sauces are very tasty and not excessively spicy!
Best authentic Mexican food for miles!!!  I'm a big fan of Mexican food and have tried most in the area and none can compare to Juquilta's!!!  Great family owned place!

This place is literally a hole in the wall. But the food is authentic and delicious. Their homemade salsa is just a little heat with sweetness from mangos. The portions are large and the prices are inexpensive. The staff is so nice and warm and welcoming.
Authentic food. Chips and salsa are home made.  Agua de Jamaica (habiscus tea) is not too sweet not too bitter...It's just delicious.

A visual masterpiece with AUTHENTIC Mexican cuisine. Very casual atmosphere that's entirely fun and a true culture experience. Spectacular value and open to great conversation and a fun filled laughs. Everything is fresh and served to perfection. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Pure fun, Fantastic Flavor, wonderful value that will ignite your taste buds.

All Mexican joints in Aurora serve these tiny tacos on 3" diameter shells. Dont know whats up with that.

But, this place has the best.

My coworker told me about this place and it's conveniently around the corner from my job so I try to go at least once a month for lunch. I always feel like I have to be rolled out the door once I'm done. Everything here is so good! I love the fish tacos, shrimp tacos and veggie tacos and my absolute favorite are the chicken flautas. Perfectly seasoned! They just got new booths which makes it even more comfortable and you can bring a nice size group to have lunch or dinner. 
If they were open for breakfast, I'd stop there in the morning! Don't pass this hole in the wall by, stop in and experience them for yourself!

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant. I live about 30 miles away, but stop in here whenever I am in town. Their burrito has never failed me, and the chips and salsa are just right. This place is a gem.

Found this on Google Maps and decided to go because it was close to work. I got the 3 taco lunch special. I had chicken tacos and it came with rice, beans, and a drink. The tacos were HUGE, the salsa was delicious,and obviously home made, and the rice and beans were fresh and delicious. I'll definitely be back!
Delicious authentic and friendly everything you could hope to expect from a little hole in the wall restaurant and more! 10 out of 10 will eat here again... maybe weekly

Awesome! Exactly what you want out of a taco stand! Great food and salsa! I had the steak tacos and they were great. The guac was really fresh and he prepared it right when we got there. If you have been looking for a go to taco stand this is the place!

This is more like a 3.5 rating. The reason it isn't a 4 is because it took 20 minutes to make 8 tacos and some guac for a take out order. I've waited less time at a sit down Mexican restaurant. There were two people waiting for take out orders in front of me. Both ended up going up to the counter to ask how much longer their wait would be. that's a fairly embarrassing situation.

I will give them the benefit of the doubt. Maybe a kitchen guy called out on a Friday night and they were down some hands. No one else has mentioned slow service, so maybe it was a fluke. I would have liked to have the option of calling ahead - that would have been much better, but they didn't have anything online and there were surprisingly no paper take out menus at the counter for next time. So if the owners read this, my recommendation is to go to kinkos and print a bunch of menus so you don't have the stress of a bunch of people waiting in the small restaurant.

So the food. The guac was really good. My husband loved it slightly more. I love salty guac and this was not that, so I would have preferred a tiny more salt but then again, that's me so in no way is there a complaint on the guac. We ordered tacos and a torta. The steak torta was messy, but the meat was well seasoned. The reviews on the el pastor tacos were so high, but I weirdly preferred the chicken. The pastor had almost a grisly texture that I didn't love. All in all, the tacos were good, and even though they look small, they were very filling.

I will go back because I got a glimpse of their burritos and I need that next - with the guac.

Food was ok. I'd suggest more seasoning in the shredded chicken tacos. A little bland. Rice was fluffy but also needed something more in terms of flavor. Restaurant was clean and service was excellent. Overall slightly above average.
Had a pastor taco and steak torta... Both were perfect and authentic.  Good prices to.  Hole in the wall location but its some amazing food.

Authentic food..... Had the Tacos de Pastor and they were excellent. Kids loved the food, and they are pretty picky especially when dad picks a place to eat. The kids ordered a cup of fresh cut Mangos with Chile and Lemon juice for desert it was fresh and taste so good. If your in North Aurora Choose this place instead of the taco place on Butterfield. Much better and more authentic.
So-so, just had steak tacos, but steak was very fatty and full of grizzle. Rice was decent. The location is TERRIBLE!! Probably won't go back, on to the next Taco joint pleassse!!!

Great little Mexican spot. We tried the steak, chicken and El Pastor tacos, all were delicious.  We sampled a few of the tamales including the sweet tamales made with Guava. The staff was friendly and informative about the menu. We'll be back.

This place has undergone a makeover recently. Looks nicer and cleaner on the inside. There might also be some change in the ownership or management by way of co-ownership. The owner seemed to have some extra professional help in the kitchen and a regular wait staff. 
They had started to slip quite a bit some months ago, but they seem to have tried to come back up again. 

We ordered burritos some days ago and all of them were very good. I personally think that the owner (or one of the main cooks named Mario) does the burritos the best. Nicely stuffed with all the advertised ingredients. Always fresh ingredients, haven't fallen sick after eating from here in a long time now.  

Hardworking cooks here. They will take orders and accommodate you even if it close to 9:00 p.m. (closing time). The wait staff is courteous and that is important if you want your customers to return and your business to grow.

Nice authentic food, reasonable pricing. Juquilita was great, finally trying different foods and worth the trip there.
Friendly staff as well.

Great food. So fresh and very authentic. Food is very presentable as well. I lived in Tucson,AZ and have eaten Mexican food in Mexico. This place IA a as food as any fo I don't I've had in either place.

When in with a group of 8 late at night and the place is quite small but we all fit just fine. We all ordered horchatas and let me tell you they were pretty good! Really sweet and none of that weird stuff on the bottom of the cup. I had there steak burrito and it was HUGE! It was also really good a lot of meat. It had quite jalapeos which was fine but some pieces where bigger than others. The lady that took our order was extremely nice. Spoke English and Spanish. She did not mind that we had two crazy 4 year olds playing after they ate. She actually gave them a candy. Overall a really great place for great food. Will definitely be going back soon!

Excellent food! My wife and I stopped in this evening for a quick bite to eat and we were both blown away by the quality of their food. 

We ordered eight tacos, consisting of pastor, pollo, and carne asada. The pollo was decent; juicy with a very mild flavor. The carne asada was cooked very well and was seasoned just right. The pastor, however, blew us out if the water. 

The service was great too. The guy who waited on us had just started but was eager to take our order and was very courteous. Overall, just a great experience. We live very close to this place and we'll be stopping in again very soon.

My boyfriend and I were so happy to have found this place after moving to Aurora this summer. The food is incredible and the employees are beyond nice! They even make X-Large quesadillas for my boyfriend.
The tortillas are the best I've had locally.  I love the fish and veggie tacos.  I keep ordering the same thing, but my friends say everything is great.

OK - we stumbled upon Juquilita Taco's stand at the Batavia Windmill City Festival while riding bikes along the Fox River Trail.  There are many good tex-mex and authentic Mexican restaurants all over the Aurora/North Aurora area.......but let me say that these were some of the best tacos around.

Steak, Chicken, Pork......all Excellent.  The kicker is that this was just their 'remote' stand at an outside festival.  The guy that served us said the restaurant is 'much better' because they can take their time and of course have a full menu.

They are located right off the Fox River Trail at State Street Bridge in North Aurora.....this will be our new lunch spot while biking from now on.

Wow. Went here for the first time today. I got the enchiladas verde con pollo and it was perfect.  Not too much sauce or cheese just right. The chicken was not diced but shredded which is what I love.  I also got four tacos two steak and two pork. I love how they chop the meat into small dices and the tacos are so thick with meat. They were so delicious. They use El Milagro tortillas and double it with each taco. So glad I decided to try it.

Update: Just tried two tortas al pastor and breaded steak. These are without a doubt the best tortas I have ever had. I kid you not. Very generous portions of meat and perfectly made. The bread was nicely toasted and the meat perfectly tender. There was so much taste built into this. you have to try them. By far the best Mexican food every.

I've lived in the area almost two years after having relocated from Los Angeles and this is the *best* Mexican found i've encountered since arriving in the Midwest.
