Really.  Now, she did adjust the bill by 9.00.  Fair enough, a simple apology and please come back would have sufficed.  One and done.

Have eaten there several times for lunch and dinner, and have always had good service and great food.  Outdoor seating is nice in the summer.  Highly recommend the chips, cheese, apples, and spreads appetizer.  Reasonably priced.

We used to love The Cellar Bistro for a number of years however over the last 3 or so visits our love affair is over.

What happened to them I do not know, the food quality has just gone down hill.

I used to put up with the tiny tables & the wait when the food was good but no longer, I'm sorry but it's over.

I went there for the first time today for lunch and I was very pleased. I had the soup of the day which was the Chicken Tortilla and for my meal I had the Penne Pasta with Chicken which was delicious. The ambiance was warm and comforting, the staff was pleasant. I recommend The Cellar Bistro!
Wonderful lunch spot for outdoor dining. Great burgers

my husband and I stopped inn here looking for a new place to try. the place is small but we did not have to wait for a table on a Friday night. I ate the pork with spinach,walnuts and apricots,And my husband had the pepper crusted steak....we were both very happy with our food.We didn't have desert because we were too stuffed. the service was great too!!

This is a lovely romantic wine bar. My fianc and I had a lovely time sipping on wine and trying their food. I especially had a good time there because they have a gluten-free menu. Make a reservation for dinner so you don't have to wait for a table. The place is small, so they can't accommodate too many couples. You'll have a great time here.

The weather and the wine were lovely. The service was astonishly distracted and the food was confusing. 
Server accidentally dropped a wine glass on the patio table, it shatters onto my husband, his person, my legs and the ground. We were moved to a new table and it was cleaned up..after another couple took the table. Apology was rapid but distracted. 
No utensils on the table for half the meal. We asked twice. We ended up sharing forks and one napkin for half the meal.
The appetizer was mushrooms stuffed with blue cheese. Little hints of blue cheese and mostly Alfredo sauce inside of mushrooms that came with tortilla chips as garnish. Tortilla chips? With mushrooms? 
Pizza with chevre, olives and bacon but smothered in  gobs of shredded mozzarella? 
Dessert would have been nice. We didn't have time. We asked for the check to be forgotten, again. My husband went inside to get it. The woman we asked for the check didn't relay to our server who seemed baffled.

So many things could be done to help this bistro. Wheaton needs one. With all the BMW's cruising by, the potential is there. In my opinion, it falls flat. Tonight, it was confused food without a chef looking it over or coukd care less a out taste and experience. (Tortilla chips as garnish at a bistro; those corn chips were going out with at least three appetizers I saw.)  

 At each and every point during the meal your service lacked grace or could make an elegant decision that would cost you a 30$ bottle of wine. You shatter a glass on us, you buy the person a drink. It's the polite thing to do.

This was now the third time we have stopped in at this little, over-rated hole in the wall owned by Nick and wife/chef Kathy and were turned away at the door. 

It was 9:00 and we were told the restaurant was closed the last call was fifteen minutes prior (third time we heard that story), however there were couples drinking at the bar and diners in the dining room. Granted, all were winding down but all we wanted was a glass of wine and an opportunitiy to find out if our reccommendations for the owner's recent trip to Paris worked out. 

The service there is mediocre at best, the menu is a joke and the one thing they have going for themselves, the wine list cannot be sampled after 8:45 p.m.

I'm vegetarian, and one of my guests is on a gluten free diet.

We came for an early dinner, with a last minute reservation. Located in charming area of Downtown wheaton. Relatviely empty upon arrival, full when we left.

I had The Wrap with grouper fish - it was unexpectadly, but very good. It came with a garlic potato salad which was the hit of the meal. It contained red potatos, chives, mayo, parsley, and garlic. Unusually, tasting, but the best potato salad I've ever had.

My three kids ordered pizzas - A Margarita which could have been good, but was too bland, A Pepperoni & Bacon which had a tasteless crust, and a Kid's vcheese which was very oilly. Cellar Bistro has a brick oven, so their pizzas COULD taste fantastic, but from what I tried, they were only average. 

That being said, you don't go to a French-style bistro for the pizza.

My final guest has a severe gluten allergy. She ordered Pork medallions with fruit and nuts,  and a sweet potato mash. She isn't open to new foods, but she loved this.

Our bill was $80 for 2 soups, a salad, 3 drinks, and 5 entrees. 

I look forward to returning.

First, here's the context of our visit... So, we went on Valentine's Day, which may not be the best time to visit somewhere for the first time, but we couldn't make up our mind on where to go so we just popped in here after driving around downtown Wheaton for a while. 

We didn't have a reservation, and despite the room being mostly empty were told we would have to wait for them to figure out where to put us. Ok, understandable. We got a seat by the window, which was nice. Pillows on the banquette were a nice touch. However, it was freezing cold and I had to wear my jacket throughout dinner. Mood lighting was nice, and they had a guitar player noodling around to add to the romantic atmosphere.

Wine list is not vast. A couple of choices in each category, many that you can find at Jewel or Dominick's. No flights available. A little disappointing for a wine bar.  We ordered cosmos to start, which were not very tasty and $11 each. No garnish or anything special about them at all.

The set Valentine's Day meal was a 5 course for $50 or so, with choice of fish or beef. We didn't know this going in but decided to roll with it since it was getting later in the evening.  We sat for a long while before someone came to take a drink order. We asked about the menu and were put off. Little menu cards would have been a nice touch. We told our waitress about my allergy and when the other waitress brought out the appetizer it was not edible due to my allergy. Zero communication between waitress #1, #2 and kitchen.  They quickly made an adjustment for me, which was great.

Appetizer was good, creamy leek soup was divine, the salad was gross (shredded lettuce? really? very Taco Bell), entrees were so-so and dessert was just fine. I didn't feel like we got our $50 worth... quantity of food was there but quality definitely was not. We left full but not satisfied. 

Overall, we'll probably go back to try this place on a non-holiday, non-special menu day, but honestly we may just go to sit at the bar and enjoy the ambiance, since the food was so not impressive.

We were lured in by the sidewalk sign's promise of half-price martinis. Our waitress, a charming and slightly nervous girl, was very helpful and immediately remedied the greasy, finger-smudged wine-glasses on our table when we sat down. 
We ordered our martinis - his was a cosmo - oddly un-garnished, but tasty.
My classic gin martini was tasty, but a bit watered-down. We were thrilled to hear that they had a lobster bisque. Who doesn't love a smooth, thick, creamy lobster-y bisque? 
It showed up promptly, watery, with corn, chunks of stringy lobster, and did we mention WATERY?
It did not even smell like a bisque. It was more a thin chowder. We explained this to our waitress, who said "well, they call it bisque, it's bisque" (with a nervous giggle.) We did not stay on for dinner as we had planned, fearing the shrimp scampi would not be shrimp, or some other atrocity.

My husband and I had a date night here (our first time) and were pleasantly surprised. I was a bit hesitant because the restaurant is so small but by the end of our visit that was actually something I found charming about the place. Our waitress was attentive and helpful at guiding me towards a wine I liked (I'm not exactly knowledgable about wines). My husband was a little disappointed with the beer selection but made do . The food was excellent! We had the bacon wrapped dates for an appetizer and they were amazing. Our dinners did not disappoint either. We will definitely be going back.

I just don't understand how other people can rate this place so highly. I guess that's why it's good we don't all like the same things. Then life would be boring.

Let's start with what I love about this place. The atmosphere, it's wonderful cozy romantic spot for dinner and that was the draw for me and my "date". On a side note, my date is married - to someone else. We used to be co-workers but now she's my best friend. Unfortunately  she and her husband don't get out often so we try to have dinner whenever I'm in town. Nothing more than that. But I digress.

Now on to what I'm not a fan of. The bar, great bar, knowledgable bartender, but only two choices of Vodka? Supposedly they were waiting on an order to come in. HMMMM

On to the appetizer. We started with their form of bruschetta. Way too much vinegar. Dinner was also not memorable. Next we shared a plate of pesto stuffed mushrooms. Quite frankly I thought they forgot the pesto. I couldn't taste it at all. We ended the evening with a cheese medley which wasn't bad, but not memorable.

Utlimately it was a wonderful evening, because I got to spend it with one of my most favorite people in the world. Next time we'll go somewhere else on our "date" 

Now I'll probably regret writing this reveiw because when I reviewed the Mexican place down the street the manager bordered on harassing me over his staff. Sorry, I just didn't like The Cellar Bistro, some may, I don't.

But, if you're just looking for a friendly place to have a drink I would recommend The Cellar Bistro. Just don't stay for the food.

I went by myself, which was not very much fun, but the place was great. I understand some of the low rated- reviews here, but my experience was superb! I orded the lasagna and it was probably the best lasagna I've ever had! My boyfriend and I are going back next week so he can try it!
The atmosphere is very cozy and the people are very nice, despite what other reviews here have said.

If I were you, I'd give it a try!

We went to Cellar Bistro on a whim on a warm night. The dining room is very small and inviting. However, we were seated at a table that felt like it was in the middle of an aisle, and we had wait staff and other customers trying to squeeze between our table to get to other tables or the kitchen. The food was spotty; I ordered the lamb with cherry compote and was blown away by its taste and presentation. My husband agreed that it was very delicious. However, my husband's bison ribeye was lacking any flavor and it was overcooked. We're unsure whether we would return because of the range of quality in their entrees; if every dish was like the lamb, we would be back in a heartbeat!

We've been here twice (on Tuesday nights) in the past several weeks.  The first time we must have walked in just about the same time as everyone else.  Even though they were busy the food was well prepared and our server (Meghan) was attentive.  The next time we came in it was slow.  Meghan remembered us, the drinks we ordered, as well as our food order.  The service and food were great! We had the mini burgers and Margharita pizza. The price is not too bad either.  If you are looking for a quiet place for a nice meal on a Tuesday night, this is a place.

Definitely for adults though.  I think kids wouldn't like it.

Went to the Cellar Bistro for the first time this past Saturday night on a date.  I was impressed by the interior and it had a good ambiance.  Wait staff was polite but not very helpful in suggesting a wine.  I was a bit surprised to see that the menu was very small and limited.  Not many options if you are a picky eater.  I was pleased that the portions were actually appropriate for one person.  Being a Dietitian it's nice to see correct portion sizes!  My date finished his whole plate and I finished all but a few bites.  Overall, I think this was an OK meal.  I was a bit surprised though that the menu didn't reflect items that are in season as they advertise they use local produce.  I would recommend going if you like a small, warm environment and if you are not too particular about options.  If you like to visit and drink after dinner they close early so you will need to find another after meal stop.

Oh my gosh!  My mom and I went here for my birthday dinner and I cannot say enough good things about it.

I made a reservation, but the only tables were bistro tables, so mom and I decided to wait until a lower table was available and sat at the bar.  We ordered a bottle of Woop Woop Shiraz and it was wonderful.  Our bartender, Jerry, was very nice in his recommendations and service.  

When we were seated, we got our appetizer osf3 dips with crostinis and chips.  Delicious! Especially the red pepper and white cheddar dip.  I definitely recommend this!  Yum!

I had the red and yellow beet salad with goat cheese, and my mom had the deconstruted blue cheese salad.  Again, delicious!

Then on to our entrees.  I had the chicken saltimbocca and mom had the surf and turf.  A medium rare prime ribeye, perfectly cooked scallops, and beautifully cooked large prawns.  We both had creamy but chunky garlic mashed potatoes, I had peas, she had mushrooms.  I can't say enough how delicious both of our meals were.  We got another bottle of wine when our first ran out. This time, Rivere, a Spanish blend.  Another yummy bottle with just the perfect bite and smoothness.

Even though we both had leftovers from dinner, we ordered the chocolate cake a la mode to share.  I was pleasantly surprised as I don't normally like cake.  It was amazing!

In short, we both highly recommend The Cellar Bistro. It was the best experience we've had at a restaurant in many  many years.  Our server, Blaine, was exceptional in his service and recommendations and the assistant manager (I am embarrassed to say I do not remember her name), was also very nice and made sure we got our cake for free for my birthday.

Jose is the chef - he deserves a lot of credit here - he is obviously an amazing cook as well as leader in this kitchen - and I would not change a thing about our meal.

Had lunch with a client at the Cellar Bistro, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The decor is a little cheesy, a little too "SEE!  WE HAVE WINE BARS IN THE 'BURBS!"  but maybe that's just me being an urban snob.

The food was very good.  I had mushroom brie soup, which was delicious and very generously sized.  I also had the caprese salad, which was very fresh.  I did not care for the balsamic glaze, but I am a caprese purist - I like mine like they make it in Italy: tomatoes, fresh mozz, basil, olive oil, sea salt, pepper.  No balsamic.

A colleague had a delicious-looking crab and avocado salad.  I didn't hear any complaints from any of my dining companions.

All in all, it was quite good.

I went here with the hubs for my b-day and I absolutely loved it. The BBQ shrimp with blue cheese grits was the best meal I've had since my last birthday. I've been dreaming about those damn grits. The husband enjoyed his lasagna and the mushroom brie soup was spectacular. It's a nice place inside. The pictures on their web site make it look cheesy and like it's trying too hard. They need to get someone beside a 17 year old with a point and click camera to take some professional photos. The service was great too. We each got soup, a main dish, split a dessert and a bottle of wine for about $80.

We were lucky enough to sneak into Cellar Bistro for dinner before a show.  We arrived at 6:30, and the place was packed.  This is definitely a place to have reservations at dinnertime.  

There just happened to be a 2 top table available, and we were seated.  The server was great and their menu really does have a Bistro feel.  Some smaller fare, a variety of cheese plates, and a fantastic wine list. 

The atmosphere at dinner time is a bit frantic, though I can see this place having a more intimate feel later in the evening. 

A great lucky find.

Just walking into this place, you're captured by the greatness of their design. Exposed brick walls, beautiful hard-wood table tops with great varnish, vaulted ceilings, and more wood grain on the ceiling fans. Topped off with good music to keep your feet tapping while you eat. I'm really digging this place, and haven't even taken the first bite. Tasteful, homey, welcoming pictures and decor with a cork board to pin your business card! Noice!!

Eager employees greet you with a warm friendly smile and are knowledgable about the menu. I got the flamethrower burger which was on point! The buns were toasted on the insides with plenty butter! So good! You get a very generous portion of fresh cut fries and they have creole seasoning on their condiment table, which is great, btw! Just ask for no salt because it makes the fries extra salty with it on them also.

The food was so good and plenty filling, but I couldn't resist ordering a custard with a baseball helmet bowl!? What?? I'm sold! Haha and I'm glad I did. It was SO good! Definitely the best custard I've had in a long time. 

I will most definitely be back here again, soon. Glad I found this place and can share on here. If you get the chance, try Van's out, you'll be glad you did also :)

Hubby had a burger. Pretty good. 

I had the frozen custard, which was great. 

The service was the best. Friendly and helpful.

I will be back.  What gave me the extra motivation to drive over and try them was their flavor of the day (make sure you check what it is before you go).  The banana cream pie was awesome!!  What made it even better is that adults can get a kid's size.  And they had kid sizes for multiple things, not just cones/cups.  We sat at a table outside, that was nice too, but would have been better if the wedding shop's mobile unit wasn't blocking the view.
I did not try the "real food," so I can't comment on that.
FYI there is a lot of parking in back (between them and Benedicts).  Helpful to know for someone who can't parallel park (don't judge).  They also had lots of games there to pass the time, if necessary.

A stop at Van's is a must whenever I'm near East Dundee.  I'm a creature of habit and always get the vanilla custard with raspberries, mostly because it's DELICIOUS. Why try anything else?? Stop in, it iw WAY better than that place across the street!

Gave this place a try after seeing it on yelp and it was definitely worth it. Burgers were made fresh to order and toppings complemented, but didn't over power the flavor of the meat. Sides are key, as they can ruin everything and they pulled through with perfectly crisp fries.

I went out of my way searching for some delicious custard dessert, and delicious custard dessert is precisely what I got!

I walked in about a half hour before closing, but the teen/early 20-somethings employees were hyped up and ready to help dish out orders.  They were friendly and (for once) it was cool to see some youth enjoying their jobs.

The decor and setup was charming, and the place was clean.

I went all out and ordered the Grandma's Brownie Sundae (regular size = $6).  It was a delicious chocolate monstrosity that, had I had someone else with me, would have been perfect for sharing.

I need to keep Van's Bookmarked - even though it's a bit of a drive for me, it's definitely a better option than the chains.

After driving past Van's multiple times a week, I decided to check it out randomly on a hot day. It looks like a small shack from the outside (I was expecting it to be like a small Dairy Queen), but inside it looks much bigger and there is ample seating. 

Everyone seemed to be eating burgers and fries, but all I wanted was a small cup of the vanilla custard (boring.. I know), but all I wanted was something refreshing.. Not a sugar overload. There are many toppings to choose from and there are many weekly specials. I saw some sundaes pass by me as they were delivered to customers and WOW, did they look good!

The girl that rung me up was super enthusiastic and very friendly. I ordered two small cups of vanilla custard and the total was a little over $5. 

The custard is really creamy and overall very good. A small cup is all I would ever need with two good sized scoops. I can't wait to return and try some of the different topping combinations!

Excellent food and service. Had pimento cheese burger and it was outstanding. Terrific flavorful cheese and perfect burger - cooked but not overdone. I don't see any room for improvement - they even carry Coke Zero at the fountain.
Possibly the best custard in the area. Great service, food, location, and any place that serves custard in an MLB team's helmet should automatically get 5 stars.

I first had frozen custard at Ted Drewes (st. Louis) which was super delicious.
The taste at Vans was good but nothing exceptional. The butterscotch sauce didn't taste like butterscotch. The almond joy sundae was okay. The brownie Sunday was good though. Basing on the other reviews maybe the other items on the menu would be good but the ones we had were not impressive.

What's not to love? My family visited Van's two Saturdays in a row and our only regret was not checking them out sooner! The first time we visited their frozen custard Flavor of the Day was Peanut Butter Oreo and it was a HUGE hit with my husband. We loved the creaminess of the custard. I had the Hawaiian Shaved Ice.  

I also loved the family board and card games at Van's. My son and I played Connect 4, but there were many others - like a giant table game of checkers! There are also crayons, coloring books, and small toys to keep kids occupied while you wait.  

After we visited, friends kept mentioning how great their burgers were. So we went back the next weekend to try some. They certainly didn't disappoint. I only wish I knew that you had to ask for all your toppings separately. I ordered a bacon mushroom cheeseburger that I thought would come with lettuce, tomato, mayo. etc. It doesn't. Otherwise, it was great. The Flavor of the Day that day was Toasted Coconut, and it was incredible. I have to keep an eye out for when that flavor comes back again!

I can probably count on one hand the number of times in my life some place or experience has exceeded my expectations. I can now add Van's Frozen Custard and Burgers to that list.

Housed in a remodeled Standard Oil gas station that dates back to 1927, Van's is the creation of Tulane graduate Chad Van Acker - inspired he sez, by a visit to the Ben and Jerry's factory when he was a toddler.

Located on Main Street in the quaint village of East Dundee, steps from the Fox River and across the street from a Dairy Queen, Chad has carved out a niche for himself as well as a popular following by serving fresh and refreshing flavors of custard and sorbet, as well as some pretty outrageous burgers and sandwiches.

My intention was just to stop in for a small cup o' custard on a hot Chicago summer day, but when I saw some other patrons enjoying the burgers, my priority shifted.

I ordered the bacon/cheddar burger (all burgers come with fresh cut fries), and there is a healthy list of condiments you can add gratis.  I went with my usual: mustard, pickle, raw onion.

Here's an insider's (me) tip:  if you plan on eating the burger, don't start munching the fries first.  They are addictive.  Hot, crisp, potato-y, lightly seasoned, amazing fries.  Even In N Out would be jealous. Even the fat cats in Oak Brook.

The amply-sized beef patty had a nice char on it from the gas grill, with a very fresh sesame bun, lots of thick cut smokey bacon, and freshly prepared vegetable condiments.  I'm glad I stopped with a short-list of add ons, if I had added lettuce and tomato, the burger wouldn't have fit in my mouth - it's a massive sandwich.

If you want to know just how good it is, peel off a section of the bun and condiments and take a bite of just the beef.  Flavorful and tastes the way beef should taste.

I chased the burger with a cup of the custard flavor of the day, Mint Chocolate Chip, which was creamy and delicious.  

Mr. Van Acker, congrats.  Build a dozen or so more.

Best custard around!  The homemade sundaes were outstanding.  Portions were large.  I suggest the berry crumble- I'm craving that right now!  The turtle sundae was excellent as well.  Cute place- make sure to check out all the old photos.  Love it!
My husband and I love coming here! Best custard around and the food is great. We always get the flavor of the day and it is always amazing! Love it!

We stumbled upon this place while driving through the area, we were hungry and want to get something quick.  It was late afternoon, so they were not too busy but the restaurant were still half full.  We both ordered the burger, I had the regular fries and my husband had the sweet potato fries.  We were pleasantly surprised by their burgers, they were huge and delicious, the beef petty were so thick and juicy, my fries were good but my husband's sweet potato fries were Great.  The price is right, of course it is pricier than Micky D, but still cheaper than a lot of those Gourmet Burger place.  We didn't tried their Frozen Custard, but will definitely try it next time we are in the neighborhood.

Been here several times..I think the burgers are outstanding. Went yesterday and had the flavor of the day which is key lime pie and it was amazing. A small is 2 huge scoops I think u really get a lot for your money! Love al the different flavors.

Stopped in with my sis-in-law after doing a drive by at the old C-ville house. waffle cone full of Van's custard was especially good after five years away.
while generally not a fan of butter pecan it was the flavor of the day - suffice to say that custardy BuPec is far superior to the creamed-ice version. couldn't find the daily-special-board so I don't know if there's still a special concrete. did I just miss it?
not sure that I am a fan of the new location: too much decor, visually busy. maybe when I have time to absorb it all that will change but for now its just like that...

Van's has turned me into a legitimate frozen dessert snob, and who could blame me?  Their custard is fresh made every day & they also make their own sorbets (usually 2 flavors a day) and you can top it a zillion different ways.  The custard is super rich & creamy, not really needing to be topped with anything, but when there are toppings like peanut butter sauce and marshmallow creme, you'd be a fool not to indulge.  My go-to is whatever the sorbet is, topped with pretzel crunch (candied pretzel sticks) and marshmallow creme.  It's pure heaven!  This place will have you craving a custard creation in the dead of winter.

If I HAD to name a negative about Van's, it's that parking is scarce, but let me tell you, I'd walk there if I had to (luckily, I have a car, so that's not an issue).  If you haven't been to Van's Frozen Custard, I think you should ask yourself why.

I'm usually not a huge fan of frozen custard in general but had kept hearing about the grill at Van's. Gotta saw I love me some meats and especially love when they're combined. The bacon cheeseburger there is simply bar none the best around. The bacon is amazing to say the least and the burger takes me back to being a kid in my mother's downtown shop and walking to pick up lunch at the Lyons drugstore lunch counter. Simply stellar. 

I can't recommend it enough. We run the bike shop a couple blocks away and find ourselves recommending Van's to the pros that come in for their rigs and have a few minutes to kill before heading back to their homes.

Vans is one of the best little joints in the area. The custard is delicious and way under priced compared to the other guys. 

Also, the sundaes are fantastic, in particular the "sweet & salty" which has raspberry sauce, pretzel pieces and little cubes of cheesecake! I can hear myself getting fatter when I eat it and I don't care.

Oh, and did someone mention burgers? How about burgers with Funyuns as a topping? Yeah, that's an option at vans and you won't believe how well it works. In fact, I only want Funyuns on my burgers now. Hear that noise? I'm getting fatter again.

Great staff, great food and Funyuns!!!!
Yum~! Great place, great custard!

I'm no expert on Frozen Custard but I had some family from out of town that knew quite a bit about Frozen Custard (they lived near the famous Ted Drewes Frozen Custard shop in Saint Louis for a while). 

They said this was some of the finest Frozen Custard they've had. We had vanilla with nothing mixed in. 

On a separate occasion, I ordered an oreo and peanut butter concrete custard and it was delicious!
Vans is so good!  Love the family atmosphere and the owners are so so nice. Frozen custard is amazing and we love the daily flavors. Best burgers and fries in town too.
Awesome frozen custard and sundaes.  Great staff and service.  Peach Melba sundae almond joy sundae and turtle sundae are our favorites.
food is incredible but service is slow.  if you have time and want a relaxing night for great burgers and dessert, this is the place for you!
Excellent ice cream! We would choose Van's over DQ any day. The muddy buddy sundae is the best!
Best ice cream place in the Northwest Suburbs.  My favorite is the French Silk Ice Cream.  And surprisingly, their hamburgers and fries are really good.

Delicious burgers, fresh, huge portions and friendly staff. Only drawback is they over cook their fries. My husband is into the burnt fries but myself and my children threw them away. I suggest them offering the option of ice cream instead of fries if they don't want to change the fry cooking style. Overall, clean friendly place one of the better businesses in Dundee.

A great place for a getaway desert but helathy? Well you dont eat CUSTARD for health you eat it to enjoy.

Wow, this is a wonderful little place with a great atmosphere and wonderful array of deserts.

Good quality, good service and oh so yummy custard.

Parking can be a pain but it's worth the hassel

Still just as tasty!  And the excellent service continues!!!  It's so nice to visit an establishment and feel like they truly are glad that you stopped in. Seems like they've gotten busier and this makes me happy as I hope they keep this home for quite a while!

I brought two of my sisters in last weekend. We weren't really hungry at all, but we were getting ready to leave the area. I wouldn't stop yammering on about this frozen custard and my precious pretzel crunch, so they begrudgingly wandered in with me. 

So here's what we did. Kids scoops!  Half vanilla/half chocolate. A couple toppings each. Great idea!  It was plenty of custard. They got each order exactly right. One of my sisters followed my lead with the pretzel crunch while the other tried graham cracker crunch and cheesecake bites. I tried some of that too...whoa!  :-)

Two of us, cleaned our cups!  The other didn't but that meant that I could taste her creation. Plus, she really doesn't do dairy, so she are more than I expected. Even for a kids scoop. 

Perfect treat for the perfect price. Don't know why you'd go anywhere else in the area. I'm a huge fan!

Loved it! Fresh burgers, tasted so good! I had a bacon cheeseburger and it was amazing. Tons of bacon, I also had a root beer float, the ice cream was really good. Try it, you'll like it. Clean place, friendly people.
Cute place nice family atmosphere :) great variety of custard toppings- would highly recommend

Stopped in for a sweet treat, and this was the right choice! The frozen vanilla custard was delicious, especially with the toppings. The hot chocolate was simply powder in hot water, but it was a nice complement to the custard.

The sandwich menu looked great, with a variety of grilled cheeses and burgers. There are bins of toys for kids to keep busy. I can imagine this place is packed in the summer.

Only negative is the limited parking.

Van's has the most amazing custard. I've only recently eaten any non custard food there and it didn't disappoint. I had a burger which is made using local fresh ground beef. The burger was cooked to perfection and the flavor was great. The fries come with the burger and they were really flavorful and they are cooked when you order, they're not sitting around waiting for you to come in. Stop in, play some games and eat some great food.

We are regulars at Van's now. We have been going frequently for the last three months. Our freezers are filled with the custard and we cannot stop from going there daily or every other day. Yesterday's flavor was pumpkin pie. First time I had it and OMG! I hope that you get some on the day it is available. That is all i have to say.. October is not October without sampling Van's Pumpkin Pie Custard.

My sister's friend is a regular here and told us about this place. I'm so glad she did since I wouldn't have know about it otherwise. Van's is very cute and charming. My sister had some special request for her order and the lady that took it was so accommodating n patient with us even though there was a line. We ordered cheese fries, burgers, shaved ice, and custard. Everything was very tasty and prices are reasonable. The only one minor issue I've notice is the bottom bun on my burger was cold (not toasted) both times. Very family friendly,  there are coloring books and games. I've been there twice and looking forward to the summer and going there more often.

I went with a friend for the custard. When I saw that they had burgers too, I had to have one. The burger was excellent; but they are very greasy. Which is excellent in my book. The fries were delicious, the extra grease from the burger gave them an even better taste.
Then the custard. Delicious. There is a DQ across the street and I have no idea how they are still in business. A great place to stop in for a cold treat; or lunch with friends and family. The atmosphere inside is welcoming.

Not sure why anyone would go to the Dairy Queen across the street. This play is far superior and much more local than that garbage. Now I can't comment much in the menu as it was my first, but not last, time there. From what I saw, the burgers looked great. Huge. And looked like real fresh beef. Just like home. I was already feeling fat, so I opted for some shaved ice. Tigers blood. The consistency was better than most places in Maui. It was smooth and not that grainy crunchy snow cone Ice. Also had a few bites of grilled cheese which was also good. Also had few bites of some pb custard concoction which was damn good as well. Next time I will have to come hungry. And skinny.
Chocolate frozen custard is soooo good. Also they kept the place open a few extra minutes so I could make it and get my fix.

I love this place so much that I've looked ahead on the calendar of flavors posted on the Van's website to mark the days our family has to visit! The flavors of the day are fantastic (favorites have been Espresso Chip and Strawberry Oreo, but I've never been disappointed with any of the others). The food is great, too. My toddler loves that there are toys and games to play with while our orders are prepared. Employees are friendly. Couldn't ask for a better experience.

Everything i have had here is really good. The Frozen Custard especially. The burgers are huge and can get a bit messy. It is a great place to take kids and they have little toys the kids can take to the table and play with. The location is good, and there is parking in the back. One of our traditions when we take our son to vans is to walk up the street to Around the Corner Candy store and let him pick out a candy. Obviously if you are looking for something healthy this is not the best choice, but a great choice for when you choose to use a cheat meal.

Had to add another 5 star glowing review. This was a much welcomed stop on our bike ride heading south on the Prairie bike trail last weekend. Got caught in the down pour, we walked in completely soaked, limping, famished, dirty, two grumpy toddlers in tow. The staff is SO friendly!! Best custard I've had, ever. I also tried the cucumber lime sorbet- so refreshing. Just awesome. Chicken fingers and french fries excellent - hot and fresh. This will be a regular stop for us from now on!

Unbelievable experience. The store was being run by a young staff of what seemed to be college and high school age students. To be honest it has been a very long time since I have experienced customer service this good!

The girl working the register provided an extremely genuine smile the entire time. They were all very friendly, no one had cell phones out. My daughter has extreme dairy allergies and the young woman at the register took EXTRA care to help me find a great selection for my daughter and then communicate it very clearly to the gentleman making the food. On top of the service he food was hot, fresh and extremely delicious!

Unbelievable experience and I am so happy to see a small business showing the big guys what customer satisfaction is all about. This will become a family favorite!

Unbelievably DELICIOUS frozen custard!!  People in the area have been telling me I have to come here, being an ice cream fanatic.  I finally did today and had a concrete with brownies and cheesecake pieces.  Dairy Queen has met its match!!  I will definitely be back, as there is an awesome lunch menu as well -- lots of burgers, sandwiches, etc.  Very spacious seating inside, plus outdoors when the weather is nice.  Staff was also very, very pleasant.
We love Vans. The service is great and the custard is delicious. We like the laid-back, family atmosphere especially on summer nights.

If I could give them a 10 I would. We do not live close but the drive is worth the deliciousness of their Burgers and home made fries. Best burgers around...and lets not forget their awesome custard and sorbets.  Try their lemon sorbet with marshmallow toping.

Great! It was really busy on a Friday night, the counter people were really patient with my indecision and generous with samples for the crowd of teens we brought. The service was surprisingly  excellent, and fast given the large group we brought in.  French Silk was what I ended up with, with the peanut butter sauce - that was so peanut butterey good.  Can't wait to go back!

Same AMAZING custard and sorbet...in a brand new(to them) location.  

They have added full food service with amazing hamburgers that make my mouth water just THINKING about them!!  

But as I said in the first sentence, it the same custard and sorbet that I raved about from my first review at the old location, so I will repost that here...
--------------------------------------------------------
Van's frozen custard is INCREDIBLE!

My wife, daughter and I cannot get enough of their custard.  It is so smooth, so rich and so decadent.  Makes me wonder why/how the alleged competition (DQ) can even compete.  

My wife and I are foodies so we have seen every Food Network show talking about the making of ice cream.  The average over-run (air mixed into ice cream) of commercial ice cream is about 50%...Van's custard over-run is about 10% which results in a super smooth and velvety texture.  

What makes it even better is that they make it fresh in what seem to be endless batches.  When we were there last night, they were just finishing making their chocolate and then they made their flavor of the day immediately afterward.

They make Vanilla and Chocolate every day and also a flavor of the day which is posted on their website.  We check their site and print their calendar and make special plans to go there for some of our favorite flavors.

They also make dairy-free sorbets and Italian ice - Lemon Ice is made every day and they have a flavor of the day sorbet (which is also listed on their calendar.

It is a family owned business (Mom and Son) and they seem to be there for every shift...I don't know when they sleep.

Great choc malt! Better than DQ accross the street. Burger was really good but overcooked. Could tell the meat was exceptional quality. Good condiments, AOR of bacon. Would have been better cooked medium rare. Lots of good custard & sundae  flavor choices. Nice place & friendly service.

Van's has moved to this location in East Dundee...but it's the same owners & the same delicious frozen custard so I'm relocating my original review here.

Van's Frozen Custard rocks my world! If I lived closer to Van's I'd weigh 400 pounds. I will never waste my time with DQ again.

This place is the real deal - made fresh every day. So smooth and creamy, no excess air.  They make Vanilla and Chocolate every day and they also feature a special flavor of the day (today was Cookie Overload). Check out their calendar online or be like me and have their calendar front and center on the fridge. 

They have concretes and sundaes with a variety of goodies and toppings. They also have some food items like sandwiches, etc. 

It's a little family owned place and it reminded me of my childhood in a very small town. Pay them a visit around the corner from Spring Hill Mall and you'll become a regular.
Great customer service and fabulous custard. Our family is making this our favorite dessert spot this Summer. I haven't tried the burgers yet but can't wait to give them a try too.

Our family has been a fan of Van's since they opened the old store in Carpentersville!! Everything about this store is amazing! I normally don't like "plain old" vanilla, but at Van's, the vanilla is out-of-this-world! Not just their vanilla is amazing, every flavor is great! Van's custard has a great mouth-feel and flavor! If you want a small town, family-run store, make it a point to stop in and try some of their custard! 

I have not tried any of the food, but if their food is like everything else, it is probably amazing!
Great burgers at this place, they tasted good with fresh cut fries . Definitely recommended. I'll be back later to try the custard as well. Nice staff and cofee was good too.

I am in love with their frozen custard! We have frequented them since they  were in Carpentersville. My entire family loves it! Granted with this awful winter we haven't been their much recently. Soon to change though. 

One thing I will say that the new location parking is scary. There are only a few spaces right next to the building. For some reason it makes me nervous - I was so afraid I was going to hit someone backing out! 

Love the new decor! Everyone is so friendly there they make you feel at home. Amazing place run by amazing people. Plus I love that they have kids portions - and they are just perfect!

Visited here for the first time last night and was pleasantly surprised. I got to try the custard and a malt, and both were truly excellent. We didn't have any of the food, but it looks like classic "ice cream shop" fare, and looked really good.

Really cool atmosphere inside, they've kept it pretty simple, and the place is surprisingly spacious. From the outside you wouldn't guess there's that much room inside.

Parking is a little sparse, so you might have to be really devious and park across the street at Dairy Queen.

Best homemade burgers you will have! The restaurant is family owned and very friendly. And the ice cream combinations & options, there are so many to choose from but all so good! Hits the spot every time :) Try the peach and raspberry sundae SOO good!

Without a doubt, Van's has the best custard around (at least here in the western burbs).  The food items on the menu are pretty good, but the custard is what keeps us coming back.  Food service can be a bit on the slow side, but that usually only happens when there's a big crowd.

I love their burgers, reminds me of a burger I would make at home as opposed to a frozen or mass produced patty. All kinds of topping choices at no extra charge. And the custaard is awesome too. This new location is spacious yet still down to earth. A great place to bring kids or just for a quaint afternoon date. They have games to play while you wait: checkers or word dice just to name a few. Kind of ironic they are located across from dairy queen...but I would definitely always choose vans when posed with the choice.
Great food. The fire breather was quite awesome. It's rare that something is so good but so big I can't eat it all. Next time the single will be fine. Then maybe I can try the Ice cream.

I've been here a few times for the frozen custard (which is creamy and refreshing) but this was the first time I had their food. I had a burger with sweet potato fries and a summer crumble Frozen custard (new favorite) the burger was a nice portion, juicy, and fresh. I love the oversized checkers/tic tac toe games they have!
Limited menu. Food is pretty good. The down side is that I get hair in my food more times than I don't here.
Yummy frozen custard treats and sorbet all made on site.  Great place for burgers as well!

My husbands quote "one of the best burgers I've ever had"! They're also known for AMMMMMAAZING custard and chicken tenders! There are a lot of choices so if you're not good at making decisions this is your hell.... Butttttt my favorite would have to be the vanilla custard with Heath and butterfinger mixed in. It is 100 times better than any ice cream place. And cutest character. Plus side we can walk there!

Cute little place with yummy frozen custard.  Went here with the kiddos for an after-Santa's Village treat.  My little guy got the chocolate frozen custard which was really dense and creamy and delicious.  I got the pineapple which was so refreshing and decadent.  The place is spacious and clean.  The staff working were so sweet.  We'd come back again!
I probably visit this place a little too much. I always get the same thing and it's always very good. Keep up the good work.

Van's is amazing! Awesome burgers, fresh cut fries, and tasty custard. I ordered their regular sized burger and it's more than enough. You choose from a good variety of toppings, similar to a Five Guys, including great caramelized onions. They have a daily custard flavor as well as the vanilla and chocolate everyday. I'm looking forward to going back more trying the rest of their menu. Five stars for Van's!
Their bacon cheeseburger is really good. I also had their turtle sunday. The service is friendly and a cute place for kids. It's walking distance from my office so it's a real treat.

First of all, it's an amazingly welcoming place for children! They have a little stash of toys for the kids to play with while you wait for your food which makes my life easier. Kids will love the frozen custard flavors and toppings! I'm fortunate to work extremely close & I have met the owners, and I must say they are sweeter than their custard! 

Now for the food... I don't really have a word to describe how yummy and delicious it really is... It's THAT good. If you like bacon on your burger, this is one place you will not be disappointed with. I'm picky about my bacon & they pass the test! 

It's a great little date night too! They have great prices & I have not a single bad thing to say about this wonderful family owned business! Highly recommend if you're in the Elgin/Dundee area any time soon!

Popped in to Van's on a Saturday and it was really cute. Tons of sundae specials (mint explosion and choco-mallow are the ones I remember but I think they had about 4) and lots of dessert options. We went on Saturday because I specifically wanted the custard flavor of the day, birthday cake. Before I ordered I sampled the lemon sorbet custard, which I think they have everyday as a non dairy option and it was absolutely delicious! I would have gotten that along with the birthday cake custard but I didn't think the two would mix well. 

The birthday cake custard was a bit of a disappointment for me. There were too many big chunks of really dry yellow cake mixed in for my liking, and I was expecting the custard itself to be cake batter flavored when it kind of just tasted like vanilla. However, the waffle cone i got it in was absolutely delicious! It had more of a cinnamon flavor than other cones I've had and I really enjoyed it. Even though the custard I had wasn't for me, I definitely want to try some of the other treats on their menu. 

Something I really liked was that inside the store they posted letters 6th graders at a nearby middle school wrote to Van's as a school project highlighting their favorite local business. That made me feel good that this was such a neighborhood place, and I like supporting businesses like that.

Great custard and service, food is delicious and fresh. Nice place to sit and relax with friends, atmosphere and music both fun and welcoming. Also it is relatively inexpensive! Beats the DQ across the street by a longshot! Perfect to have after exploring West Dundee or having taken a long bike ride.

THE CUSTARD IS PHENOMENAL! I love this place, I love it that we now have a "Ma & Pa" dessert shop to compete with DQ, LONG OVERDUE!

I haven't had a problem with kids out of the four times I have been here, as the other reviews imply.

As to which I have a question too. How can you avoid kids when going out to ice cream? AND  if that ruins your experience, than you must be a old fart that doesn't like the kids to run thru their own lawn.

Kids laughing and running around brings the nostalgic part of going out to get Ice Cream back. Its a great place to bring families as they have plenty of room.

Avoiding kids at an Ice Cream shop is like trying to avoid kids at a candy or toy store....its not going to happen.

Van's Frozen Custard and Burgers is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! The sandwiches that we ordered (burger and chicken sandwich) used fresh ingredients and tasted delicious. The French fries are feshly cut and well seasoned. Oh wait...then there's the custard! I never knew you could take delicious custard and turn it into a shake, malt, or concrete mixer. All desserts are made to order by friendly staff. The prices are very reasonable. I can't wait to come back here!

We visited a short time after they opened at their new location on Main St. 

For starters, parking is a disaster.  There are 3-4 spots in front which are all but unusable since blindly backing out onto Main St. is a good way to get into a car accident.

Once you have the car parked, however, things take a dramatic turn for the better.  They did an excellent job with remodeling an old, run down building which housed several previously unsuccessful restaurants.  Essentially, everything looks brand new.  

I cannot comment on the food since we did not order any, but we did try a couple of sundae's and found them to be outstanding.  A bit on the pricey side, but well worth it.  The burgers that we did see looked very good.  

I do a lot of cycling in the summer and look forward to stopping in during the summer months when out for a ride.  It will certainly be a lot easier to find parking for a bike.

I personally don't think you can ever beat Dairy Queen in terms of a cold treat on a warm summer evening, but it is nice to have a new option in the downtown area right off the bike trail.

Fantastic place - order at the counter and they bring it out to you.  It's not fast food and is well worth he wait.  My double burger was huge (if I'd known, I might have gone with a single), juicy, hot, and there are lots of toppings to choose from.  They have other sandwiches, kid-friendly sides, and both regular and sweet potato fries.  

The real star is the custard - any other ice cream you ever eat will pale in comparison.  they always have vanilla and chocolate, plus a flavor of the day and non-dairy sorbet.  There are specialty sundaes or build your own with an abundant list of toppings.  I had the "Cow Tracks" - peanut butter cups, peanut butter sauce, hot fudge - and it was fantastic.  The "small" is generously-sized and would be a "medium" anywhere else.  I wish I lived closer so I could come more often, but I have family in the area so will definitely be back.  Service is friendly and it's a family-owned business.  They're kid friendly with toys and games while you wait.  There's limited outdoor seating and parking can be tricky ( a few places in front and on the side, with more in back).  It's right off the bike path if you're walking or riding...just a great "hometown place"!!

Love this place! Every time I come here I'm more than happy! Get the Candy Bar Parfait but make sure you ask for it with hot fudge instead of chocolate sauce. It's no longer on the menu but I promise they'll make it for you!!

Great addition to the community. An old fashion family owned business that goes that extra mile to make sure you are happy. The food is great, and the end to a perfect meal the ice cream is amazing. Daily specials, they even make a menu so you can check off when your favorite will be made.  The service couldn't be better and she always has a smile.... Truly an amazing family that definately found their calling!
I eat here multiple times each week.  The food is hot, the people are great, and I've never had a better dessert. Try dipping the bacon grilled cheese in the frozen chocolate custard.

I've been to many of the famous custard places like Kopps in Wisconsin and the legendary Ted Drewes in St Louis and I must say Van's is a gem.  Staff is very friendly,  they are VERY generous with the toppings and the Burgers are sooooo good.

YUM! YUM! AND YUM! A friend and I took advantage of the warm October weather and took a ride on our motorcycles. Hamburgers were in order so we decided to try Van's. The bacon cheeseburgers are greasy,  messy and decadent, but OH SO GOOD! I had a double. Be forewarned, it's a huge burger. A plethora of toppings can be had so don't go crazy with the additions or you won't be able to fit it in your mouth. I had a double bacon cheeseburger with mayo, grilled onions, grilled mushrooms and American cheese. What a way to go! I also had a large order of the fresh cut fries, so small unless you're sharing. I also had an espresso malted. Again, YUM! So many options and toppings for frozen treats. I highly recommend Van's for both frozen treats and the burgers. A bit pricey but after you try anything there you'll glad you did.

Great local business in East Dundee!  Nicely decorated, feels like a vacation destination.   Cookie Dough is the best.  Good burgers also.  Friendly service   Been here several times and never disappoints.

Van's has the best bacon cheeseburgers and fries around. The atmosphere is very low key and kid friendly and the food is reasonably priced.  You have to get the frozen custard to go (which is really good too) because you will not have the room after eating the burger and fries.

The place was empty,  I walked up to the counter and asked what custard flavors they had. The grumpy looking woman told me that they're on the chalk board and change every night.  I looked around and said what chalk board?  She pointed to the front of the restaurant.  I walk over and listed were vanilla, chocolate and Nutella (seriously, she couldn't have just told me that?). I turned around to go back to the counter and a big family had just walked in and gotten in line.  I like trying out new places but Van's Frozen Custard left me with a bad taste in my mouth before I even had a chance to try it.  For a "family run" business you'd think they would have friendly customer service.

They swear that the vanilla is the same, but it tasted much better.  Kopp's in Milwaukee is the gold standard, but this was the deal.  The real deal.  I have to give thanks that we have no custard places near our home.  I'd be a beached whale.
If you can find better burgers and custard, you should be searching for bigfoot and the Lochness Monster cuz this place is fantastic.

With a name like Van's Frozen Custard you'd think it's all about the frozen stuff, right?  

Well let me tell you about the burgers and fries...

Burger - well seasoned, nice crust on the outside from the griddle, high quality bacon and a decent amount of toppings (I got mushrooms, grilled onions, and bbq sauce).  Cooked through but still messy/juicy!  Not a thing to order when wearing a white top.  One burger could feed me and my 10yo daughter, but hey, I want leftovers for lunch!

On to the fries, they offer regular AND sweet potato!  They appear to be hand cut, and are cooked nice and crispy!  Yum, YUm, YUM!  A small order could feed two adults as a side, I'd be afraid to see what their large looks like.

Their custard and sorbet alone is worth a trip, but now I am SO glad there is a local place that takes their burgers as seriously as I do.

Why only 4 starts instead of 5?  Well the owner's wife came in when we were there with the three kids.  Two kids running around while she held the baby and watched everyone else working their asses off.  Kinda off putting to be honest.  It's a business and sorry to say I don't want anyone's kids running around the restaraunt while I'm trying to eat.  Hope it was a one off event.

Love this family owned, local business! The custard is SO creamy! My favorite is the blueberry crisp! Service is very friendly & I love that a side option for their burgers is frozen grapes! Burgers a juicy & fresh- which you must be patient for because, well, they're FRESH! Pricing is fair & plenty of seating- so glad they're on my way home from work!

Their frozen custard is really good! I highly recommend the Cow Tracks and Turtle Sundae. They also have very good burgers and sweet potato fries. Generous portions, reasonable prices and friendly service.

Didn't have the yogurt, but the burgers and fries are great!  The burgers are a good size with all the toppings you'd want, and the fries are delicious.  The large basket is easily enough for two people.

I like too that there's plenty of seating inside along with a couple tables outside.  I hope they fix up the outside a bit and make it a little more inviting.

"This place has great frozen custard. I don't like that the owners kids are running around everywhere the store. They are getting into everything behind the counter, the employees have to work around these kids. Being a parent myself it makes me nervous thinking these little kids are playing around a dangerous environment. Please leave home at home. Geez!!! Parking is terrible and the fact that they across the street from another store with almost the same product is weird that they chose this location. I would give a better rating but seeing that they need to focus on their kids more than their customers I only give 2 stars.

I love Vans! As someone who is lactose intolerant, I love the fact that Vans has a sorbet selection! I think this is a great alternative to the Dairy Queen across the street, and I like that there's both indoor and outdoor seating available!
The custard is delicious. Service and ambience is mediocre.

Really like their custard (just had the caramel apple and it was amazing) and their food.   I only gave 3 starts because of the service - it's very slow.  We went in there on a Sunday night around 7pm.  We stood in line for 5 minutes and ordered 2 burgers and fries.  It took us 25 minutes to get our food (to go).    Really hope they can speed it up - having 2 cash registers during busy times would help.    We would go their more often if we knew the service was quicker.
Really good custard and hot food!!! Super friendly service! Has that "mom and pop" feel.
Delicious custard! You can't go wrong. Food is pretty good, not great, but it is a super good price! Definitely try this custard!

My husband and I stopped by on a Friday evening. We were looking to try a new spot that was quick since we were on a time crunch. We ordered the shrimp and crabby burger along with fries and drinks. 

The shrimp and crabby burger were both delicious. I really enjoyed the crispy crunchiness of both. The fries tasted like normal fries BUT they had those cheese toppings and mayo dips. My favorite is the spicy mayo.

If you're looking for a super casual and quick burger joint this is your place! There are a variety of burgers which is very nice to have. I also want to note that the staff is very attentive and nice. I noticed the dipping sauce cups were all gone but one of the staff members refilled it within few minutes. 

I definitely want to come back and try their chicken wings and their signature burger!

Came here with high hopes but left disappointed. The Gabutto burger with cheese was nothing to write home about. It tasted like a run of the mill fast food burger. We got the spicy wings to share, which came lathered in a sweet(!) sauce. Worst of all, when we opened up the crab burger we thought they had forgotten the crab. It was a pathetic, flat little crab hidden under a pile of cabbage. You couldn't even taste the crab. The family next to us all ordered the crab burger and they got the same thing, which means this wasn't a one off incident. Terrible false advertising.

The only saving grace were the fries, which when combined with their selection of dry seasonings tasted pretty good. The bill came out to be just over $30 for these 4 items, which would have been fine had the food been any good.

The Gabutto Burger is super flavorful and juicy without being too greasy and the in-house baked buns taste incredible. I can't stress enough how much better the patty tastes over other fast casual burger options. The flavor is unique and if you find yourself in this part of the city, you owe it to yourself to wander over and give Gabutto Burger a shot.

Staff are friendly, attentive, and helpful.

I ate here tonight for dinner.  "Gabutto" is the sound you make when chomping or biting into something, in Japanese.
The inside is clean, colorful, and organized.  People who are fans of anime would take a liking to the interior.
I ordered the Gabutto burger w/cheese and fries and it came out to about $11.

Burger:
Soft, brioche style bun.  Meat was juicy.  Cheese was flavorful.  Each bite was delicious.

Fries:
Quality is a bit on the cheap side, but what's cool is they have a variety of seasonings you can  add yourself.  They purposely put the fries in a bag so you can add what you like and shake it up.  I chose the ranch and wasabi and it was good.  My friend added the garlic butter and that was tasty.

They have different condiments too, such as spicy mayo and wasabi mayo.  

The burger portion was a bit on the small side but they gave you a good amount of fries.  I probably could've eaten two burgers if I was really hungry, but besides that, this place offered great value and I would come back if I'm in the area.

I never had a chance to try this place while it was at Mitsuwa, so I was excited to hear they were opening a separate location! I love the concept of Japanese and American fusion foods! 

I came here on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't crowded at all but there were a few groups that were already seated. The walls and decor are bright and colorful, which set a fun, welcoming vibe. The place isn't very big, but there was plenty of seating area. 

This is more of a fast-food style restaurant, so the menu is up at the top and you place your order with the cashier in the front. The menu is easy to read and navigate. I ordered the soft shell crab burger and carbonara wings. 

Soft Shell Crab Burger: DELICIOUS! Lightly fried, very crispy, and nicely seasoned. I added some spicy mayo for an extra kick-- it was amazing! I had my eye on the shrimp patty burger as well, but I'm glad I ordered this one. 

Carbonara Wings: So, there was a mixup with the cashier and she actually put in the order with sauce on the side. I'm really glad she did. I'm not sure why it didn't click to me that carbonara is literally carbonara sauce, as in the pasta. It wasn't bad, but it just caught me off guard! The wings by itself were large and had a nice crisp breading. Wasn't oily at all! I'd order this again. 

I'd definitely come back. Next time, I'm willing to try a burger with the rice patty and order fries. I noticed there were many seasoning flavors you can add.. really cool!

Since Gabutto Burger closed at Mitsuwa, I've anxiously awaited (and staked their IG) for the opening of their new stand alone location. They have an extensive burger menu, a few wings options, interesting sides/soups and some tasty fries.

Yesterday was opening day! I have to say everything was running quite smoothly, service was great, food was good - just a very pleasant opening for Gabutto Burger! The only disappointment was that the Carbonara fries and wings which sounded cool & different were not available.

My best bud and I shared an order of fries, a Gabutto burger with cheese, and the BBQ Pork Rice Burger $6.95. The owner (I am assuming? or maybe manager?) was so sweet and accommodating! She was walking around and thought our fries looked too well done and made a completely fresh order for us! What a kind gesture...and I thought the 'overcooked' fries were just fine but appreciated the attention to detail! She also gave us opening day coasters, woohoo!

The fries were tasty and the various saucy dips made it fun (wasabi mayo, spicy mayo and ketchup) - I liked the spicy mayo best! They also have seasonings for the fries which seemed really cool and again, fun flavors, but honestly we tried 4 and didn't think they made much flavor difference to the fries.

The Gabutto Cheeseburger was good, but nothing over the top amazing. I really enjoyed the BBQ Pork Rice Burger. It was unique and edgy but incredibly messy to eat. The buns are made of rice and it kind of all collapsed after my first bite. However, the flavors in the bbq pork and how the meat was cooked was just perfect. I loved how the flavoring of the pork seeped into the rice, nomzzzz. I'd get this again but be prepared with a fork next time. 

Ah yes, they were blasting baby metal when we went in. That was hilarious. Cute, casual decor, good food, and great service made for a lovely time at Gabutto Burger and I wish them the best in Rolling Meadows! This could be a good option to grab & take to Bigby's right around the corner.

Finally!!!

They have awesome burgers that are Japanese catered. They used to be at the Mitsuwa Japanese market and it was good there. They finally have their own standalone space and it's perfectly located next to Starbucks on golf.

They have teriyaki burgers, wasabi burgers and love the fries with the ability to add your own flavors on the fries.  They also have really good wings

This place is right across the way from where  I work so I had been meaning to stop in for lunch. I finally made it over there and I purchased the Gabutto Cheeseburger. It shows on a visual all of the ingredients that come on each item. They had a signature glaze of sorts they put on their burgers. I really enjoyed it. Plus the Frittos (fries) are served piled high in the bag, so get if you get a regular you will have PLENTY of them. 
Oh! my favorite part...all the dipping sauces for the Frittos. The Spicy Mayo (like you get when your order Sushi) was delicious! There were several more, but I just love spicy mayo.  I'm trying the teriyaki burger next :)

Not bad but too much hype for what it is... Teriyaki sauce on a mediocre patty with minimal fixings and shitty shoe-string fries- the worst kind. 

All the crap-flavored powders don't help justify the high prices and limited offerings.

The mayos are rather bland as far as flavored mayos go but do serve their purpose to help down the fries before they cool off and harden only to destroy your gum line.

The decor is cheesy Japaneesy and rather tiny. Orange and yellow are quite bright and nauseating.

The big coke fusion machine is crapola but the youngsters dig it.

I'll stick the brewed iced tea. 

If you like an Asian flare to your crappy fast-food, you'll probably love this place.

It was much better suited in the food court at Matsuwa Market because that's the caliber they deliver.

I was so eager to see this joint open but am sorely disappointed.

the professionalism of the employees was astonishing! food was tasty, delightful, and defiantly made me want to keep coming back for more! fabulous group of employees at this burger joint and couldn't have been happier!

Best burger I have ever had !!! 
Great Concept for food 
Amazing sauce selection for the fries
Staff was great

Been here 3 times now. I loved the pork burger with thr rice patties. The shrimp burger was good. The soft shell crab burger was good but small for the price. But the sauces and fries and wings are amazing! It is a clean place and the staff is extremely friendly. I highly reccomend going here! The restrooms are clean and have funny decor too!

Hi thanks for your response! Actually I later find out it's because somehow the order fell through, duplicate order number. The staff was very responsive when we inquired about it, and even refunded our money, but still made the order later! I would definitely come back because of friendly staff and delicious burgers.

I don't understand what all the hubbub is with this place. I'll give it props for trying. 
The burgers are lack luster at best. Everything lacks seasoning and blah. Might be due to a guidance of seasoned mayos.
I asked for their signature burger just to get the wow factor. Still looking for that wow factor. 
Interesting decor. PVC pipe made to look industrial.

I went on a Sunday afternoon and was really busy but worth the wait! I ended up getting the regular Gabutto Burger with cheese. The burger was a mix of beef and pork. For the most part, this seems like your standard burger but the demi-sauce was what gave it the twist. I'm not sure what the sauce was but it tasted like a blend of bbq sauce and teriyaki sauce. The fries here are good as well. Shoe string fries with various spices you can put on top. I'll definitely be returning!

FUN youthful place! really enjoyed my burger! Fries with seasoning I did not get to try but I'll bet it's really tasty. I had the burger/fries/drink & a lobster bisque. A bit pricey considering I could have had sushi at either of two (awesome)  places nearby for about the same cost. A fast food place with quick turnover seating (uncomfortable) needs to do a little better on price.

While the amazing Chicken Curry Naan Burger that was carried at their previous location is a thing of the past (sadface), many fantastic options have come into play to replace it: want Korean barbecue in a burger? Coming right up!  Excellent fries with amazing flavors drizzled over them?  You got it!  This place is still definitely worth a stop.

Gabutto burger is back and better than ever! The new location is adorably decorated with new burger mascots and the "deconstructed menu" they have behind the counter makes you wanna try all the burgers and sandwiches! The burgers are very good! Even something I never would have expected to like (the shrimp burger) was very delicious with a satisfying crunch that went well with the condiments and bun! The rice burgers were a little messy to eat but the rice patties were strangely addicting with an interesting texture! I cannot wait to come back and try more!!! I especially can't wait for the stuffed pancakes!!!

Horrible service. My wife and I went there for the first time tonight and we were disappointed at their lack of professionalism and customer service. When we first went in, no one greeted us. My husband, as he usually does, greeted the cashiers and asked "how are you." Neither of them acknowledged us. We placed our order and as we were waiting, we noticed that one of the cashiers was behind the counter eating out of a bag of fries after they were playing a game to see which bag of fries was hers. For a second, we were hoping she was not eating out of our order of fries -- she wasn't. Nonetheless, our number was called and our food was placed on the counter. We went up to retrieve it and did not get so much as a "thank you" or "have a good evening." The guy was turned around facing the kitchen as soon as we went up to the counter -- and it wasn't even busy. It was our first visit and definitely our last. We get better customer service at McDonald's. We are a young couple but even we recognize the importance of customer service and just being a polite person.
Fast casual concept. Very creative fusion. Portions are large and everything tastes fresh. Highly recommend it.
Good burgers.  Nice to try something different.  Crabby burger good but a bit fishy tasting.  I know, it IS fish, but the taste was too strong.  Enjoyed having a burger with a twist.
Gabutto Burger with cheese was good. Fries are good. Wasabi sauce for fries has a kick. Spicy mayo sauce for fries is a little more tame. Liked it!

We are officially on the TLs bandwagon and we still haven't even gone there.

Is Delivery still expensive?  Yes, but the food is pretty darn tasty.  Plus, we were able to have leftovers last time ;)

This review is for sushi only. I eat at this restaurant 1 to 2 times a month. Typically I'm ordering delivery. About every other month I eat inside the restaurant. 

My favorite sushi dish is tuna Maki, TL's tuna can be hit or miss.  Sometimes when I order it's really fresh other times it has a fish taste which to me says old. I thought that it had to do with the time of week I bought. However there's no consistency with it as I've tracked it. 

The very first time I ever ordered delivery I had a lobster Maki roll, it was horrible and I never ordered it again. As far as price goes they are on par with the other sushi places in Bartlett, if you go outside of Bartlett you're going to find cheaper. However they are the only place that delivers to my house.

I highly recommend the Chicago fire roll and the Sakura roll. Those are my two favorite rolls. TL's is not well known for their variety in rolls, I would suggest going to Tokyo steakhouse if you want a wide breadth of sushi rolls. 

They are still my go to place for sushi because of the area I live in. Also their delivery service is awesome. Never once has a delivery person forgotten something or given me the wrong thing. 

I have also never had an issue when ordering, they always get my order right over the phone no matter who I'm talking to.

The three stars really comes down to the quality of the fish and the inconsistency with that quality based on my week to week experience.

Ordered from here today. Found on yelp. Was hesitant to order from here because although it has great reviews I wanted orange chicken and none of the reviews mentioned it. They just talked about the sushi. My husband still convinced me to give them a shot. 
We got our food delivered. They said it would come in about an hour, but it actually came in 25 min so that was cool. 
Orange chicken was terrible to me. I'm not a fan of it at all. My husband said it was ok. I prefer my orange chicken crispier. My husband ordered vegetable fried rice. It was terrible to me as well. Had a weird after taste to me , but my hubby thought that it was tasty. Also ordered crab Rangoon. It was really good. I actually really enjoyed that but because my entree wasn't the best I'm still only giving 2 stars. I'm not a big sushi eater so I won't be ordering from here again. If I was I would try the things everyone else is recommending.

Not worth driving more than 5 miles to eat. This food would be good Chinese delivery if I was in the area but Chinese was just mediocre and we ordered a selection of 4 plates to choose from, chicken, beef, scallops, and combination Chow Fun. Sushi over all is bland and poorly executed wouldn't order sushi ever again from here.

Whether you are planning on taking out or eating in this place is the best if you are craving Chinese food! 

There have been plenty of times where I've ordered food here and was told a specific time and they are really on par when it comes to your food being ready to go at that time. You can tell that they planned it out perfectly because your food is still hot and fresh when you pick up. 

Dining in is a great experience as well. The staff is extremely friendly and offer great suggestions if you aren't quite sure what to eat. The portions are family style which makes this place a perfect spot for a group. Definitely try their special drinks. Once you try one, you will be hooked because they are extremely delicious!

We ordered our food over the phone this is the first time we had been here we had ordered for pickup....beef fried rice,shrimp fried rice these both came with a spring roll and soup for a lunch special and also we ordered crab rangoons...Our food was ready when we got there in 10 minutes hot and fresh! I'd like to go back and try their sushi next time....

This is my family's all time favorite Japanese/Chinese spot. They never seem to disappoint in food or service. The owners and managers always recognize us now that's how often we come in. Last night the manager sat us, and then proceeded to tell us all about his travels to Hong Kong, it was so sweet! 

I've had almost everything on the menu and it's all good. A few of my families favorites are the chow fun noodles, dry chili chicken or beef, nabayaki udon, and the garlic scallops. The appetizers, sushi, and soups are also great- the best we've found in the burbs. Their wonton soup serves about 2 people, it's a huge amount of delicious pork wontons and lots of veggies.

I really can't recommend this place enough if you're passing through Bartlett. It's the best!
The Chinese food there it's delicious for an actually Chinese for sure. Restaurant it's nice and clean. If you looking for some real Chinese food around the area. This is the place to go.

My favorite sushi place by far. I'm a regular and go about every other week. Some of my favorite rolls are Godzilla roll, TL's Sakura roll (when u remove most of the mayo on top), and tempura roll. The service is great and so is the atmosphere. I highly recommend.

3.5 stars. Been here several times now. Used to work in a sushi restaurant, so I have a high standard for sushi. That being said, the sushi here is okay at best. 

What to order:

Mussels: (each plate comes with 4) 

Black pepper garlic beef: very tasty, some pieces are very fatty. 

Hand grenades: two pieces, not necessarily a roll. Each piece is served on top of a slice of orange and shrimp. Served warm. 

Mongolian beef: is a good choice as well and served as a good size

Basil garlic chicken was also tasty

Snapper: I talked to the table next to mine, they say that the snapper is very good, though I cannot confirm.


The egg drop soup could be better. I don't recommend ordering that. 

Atmosphere: nicely decorated with a bar and a sushi bar. 

Reservations must be made before 5 pm.

I've been to TL's once since I've lived nearby. I had the red snapper dish and it was very delicious. I'll need to return t update the review. The atmosphere was very cozy and quite small. Staff was very helpful in ordering our food and serving us. If you're looking to try a new dining experience, give the a try. They also serve decent sushi and Chinese!
