SHOCKED that this place has 4 stars. TERRIBLE food, their sushi is sub par, there is definitely better sushi elsewhere, servers can't understand what you're saying, so you can forget about modifying your food to your liking. 

Menu descriptions aren't accurate.. AND their #1 selling dish tasted like fast food, you're better off going to Panda Express. Left hungry since my order came out wrong after many people came to ask how i wanted it... I ordered an entree and i received a broth mess served with a soup spoon.

waste of time and money.

This is not all you can eat sushi. I even called the front desk and she said it was. Got there and it wasn't. Don't put someone to answer phones if they don't understand you. Plain and simple. Super irritated that's why it gets one.

Never disappoints. Both Japanese and Chinese dishes are outstanding. Great place to have lunch as prices are more reasonable. Sushi always fresh too. If you can't decide, try Bento box, a little bit of this and that. Same staff been around for many years which sign that they love working there. Gets really busy during dinner rush but they do take reservations.  Dishes al aye so artfully presented too.

As for the sushi, you can definitely get cheaper in other, smaller little shops in the area with quality just as fine.
Most Chinese or Japanese restaurants are pretty indistinct when it comes to the meals they offer. The entrees and appetizers are really what makes this place stand out. And soups! It they start offering fresh ramen I think I'd eat here every meal, but they still offer more and unique soups than you can typically find elsewhere.
I usually get the soups when I order take-out. I also love the Chirashi bowl. Don't be afraid to try appetizers and entrees you've never heard of, because they're all good. My current favorite is TL's Snapper. The fish is battered and fried and served in a very sweet and flavorful sauce. I also really like the mapu tofu, which is moderately spicy. The fish soup that I always forget the name of is also QUITE spicy. But do yourself a favor and don't just get boring typical fare.
I can't say enough about this place!! I would give it 6 stars if it were possible! All ingredients are fresh and the sushi is amazing in presentation and taste!

Great experience getting take out from TL's. We got orange chicken and chicken fried rice. They were very tasty, with standard serving sizes. The price was fair for chinese food, approx ~$23. We didn't have to wait at all, the food was ready right on time. Will visit again.

Best kept secret in Bartlett (unless you are going in on a Friday or Saturday night!)
Quality Sushi and unique Chinese dishes! The TL's snapper is a must!
Place is a little pricey but the overall quality is good. If you're looking for fusion food in the area, this is the best you'll get.

Bartlett struggled to develop strong restaurants downtown until TL's arrived on the scene around a decade ago.   This restaurant sets the tone for Asian fusion in the region with a nice mix of sushi, Thai, and Chinese.   The owner, Sean, is usually around the restaurant and adds the personal touch that is missing at many restaurants.  The fish is very fresh, being picked up at O'Hare daily.   Our favorite menu options are the black pepper beef and the TL Snapper.

We almost missed the place because their sign outside was quite small but glad we didn't because I would have missed out on some great sushi! 

We ordered the calamari for starters which were gladly not overly-salted and had the right amount of crisp and flavor. 

It was lunchtime so most of the menu items were half-priced compared to the dinner menu with the exception of sushi if I'm not mistaken.

We got the volcano roll, bbq eel, dragon roll, and orange dream roll. Bbq eel was okay, the dragon roll and volcano were excellent, but my favorite would have to be the orange dream roll. It was awesome and I highly recommend it! 

I am yet to come back and try their lunch bento boxes!  The table right next to us ordered them. They looked amazing, the portions were ample, and seemed reasonably-priced. Can't wait to come back!
I love the location. I love the decor. The servers are kind and fast. I've never had an issue here. Sushi is always fresh and on point!

This place has been excellent since the first time I came out here. The service, eh, ok. The food is great though. Never disappoints in food and the owners are very nice people. I should tell you that take out is very good, and the food still tastes like in restaurant service. The garlic scallops and all the sushi are fantastic! The portions are huge, and you will be fed until you're full. 

Bartlett has many fantastic food places in this area specifically. I suggest you go to downtown Bartlett and try them out!

Started with the potstickers and the scallops for appetizers. I liked the scallops more, they come in a delicious mushroom broth. Ordered the "spicy trio" for lunch (spicy salmon, spicy tuna, spicy crab rolls). Beautiful display, fresh fish. Also ordered the shrimp pad Thai and the honey glazed chicken---both were delicious and came with an egg roll. Lots of food! Great prices. Clean, comfortable atmosphere.. Will definitely be coming back.

This restaurant is so good for what it's supposed to be for, the Sichuan delicacy. I have been going there even though I live in the northwest suburbs, that's how good it is. I ordered Mapo Tofu with fish, dried chili chicken, spicy pork belly. I swear I gulped down the Mapo Tofu all by myself (the portion resemble any good old Chinese plates served). You can also ask them to tone down the spice a bit.

The staff is AWESOME. The food is fresh and fantastic. I can't say enough great things about TL's.
A must vist restaurant in Bartlett.

Not sure what everyone is raving about.  Maybe I need to try the sushi.  Because the Chinese food we tried was way below average.  Will give them one more chance.  My expectations must have been way too high.

Not really sure what all the fuss is about. While there wasn't anything wrong with the food, it wasn't all that special, and the portions were a bit small. On top of that, the vegetables served in my Kung Pao dish were huge. I would have gladly cut them up myself, yet we only got forks and spoons, no knives. Why would you deny me a knife yet give me half a green pepper in my dish? Am I being punked? On top of that the consistency of the chicken was just odd. 

Overall this place is underwhelming. I'm just glad we came at lunch time since the food is overpriced, but even more so on the dinner menu. In any case, we don't plan on returning.

Really awesome Sichuan style Chinese food! We started with the potstickers which were tasty especially with the chili oil.  I loved the dry chili chicken and the black peppered garlic beef. The portions are generous and fair for the price and quality. I have found my new favorite Chinese restaurant in the burbs! I will be back for sure!

Loved this little find. Sake flights are a great idea. The sushi is top notch and reasonably priced. The service is very quick, efficient, and expertly performed. If you've been to Japan and you miss the sushi, ypu won't be dissapointed here!

Went here with my hubby because our favorite sushi place is closed on Sunday's but it was a pleasant surprise! 

We got some signature rolls (definitely get the kamikaze and the volcano is awesome too), edamame, and we were still hungry so we ordered some chicken lo mein and crispy sesame beef and all were awesome! We ordered just enough to have left overs and not feel like we over ate. 

We will definitely be back, especially since it's 5 minutes from our house!

I eat here all the time (dine in, delivery, take out). I pretty much survive on their orange dream sushi roll. I'm a huge fan of spicy and that roll is absolutely divine (the paper thin jalapeno on top adds a perfect amount of heat). I don't normally gravitate toward cooked rolls, but their Chicago Fire roll is magnificent. Looking at it, it you wouldn't put a lot of stock in it (it is rice-less and looks quite a bit different from standard sushi rolls), but give it a chance.Don't let the "fire" in the name and the chili oil ingredient deter you! It is very mild. I think I've tried every roll on the menu now, you cannot go wrong! Best sushi place in the area.

I really can't say anything about this place other then the man on the phone basically told me to go fornicate myself.  
I got in the mail a menu with a big sentence that read "We deliver to you" with my address on it.  I live 10 min away in the same town.  I got home from work today tired as hell not in the mood to sit down and eat and me and my family really wanted sushi.  I got together an $85 order and called them up.  
The gent started taking my order then in the middle of it asked where I lived I told him, he rudely said "IM NOT DELIVERING TO YOU THATS TO FAR... GOOD NIGHT!" 
So needless to say I placed an online order for Tokyo Steakhouse on 59, and got 15% off just for placing an online order.  This was farther then I wanted but I was so pissed at this place I decided to go there...it was great.  
Next time don't send menus out if you don't intend to deliver.

I don't know what people are talking about when they don't rate this place 5 stars. This is my go-to restaurant with amazing fresh sushi. Everybody is nice, authentic, and a perfect little Chinese restaurant
It's alright I had less expensive before they are over priced and not that friendly.  My husband loved the crunchy garlic shrimp but last time he had it he said it didn't taste as good.

This place is hit or miss.  The delivery service is usually slow.  The waiters are hard to understand and the food sometimes comes out cold.  The sushi is the saving grace here.  The hot dishes are over priced for what you get.  The location is good, but parking is a hassle do to it being in the downtown area.
This place is very nice inside, so if you like ambiance this place has it for a casual restaurant.  The food is very good as well.  Nice to be able to order sushi or Chinese.

TL's is my FAVORITE takeout sushi place! Their sushi is always fresh and super tasty! My family and I order from there at least 3 times a month! I highly, highly recommend any of their spicy rolls. Their spicy crab is my favorite. Also, their Chinese food selection is wonderful. We always get their combo LoMein!

Delicious food. Very busy place. Make reservations ahead of time. Sushi is the best.
Thai food is very too.
Very good and fresh sushi! Great Chicken Pad Thai. Definitely would go back for more!

One of my all time favorite resurants for asian fusion.  Best flavors and good sushi.  Luncheon menu is good and half the price of dinner. Service is prompt and the mnager checks in to make sure that you are happy with your meal.

Enjoy their sushi. Get the Chicago Fire roll and Spicy crab roll every time.

Also love the szechuan green beans. 

Not a fan of egg rolls and soups.

I always get take out.  The sushi is my most favorite ever.  I also love the scallion pancakes and HIGHLY RECOMMED the TL snapper (red snapper).  This meal is a bit pricy but it is 4 hunks of fish so it really feeds 2.  SO GLAD this place exists in Bartlett; good food is limited here.

I love me some sushi, and TL does it as well as any sushi place I've ever been to! I came here with a group of folks and we split a wide array of rolls, and fortunately I managed to get my chopsticks on each kind.  Highly recommend the Godzilla roll and the Chicago Fire roll.  There was also a roll called Snow White which was the evening special but hopefully they offer it regularly because it was money!  They use fresh ingredients in the rolls and they are very well put together.  We also enjoyed the edamame and the veggie tempura.  

If sushi isn't your thang, there are plenty of other options ranging from Chinese to Japanese to Thai.  I can't speak for those dishes as I did not taste them, but if the sushi is any indication of the quality of the rest of the dishes then I think you'll be just fine.  You'll also find a good cocktail menu and a great variety of Asian beers.  

I have nothing but good things to say about this awesome little spot in downtown Bartlett.  It's well worth venturing out!

You'll find better places in the city, but not out here. Great food, reasonable prices, good ambience. You can dine in and they do considerable amount of takeout. Sushi and Chinese dishes are most prominent. Have a full sit down bar, sushi bar, and ample seating. Right next to the tracks in downtown Bartlett. Wait staff is very attentive.

Used to be a great place. The smell of chlorine bleach the past month or so made me suspicious, but the great tasting food made me overlook that fact. The last straw was the water that had a foul taste to it, and the replacement glass of water that was the same. Never going back.

Great place for sushi. Prices are a little higher then normal, BUT seeing it's hidden in downtown Bartlett , and the place is huge and you wouldn't expect the size when you are outside. They have enough food here to adapt to any tastes you have.

Me and my girl visit this spot whenever we're in the area, and every experience has been good.  There were a couple times when we had complaints, but they fixed it immediately and didn't give us any problems.  We usually get the Sakura roll and the JB roll, and try out different appetizers and entrees each time we visit.  There are some dishes that aren't as worthy of the price, but most have been tasty and well portioned.  Our new favorite entree is the Shanghai scallops.  What a tasty dish!  
The servers are usually very attentive and take care of us well.  We never feel rushed, even when the restaurant is packed to the brim.  Water refills are never a problem.  I can't think of anything but praise for the service team, and we make sure to give them fat tips each time.
Try this place out if you haven't yet!
Good over all, nothing makes me to excited about it though.

You see, you know how to *take* the reservation, you just don't know how to *hold* the reservation. And that's really the most important part of the reservation: the holding. Anybody can just take them.

Made reservations.  Showed up at the restaurant and our table was not ready.  When asked how long our wait was the hostess told us she didn't know and that the large crowd in the waiting room was ahead of us and also had reservations.  What's the point of making a reservation at this place?  We were finally seated after 1.5 hours waiting at the bar.  The owner/manager came over and asked if we paid the bar tab.  Did he offer to pick up any of it..........  Of course not.  Sure we'll sit here and spend more money at your place wasting our time because you have no clue how to take reservations.

If you are a Seinfeld fan you much watch the episode called the Chinese restaurant from season 2.  This was our experience except we did eat eventually.

The food was good and the waiter was ok though a little goofy.  

We made it out by 11 (7:30 reservations). Good thing we didn't have a post dinner event to attend.  

As we walked out we were hoping for a thanks for coming or a sorry for the wait.  We received neither.  So in summary the food is good, the delivery is suspect and the owner/manager has no management skills.

There's plenty of good Chinese/sushi restaurants out there we'll be giving our business to someone else.  An apology and some gratitude at a bare minimum goes a long way.

THE BEST! We have become regulars here and wish we would have tried this place sooner! We had heard about it from several people and live very close to it. The service is phenomenal and the food is exceptional! It's a lively atmosphere and always busy. There is a large drink menu featuring several different options--all very good. The menu caters to a variety of tastes! There are Chinese options, Japanese options, and sushi! The workers are all very friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have a great experience every time. I would recommend this place to everyone!!! One of THE BEST!!!! We always request Noy, one of the waitresses. She is so knowledgeable about the menu and one of the best waitresses we've ever had! She always takes such good care of us and has exceptional customer service skills!!

Love TL's for sushi. They also have Chinese and Japanese food. Eat in, carry out, delivery. Prefer to eat in, seems they skimp a little with delivery. Nice atmosphere. Parking can be a little tricky on Fridays and Saturdays.

This place use to be so good.   I don't know what happened.  The service is horrible now and the food doesn't taste the same anymore.   Well the Chinese food there has gone downhill but the sushi is still great.

Amazing, I can't say enough about this place.  Having moved from downtown Chicago, I was used to really good cuisine from various nationalities.  TL's is my go to sushi & Chinese/Japanese food place.  They are a bit pricey, but worth it to me and my family.  I love their location and enjoy that it's well within walking distance.  The Dragon Roll reigns supreme with me, but also love their Orange Peel Chicken and literally everything else I've ever ordered whether in the restaurant or for delivery/takeout.

Perfect take out Chinese food. Large portions and great prices. Food is good. Not amazing but good enough to eat here once a week.

Guest post from my wife. Note: I did not use their bathroom.

I think I have dined here twice before, but I do not recall the first time since it was so long ago. Second time though, I dined at lunch time. I have read the reviews here regarding bad service, and I am a stickler about service. Fortunately, I did not experience horrible service. In fact, my Asian waiter was pretty attentive! I was impressed because there are a lot of "Asian" establishments out there that could use some customer service training, amongst other restaurants that aren't "Asian" as well though. But to be fair, this could be a cultural thing that some may not understand or realize. 

The sashimi was good and fresh, and the soft shell crab was to die for!! They certainly do not skimp on that appetizer dish! That is major points for them on that because other restaurants I have experienced, only serves dinky pieces of the whole soft shell crab! 

I rate this restaurant 4 stars for now since I only recalled my one dining experience here. Future visits are planned, and I will revise as necessary.
Terrible sushi. Go anywhere but here. The Chinese food is alright, but the sushi is complete garbage.
Fantastic sushi and chinese food. The best in the area! The owner goes out of his way to make every diner happy.

Never again.  My first experience with this place was entirely sushi related.  I would compare the quality to that of a gas station.  However, they go the extra mile by insuring that the sushi is falling apart and warmed up (because its steaming together with the soup when the delivery driver brought it).  I accepted the fact that this is probably more of a Chinese than Japanese establishment.

Given my first experience, my second encouter was all Chinese food.  My roommate and I ordered the General Tao's dinner combo.  Egg roll was bad (probably frozen),  Miso soup lacked flavor, and the chicken was worse.  Both me and my roommate discovered that almost every morsel of battered chicken contained some form of chicken joint.  We lost our appetite after the first few bites and fed the remains to the garbage can.  Just Don't.

Prices are comparable to a decent sushi place but the quality is pretty low. We ordered delivery. I would have preferred sushi from whole foods. My fiance got the spicy trio. He said the tuna was not good at all. It was basically the fish, the rice, seaweed and crunchy toppings. It was missing something. I wanted to get basic before I spent $145 on a roll so I ordered the California roll and miso. It was mushy and my miso had a strange taste. I would not go back.

I have been here a number of times and have never had a bad experience. The sushi is still the best that I have had. I have had a number of the dishes and like how they will customize the level of spiciness to your taste. The hot and sour soup is a favorite of mine as is the Crab Rangoon. Wait staff is wonderful and I have never had a bad experience with any server. Prices are reasonable. I have brought a number of friends and family here and every single person has enjoyed the food and the experience.

I'm not really sure what everyone seems to be raving about. It's not bad. It's not good. Spend a dollar or two more and go to yu's mandarin in schaumburg.
There is no small or large size here so singles... you're screwed money-wise.
I am obsessed with everything seafood on this menu! Awesome service and cozi atmosphere.
Amazing food. I take my kids here very often.

I want to be able to give this place 5 stars because their food is THAT good!!  However, I can't do it.  Their service is AWFUL!!  Out of 4 times I have been here (both dine-in and carry out) they have forgotten things, mixed up orders, forgotten food, etc.)  

We keep going back because the food is SO good and SO fresh...but that's when you actually get what you order...

There have been times when we did pickup, and they completely forgot two entrees that we paid for (and then didn't answer when we called back).  They gave us some completely different dish than the mongolian beef we ordered.  None of us could eat it because it was too spicy.  

And when we dined in, OH MY GOSH.  I don't know what we did to our waiter to make him hate us, but he had some serious attitude.  It changed when the (separate) bills came, and it was time to tip, but it was Too Little Too Late at that point.  He needed to be reminded to bring drinks and about ordered drinks more than three times EACH drink.  He was bringing our food out in shifts (one person got their food 20 minutes after everyone else, and was STARVING).  He even brought me the wrong food and got mad when I asked for the shrimp that I actually ordered...

I would probably never dine in again.  I just wish the food wasn't so great--then I could write this place off completely!!

This place was a complete surprise for me. Bartlett is one of the last places I'd expect to find an excellent Chinese restaurant. Like other restaurants that have done well in the Top 100 Chinese Restaurants Competition, the authentic Chinese food is amazingly good but the Americanized food is only passable (in my opinion). The food here reminds me a bit of iChef in Hoffman Estates in style but more like Lao Sze Chuan in Chinatown in terms of execution. I don't recall seeing this restaurant in the Zagat Guide, but based on what I've tried so far, I'd probably give them a 24.

The Chongqing Style Noodle Soup is definitely something you should try if you love nice hot soup that's not excessively strong in flavor. They are very generous with the amount of whitefish they give you as we were able to make 8 fully loaded small bowls with cellophane noodles and fish with the amount of soup given to us. The mustard greens were not extremely strong in flavor but just strong enough where I noticed them. They can make this non-spicy but spicy soup is amazingly nice in the winter time.

The Honey Sesame Crispy Beef had a nice flavor to it, but the texture wasn't quite as tender as I would have liked it to be. My problem though could be that I compared everyone's version of this dish to Sun Shui's Crispy Szechuan Beef and that's why I feel disappointed with everyone else's version. The egg roll was okay but nothing special.

This was not on the menu, but we had them make Cantonese-style ginger and scallion red snapper fillets. This was a really nice variation of a popular dish that was perfectly balanced with a strong flavor and not too much salt. The excellent execution of this dish makes me want to try the Chendu Snapper and Spicy Chili Fish next time.

The Beef Chow Fun (Gon Chao Ngau Ho style) was one of the best I've had outside Chinatown. It had a strong onion flavor to it and beef that was seared to slightly crispy on the edges. It wasn't excessively oily like most of the versions I run across and had just the right amount of salt to be noticeable but not overbearing.

Their Cumin Lamb (Zi Ran Yang Rou) was excellently done with a strong flavor of onion and peppers and lamb that was cooked to a nice tender texture without being overdone and slightly crispy on the edges. I don't even like cumin but the dish was so excellently executed I couldn't stop eating it.

I wish I'd taken pictures of the authentic Chinese menu since it's not on their website. Like other highly rated Chinese restaurants, that menu is where you'll really find the hidden treasures the restaurant offers.

The four star average for reviews on the date this review is being written is, in my opinon, fairly accurate.  Pros and cons of this restaurant are as follows:

PROS
- they serve both Chinese and Japanese food so if you go in a group, there's a higher probability everyone will be pleased.  It's rare to find a restaurant like this
- both Chinese and Japanese food are good which is even rarer
- Big sushi/rolls menu and it's good quality.  Prices are decent for sushi, which is a bit too expensive but that's just my opinion about sushi prices in general
- Lunch bento boxes are a very good deal.  Lots of food (choice of meat, rice, salad, tempura veggies, 3 california rolls) for less than most places (~$8).  Very good as well
- Chinese dishes are somewhat "fusion"-like, not really authentic but very good
- Nice family atmosphere.  Nothing fancy but nice enough interior to take someone on a date

CONS
- Chinese dishes are, on average, very salty.  They really load up the salt.  Can be unbearable unless you tell them to put less salt or eat it with rice.  An example is the garlic chicken.  Very good but very salty
- One time we ordered bento boxes for takeout and they didn't give us tempura veggies.  We called them and they said they don't give out tempura veggies for takeout.  I thought this was idiotic because that means we're paying the same amount of money for less food.  This was years ago and I told them I'd never go back.  I finally went back after many years, but just avoid ordering out bento boxes from them.  Not sure if they've changed their policy on the take out orders for bento boxes

I'd say that about sums it up.  Good restaurant.

I come here a lot because it's so close.  I have to say that I REALLY like the sushi.  It always tastes fresh.  The food isn't bad either.  I've ordered a few times for delivery and they are always fast and the food always tastes fresh.  It is a little on the pricey side, but not so much that I wouldn't eat here as often as I do.

It's time for an update. We are definitely regulars at TL's and for good reason...  The food is good!  

The restaurant is clean and the service is prompt. We have waited for 20-30 minutes for a table on occasion, but for a local spot, I'm okay with that. That's probably my only real 'complaint' - I wish there were more tables in a larger dining area. The space is a little cramped and they are always busy. But it's worth the wait. Everyone that we have brought here has enjoyed their meals and most have come back with and even without us. I think TL's does a lot of things right. 

Things like the chicken lo mein and the crispy spicy shrimp are seasoned with an expert hand. The portions are large. We always have leftovers for lunch the next day. 

Seriously, I'm starting to think that they are gaining a little local fame as they have a huge billboard on Route 59 and they are hopping on most nights. Stop in and see what the fuss is all about.

Magnificent rainbow roll & the crispy coconut shrimp appetizer is to die for. I live in Miami and frequent many establishments that serve sushi. This quaint place was quite a wonderful surprise. Would have given 5 stars, but no hot tea available the day we went :(

We ordered trays of food for a family celebration. we had 7 dishes: scallion pancakes, tray of sushi, seawead salad, fried rice, honey sesame beef, pork with chives and bokchoy. All summed up to be almost 600 dollars in total. Not too bad, cos the aluminum trays that the food were in were twice the regular size. Plus they also gave us complimentary white rice:) 

Everything was alright except for the crispy honey sesame beef that was supposed to be "crispy". the beef was chewy and can hardly be bitten into. I think the cut of the meat had something to do with it.

My mom loves this place, so when I visit her, we usually go here. It has good atmosphere and drinks always come quickly. Service is always nice and quick. I usually go for the sushi but I have tried quite a lot of their dishes. I like there spicy tuna and the spicy crab. The volcano, spider, tempura rolls are good, as well. The crab rangoon is very crisp and delicious. The lo mein options are the best "off the sushi" menu options. Pricing is good.
We come here all the time.  Sushi and grilled red snapper are my favorites here.  Great service too!

The only place I'd be happy just ordering any of their Chinese fried rice outside of Chinatown.. I mean, really. Who raves about fried rice?! But it's not just the fried rice. The food, both Japanese and Chinese is phenomenal. I love the sushi options, though I usually don't go for any of the fancier rolls here. Their fish has been fresh every time I've visited, and that's what I focus on most. Their cooked seafood dishes are awesome too!

SURPRISE!!! A delicious little white-linen place with great food and actual, reasonable prices.

We went here after my nephews graduation ceremony last week. I was a little hesitant: I'm not a sushi fan by any means, and I'm not big on trying new Chinese/Japanese restaurants, but woah!! These guys are good. A little hidden gem across from the tracks in downtown Bartlett. 

I was without my better half this particular evening (limited tickets for the graduation), so I chose to order something I would eat and that he would enjoy too. We ordered some apps that were pretty tasty...some meat on a stick thingy and pot stickers (pretty decent).

I ordered the "Yu Shiang Dish (Garlic Sauce) - This flavor only shows up in Szechwan food. Sweet, Sour, and Spicy are a perfect match w/ginger, garlic and scallion flavor." I opted for Chicken as my protein of choice. I love ginger and garlic, so how bad could it be? And for like $8.00 with a soup!

O!

M!

G!

It was like all my favorite attributes of Chinese food all rolled into one dish!

There were beautiful bits of ginger, gorgeous "trees" (That's what I call broccoli), HUGE pieces of white meat chicken, water chestnuts, peppers, etc. It was Fan-frickin-tastic. Spicy, sweet, and garlic-y. You can not go wrong.

Oh, did I mention it was a ginormous portion that I ate that evening and both my boyfriend and I made dinner out of the next night?

I will be a regular very soon....you'll see. I'll be checked in multiple times coming up.

Good Chinese and sushi restaurant in comparison to others in the area. Good execution with food. Restaurant was clean, unlike most Chinese. Went on a Wednesday night and was extremely busy, which shows the popularity. Recommend.

This place used to be good.  It seems they have changed ownership or management.  We used to go for the Mai Tais that were excellent, I think the bartenders name was Jeff.  He was a cool guy, always talking with everyone.  Last week we were there and the drinks sucked.  Like horrible.  The asian guy behind the bar would just squint, smile and giggle when we asked him what happened to the good mai tais.  Sushi took for ever, the bartender was our served.  Everything we asked he would squint, smile and giggle, maybe its a medical condition or hes just a little "lost"

I've lived in Bartlett for 12 years never tried this place because I didn't know it existed. When I finally found it, it's my new go to Chinese restaurant.  A little more pricy than the others in the area but definitely worthy.  About $40 for 2 full dinners to take out or eat in. Only have done take out so far.

I don't get what the hype is about this place. The service is good yes. The food is whatever. It just has no taste to me. Or am I just ordering the wrong things??
I had sushi here once for dinner with the boyfriend and it just did not impress me. yes the sushi was stuffed more which is a plus, but it just didn't taste like anything. I love spicy tuna and their spicy tuna is just tuna minus any spice. I will never come back here for sushi. I know this place is well known for chinese food so the server recommended this boiled beef spicy dish. It wasn't that spicy, but it was good enough for me to eat. 

On new years day we ordered lunch from here and it was decent. I HATED the gyoza's they had. I don't know if they make their own dough or not, but the gyoza was hard and mushy and very floury doughy tasting. I hate that. And they were barely stuffed with any meat. the Calamari was on point though, nice and crispy. We also got two hot and sour soups which were so so so good!! Perfect for such a cold new years day. I forgot what we ordered exactly but it was a crispy noodle combo dish and honey glazed chicken or something.

I think the only reason why I would ever eat here is because of how close it is to my boyfriend's place. Other than that, from my first experience I'd just skip this place for dinner.

I came here last weekend with my husband and in-laws, and good times were had by all.

My husband had made reservations for the 4 of us, so we got there and walked in, no wait at all.

We started off with some warm sake that definitely warmed us up on a chilly night.

For appetizers, we got the tried and true crab rangoons, and the mushroom and scallops. The rangoons were good, but they were more chewy than crunchy. The sweet and sour sauce that came with them was very tasty. it had an extra note of orange that I wasn't expecting, but really liked. The scallop and mushrooms was fantastic. the scallops were cooked perfectly, super tender and not rubbery.

On the recommendation of a friend, I had the miso soup and was not disappointed.

For dinner, we did a combination of 3 main dishes, some sushi rolls, and some chicken fried rice. 

The Mongolian chicken, pepper garlic beef, and honey sesame crispy beef were all very good - I'd recommend any of them. If I had to pick a favorite, it would be the pepper garlic beef. I only had a little of it, but it was really tender, and not at all greasy.

I believe we ordered the California roll, Chicago roll, and one of the spicy rolls (scallop or shrimp, I forget). Judging from my ability to remember, you can guess the sushi was just OK, but not very memorable. Everything was very fresh, but I don't think we picked that interesting of rolls. Maybe if we'd gotten more from their signature rolls I would have been more blown away.

As for the chicken fried rice, it was chicken fried rice. Kinda greasy, not the star of the meal, and just as it should be. You know, one of those dishes you aren't really blown away by because it's standard fare, but if the dish was bad, you'd judge the restaurant.

The experience itself was nice. We were there for about 2 hours and never felt rushed, even though we saw quite a few people waiting for tables when we left. The servers were very nice, and were very attentive. 

I would definitely go back if I find myself in the area again.

Not gonna lie, I used to love TL's.  Used to, being the operative phrase here.  I live local, so it's nice to get some fresh sashimi in close proximity to my house...and they deliver so I can shlub around in my pajamas and eat all fancy.  However it seems that every time I go to TL's, the quality of food and service get worse and worse.  

So I normally order the sashimi appetizer.  While it started out very fresh and very well presented, lately it's gotten that not-so-fresh sashimi feel which is just blech.  Will not order anymore.  

I also usually order the shrimp (2) with vegetable tempura (5),  It's a cheap-o appetizer that used to taste fantastic, but on my last visit it was inedible.  The oil used to fry it in was obviously old judging by the taste, the batter was rubbery, and the sweet potato tempura had dark black spots on it.  And the topper was an entire half of a green pepper; tempura style. GROSS.  All of it went in the trash. 


The service when you dine in is pretty meh.  For some reason they can never remember to bring drinks, and it almost seems as if a person is a regular there, they get their food served before others.  Just an observation.

LOVE TL's! Every time we dine here, the staff treats us like VIP's! They know what we like and what we order. Everyone is friendly & the service is outstanding! We've ordered many things from the menu...appetizers, entree's, and every sushi roll - everything is great! If you haven't been here yet, you must experience TL's!! The TL's Sakura Roll is my favorite!

I wish this place was like Doctor Who's TARDIS & bigger on the inside but sadly, it is not.  6 p.m. on Friday & they were already PACKED!   I was so glad I had made reservations.  As we dined the tiny waiting area was overflowing & the bar stayed packed to the gills so be prepared to wait or definitely make reservations.  They've squeezed in as many tables as they can to accommodate their popularity so also be prepared to carefully weave your way through the densely populated space to get to your table and/or use the restroom.

With that said, once the food arrived we knew why this place was popular.  The food was amazing & reasonably priced.  We brought a friend who never had sushi before so we ordered a variety of things.  A large sake for us to share, 2 tempura appetizers, a plate of dumplings, the American's Favorite Sushi platter & the CPT Roll platter.  Of course it all came with a small salad & miso soup for each of us.  All that amazing goodness cost us $75 before tip.  Sweet!

On subsequent visits we have tried various other sushi offerings - all of them delicious.  The Super White Tuna (SWT) is amazing!  How can raw fish melt in your mouth? I have no idea but the SWT delivers.  The volcano roll was also quite popular at our table and good for anyone who shies away from the raw offerings.  
Most recently we tried the Kamikaze "rolls" - actually served in an endive leaf, and the Triple KC roll which has no rice & is served in a thinly sliced roll of cucumber.  Those two were my favorites. 

They also have Chinese food and we've only tried one entree from that part of the menu - the General Tao's Chicken (not General Tso's, as you see at other Chinese restaurants).  This has been our only disappointment.  The cuts of chicken weren't as high quality as I've had elsewhere and the breading on the chicken was completely soggy from the heavy sauce.  I realize anything breaded and fried then covered in sauce will eventually not be crispy but it shouldn't come to the table already soggy.

The service is also quick and to the point - you will definitely feel rushed if you come here during peak times.  The service is a bit more friendly and relaxed if you come on a week night when they aren't so insanely busy.

They seem to do a brisk take-out business as well so that's good to know if you don't want to wait.

I have been to TL's about 10 times.  It is close to my house and the food is pretty good, but there is something about it that just doesn't make me love going there. 

I have struggled with writing this review for a long time because I am torn.  So here are a few things that I wanted to share about my experience at TL's Four Seasons. 

I love the black peppered garlic beef.  I get it every time I eat here.  Delicious, tender and well seasoned with a hint of sweetness.  I wish it came with a little more veggies.

Salmon teriaki was over cooked. Sliced too thin... A little dry and tough despite being drowned in sauce.

I have only had sushi a couple of times.  It was tasty and the fish was fresh.

Some meals come with soup and salad.... Others just one or the other.  It is never quite clear how they decide.

This place doesn't have anything decent for craft brew drinkers, so I feed my thirst for alcohol with scotch.  On more than one occasion I have found that the waiter doesn't recognize "Glen Fiddich - Neat" as a drink order.
In fact, almost every time I come here there is some small annoyance related to the less than finely tuned communication skills of the waiters.

This place isn't very big and it doesn't take much to fill it up.  It always feels full, even when it is not.  I guess I just don't like the way the tables are laid out.  Plus there is something wrong with the acoustics because it always seems lound.  You can only faintly hear the music when the place is even remotely busy.

Some places have TVs, some don't.  This one has 2 TVs showing beautiful pictures of the food... But why?  There is no text.  At least that might have helped me order.  But a slideshow of food pictures seems weird to me.  More like something a fast food restaurant would do.

There are always more kids here than I would expect.  It doesn't seem to be a kid type of restaurant, but I people love to bring their kids here.

So I would come back to TL's for the food, but all the other small things keep this from being a favorite.  I'm giving it a solid 3 star review, not because it is bad, but because it is not great for me.

I have been going here for 2 years and have started going here every week or so. I love this resturant. We always order a mix of Chinese and Japanese food. The waiters are very good they stop by enough so that if we need something we can tell them soon. The food is delicious we always order the dragon role and make the spicy tuna a hand role (which I urge you to try). They have some of the best fried rice in the world and they bring it out in a huge bole so if your getting other things it's a good idea to share it. This is a really good idea for a Friday night.
Really good food and awesome sushi just don't order delivery. Slow and they forget half your stuff and they are not to willing to fix the situation.

Ok, so here's the low-down. 
My family has been going to this restaurant since it opened because it is in a good location for us to all meet.The food is really great--I love it. 

The issue I cannot get over is the service is HORRIBLE. I have very specific dietary needs/quirks/whatever. Because of this, I am used to ordering very slow in specific detai, explaining exactly what I want . I actually have the waiter repeat what they have written down. (This process is the only way to get your food ordered right so you can dine with the rest of your crew.)

Last night we went there to celebrate my birthday.  The order came out completely WRONG.

Well, the waiter had the nerve to argue with me, huff and puff and make a big deal out of it. Making ME feel horrible that HE got the order wrong. 
 
Well, needless to say this birthday girl felt extra specail and happy watching my friends and family eat and then feeling berated by an boarderline abusive waiter. 

To top it all of there was no apology free drink or any restitution to make things better. Sad to say, this has not been the first time that this has happend at TL's.  (Similar treatment  has occured at least 4 times in the past. I know, I know...)  

But,I kept comming back because the Basil Chicken dinner is to die for. I can be weak, I am only human!

But, refuse to be "bribed" into going to a place like this no matter how much I like the dang Basil Chicken.  Being treated like a human being is far more important.

Thanks TL for making my birthday extra "sucky" this year. It is the last you will ever see of me or my family.

The moral of this review is:  If you're a person that likes excellent food that does not really care about being treated humanely, I guess you might enjoy TL's. If your a masochist with a big appetite, you will be very happy.

For those rare breeds that like to enjoy a full dining experience,  save yourself the beat-down and just order carry out.
Very nice place to go. My visit with a friend was at about 2:30 pm. Staff was courtious and the food was very very good.

Our 3rd time here and it definitely was a charm! Hubs loved the sushi and rolls and I ordered hot food (sooo cold outside!) of honey/soy chicken and mushrooms along w/ the sauteed green beans and pot stickers (much of it came home!) The chicken was delightfully sweet and rich and even tho we said no to rice, we ended up getting rice in our take out bag. Not expected at all! 

The service is always great, and once again, our server used his own gluten free soy to make our dishes. We'll be reimbursing him a bottle soon!

Disappointed in the sushi. The seaweed was rubbery and the fish was flavorless. I always order sashimi or rolls without the mayo sauces which hide the elegant favors of fresh high quality fish. When I mentioned the rubbery seaweed the waiter proceeded to explain to me that it was probably an older package of seaweed they used. BINGO, I make sushi and if I use old Nori my rolls are rubbery.
My husband ordered the tempura. The vegetables were cooked with the traditional batter but the shrimp had panko bread crumbs. I don't know why they used two different batters but neither were very good. I'm not sure how you can mess up on tempura! 
It's unfortunate I'm giving a bad review I read many great reviews. I could have been a OFF night, however I think I'll move on to another spot......

Dine there every month or so.  I'm not a sushi fan but my husband travels frequently and claims they are one of the best he's had nationwide.  They have Japanese and Chinese.  All of their dishes are a cut above the ordinary and the service is attentive and friendly. Many times I'll just get a few hors d'oeuvres for dinner: the presentation alone is beautiful. Always busy. Best to make a reservation Friday/Saturday.

The food was ok but the delivery was awful. First time ordering from this resturant. We were told 45 min for delivery took an hour and half for our food to arrive. Potstickers were ice cold and the avocado had oxidized to completely brown. According to mapquest we live 7 min from the resturant.

We will not do delivery ever again from this resturant.
Good sushi ! Friendly staff and nice ambiance !! Not a fan of the crispy sesame chicken because I felt like the chicken was frozen
I enjoy this restaurant very much. The food is always delicious and the atmosphere is nice. The menu selection is great and the service is top notch. It's a great place for all ages.

I've been coming here every couple of months for the last couple years.   I especially love the sushi and order it most of the time.   I've tried a handful of dishes off the menu.  Some are prepared a bit differently than I've had at other restaurants but the flavors are always good and I've never had a bad meal.     We can always count on having a very good meal at a great value.

Went in for a quick bite and came out more than satisfied. Great portions, awesome service and the food is made fresh to order! We had the spicy falafel and the beef shawarma pita sandwich and were both incredible. You can taste the freshness, care and def the quality of their products. 

  I would say the falafel was made in house, which is not something I see very often in other similar restaurants where their falafel is cold and crumbly, these where nicely fried and fresh. The beef shawarma was so good too, I would compare the spicy option to our good old traditional Mexican chorizo..   

   The place is kind of small, had a few drink options (including very popular Mexican soft drinks so that's a plus) but they sure exceeded our expectations. Super friendly, polite and helpful as well.

If this place wasn't so far from home, we would be regulars!

Date of my visit: 23-September-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

I was in the mood for some Mediterranean food.  I figured, I would try this place out.  The reviews were decent enough and I was just in the mood.

It's in the strip mall and unless you know where you are going it's slightly harder to find.  I ordered large chicken shawarma plate, with tax came to a little over $14.  One knock to start with, they don't accept AMEX, but they'll take anything else, including less known JCB (given that it's on Discover network, but nonetheless, still...).  I wanted to dine in, so I took a sit while they made my food.

The order came out pretty fast.  The chicken shawarma plate was pretty large.  I started with the salad, and it was okay.  I felt there was too much oil on it. Almost to a point of a cover up of some sort.  I was not a fan.

The chicken shawarma with rice and garlic sauce was delicious, freshly cooked, meat tasted soft and moist.  The pita bread was okay.  I would definitely recommend trying it.  With large plate, you will have left overs for sure!

The service was great!  I must say, both people I have interacted with were very polite, sweet and nice!

I would say, overall it's a B-.  I would like to come back and try something else and I get some water too!

Not bad. Came in here this past weekend for a quick meal. Wife had a taste for Mediterranean so we decided to try this spot. The owners (at least that's who I'm assuming they were) were really nice when we walked in the door. We called our order in beforehand, no issues with that being done.

Taste wise, everything wasn't bad. Can't quite say phenomenal but it gets the job done. We got some falafel. Not the best I've had but good with the sauce. I got the combo platter and my wife got the chicken platter. Both had a sufficient amount of food, had enough for leftovers. Taste was well on both dishes.

Overall, this place is good enough to return to but I wouldn't consider it at the top of my list for Mediterranean food.

Holy Falafel!!  That's what it says on the door and what I said after taking a bite out of my sandwich.  The $5 falafel sandwich I had for lunch was pretty good.  It was filled with tomatoes and cilantro yummy goodness.  The lady working the registry was very nice and friendly.  They also offer gyro and pop for $6.

There's a small grocery section against the wall inside the restaurant.

So delicious! Some of the best falafel I've had!! I got the sandwich spicy. My boyfriend got the chicken shawarma plate which was also fantastic.  It had an excellent blend of seasoning. Salad was yummy too, not too much oil like some other reviews I saw. There was a lot of liquid at the bottom of the bowl but it was mostly juices/water from the veggies. I suppose this could be confused with oil... Can't wait to go back and try something different! Pretty generous portions for the price. Lunch for two under $14 and we were stuffed!

Horrible!
I should have known something was wrong when there was only one person in the restaurant at lunch.
I'm used to delicious slices of rotisserie cooked chicken shawarma, our chicken shawarma looked like it was out of a can of dog food. Instead of sliced,the chicken was diced and was not good.
The restaurant is dingy and there are no restrooms. 
I've been looking for a good Mediterranean restaurant in my area,this is NOT it.

This place fits the bill of the old adage: don't judge a book by its cover.  If you can get past the shoddy strip mall location and the menial interior, you shall be rewarded with some authentic, fresh, delicious food! 

The wife and I went in for lunch on a Saturday and were blown away with they portion size and quality.  Everything is made when you order it...super fresh and uber delicious...don't miss this gem!
I just had the best shawarma ever!  Perfect portion size, and all of the ingredients were fresh and crisp.  I will definitely be back for another visit.
Very tasty beef shawarma pita sandwich and a very pleasant lady at the register (all smiles)!

Definitely a great place to get a quick bite; I was satisfied with the food quantity, quality, taste, and best of all the service.  The restaurant is a small place along with grocery items but definitely the place to go if in this area.  It seems to be owned by a couple with great hospitality skills. I really liked the food and the reviews are 'justice' to the place.

2 stars for friendly service and the 1 meat type- kefta. 

This place is located in a strip mall with no other significant venues beneficial for me so no star on location. My order cost $10.81 and I guess because I didn't order rice, it wasn't filling so no star for value. The taste is ok with all the spices and marination but the chicken and beef were over cooked, dry, and chewy, not tender at all. Very bad quality of meat. I liked kefta because of the taste but it was very dry too. 

I would only come back to say hi to the friendly and sweet lady but not to eat.

This is the Mom and Pop of delish Mediterranean food. The owners are so nice! Tonight they offered patrons tea to warm up from the chill.

I ordered the Combo Plate (spicy), Vegetarian Plate, and Lentil Soup (= $22). 

+ Tahini sauce is AMAZING. Seriously the best thing ever.

+ Jerusalem salad = so good and fresh

+ Yummy bread. Not fresh baked, but soft

+ Lentil Soup was good - very cumin-y

- Falafels were tasty, but a bit harder than I like

+ Portions are good and more flavorful than other Mediterranean places I've tried, and I could tell the ingredients are fresh. I get 2-3 meals per small entree.

I feel better eating Halal meat, so I might sneak some from the boyfriend's leftovers. 

Yum. Totally satisfied.

' Deserving of a 4 star review, but in a mediocre way. It's supper fresh! They serve up a great $10 lunch! Every entree is a foil bowl of healthy, fill-you-up goodness. That's about it. Wicked busy lunch rush, and average service.  They also sell an odd array of groceries and a few hookahs for purchase. Probably better than Pita Paradise on Schmale Rd because of the freshness factor and better ventilation.

Thanks Janni's Review of the Day today, I took the turn into the parking lot at Holy Falafel tonight. Bottom line...it was pretty good. 

Now for the nitty gritty.... Teresa greeted me before the door was even closed behind me. Smiling and happy to tell me all about my options. That was a nice start. We took a little menu tour and I decided on the small combination plate. This included a pita, kefta kabob, chicken kabob (even though I don't think that was listed on the menu, chicken schwarma and beef schwarma with onions, a tomato wedge and a large piece of green pepper served over a bread of rice. The side salad that was included was a really nice size. My son ate that almost immediately and said it was fresh and tasty. The kefta kabob had the flavor I was looking for and it wasn't overly dry. The chicken schwarma was a little drier. But everything else was really good. 

You can't go to Holy Falafel without trying some falafel. Crispy on the outside and large in size with a nice texture inside. I don't really do the tahini sauce, but that's all about my pickiness and is not a reflection on their sauce. I don't eat that anywhere. As a nice treat (and surprise), Teresa put a bit of hummus in the carryout bag for me to try. She was right...I loved that!  

And yes they have some random things for sale. But most of it was on one shelf on one wall. There were a few items that left me confused, but I'm totally okay with it because the food left me satisfied and convinced we will go back. With our punch card in hand, of course!

Ever since I found this place I cant stop going in. The falafel is great but if you are ok with a bit of soicy definitely ask them to put the spicy sauce and make it the best falafel ever.  Also had the chicken shawarma and it tastes just as good.

This place use to be called "Holy Falafel". Either case, I call it Holy Delicious! I think this place is a lot more flavorful than Pita Inn. I ordered the combo plate and it included rice, beef, chicken shawarma, lamb kabob, pita, a salad, and the usual tahini and hot sauce. All of it was absolutely delicious!

The lamb kabob was seasoned perfectly, and the chicken shawarma was nice and tender. And even the filler rice was extremely tasty. J.P. ordered the veggie plate and she said it was tasty as well. Overall, good price, good food, and not greasy, but healthy. I would definitely come here, versus Pita Inn.

This place isn't much on the eyes, but this little family owned and operated four table location does have some pretty good eats. Had the small combo plate and ordered it spicy(as another yelper suggested), was pretty good, chicken was a little dry but tasty. Fantastic falafels for sure and the service was above average. We will definitely be back.
It has good food and okay pricing. I may go back but its not a must have kind of place. The food had good flavor. The restaurant was not necessarily the cleanest that I have seen.
The place doesn't look like much, but the food I'd fantastic. Large portions of very flavorful meats and vegis. I got a small combo which could feed 2 people. I will come here again.

This is a nice little Mediterranean place that has a tiny selection of okay combinations with decent pita BUT offers excellent service and a couple of things that will blow your mind on the menu (thus a 4 instead of a 3).  

Here's what you've got to do:

1)  Order the chicken or the beef shawarma (and the hummus!) but order it SPICY.  I don't know what they do to the shawarma (or the hummus) when you order it that way, but it makes it a hundred times better.  It's juicier and obviously spicier, but it's just overall tastier.  (And messier, but who cares about that!)

2)  Order the falafel.  I know you don't need 6 of them, but I promise you they are worth it.  These are some of the best falafel I've had.

They also have a punch card here for return customers which I thought was a nice touch too.  You can eat-in but there are only a couple of tables so I would recommend taking it to go.  They pack everything really well and keep hot/cold stuff separate so you don't have to worry about coming home to soggy salad.  And if you're a spice freak like I am, they will make sure to toss in extra hot sauce too if you're nice!

We were really excited to go here. But we arrived just after 8pm on a Friday (when they're supposed to be open until 9pm) and they were already closed. Call before you go to make sure they're still open. 

I'll revise this review once I've actually had a chance to enjoy their food.

I recently went to my fave Meditterean spot Pita Inn and again was wishing some place like Pita Inn was closer to me.    I looked around and found on Yelp this place.    Since it had mostly good reviews I decided to check it out.

It's no Pita Inn however the food portions for their large size is literally just that.   I ordered a combination plate and chicken shawerma entree and I have enough food to last for at least four meals.   I do like that they pack the salad (chopped cucumbers and tomatoes) in a separate container.    I enjoyed every bite of the dishes and especially love the yogurt sauce that comes with your food.   I would say that I wished they chopped up the peppers, tomatoes, and onions that come with the dishes but aside from that, the food was tasty.

Also the owner was very nice.   She asked if it was my first visit and I told her yes, so she gave me a card where basically if you order ten times, you get a free sandwich.  That's definitely a good incentive to return.

They have a small seating area in case you want to eat at the restaurant and even had some random groceries on another wall, in case you were missing a spice or a condiment.

I'm glad I found this place.   Can't wait to try their gyros.

Sometimes when you're having a bad day, a plate of tasty, spicy homemade food will make it all better. And yes, this place is THE place for my favorite shwarma plates and sandwiches. We love coming here because we know the owners (husband & wife, with 2 daughters) are super sweet and they have the best recipe in the area. When all else fails and we've no place to go, we always come back to Royal Falafel.

Really, this should be about a 4.75. The falafel is amazing (and gluten free...I asked, because sometimes it isn't, depending on how it's made). The large combination plate includes rice, beef and chicken shawarma, lamb kufta, a pita, a salad of your choice, tahini, and hot sauce (if you want). It's enough to feed two people, possibly even for two meals. They pack the salad separately from the hot food, so it stays cold. It's all very tasty, moist, and wonderful!

The people here are super nice and friendly, too. So glad this place opened in my neighborhood (you can probably tell from my check-ins, haha)! :)
First time visit & we will definitely be back. Had the falafel sandwich-excellent-and the small combination platter-delicious!

As I'm eating this delicious food, I get the urge to leave a review for this small gem if a restaurant. Gyro in one hand, phone in the other. This is my second time eating here and it did not disappoint. 
Gyro plate,  combo plate, and falafel. that humus tho. It's definitely a good portion a the price is on point. If It's your first time here I'd suggest the combination plate as it has a variety of meat over rice.
As a finally note u must add the couple that run this place is by far the friendliest I have ever encountered as far as management /ownership goes.  On the phone and in person, so welcoming and helpful with knowledge and suggestions. A must try.

Went there with an Assyrian friend of ours just for comparison.  My husband and I ordered the large combination plate which was enough for both of us. Our son had the gyros and he liked it.
Our Assyrian friend had the combination plate too and he said that it needed more onions.  All in all, he said that the food was ok.
I'm looking forward to trying their gyros next time.

Outstanding food. Great lunch specials and friendly staff. The only downside to this place is the sign and the lack of marketing. The location doesn't standout and it's a hit or miss. I live a block away and didn't even know this place existed.

This is a nice little Mediterranean place that has a tiny selection of okay combinations with decent pita BUT offers excellent service and a couple of things that will blow your mind on the menu (thus a 4 instead of a 3).

I don't know what they do to the shawarma (or the hummus) when you order it that way, but it makes it a hundred times better.  It's juicier and obviously spicier, but it's just overall tastier.  (And messier, but who cares about that!)

2)  Order the falafel.  I know you don't need 6 of them, but I promise you they are worth it.  These are some of the best falafel I've had.

They also have a punch card here for return customers which I thought was a nice touch too.  You can eat-in but there are only a couple of tables so I would recommend taking it to go.  They pack everything really well and keep hot/cold stuff separate so you don't have to worry about coming home to soggy salad.  And if you're a spice freak like I am, they will make sure to toss in extra hot sauce too if you're nice!

We were really excited to go here. But we arrived just after 8pm on a Friday (when they're supposed to be open until 9pm) and they were already closed. Call before you go to make sure they're still open. 

I'll revise this review once I've actually had a chance to enjoy their food.

The people here are super nice and friendly, too. So glad this place opened in my neighborhood (you can probably tell from my check-ins, haha)! :)
First time visit & we will definitely be back. Had the falafel sandwich-excellent-and the small combination platter-delicious!

As a finally note u must add the couple that run this place is by far the friendliest I have ever encountered as far as management /ownership goes.  On the phone and in person, so welcoming and helpful with knowledge and suggestions. A must try.

Our Assyrian friend had the combination plate too and he said that it needed more onions.  All in all, he said that the food was ok.
I'm looking forward to trying their gyros next time.

Outstanding food. Great lunch specials and friendly staff. The only downside to this place is the sign and the lack of marketing. The location doesn't standout and it's a hit or miss. I live a block away and didn't even know this place existed.
Tried this place for the first time tonight, was pleasantly surprised. Falafel and beef shawarma were delish, we will definitely be back!

As I type this my tummy is stretched to capacity full of YUMMY combo plate. My husband and I shared a large combo plate - and we had LOTS of leftovers. The combo plate consists of chicken shawarma, beef shawarma, chicken kabob, kefta kabob, rice, grilled tomatoes and onions, two big pita breads, tahini, and a container of Jerusalem salad for $14.99!!!! I could not believe how much food we got! AND IT WAS SUPER DELISH! The chicken kabob was tender, moist, and flavorful (as opposed to dry and bland). We also ordered the Tabbouleh salad - it's homemade taste overflowed with loving care! Thank you fellow Yelper's for your unwavering accuracy and introducing me to this little gem!!

If you like middle Easter food then these place is good to go to, no thrills just good food, if you are ordering for one don't go for large, large can feed a family, price is quite reasonable, portions are generous some times to generous and service is fast

This is the best Falafel I've ever had hands down. A great option for vegan/vegetarians.

Prices are very reasonable, and everything is made fresh to order.

Tabbouleh salad is very balanced in flavor.

I'll be back.

Food was pretty good, portions were a bit small for the pricing. There aren't too many of this types of places around anymore so finding a good one is difficult. The people are very friendly and work quickly. If you're in need of a quick schwarma fix, this is a good place to go! The rice and pitas were not my favorite but pretty standard.

I love Mediterranean/ Middle Eastern food of any kind!  I'm so glad a new place has opened up near me.  

The bf and I checked this place out 20 minutes before they were closing.  I really thought/expected that they were going to turn us away  and that the food wouldn't be at it's best since they were trying to close up-I was wrong! 

The husband and wife owners welcomed us with open arms and encouraged us to eat in.  We asked about the menu, asked about the business, etc. and they were glad to help us. 

We ordered kefta kebab, gyros, falafel and hummus.  The falafel were great, fresh and flavorful and my bf the falafel monster happily chowed them down.  The kefta and gyros were also good, as were the sauces that accompanied them. The meat they serve tasted very fresh and was 100% Halal.  The hummus was plated beautifully and tasted even better than it looked.  

There is a random grocery store like shelf selling spices and Middle Eastern canned foods.  Most of the entrees are under $10 so Royal is pretty well priced for the large portions they offer.  If you are a Middle-Eastern food fan like we are Royal is definitely a good option in the Roselle area.
They are a little pricey, but their food is awesome! I highly recommend!  Quality place.
Delicious food. Had the small combination plate and lived it!  They area also very nice and attentive. Would come back again.

Great little gem hidden in a strip mall! Don't judge this place by the exterior. The people inside are extremely kind, the food is delicious-portions are quite reasonable, I almost always have leftovers. Really just give it a try....

We ordered beef shawerma entree and falafel.  Excellent!  Very happy a place like this opened in the area!

Also owners are very nice and restaurant is very clean. Overall a positive experience. We will be definately be back.
Excellent authentic middle eastern cuisine! Family owned and operated! Great portions and great service!!
The place is funky... We had one of the best Lentil soups ever. The falafel was pretty good too. My wife loved the chicken rolls. We recommend this place. Everyone is so nice!

Stucked at an old strip mall, between Nancy Pizzaria and El Burrito Mexican restaurant, is this fantastic hidden gem, a Middle Eastern / Meditteranean small diner.  I had a combination plate and it was delicious.  Service was beyond compare and I wonder why the low volume of review.  The food this place offer is definitely a lot better than Pita House.  The meats here were so tender and the spices is just so fragrance with a nice barbeque char smells.  I ordered spicy, and it was spicy but not too overwhelmingly.  I can say that this place will definitely be top five on my Middle East restaurant list.

Better than average Gyros and an east small Middle Eastern menu makes this a beginners place to sample Arab food. Located in a small strip mall I. Roselle  this place is in a area that has a variety of small ethnic eateries. They are big. To the falafel and has some interesting burger and kabob varieties that are tempting. They also have one row of supermarket choices of food including whale ties cereal right next to Persian spices. Bizarre .

Not too bad for Mediterranean in a pinch. I got a combination plate which was more food than I could eat in one sitting. A real stand out here was the hummus which was very good. However, I found the shawarma to be on the dry side, maybe it just needs to come with more sauce. Either that, or I have just been spoiled by Naf-Naf grill which remains tied for first as my favorite in this category.
This place is legit.  The large combo easily feeds two, and is priced just right.  The food is fresh and flavorful.  We've come here twice in two weeks, and I'm ready to stop in a third time...

I have not gotten anything here that I have not loved.   They are the classic find...  A small operation that really does it right.   Look for Holy Falafel  and you won't go wrong with anything in the house.   Highly recommended for anyone who wishes a little diversion off the beaten path.   Really excellent.
Soo delicious and you get a lot of food for the money too. A falafel meal comes with 6 falafel's, a TON of rice pilaf, a small salad and bread. yum.

I was so excited to try this place because it's so close to me, but it was a huge disappointment. We ordered the chicken shawarma wrap, beef shawarma wrap, and two falafel (we wanted to try them). The chicken was bland and dry and the beef was bland and tough. The wraps themselves were pretty good, but not sure they're worth the $1 extra over the pita. Neither of the wraps came with sauce and we had to ask them for it. They gave us 2 free falafel to try which would've been good to know when we were ordering so we wouldn't have ordered the two. 
Overall, a huge let down. If we go back, we'll try the kofta or the gyros - maybe they're better?
Very, very good food! Super friendly counter staff. Portions are very generous for the price. Try the sample plate, it's enough for two people.
The place is funky... We had one of the best Lentil soups ever. The falafel was pretty good too. My wife loved the chicken rolls. We recommend this place. Everyone is so nice!

Stucked at an old strip mall, between Nancy Pizzaria and El Burrito Mexican restaurant, is this fantastic hidden gem, a Middle Eastern / Meditteranean small diner.  I had a combination plate and it was delicious.  Service was beyond compare and I wonder why the low volume of review.  The food this place offer is definitely a lot better than Pita House.  The meats here were so tender and the spices is just so fragrance with a nice barbeque char smells.  I ordered spicy, and it was spicy but not too overwhelmingly.  I can say that this place will definitely be top five on my Middle East restaurant list.

Either that, or I have just been spoiled by Naf-Naf grill which remains tied for first as my favorite in this category.

Look for Holy Falafel  and you won't go wrong with anything in the house.   Highly recommended for anyone who wishes a little diversion off the beaten path.   Really excellent.
Soo delicious and you get a lot of food for the money too. A falafel meal comes with 6 falafel's, a TON of rice pilaf, a small salad and bread. yum.

The chicken was bland and dry and the beef was bland and tough. The wraps themselves were pretty good, but not sure they're worth the $1 extra over the pita. Neither of the wraps came with sauce and we had to ask them for it. They gave us 2 free falafel to try which would've been good to know when we were ordering so we wouldn't have ordered the two. 
Overall, a huge let down. If we go back, we'll try the kofta or the gyros - maybe they're better?
Very, very good food! Super friendly counter staff. Portions are very generous for the price. Try the sample plate, it's enough for two people.

Every time me and girlfriend want to go back here they are closed before posted business hours! And this hasn't happened to us once! So annoying and such a bummer! Don't know how they will keep business with unstable hours!

Alright I really hovered between four and five stars for Holy Falafel.  This place is really good.  

I stopped by there for the first time tonight to try it out.  I got the same thing that I always get at a Mediterranean restaurant: Hummus and Falafel.  Seriously one of my favorite foods.  Plus I get a gyro for my wife.

The lady who took my order was very friendly.  The food was prepared fresh.  The price was pretty much on par with what I have paid at other places.

So how was the food?
excellent.  My wife said she wants the gyro every day.  The falafel was flavorful with a nice crisp outside.  The hummus was very good.

Yea, I'll be going back.  that's for sure.

Edit:
I should add that their white sauce, something I don't normally care for, is great.

Ordered food for takeout and the food was ready super fast.  We had the tabbouleh salad, hummus, falafel sandwich, and a falafel entree. All the food was really good!!  Only thing that I wish is if the falafel entree would include pita bread.

i work in the same strip mall as holy falafel and have been dying to try it out, i went in tuesday and ordered the large combination plate it was roughly $14 but can easily feed 2-3 people. the food was very fresh, all the meats were seasoned lightly and are very tasty. it comes served over a large bed of rice and i believe a side tabouli salad. over all a great new place and i am excited to try other items of the menu in the near future.
the food here is excellent . the prices are fair and the people working here are beyond friendly . worth a try!

Just an added side note... It's funny we have ordered so many times that the guy knows our order. We always order pizza with sausage and mushroom, with 2 sides of fries. Last time I ordered I gave him the pizza order and he said ... plus two fries?....LOL I laughed and confirmed!!! GREAT customer service!!  Our FAVORITE place for pizza!! We have been customers since we moved here back in 1997!!
Worst Rosati's ever beware the owner is a complete crook. Avoid at all cost .... I selected 1 star because I had too.

We called to order two sixteen inch pizzas, for pickup. Two specialty pizzas, and our total was $52.53?? Insane! The four of us could have gone out to a modestly nice dinner for less. We cancelled the order, that was way too much.

This has to be the worst Rosati's in the entire franchise. I have called for delivery on several occasions and have run into the same problems. First, the guy who answers the phone comes across like he is doing you a favor simply by answering the phone; he just seems annoyed with your very existence. Second, they try to discourage your delivery order by quoting you an ungodly wait time. This last time it was an hour-and-a-half, and again that information was delivered with a disinterested and disenfranchised tone. The final insult came when, despite their extensive menu, Mr. Happy informed me they were only "doing" pizzas at that time. Mind you I was placing my order prior to 9:00 p.m. Now, a good pizza place would be forthcoming with information about limiting their menu at a particular time. I have to assume Rosati's franchise system wouldn't stand for this. Instead, I believe the guy who answered the phone just wanted to go home, and the inconveneice of a late night order dashed those hopes, so it was just easier to make things difficult for the person on the other end of the line. It's either that, or this Rosati's just doesn't want to make money. Do yourself a favor, if you live in the Elgin area, just order from White Cottage, their service is friendlier and their wait times are reasonable.

Today was my first time ordering from here and I received top notch customer service!  When I first called, I was referred to another location which was closer to me and told to call back if they couldn't assist.  Well, the South Elgin location was unable to assist and they do not deliver until later in the day, so I called the Tyler Creek location back.  The gentleman I spoke with was great.  I told him I understood if we were outside his area, and that I could try somewhere else.  He said not to worry and took our order.  As the Tyler Creek location is close to my house, I look forward to giving them more business!  Thank you Tyler Creek Rosati's!

I ordered for delivery tonight. This will be the absolute last time time I spend a penny at this place. The ribs I ordered were not cooked right, they were tough. Hard to chew not tasting right. I called to speak to the manager and he really didn't care. Very unprofessional and unwilling to hear the issue. I would not recommend this place to ANYBODY.
I can say I actually like the breakfast better than the dinner.  They have variety of stuff.  I will for sure go for breakfast more often...

My wife and I stood in line for about 10 minutes on a Saturday night to spend $30 for buffet from hell. The place was utter chaos and filthy. Not a clean table to be found although plenty were empty. The buffet was well picked over and not being restocked. There was food all over the floor and the dishes were dirty. While walking past the kitchen, 2 staff members were screaming profanities and brawling with each other. I would have thought there wasn't a manager on duty but I did hear an overhead page calling one to the front counter. What a horrid experience and I am just grateful to get out of the place without catching some terrible infection or case of food poisoning.

Not really recommended, I think these guys weren't ready for us or something, but there's like a lot food missing in this buffet, the only thing I like about this place is the decor, the food was just meh.

Tonight we went to dinner here.  The line to get in was not long but it took about 10 mins to pass the register ..people were standing around waiting for CLEAN tables.   They had tons of dirty empty tables available if you were willing to clean them yourself..which we did.   The soup bar had 2 almost empty dried up soups in them. Did I mention it's 6:15 pm on Sat. ?  food missing from most areas and staff standing behind the counter doing nothing.. I did ask for something to be refilled and the response was a strange look.  Near the pizza area 2 employees were fighting and throwing stuff in the kitchen and then it rolled out into the dinning area. 1 girl yelling " Bitch  don't you be coming up in my face or I'll smash it in."
