Woow!!   dinner and a show.  the desert area had no hot fudge, the chocolate fountain was running low and gluging out and a employee just standing like a idiot.  Pie pans were empty and other guests asking about refilling the station...and again the employee stood there like Don't tell me what to do. Kudos to the cooks that made the roasted chkn,  mac & cheese and fried shrimps...very tasty . This place had filthy floors and food dropped all around,  filthy tables, lazy employees and apparently No management to be found...until the cops showed up to take away the Rockm Sockm kitchen staff.  This place needs a inspector to close them down.there was also filthy dished in the clean dish rack area.   Stay away !!!

Our family of 6 enjoys the variety of the buffet but overall only give it 2 stars since the quality and cleanliness has deteriorated. The silverware was crusty our last visit and the food selections were unpalatable. The restaurant also looks unkept, could use a good cleaning. The servers and staff are polite, just need to focus on improvement.

Dirty dirty dirty .. lazy staff and the cook on the grill does not know the difference between medium and we'll done steak. Good luck getting a clean table and some to take the dirty plates away. Top it off bring your own drink they take forever to refill your cup. If I managed this place I'd let go off all staff and start all over.

The food was horrible! The biscuits were hard as a rock, could not even use a knife to cut through them. The orange juice was watered down and disgusting.  The bacon was hard and greasy. Very disappointed we were looking forward to coming.  It does not even deserve a star.

Never again. No idea why I even stopped. Week day night about 8 PM, hardly anyone here. Sub-par buffet food even for the off strip streets of Vegas. The best thing I had was the salad I made from the salad bar. They are all about being a steak buffet place and maybe I would have tried one if someone would have been at the steak station during the 1/2 hour I was there. But nobody home and honestly, the steaks sitting behind the glass looked sad and tired anyway. I am convinced this is where America goes to get fatter.

First off when got there and everything was old. You could see it. And they were just stirring to hide the dark colored food. Secondly there was hair in my food. Third one of the ladies was talking crap in Spanish when I completely understood every word she was saying as I stood there starring at her. Told the manager and he did go towards the direction but who knows. You wanna talk shit ok but go behind the wall and not in front of the person. Geesh.

Honestly not too bad. I have gone to this GC a few times, I like the imitation crabmeat salad. I do go during the week day hours around lunch time. I am usually satisfied with the service and the food. There are good and bad days, just like any other business. I may just stay away during week ends, it looks like a lot of negative comments were written for week end visits.

2 star only because my kids like coming here. Cashiers and the drink prep are usually the friendliest, Servers here have no kind of service manners, Food is usually over cooked, we have to Literally sit around until a new fresh batch comes out, Btw your Steak cook is horrible! Never been here once when we have a good experience with the steak cook. I ask for med he gives me rare I ask for well done he says there is none, he can stressful day it'll be 10 min ect...The only...only reason i continue to come is by my kids request they love the fruit bar, ice cream and desserts.

I choose one star because I don't have an option to choose zero.  We were there Saturday night 3/7/15. We sat in Jasmine's section and Jasmine's way of cleaning tables was to stack all the dirty plates on one of the back tables and her and her friend (?) would scrape them in the dining room into the slop bucket in the dining area and then stack them almost 2 foot high by color. Everywhere you looked there were dirty plates. It was disgusting!!!!!!!
Lots of people were asking for silverware (all dirty and piled up too on a tray at the back table ). Had to ask repeatedly for our drink refills...

Needless to say we quickly lost our appetites!

I would have complained at the time to a manager but being almost to the point of being physically ill, We decided to go home.

Don't get fooled by those happy succulent commercials. A family of 4 w/2 kids still costs $42 and the quality of meats is pretty sketchy. 

I don't get why dinks is not all-u-can-drink and the cup of coffee is not self serve. 

Oh well, you live and learn. Not coming back.

Absolutely disgusting!  Food is terrible, dishes and silverware are almost all dirty and even the restrooms were so bad I had to walk out due to a strange smell (not coming from a stall). I wouldn't return if I were paid to eat there!

Off all the Golden Corral, this is one of the Mediocre ones... This is what you say you paid cheap for cheap food.. Everything tastes bland.. Soup was missing flavor.. Asian dishes? Come on!!! Pork Steak, hard and over cooked... 
Our server? Looked irritated that she was working that day, never even bother to check if we still have drinks.. 
Bad food and bad service... You should take it from the GC ALGONQUIN.. Manager is in the storefront making sure everything is filled up and customers don't wait.. Where servers really take care of customers...

One reviewer indicates that this location is closed.  I can assure you that it is not.  I went there with my wife yesterday and in all honesty the food quality was what we expect from this type of an establishment.  If we want prime food there are other places to try, but dollar for dollar this is not bad.

4 stars because it's fairly good value. $20 dinner for 2 on Mon-Thu, lunch priced at $7-8 (ends at 4pm). Nice salad bar and desserts. Usually like their steaks. Awesome onion rings. They have 3-4 types of soups. Really like their banana pudding thing the best. More variety than what Old Country Buffet offers. Better value than Sweet Tomatoes. They also have soft serve ice cream, ribs, cotton candy, a chocolate fountain, a variety of fruit.

EDIT May 2013 - I'm downgrading it to 2 stars because I came here on a weekend for dinner. It was during their wings promotion and was priced at $11something/person. I would've been okay with the price, except that the wings were poor in taste and selection. They were frequently out of their non-original flavors and the sauces weren't good at all, generally overly sweet and artificial. After that experience, both of us agreed that Golden Corral wasn't for us anymore. The onion rings were still my favorite though haha.

EDIT June 2013 - 4 stars only for the brunch. 

I was extremely against going here again after my lackluster dinner experience during their wings promotion, but I was outvoted. I'm glad I gave Golden Corral another shot because it turned out to be a great local breakfast option mainly because of their massive, made-to-order omelettes and their fruit/salad spread. You can select the ingredients that you want in your omelette, and it's made right in front of you, ready in a few minutes. Love their fruit & salad bar, a ton of variety. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive, so we usually try to sit at one of her tables :)

The price was under $9/person, free drinks before a certain time (I forgot when exactly).

When you roll up to the Golden Corral, it occupies a large corner of a strip mall that looks like a ghost town. And though this might not be my first, second, or third choice for eats, there were some positives, to go along with the negatives, at this exceptionally large international style buffet.

A friend selected this spot so we could "munch" as we discussed work. Our group of 4 soon realized that at peak time, Golden Corral is more entertaining, in terms of people watching, than it is a place to be in work mode.

After forking over bucks to eat until we dropped, we were offered beverage choices, and although several of the iced teas sounded wonderful only one was available. We were ushered to our table, conveniently located smack dab next to the selections of colorful plastic plates and utensils. 

It definitely takes awhile to peruse the choices when you actually hit the buffet line; and height dependent, some folks were underneath all protective barriers when scooping up food. Hmmm. Was it my imagination or did I really see one, make that two, okay three really cute kids select plates and put forks back in the containers after they had hit the all purpose rug.

Choose wisely. Many options are cooked to order; that appealed to me. And many of the items were easy to label as super fresh due to massively high turn over.

The staff behind the barriers as well as those continuously removing used plates were not only friendly, but efficient, and several made a point of providing brand spanking new portions if anyone's lower lip quivered in sadness; IE. the super great cinnamon bread pudding.

My meal was tasty and hot; and my salad was fresh. Though I didn't venture off to far in buffet-land, I was able to discover some awesome garlic and herb biscuits that melted in my mouth. The dessert section was interesting; they have quite a few sugar free options (look for that blue handled serving spoon), as well as a fountain of chocolate.

The appeal here is no doubt for families; and the place was packed. Kudos to the serving staff, but maybe it is literally too tough to corral the hygiene factor when feeding the hungry masses. Still, a great value with a lot of choices

I'm not really a Buffett person because of the amount of scumbags that come to them but my kids like the variety. I really liked and would come back for the pot roast and real mashed potatoes and the fried chicken is better than kfc. The steak is good if you can get it well done. The washroom makes them lose one star. The Mexicans not watching their kids running around like its a chuck e cheese was really annoying. Management should make them leave if they can't control them it's a restaurant not a zoo. I saw four of them sticking their filthy hands in the chocolate fountain and told a worker. They had to tear the whole thing down but did nothing to the parents not watching their kids. I would have told them to leave. Kids should not be allowed unless they are at least 10 to go by food. Employees should enforce the running around kids too. Place was out of control with little kids running everywhere touching everything.
Kids like it for the deserts, husband likes it for the steak, I like it for the salad. Its a win win. The quality isnt the best but we all leave full and pretty happy =)

My husband and I decided to give the Golden Corral a try after seeing all the ads on TV. 

First thing that they did was assign us a server - what do we need a server at a buffet for? To refill drinks because GC opted not to put a soda fountain on the floor where you can refill your own drinks. The server assigned to our table did not refill our drinks once, I had to get up and go over to the cashier to ask for a refill (which he made me wait 5 minutes to get). The server then had the nerve to give us a nasty look when she saw we did not leave a tip.

At first we were exicted to try all of the food since there was a large variety. Between my husband and I, we tried just about everything available. It was all cold, dry, and disgusting. The only things that tasted even remotely good were the mashed potatoes and the salad (because honestly, how could you mess up a salad?). Everything, and I mean everything, else was cold. The dessert bar was terrible. I just about cracked a tooth on a rice krispie treat and the cake was so dried out that it was inedible. The orange chicken looked like the food I feed my dog, the rice was cold and hard, and the ribs were all fat. It was really terrible food, my husband and I left feeling sick.

I would never waste my money here again. I would rather just cook than go back to the Golden Corral.

I don't think ill ever be back. Food has always been just...eeh! Decent deserts. Good staff, always very friendly and attentive. What really turned me off was the bathrooms. Just disgusting. I always figured if they cant keep the facilities clean, the kitchen is probably not much better. Also dinner is a pricey for what you get. Not impressed at all. Beware!

I was shocked when she told me that it was $27.45 for my 13 yr old son, and myself. Seems pricy. Very polite staff. Ample parking. I have to say this again, the staff (Veronica) did an excellent job of keeping our drinks filled, coffee hot(which was good), and our table clean. Wide variety of food, including Chinese & Mexican. Much better Salad bar than OCB. The dessert bar even has a running Chocolate Fountain! Did I say the coffee was good too? I give 4 stars, would have been 5 except for price. I'd come back.

Restaurant Review
Steak and a chocolate fountain, what more can you ask for! Although in the ads, the buffet looks amazing; the actual quality of the food is quite average. If you go during peak times be prepared to line up the in the "corral" for seating. You are greeted with large grills with large sirloin or flank steak upon entering the buffet. Along the side if the custom seafood station where you can get "crab cakes" (mostly filling with small piece of crab meat), shrimp scampi with noodles, or white fish. The fish is not bad, but your typical white fish cooked by skillet with seasoning. The steak is notably tough and resembles large flank steak that have been marinated to soften the roughness of the meat. Scattered throughout the buffet is multiple food items including yeast rolls (amazing with the honey butter), veggies (corn, carrots, etc.), asian stir fry, salad bar, ribs, pizza, etc. There is slightly larger selection than Old Country. Wrapping up your meal the chocolate fountain with rice crispies, marshmallow, macaroons, and pineapple was a real treat. The soft serve was below Mcd quality. Overall the place is clean compared to other Golden Corral. Wait staff is hard working and the table was always cleared of dirty plates.

Pro- wide selection of food including flank steak, comfort foods, large selection compared to OCB

Con- average quality food, tough steak, drinks not included

Hidden deal- Weekday dinner deal 2 for 20, saves about a dollar per person

The only reason this place even gets one star is because the bread they have is pretty good.. Then again, it tastes like warm hawaiian bread, which is why I like it.  So next time I'd rather just go to Jewel and pick up some of that instead.

The service here is TERRIBLE.  I was pushed more than once by a staff member because I was "in the way".. Our server [why do we need servers for a buffet?] refilled our drinks ONCE while my family and I were there.. even though we were there for a good hour and a half.

They do have a good assortment of food, but my taco meat had at least 3 hairs in it.  Some of the other food lacked major taste.. and the brownie / chocolate cake [I'm not sure what it was] tasted like an experimental "microwavable cake" I tried a few years ago.. basically it tasted like rubber.

The place is very cramped.  There's hardly room to move around in your seat, which is usually already rubbing up against the person's seat behind you.

Do yourself a favor.  Go to Old Country Buffet.. or even McDonalds.. You'll get better service.

Wow, THE WORST BUFFET EXPERIENCE  EVER!! 
I enjoy going to a buffet, whether it's a Chinese or American. 
But this one, Golden Corral in Elgin, I feel bad for giving even a one star to this restaurant.

All of the staff members there were Mexicans. 
This means several things.
1. The owner is very concerned about saving costs
2. The food quality would most likely be sacrificed. (In my opinion, Mexicans have work ethics in general. However, they aren't necessarily a good cook for sure.)

This was my first time eating at Golden Corral, and I had some sort of expectation because I heard that they have good food.

Totally not. 

I walked in to the restaurant yesterday, (Friday), around 12:30 p.m.

The restaurant was huge but there were only several groups of people. I thought the whole large dining area was reserved for a party or something, but NO. I just sat there by myself.

None of the food I tried tasted fresh and good. 

The french fries were not crispy but soggy. (How can you mess French Fries?? Come on...)
The pasta noodle was also soggy. 
Mac and Cheese, ehh. Whatever. 
Burger Slider, the bread and meat was tough, and tasted like it was made like an hour ago.
Lettuce was turning red, which means it's not fresh.

And you call those trash-looking foods(They call it Sweet and Sour pork, Almond Chicken, etc) Asian Food? God, you should be ashamed. 

I'm an Asian who spent 20 years living in South Korea, and I know what I'm talking about. 
The Almond Chicken was salty and tasted like nothing. 
Sweet and Sour pork, the way the pork was fried just looked gross. 
All of the Asian foods tasted like they were made several hours ago. Not warm enough either.
Some cheap sloppy Chinese buffet near my house didn't even cook Asian food the way Golden Corral(at this location) did. 

It was nice to have an option of "Asian" food I guess, but I was expecting maybe somewhere close to Panda Express, which isn't necessarily a good Asian food restaurant. 

Finally, for those of you who left good or positive reviews here, you SHOULD BE ashamed too.

The food was terrible, and I'm not even sure they use some crappy out dated ingredients or so.

I literally finished my eating in 10 minutes. 

If I go to a buffet I usually grab 5~7 plates. (I'm a huge eater).

But the foods at this restaurant just made me feel gross and want to get out of there asap.

Left a tip just because the Spanish speaking server was very nice.

I don't know guys. I'm not picky about buffet at all. And maybe just this location sucks. 

Anyway, I won't go back to this location for sure, and I won't recommend this location to anyone at all.

Stay away from it please, for your and your families and friends' health.

We don't do the buffet thing often, but when we do, we usually go to this Golden Corral. The staff is friendly, the food is fresh and the desserts are plentiful. The price is right for a meal in which everyone can find something that they want. My son likes it because he can have Chinese and pizza all on the same plate. My husband likes it because he can have Chinese and a salad. I am a fan of the wide variety of side dishes. For price and variety, we will probably be back.

Of all the Golden Corrals I have been to, this is my favorite one. They serve Horchata which is delicious. The food is great and I usually drive up from Chicago when I am with a group of friends just to eat something different. I prefer this place over Old Country Buffet.

Mini-previous review: Tried this a while ago at mid-to-late supper time, and it was as you'd expect for a buffet in the middle or near the end of a rush. Messy, out of some dishes, other dishes picked over to the point where you would be smart not to touch them, some dishes dried out, and ... some dishes in their prime, so pick those out carefully.

Latest review: Very good! Went when they switched from the breakfast menu to the lunch menu, so everything was fresh and clean. Still "buffet-food" menu items, but some fresher cooked options too.

Tried, for example, the fresh-cooked scallops. They were on the small side for my tastes (love those gargantuan ones!) and I told the chef I'd take 'em now please, he would have overcooked them had I not.

I suggest, if you have the choice, waiting a half-hour after they switch menus, as it takes time to replace some items and you'll miss out on them if you get there right when they switch menus. On the other hand, I grabbed some corned beef hash from the breakfast menu, so that can go either way.

Everyone was very friendly, and they cleaned the plates and tables quickly.

I'd say for the price, it's a deal. I got a huge salad to start and that alone can cost the price of entry if you go to a place that specializes in salads.

And yes, I pigged out.

Note: It's apparently a kid-friendly choice for dining out, so there are rug-rats underfoot everywhere you go. Good for you parents, a warning to those of you who would rather do without the noise.

This is the by far the worst Golden Corral I've ever been to. Extremely dirty, our tables felt sticky resulting in my party feeling very uncomfortable eating there. Not to mention our waitress didn't bother to remove are dirty trays from our table. She sort of lingered around waiting for us to call her. Only once did she take a single finished place while for the rest of our dinner our dirty plates pilled up. Very unprofessional to say the least. I doubt if I'll ever dine at this place again.

Great NASCAR supporter, but cleanliness my concern .... food was cafeteria fare and tasteless. Expect to be grossed out by some patrons coughing and sneezing next to food buffet bar . Holding 2 plates does not allow them to cover their mouths . Not trying to sound snooty but come on.......

For 7.95 you get all you can eat . This place is like 3 times bigger then Old Country Buffet. The food was excellent and the service was great. I had the honey grilled chicken breast, crispy fried chicken which was decent, Bourbon street chicken and the salad which I wasn't too crazy about it. They didn't have enough salad fixins to add to the salad. They were missing green pepper, celery, and bacon bits. The dessert was great. I had the sugar free Strawberry cake which was very delicious and I had jello. Free refills on all drinks.

Not the "around $10 advertised price" when you have to buy a drink separate, more like $14.50 WTF? Next time a glass of water will do, that is if there is a next time, went for their advertised Ribs...so fatty I only partially ate the 4 ribs I was served. And the brisket was just as fatty, that was brought home and given to the dogs. Lots of different ethnic groups all chattering in their own lingo makes it pretty noisy too. Occasional slob with a used plate back at the buffet, and that drives me nuts...eeewwww. I have to say the " baked herb butter fish" was outstanding, but the only fish dish available. Also unattended young ones running the ice cream machine is always a treat....

This is an average buffet for $11 per person without drinks. The kids like it, and always find something they like. Today's menu had:

Grilled steak - very good. Cooked to order, good flavor. A little grizzly and chewy, but overall very good.
Rotisserie and BBQ and fried chicken - overcooked and overcooked and overcooked. No good option here.
BBQ pork - very good, although pretty fatty
Salad bar items  - pretty good and fresh
Vegetables - good selection, with beans, okra, Brussels sprouts and others. Overcooked in most Cases. Mashed potatoes looked pretty nasty, so no one tried it.
Taco bar - ok, meat rather tasteless.
Breads - good selection, but the garlic cheese rolls did not come close to challenging red lobster.
Dessert bar -  excellent. Many items, and pretty tasty. They even had a chocolate fountain with pretty good chocolate. 
Overall, stick with the salads and desserts. The steak was good, but not high quality. 
Almost all other sides or main dishes were overcooked or tasteless. The dessert bar might be worth the price if you don't fill up on the mediocre items.
If the kids want to come back, I would return. Otherwise, it would not be high on my list.
Good food at this Golden Corral for lunch. A low attendance before 4 pm.

I had not been to the Golden Corral for awhile.  I enjoyed my last visit about a year ago.  Good variety of quality food. So I decided to go yesterday it was a major disappointment.  Some things were OK but most were not. Fried chicken was frozen cooked and seemed aged.  I had cauliflower that tasted like fish.  Ate only two bites.  I had spinach that was so bad I thought I would be sick on the spot.  They have lees choices than before and it is obvious they are trying to cut cost by using  cheap food products that are poorly prepared.  I predict this restaurant will either go out of business or someone will get very sick.  Like I said in the beginning this place was a good place to eat a year ago and either I came on a bad day or it is heading in the wrong direction.  I do not recommend.

First for the record, I'm not a buffet fan, but my boyfirend is so I end up at a lot of buffets when its his turn to pick the restaurant.  Golden Corral is some huge chain from North Carolina ala OCB but I must say its an upgrade from our OCB.  The food on the taste scale is a solid 3 out of 5, service sucked hairy ones but its a buffet what service are you really looking for, right?  There was a seafood promotion running, which was basically "if you call it seafood, we can fry it!" type deal.  Desserts were actually what I liked most (Surprise!) they had buffet standards soft serve, toppings, but they also had lemon bars and red velvet cake Yum! Hopefully I will not be back just because I'm serious done with the buffets UGH

I am not a buffet boy -- it's just not my thing. I have been to one, maybe two other buffet restaurants in the past 20 years. My experience has been that the food was mediocre at best and the ambiance was rather stark. However, I found myself at the Golden Corral for a young relative's weekday birthday lunch (it is her favorite place), and it was not bad for what it is. There is a very broad selection of dishes with nods to various ethnic origins. The salad bar is commendable, with lovely mesclun greens and spinach among the choices. The steam tables were well maintained and the food attractive. Everything I sampled was satisfactory, if too salty for my taste -- nothing was cooked to death, and most dishes had some hint of appropriate seasoning. The dcor is warmer than I expected, the place was clean, the staff friendly and helpful. All in all, they do a good job of running an all-you-can-eat buffet with decent food. The only discomfiting thing about the place was the number of morbidly obese customers -- scary, but I guess that goes with the territory...

So I stopped in here twice, once being on a Friday night and the other time on a Thursday night and I will only be going back on Friday nights because there was a HUGE difference in service!

So the place is set up like a regular buffet (pay first and then sit down or get seated and then get your food).  The only difference here compared to most is that you have to pay separate for your drink.  So for dinner it was around $10.50 plus another $1.75 or so for a drink.  I didn't really understand that too much but whatever.  You then get seated if it is busy or seat yourself, at this time you wait for your server, yeah...server, to bring you your silverware and plates.  And anytime after this, you have to ask them for refills and more plates, which again, I didn't like too much because, especially on the Thursday, the service was lacking and we would have to wait a while for the server to even come back to our table to give us fresh plates!  Big downer!  But about the food...it is kind of set up like a casino buffet with stations, if you will.  They had a very large selection with everything from pot roast and mashed potatoes to tacos and Asian style foods!  I really can't complain about the food, except for that Thursday when they weren't refilling the items so when you would go up, the things that were empty on your first trip were still empty!  Another big downer!  But this was not the case on that Friday night...they could not refill everything enough!!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for an inexpensive, tasty meal on a weekend day or night, it would definitely be worth the trip out! =]
I would highly recommend Nella's Beef. John did a great job catering our family picnic last weekend. The Italian Beef and Sausage was excellent.

Not very happy with this place. Seen a post on fb about them and decided to try our their $.99 hotdogs on monday with my 3 year old. We get there and order our food. The guy wasnt friendly at all and hardly said 2 words. We sat down to eat our food and all i hear is little whore this and bitch that...maury is on the TV. not what i want my child to watch so i gave her my phone and we rushed through our food and no words again from the employee. I will never be coming back and i hope others decide to spend an extra dollar to get a better environment and service. Hotdogs were hotdogs, nothing special and everything doesnt include hot peppers which werent even offered.

Pass by this food joint every now and then and my son mentioned that we should try it sometime. Well, we had time this Friday evening so we went for a casual dinner. 

Their menu is not super big but, it has the usual beef, burgers, hotdogs, etc. It's a very nice sized menu.

I ordered the Garlic Cheezy Beef meal. It was OK (decent). I thought it was just a tad salty but, again, decent. I think the same sandwich though is a bit bigger at other beef joints.

The fries were really, really good! 

We ate in. They had other people coming in but, they were ordering to go. It did sound like the other customers were frequent customers.

I'd go there again and eat in or maybe order to go but, next time, I'll try something else.

Decided to try this place cuz I was in the area for work and I'm always looking for a good beef sandwich.  Sorry to say I was very disappointed.  

I tried the garlic cheezy beef, their signature item, and found it to be bland and rubbery.  Good news was fries were made fresh so they were hot and crispy.

The gyro there is good and they have reasonable prices .    The owner is there most of the time and he is pretty nice.  The food comes out quick and there is a TV to watch.  It's a small place but good
Really good food at a very reasonable price.  The hot dogs and beef are wonderful.  Very clean and great staff.
Great place for a sandwich.  Try their italian beef sandwich on garlic bread with melted cheese...even better than portillo's beef!  I've had their meatball sandwich as well and it is very good.
Great food and service! I had the green curry at level 7. Outstanding!  My wife had the cashew chicken and was very impressed.

This place is gross.  Ordered pad Thai and a bunch of other simple chicken/beef dishes.  Nothing is made fresh, no fresh ingredients whatsoever.  

Stay away

If I were writing this review based on food quality alone this would have been a solid 5 star review BUT you do have to pay for the food and pay is exactly what you'll do a lot of at Thai Town. Our  take out order this week for a family of four was over $80 and this is not the result of over ordering - this is three entrees (none seafood) two soups and two appetizers, 2 iced teas - no tip. Don't let the larger containers for take out fool you - our dishes at home didn't change size when Thai Town moved to their new location so although their containers got bigger, the amount of food in my bowls at home was about the same.  I don't mind paying for great food and portions but these prices are higher than I can justify and unfortunately means we won't frequent this tasty choice for local Thai so enjoy the food but have your wallet handy, you'll need it!

I've never dined in, but we've ordered delivery a couple times. Never disappoints. There's an extra charge to deliver to St Charles... A little word since we are super close to South Elgin. but whatever, we're willing to pay. The customer service is great too.

The Pad Thai is where it's at! Husband always gets various chicken dishes and always enjoys them.
Don't order a bubble tea. Definitely not made with fresh fruit seems to be made with the powdered milk. Could not drink more than a few sips of it was very bad.

The best Thai restaurant in the northwest suburbs. Been going there now, for a few months, can't rave enough about it. Food is also hot and delicious, quite an extensive menu to choose from. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Great food, definitely will keep going back.
Tottie

If you like Thai food, you will love this quaint little restaurant. It's located inside of XFactor and oh so delicious! I've never had anything bad here. The family owned business is very customer friendly.

This place really overprices their seafood. The regular soup is 7.95 and with seafood it's 16.95. It shouldn't be a $9 difference just to add a few pieces of shrimp. For regular seafood (shrimp) fried rice it's 16.95 and the beef, chicken and pork fried rice are 9.95, but as soon as you make it combo fried rice (one fourth of each meet all combined together) the price goes back up to 16.95. So because we didn't care that much about the shrimp we decided to ask the waiter how much it would be. He said, "I guess that would be 13.95." It feels like we are negotiating the price of the food. 

                The restaurant has not been very busy when I've gone there, but I guess that's because I eat earlier than most people. It's got a depressing atmosphere. I wouldn't recommend going there when you were looking for music or more than one waiter.

I get takeout from here all the time, and occasionally dine in...never disappointed! Always great food and the service is beyond exceptional. Everything is fresh and cooked perfectly. I always get the pad thai, potstickers and rama noodles.

The food here is excellent. So good. I've been dreaming about going back again. The shrimp cigar appetizers were fantastic. I had pad see ew and it was exceptional (that's my go to entree when I try a new Thai place). The service was good. My complaint is that there are no lunch specials available on the weekend. Also the restaurant is in a strange location (connected to the X Factor - whatever that is). The portions are not gigantic but are definitely filling. I was hungry and didn't leave with leftovers but felt full and happy. 
Overall Food is great and I loved the homey and authentic decor.

Overpriced and overrated. Based on the Yelp reviews we decided to try this place.  The price difference between a chicken/beef item versus a seafood item is about $5-$7 more for seafood. The Pad Thai we ordered was a small portion and too watered down.

This is a local jewel.  The food is excellent.  Be sure to get the egg drop soup.  It's the best I've ever had.  The host is the sweetest lady.   She will make sure you feel at home.   It appears to be family owned and operated.   There is a steady flow of take out orders.  Everything we have tried has been excellent.  It's not salty like you sometimes find with these sorts of restaurants.  Give them a try, you won't regret it!

My family has been a fan of Thai Town ever since they were in Elgin on Randall by  the Dunkin Donuts. They have since moved - twice - but we still enjoy their food. The main reason they get 3 stars from me is their new location. The last time we visited was on Valentine's Day - just a week ago - and I was not happy. It's odd enough that they are located in a nightclub. Beyond odd, really. But we were seated next to the window - and anyone in the Chicago area knows it's been frigid here lately - and I was FREEZING. The draft from the windows made it impossible for me to enjoy my food. I left my coat on the whole time - which doesn't make it enjoyable for me.  It wasn't just me either, two other tables next to the windows had their coats on too. The food was solid, and the service great, as always, but I just can't get over the cold.

We've been looking for a great thai place close to home forever. We were planning on taking our 2 yr old to Jurin to watch the chefs cook and we couldn't wait 45 min with a two year old and six week old. So we took a chance on thai town and so happy we did. It was excellent from food to service.  They brought a fun water glass out for a daughter, a special plate fork and knife with heart shaped rice and a frozen candy bracelet. Our daughter was so excited and it was so generous. And then when the food arrived it was delicious too!  Great place !!!!

The food is pretty good in there. But they merged with a bar that is so so. But it kinda smell like a sewer in there unfortunately but I like the female owner so we go there on occasion. They always get lost on delivery. Just better go on pick it up unless u live down the street literally.
Delicious food, pleasant atmosphere, friendly service. If you like Thai food (and who doesn't?!?) you'll love Thai Town!  We really enjoyed our lunch.

For those of you who give this place 5 stars........ puuuuhlease.   You haven't had good Thai food then if you think this is 5 stars good Thai food.  I'm just commenting on the food everything else with this restaurant is ok.  

I will keep it simple.  I ordered a chicken dish I cut the chicken took a bite and it was cold.  Told the server and he apologized and explained to me that sometimes they don't microwave it long enough before it goes into the fryer.  Seriously???????

If you like your meat "fresh" frozen and microwave thawed as part of the cooking process then this place is for you but I'll try other places for my Thai food.
Good food, but leaves you feeling sick. Very salty. Crab lagoons are great.

Went there for lunch today and was really impressed on how unique it was. The restaurant is in a separate room of a night club. Lots of detail to decor, cleanliness and presentation. 

Hubby ordered off the lunch menu Pad Thai and enjoyed it. We both liked the soup and crab Rangoon appetizer that came with the meal. 

The only disappointment for me was my entree. There really were not many lunch items that did not include green peppers or were flagged as hot so I ordered one of my favorite dishes which is pad siew (sic) off the regular menu. I asked if they fried the tofu and they do but offered not to fry it for me. My tofu was ice cold. I think it could have at least been heated but not fried. Plus, it did not have the traditional flavor that pad siew does. It was very salty, loads of soy sauce is my guess and it had to be made with jar garlic instead of fresh. Every time I got a piece of it in my mouth it was so bitter that it was unpleasant. 

Maybe we will try it again...maybe not...

We have had consistently good food at Thai Town. They are in South Elgin where Blue Razz and a few other places used to be. The restaurant is clean and the service friendly and efficient. We had chicken with peanut sauce and my husband had the rice noodles with yellow curry. We shared the cucumber salad (although my garden is overflowing, it was nice to have them somewhere else) and the egg rolls. 

Bathrooms were just ok - they were in the night club part. Need updating and a good hose-down. 

I hope they stay open a long time -- seems they have a good take-out business.

First time ordering.  Love Thai Food.  But very disappointed in this restaurant.  Ordered delivery. Time wise ok. But the crab Rangoon and egg rolls came cold.  The pad Thai not a lot of flavor. Definitely not happy. Plus definitely  not a cheap place.  Lunch for three 60.00. Delivery 5.00. Just expected  a lot more based on the other reviews.  Not going to order again.  I don't have a problem paying the price. I just want what I paid for.

i would never buy there ever again!! 17$ for a small Tom yum soup that's sweet? They said it's because it's seafood? For 3 pcs if shrimps?? It's a rip off.. 10.95 for a small pad thai? And Green curry that's watery? No way!!

The food is wonderful. To the nay sayer about people being crazy rating so high, you must have just been there on some random off night. I use yelp all the time & travel at least 40 times a year. It's a necessity to rely on yelp reviews. And... I obviously eat out frequently due to travel. Thai Town is a 4-5 star restaurant hands down. The pot stickers & crab Rangoon are some of the best I've ever had. The pad Thai chicken, also the best. We've recently become addicted to the Thai coffee, so good! My picky 9 year old loves the chicken satay. I love our usual order so much I don't try other things, lol. I'm sure it's all amazing. The ambiance isn't fancy 5 star equivalence, but it's quaint & clean. The staff is so attentive and grateful for the business. A true local gem.

So far the best Thai food we've found in the area. Met a mommy friend for lunch here. Loved the smoked noodle flavor on the pad thai. A little strange that's it's in a night club (X factor). All in all, we enjoyed their food.

Excellent food, great service, wonderful ambiance... I highly recommend this lovely restaurant! Had the Panang Curry, Ginger Beef, and Pad Woon Sen. Delicious! Have no idea why anyone would give this place one star. Has moved to a new location to the north end of the building. Come and enjoy!
love the thai food here! :)   best in the area!

Great customer care and service.  I've been here about 8 times in last few months , tonight I was on my way home from work, got to the area about 8:50. I called thinking oh crap they close at 9 and I need to order to go.  The owners son answered and instead of being impatient or making it clear the kitchen was closing, he said don't worry I'll keep the kitchen open for you.  I was elated. I didn't know what I wanted so I was able to get to the restaurant, look at the menu, and order what looked good.  Food was delivered to me at their bar, which by the way has multiple TV'S for sports and a 1/2 dozen poker machines.  Food was spot on and the beers were cold.  If you like Thal or you are looking for a local spot for the games,  this is a great choice.
By the way the kid that answered the phone and told me he'd keep the kitchen open ( owners kid)  had no idea I was a regular

They're a bit onion happy at Thai Town. 

And onions don't neccesarily make me happy.

You'll find at least half a large onion in each dish which doesn't allow much room for the actual dish itself.  Portions here are small to begin with.

Their Tom Yum soup had a great kick to it with a great mix of cilantro, straw mushrooms, & tofu...not too spicy & just sour enough. Beef salad (nam tok)wasn't the best I've had (see Rosded review). Beef was hard to chew and could have used a touch more heat, lime, and fish sauce. 

My sister loves Thai Town.  Then again, my sister's never lived in the city and had the pleasure of authentic, flavorful, and cheap Thai food!
Good food

Wow! This place is fraudulent with debit cards and delivery. We ordered lunch today from the lunch menu. The charge was $7.95 for pad Thai. The size delivered was certainly small and most definitely a lunch portion. I noticed my bill was $17.85 for delivery to a location that is .5 miles away. After calling them to dispute that, I was told that the delivery fee was $3. Then she said it was $6. And the tax was 30%, none of which makes sense. I called my bank immediately to dispute the charges. Skip this place. It's not worth it.

I've been a loyal customer for years. The food tastes very good. Ingredients are fresh and the flavors are nice.

No more.

Over the years the portions have shrunk.
Over the years there has been less and less meat in the portions, more and more filler...onions, water chestnuts, thin sauce etc.
Over the years the staff has stayed nice in store, but the ownership has changed hands and it's been for the worse. (see the response to a customer from March of 2013 below...)

Yesterday I bought lunch for us and guests visiting my home. They come from out of country and always look forward to the food from Thai Town.

Our food came and looked like lunch portions. They were that small. I remember when this place opened, two entrees and my husband and I couldn't finish it all!

The curry looked like SOUP. SOUP I tell you...maybe 5 pieces of meat in the whole dish.

Then I called to check that we did NOT get lunch portions. The first woman who answered the phone apparently was not aware that she worked at the restaurant and said she'd have the owner call me back. Fine.

Then he called back. And I can tell you that he is as rude as in the post below. He was rude from the moment I picked up the phone. He was abrupt. And he told me he didn't care if he had my business.

Fine. Thank you. Goodbye.
7.95 lunch special is great! Get soup, 2 delicious crab meat ragoons, and the entry special. Great food!

Thai food, when done right is flavorful and fresh, a perfect balance of texture and spices (sweet, sour, bitter, spicy).  I wish I could say that Thai Town delivers that and then some, but they just don't.

Tucked away in the long strip mall in South Elgin off Randall Rd. and Silver Glen, amid the Targets and Caputos of the world, lies Thai Town.  A cute little, cheerily decorated (in bright orange) locally owned Thai food establishment.  Their menu is pretty standard American Thai food (pad thai, wonton soup, fried rice, Thai iced tea, etc).

We dropped in on our way to the Paramount Theater for the latest show, "The Music Man," in order to fill up on delicious Thai food.  There was only 1 other table occupied in the restaurant when we got there, and by the time we left there were 2 others as well as a handful of takeout orders that had been picked up.

Prices are typical suburban Thai food prices at about $10+ for an entree or noodle dish.  You won't find any city type mind blowingly cheap dishes on this menu, which is a little bit of a bummer.

The staff is quite friendly & took turns refilling our water any time it was less than half full (quite optimistic, I guess), which was much appreciated.  Our server came over with a big smile on her face to take our order, equally appreciated.  Our soups came out pretty quickly, and they were piping hot and smelled divine.  

My soup (tom yum) was just ok, not the best I've ever had.  There were a lot of vegetables in it (I asked for no meat), including a generous portion of onion.  I wish that the broth had been more spicy and sour; it was sort of weak as is.  My hungrier half's wonton soup was "really good," a high compliment since this guy thrives on wonton soup.  Our matching entrees (chicken pad Thai) arrived before we finished the soup, but they were molten hot, so I didn't mind letting it sit for a minute.  The portions were a bit small, more like a lunch sized portion than a dinner portion as compared to the countless other pad Thai dishes I have under my belt, but it was still plenty, leaving me with a snack-sized leftover pile.  The food itself wasn't very memorable.  The noodles were overdone to the point that they were short from being stirred in the sauce in the kitchen, and it wasn't served with a lime wedge, which is pretty standard in any other restaurant I've been to.  The hot sauce that we were given was WAY watered down too, resulting in me having to essentially douse the pad Thai in order to taste any heat.

The best part of the whole experience for me was in the bathroom.  Their sink is probably one of the coolest sinks I've ever seen.  It's a leaf shaped raised bowl sink in a beautiful gradient of red to yellow...SO COOL.

But I digress...The bill for 2 people (water to drink, wonton soup, tom yum soup, and 2 chicken pad thai) was $36, which I think is a bit high for "meh" food.  With Thai Village just up the road, I think we'll pass on Thai Town the next time we're looking for a Thai place to dine.
Nice ambiance. Excellent service. Fresh and flavorful food. Love this place from start to finish.

I have been to Thai Town on several occasions for lunch and dinner, and each time I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. My two favorites are the Ginger Stir Fry and Pad Woon Sen. Last weekend, we dined with another couple, and although we were not hungry enough to order an appetizer, they brought us a delicious free sample of Crab Rangoon. After our meal they brought complimentary scoops of their pistachio ice cream.  The owner is so sweet and eager to please her customers. My husband and I definitely will return!

Thai Town is NOT closed! Just ordered from them tonight. Restaurant next to Target is still open and they still deliver. 

Please stop reporting false information. This is a small family owned business. False information on Yelp is very damaging!
Delicious food, fast service, nice decor. Reminded me of when I was in Thailand. Lunch special for $7.95!

Food is good. Real good. A little on the pricey side but at least the quality is there. It was raining and we opted for delivery. The pad thai and spicy Mongolian entrees were excellent. Along with the shrimp cigars we had a lovely meal. Perfect Friday night option.

this place is not closed, never has been closed, u r confusing this with another location that they had in elgin that closed a few years, this location is still open, i repeat the location in south elgin is still open, also the location in wasco is still open as well. stop spreading lies this is damaging to their business. the food is amazing and always has been, have going here for yrs,

Thai Town is great, genuine good that tastes a lot like the quality of the Thai I first tried, which is on the east coast.  So good!  The service here is so attentive and sweet, and the food is always delicious.  The appetizers and the noodles are my favorite.  At most times, there are not a lot of people in there, but I will never understand why!  I'm a huge lover of Thai, and this place is great.  So, I try to support them by going once a week or twice a month, and I'm always happy to since the prices are awesome, and the food is always amazing.  I know the location is a bit weird and it may not strike you as a name and location of incredible thai food, but give it a chance.  I can almost guarantee you won't regret it.  I love thai town!

Was craving for some Thai food and decided to check this place out.  Walked into an empty restaurant and sat down.  My first thought....please let this be good.  We ordered the eggrolls for appetizer and the red and panang curry.  Egg rolls were decent.  My red curry was great.  Nice and flavorful.  I went the mild route and was glad I did because it did have a hint of spicy flavor for me.  My dining companion got the panang curry with a spice level of 6 and said that was a little more hot than expected but still tasted good.  The only thing I could see as a negative is that for the price, the portions are a bit on the small side, but what are you going to do?   Good Thai places are hard to find in this area and for me, this is a good one.

My parents love this place... I went for the first time when I came home to visit for Christmas and got the cashew chicken with peppers and water chestnuts...my favorite! We got a few egg rolls and my parents ordered the pad Thai, which is what they get every single time. We actually walked in after they were closed, but were still greeted with smiles and they were very friendly. They had our food ready in less time than estimated and they even gave us some free crab Rangoon, which made my day after several hours of traveling. 

Definetely recommend this place..try the cashew chicken with white rice!

I love Thai Town. I tried it because I Knew there were things here that I could eat even with my "gluten allergy".

 I was surprised at how pretty it is inside their establishment. Every time I go It's never super busy. A lot of the time I'm the only person in there. I would assume a lot of people order take out from Thai Town, because whenever I go in there I see someone paying for a takeout order. The people who work here have always been so nice and respectful to myself and anyone I bring with. They are also SUPER FAST in preparing your meal.

I see a lot of people complaining about them being "ONION HAPPY" at Thai Town....But I LOOOOVE onions. I love every dish I have ever had there. So rock on with your onion-y selves Thai Town!
Definitely the best Thai food around this area.  Always fresh and the flavor is always amazing! I def recommend if one hasn't tried this place. Also, very good service.
Save room for the fried banana and coconut ice cream!

Thai Town DID NOT CLOSE. It moved over to X FACTOR which is to the right at the end of the plaza. 558 Randall Rd. Thai Town moved to have more room for it's customers. Thai Town still has fabulous food. I've been there many times and never been disappointed with any of its dishes. if you want authentic Thai food,this is the place to go. This is a family owned restaurant that takes pride in their cooking.

A friend and I visited Thai Town on 6/21, just after lunch about 1:30PM.  We were the only people in the restaurant the whole time.  Now, I didn't consider that bad, maybe just hit at a bad time. Nevertheless, my order consisted of the Pad Thai with Chicken, not the lunch portion - the regular dinner portion.  The appetizer we ordered was the Pot Stickers.  Both were very good and I would order them again.  The Pot Stickers were deep fried, not steamed.  The hot sauce we got on the side was very good and not so super hot that I couldn't have it.  The Pad Thai portion was smaller than I expected but it was filling I guess.  I would recommend Thai Town and would visit again.

-Zac A.
Elgin, IL
Great Thai food!  Had the pot stickers and the Pad Thai, both were very good!  Also, the restaurant is decorated in Thai fashion, makes it feel authentic.

Thai Town is my very favorite restaurant in the area. The food is so fresh and everything has been so delicious. My favorite is the yellow curry and the chicken basil. The Pad Thai and the Tom Kai soup both spectacular as well.

Very small portions and above normal prices for Thai in this area.  The owner is pushy and weird.  Made my boyfriend and I really uncomfortable because he kept coming to our table and bothering us during our meal.  I would not go again.

My Mom and I were not impressed with this establishment. The pud Thai is sub par. It was a little sour and did not have much sauce. My panang curry was just OK not even good. The soup and appetiser were good, but nothing special. I would be interested in trying this place for lunch because they do have a good selection of large sized soups. If it's any better for lunch, I will submit an update.
Fresh and tasty.   Portions could be a tad bigger but the food is always good, especially the curry.

Overall average experience.  Panang curry was average and Spicy Basil dish was good.  The tofu was very mushy, I prefer firm tofu.  Also noteworthy were the filthy tablecloths that had stains all over them.  Staff was very nice and attentive.

My father is Thai and the whole family just got together for my mom's birthday.  We are really hard to please when it comes to authentic Thai restaurants that meet our expectations.  We ordered 6 different dishes and they were the best we've had in a long time.  Good Pad Thai, Tom Ka Gai, Pad Sieuw, Basil Chicken.  Thai Town, thanks for feeding us well on this family occasion.

THIS PLACE IS GREAT!  This is a family owned restaurant and you can tell by the sense of pride they take in the food they serve.  The food is great, and the servers (usually the owner or her daughter) ask great questions to make sure you order what you want.  There always seems to be a steady stream of people picking up orders, and the tables are often full too.  It's in a little strip mall that is quite deceiving.  Once you're inside it's a quaint place that is quite enjoyable.  This is some great Thai food.  We've ordered different curries, pad thai, and some other goodies.  We've also gotten some appetizers as well which are always great too.  I've never left disappointed.

Now that Akina's in downtown Elgin closed, this is the place to go.

Great thai food, nice and spicy if you like it that way and a good variety.

The service is the best around and extremely friendly.  They also have the coolest little garnishes in the shapes of roses and leaves made out of vegetables.

Wow this review is pretty bland, but do you get the point?  This place is super!

The food is superb! It's always fresh and thoughtfully prepared. The staff is very friendly and wants to please you. We dine in at least twice a month. Like the other reviews state it is a little pricey for Thai food, but it is the best Thai in the area.

Thai Town is amazing.  I wouldn't hesitate to call it THE BEST RESTAURANT IN SOUTH ELGIN.  The food is fresh and flavorful, with perfectly cooked protein and crisp, deliciously healthy vegetables.  

The family who run the restaurant create a friendly and relaxed atmosphere, and the granmother/mother who runs the kitchen could cook yours under the table.  

A must visit.

Thai Town is one of my favorites in the South Elgin area.  Love the fresh flavors, the ground chicken basil leaves is excellent.  I can't resist the chicken rice soup either, so it's great that the soup comes with their lunch specials.
The food is very good. Love the chicken pad thai.  However, the restaurant smells bad. So, we typically pick our food up.
Excellent Shrimp Pad Thai. Good service. Overall very good.

Excellent Thai food in South Elgin, iL?  NO F'in WAY.  We've been to the BBQ place next door and since Akina in Elgin closed down due to the construction here.  We hit up Thai Town.  We were delightfully impressed.  The owner took a lot of time in decorating and providing a great environment.  I liked the mixture of thai culture pictures and Muay Thai photos (I'm a big MMA fan).  We were seated quickly and the waitress was very friendly.

We ordered a couple of appetizers (chicken satay and some shumai dumplings), both were very tasty and as our entrees I got the pad thai and my wife got the red curry.  The pad thai was pretty good but my wife's red curry with chicken was awesome.  I love the coconut milk curries and this one was one of the best I've ever had.  Definately will return to this place.

My friend and I decided to try Thai Town the other day.  It was a little hard for us to find (there is so much stuff on Randall Road and Thai Town is in a strip of stores behind some other buildings so it wasn't visible from the road), but now that we know where it is we're definitely planning to go back!  I love Thai food and there were a lot of options on the menu that sounded good, but I decided to try something I haven't had before: Panang Noodles.  It was wonderful!  Very thick, soft noodles with vegetables and a yummy panang curry sauce.  My friend had Pad Thai with chicken, which she said was very good too.  The portion sizes weren't too huge but we were too full for dessert.  Prices for entrees seemed to be in the $9 to $13 range (average).  I want to try some other dishes, but the panang noodles were so good it will be hard not to get that again. :)

WOW!!!  Every now and then you find a hidden gem.  This place has everything to offer from spectacular food to warm & friendly service.  The dining room is really nice --- clean and comfortable.  We started with some Thai Ice Tea --- these are a MUST ORDER if you have never had them.  Sweet, refreshing, and kind of unusual.  For an appetizer, we went straightforward and tried the steamed dumplings.  Sounds boring?  Give them a try.  The dough used to make the dumpling is thinner layer than your typical dumpling.  You get 8 or 9 dumplings in a single order and the sauce is fantastic.  Not only that, the presentation will exceed any order of dumplings on the planet.  Two thumbs up on the dumplings.  We then ordered one of the daily specials --- Scallops in Garlic Sauce and an order of the Pad Thai with Chicken.  Again, Thai Town's presentation is phenomenal!  The flavors were spot-on, the food was hot, and ultimately was DELICIOUS!  The ONLY thing I would comment on would be size of portion --- but, we definitely felt satisfied.  At the last minute, we decided to order dessert --- Fried Bananas with Coconut Ice Cream with whipped cream & chocolate sauce.  This was the PERFECT compliment to an outstanding dining experience.  And, all of that was less than $50 for two.  Great restaurant!  We'll definitely be back for this one.
Very good food and beautiful presentation!  Great service!

I have been here various times and food is excellent and fresh. The only deterrent for me are the portions. They are really small and the seafood dishes are expensive. If i can afford it I wil go back all the time.

I went here on a lark, just to see if it was good. My girlfriend and I eat a lot of Thai food because eats easy to get a wide range of vegetarian options for her. This place was really yummy. I had some Schezwan style Chicken and noodles with a side of Jasmin rice... it was superb AND it happened to be one of the Lunch Specials so it was cheap too, only 6.95 for 2 stomach fulls of food. My girlfriend had the Green Curry with tofu which she loved as well. I had a taste of it and it was quite good.

The staff was nice and we got plenty of attention seeing as it was pretty desolate on a Thursday afternoon. The decor was ok, various pictures and paintings against a purple painted room. Plenty of tables and chairs. I don't live close enough to be going there for take-out often, which is a shame because I liked the food as much as Akina's in Elgin, but it's a little bit cheaper at Thai Town. My girlfriend remarked that the tofu at Akina's was slightly better though.

An older gentlemen came to the restaurant sometime during are meal and greeted the manager and the waitresses happily and made friendly conversation with them (that we couldn't help but overhear). He seemed to be a regular and complimented the food and the service several times. He said something like "This is good eats... and cheap too!" I'd have to share his sentiments exactly :)

We went to Thai Town a few months ago. It was hard to find and I had to call them to find out exactly where they were. We took my 4 yr old son with us and this place wasn't very kid friendly. We were the only ones there for lunch on a Monday. The shrimp pad thai was excellent. That's the only reason I would go back.

I am a HUGE Thai fan and this place is as good as it gets.  The food was amazing and the waiter was pleasant.  If you enjoy Thai it's a must and if you are a vegetarian or a fan of any asian cuisine you have to give it a shot.  FYI, I think the new Thai town off Randall just South of HWY 20 (Dunkin Donuts side) is from the same owners so I would expect the same quality.

Every once in a while, you'll catch a puppy or two on the patio. That in itself makes me love this place. Add in Franky, who is impressively knowledgeable on all things craft beer and wine. She's witty and a breath of fresh air. John (the chef) has been concocting some really amazing pizzas which just takes this small space to the next level. If they had brunch, I'd be here every weekend just to see what he's come up with. Overall a great spot.

A real gem in a place you wouldn't expect.

Another fly by visit to Chicago and I was hankering for some beer.  I found this on Yelp, nudge nudge and figured I'd swing by on my way to O'Hare.  From the outside I wasn't too optimistic, but I am glad I went in.  The look and feel is exactly what I look for in a bar, nothing fancy, a lot of cool stuff on the walls, and loads of good beer.  

Service was good, beer was great, prices were a little high.  Did not try the food, but I know where I will be next time I am in the neighborhood.
Apparently, with the new Illinois Happy Hour rule, pints here before 6pm are $2.77.  Woohoo!

I'm the last one of my friends to go, but I finally went. Yay! My husband and I were attending a wedding in the area, so we knew a pit stop at Bigby's was mandatory. Plus, who doesn't love a little day drinking? We stuck out like sore thumbs being all dressed up in a place like this, but we were welcomed like old friends.

The bartender was alone, but he was efficient---pouring, passing, then starting the process again for the next person. It only took a few minutes for him to make his way over to us and make some suggestions. I also asked about a beer and how it got it's name and he gave me a really detailed description about it. 

The people that come here are cool. They realize that this place is sacred and not like other bars, so they treat you well too. We had a random conversation with another couple at the bar the entire time we were here. 

I didn't get to spend as much time here as I'd liked, but I'll make a special trip to Addison to visit soon. Bigby's is one of the few places that live up to the hype.

This place has a huge selection of beers and a small footprint. This means, get here a lil early to grab a seat. The bartenders are very knowledgable and can recommend any of their beers for you if you just tell them the flavor profile you're after. The pizza is really good too! I would mark this a 4 start spot but it can get pretty tight in there pretty quick. So I don't always think to come here as the seating isn't always available.

I would still give this place a shot as the food and beer will not disappoint!

It's a different type of atmosphere I'm used to but I really enjoyed it the board games were fun and selection is good! Only thing is the bartenders are rude and condescending!! I felt I was a bother asking them questions about the beers. Only reason I cring when people want to meet up there!

I have to say, I was surprised to find a place like this in the burbs! Great rotation of craft beers (though note Sierra Nevada was on at least 3-4 of tap handles the day we went in). 
Unassuming and casual, some couches in the corner that somehow work and aren't creepy. Think a little bit Kumas Korner meets   World of Beer. For folks that like Three Floyd's, Half Acre, etc it is a nice place to drop into.

I've lived in Addison my whole 21 years 4 months and couple weeks and never really noticed this place until a few months back. Granted, I only turned 21 this year so I suppose I only actually started caring about where one can get a decent drink recently, but gosh I'm glad I found Bigby's! Addison doesn't exactly have a reputation for having anything decent but I'm starting to beg to differ! (See Elio's, Freddo's, Zaza's, etc) Bigby's has an incredible beer selection, one of which you're more likely to know fewer beers on the list than you know and taps that rotate daily. If you want to drink pee on tap (aka Bud, Busch, Pabst, etc) or even many macro brews, this isn't the place for you. Though Bigby's is definitely mostly a beer place, they do also serve various wines including wine flights for $13. The prices of beers vary. Food is pizza and tapas, though I have yet to get any food here.
The staff is very knowledgeable about what they serve, so ask away if you have questions! They can sometimes come across as cold, which can be off setting, but don't let that put you out. The clientele is dominantly young adults (and a bit hipster) but, likewise, don't let that stop you from coming in! The volume isn't generally loud, there are only 2 TVs (awesome), it's comfortable and casual in appearance, tables, couches, patio or bar for seating. There is a whole shelving space full of board games which is lots of fun. Bathrooms are shared with Mario's but they're fine!
I will note, you sometimes see reviews complaining that they don't serve hard alcohol and don't have enough TVs-- well spotted, this isn't a sports bar and they don't advertise as such so stop complaining. Also don't bring your kids here, for Pete's sake. I'll cut off my review here, if I get anymore detailed there'll be no point in a reader going. Do give it a try!

I stopped in here while in town for work.  I was looking for a spot with some decent food and a great beer selection.  This place fits the bill.  

It has a great dive/local bar feel to it.  The beer selection is great, and the friendly bartender was more than willing to give me a quick sample before making a decision.

The menu here is pretty small, but my food was great.  I tried the "prosciushi" and the latin lover pizza.  The "prosciushi" is house cured prosciutto with fresh arugula and mozzarella rolled up and cut like a sushi roll.  It was fresh and delicious.  The latin lover pizza (chorizo, onion & cilantro) was pretty good as well.  

I won't bore you with every detail of the 4 beers I had here, but they were all really good after a long week!  This is a spot I could definitely frequent.
Wanted to try the food but we never got a menu. Also, the person who waited on us had a bit of an attitude and i am not having any of her BS.
The food is good, but not great. I definitely come here for the laid back atmosphere and the beer.

Who knew??  I've wondered about this place for quite some time...What is a "pour house?"  Can anything nice be in that building??... and finally popped in with the neighbors.  

Comfy, casual little place with a stunning and ever-revolving variety of beer on tap.  If you're a connoisseur, this is the place!  Wine is also available but this is definitely a beer place.  The night we stopped in they were playing a trivia game.  It was slow-paced and even though they were calling out stages of the game, it was unobtrusive and a fun aside for non-participants.  

They offer some food...tapas, some pizzas...  We tried the charcuterie platter (good snack for 4 but better for 2) and a small cheese pizza (okay).  Also available are a whole lot of board games.  Hankering for a brutal round of the Game of Life?  This is the place!

There is a patio but it doesn't seem put to good use.  That's a shame.  I'm all about the patios if the weather is at all tolerable.  Service struck us at first as a little dry...not particularly helpful...but I'll chalk that up to style because either we or she quickly warmed up and we found our server to be passionate about the brews and full of good suggestions.

...but here's the thing.  I'm 49 years old.  This is the first place I've ever gone where I felt like an old timer.  lol  Seriously...this is Hipster Central.  College students abounded but not in a raucous kind of way...the mood was happy and chill.  It was just weird to feel like I was in another generation's territory.  But that's just me.  I totally felt welcome there but it didn't feel like a peer-place.  ...not that that matters.  Just an observation.

PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT: DO NOT SERVE FOOD ON SUNDAYS!!! NO FOOD!!! 


Large section of beverages! Friendly service, great decor. Smells great inside, really great atmosphere and comfortable feel. Enough room for a friendly get together. They have a lost and found and a little Library for books to read while you drink.

I do enjoy Bigbys, they typically have some excellent beers on tap. I think one of my favorite parts of this bar is that they put out empty bottles on shelves as you enter so you can see what they have. They have plenty of comfortable seating including some couches and lounge chairs. They have board and card games on the wall. It wasn't loud at all when we were there. The bartenders are down to earth and very easy to talk to. They had a $2 off cans special one night while I was in which resulted in $3 16oz cans of daisy cutter. 

Protip: follow them on facebook for their various rotating specials

Very interesting place. 

Came in town late and was looking for food. Checked Yelp and found this place near the hotel. The atmosphere is unique and the food is pretty good.

This was my first visit as a "walk-in" - my first visit here was part of a Yelp Elite event that convinced me to come back for more. So I did, as part of an entourage of ten.

We walked in on a Monday night around 9PM and there were very few seats to be had in the house. We scavenged what we could until a few more people had drifted out and finally managed to muster up two tables and enough chairs to accommodate us. I couldn't begin to tell you all the beers that were ordered, but I can tell you that the whole group enjoyed them as well as the Muddy Pig that we ordered - a chocolate and bacon dessert that hits the spot. 

We opted to play Headbanz, which is one of thirty some games that they have there for patrons to use and enjoy. Bigby's is like a coffeehouse designed for beer - there's nothing else like it in the suburbs and very few if any in the city. Go for the beer and the experience as well.
Love this place!  They have a great atmosphere, great food and great beer selection.  It also has a very cool atmosphere, with board games and kitschy sofas.  Fun times!

It's like day care for adults expect ( a lil later in the day) it sells alcohol and the juice and crackers are substituted with grown up food. Games and beer and food oh my! There is always something special going on here with brews and food. Go around Oktoberfest season and mouthwatering pretzels and fall beers. It's always fun to try something new and you can bet it will be good. Staff is awesome!

It's very apparent that their new location is getting all the love and attention of the ownership.  Tap list and bottle selection is nothing special anymore.  I'm able to find the same if not a better selection at other places.  The place is falling apart.  Good luck finding a seat at the bar not being held together by duct tape or just split open.  The entire vibe has changed here.  The old bartenders were knowledgeable about all the beers they had.  Now it's just another bar that has craft beers with the owner walking around in his pajama pants.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed Bigby's yet! This place is a favorite spot of mine for many reasons. First of all, the staff are all great, very knowledgeable, hospitable, and friendly. Ed the owner has done a great job creating an atmosphere that is easy going, relaxed, and fun. There are always interesting beers on tap and every time I go, I try something new. The food here is great and simple: pizzas, gourmet appetizers, and desserts. The food is always consistent and efficient when it comes to soaking up beer. If you are a beer person or a foodie in general you will definitely appreciate Bigby's and the vibe they present. Board games, pizza, beer, you can't go wrong.

Couldn't ask for a much better experience. This place is intimate, comfortable, and feels warm. I like the selection of board games; it makes the place feel like a local coffee house. I showed up for a Yelp event and we were treated great. The staff, Frankie and Joel, was knowledgeable with their beer recommendations. I drank a Metropolitan lager and a smoked wheat on draft and both tasted great.

For a pub, the food was very impressive. The spicy bacon pizza was really outstanding. The tomato sauce is flavorful with a good kick of heat. The 4-cheese pizza was ok, I would have preferred it with sauce though. And the appetizer with the flatbread and sauce with the goat cheese is not to be missed. I don't even care for goat cheese, but this app was tremendous. It was like an upscale creamy pizza sauce. The triangular-shaped bread was well seasoned with Italian herbs and came out warm. I don't know if I could visit there without ordering this dish. 

Parking is a little confusing as I wound up in the Dunkin' Donuts lot next door, but hey, if that's my biggest complaint, that sounds pretty darn good.

Bigby's is quite the eccentric 'bar', if you want to even call it that.  It's a 'bar' in the sense that they serve alcohol, but I'm pretty sure it's just beer & wine, no hard liquor or cocktails.  Aside from that, there's very little separating it from looking and feeling like someone's basement or a decked-out garage with TV's and hightop tables.

There's a shelf full of board games, comfy sofas, a fishtank with 1 fish in it, a wall covered with bottle caps.......overall, it's a very eclectic assortment of junk that fills the space, and it kinda works?  I'm still on the fence about whether or not the atmosphere is cozy or just too weird.

Drinking environment aside, the only thing that surpasses their number of wall decorations is their brew selection.  I honestly had a difficult time finding something on their beer menu that sounded even remotely familiar, so I finally settled on a white IPA.  Dozens of snazzy beer taps (including a shotgun one--cool!) are displayed above their crowded bar countertop, and some are pretty amusing/unusual.

Because this place is in Addison (read: not at ALL close to either my work, my apartment, or my parent's home), I don't imagine I'll be coming back here anytime soon.  A modest pour of Moscato was $8; yesterday I picked up an entire bottle of Moscato at the local Trader Joe's for the same price, so I'm having a hard time justifying charging that much for a single glass.

The beer's not not cheap, but it ain't no tall boy of Bud Light, either......the least expensive beer I saw was a 9oz for $5, and, unlike the majority of bars on a Wednesday night, they didn't have any featured specials on ANY night of the week.  So that further discourages me from returning......

I don't know.  This place might be some people's cup of tea, but it wasn't at all what I expected, and that caught me off-guard.  Call me frat-tastic if you want, but I'm all about the noisy pubs with lots of room and daily drink deals.  And what's the sitsh with that fish in solitary isolation?  Why is he all alone?  Was he put there on fish probation for poor fish behavior?  Did he eat the rest of his tank buddies?  I might never find out.

Being the last yelper on earth to try this place, I finally made my way last week for a party and don't understand why it took me so long. 

The staff was super-friendly. The beer selection was ridiculously huge. I love the system of dropping the stones into the beer bottles to get them on tap. That's just genius. 

Everything I tried on tap was good. And I sampled a bottled cider from the massive wall o' choices too. 

I didn't feel intimidated not knowing a lot about beer, like how you feel at most bars. And the atmosphere was comfortable, with a nice beer garden outside to head to when it got a bit stuffy inside. 

I'd definitely go back because I want to try the pizza I keep hearing about. It looks and sounds awesome.

I plea guilty!

I live only about 10 minutes from Bigby's and finally just manage to check it out. *hanging my head in shame* The stories you hear are true, this place is a swanking good time. An extensive list of on tap beer including prices and alcohol content is conveniently posted on a chalkboard for your ease. Their menu is short and delicious and their selection of board/card games will turn your already fun night into tears of laughter and belly aches, at least for us it did.

Thanks to BPH it was my first time playing Cards Against Humanity and my oh my if you do not have a open mind and a fun sense of humor CAH is definitely not for you, but I can't remember the last time I laugh so much.

During our laughing session with friends, the bf and I decided to split the Latin Pizza. We both are cilantro lovers and seeing that cilantro will be an ingredient on this pizza we couldn't say no. The pizza was thin crust and quite delicious with the chorizo, but we couldn't taste any of the cilantro so we were a bit disappointed. No worries, we'll just ask for extra cilantro next time.

We had good company, refreshing beers, delicious pizza, and CAH, what more can we ask for? Cheers to a fun-filled night at Bigby's we're sure to be back.

This is exactly the type of bar that I personally enjoy.  There is a lot of craft beer, the music isn't so loud that you can't talk to your friends, and the atmosphere is cool.
