However, I also did not have a taste for it that day. I wanted soup but ramen broth usually is so rich and thick while I just wanted something light. At that point though, I would slurp just about anything even Archimedes' bath water.

Luckily, we got seated right away thanks to my friend calling ahead. The place was pretty cool inside though small and people were waiting for a table. It was absolutely packed! I started to salivate looking at what other people were eating at nearby tables.

I was jumping for joy when finding out they had Shio ramen, which was ramen with clear chicken broth. That was exactly what I wanted! Chicken broth for my hoarse throat recovering from a cold. Perfect!! Our table also ordered the Tonkotsu ramen and Miso ramen as well as Kara age or fried chicken and some Japanese fried rice.

The fried chicken came first and oh it really was tasty! It's crispy, hot, and had a very good flavor though it could stand a bit more salt. However, once you dipped it in the mayo sauce, all is well.

My ramen was delicious and from not really wanting one, I ended up really enjoying and appreciating my bowl. The broth was light, clear, and it felt so good going down my throat. I think I drank the whole bowl of broth and left half the noodle behind completely dried. The tea egg was tasty and they gave you both halves! The noodle part was okay and I wasn't sure if the noodles were homemade. I tried my friend's Tonkotsu, and that was great! Next time when I wasn't recovering from a cold, I would go for that rich, thick, pork broth and slurp away.

The Miso was pretty good but I have never would go for Miso ramen so my opinion did not matter here. The fried rice was really nice. I don't know..it just tasted good. Was it because I was hungry? Could be, but it was still good and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Great find for me! I would never thought of going here looking at it from the outside. It was in a strip mall and it didn't stood out at all. It's cool that we don't have to go fighting traffic next time and go to the city just for ramen. That's a great discovery as great as hydrotastic or pi. The displacement of my watery broth from the bowl to my tummy was enough to make me follow suit to Archie and took the street naked jumping for joy of my discovery.

On second thought, naaaahhhhhh. I don't want to get arrested for ramen.

Is ramen supposed to be really salty? And when I got my food, soup skin was formed at the top. And the Kara-age was really salty too. With all this saltiness, I needed a lot of water, but thank god to the really attentive and friendly wait staff, hence the plus points. And I wish I could take home those canvas prints on their walls, so serene and simply elegant. Too bad, I was looking forward to this place.

Important to be there when they open if you do not want to wait. Very generous portion and well spiced noodles.  Once done you are expected to pay and leave,  otherwise you will get stink-eye from those still waiting. Worth it.
_ramen taiwan ramen, good to try. Interesting flavor children wrings. Authentic Japanese restaurant.

Super tiny place for busy busy business. You have to have extra an hour or so for time you planned to eat. Very crowded and hot!!! Once you are in the service is excellent. 

For ramen: good ramen. Specially the Taiwanesse Ramen. I have tried the others but I don't find them as good as Taiwanese one.
Even better this go round! Tonkotsu-ramen was where it is at today and a side of negi! The broth seemed richer and more flavorful as well. Off to the Copper Fiddle to taste booze with the boys!
This is the most authentic Ramen house I have ever been in the US. Lots of Japanese and makes me feel like I just visited somewhere in the middle of Tokyo. Great Ramens! I also love the Donkatsu.

I had the tonkotsu and it was very good but I've never had it before so I have no comparison. 

Mu group also had the Tiwan and Best Condition Ramen. Everyone liked their dish. The Tiwan had tons of whole garlic cloves but they were pretty mild and while spicy the broth was not overwhelmingly so.

Wish they had translations of the specials on the chalk boards.

Overall very good, will be back.

This place is awesome! I got the Veggie Ramen dish and it was so flavorful, and you can choose how spicy you want it which is nice. Makes great leftovers cause portions are huge. I love how simple it is and that their menu isn't too big so you know the ingredients are very fresh! Will be returning :D

4.5  I really like this place.  The noodles are cooked well (not soft) and the broth is not over seasoned. 

I had the char-su ramen (pork belly) in miso. Pork was definitely tasty.  The egg was cooked well. Not a completely light yellow yolk, but nice coloration.  I hate an overcooked yolk!  Broth was delicious.

Tip: When you walk in, always checkout the chalkboard on your left.  There are always additional menu items there.

So happy there is a good ramen shop nearby.

There are lots of places to consider in the NW burbs when it comes to ramen now, and Shinchan makes a decent choice for satisfying your ramen craving.  

Having tried 4 different types of ramen here, Tonkatsu is the best.  It's got a nice salty flavor for the broth and the noodles are nice and chewy.  The pork chop that comes with it is tasty, but not as good as Ramen Misoya's (and they give you 3 pieces).  I've also had the Miso Ramen, but I found it to be quite bland, which was a disappointment.

They also have these salt and pepper chicken wings that are pretty good, and I forget the exact name of them, but it's definitely something to try.  However, the wings are super tiny, more like quail wings or something and at $6 for 5 wings, it's kinda pricey.

Also, we came with a group of 6, and it was quite difficult for them to find a place for us so we waited almost an hour at lunch time on a Sunday when it wasn't all that busy.  Then they proceeded to seat us at a 4 top, so they squeezed us into a small table.  So just something to be aware of if you are coming with a large party.

Ugh...this place is like my favorite little secret. Sometimes when I'm sitting at home I have a crazy craving for noodles in a delicious broth. I've only ordered to go because it's always crowded but one day I will sit and slurp happily with everyone else. I've only tried the Taiwan Ramen, which is spicy and makes my eyes roll  to the back of my head. I'm reserving the one star for when I dine in. If I were to rate the food I've had...5 stars!

Are you kidding me?  This place is unreal.  We got there early and stood in line outside before it opened.  We started with the Gyoza and they were superb.  I had the best condition ramen and I absolutely loved it.  It is a huge portion and I brought home enough to have ramen for the next two days.  My youngest son had the chicken wings and I was totally surprised at how tasty they were.  My other son and husband both ordered different ramen.  All were delicious and warmed us up on a cold day.

As authentic as it gets. This place is a hidden gem and it's definitely worth the venture. It's a small restaurant and decor is simplistic and so is their food. 

Servers for the most part aren't fluent in English, but very helpful and attentive. They have a simple menu consisting of ramen variations and some appetizers. Note that there are more options on the chalk walls inside so look up from the menu and try something that might be more seasonal or the special.

Miso Ramen: Creamy and hearty. The perfect traditional bowl of ramen. 
Best Condition: Veggie lovers paradise. Sooooo many bean sprouts that it'll take 10 bites before you find your noodles. 
Taiwan Ramen: Spicy and meaty with an extra kick of garlic. 
Kara-age: Perfectly crispy.
Gyoza: Standard

Overall great quality and price. Perfect for a quick bite or when you're craving ramen. Definitely a go to for me.

Great friendly staff and nice environment.

I come here during my lunch break for a personal pizza and a pop for $4.99 and it's the perfect meal if I'm really hungry.  The pizza is topped just right.

I dont write very many reviews,  but this friendly little spot deserves a mention. 

My girlfriend and I were visiting from chicago for the weekend and developed the taste for pizza.  We found this mom and pop spot on yelp and thought we'd give'em a try.

One of the best decisions of the trip.
The pizza was awesome !!!!
And let me remind you, im from the city,  on the west side.  I know pizza.

The crust is perfect, and the freshness of the ingredients really comes through. 
 
The owners were there,  and Rosalee was wonderful,  her service was amazing and made us feel like family.  We felt like we knew these people for years.

On our way out, the husband and chef of the establishment offered us a dessert. I was already stuffed, but my girl wanted to try it.  He brings to the counter a homemade cannoli.  It was nothing short of amazing,  i had to make room it. This place is a must do if in St. Charles area.
Thanx guys.

Pomodoro is SO much more than a pizzeria...its a little treasure of authentic Italian eats AND priced so affordably you wish you lived down the street...

Heard this place had some ridiculously good pizza and Italian specialties - so we made the trek down to Pomodoro E Mozzarella (I love the name alone) and let me tell you I may consider moving to St. Charles (or buying a helicopter to get here).

Cute little trendy spot located in a small strip mall off of North Ave.  Its more of a carry-out spot as there are only 3 or 4 small tables.  Interior is modern, clean & narrow.  You can plop yourself at the limited counter seating to your left, but not much room here especially for a large group.  On a Friday night, all tables were occupied...

The extensive menu boasts an ARRAY of traditional & specialty offerings. From the traditional pasta list (18 house made choices) to seafood, chicken, sandwiches, salads and unique app's and lets not forget PIZZA. The atmosphere along with the Sicilian inspired dishes left me quite impressed....its more of a caf than a typical pizza joint..  

Our large group placed a large order to go:

Med Thin crust - Pomodoro Special (green pepper, sausage, mushroom & onion).  
Piccola (small) Artisan Ortolana (grilled eggplant, zucchini & roasted red peppers).
Piccola Artisan Gamberi (shrimp on garlic confit tomato sauce with fresh mozzarella).
Pesto Gnocchi
Penne w/meatballs and sausage in red sauce
Side of Rapini (for me).
Grilled baby octopus app (for me).

Our order was ready before we arrived (yes, that's how long it took us to get here, driving into the City is even faster). They even phoned to make sure we were on our way (very nice gesture) - we had passed it a few times.  From the nice phone girl to the workers behind the counter, everyone was professional and friendly and everything was nicely packaged and bagged.

While I thought the pizza's were wood fired, their in fact oven baked. Artisan resembles a wood fired crust. Around 10" for a small.  They offer both small & large sizes in Artisan only.  All smalls are $13, Large $20 with the exception of Margherita; $10 & $18. 
Many traditional Italian varieties, but Shrimp is not one I see often, so I went for it.  

I tasted it all. Pesto gnocchi was a standout with a generous amount of pesto packed with flavor. Gnocchi was somewhat tender, but didn't melt in my mouth. I've tasted some really heavy gnocchi and this was definately better than most. Penne in marinara was overcooked but both sauce & meatball had great flavor. I'd order the gnocchi before Penne.

I loved my side of Rapini. Very tender, very flavorful.  Sauted with lots of chopped garlic and olive oil.  Healthy and tasty.  I would order this again in a heartbeat.  Not something I expected to see here, love that they offer this. The grilled baby octopus...ooooooohhh....they give you three nice sized octopus and I am a SUCKER for this.   Perfectly charred and tender, gently laying in balsamic & oil with lemon..I was in octopus heaven. Another stand out - Loved this. You MUST try it. Screw the calamari, get this instead, well worth it.

Artisan pizza - I tasted & noticed olive oil on the bottom of crust which had a softer bite vs. chewy.  The fresh mozzarella they use is excellent quality, you can taste it. Shrimp pizza was a garlicky explosion. You may not want to kiss anyone after eating this. Nice amount of shrimp not overcooked.  Ortolana is a go-to of mine, but veggies were cut to thick for this crust. Chunks of grilled red pepper, thick sliced zucchini and eggplant.  It made the middle soggy and crust couldn't hold the weight of toppings. But I loved that each veggie was perfectly grilled, tender and ultra tasty.  I had no problem finishing leftovers...  
Thin crust pizza was liked by all. I thought it was good, but would go with the Artisan again.

You won't find a better value for the quality here. Seriously. Pasta's start at $10, most expensive $12 w/seafood.  Compared to your average restaurant, that is a STEAL.  Most expensive app; Octopus $11.  Portions are enough for two. When you don't feel like making dinner, you come here for some home style cooking instead..

Pomodoro is a great find and I can see why its popular among locals.  Quality & preparation is above and beyond. Sicilian owned with dishes done right. I'd come back for the rapini and grilled octopus alone and maybe try an Arancini or the Sicilian specialty -  Tronchetti Di Panelli (garbanzo fritters - sound delish).  They make their own bread too.  Grab an 8" pizza and soda for $4.99 during the lunch special.

St. Charles is lucky to have you Pomodoro. If your in the area searching for a great, casual, fast and affordable meal, you'd be stupid not to check them out.

Ordered carry out and the pizza was amazingly fresh! High praise for the pizza from the Californians visiting us! Brilliant!

Also, they've remodeled and added more tables... Definitely a gastronomic stop for the family...

Salad, pizza, and pasta were all delicious. The service was excellent as well.

This place needs to become BYOB or get liquor license. Way too good of food to not have beer or glass of wine.

I grew up on the Northwest side of Chicago, in Little Sicily.   I ordered to special which is sausage, green pepper, mushroom, and onion. The pizza came out a bit charred on the edges, hot, and super delicious. I told my spouse that this pizza reminds me of my youth in the old neighborhood. Sure enough the owner lived in the same area too. You can always tell!!!!  

In addition to the pizza we ordered wings. They were great!  Naked, crispy, No breading with a side of sauces. 

This is my new go to place.
We LOVED their eggplant Parmesan so much. Can't wait to come back in town to eat here again. I can't imagine that they have anything bad on the menu.

This is the absolute best Italian food you'll find in this price range.  There are a few better places for Italian food but you'll easily pay double what Pomodoro charges.

This is mostly a take-out restaurant, but there is a little counter to eat at if you'd like to stay and eat.

Now, good Italian food is simple and gets it's flavor from good ingredients. These guys deliver on that. The sauces are excellent and the pastas are always done perfectly - not overcooked like 90% of the places around here. 

Their pizzas are seriously fantastic.

This is definitely a place where you'll do well being a little adventurous with your order. For the love of God, quit ordering spaghetti and try something new. 

The couple that runs this place are great. Super nice people. The food isn't pretentious at all, it's honest and really good.


The best part about this is that right next door is Muscle Maker grill.... all the gym bros from XSport around the corner have been trying to get swole eating bad chicken next door and have no idea how much better they'll do if they just got some chicken and pasta after their workout.  Makes me laugh every time......

Full disclosure: I downloaded the app just so I could write about how delicious the food here is. My girlfriend and I were just passing by and she said she wanted pizza so we pulled over and ordered the Ai Spinaci, a side of meatballs and fries. With two drinks it was just over $20. While we sat and waited for the food we spoke with the owner and found out that she was originally from Sicily. After a great conversation, she brought us some of the homemade toasted ravioli and fresh bread. It's hard for me to find new adjectives to describe how absolutely amazing the food is. We both took one bite of the ravioli and just melted in our seats. The meatballs came out next and the food just got tastier and the pizza was even better. We've been to eight countries around the world and this is easily the best pizza we've ever had. 5 stars isn't enough.

Every time we come in, the owners, Joe and Rosa, make us feel like we are coming into their home for family dinner. After dining in again, it is great to see that these truly kind people care deeply about all their customers. 

I can't say enough good things about the great taste and high quality of the food. From the delicious marinara and meat sauces to the meatballs and pizzas, you will not find a better Italian Restaurant in the area. This is not dining Italian style, it is true Italian dining. It doesn't any more authentic than this. 

With great food being the norm and Joe and Rosa's deep desire to please their customers, Pomodoro e Mozzarella is destined to become a Tri-Cities institution. I know our family already considers it a gem.

Full disclosure: I've never even set foot in here, but the pizza we ordered blew my mind! We got a simple family-size thin crust sausage and green pepper pizza one night and it was tastier than any pizza take-out I've had since l lived in the city nine years ago.

My family went to pick it up and spoke to the owners for a bit, had nothing but wonderful things to say about them. 

I can't wait to try some other items on the menu. And let it be known: the price is right. In fact, considering how tasty this pizza was, it's a steal!

I truly believed I no longer liked pizza until I tried this 5 star diamond in St. Charles! My friend and I shared the Artisan Salmone Pizza {Smoked Salmon in a rich creamy pink sauce topped with Fresh Mozzarella}. Ok, we both enjoyed every sultry delicious bite...it was over the top fricken fabulous! My children swallowed down a half cheese/half pepperoni and sausage pizza, which is rare for them. Huge thumbs up from them as well. Will be ordering again very soon!

service was excellent.  food was nothing special.  pizza was chewy and somewhat rubbery.  salad was all lettuce nothing else in it.  desert tiramisu was pretty good.  I hope they do well but again I think the pizza was decent at best.

We ordered from Pomodoro E Mozzarella a few days ago and enjoyed the pizza. The staff was friendly, and the service/time to pickup was prompt. Their prices are great as well taking into consideration the free smaller pizza with purchase of a larger one. 

We didn't order the artisan style pizza which seems to have better feedback than the regular pizza. The regular pizza was good, but perhaps could have used more sauce. Overall experience was moderately impressive; Pomodoro E Mozzarella is in my top 3 or 4 pizza joints in the area. We weren't blown away like the reviews suggest, however, so I'd suggest going more with the consensus and ordering the artisan. That's what we plan on doing if we order again.
Awesome baked clams all food was fresh and I felt like our dinner was treated just as important as the next person. Real Italian food.  Also very clean facility and kitchen.

We love Pomodoro!  We order from them all the time and and are always pleased with everything they order.  They have great pizza, sandwiches and pasta!  Their customer service is wonderful too!  We placed an order yesterday and the girl answering put our (delivery) order in wrong and when we called they immediately sent us the correct sandwiches, no questions asked!  We well remain loyal customers!!!

I finally found a pizza place that meets my insanely high standards. After going there a few times and meeting the owners I can see why. They are real Italians and real home grown chefs. They value quality ingredients and make everything from scratch. 

The artisan pizzas are my favorite. Some of the best pizza crust I have ever had. My husband loves the deep dish and their toppings are all better than any place around! My bad pizza days are over! I come only here any time I need a fix.

We had an excellent experience with Pomodoro E Mozzarella when we ordered a large amount of pizza for a student council event. We ordered several pizzas, and they were super hot and delicious upon delivery. Delivery arrived exactly at the time they said it would, which I love in a delivery service. The pizzas we ordered were artisan- and they were absolutely perfect- I love when pizza places use all fresh ingredients on their pizzas. I will definitely order from this place again when I am in the area- timely, delicious, and a fair price.

Great food,great owners,great prices (JACKPOT)
Well rounded menu and best value around !

We stopped in on our last day here and I'm so glad we did. Rosalia and Husband get 5 stars alone because they're so welcoming and so friendly. The food is so fresh and light & you can definitely  taste the authenticity in their food.  We will go there again for sure..  I highly recommend this place.

I love this place! After having a weird delivery situation with my first order, the owner came out to me personally to deliver and did not charge me. After that, I went to Pomodoro a few times a week and he always remembered my order - extra cheese, fresh garlic, and even recommended I try it with basil. Great suggestion! I cannot say enough good things about Pomodoro E Mozzarella!!
Great find! Insalata Greca Romana was delicious, as was the freshly baked bread together with the olive oil and cheese, that came with it. Rosa was A fantastic conversationalist. What a gem.

We ordered two pizzas: the Ortolana and a Hawaiian/Quattro Gusti hybrid. 
Pros: both pizzas had ample topping portions, lots of cheese, melted to perfection. Delivery within an hour of order!
Cons: so so soggy! The primary flavor was burnt and otherwise underwhelming. There was a black piece of eggplant on one of the slices (no pic, sorry). The person taking my order asked me what toppings were on the Ortolana - so I checked their online menu and read it to her! 

The locals I was visiting do not plan to repeat business. Too bad, we had high hopes!
Really great pizza!! We got the special delivered and it came pretty fast!! I will reorder again and try a few different pizzas.

Very nice experience here. I dropped in for their lunch special ($5 or $6 8" personal pizza with soft drink). The very kind lady at the front was very courteous and a pleasure to talk to. Often times in a relatively fast food environment the quality of service if bottom of the barrel. Not so at Pom - they did a great job and the two staff members I interacted with were top notch.

Definitely a great lunch choice if you're in the area - or food to go of course if you're on your way home.

After trying this pizza house a year ago, we just can't go anywhere else.  Nothing compares to their quality, crisp thin crust and fresh ingredients.  Beyond superb.  This pizza sets a high bar no one else has been able to match IMHO.  A memorable food experience.  The best.  Ever.

Had to add another star to my review after trying the Artisan Style pizza. Even better! I love the coal-fired style crust with it's thin, yet chewy texture - a little bit of char and the dough bubbles in the crust. This is PIZZA!! It can be a little hard to pick up to eat as it's a little floppy with the toppings - but the taste and texture are exactly what I want in my pizza. 

The Arancini Rice Balls now come in more of a cone shape and 2 come to an order instead of one big ball. Still love these! 

Oh and we've tried delivery and it's great! 

Fresh ingredients! We love Pomodoro E Mozzarella!

The food here is consistently excellent! Whether it's sandwiches, pizza, salads or pasta, everything is extraordinarily fresh and well prepared. This has become our takeout place of choice. 

The owners are very nice, food is prepared in a timely fashion and ready when they say it will be ready. And finally, you really get your money's worth when you order from Pomodoro E Mozzarella. 

Highly recommended!
Stuffed pizza wasn't stuffed and the thin pizza had very little cheese on it and was cooked to long. Crust was very hard. Won't be going there again.

Delicious, authentic Italian food! We ordered the grilled octopus; it was perfect and smoky, just as I like it. The fried mozzarella sticks had a unique batter on them, and were delivered piping hot (something most other places manage to screw up). As recommended here on Yelp, we ordered one of the artisan pizzas, the Quattro Gusti. It was outstanding. I'm not sure about some of the fuss about the crust being overcooked; it had a lovely slight char that we thought made the pizza. The ONLY reason I didn't give Pomodoro E Mozzarella five stars is because when it was delivered, the center of the pie was completely soggy, making it difficult to eat or even pick up. Perhaps the center was rolled just a little too thin, but we won't let that stop us from coming to this place again. Neither should you.  I think it was an isolated incident.

This is an owner-operated jewel of the tri-city area. These people love making great pizza and Italian specialties with many ingredients imported from Italy. I highly recommend you try their artisanal pizzas. I've only ever had something comparable in Florence, Italy.

We were in town for a triathlon and the kids wanted pasta.  Decided to give this place a try based on other reviews.

The owners were so friendly I felt like I was part of the family.  When the other patrons started talking in Italian, I knew this was the real deal.

Everything was delicious!  I can't wait to come back and try something else!

Five stars for food & five stars for family atmosphere!!!  Bravo!
It's a small store in a strip mall, but the atmosphere is great, like you're in their kitchen. Nothing too fancy, just good stinkin Italian food

Excellent pizza, great salads, and the chicken parmigiana is out of this world! The meatball sandwich was HUGE. They're not real busy right now, so you get very personal attention to your order. I highly recommend checking this place out.

Not a lot of seating, but they have some counter seats and a couple tables. We alway pick it up or get it delivered.
Best pizza in town, not even close. Very good pastas too. Helps that an Italian family owns and runs it.

So yet another pizza place opens in the Chicagoland area... shocker. But this place has some promise. The sausage on the pizza seems to be actual crumbled Italian sausage and it's perfectly spicy and tasty. Not hot, just perfectly spiced like Italian sausage should be. The sauce is really good and the "artisan crust" is a must have. BUT I've had them three times now and the pizzas are always overlooked. Too bad because flavors actually disappear when you overtook a pizza. They need to watch the clock and cut it down a couple minutes for sure! The calamari had a great texture and was very flavorful. It's fried, but not crispy. So that should be looked at as well. 
This could be in the top 2 or 3 pizza spots in the suburbs if only they tighten up the kitchen: fry your calamari longer and bake the pizzas less. I give 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 because I'm generous and because this place shows promise.

My family and I go out to eat quite often yet I left dinner today saying "I have to write a review because this place is amazing." This family owned restaurant has the best authentic Italian food, and this level of service you don't find very often anymore. I felt so welcomed by the owner (even though I had my two very young boys in tow) and she went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and enjoying every bite. The fresh baked warm bread and seasoned oil, homemade toasted ravioli, Italian chicken salad and thin crust pizza can't be beat! This place is a gem and I hope many people go to try it like we did! We will definitely be back soon!

The restaurant is pretty small; when we walked in, we were immediately greeted by Rosa and her husband. After putting in our orders, the owner/chef/order taker went straight to work. The food was really delicious. The rice ball that my coworker had looked amazing. Everything was freshly made and piping hot when it came out. Soooo delicious! I ordered the Sicilian deep dish pizza, which is just red sauce with onions and spices mixed into the marinara and topped with oregano. The chicken Parmesan sandwich is a hefty portion, too, really tasty and filling. They don't skimp on the meat. The only downside is there aren't public restrooms yet, but they are undergoing renovations to install a restroom accessible to the public.

Really good specialty pizzas! The crust was great and the toppings were generous. 

We got the wrong toppings on one and didn't realize this until we got home, so you might want to double-check your pie before you leave, but other than that, it was great. 

Owners were very nice and had good personalities. We'll be back to try non-pizza offerings, which sound great and appear to all be home-made.

Oh - and the arrancini were some of the best we've ever had!
five stars.  fantastic, great service.  Ordered twice in one week. The Marghareta pizza and gnochi are knock-out good.

From start to finish an outstanding meal. Rosa did a great job keeping up with the front of the house while her husband made up the food, fresh, hot and so delicious. I ordered the Inferno sandwich: fresh mozzarella, pickled spicy peppers (like Giardiniera), fresh baked roll (heavenly!), sliced Genoa salami and handcut potato chips, salted ala perfection! My dad got gravy and meatballs. The gravy was so good. Just sweet enough with a little kick. The meatballs were also very good! After our meal we enjoyed espresso and an airy croissant for dessert. They were out of cannolis but next I go, I have to get one! Great experience, wonderful people and a truly authentic dining experience. Recommended very much!

Yum! Pizza, arancini, and chicken Parmesan were all very good. Tiramisu wasn't bad either! Owner and staff are super nice. We waited a little for a meal we were picking up and the owner insisted I help myself to a drink from their cooler. Very sweet!
This place is great! We ordered a calzone and the Margherita pizza. It reminded us of pizza we had in Italy! The owners are so nice...definitely give this place a try!

(+) Delivery was timely and delivery guy was polite and called when I forgot to turn on my front light and he couldn't see my address.
(++) They used fresh, not canned pineapple on my pizza. 
(+) The lady who took my order was friendly and polite. 
(+) Reasonably priced.

Came an hour away to try some new things. It was perfect. Two Artisan pizzas and Fried Ravioli! Quattro Gusti & Salmone were the best we've had. The owner, she was so nice and generous, spoke English or Italian, graciously served and talked to us. She provided samples of Quattro Formaggi pizza too! Very clean & beautiful little place. We're invited to come again. Absolutely!

I have had many pizzas in my day, but nothing compares to the quality and taste of this pizza. Absolutely amazing and the service is even better. Top notch family owned establishment. I only wish it didn't take 39 years for me to discover this taste.

My wife is a writer for the Institute of Food Technologist and gets to travel and try a lot of wonderful chefs creations from around the world. She too is now addicted to this pizza. The most recent combination we tried was the Sicilian Deep Dish and the Fresca. We are having fun trying everything they offer. The Fresca had a wonderful combination of fresh arugula offering a bitter element that is balanced by the sweetness of the asiago cheese. With the savory base quality of the prosciutto, this will be a pizza we will order on a regular basis.

I don't know how you offer such a high quality pizza at the price you do, but I hope we can all benefit from your creations. My family has been residents of Saint Charles since 1981 and in all the years we have lived here, I have never been so excited for a restaurant to open it's doors.

Hats off to Pomodoro E Mozzarella.

Wow! Just wow! Read all of the wonderful reviews and I have to agree. This was our first time ordering from this restaurant. We tried a traditional pepperoni, cheese and Fresca. The Fresca was AMAZING!!! One of the best pizzas I've ever had. The cheese and combination was phenomenal. We will definitely be ordering more pizzas here. I highly recommend it. I so wish they were in a bigger building to eat in. Take out it is!

I am so glad!  I didn't know this place could deliver all the way to Fox Mill!  It is really a step up from pizza cucina and Taylor street, especially their artisan pizzas.  

Food- We were ordering for ten people, so we ordered quite a bit of food including cheese thin crust, sausage and spinach artisan, wings, pasta, and salad.  The thin crust cheese id say was about the same quality as pizza cucina or Taylor street, but the artisan pizza is where they really step up their game.  In my opinion they should only have the artisan pizzas on the menu because it was way better than their other kinds, and way better than a lot of other pizza in the area, especially for delivery.  We got the ai spinachi pizza with sausage, fresh mozzarella, and spinach.  The sausage was hearty and flavorful, just like Italian sausage should be.  The spinach also had great flavor and did NOT overpower the other ingredients with bitterness like spinach tends to do.  The wings were pretty good as well, but were pretty expensive for how small they were and the quantity they came in.  The pasta was a simple EVO sauce which was good but the tomatoes in the pasta were tasty and fresh.  Salad was good as well. 

Service- Delivery took about an hour as they said it would, which is good time considering we ordered three pizzas and a lot of other stuff.  They got the order completely right as well.  

I'd recommend the artisan pizzas to everyone within delivery range.

Okay, I'm sold.  We recently moved to the area, and were on a quest for a new pizza place.  We tried Pomodoro once based on reviews, and ended up ordering 3 more times!  What sold me was the Fresca specialty pizza.  The ingredients were plentiful and fresh.  I've also tried the pan pizza which was good, but not a "must have" for me.  I really got creative last night and had the Chicken Piccata.  It's so hit or miss ordering something like that for delivery, but it was delicious.  I had my leftovers tonight!  I've also been impressed with the friendly order takers via phone, and delivery has been quick (mention you have a coupon for free delivery with a $20 order!).
Ordered delivery and the pizza is great. Big menu to choose from and very reasonable.

I ordered the Ai Spinaci pizza for delivery. It was missing something. The ingredients were as fresh as described, but there wasn't any flavor. I sent an email to the address listed on the restaurant website. I received a reply from, Giuseppe, the manger telling me that this wasn't normal. He offered to make me one himself for pick up or delivery at no charge. A week later I did just that. I phoned and Giuseppe answered and after I introduced myself he replied he had an idea of what went wrong. He did in fact make the pizza and it was delivered hot and fresh by his wife. The flavor was there.

I'm a fan.

Authentic Italian food!  The pizza tasted just how I remember it when I went to Lago di Garda several years ago.  We get the lemon Chicken in a white wine sauce and it is divine. I've watched him make the sauce from scratch each time (you can see the kitchen from the waiting area). They use quality ingredients for sure, is it weird that I can taste that the olive oil tastes different in a good way? ;)

Good god, if I were on death row.. This would be my last meal. 

The quality of the food is top notch and it shows. The owner is the best, true Italian, and by that I mean he takes his time to get to know his customers as well as to make his food. 

If you are looking for a 30 min or less 4.99 frat pizza, don't bother. He takes his time to make sure your food will taste amazing, and it pays off. 

Best pizza around I will continue to go here, great job!!!!

OMG, we love this place! The thin pizza is excellent, everything is just balanced and cooked well.

My son loves the aranchetti, they are also really reasonably priced.

We live on the north side of Batavia and they deliver to us and it is surprisingly quick. I have never been in the actual restaurant but I don't feel like I need to. It's simply good.

Highly recommend.

One of the best pizzas I've had. Haven't had their regular pizzas but loved the Artisan one that I've tried...Fresca. So delicious, my mouth is watering while I'm thinking about it. The owner is wonderful! 
Now go out there and support local businesses! And don't forget to try their array of San pellagrino and Italian drinks!

My husband and I have been searching for our favorite pizza place in the St. Charles area so we tried this place based on the recommendation of a friend. We were impressed by the prices, but we found the crust to be tough/chewy and not the best tasting crust either. Needless to say our search for the best pizza in the St. Charles area continues.
This Is the best in St Charles. Always good, always friendly, have never had anything here that wasn't extremely good.  Stop in and feel like familia.

believe the hype..delicious thin crust pizza with out of this world mozzarella. Finished the meal with a homemade cannoli. Great for lunch and I noticed some very interesting vegetarian option for Fridays.

I was hoping to love this pizza, but I didn't. On the positive side, it was inexpensive and ready in 15 minutes and had plenty of cheese and sausage but that's where the good pretty much ends for me. It was a thicker, thin pizza. I didn't think it had that great of a sauce. The crust was over cooked and very tough and chewy. When I was checking out the pictures on Yelp, the pizza appeared to be over cooked in several photos. I went only because of the glowing reviews and felt let down with the pizza. Oh well, since Charlie Fox's seems to have gotten their act together, as far as their management, they're still my go to pizza, unless I want to drive to Lou Malnati's.

Came for the first time in response to Yelp reviews.  Minimal seating made up for by gracious and attentive owners. They couldn't do more to make us feel welcome!  Food all fresh and tasty.  Have a cannoli for dessert. It was like visiting my Italian family! Gracie!

Great things come in small packages.  This applies to restaurants too.  Get yourself over to this itty bitty Italian spot.  Now, let me tell you about the food.  The toasted ravioli were crunchy and with delicious creamy insides.  The fried zucchini sticks stayed firm.  I've had them from other places where the vegetable becomes floppy and gross.  The breading was dense and seasoned.  They came with ranch and marinara.  I wish the marinara was thicker but the flavor was sweet and flavorful.  The arancini rice ball was huge.  It was also amazing.  We should have stopped there but we already ordered an eggplant parmesan sandwich and two pizzas.  The sandwich had three huge slices of eggplant and enough cheese for a small pizza.  Do you like just fried potato chips with a dusting of seasoning.  It was the type of seasoning that you would lick off first and then eat the chip.  But when your in public that sort of thing is frowned upon.  Anyway, the fresca pizza will be ordered again and again.  It had such a fresh look and perfect flavor combination that I would understand if you stopped reading and went there now. The other pizza was very good.  Ai Spinaci was the name.  The garlic in the sauce was chunky.  I love garlic so this was so welcomed.  As for the sausage I am guilty of picking off a few extra bits from the other slices.
So, are you influenced enough?  Go try it out and order me a fresca pizza while you're there.  
  And they cater.  I put that this place isn't good for groups because the place is small.  So if your party is bigger than 4, get it to go.

Very delicious food.
 Yelp steered me right here. 
Never had rice-ball appetizer before, but how tasty, glad we went with that! I'd love to have one in front of me right now!

Have NO idea why it gets 2 dollar signs, it's about as affordable as it gets! 

The couple running this business are seriously charming & delightful to speak with. Wife came over (as 3 of us are teachers) to chime in on education (so nice to hear support on any level). 

Being Italian I know the food well & trust me, this is as good as you get back home in Italy, it's the genuine article with all fresh ingredients. 

I know they haven't much room (4 of us actually ate there. Proximity perfect; place happens to be situated between us. And yet still hr. away for each party) so how wonderful if they could expand---albeit, on other hand, one doesn't want to see them overwhelmed & potentially risk lower quality! So maybe this is best!   

The absolutely ONLY slight issue is they are not suited much for dining in, so had to run to Oberweiss to use bathroom after long drive but hey, that's fine by me, got to decide what small ice cream to order afterward. 
Though honestly, we all agreed after we sat down to eat it, STUPID move!
How in the world did I NOT think Tiramisu & other desserts HERE instead, was the way to go??! 
Clearly, we were NOT thinking!
Now I'm dreaming of what that would've been like instead. The desserts in Italy are decadent & delicious. This place seems virtually plucked out from my two Italy-trip experiences.. 
Maybe time to go back, no matter how far!. 

Thx to the owners for the somewhat unexpected & wonderful treat.
And of course to yelp posters!

Delicious! Had the Fresca pizza and the Rice Balls for an appetizer. SO delicious! The owners were very friendly. They really made you feel like you were a guest in their home. Small inside in terms of seating but that's what gives its charm. Highly recommend!!
Forget about Neo or any other traditional pizza place. This place has amazing pizza and its run by the nicest family you'll ever meet. Amazing crust on the artisanal thin crust.

I ordered food to go as a delivery, it came on time as they said it would. 

When it comes to trying new restaurants my expectations aren't very high until I try the food, I never know what to expect.  And usually by the first bite I'll know if I'm coming back or not.

I got the eggplant sandwich and the margarita pizza, both of which were very tasty.  The eggplant sandwich was very flavorful, and the bread they used was a good choice to compliment it.  The pizza was larger than I thought it would be.  It was also very tasteful.  Over all the food was amazing and I would definitely recommend this place to other people, and next time I'll dine in with friends and try something new.

I've only ordered pizza  from them 3 times and each time, it was delicious,  made correctly meaning the crust was cooked el dente and.the sauce and chess didn't slide off the pizza when you bite into it. The owner knows how to run a business too. I had a minor issue omce and he followed up on his own and called me. That was very unexpected but goes a long way in showing pride in his food and that he cares about his customers. 
btw, the Oricini (rice balls) are just as good as my mom used to make. Order them!

I have used yelp all the time but have never signed up let alone made a review. I just did so in order to review this place. 

I'm quite the pizza lover. The sad part is that I don't get to have it often. I live in Los Angeles. Coming from Chicago, it's hard to even bother with pizza in LA. So when I came home for the holidays and saw this new pizza place right on the corner, I was super intrigued. I had to try it. And boy did I try it- 3 times in 2 weeks. I've tried their thin, artisan, stuffed, pan, chicken parm, and arancini. MY GOD, YOU GUYS. This is the real deal. The dough tastes fresh. The tomatoes in their marinara and pizza sauce is unlike any other pizza joint. The spaghetti was homemade. Why go to any other pizza place and get frozen stuff just warmed up when you can go to this amazing place?! 

I don't want to go back to LA, but you know I'll be getting my fix here as much as I can until then. 

Thanks Pomodoro e Mozzarella!

If we eat in, we are treated like we are family.  The area isn't designed for too much dining in, but there is just enough room to sit and enjoy.  The food is outstanding, with the homemade taste that my family enjoys.  

I recently stopped in on a whim and Joe was able to make a sizable spaghetti order for carryout by the time I watched a couple of innings of baseball.  Outstanding!!
Their pizza is so good! Love the crust and the sauce. Had the chicken parm as well, it was ok, but my husband likes mine better. Definitely go for the pizza, its delicious!

When we need pizzas in bulk for a good party we recently started ordering from here. The pizza is so good. The spices are placed and selected very well. The rumor is that all of their ingredients are imported directly from Italy. I would not be surprised considering how well done it is, and the quality of the pizza. I would highly recommend this awesome Italian-family-like pizzeria.

This is one of the best places in the vicinity of where I live.  Dined in with a large group (10 people; we're Italian) ordered 3 different types of pizzas and calamari as an appetizer.  Calamari was fantastic!  Probably the best I ever had at a restaurant.  It's not that frozen crap that most restaurants serve.  This was freshly cut and battered.  The pizzas were tasty and met our expectations.  The service was excellent.  Rosalia and Joe (owners) are one of the nicest people you'll meet.  It's like we knew them for years!

It's a great place with great food and reasonably priced.  I definitely recommend it!!!

I just moved to St Charles a few months ago and had NO pizza place...so I started trying them all, let me tell you that was NOT fun.  Every place was boring, expensive and unoriginal.
I found this place a week after they opened and have been pleased since!  No more searching for a good pizza because I have found it!!!!  Amazing cheese and crust!!!!  

If you want amazing pizza, look no further!!!!!

This is some great authentic Italian food! The wife is extremely nice and friendly... I had catering from them for a large party and my guest could not stop complementing the food! Love this place highly recommend

Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!  

On par with pizza from Italy!!

I'm so happy this place is 4000 miles closer!
We had the pizza cruda and it was delicious, super fresh! Ordering was super easy and the woman on the phone was very sweet. We will order again soon!

This place is defiantly worth the wait and the pizza is great. I guess I'm a poet and I didn't know it. But anyway the artisan pizza, especially the Pizza Fresca with arugula and prosciutto. Anything you order is very good and the owner and people are very nice and hospitable

If you are into arancini - this is an authentic, Sicilian recipe - wonderful! If you haven't tried arancini (also referred to as "rice balls" - an underwhelming description), you are in for a treat. Think of a ball of soft, moist arborio rice (about the size of a baseball) filled with a thick, cheesy, tomato-based, meat ragu. The entire ball is breaded and deep-fried. Served with a side of tomato sauce. Delicious is not a strong enough word. 

Originally, arancini were made with day-old risotto - not a bad way to make use of your leftovers! The point is - you would expect to find seasoned rice with plenty of cheese. Pomodoro has found a way to keep their rice moist and wonderful without adding the calories/fat from additional cheese. The ragu center is equally creamy (you'll find a little cheese in there). They are fried to a perfect, crispy golden brown. 

Ok - can you tell I'm an arancini nut to begin with? I've made a few thousand from my own Sicilian family recipe. Pomodoro E Mozorella comes as close as anyone ever has to my grandmother's arancini.  

The restaurant is primarily a take-out joint. Pizza with a broader Italian menu. For me, it's simply my much-needed arancini fix!

Ordered delivery because all the great reviews. Large pizza, calamari, and fried zucchini.  One star is for the calamari. Rest was so bad we tossed it and grilled up dinner burgers. Pizza was burned, zucchini was fresh out of the freezer soggy and bland. One again St Charles is without good pizza.

This place is fabulous! We've ordered pizza, spaghetti, eggplant Parmesan, the portobello sandwich, steak gorganzola, and the chicken Parmesan sandwich. Not a complaint about a single one! Out of the dozens of pizza places out here this place has the best pizza. Best gravy I've tasted in the area. The sandwiches and bread are fantastic! Our new favorite place!

We have been here twice, the first time we stopped in ordered and waited for our food.  We had an appetizer of fried mozzarella sticks which were simply awesome!  Homemade cheese, perfectly battered and fried, super sauce too.  Also order gnocchi, eggplant parm and fried calamari.  Gnocchi was decent, eggplant was good, a little too breaded but still good, calamari was terrible and had way too fishy of a smell.  Chewy and just not good  
The second time we ordered for delivery I was told about 45 minutes.  1.25 hours later, nothing, so I called and spoke to the female owner, our pizza and mozzarella sticks arrived about 15 minutes later.   We ordered a cheese pizza, it was terrible.  Honestly, we couldn't get through the crust, we were so bummed out.  The pizza and sticks were pretty cold upon arrival so even the sticks were not very good this time around. Again, we were bummed!
I have to recognize the female owner of this restaurant though, she is a gem.  I enjoyed talking to her the first time we went while waiting for our food.  She is a people person and loves her restaurant, it's nice to see that.  We will try this place again, just maybe not delivery, or the pizza?

I am 100% Sicilian and these guys are the real deal!!! Arancini just like my mother makes. The pizza was awesome, good crispy crust, fresh toppings. Try the Rigatoni Bosacaiola, rigatoni noodles with mushrooms, Italian sausage in a cream sauce. It is awesome!! Everything we tried tonight was spot on, not one misstep. Going to try the Artisan pizza next time. The owners are wonderful people, the wife greets everyone who comes in. There is a small counter inside where 4 people could sit and two square outdoor tables so its mostly a take home place. Would love to see them expand just a bit to include a few indoor tables. I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!!!

We usually have a family pizza night once every 2 weeks or so, so we've tried almost every pizza joint within 10 miles of our house in Geneva in the past 10 years. Yet we hadn't tried this relatively new place in St. Charles. So we did.

We ordered a medium cheese for the 2 kids (and OK, for us a bit too) and then a "Fresca Artisan Style" pizza (a "no red sauce" style pizza) for the adults.

 We all agreed when enjoyed them both. The bit hit for us adults was definitely the Fresca pizza we ordered. I absolutely loved the crisp crust and the fresh toppings. That pizza was gone within a few minutes.

Then we stole a piece or two of the cheese pizza... it was.. good. The crust wasn't nearly as crispy as the Fresca pizza we ate. It was loaded with cheese... the kids loved it.. but it was almost too much. As some has stated it's very greasy, but hey that's what lots of cheese does when baked.

We'd order here from again and definitely try more of their "Artisan Style" pizzas.

We did pick up so I can't comment on the conditions of the pizzas with delivery, but when I picked them up they had just come out of the oven. 

3 stars for the cheese and 4.5 for the Fresca, so 4 stars it is!

This is one of the best pizzaria's my boyfriend and I have been able to find.  Everything is authentic and flown in from Italy, which doesnt get any better than that. The owners are a nice family and very welcoming. Love this place

Margarita pizza is delicious! Regular cheese and veggie also really good. Brushetta is very yummy too! Still have to try more menu items, but I think this place might become my new favorite pizza place!
Not a fan of the pizza

I just ordered my first pizza from these guys a little over a week ago and I will tell you, it is the best pizza in the St. Charles area. There was one glitch, the delivery driver had obviously held the pizza to one side because all the toppings that slid to one side of the pizza but when I contacted the owner, Rosa, she was more than accommodating and very apologetic. The toppings were fresh and plentiful. The prices were better for what you get from any of the chain places. I ordered cheese, pepperoni and fresh basil. You can tell the difference in the quality of the cheese and the toppings on their pizza. Thank you for bringing a quality product to the area and let's get as many people as we can eating in this place because I am very pleased !
The Fox Valley finally has a "go to" pizza place! This was fantastic! Everyone loved it, even the kids! Thanks for making a great pie! Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!

Tried take out for the first time after all the positive reviews. Was not disappointed. Got an app of arancini, rigatoni pasta, and a margarita pizza. All were great, and will return even if it on the other side of town.

This place is fantastic. Great pizza, dough is really different and great.  Everything we have tried is freshly made and rice balls are unbelievably good. They even make homemade chips. 
The artisan pizza is actually as good or better than what I have had in Italy, and my family thinks the tiramisu was better than in Italy too!  
I hope everyone tries this place!
We visited today and had a fantastic lunch! The pizza was outstanding and so were the arancini

Ottimo-- the perfect mix of authentic Italian cuisine and Italo-American favorites. I'd suggest some of my picks (arancini, tiramisu, pizza) but you'll get a delicious, fresh meal with any of the items on the extensive menu. Buon appetito!
i love the artisan pizzas. thin with perfect crust. salads are great. i've ordered from here about 10 times and great food every time.

Finally tried it out for the first time yesterday, and I am super glad I did. Since it was my first time, I decided to order the lunch special, an 8 inch personal pizza and a can of soda for $4.99. No, you are reading it right, a pizza and a soda lunch combo for only $4.99! I ordered a basic sausage pizza with fresh basil. Initially, I wasn't expecting much for two reasons. One, there was only one other couple dinning during my visit and, two, other than their selection of Sicilian style artisan pizzas, they offered some of the most common "Italian" selections one would find or expect to find in just about any other mom-and-pop pizza joint. However, when I saw chef and owner, Joe, reached in a rectangular tube and out came a ball of dough, one you can see is very fresh is just right, I knew I just ordered something special. I was right! As a fan of just about everything pasta or pasta related, one bite of my pizza told me Joe took the effort to craft perfectly al dente bites for his customers. For me, the dough makes the pie and everything else completes the master piece. I was in heaven! The sauce was just right. The topping were all very fresh, especially the fresh basil. To top my experience off, I had a most wonderful conversation with owners Joe and Rosalinda (two of the most beautiful people anyone could ever meet). I felt more like a guest at their home instead of dinning in a restaurant. I am hooked! I will have to try one of their artisan pizzas the next visit. It is really too bad that this place does not have the best location. Joe and Rosalinda's place isn't an everyday mom-a-pop joint. They should be a gourmet restaurant. My only complain? The price of their pizza lunch special is too low. They need to seriously think about raising it another $2 or so. People will pay for the value because the pie alone is worth the extra $2. Go! Go to Pomodoro E Mozzarella!

Pizza was decent with fresh ingredients and lots of cheese but seemed like it needed more sauce. The sauce that was on the pizza was decent but not great. Also had spaghetti and meatballs. Meatballs were really good but the spaghetti was a little overcooked and the Arrabiata sauce had nice spice but not much taste. Staff was friendly.
Not for me.  Dough was too chewy.  I prefer a lighter, crispier crust.  Kind of greasy too.  One and done.

Went two times in the last two days. 

The interior is really nice. Enough to take guests when they come or for a fancier outing consisting of Filipino deliciousness. 

First time the service was A+, but the second day it was so slow...they also forgot to give us rice as our entrees were coming out and one of our dishes came out as we finished our food. We ended up sending it back because it was too late. But everything we ate was delicious, so I am less bitter. 

Recommended Dishes:
Seafood KareKare 
Fried Tilapia 
Fried, Marinated Milkfish 
Garlic rice 

The desserts were worth the try and really good: 
Halo Halo 
Taho 
Flan

Want to try next time: 
Chicken Adobo 
A soup dish

Went with a friend who never tasted a Filipino food and he was pleased. We ordered Lechon Kawali, Chicken Adobo, Seafood Karekare, Bowl of Garloc Fried Rice, and Halo halo. All were good and tasty. Unfortunately the fish paste for the Seafood Karekare was not within our like of sight and hidden behind the huge bowl of Karekare so we ate without it; I wished we would've known as I don't normally eat this dish. It was bland and my friend agreed given to what was mentioned, we wished it was on plain sight. Lechon Kawali was great and crunchy, though the sauce was the generic liver sauce (Mang Tomas) nothing special there.

The server was great and suggested some for us and we tried it, such as ordering a bowl of rice instead of 3 cups of rice. Thank you for that. But once we ate, we were only checked one time and we had to get the attention of other servers so we can ask for something. Observing the servers, there was a lot of talking amongst themselves and that could be one reason why we weren't paid good attention, also it would be appreciated if all of them smiled and not look that they were having a bad day or just had a poker face. Our main server was great though he smiled genuinely and had good mannerism. What's good was after we got their attention, our request was granted in a timely manner, it wasn't a hectic day I might add.

This was our first time coming here. We're from the Chicago city area so it was a drive to get here.. 

I'd give this place a 2.5 only because the food was great but the service was really bad.. 
Maybe it was the time that we got here (around 2:30 on a Sunday) but the service was just... bad. First off, there was a really disorganized line - only one line for both those waiting to be seated AND for to go orders. Everyone was hovering the front desk and customers were all over the place.   As I waited in line, I noticed waiters on the side talking rather than cleaning up tables  for other customers to be seated. 
Anyways, they finally called our names and we were seated an hour later. They took our order (hototai soup, crispy pata, pancit Bihon, okoy, Kare kare, and 3 desserts - halo halo, Taho, and buko pandan - & like I said we came from Chicago so we wanted to try a lot of food and take whatever left home). We got our food in decent time and everything was fresh and hot (which is why I'd give this a 4/5 if only rating the quality of the food)..
BUT.... Honestly there was a lot of hair on the crispy pata - not appealing at all. And the pancit came last and we were basically done with all our main dishes by the time it came out (we thought they'd forgotten about the order). But whatever, it was good. 

SO THEN they eventually gave us the check.. YET it turned out to be someone else's check smh (theirs was like 90 and ours was supposed to be around 60) so we complained and they finally came back with our check. We paid, blah blah. BUT WHERES OUR DESSERTS? A bus boy kept hovering our table like wondering why we aren't leaving and we finally told him that we've been waiting for our 3 desserts for the past 10 minutes after we returned our check. So they finally give us the halo halo and Taho and they apologize for the wait and thank us.. BUT WHERES THE BUKO PANDAN? So they finally give us that after like 5 minutes... Smh everything was just going badly service wise. 


Other than the terrible service the food was pretty good especially because it's rare to find a Filipino restaurant that doesn't have oil overpowering the food. Also, the quality and quantity of the food was fair for the price. The food is the reason I gave this place a 2 (a 2.5 if I could) but the service was too bad for me to give it any more.

I actually really like this place. I'll admit it- I tend to be skeptical about Filipino restaurants because my mom caters Filipino food and I haven't found a place that is up to par with her cooking until Hong Ning. I recommend! My mom does too!

We usually visit on Sunday afternoons. There is always a bit of a wait, but we just walk over to the nearby Starbucks to kill time (the waiting area is not that big). From my experience, the wait never went over 30 minutes for a group of 4. Most of the guests come in families. 

The decor is nice, but the floor is a bit slippery-- not sure why. The tables are small, especially since the food comes in large plates/platters so the table gets a bit crowded once the food comes. I can tell that this place is a bit understaffed, but service was still pretty good on all occasions we've been there. All servers are helpful, despite how much they are running back and forth from the kitchen to the dining area. 

We always order the sinigang, crispy pata, and the inihaw fiesta. The entrees are meant to be shared, so the portions are a bit large for 2 people. 

Sinigang: Yum! Served at a nice, hot temperature and is very sour-- which is how I like my sinigang. It could've had more meat and veggies, but it is still very good. 

Crispy Pata: We order a large for a group of 4 of us. Very crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. They got the dipping sauce right, too. 

Inihaw Fiesta: Beautiful presentation, it's served on a platter with banana leaves (love!). It comes with muscles, calamari, tilapia, barbecue chicken skewers, chargrilled pork belly, dipping sauce, and bagoong. This is perfect for a larger group. Definitely my favorite on the menu. 

Overall: I very much recommend! Honestly, Hong Ning is the ONLY Filipino restaurant in the Chicago-land area that my family and I regularly visit. Haven't found another restaurant that we like enough to make a second/third visits to except this place!

I came here on one of my Friday lunch outings. I really like Filipino food because it reminds me of the friends.i made in college. However, the restaurant didn't have a lot on their lunch special. I ordered off the main menu and I think the food was a little costly. Also, for lunch, this was not a good option. We had an hour to eat but the check took a while. The food I got was good, but not a huge favorite. I think if you want authentic meats like tripe, oxtail and jackfruit, come here. They have a lot of those options.

I've gone here since I was a kid, and although I think the owner is amazing and has worked so hard to make this place as successful as it is, he needs to do something about his waitstaff. They seem blas and unfocused. Upon seating, our party of 5 was given as carafe of ice water... with no glasses. I asked waiter #1 for cups. He said yes, then proceeded to do other various tasks. 5 min later I ask waiter #2 for cups. She says yes.. then a couple min later, waiter #3 arrives with our cups. But in all that time no one asked if we were ready to order. We finally order (15 min after being seated), and the food arrives very quickly. The amount of stars I've given are based on the food alone. I've never had any bad food here. Maybe the negative food reviews are on their off days?

So we finish what we can but of course have leftovers. I went through the same amount of almost begging for to go containers as well as the check. When asking for the containers the 2nd time, I also asked for our 2 halo halo to go, since at that point I just wanted to get out of there. It took almost 30 minutes from the time I asked for the check the 1st time to the time I could finally leave. 

I'm not sure if I've done something to offend the waitstaff but it definitely felt that way. I'll definitely be back, but never again to stay and dine in. I hope they improve their ideals of what it means to be customer-oriented. You don't have to love your job to deal with the public, you just have to know how to make the customers believe you do. ;)

Fact 1: The Philippines has over 7000 islands, is the second most polylingual nation on earth after Papua New Guinea and cuisine-wise is as varied and diverse as the cultures that have influenced it from the Spanish to the Chinese to the American, et al. 

Fact 2: despite being proud of the awesomely diverse culture, just about every Pinoy/Pinay dining at a Filipino restaurant secretly expects the food coming out of the kitchen to taste EXACTLY like mom's, lola's or tita's.

Fact 3. Ain't no way a Pinoy/Pinay that is dining w mom, lola or tita will admit that the restaurant food is better. That would be suicide.

Given these undisputed facts, it is a testament of quality to Hong Ning that they've been able to thrive for almost 2 decades from its original humble store front in Glendale Heights to its current locale in an area that has a large Filipino community full of home cooks that think they're the latest incarnation of Iron Chef Pilipinas. Hong Ning has stood the test of time bc it's good Filipino food period. If you don't like the food here, you might just not appreciate Filipino food. Yet. Give it a few tries before you give up bc sometimes people need some adjusting to unfamiliar flavors.

Anyhow, if you haven't tried Filipino food, this is a great place to start. The food here is better than some nationally recognized Filipino spots I've been to around the country. Entrees are inexpensive and I suggest coming with a group of at least 4+ so you can try a lot of things (BBQ!). The service I've had here has been above average especially for an Asian restaurant (no shade thrown... You know what I mean!) and especially since the last time I was here it was with a rowdy group of 20+ picky ass eaters who ditched their moms, lolas and titas bc they didn't want to hide the fact that they were really enjoying the food. A lot.

Hong Ning has upgrade their location!  I can't believe they have been around for almost 20 years.  The decor is very nice and the restaurant is spacious.  This is where Vietnamese Bistro used to be and hopefully Hong Ning can make it last.  There aren't many choices nearby by for Filipino food, so any location is a good location.

Hototai Soup $7 - Clear broth easy to eat soup
Kamansi $9
Mixed Chicken and Pork Adobo $10 - One of my favorite dishes here.  Savory and delicious.
Large Rice $3

Great food presentation and place is clean.  It is located in a not so busy stripmall. Overall look is similar to a school cafeteria except that someone takes your order and serves the food at your table. Servings were ok but pricetag was a bit high for the general ambiance. 
Don't be misled by the chinese sounding name though- this serves Filipino food.
Awesome place to get Filipino food! Food is served hot with decent portions. Love this place!
Have to drive an hour for this place, they have the best, tastiest halo halo ever ... and their crispy binagoongan makes you feel happy.Looking forward to come back to this place.

Terrible service. I asked for a pitcher of water, the waiter said yes but didn't come back, so I looked back to where all the waitstaff was standing and he was freaking sitting!  Our original waitress was sort of in a daze, and did not come back to ask how the food was; and to think it wasn't even packed in the restaurant. The way I was treated in "American/Italian restaurants" was far better, even with the fact that I'm Filipino. 

They have good food and I have been here thrice  but because of their service today, it took away the joy of enjoying our meal.

Certainly will not travel 30 miles again to be treated this way.

Food is incredible! One of my favorite spots in the burbs. If you like crispy pata get it here! Make sure you act quick though. They sell out fast! The dishes hit close to home. Keep up the great work!

Our first time at the new location.  Kind of far for us, but the food was delicious.  We had very low expectations of the staff, and were thus not disappointed.  They gave us pitchers of water, so we did not need to hunt anyone down to refill our glasses.  

We ordered the calamari (skip it - huge rubbery rings of seafood), lechon roll (lots of fat, but the meat and skin were crispy and tasty), kare-kare (plenty of beef cubes, but I prefer it with more oxtail and more sauce), a pancit (a bit salty), a grilled chicken, halo halo (yum!), and a pandan sundae (very good!).  See photos.

We tried to call for a reservation, but were told it was strictly first come - first served.  Luckily, we were seated right away.  When we left, there was a line out the door!  Go early or go on a weekday!

We are proud of this Filipino restaurant to which we have taken many guests. Ever since they moved to this Carol Stream location they upgraded the entire dining experience. Not only is the food still delicious with generous servings and nicely presented, but the staff is younger and friendly. The Filipino decor on the east wall is tastefully done, and you can learn about Philippine history and culture by taking a close look. Good quality tables and chairs are not usual at Asian restaurants, so I am glad they invested in them. But my #1 pet peeve with Asian restaurants is the typical filthy, icky restrooms and the hallways that lead to them. Hong Ning has now broken ranks from that low standard and have installed presentable, decorated restrooms that are clean! May they keep it up!

I've been going to the old location since forever but something about this new location just somehow made Hong Ning 100 times better. the art work was beautifully displayed and the vibe of the restaurant from the food to the furniture (tables/benches) really made me feel at home. I truly felt like I was eating a home cooked meal in the Philippines with each bite of every dish.  everything was beautifully prepared and the food was great. Come by if you're missing some authentic Filipino food and dessert. 

also, staff was very polite and helpful! 

will be back again

I tried this placed well over a decade ago when it was still at their old location. Back then I was far from impressed. Perhaps it was my food selection  (I honestly can't remember what it was that I had ordered). This evening I decided to give it another shot not feeling like preparing anything at home and knowing my rather picky son would settle at the very least with some white rice and something crunchy. I decided on something rather simple that both my little sons would be happy with. We ordered the shanghai egg rolls, BBQ pork skewers and an order of chicken inasal. The chicken in particular was very good. My boys were happy and couldn't get enough of their baby egg rolls. My 4yr old (the particular one ) asked me about 4 times if we were going to be able to bring the egg rolls home... so that means they were a hit, lol. He was not excited to eat there on the way to dinner but made sure to ask me on our car ride home if we could go back sometime. We'll be back and I'm excited to try something else soon. Service was fine. They weren't overly attentive but available when I needed something so I have no complaints with regards to service.

5 stars for the food, but 4 stars overall due to their service. This is one of the better filipino restaurants that serves really well cooked filipino food. The crispy lupia is cooked to perfection. Perfect crunch with a meaty inside. I recommend to skip the calamare. It used to be fried squid, but now its the rubbery squid rings that you can get a a grocery store. The chicken inasal with java rice dish is one of my favorite dish. It comes with about 4 chicken medium sized chicken breast grilled well. Inside is moist and tender. My family likes to get the Crispy pata, which is roasted pork hock. Skin is crunchy and there is a lot of fat, but the meat is tender. 
This place gets pretty busy, so if you come with a party make sure you have everyone with you, or they won't sit you. Service wise, kind of typical of any asian place, you usually have to flag down a server and they tend to be inattentive and slow. Don;t worry if its not the one that initially served you. Flagged down any of the staff that is running around so you can get what you need.

Sizzling bangus belly was really good! Sauce was tasty and not too strong. We got sited within a few minutes of waiting. We were handed menus while waiting. Although we were asked multiples times how many we were in the group. And by different people. Place is very family oriented.

I went here with my grandfather and uncle for supper on a Wednesday night. The waitress was really nice and patient with me as I totally mispronounced several names of items on the menu.

We ordered okoy, lumpia shanghai, fresh wrapper lumpia, pancit bihon, crunchy bagoonan, chicken adobo, lechon and garlic rice. Everything was delicious.

I really loved the lechon! We also had flan, pandan sundae and halo halo. If you are looking for filipino food, I definitely recommend Hong Ning.
Came in on a hot summer day.  I knew what I was going to order before I walked in.  Best Halo-Halo I've had at a restaurant in years!

I come here all the time, as the location is near my parents' house. The food is good, but the service is slow! It took a while for our server to get to our table. We ask for napkins, then they leave and take a long time to come back. Same thing at the end, when we ask for the check. 

The food is delicious, but only when it's available! We order fresh lumpia, but they are often out of stock and will cancel orders in the middle of your meal. They also adjust or cancel to-go orders when their supply is low, but they don't even call customers to let them know that the order is being changed. One time, I ordered a large pata, only for it to be downsized to a small. I didn't find out until I arrived to pick up my order.

The restaurant gets loud when there are a lot of people, as the floor and walls are not designed to absorb sound.

The Good- the food was delish and somewhat authentic.  The place is big for a Filipino restaurant around here. The decor is nice.  
The Bad- as you step in you can feel the greasy floor as well as the chairs and table. The service was lacking like they are understaffed.  The food came in different times so when we got the rest of our orders the other food on the table got cold. The portions are skimpy for the price.
Overall- Although the food was good, this is not where you go when you have a big party. The staff was not able to handle a table of eleven people. We felt neglected.  Asking for a pitcher of water took forever.   Filipino restaurants are known for lack of service and this is right up there. This is unfortunate since the food is good. I would hesitate to recommend this place for a big party.

I give this place 4.
5 stars for the food which were all good: dinuguan, pancit, lechon, 
I give 3 stars for the service.  Our order was taken shortly after we got seated.  We didn't have to wait long for our food, but our waiter wasn't the greatest. He wasn't smiling, he never checked on us, we had to flag people down for help with getting containers and our checks.

Good food, slow service but not as bad as previous customers made it out to be. 

We started with a hearty bowl of lomi soup which is made with thick pancit rice noodles, assorted meat, and a beef gravy. Warmed the bones on a cold fall day. 

We moved on to  the salted fish & chicken fried rice and 3 sticks of chicken barbecue a la cart. The fried rice is my favorite! 

Good value for the price. We have leftovers for lunch the next few days. Definitely coming back again.

The food are fantastic! Been coming here every weekend for 2 months now. We try different food every time we order. My hubby favorite are pork sinigang, caldereta and sisig. Mine is halo halo to go. But for some reason that I still want more in halo halo. Some taste that I have been looking for it. Please work on it. ..
The service was good. The food arrived so fast, but the juice come at the end. But it's ok.

Service is too slow, we got seated and ignored for 20 mins! When the waitress finally came , she asked if we ordered already. I was about to walk out when she said that , but I was still being nice because the old Hong Ning was very good. We ordered sizzling tangigue (king fish) , it was awful. Too dry and very oily, the fish was not fresh at all. Also ordered the pork bbq and it tasted "funny". The shrimp was oily and very salty. After our meal we still waited for freakin 30 mins for our server to check up on us if we are done, I saw her in the back sitting , talking and laughing at her co workers. I finally called a different waiter for our bill. I would never go back there ever again, the old Hong Ning was good but not this place!

Came at Hong ning for the first time. Since we heard it from other filipinos that this place is good. Me and my fiancee came here for the first time last night for dinner, and immediatle the place doesn't look like your typical filipino restaurant. The decor is very nice the tables and lighting are unique. When we got in the place is packed and busy with filipino athmosphere.. We were seated right away after they cleaned a table for us. 

The menu was very simple and right on the spot your classic filipino dishes. We started with appetizer of fried calamri and for entree the sizzling sisig and grilled pork belly. The service was fast, food came in quickly.. 

The food is very flavorful and everything we like. The only negative was they charge for the rice.

For dessert we ordered the halo halo. And it was plentiful for the price me and fiancee had hard time tackling it. 

Overall our 1hr trip was all worth the drive. They set the standards high for all filipino restaurants. Filipino restaurant in the orland park area are pretty mediocre. 

We will be back soon. If we crave for more filipino food.

I am glad I chose to visit this place without consulting the Yelp reviews.
