We were handed menus a few minutes later and the waitress quickly took our order. It is hard to distingush the staff because they wear street clothes. We recieved our salads with our entrees vs. before which I thought was odd, the waitress thought it was normal.  I had the meatloaf, it was really tender but covered in a really thick glob of brown gravy.  My husband has food allergies and had a hard time finding wheat free options on the menu.  Nobody asked us how our meal was, even when I asked for a doggie bag for 3/4 of my meal.  They really need to fix service issues and improve their menu.
Friendly service & great beer selection

Have just gone for drinks, and craft beer selection is great. 11 uncommon draft beers on tap and 35 bottle beers with some rare 22 oz bombers. Food menus looks like regular pub fare with sandwiches, burgers and pizza. Will be back.

Server was friendly with a pleasant demeanor.  She tells things how they are which is what I prefer instead of a script.  The beer list gives you plenty to choose from.  The atmosphere is very quaint but not stuffy.  The food is simple and delicious.  The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because we were told the fries were fresh cut and they were anything but.  Will definitely be back though....

This place is tough to find unless you know where you are going. I am not sure why they have a Batavia Ave. address, when it is really more on Wilson Street behind a building that is on the corner of 31 (Batavia Ave) and Wilson.  That said, this was a fun, small local place that was worth the adventure of trying to find the place. Good beer and good food. Our server, Matt, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Good burgers, sweet tater tots, and a good beer. It has a quaint, relaxed atmosphere which is much needed in an area loaded with chain restaurants. Keep up the nice work fellas!!

Wow, I must have been there on a bad night considering all the other positive comments listed here. I felt the place was claustrophobic, limited menu and crappy service. We sat there for 30 MINUTES and the waitress kept walking by and avoiding my frantic wave for service. At least the bartender  (owner maybe?) came by and took our beer order. So we drank our beer and left. 

If you're craving an extensive beer menu, skip this place and try Geneva Ale House instead.

I'm a self proclaimed beer snob and rightfully so.  I've lived in the Pacific NW for quite some time and was exposed to some of the best craft beer in the country.  Now I'm lucky enough to live in the Great Lakes region where we have equally as good craft brews just not quite as many options.  BUT thanks to The Gammon Coach House I can experience all my favorites and try some new ones without having to leave my hometown of Batavia.  It's true good to be true but yes...Batavia finally has a pub worth raving about.  GCH is a nice spot to enjoy high quality craft brew with a solid pub menu.  They just opened so I think they are still working out some kinks but overall they're on the right track.  I've visited GCH about 5 times now and continue to enjoy the experience.  The food menu is a bit limited but the if you're in the mood for a quality burger or flat bread pizza then you'll be fine.  The burgers are better here than at the rival Geneva Ale House!  They also have sweet potato tater tots which are way better than their cousin the sweet potato fries.  They serve 10 beers on tap (sometimes they may be out of one or two of the hot sellers) and a host of bottles.  They could probably expand the bottle selection a bit but I prefer draft beer so I don't really mind.  They have two LCD TV's where you'll find a prime time football or baseball game on but watching sports isn't the main attraction here.  Save that for Buffalo Wild Wings.  Their patio is pretty big but with only a handful of nice days left in the year you better enjoy it while it lasts.  The service is pretty good but it's getting better.  The two girls behind the bar, Melmo and Nora, are great.  

The one think I'd like to see is some drink options for kids.  Maybe some apple juice, lemonade, milk and a plastic cup option.  I'm not suggesting they go over board with a full kids menu option or anything but it would be nice to have an alternative to glassware and the orange juice and water they serve to kids today.  I'll be watching to see if they change this up.  If they don't then I'll have to assume they're intentionally not catering to kids which would be sad because Batavia is a family oriented town.  I'd hate to have to limit my business because I couldn't have my 6 year old join me for a burger and some tater tots!  

I really hope they continue with the quality beer and food selection I've seen so far.  If they do then there's no doubt GCH will be a big success for Batavia and the surrounding Fox Valley area!
Gammon Coach House Rocks!

I really wanted to like this place. It's so cute, and Batavia could use another good restaurant. However, I think they have some kinks to work out...

We visited on a Friday night to try the fish. We sat outside on the cute little patio out front. So far so good. The menu is not extensive, but we were just there to try the fish, so it didn't really matter. I decided to try the baked cod instead of the traditional fried variety, as I was trying to be good. The waitress came by to take our drink orders and explained that did not have baked cod that night - instead there was a tilapia dish with mushroom polenta. Ok, no big deal. I decide to go with the fried fish. One of my companions tried to order a non-alcoholic beer, which they do not have. Oops. I asked for a kids menu for my four year old, and the waitress explained that they don't have one. She said most kids just order the pizza or hot dog from the regular menu. We decided on the macaroni and cheese for him (side order - $4). I hate paying for macaroni and cheese since it's so cheap to make at home, especially when doesn't come with anything else, but I digress...

The food came out fairly quickly, and everything was nice and hot. The fish itself was good, but the batter was super thick, and reminded us of a corn dog. The fries were good, but the coleslaw looked like it was made quite a while ago. It was starting to brown, and the carrots on top looked dry. I asked the waitress (very nicely) if there was any fresh coleslaw, and she told me it's a vinegar coleslaw and not a creamy one, and that it had been refrigerated (basically telling me I was wrong to think there was anything wrong with it). Um, ok. She said she could bring me another one, but at that point I just decided to skip it altogether. At the end of our meal, we all had piles of breading on our plates and no one had touched the coleslaw. 

One final experience that sort of capped off the evening. I believe there are apartments or offices of some sort above the restaurant. While we were sitting on the patio, someone came out of a door that opens right onto the patio with a bag of garbage. I'm pretty sure they worked/lived there, and weren't a restaurant employee, but it's still kind of gross to have someone carry garbage through a restaurant. Even if it is outside. 

Perhaps it will do well as a bar, what with the beer selection, but we probably won't go back for a meal.

Love Love Love this place!  Great location, cool inside (north woodsish), awesome staff, GREAT BEER and tasty food!  This is the type of restaurant the Batavia area needs and I hope it stays around for awhile.  My wife and I visit this place at least 3 or 4 times a month, either just to grab some beers or enjoy some food.  They change their beer menu weekly and always are getting something new in.  Food is great, recommend sweet potato tots, chips and salsa or pulled pork.  I hope the rest of the downtown Batavia restaurants take a note from this place....we need interesting food, great drinks and just a good all around atmosphere.  Try it if you haven't yet!

Great beer selection on tap and good food to boot!  Hidden gem off the beaten path and glad to see it.  Great selection of finger foods that go great with their selection of every changing micro brews.  Can be a bit crowded but that's understandable.

I was am so happy to have been introduced to GCH. Their beer menu is fantastic, and even better you can order your drafts in 3 different sizes, perfect if you want to taste a few different drafts without getting hammered. I have never eaten a full meal here, only tried a few appetizers and queso, and was very pleased with how good it was! They have a late night menu after the kitchen closes, which is great for me cause drinking always makes me hungry. The bartenders are great, have really only had the same to guys ever behind the bar because I tend to go on the same nights, and they are knowledgable of the beer and very friendly and fun.  Go to gammons, its fantastic.

Food very good, especially the sweet potato tater tots!  Service was great and super friendly.  Really great beer selection as well, and great that they have sizes so you can try different beers without committing to a pint.

I agree with the previous reviews! The one thing really I did not love was staring into the kitchen sink, the bright kitchen lights and the normal conversation coming from the kitchen.  I definitely will return at least once but if the kitchen situation remains the same it may be a deal breaker.
Loved the thin crust pizza.  Haven't tried anything else yet.  We will be back.  Our new favorite in schaumburg area.  Great cheese and sauce!

Very average eating experience.  Italian beef was average.  Meatball sandwich was edible. Overall, the place is "ok" to fill up your tummy if you're close, but otherwise I can't think of a reason to go back to this DIRTY, little establishment.

Places like this u should go a couple times before you give it 5 stars. These guys have earned each of the 5 from me based on the fact that every single item I've got from there in like 10 trips has been damn good. Here's a rundown. 

Lasagna: shut up and try it. 
Pizza: thin crust is delicious. Sauce is sweet, but hey, it must be a signature thing
Chicken Wings: dude, they are huge. U can make a meal from 6 wings. Meaty as hell. 
Cheezy Fries: the girl on the phone convinced me once. Glad she did. 

I'm sure I've had more items than these. 

As for the ppl here complaining about a guy smoking in the back, shut it. It's a small family owned place. Not Pizza Hut. I'm an avid non-smoker and it didn't bother me. Nothing smells or tastes like cigs. These are real ppl who make real food.

Always quick and tasty. We usually order the burgers from there. They are massive and delicious. I usually get the food for pickup and take it home. I would recommend this place if you are in the neighborhood.

If there was an option to choose 0 stars, I would. As another yelper said, they do not wash their hands. We caught the owner picking his nose in the area by where the pizza was being made. Totally disgusted us. And they do smoke in the kitchen. Another turn off. I would never eat there again. It seems like they do well with students tho with their slice of pizza and pop deal. We begged our sons not to go there. That place should be inspected by the health dept!
Owner's friendly and down to earth. Love, love, love their pizza! All other sides are great as well. I always stop in for a pick up, and yes, the food comes out pretty fast!

TERRIBLE!!! We catered a graduation party from Dominicks. Let me start off by saying the staff who answered the phone were not helpful. We placed the order 1 week in advance the package was for twenty people we only had about 17 so we were content with having plenty of food for everyone. (BE AWARE it is deceiving, it says it feeds 20 but once you question them on it they are real quick to change their story and definition of what twenty people look like.) The gentlemen who took my order reminded my 5 times that he was doing us a favor by delivering and we BETTER take care of the driver, we agreed of course we were never planning on not tipping the driver. Today was delivery day and apparently they don't know what 20 people look like. There was no way what they delivered would have ever fed twenty people.  We called concerned that they might have forgotten some trays but were rudely told that was a lot of food and if we need more we  can order and pay for more. Unsatisfied with this place. I have never been treated so rudely. We have corporate events and birthdays almost every month and are always catering from restaurants at least once a month.  We took a risk and tried a new restaurant this was a terrible experience. Food is bland and barely enough to feed ten let alone twenty. I cant believe we spent $237 dollars for something that we could have gotten somewhere else that valued their customers. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT.

ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! I have never seen such unprofessionalism in my life!! The thing about dealing with a business is that even when the customer may not agree with certain business practices such as pricing or policies on delivery, it is about the customer service received from those who are representing the business that makes or breaks the experience. From the moment my colleague called this restaurant to place our order, the service has been distasteful. We placed a very large catering order for an event we held at work. The order was placed a week in advance to accommodate the restaurant and give them time to prepare. Placing the order was extremely interesting to say the least. The gentleman taking our order was rude and short. He made it seem as though he was doing us a favor by delivering and in doing so we better not stiff the driver. HOW INSULTING!?!?!?!?!  If that wasn't enough, after the food was delivered (delivery was on time and the driver was outstanding actually!) and we were able to see what our $237 had purchased us, it was just downhill from there. This was supposed to be a party package that fed 20 people. There was no way that was possible. We had to cut food in half in order to accommodate our group. They gave us a pan of ribs, pan of fried and baked chicken that looked as though it fed a party of 4 let alone 20!!! After our discovery, we gave the establishment a call back to explain that what we received no where equated to what we paid. The "owner/manager" went off. He told us that was we got was what we paid for and he was sure it fed 20. If there was more that was needed then we could call him back to order more. He attacked us immediately instead of addressing our concern with why we felt as though what we received wasn't what was promised. And if not to make matters worse, when my colleague took to Yelp to post her experience, the owner replied with "I knew you were going to be a problem the moment you called" SERIIOUSLY?!?! I have never dealt with such nastiness in a business owner in my life. I would not recommend this company/establishment to anyone. They are the worse with their customers.

I have to tell you all right off the bat, this is a solid pizzeria! While driving home from work and on a whim, I decided to have pizza for dinner. I stopped into a strip mall area. I am glad that it did!

As a walk-in, the young lady who took my order, informed me it was going to be at least 20 through 25 minute wait.  The next time I order from here that will be way too long (mainly because I will be greatly coveting with an eager desire for its completion)! What a solidly wonderful pizza! 

One of the best crusts I can remember. It was flaky and firm and but not like cardboard. It was rather light while being strong. The sauce is a little sweet for my personal  taste, but the garlic and hint of pepper give it just enough so it's not too sweet. The cheese is high-quality and you can tell. Very well melted and very good texture along with solid taste.

I ordered a meat lovers pizza;16 inch. The toppings were distributed just right, in my opinion. There was not a heaping mount of meat yet it was evenly distributed and you could taste a little of everything on every piece, in every bite. 

As a former pizza maker myself, I really have to give these people kudos. They do pizza right! I will return to this place again in the near near future. In my opinion a job well-done!

Please be very cautious before you go to this place, they over charge you for no damn reason.  Never wash their hands & the owner and his son smoke in here. Never coming back worst experience of my life. The only nice one here is the delivery driver.

Pros: fast service, freshly cooked, delicious, affordable, yumm-O!!!
Cons: too small to actually eat there so best for take outs and delivery. Skip the garlic bread, it's fresh but too chewy. 
Must have: meat lasagna and thin crust sliced beef and giardinera. And any pasta dish!

I ordered a chicaken pizza and it was horrible. Chicken pieces, oh wait we can't even call them chicken. It is better to call them as Rubber pieces, that too with a premium pricing for chicken :) .Another worst thing is their Sauce, i felt like it was made from rotten tomatoes. For a large pizza i paid $24+ and it is totally worthless. Stay away if you are going for a chicken pizza here.

It was my first time trying this place a few days ago and I'm happy I did. I placed a pick up order and when I arrived the owner told me our pizza had burned to the bottom and he could not serve us it and that he was starting a new pizza right away. He then took off the pieces of pizza from the pizza he had burnt and gave us the pieces that were salvageable for no extra cost.We literally got 3/4 of a pizza free, so it a steal! While waiting, we nibbled on the free pizza while waiting for our new pizza to be done cooking. The owner talked to us and joked around which made the wait we had fun. 
The amazing customer service was only half of it! The pizza itself? It was amazing. It had a very light, flaky crust, but it still managed to hold the ingredients. The sauce was delicious, maybe a bit too sweet, but I add lots of hot pepper flakes. The pizza also reheats very nicely. I reheated it up today and tasted as good as the day we got it. 
I will be returning!

My reviews will ALWAYS be the same! Consistent pizza EVERY TIME we order. I tell everyone I meet or who just moved into the Condo building where I live that if you are looking forca fabbbbulous stuffed pizza, go to Dominicks! Never disappointing, toppings are always piled on high, delivery times are always consistent and always HOT on arrival. THANK YOU again for the awesome pizza pie!!! The BBQ wings are really good also

Love the pizza here! Also, the antipasto salad is true Italian style. I work down the street from them so it's my frequent go to for lunch. I've never been disappointed ordering from them. Prices are very reasonable and you get a ton of food. Can't say enough good things about them!

We got wings from here for the first time on Friday. We keep trying new places at work in hopes of finding the real winner. Ding ding ding! We think we have found it.

They have amazing wings! They are full of meat, so moist and flavorful. The BBQ flavor on the wings is so incredibly tasty! Everyone at my company was in agreement that these were the best wings we have had on our quest for wings delivered. The regular flavor is just plain like chicken nuggies or naked wings. The mild was very mild with just a very slight hint of heat. I'm super weak with spicy flavors and had no problem eating a couple of the milds. I didn't dare touch the inferno but I heard those weren't quite as spicy as they had predicted. Overall, great tasting wings!!!

We also got the breaded mushrooms which were ehhhhh...I think they were overcooked. We won't be ordering those again.

We will be ordering again this Friday from Villa Rosa and are going to try the cheese stick appetizer in place of mushrooms. I'll keep you Yelpers posted! :)
Amazing panzeroti, and fantastic meatball sandwich. Best I've ever tried, I can't wait to try their pizza!

With Dominick's grocery stores in the news recently for closing the doors (late 2013 for all the review-readers in the future) the name had me perplexed (and worried). However, I was glad to learn that the grocery chain and this location aren't related; think about your Yelp friends Mike S. and Mike G. they have the same first name, but probably aren't in the same family tree. 
[Note: no need to check your friend list for the Mikes, they're on there...I checked.]

Regardless, Dominick's Villa Rosa Pizzeria is my new pizza place. It's Yelp official. I have only eaten one pizza from here, so it's a bold statement, but I felt strongly about it. 
Not to down play the deliciousness of their pizza, but there isn't much else around for a quick, stop-on-the-way-home-from-work pizza place. The one I discovered closed, and DVRP was next on the list so I gave it a try and found it to be a success. The pizza itself was very good, even better than the place I mentioned that closed, what confused me was the name (which is why it wasn't initially first on my list). 
I really liked the sauce to cheese ratio, and the flavors were on point so it really hit home for being a nostalgic pie. We tried the sausage pizza which was/is/always will be a staple selection in pizza toppings with my family, but  I wouldn't mind trying some other options. I very much look forward to the trial and error process of determining what the best toppings are.....also, where do I sign up for that job?? I want to make that my career.

I will be back on the next 'pizza night' aka: after the holiday season. One day I hope to call them up and tell them it's me, and ask for the 'usual'.
good pizza. a little pricey but its schaumburg so ...

This is the second time we're ordering from here but I am compelled to say that it's just ok. Will I order from here again? Probably...maybe....like several months from now when I have forgotten what the food tastes like. 

Had a coupon for some meal deal. Came with pizza, wings, etc. 

Pizza was good. I love thin crust. A little greasy for me but still kinda good. 
Wings were...let me put this delicately, GROSS. They tasted like they were microwaved and the flavor was awful. 
Fries were soggy and sad looking. Not the best I've had either. 

Overall, kinda pricey for just an ok meal.

Very nice pizza carry out.  I've come through several times and the quality has been consistently good.  I've had sausage thin crust pizza and hope to try out other varieties in coming months. Sandwiches are good too.  I've had the Italian beef, which is as good as Portillos, maybe even a tad larger in size.  The meatball sandwiches are also solid offerings.  Bread is fresh with a crispy crust.  They also have a two hot dog special with fries that is worth trying.  A nice local establishment that gets it done for lunch or for pizza.

This place is gross, ordered twice only because its close to work, on both occasions the food were cold, last time we ordered the gyros smelled very very wrong.... no thank you! called to complain to the order, instead of taking constructive criticism he yelled profanities and hung up on me

These guys are close to my work and we go here often for lunch. The pizza and wings are excellent. They have really good pasta & ribs too. Family owned pizzeria, NOT a chain of fake cheese and cardboard crusts.  Try the Western BBQ Pizza!!

Just ok. Stopped in for a slice since it had 4 stars. Sorry, but mediocre at best. I wonder if they freeze them first, since it was flat and bland. Cheese wasn't hot and stretchy, just laid there. Crust was flat with no character. Sausage crumbles reminded me of the old Pizza Hut. No seating. One good thing:  only $2.50 for a slice.
Owner Dominick was awesome. Pizza is great. Wings are soooo good and they don't lie about "jumbo" wings. Go here for pizza and wings!!!
1st timer. Have been looking for a well made western/bbq pizza.  The place I went to for years closed.  It's been a few yrs and many pizzas later, I found a good one.  Will be back for sure.

We are new to the area & tried this restaurant on a whim. We ordered the stuffed shells with meat sauce & meat ravioli with meat sauce, & said that we would definitely order from them again! Delish! Looking forward to trying their pizza next!

I could take or leave the pizza, I wasn't blown away by it, but it wasn't bad. Just okay. 
I LOVE the spaghetti with meat sauce & cheese stuffed shells with meat sauce! Full of flavor. Tastes home made. Not from a jar. 
The Mean Green Salad was a little disappointment. I expected more green- like spinach or at least more romaine. There was too much iceberg lettuce for how much it cost.
Now when I go, I order either the spaghetti or stuffed shells. They are so good I don't want to order anything else!

My brother and I stopped in here for sandwiches for lunch and in spite of the fact that there is only seating for 4 people in the place, I would have given it 4 stars based on the chicken parmesan sandwich and gyros we had. BUT, when I got up to ask for another drink, I noticed through the window to the kitchen that the owner was pouring meatballs from one container into another and one of them fell on the floor.  He bent over, picked it up and threw it into the container with all of the other meatballs!  Disgusting!!!

Great pizza !! Great staff !!!  My family loves the food @ Dominick's !!  They are always fast and happy to greet you when you hit the door !! Best pizza place in Schaumburg by far !!! Keep up the great food !! Happy customer !!!
great pizza, fast delivery, great deals! I love this place!
I go here at least twice a week the pizza is "amazing" and the wings are "incredible" the owner is all ways very friendly.
BEST EGG SALAD SANDWICH! If you love your eggs like I do, you must try their sandwich. Just do the plain sandwich #39. It's worth the 20 minute drive I have to take.

Great find!  Totally local, food served on fresh baked bread.  I had chicken dumpling soup and a Sinatra sandwich both so good.  I picked up three mini pies to go as well.  Caution this place is busy and they run out of specials. Limited seating inside.  Super friendly and efficient staff.  The owner was greeting most regulars by name.  If I lived closer that would be me......

Earning their five stars the old fashioned way!

I'm giving Frank's a 3 star due to the ambiance and the corn beef sandwich being to salty. The place is a bit run down needs some refreshing. Skip the soup way to much cornstarch used.
Bottom line if you need a quick sandwich it's ok!

Just "meh". Saw the positive reviews and thought we'd give it a try. The restaurant itself is small and disheveled. There is a random table near the door that just holds a lot of junk and the whole restaurant could have used a good cleaning. That being said, the food was liked, not loved, by 3/4 of us. My roast beef sandwich was super fatty. We won't be back.

Call it Karma, but after a rough weekend with family, found this welcoming and local shop on Main Street in lakeside Wauconda.  Unimpressive and humble front entrance lead to an even more unassuming space filled with a scattering of tables and chairs.  Orders are taken at the counter and food is then delivered table side.  

I arrived at around 2:15 pm on a Tuesday and as I asked what was good, the guy said, "our daily specials" but then informed me many were sold out as he wiped the specials off the dry erase board.  Bummer.  

So I asked "what else is good.". He talked me into the Reuben, one of my go to sandwich orders.  He assured me that the bread was homemade, the corned beef slow cooked insight, and the coleslaw made in house.  Cool.

I could have added a mini homemade pie to my order, but I resisted despite the lovely strawberry rhubarb pie that was looking at me from the counter by the register.

Sandwich came quick.  Good crust on the grilled bread.  Good ratio of meat, sauerkraut, cheese, and bread.  Only complaint was the sandwich was a bit too salty.  Others here on Yelp have remarked the same and I concur.  I was glad I had the side of slaw as it's sweetness and creaminess balanced off the salt.  Perhaps they should serve the slaw alongside the Reuben all the time (it cost me an extra $1.50). 

I was checked on a few times and appreciated the attention.  

I would come back, for sure.  But would get here earlier and before those specials were wiped off the board.

Update:
I broke down and bought a pie when I went to get a box for my left over.

My review is on the service of this establishments owner. I've frequented this cafe to purchase their pies. I thought I would bring a group of friends there to have lunch. NO SOUP FOR YOU! Does anyone remember that Sienfeld? I first was told I had to order off the menu, NO changes, except bread. Ok! Then I requested a turkey sandwich, off the menu, sheepishly, I asked if they could please hold the mayonnaise. BIG MISTAKE! He schooled me! Telling me that they just came off a huge lunch rush and everyone liked what was on his menu, and if I can't find anything on the menu, it must not be the right restaurant for me.  ARE YOU KIDDING? Of coarse we left. Talking to people, I have come to find out that the owner has a reputation for not being the friendliest person. 
It's interesting that the name of this restaurant is Karma cafe.  You know what they say about Karma?!

So, so good! Grilled chicken prepared on a Weber Grill out back every day (and you can taste the difference!) I opted for the Spring Salad topped by a homemade Cider Vinaigrette. Attention to details and care taken with ingredients is obvious. 

Highly recommended! Friendly staff, small dining space.

Franks karma Caf has very good food unfortunately the pretentious people that work there make the whole experience unbearably bad. It's a bit overpriced but innovative I would highly recommend doing takeout and having as little contact with the staff as possible.

While the meatloaf was good, that was it!! Ughhhh, the yummy bread was charred, twenty minutes for two sandwiches, place is so disorganized with unnecessary stuff collecting dust and taking up the minimal indoor real estate in the dining room, there's no room to sit for lunch and people have to get up from their non-relaxing lunch to let another guest pass, and the final burn...
no refill on the ice tea, REALLY, last I checked tea bags are pretty cheap!
Takes a lot more than a good meatloaf for a good customer experience, don't ya always say?!

I have eaten at Frank's Karma for many years (but never as often as I would like). All of their sandwiches and desserts are amazing. During certain times of the year and on certain days, they have Marshall Field's recipe for chicken pot pie. It is a delicious dish, but you need to come early or pre-order, since they make small batches and popular menu items sell out quickly.

Andrew (up front) and Cliff (running the back of the house) are really nice people, and they take great pride in the meals they serve. I am also quite sure Andrew actually knows every person in Wauconda and knows all about them. Cliff is a true artisan when it comes to the food. I hoped to beat the odds and get a pot pie today, but the gastric gods had other plans. I ordered a pizza sandwich on focaccia (one of the daily specials). Look for the picture I posted of it, and imagine it tastes even better than it looks (and that is a handsome sammich!). I know I enjoy my meal when, during my last bite, I have the pang of disappointment that my food is now gone. I experienced that today, and it's not the first time I have felt that way after lunch at Frank's Karma Cafe.

Their location is small and intimate, only a handful of tables (which are nearly always occupied when I come). Dining on the patio in season.

I can wax poetic about the wonderful food, but instead I will say...go there. Try it for yourself. I have never had a disappointing meal!

I was a little worried when I decided to stop to eat in Wauconda for lunch and now after eating here I wish this place was closer to where I live. They make their own bread for their sandwiches and they have a crazy amount of pies.  The guy behind the counter is probably the nicest guy in the hospitality industry.  If you find yourself in Wauconda go out of your way to check this place out.

I love Frank's best sandwiches north of the city that I've tried. All the bread is made from scratch, as are their sauces, pies, cakes, soups, and they always have something tasty to wash it down with, homemade as well. Amazing Reubens, the sirracha focaccia is great too when its available. The place is tiny and gets packed for lunch, they also aren't open past 4:00 or so.

I ate here again today, along with my mother. We were really disappointed with the food this time. We both had one of the specials: I had the grilled chicken avocado mango salad and my mom had the Siracha Foccacia Club.

My salad was a plate full of dark green lettuce (romaine?) - and that was it as far as the salad part. No mixed greens, which would've been nice. The lettuce was topped on one side with a few chunks of thick cubed chicken. Definitely not grilled as the description says. This was like the middle of a thick, chewy chicken breast (gross). On the other side of the greens was a bunch of cubed mango pieces. That was the best part of this "salad". It was served on the side with some kind of dressing that I have no idea what it was. Had no flavor whatsoever. It was a little dish of oil with some herbs floating around in it. Franks - please, please at least learn the proper way to make a vinaigrette! This salad was NOT worth $11.

My mom's sandwich was mostly thick focaccia. There was one thin slice of deli turkey meat, as far as the turkey portion of the sandwich went. We were surprised that it wasn't "real" turkey. Anyone can put a piece of cheap, crappy deli meat on bread. And what was with the one measly slice? The only good thing about this sandwich was the bread and the aioli sauce.

One more negative: we got to Franks at 11:30. We wanted to beat the lunch crowd. They were already sold out of the egg salad (a special). So, word to the wise: if there's a menu item on the daily special that you REALLY have your heart set on, pre-order it over the phone or online. 

The only positive: My mom got a blueberry pie and she had a piece after lunch and said it was delicious. She would know - she's been an expert homemade pie maker for 50 years.
My friend Anthony recommended this place. I tried it out today & I ordered the Monday special tuna wrap. It was very good.

Amazing gem in the heart of Wauconda. Fresh ingredients, creative menu and a great vibe from the minute you come in until the minute you leave. Kudos to Cliff and Andrew for maintaing such a great establishment. In a town with so little options for good eats, this place rises well above the rest. 

Try the flank steak sandwich anytime they have it on special. The peanut sauce is to die for.
Great place, but Frank's karma would gain by turning on their front window lights to assist potential customers finding the place.
Excellent and tasty food. My favorite spot. Nice people and fast service. Nice atmosphere. Good karma.
Always forget about this place, but kinda forget about Wauconda too. Good grub
Luckily I live in Wauconda and can frequent Frank's. Their food is creative, fresh and delicious.

A MUST EAT PLACE! There is no reason to eat anywhere else in the world. Homemade goodness in every bite, whatever you choose. 
They are people who really care what they are serving. 
Thanks Andrew and Cliff!!

Food here is home made and amazing, they have an awesome drink selection, try the limeade, it's incredible. It's a small quaint place and gets very busy during the weekend and can be hard to find a seat, but that is part of its charm.

What can I say besides "Delicious!"  I guess I could be wordy and say a lot more, but trust me, delicious sums it up. I got the #27 today, hot roast beef and cheddar with giardiniera on a sub roll.  My mouth loves me so much it swears it will never leave me.
The food is great and the place is quaint. It is definitley a place to stop in for lunch.
Excellent sandwiches and soup. Extremely well done recipes and execution. Reminds me of the saying "sometimes less well done is more". Not much room to sit.

This is my new favorite place! Great customer service and the people are soooo friendly! I love this place and the people that work there! The food that they serve is AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS! It's always so fresh and it tastes like it was made with love! They buy everything locally which is so rare for restaurants to do and they bake all their own bread. Best bread I have ever had! Also their tea and pie is to die for!

Really great find. Saw the reviews on Yelp and had to give it a try. Come early they believe in fresh foods which means if the special you want is a hot seller it may be out by if you come late. Small place, but the ordering moves pretty fast. The pies are a stellar choice for afterwards, I was hoping to try one of their bars as well, but they were sold out by the time we got there.

I thought this place was great, small little bistro style seating area, fresh baked breads, and wonderful homemade soups. They also make little homemade pies which I'll have to come back and try. Fair prices, and the staff is very friendly and helpful when making suggestions. I will definitely be back. The siracha focaccia club on Saturdays is AMAZING
Great place, small but great unique food.  The staff and owner are very friendly and hospitable.

My wife and I went to Frank's for the first time on Saturday and it will not be the last. 
Everything we had was great. It is a small place but do not let that stop you from trying Frank's.

This place is a real gem! Been there twice now and we have been really pleased. My wife loves there soup and found out she can do a half sandwich with the soup. I have tried the chicken wrap Wednesday special and the on the menu club. Both filling and their bread is excellent. The real item that puts this place over the top is their pies. First time we took home an apple and a banana cream. The crust is outstanding. Today we brought home a tart cherry and same results.
Place is small with a limited seating area. Also today we were there by noon and 1 of the 2 soup choices was already gone and so was 1 of the specials.

Horrible customer service. I called to place an order lady told me to call back after I looked at the menu online. Just for that I will never send anyone or have any business associated with franks. Horrible just horrible.

When I forget my lunch for work, this is my go to place.  Of course I also can't resist tagging along when a coworker suggests going to Frank's for pulled pork on Wednesday or mushroom lentil burgers on Friday.  Can you tell I love the daily specials? 
The food here is always fresh and unlike many dining out options, is actually pretty healthy too.  Andrew (one of the owners) is so kind and courteous.  He takes the time to get to know his customer's by name and you can tell he puts his heart into the business.  
I'm not usually one to splurge on a non-alcoholic drink, but for this place, an exception is well worth it.  House made freshly made drinks with whatever is in season, yes please! Some highlights include blueberry limeade and hibiscus lemonade, but I haven't disliked one yet.
You should also think ahead and save room for dessert or grab a mini pie to take home.  The kitchen sink cookies are amazing, but again, I've yet to have a undelicious dessert.  
Definitely worth a stop if you are in the area!
Frank's has a wide variety of interesting sandwiches, salads, and soups. Everything is fresh and tasty.  Don't miss the pies, which are outstanding!  My favorite is the triple berry.

We weren't impressed. My grilled ham and cheese was really salty, and although the bread was good bread, it was too greasy from the cooking process. My husband's sandwich was okay, but his bread wasn't very fresh. Panera prices for puny portions. Lemonade was really good but not redeeming.

It seems as if most of what can be said has been said by other reviewers, however I do want to praise Frank's sandwiches which I have to compare favorably to my favorite place in Los Angeles "Sunset Grill" (as immortalized by Don Henley).

Having worked in a similar sandwich shop in College, the policy on substitutions is probably in place because they are trying for a certain texture or taste with a particular menu item. Let's face it- the only reason Burger King has "have it your way" is to bring in parents of petulant children. Frank's is a Cafe geared more to adults- and BK certainly doesn't have 30+ sandwiches on their board of fare.

Also worth mentioning is the drink menu; Frank's is one of the few deli-sandwich shops that I know of that offers an "Arnold Palmer" (which is half lemonade and half iced tea). One of the people in our group ordered a raspberry smoothie and declared it "yumlicious".

Miss Vickie's chips are one of my favorite brands and Frank's has them in several flavors. I'd encourage you to try the vinegar and sea salt chips...

I didn't try their desserts but they certainly looked tempting- next visit I will splurge and get something sweet.

The only possible negative that I can give is that there is only one (inside) table that seats 4, the others all being for 2. I feel that this is balanced in good weather by the two picnic tables provided outside for those who prefer al fresco or are smokers.

Even though parking is listed as "street", Frank's is steps from a good-sized municipal parking lot.

I'd encourage people who like freshly prepared and tasty sandwiches, salads and home-style soups to give Frank's a try.

If you're anywhere near Wauconda and in need of lunch this is THE place to go. Incredibly tasty and creative food. The staff is always super friendly and accommodating. They're in business because they love food, not just making money off of food. Sitting down here you get the idea that everyone in the place frequents it about once a week, and with good reason.

BUT i haven't mentioned the best part yet. Frank's is home to M. Belle's pies which are hands down the BEST pies I have ever tried. We love them so much that we had them at our wedding instead of cake. Andrew was incredibly easy to work with and even talked me down from the number of pies I wanted since I wouldn't need that many for the number of people I was inviting. You've got to love that.

The sandwiches we got were great, however they are a bit too expensive for me. Panera pricing but you only get the sandwich and a pickle if it comes with. Bread was different and really good, meat was great and I really did like the sandwich. It was also super crowded when I went and I learned if I go there again i need to call in my order. I heard they have really good dessert so maybe I'll try one of those sometime.
Very good sandwiches and their daily soup selection is great! Highly recommend for a low key lunch!

Frank's is my favorite place for sandwiches in Wauconda!  But the real treat are the mini-pies the cafe offers; especially the mini-chocolate pies. 

The food is always delicious and the service is always friendly-- even when the cafe is busy (weekends/weekday lunch). 

I highly recommend it!

Yep, I am giving Karma Cafe a perfect rating after only one visit.  We will definitely go back.  I had a Chicken Tahini Wrap and it was fabulous.  My husband had a grilled eggplant with red pepper sandwich and a cold carrot soup.  The vegetarian options were impressive for a tiny cafe in Wauconda.  Plus my son had the breakfast sandwich on a homemade English muffin with a potato bacon soup.  All of the food was superb.  In fact it was so good that none of us had room for pie.  I can't wait to go back and try the pie.

OH My Goodness! I just ate some of the Banana Cream Pie that Franks serves! we met the pie guy, Cliff at the Bliss Wine place next door.... He brought some over and even gave us a fork. I saved it till home, and it is unbelievable! The crust is perfect, like made from home, and the pie has the perfect sweetness!
 YUM!
 I have never been to Karma Cafe, but plan to visit ASAP! Thanks for the pie Cliff! Keep up the excellent work!

Awesome! Amazing selection, awesome selection, fresh mades drinks, homemade pies, local ingredient, great customer service, everything you could want. Prices are higher than our average sandwich shop, but you're paying for a wonderful menu with a lot of selection.

Had a great experience here. Vegan and vegetarian options, delicious and creative meal choices. I had split pea soup and it was hearty and good. Pies are legendary. 
Something here for everyone

Wide variety of tasty sandwiches, delicious specials, great homemade baked goods. One of my favorite specials is the herb egg salad sandwich...very refreshing! 

We like the mini pies--perfect for two, and lots of choices. Last time I was there I had to choose between at least three different kinds of cream pies (chocolate, banana, coconut and more), several different fruit pies, pumpkin, and sweet potato too. All homemade. Not bad for a small deli-sandwich shop! And don't forget the homemade soup... And the welcoming owners & employees!

Gotta stop, running out of battery. Love this place!

Franks is a tiny hole in the wall restaurant with awesome food. 

Far above other sandwich shops. The owners have done a great job keeping the place alive and serving great food. Defiantly the place to stop for lunch. I work across the street and we usually order from them once a month. Their daily specials are great, but order early so you are able to get whatever is on their daily special menu. A good example: their special pulled pork is served in Wednesdays and is so delicious!!! If you don't get your order in before noon, its likely you won't get one!

The perfect place for lunch!  I'll be honest, this was my very first time there, but I was overstimulated by the selection, blown away by the environment and tantalized by the texture and flavor of my seemingly simple sandwich.  

The menu is super diverse for a sandwich shop.  There were a handful of specials as well as a wall full of regulars.  I suggest taking a look at the menu online if it's your first time.  I was overwhelmed by the selection and found it difficult to read the smudgy chalk on the wall, but the owner helped me pick a fabulous sandwich; I wasn't sorry.

Their pies, I'm told, are fabulous.  Everyday they have mini-pies and larger pies can be special ordered.  I have a mini apple pie sitting in my car right now, awaiting consumption!

I see several return trips in my future.  Enjoy!

Franks is pretty cool.
Small, so not alot of room to sit. But the food is pretty neat.

 and they upsell upsell upsell their delicious baked goods. I'm not sure if thats a good thing or a bad thing

Hands down my favorite place in the area for lunch. There's always vegetarian options. Their sandwiches are delicious! My dad loves their pies also. Almost everything they make is from scratch and of high quality.

So delicious and fresh!

Very friendly service and delicious food. The owners are great guys.

There's limited seating but they'll send you over to Bliss and you can enjoy a glass of wine with your meal.

Absolutely amazing. 

Frank's is the go-to place for us when we're anywhere near the Wauconda area. They offer several vegetarian choices plus the most heavenly pies for dessert. The menu is vast but they also have great day-to-day specials. Be quick though, those tend to sell out by mid-lunchtime! The only negative here is the tiny dining area.
nice spot great sandwiches and pies a must try when in town everything pretty good!!

Franks Karma Caf is really, really special!!! Their menu is huge, with plenty of great options for vegetarians. Their daily specials are fabulous!! It is smart to call ahead as they can sell out. The lentil- mushroom burger and stacked torte(spinach, cheese, peppers, artichokes, olives all baked in a delicious homemade crust) are just two of my favorites. Their soup is homemade and really spectacular. Lots of flavor, but not salty at all. And their bread made fresh by them and so tasty. And lets not forget about the delicious desserts....everything that I have ever tried has been great!! 
It is very obvious that Cliff and Andrew really care about the food they make. They use fresh, local ingredients and that really shows in the quality of the food.
I drive 45 minutes(one way) several times a month to eat at Franks. And all my friends and family that I have ever brought there always want to return. Don't pass this place up!!!

Check out the menu and specials online if you're visiting this place for the first time because the huge number of choices on the  menu can be overwhelming -- and they're all fantastic.

Andrew and Cliff have created a really special place with Frank's and Wauconda is much better for it. 

My favorite off the regular menu is the turkey reuben with cole slaw. But I can almost always find a special to tempt me. 

The cookies, pies and other desserts are hard to resist and I love how they've partnered with Bliss Wine and Gifts for dinners and "take out" (delivered to your table at Bliss).

4 stars based on the brownies alone.  Pies and sweets  are great and very well known in the county. Sandwiches are supermarket deli-esqe.  The owner and workers are extremely cordial.  The location is cute according to my wife.

Always delish!! Andrew and Cliff have turned this into a treasure. Everything is fresh and flavorful. The daily specials are a culinary adventure and of course, who can knock Andrew's homemade pie crusts. The best has to be the Bread Pudding - too yummy for words!!

I just finished my first experience with Frank's, and already plan on having many more. We split two of the daily specials, the cubano nuevo and the pretzel brat, and they were both delicious. I kind of just wanted to eat the pretzel roll by itself because it was amazing. The pork on the cubano stood out, and it was worth the few minutes we had to wait. Most importantly, the oatmeal cherry coconut cookie was epic... I could literally see myself going back specifically for another cookie.

As with most local sandwich shops, Frank's is going to cost you a few bucks more than your average chain, but if you really "get what you pay for" I'd rather pay a little more. There are plenty of other menu items I want to try, so I'll be back soon enough.

Love the Karma Cafe!  The sandwiches are so good (well sandwich since I get the same one) and the bread is incredible!  Everyone there is so nice and it's just refreshing to have healthy, simple vegetarian option in the suburbs.  I haven't tried the desserts yet but I drool every time I see them sitting in their little case.  Try this place, it's amazing!

I had the Petr Brady sandwich - roasted pork with sauerkraut and apples on a delicious roll.  Great iced tea - hibiscus.  Also brought home 4 slices of sweet potato pie.
Was soooo good.  I keep thinking about it and can't wait to go back, though it will be hard to choose between great soup selections, main dishes, and vegetarian.  Great food, nice atmosphere, friendly service - this is my kind of place!

If you want an array of pies for your wedding, this is THE place to go in the North-West Chicagoland area. Their pies are so good that my husband and I plan to travel up to their place just for pies in the future. Quick note about the pies: they are all fresh, home made, filling, and just absolutely amazing. Seriously. Baker's Square has nothing on a place like this. 

The owners, Cliff and Andrew, are great. They worked with me and my husband via phone, email, and in person, getting everything right. The pies are all home made and their recommendations of pies per season should be paid attention to--we wanted 2 pumpkin pies, but since pumpkin is not in season in April, they recommend sweet potato and no one knew the difference. We had 13 pies and 2 cheesecakes for 134 guests and every bite was eaten! There was no waste and just enough.  

One phenomenal note about their service: Cliff called me the morning on the day before the wedding (my mom was going to pick up the pies later that day), and he offered, at no additional cost, to bake the pies the next morning, the day of the wedding, and to drop them off at the venue itself on the wedding day so the pies would be fresh that day, instead of 1 day old. Phenomenal!! I was so pleased with their services and their prices that I highly recommend all Chicago-based brides who want pies at their wedding to go to this place. 

You will honestly find no place better than this. I promise.

I do not live in Illinois but I get there often and  we do not consider the trip complete without at least one stop at Frank's Karma.  The varied menu and the excellent quality has never disappointed us. Every time we go, usually there is  no place to sit...but not a problem..just let the staff know you will be next door at Bliss wine..and the great Karma staff  are happy to deliver your order there.  Bliss is so gracious about accommodating Frank's overflow...Wauconda is so fortunate to have such great non-chain businesses..Frank's karma, Bliss wine,  Honey hill coffee and now Moddleton''s. So fun to see a thriving downtown.

What a great place in a surprising location. Everything is super fresh, homemade and delicious. Everything I have tried has been outstanding, most notably the English muffins, focaccia and other baked goodies. I've grabbed lunch here 4-5 times and the specials are usually the way to go. Planning on taking advantage of delivery service while home with my newborn! Just go there. It's awesome!

The anti-drive through!

With at least 40 days of sandwiches to sample, we've got our work cut out for us. It will be pure pleasure and then we can start over. Fresh sandwiches on good breads. Crisp salads. Soup. And, pie, did we mention the pies!

We walked in one evening and they were closed but baking pies. Big pies, little pies -- all savory and tempting. These folks are the hardest working in this business and, way out in Wauconda, way better than any city joints.

Alert the Food Network!

yum yum! homemade lemonade, and a sandwich with ham, apples and walnuts all while eating at a picnic table on main street.

this place is amazing!!!

Rarely does a week go by when I don't have lunch at Frank's, and usually it's multiple times per week. If you like fresh, creative, delicious sandwiches and soup, this is the place for you. They also have amazing deserts. Through the years I have tried nearly everything on their menu and have yet to be anything other than impressed. 

Some of my favorites include: 
--Stacked Torte: both the meat and veggie versions are excellent. 
--Flank Steak Wrap w/Tequila Pesto Sauce: this has a perfect zip to it! 
--Any of their Chicken Wraps (Asian, Mojo, etc.): the chicken is cooked outside on a charcoal grill which seems to make the difference. 
--Tomato Basil Soup: intense tomato and basil flavors; I can't find anything that compares. 
--Cream of Asparagus Soup: simply incredible. 

Wauconda is lucky to have such a great place to eat!

I *love* everything about this place - from the freshly prepared, delicious daily specials to the giant handwritten menu board, to the homemade tea & cookies, to the dining soundtrack (today: Andrew Bird). I even love coming in the back door, passing the smokin smokey joes outside and the staff busy in the kitchen who all pause and say hi even though they're busy. Felt like a regular the first time I walked in. Perfect in every way.

I could write a book about how great this place is, but for time and convenience, I'll touch on the highlights and WHY you should eat here.

Amazing hospitality, combined with excellent food and atmosphere make Frank's a rare oasis in the desert of suburbia.  I would say, hands down, some of the best eating in Lake County.  Not only was I blown away by the amazing food, but the service was incredible.  I've never met a more personable business owner that not only "just interacts" with his patrons, but gets to know them.  He even handed us a plate of cookies in good faith that we'd return the plate.

But let's talk food...AMAZING!  Every bite of every sandwich or wrap leaves me wanting more and more until you get to that point where the sandwich/wrap ends and it's bitter sweet; You just ate the best sandwich you've ever had, but unfortunately, there's no sandwich left!

You get the sense, and it's easily confirmed that the food is fresh and handmade.  Their menu is INSANE!  It's so comprehensive and their sandwich-master is an artist!  Always experimenting and working on new combinations of delicious fair.  

I could go on and on forever on this place.  By far one of my favorite places to eat...great food and great hospitality...the 2 things I always look for!!
The greatest pies and sandwiches. Over 30 off the menu, you can't go wrong.

Gotta lova a restaurant named after a dog. The sandwich selection in this place is dizzying. If you can cram it between two slices of bread, it's probably here. I tried one of the specials of the day, their version of the Cuban sandwich. I thought it was absolutely great. I will definitely be back here.

Came back recently and even though the sandwich I ordered was supposed to be a "customer favorite" I honestly hated it. I don't know why I listen to popular opinion! I always seem to have different taste buds than everyone else. I'm going to come back and keep ordering my favorite, the #23.

Wow!  The best customer service!  I needed a dessert for a last minute dinner party and called Frank's Karma Cafe.  Even though they had already closed, Cliff, went out of his way to help.  I was able to pick up one of their famous pies! I'm certain our friends will appreciate every bite.

I LOOOOVE Frank's!  I work in Wauconda and if Frank's wasn't here I would have to bring my lunch every day (which I try to do anyway, but when I receive the email from Frank's about the Daily Specials, I can't resist!).  Where else can you go in the area to get freshly prepared homemade delicious food??? The regular menu is extensive and has so many great choices, but I rarely order from it because there is always something awesome on the  Specials Menu!  Also, I am vegetarian - and I love that I get choices other than salad. I would say that pretty much every day,  there is at least one vegetarian special and the regular menu also has vegetarian choices every day.   Cliff, Andrew and staff are creative with the menu and the service is friendly. Oh and be sure to check out the desserts - YUM!!!!

I lived in Wauconda 3 years before someone told me about this little Gem. I go there 1-2 times a week now. They have a LARGE selection of sandwiches(Over 20) to choose from. Best quality meats/cheeses/breads you can imagine. And the desserts....OH MY! Mini Pies, Cookies, Brownies, Cheesecake...all super yummy! The owners and staff are all super friendly which adds to fact that I keep going back. Every time I go I get something different and have yet to be disappointed. This is by far my favorite place to eat anytime!!!

You need to stop by for lunch!  The specials are always fantastic...although they can sell out quick, but don't worry the regular menu food is just as fabulous.  They serve real food and you can tell they really care about the ingredients, fresh and wonderful.  The little treats of cookies and pies are always tasty.  The people there are super friendly.  Highly recommend it.

I loooooove this place.  You can tell that the owner does too.  Everything is super fresh, evidenced by the ever-changing menu.  Specials are often so good they run out so be sure to get there early.  If the special's all gone, you can be confident that whatever you order will be fantastic.  But perhaps what I love most about this place might be its local, earthy feel... or the fact that it's named after a dog :)

This is one of my favorite suburban finds! The food is amazing and the staff are always warm and friendly. We have dined here at least 20 times in the last few years and have never been disappointed. The specials are always a safe bet, as are the reuben sandwich and the vegetarian sandwich. The staff is always working on new recipes, so its fun to stop in and see what's new.

I will always help a small business owner. However, this place was VERY expensive for what I got. Menu is nice - great selection of sandwiches, pies, soups, home made lemonade and teas.

But I'm sorry, 2 sandwiches, 2 drinks and 1 bad of chips should not cost $16.00. I ordered a roast beef sandwhich. Fresh roll, minimal meat (I'm talking not more that your average JJ's or Potbelly), and horseradish mayo. NOT EVEN A PICKLE!. I literally went home and had another sandwich.

Sorry guys, wont be going back. Reduce the prices and let it be known, and maybe I'll be back.

I love this place.  I love the confusing amount of sandwiches available!  It's too much!  I usually get the tuna melt, which is huge and awesome.  It's 2 meals! Yes, they're a little pricey...but it's 2 meals!  All of their sandwiches are 2 meals. The specials are usually sold out by the time I go down there, but that's okay.  There's a brazillion other great things to choose from. The desserts are to die for.  

When it's busy, the owner/manager can be a bit brusque.  That's the only fault I can find.  I also like their no substitution policy, and their adult friendly atmosphere, i.e., unruly children are not tolerated. Yay!
We had a wonderful lunch here, super fresh and quick.  It is a cute place, kids loved it too!   The owner is very friendly as well.
Love it! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Really, really good sandwiches and homemade soups.....Everyday specials run out fast, so be warned.  Pies are top notch too (its got to be the lard crusts)!  All fresh and mostly local ingedients make a differnence.  Best place for lunch in Wauconda.

Funky little place with great food and baked goods.  Salads and soups are great.  Daily specials that tend to run out early.  All the food is very fresh.  Service is ok - could be a little more charming.  Worth a stop if you are in the area.
This place is very good for real home made sandwiches. All of their food is delicious and I love the feeling it gives off as being at home. The managers are very nice people as well.

The most amazingly tasty and healthy food you can find.  Nearly everything is homemade to the most basic ingredients, salads, sandwiches, desserts and drinks to die for.  If in the mood for wine with the meal, have it delivered for free to Bliss next door!

Far above average deli sandwiches with daily specials which are awesome. The specials need to be pre-ordered in the morning as they usually sell out by noon time. They have a large menu if the specials are gone and have daily homemade soups also. Prices are above average but you get a premium level of quality which is worth it. This place seems to get more and more popular as time goes on. Limited seating available inside so arrive before or after the lunch rush to insure a table. There are a few tables outside if the weather is decent.

The sandwiches are incredible but the desserts are AMAZAING!  I'm not a pie person but the freshly baked mini pies were just too good to not try. Pies, cookies, sandwiches, salads...its all excellent.  I'm a devoted fan of this cafe and all of its goodies!!  Andrew is great and the staff is very friendly.  Feels like home.
Hands down the BEST customer service in the Fox Vally area, these guys know how to make you feel wanted and appreciated!  And the FOOD!  A- MAZING!!  Great place to catch a game!

We have gone to Chubby's for Fish on a Friday.
Very tasty. We did enjoy their Chili.
People were friendly. I don't drink any alcohol,  other than eating food, I don't see returning to this place of business.

Management is awesome, very engaged and present!  

I recommend the Chubby Club with pepperjack cheese, tater tots and a side of Bullfrog Sauce!  A great meal for someone hungry or perfect for a lite meal for two! The buttered toast compliments the thick-sliced bacon well and you'll need both hands, for sure!

I have also tried their Chubby Butter on an 8-pack of chicken wings and want to try same sauce on their frog legs or pulled pork sometime soon!

Frog legs fell off the bone. Cooked to perfection & tender. The chipotle bbq sauce was decent but didn't knock my socks off. While I found several reviews praising the fried pickles, I found them ordinary & forgettable. The loaded tater basket was mediocre. Needed more cheese but I appreciated the fresh jalapeos. Service was slow. We waited an especially long time for the bill, easily 20 minutes or more. Loved the decor & jerseys that hung from the ceiling. Would be great place to watch a Hawks game but I wouldn't return for the food unless craves frog legs specifically.

Took my mom there as she really wanted Frog Legs and we were all impressed with this place! She loved them - I tried a bite but the idea of it grossed me out (nothing to do with the place though!). We have been back since and it's still just as great. 

Everything was delicious! Between all of us we tried the honey BBQ frog legs, soup, grilled cheese with bacon (boring I know, but good), tater tots, mac and cheese wedges, tacos (on Taco Tuesday) and the funnel cake sticks (these were exceptional!). Everything was delicious and everyone there is friendly! For five of us to eat the first time (one child) it was about $70 with drinks, meals and an appetizer. Can't wait to go back again!

I'm not sure if I'll ever get used to bars and restaurants in strip malls.  I guess it's perfectly fine to younger generations, but the idea of trying to squeeze "ambiance" into a former yogurt shop or dry cleaner just seems a stretch to me.

The Chubby Bullfrog sees itself as a sports bar, with the usual memorabilia perched on the walls, and a couple dozen NHL jerseys hanging from the ceilings.  Five TVs ring the bar, and four video poker machines are perched in the corner.

The owner has decided there is no local lunch crowd, so they open at 3 PM  most days.   With the exception of there being alligator bites and frog legs on the menu, it's straightforward standard  Chicago bar food.

It will come as a surprise to absolutely nobody that I had a burger, which are hand-formed patties in your choice of 6, 8, or 10 ounces,  on a fresh 'pretzel-like' roll, and topped with Spanish onion, tomato, lettuce, accompanied by a kosher spear.  I say "pretzel-like" as it has the appearance of a pretzel roll, but not the cloying sweet taste most buns of that ilk possess, which I find unpleasant.

Fries or chips are standard, upgrade to tots, rings or a salad for a buck.  About $11 in all for the 8 ounce, with bacon and blue cheese.  The bacon was very flavorful, and while the blue cheese was a chunky sauce, is was very "blue," strong in flavor, which was a delight for me.

At some point in every burger experience, I strip everything away to taste just the beef, and this is a nice grind, very flavorful, natural  beef flavor, with a slight char.  The deep fried tots were exceptional.  Pepsi soda products and a gajillion beers in bottles.

Ella was my server, she was attentive, personable and prompt. Stopped in for a couple beers and some appetizers (specifically gator bites). Food was good, service was great and I'll definitely be back.

Very disappointed. We were the only diners in the entire restaurant (there were some patrons at the bar) and yet waited more than thirty-five minutes for burgers. The server did acknowledge the wait and apologized, giving us free drink tickets to use at a later date. However, when we did eventually get our lunch, we immediately asked for "to go" containers and the check. We had to leave. It was still another 7 minutes before the check and containers arrived. Burgers were pretty good, but we will not be returning. I'd hate to see what it's like when they are busy.   Again, server was polite, but overall the service/wait was so ridiculous that it doesn't warrant a return trip. Tried to blame it on wanting a well done burger.... Nice try but no.

I've been to the Chubby Bullfrog twice.  Visit #1, we sat at the bar, the restaurant was largely empty, but despite that it took 45 minutes to bring out our dinners.  I can't remember what I ordered, some type of beef sandwich, and my partner had a burger.  Visit #2 was horrible, they claimed to be smoking some meat but the restaurant was full burning chemical type smell that only got worse and worse as we sat there.  It took so long for our food to come out that we ended up just having them box it all so we could leave and get some fresh air, we all had to change our clothes when we got home because the stench was unbearable.  Both times the food was completely unremarkable.

When you combine two unsavory visits with a bunch of overzealous regulars that hurl insults and attack other customers on the restaurant's facebook and yelp pages... Well let's just say that with the huge number of really good pubs in the area there's no reason to bother with this place.  Try Randall Roadhouse(amazing pizza), Village Squire(great local flair) or Blues BBQ(the pulled pork is to die for).

I gave The Chubby Bullfrog 1 star because zero stars is not an option! We went on a Saturday afternoon around 4:30pm. I had accidently stumbled across TCBF while searching for a new place to try on line.

I went with my wife and a friend of ours of whom we go out to eat with quite often. We walked in the door and I did not see a sign indicating whether we should seat ourselves or not. The bar had 6 patrons seated at it and there was only one table on the floor that was occupied by one person.

I got the bartender's attention and asked if we could seat ourselves. She was very polite and told we could sit wherever we liked. With-in seconds after the bartender telling us that a patron at the bar felt as though he needed to stand and point to each empty table and yell "except that one, and that one, and that one" until he covered all the tables. I picked the first table he pointed at and told him that I was going to sit there just because he said not to. I don't know he felt the need to say that but it pissed me off.

I ordered the frog legs and gator bites apps for the table. The frog legs were very greasy and left a strange film on our teeth. The gator bites were decent but there is more breading then gator meat.

For dinner I ordered a bacon blue cheese burger and ordered it medium well. Burger was cooked well done (which I really don't mind). The burger was oozing grease!! The meat had a weird texture. I think it may be twice ground. 

My wife ordered a club sandwich. Looked good to me. I did not try it at dinner but did eat the half that she took home the next day and was good.

Our friend ordered a grilled cheese with ham. (He orders this same sandwich wherever he can) and said he has had better.

The patrons at the bar were quite obviously regulars. Which is cool by me but they were extremely obnoxious and we felt as if we were not welcome.

The bartender was our waitress and was very polite and we were very satisfied with her service.

I usually try a new place three times before I post a negative review to give them a chance. People have bad days and the cook may have been having an off day; but I don't think I could stand the behavior of the regulars and after reading some other reviews here on Yelp, I'm not the only one.

We stopped in for a quick lunch today.  Delicious!  Tiffany our server/bartender was a delight.  She explained the meat was fresh,  never frozen. The burgers are formed as they are cooked.  The soups are homemade. We had a cup of orzo,  tomato,  spinach.  It was good.  I ordered the sliders,  one burger,  one on site smoked pork and one meatball.   My husband ordered a 1/2 lb pub burger. 

My husband said his burger was one of the best he's ever had in a restaurant. And the bun was excellent as well.  He ordered his burger medium,  and it was nicely pink in the middle.  He also said he didn't think he'd order anything but a burger next time, it was that good.

Great, local neighborhood watering hole and Mike the owner and barkeeper is a huge hockey/Blackhawks fan and knows how to treat his patrons. Their pulled pork sliders were really tender and good BBQ sauce. Awesome selection of appetizers like frog legs, mac & cheese bites, wings, deep fried pickles etc. Decent selection of beers on tap and definitely in bottles for local craft beers as well.
Place was great. Came with A group of 12. Food was really good service was excellent. Try this out.

Disappointing first experience! First being double charged for drinks(please pay attention to ur bill) aNd a very vulgar bigger blond lady....for our first time being there I wasn't expecting at bar close for this woman to scream "loVe you guys but GET THE F..CK OUT!" She acted Completely inappropriate & CLASSLESS! We were so excited to try this place & needless to say we won't be back! I can't comment on food because kitchen closes at 10:30, I kno kinda early, we were bummed!

We love this place... I'm from a small town, free standing bars, or where there is one on the corner of a neighborhood street... I like the small town feel, you know where everyone knows your name kind of place... and if they don't they are nice enough that you think they do... love the serving staff... they make the place what it is that is for sure.  Smiles, happy, honest and funny... I was so glad to finally stop in here, we now have our hang out... our bar to meet up... oh... the food, is great, you cannot top their amazing fish fry on Fridays and their coleslaw is to die for.  Not all vinegary, it's fresh and absolutely delish.  Best place in the area to be for a Blackhawks game that's for sure!

This is definitely a local favorite. The food is great, and they always go above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied and enjoying yourself. Very popular spot for Hawk's games. 

The owner makes these specialty sweet tart shots that taste just like the candy. I will continue to go to here! Looking forward to the expansion!
Had a blast with the kids during "kids karaoke night". Great food, reasonable prices, awesome service, friendly atmosphere, and the kids loved it!

Hit the Chubby Bullfrog a few weeks ago. Three of had sammiches and we tried the FROG LEGS. They were big, tasted great. Between good service and my pulled pork sandwich I would have given this place four stars that night. 

Took some more friends, stopped in for a Friday night Hawks game. Place was packed, service at the bar was only decent and the pricing wasn't great. Good hockey viewing everywhere; stayed to the end of the game. Three stars.

Went back a third time with friends for the hawks game, had bragged about the place. Well this time they served scrawny little thoughtless frog legs, only passable nacho's and a very ordinary sandwich. Pricing was nothing special, frog legs should have been sent back and the service was terrible. Two stars

Wow, what a surprise, we drove by kind of by accident and decided to stop in and have a couple of drinks which ended up being dinners too.  A very nice ambience for a local bar, very good service, quality drinks and some delicious fish fry (it was a Friday after all).  We would definitely be back, for sure.  Nicely done chubby bullfrog.

Coming back to watch all the Hawks and bears games. The inside is loaded with all sports gear and there're 6 huge TVs that you can clearly see from every table. I got a cheeseburger that was cooked perfectly (medium rare). The fries are really good too. First time here but won't be my last- it's well worth skipping all the overcrowded bars in Algonquin for games and drinks.

This note is to Jason N.    I just so happened to be sitting just in front of your beloved on the night in question and not for nothing but it didn't go down quite the way the wife had reported. 
 It is possible that the way the message given was not done so with a dozen roses but Mike (the owner) was very up front with the fact it was standing room only and if she was okay with standing she needed to do so out of a high traffic area. Let me preface this by saying, the time in question was 3 minutes left in the first at a Hockey Bar were everyone but you and your wife is dripping in BLACKHAWKS swag. So I'm not sure witch one of you had the brilliant idea of trying to come in to a Hockey Bar (during playoffs) to try and get a seat. 
Well, at least we may be able to chalk this up to a learning experience and know for next time.
  If you had come in early enough to get a table for the game, you might have had the chance to experience why I and my family and friends go in to the Frog. Mike and his entire team are like minded in understanding customers come first. Mike happens to be one of the most gracious people I know... He contributes to the community with fundraisers, He donated to our community Youth Football Team  (Jr. Chargers) and most of all he cares.... 
  Overall thanks for the input, as a business man myself I'm constantly looking for  opportunity's to straighten my team.  I got a feeling the learning from this will help to do so... 

Footnote: The Chubby Bull Frog is a place to come have fun and some drinks. 
Great Drink Specials, Foods is always Good and the service is on point! 

Personal recommendation:   SW Chicken Sandwich & Fries 

Five Stars from me
Been to this place a few times.  The food and service are amazing.  It is THE best spot to watch a hawks game.  The staff is amazing!

Great food and a great experience. The bartenders introduced themselves and shook my hand before they took an order. Unheard of nowadays. The Friday night fish was awesome. I was visiting the area but will definitely go back when in town.
Had a great time. Food came out in timely fashion. Was able to watch cubs and blackhawks games at same time. Very friendly service people.  Will likely go back again for lunch or dinner.

Decent food, a nice setup. It's in a strip mall not really near other lively stores or a major intersection. Walked in at 3pm and not a single person was there. Ate our food and left 45minutes later. In that whole time, we were the only two people in the restaurant. Felt kind of awkward eating there with nobody else at all. Might be more a product of its location in West Dundee. Just a minor complaint, but the food was fine, the place was clean, and the waiter that served us was great.

I've been meaning to write this review for some time.  

From time to time, they have a chicken dinner special that is outstanding.  Three pieces of chicken and fries for $10.  The chicken always comes out piping hot and has excellent flavor.  Someone told me that the flavor is the result of frying the chicken in the same oil they use for the frog legs (yuck) but I can't verify that either way.  In any case, great chicken, even if that exquisite flavor flavor I am picking up is that of frog guts.  I have also tried the pulled pork sandwich which was very good.  

Liquor prices are a bit high, so I usually have only a beer or two and cannot comment on anything beyond that.  

One negative I will mention, is the cole slaw.  Each meal usually comes with a big heaping bowl of cole slaw.
