Let me tell you, this cole slaw is the most retched, disgusting stuff I have ever tasted.  Holy crap.  Making a good cole slaw is so ridiculously easy, I just can't imagine why they would want to plate up this concoction when everything else on the menu is generally decent.  

I don't consider Chubby Bullfrog to be in my regular rotation, but I will check in there from time to time when the chicken special is on the menu.  I did have one experience with one particularly snarky server there which was a bit of a turnoff for me.  I promptly re-seated to a different servers section and that was that.  If you decide to go, ask to be seated in Jenn's section and she will take great care of you.  And, for heaven sakes, hold the g** d*** cole slaw!
Really Good Fresh Burgers.... Delicious!  Excellent service, owner was nice and friendly

Last Friday my wife and I visited the CBBG for the first time.  We have known of this place since their opening and know that there is Fish on Fridays. The server came to the table
immediately with the menu and took our order for drinks.

Since I decided to have fish, I asked the server if the batter on the fish was thick or thin, since
I don't like thick batter as is served in many restaurants.  She explained that it was thin...I said to give me one order of three pieces vs all one can eat.  My wife ordered another item from the menu and was satisfied with her order.

The fish was served hot with a perfectly browned thin batter coating. I was struck with the
appearance of the plate with perfect colored fries and a container of coleslaw.  The fish
was flaky and hot. (Not mushy and overcooked like many places).  The coleslaw has good flavor without all of the usual juicy liquids.  I was impressed and satisfied that the food was perfectly prepared. 

Our server was excellent from start to finish.  We are looking for another visit.
Great place for Darts and a Blackhawks Game.  Does get crowded, so you want to get there early and save a seat.

Great, much needed neighborhood bar! 
The owner and his wife could not be more conscientious and accommodating.
Great hockey bar,, as well as any other sport, excellent t.v. Placement.  A great music  and karaoke venue.
I've eaten there more times than I can count, and have never been disappointed.
Chub on!

Chubby's is THE place to go. It doesn't matter who your server is, they are all amazing. Mike has done a great job with the place. My 6 year old son loves it here, and it's very family friendly. Especially during hockey season, if you're not at the chubby bullfrog, you're doing it wrong!! 

Also-the chicken parm on Wednesday is to die for. You can catch me there EVERY Wednesday!

Will not be returning anytime soon. The service is so awful and rude. During our visit we had a server named lexi. Super rude and acted like we were a bother to her. We had never been there before and had many questions about the menu and it was obvious she was annoyed answering them. Drinks took awhile and my husband got up to use the restroom and saw our sever in the back texting.... Needless to say we will not be returning. Food was alright but nothing special. It's a shame.

I really like this place. It has a great menu, a relaxed atmosphere, fair prices, and the bartender (Mike, i think) was super friendly. 

My date and i ordered the frog legs b/c we've never eaten frog before. Basically like a rubbery hot wing. For dinner we had a cheeseburger and nachos. Both were good, no complaints. 

There's more items on the menu we'd like to go back and try so we'll probably return

An amazing place to watch a Hawks game..food was excellent and Service was fantastic even though they were slammed...I would definitely suggest this place for a good time watching the Hawks playing darts or just stop in and to have a beer!!
Went there for the first time on Saturday.  Food was ok...bar food but the staff really really nice but it was SO loud. The Hawks were playing, so I get it.  But overall a nice neighborhood place.

Great little pub. Finally found a perfect hockey bar south of the 49th parallel. Frog legs tossed in garlic parmesan are incredible. Be sure to try the chili too; hearty and subtly spicy. Will be back to Chubby Bullfrog for sure.

This local bar and grill is awesome. If you love hockey, it's a must go!

It's great to go and feel welcome with fabulous hospitality.  Great food and service.  Family friendly. I highly recommend it.  Thanks Neg and Mike for all your comforting service.

We went here for dinner on a Saturday night.  This place has a great atmosphere.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome.  The food was delicious - especially the homemade chips- and the prices were reasonable.  A great experience!
Always have a great time here the staff is always attentive and friendly! Keep up the good work!

Good food and friendly service  . 
Stopped in on a week night so was quite . Lots of TV's . Will come back agin

Beer prices seem a little high. I have not tried the food at all.

If you are there during a hockey game and would like to watch another game - any game - prepare to go somewhere else.  In fact, the owner said as much - no beating around the bush.  So, we did.  This was prior to the playoffs.  

There are multiple TVs, but no flexibility.  I was told that the system isn't set up to show different channels (or something to that effect), but until the game started, it was showing different games.  

I get it, you want to have a hockey bar.  There are other sports games though.  Play the audio of the hockey game and show it on most of your TVs.  There is nothing wrong with another game on a silent TV.

I've been here twice.  I'm not sure if there will be a third time.  When I am told that I would be happier elsewhere, I can't argue with that.

This is THE spot to eat at in the area. Down to earth, friendly staff. Simple yet somehow unique menu. Mike knows his bar and knows his customers even better. Great atmosphere and best Blackhawks Bar in the NW Burbs.

I practically live at this place.  My boyfriend lives down the street and this is the best place to go in West Dundee.  Not only is the staff wonderful and the owners Mike and Megan are some of the most accommodating and caring people I've ever encountered.  The food is fantastic thanks to the talented cooking staff.   They even created a gluten free option just because I asked them to because I have an intolerance.   And if your a hockey fan this is the place to go.  Although they always try to play all sports, contrary to the comments in a previous review.   Anyone who doesn't like the bullfrog is obviously living under a rock cause this place is top notch.  So glad they opened and have stayed around!!!  Bullfrog fan for life!!!!!

Went with a couple of buddies for some appetizers and drinks.  Great little local pub, owner is nice...introduced himself to us and asked if everything was good.  This is a Hawks bar, so if you go on a night the Hawks are playing, it's going to be packed which is great.  Lots of excitement.  These folks that complain that the service is slow when it's crowded are just being whiney.  It's a sports bar in a strip center, so you can expect interesting bar food, good drinks, friendly people, and sports on TV.
Best bar around! Awesome staff, awesome owners! Best HAWKEY bar around! Food is always great and always treated like family! Can't say enough good things about this place!!!

I think this bar is cool is a very friendly bartender named Tiffany and I am hanging out with all some girls talking about life and his bar is awesome I need more words to fill this review so I become a yelp professional have a nice day oh and by the way there's great TVs and sports radio grave you wherever you go overview six and there are darts and maybe they'll be a pool table under the bed to rest nice I'm sure if I ate food to be delicious

I love going to new places to eat and when I heard about The Chubby Bullfrog I couldn't wait to try it. Came on a Sunday to watch the NASCAR race and have some lunch. I walked in and was sat at a hightop table right away. The place is smaller just a few tables and some seats at the bar. The bar menu is pretty standard for a bar, except they did have froglegs....I did NOT get those! I ended up ordering the cheese fries and my friend got the mozzerella sticks. The food was good, I think next time I would try a burger, they looked good. Also, they have Kareoke on Saturdays that I wouldn't mind checking out either.

A place to check out for sure if your looking for a nice bar to just hang out at.

This was my first time trying this place. Specifically went for the fish fry because it was haddock. It's hard to find places that use haddock for fish fry. What a disappointment! There was twice as much greasy batter than actual fish. Batter smelled and tasted fishy, like it was fried in old oil. It was also very dark brown, not golden brown. I peeled the batter off and ate the fish. The coleslaw was terrible, very sweet and drowning in liquid. The best thing about the meal were the fries. Perfectly cooked!

Went there recently on a Friday night and the food was terrible and so were the drinks.  Had the wings they were way too salty.  We were told the brine them...well why?  They tasted like they were never rinsed from the brine.  Second we also ordered the pretzel with cheese.  The cheese sauce was so "milky" and tasted terrible.  More like a watery cheese soup than a dip.  For drinks we ordered a couple of vodka tonics.  All tonic no vodka.  Your better off getting a beer so that you know you will actually get what you pay for.  I will never go back.
Nice little neighborhood sports bar.  Surrounded by large flat screens, great service, and good food.

This is my go-to spot when I'm back in town visiting friends & family. Always great service, great food and great times. Best place in town to watch a game - ANY GAME - and their karaoke parties and live music bookings are fantastic. The owners are not only dear friends but the consummate hosts. Even when we've barn-stormed them with a giant "reunion" group with little notice, they are all over it. Do yourself a favor and stop in for some grub & cocktails soon!

OMG! The pulled pork sandwich was the best BBQ I've had this side of Memphis! We have been all over the southern states, and I'm telling you, this stuff rivals the best of them. They smoke their own pork out back, then pull it and put it in a fantastic BBQ sauce that has a little kick to it. It's served on a pretzel roll with a fried onion ring on top. They don't skimp at all on the meat either. I wish they would offer more of the BBQ dishes like ribs, brisket, etc. I plan to be a regular here. 

They have a nice children's menu and even offer children's karaoke one night a week.
Rewrite. Fun bar. Totally hockey oriented. Food is average. Service is excellent.  The owner mike is into his business and always looking for ways to improve his business.

I've been back to The Chubby Bullfrog a few times now.  Usually a good place to stop for a beer, unless it's busy. If its busy you will wait quite some time in between visits from the server. We tried to just go up to the bar to bring back our own drinks, but that was hit and miss too if they bartender will bother to notice you.  Pork nachos are great, but don't get the fries, always get the chips. Had a bad pork sandwich, really fatty, noted this to my server and the owner came over and admitted they were probably too busy in the kitchen when they were preparing this to notice, but did not take this off my bill.  Also, unless there is a special, the beers are a bit $$ for this small town area.  I'll visit again when they are not busy.
We really enjoyed the food and service. Well priced.
Great homemade potato chips and pulled pork sandwich.  Cannot wait to try the rest of the menu.

Great sports bar!  The best place in the Fox Valley to watch a Hawks game!  Fantastic atmosphere with large TV's all around, so you can enjoy a variety of sports.  Extremely family friendly, live music & even karaoke!  Excellent & friendly service always...Drink & Food specials Daily.  Cold draft imports & large beer selection.  The Food is awesome - Great Pulled Pork Sandwiches, Burgers, variety of appetizers and Daily specials that are out of this world!  I love the Friday Fish Fry!  The place to hang, whenever I'm in town.

I was driving through the area recently and stopped here for a late dinner and a drink. First things first, they have Molson on draft... and they're a hockey bar (they go hand in hand). That made me happy. The staff was good. I had the nachos (no meat) as an appetizer. I was not impressed with them though. Too much lettuce and not enough other stuff for me. I could really just do without the lettuce. I then tried the sliders (because I wanted to try a variety). I had one of each, pulled pork, shredded chicken, and burger. All three were quite tasty. I did prefer the chipotle sauce over the honey bbq. My friend had a wrap and was disappointed. So, i'd stick with the normal bar and grill type food. The Molson was great. I went there again another time after that. Food was still good. They were out of Molson the next time though, which was disappointing. Hopefully they get the Molson back. I'd go back if going through the area.
This is a great place! Friendly atmosphere and the service is awesome. They have fantastic food, try the pulled pork nachos!!!

Great place to view a game. Generous portions of food.  If you don't believe me ask for the Chubby Club. You probably wont finish it. Beer selection is ok, you can find a few good tasting beers on tap or bottles.  A word of caution, if its the playoffs you may not find a seat!
Quick delivery, friendly service and the food is always so great! Great price point, also.

Only order from here if you love having loads of sugar in your food. 

We had the sweet n sour pork and the sesame beef. The pork had little flavor and the sauce was ultra sweet and no evidence of the sour. It was like a sugar syrup with added with msg and whatever makes it that scary neon orange color. The beef was really tender and might have been delicious if it was not floating in a similar syrup, this one just brown. I did not see or taste much sesame but it was loaded with garlic. Eating the dish was like sucking on a garlic and beef flavor lollipop. 

The large portion comes with enough rice to feed the contenders of Survivor for a few days. 

I had a coupon for 2 egg rolls for a purchase above $15. Mentioned when ordering, handed over the coupon in the store, and unpacked the food at home with no egg rolls in sight.

Best Chinese take out in the area. And even with that it is only three stars. And there's really not much to say here. It's a typical Chinese takeout far better than the rest of the garbage around in the neighborhood. They have standard lunch specials which are five or six dollars and get they give you enough food to last three meals. I never understood why Chinese restaurants I love to give enough rice for six people in a meal for one.

Before I just ate this for the umpteenth time, I was sure I was going to give it four stars. However I have realized that there is much inconsistency in their orders every time. And it is not like they have a language barrier when ordering. This is the best part about this place. The guy in the phone speaks perfect English in the back of the house is Asian. I just don't know why there is inconsistencies in the food. 

Tip. If you want it really spicy, you need to say brown people spicy. Otherwise they're spicy dishes made extra spicy are still sweet.  If you like your chicken crunchy make sure you say well done. 

I also love that they don't cheap out I'm giving you 20 packets of soy sauce or whatever they have. They don't even charge you. Take note Ho Luck down the block.

Never ever order from this place, they took two hours to deliver my order. 
Did not even care to inform the customer that there might be delay in the delivery.

Came 2nd time, completely forgot that I had already given it low review (2 stars) two years ago and shouldn't have came back.

Well we did because our favorite chinese restaurant is closed on Tuesday. The foods here at Fortune are still the same. No improvement! Sodium is skyrocket high apparent through strong sauce. Too much on my plate!

Ragoon were nasty, too. I feel this business doesn't care about our cholesterol going through the roof!

Please please remind me not to come back here. Their frequent mailing advertisements are a waste.

I cannot say one bad thing about fortune house they have great Chinese food the noodles are delicious the eggrolls were really good the sweet-and-sour chicken was perfect exactly the way that I like it the food is not overly salty but definitely has enough flavor

I don't think I have ever been disappointed by Chinese take-out food - even the bad ones are usually still decent enough. But this place was so disappointing that I question the other reviews on here..

I ordered the moo sue pork which was way way too sweet and drowned in liquid sauce with barely any pork - and any pork I did find was super dry and hard (and bright red...?) and the wraps were so dry it crumbled when I tried to wrap the filling. 

I also ordered the chow fun (switched out the beef for chicken, which they were kind enough to do for me since it only came in beef on the menu - but at the same time I don't understand how that item doesn't have other protein options like everything else..) - and it was way overcooked, bloated, and bland.

I would have posted a photo, but it was just all dark brown mush, so I figured I would paint the picture with words instead. It's not even like its super cheap to justify paying for it.. I don't think I will ever order from here again.
Done by accident

Just called to place an order for delivery and the girl that answered the phone was the rudest person I have ever dealt with. Answers the phone with a simple hello, like I was bugging her, so I had to verify that I had the correct place and not just some snotty teenagers phone. The price for 2 small items and a can of coke were outrageous and then there was a 45 min wait on top of it. I ended up calling back and cancelling the order because I can't stand people like that. I'll drive to family house and get great Chinese food from helpful people instead.

I have ordered from Fortune House for the past several years but only delivery so I can't comment on take-out/dine-in. The beef quality is fairly decent but I would pass on the chicken as it tends to taste old. I recommend the Mongolian beef, Human beef, and Hot and sour soup. 
The quality has been consistent but of a mid level restaurant. The portions are very large and delivery time has always been fair.

If I can give a 0 I would.  Horrible customer service. Rude, hang up the phone on you when your deliver takes over an hour. Food is okay but not worth the rude service. I'm from NYC, I'm used to rude service but at least you get your food on time.

Who doesn't like Chinese now!! 
5 star for the fried rice .. The portion is large and worth every cent!! 
The chow mien is yum yum!! The oil is a bit extra in this but it has all the Taste and flavor otherwise .. The portion is amazing again!! 
The veg spring roll was a blah!! No flavor .. No salt.. Nothing wow about it!! As a matter of fact it was sweet!!!! 
Their famous tso chicken was not of my Taste but wasn't bad either. Portion size -superb!! 
Ordered for home delivery on a Saturday night and believe it or not it was delivered well before I could even finish one drink!! 
Will surely order the rice again!
This place is so fast and awesome. I just ordered on GrubHub and it took 12 minutes. That is also a consistent happening. Food is really good as well, I would not continue to order if it was sub par.

Taste: Poor
Service: Decent
Delivery: HORRIBLE

I decided to order lunch from here today and was highly unsatisfied. 
It took 2 hours for them to deliver my meal. (Which was just one order of Sesame Chicken, and an Egg Roll on the side. Nothing big) 
I had to call twice to remind them I was waiting. Their online ordering is very disorganized. After the two hour wait, I didn't get any kind of discount, just an apology. The food was hot, but the taste was poor. There was way too much garlic in the Sesame Chicken and it ended up hurting my stomach. 
If you're looking for a convenient, good tasting meal don't go here. 
Do not recommend.
This place is great! The lunch menu ends at 3, but its really cheap and all the orders come with an egg roll and a drink. We got orange chicken and sweet and sour chicken and both were amazing!!

I ordered $73.00 worth of food for dinner. I am not sure if owners or management has changed at Fortune House, but it was a big waste of $73.00!! The food was 100% terrible!!!! What a disappointment! I lived in Schaumburg/Streamwood for 17 years. I moved to California 3 years ago. I came here with my husband and daughter to spend Christmas with my family. On this very cold, windy, icy, snowy night, we wanted good Chinese food and I thought FH would be it. NOT at all! The sesame chicken I ordered was extremely soggy with no flavor. It's like they took heavily breaded chicken and drenched it in sweet syrup sauce. Sooo gross! I called and spoke to the manager- he said he can't give me my money back but he can give me a credit on my account. I will never eat there again, so I guess I won't use my credit. Don't waste your time and money on this place!!
Best Chinese food made to man! I have been looking for a good Chinese place for awhile now and found this pot of gold!!! I must order from here atleast twice a week that's how great this place is!!!!

History: first time trying this place. I will not be back. 
Pros: reasonable price, fast service, big portions, friendly cashier, not too greasy food
Cons: taste is mediocre, not a place to dine-in
Must have: I don't know since I can't recommend getting the s&s chicken or their fried rice

STAY AWAY!!!  ORDER ANYWHERE ELSE!!! 

I used to love their food until I ordered a low mein noodle from them on Friday, 8 May 2015.  When I was plating my food, and thankfully I did not just eat from the container.  The only reason I did not eat from the container was because I was going to share this with my mother in-law.  

As I was portioning out food, I heard a strange plunk.  After looking at the scoop of food I just plated, I found a ROCK in the food.  Not a hard seed, an actual rock that I would find in my yard, in my food.  Had I not plated it, I would have ran the risk of breaking a tooth, or worse breaking my family members tooth. 

How does a rock I would find in the yard get into food? Absolutely no excuse for this, and I have already told neighbors, friends, and family to stay far away.  

Needless to say, I tossed our EVERYTHING that we ordered.  I would not even feed your food to my dogs now.

UPDATE: I called the health department, and learned what was in my food.  It wasn't a rock, but a part of their nasty floor.  They were preparing food when the inspector showed up, and also had someone jack hammering the floors.  They shut them down until repairs are completed, but it was confirmed that there was dust and debris everywhere.  Absolutely appalling!

Messed up my order, and chicken from my sweet and sour chicken was still cold !! But then again this could've been because
I ordered 30 mins prior to closing ? ...hmmm

Worst place ever do not order!!! The manager told me to never order from him again because he won't omit garlic from the chicken order. He told me my orders are too much for him to make without garlic or without onions. The food is not fresh premade and the manager and owner don't want your business. Save your time and money and go somewhere that wants your business!  

I give this place 0 stars

Wow, wow, wow, wow! This is the real deal. I love their Chinese food!

I love that this place is strictly carry out or delivery. 
There is no better place than at home to eat Chinese food, alone or with others.

It's not a fast food restaurant but I don't have to wait very long for my order to be ready when I call ahead and tell them I'll pick it up myself. By the time it takes me to walk my dog to the strip mall of where this is, I've worked up an appetite and when I reach my dad's place with the bag of goodies, I've given myself a decent workout.

I like the Smart cars their drivers use to make deliveries. They are so darn cute and a great option for lazy days or bad weather.

This place is the bomb! You really cannot go wrong with anything that you get here. What I love the most about their lunch special is you can replace the egg roll with crab rangoon. That is hard to do these days with other Chinese places without getting the 3rd degree or hassle that comes with that kind of request. The rangoon is FILLED with cream cheese-not to mention super crunchy and flavorful. So it's typically 7.00 lunch special with your option of crab rangoon/egg roll, choice of fried rice or regular(I'd recommend the fried-absolutely the best I've had to date)choice of soda and your main dish. HUGE PORTIONS. I like the Mongolian Beef, Empress Chicken, Sweet and Sour Chicken, General Tsos Chicken...you cannot go wrong with their choices! My ultimate go to is the Mongolian Beef spicy. Good quality meat(aka doesn't taste like you might be eating dog)great portions and they deliver! Delivery fee isn't too bad and they arrive relatively fast! Great place.
The food was delicious! Huge portions as well. We had Mongolian beef, orange chicken, crab Rangoon, beef fried rice and egg rolls.. Everything was delicious and hot!
First time ordering and have to say it's was very good... good size servings ... will definitely order from again
They burned my egg foo young. It was the first time I've ordered from them. Also the prices on their web site are wrong. I will not order again, a couple doors down there is a great thai food place.

Cant believe it. They did not gave me what i wanted and when i called to complaint they refuse to give me credit and they even hang up on me.  When i show up back to the restaurant bring in the food back they refuse to issue a credit for something that i dont even wanted anymore, never come here again.  I been in the restaurant bussiness for so many years and you do whatever is in your power to make a customer happy,  blame on this people for being in the restaurant Industry

Based on all the recommendations on here, we caved and ordered for take out on a late Sunday afternoon. Our order: General Tso and Hot & Sour Soup. 

I can honestly say that I am not impressed. If you have not been to many Chinese food spots, you might be okay with their food but this one does not make halfway up our "top" list.  My husband is a Hot & Sour Soup fanatic while I always skip on it because I personally don't like it. According to him, the soup was cold, completely watered down and tasteless. While the General Tso was nothing special. In fact, most places we've gone to have broccoli with it. It tasted more like sweet & sour chicken than General Tso. It was sweet and not spicy at all. Our rice was also overcooked. I posted pictures and while it looks delicious, this is a case where looks can be decieving. Don't get me wrong, it's not horrible - it's simply average. 

Our hunt for a good Chinese spot in Schaumburg continues ....
My go-to since moving to Schaumburg. They're quick for pickup. I've never orders delivery.

3.5 Pretty standard, go-to lunch special joint.  I only order for delivery.  You'll get huge portions for the food. Nothing amazing or authentic, but great for a fast, cheap, quick lunch. 

I always get the General Tso's special, and the shrimp egg foo young.  The General Tso's is meaty, hearty, and has that sweet and sour zest with a mild kick. Shrimp egg foo young sometimes comes burnt on edges, but usually not too bad. The fried rice is dry, but at least flavored. Egg rolls are okay.

All-in-all, passable. Although I can't gush over any one thing, I do keep coming back for more, so it says something.

Is there such a thing as good Chinese Take Out? 

The BBQ Pork tasted like it had been in a freezer, it tasted more freezer than pork, actually. The BBQ sauce was super runny. More sweet than bbq. 

The General Tso's...where do I begin? It tasted nothing like General Tso's. It was sweet, no hint of spicey at all. Half of it tasted over cooked with a stringy & hard texture. The other half was "just ok". 

Overall the food was bland. I asked for extra Sweet and Sour and only got two cups of the orange sauce, which isn't standard Sweet & Sour note did I get extra. 

Does Fortune House know what seasoning and fresh means. Apparently not...I will not be returning.

Pretty much the best take-out Chinese I have ever set tongue on in my life.  Ever.

I come to Fortune House regularly when I don't want to cook for a while, and I don't mind straying from my healthy-eating habits for a while.  Why?  Because the portions are HUGE.  I usually get the special combination platter.  For $8.75, I order the General Tso's Chicken, fried rice, egg roll, and a can of soda.  For me, the food lasts for about 3 days.  The lunch specials are around $6, with about the same portions as the dinner specials.  Not too shabby.

And the food is delicious!  Of course, it's not P.F. Chang's (that may or may not be a bad thing, depending on your preferences), it's take-out.  The rice is fresh, the meats are juicy, the vegetables are crisp, and the Hot and Sour Soup is hearty and spicy.  Love, love, love it.

The prices are already decent, but know that Fortune House participates with Restaurant.com, and you can purchase discounted vouchers to apply to the cost of your meal.

Can't wait to come back and try the Empress Shrimp! :-)
Great food and prompt delivery.  The sweet want shrimp are really outstanding! Big fan of their fried rice.

Oh wow... hello lunch special!!

Hubby and I decided to order lunch from here since we had never before.  He got his normal General Tsos and I opted for the Sesame Chicken.  HUGE, huge, huge portions, we had enough for Dinner and then some.  Flavor was good as always, though I did miss the pork in the fried rice (whenever we order for dinner, we get it with pork).  Egg roll is great and crispy, and its always nice when they include a pop.
Delicious cuisine! The egg foo young is by far the best thing to date. The orange beef is aromatic and tender. Defiantly worth a try.

saw this restaurant on grub hub & i took a shot in the dark and ordered from here and let me tell you. oh their chow mien was the best thing i've ever had and they give you more than enough to share (not that you would want too)  5 stars!!

Since I originally wrote my review I've been to Fortune House a million times and also catered my company's Holiday party this year. I stand by my original statements that this is the best Chinese food in Schaumburg. 

I've tried tons of dishes on the menu and have never had a bad meal. They have very good eggrolls which are a truly rare find at Chinese places. I suggest getting delivery because going into the actual storefront is sometimes weird dealing with the young college aged guys that man that front area.

Lunch specials went up a quarter so are now $5.75 but the deal still cannot be beat. With lunch specials you get an eggroll, can of pop and huge portion of your desired entree. The portion is really so large, I can only make my way through half of it and then always end up with dinner out of it, too! Score!

You can't go wrong with their Sesame Chicken, I really think it's the best I've had anywhere. General Tso's Chicken is also a winner with a hint of spice that someone with super low tolerance to fire like myself can handle! Moo Goo Gai Pan is delicious here, as well as the crowd pleaser Sweet & Sour Chicken. ....Can you tell I like chicken dishes? :P

If you're in Schaumburg and looking for Chinese delivery or pickup, I would steer you straight to Fortune House.
Usually good food, but the last time I ate there there were ants in my egg drop soup. They apologized and offered me credit to the restaurant but I can't bring myself to eat there again.

I like the food. I'm also not a Chinese-food aficionado. I like basic stuff like chicken fried rice and sweet and sour chicken. It's hard to screw that up. Their pan fried noodles are a hit or miss but they are still edible regardless.

I have no complaints on their customer service because we live a mile away and pick up our food and since they have never screwed up an order, we are fine with the service.

Certainly not the best Chinese food ever, but well worth the money considering the portions are pretty big. I always have lunch the next day. 

It's also super close to our house and convenience is a huge factor when you get home from a long day and just want something fast without it being fast food.

I give Fortune House a solid 4 stars.  I've had better, and worked at Leeann Chin's (5 stars) so I can't quite give it 5 stars, but I've had a lot worse.  So that's why I say SOLID 4 stars.  

I crave the crab rangoon here.  They don't skimp at all on the cream cheese mix.  Big and plump!   

The pot stickers (oops, they were so good, I ate them before I could take a picture of them, ha ha) are huge too.  And the pot sticker sauce is the BEST I've ever had.  I wanted to say it had some orange juice in it, and my husband thought it had little bits of apple in it.  Don't know.  It's a mystery, but so delicious I can drink it straight!  ha!   

They have great lunch specials.  

So many Chinese restaurants have a lot of items, heavy in the soy sauce taste.  I'm always happy to find a place that doesn't cook like that.  

The egg rolls are okay.  Sometimes they have a pasty floury taste to them.  Don't know if that means they are not cooked all the way, or just use a heavier recipe for the shell.  

Kung Pao beef is so pleasantly tender.  And like other reviewers have already stated, the General Tso's is very good too.  Not overly sweet like some make it.   House fried rice is done well.  The chicken corn soup always warms up the soul and is nice.   We'll be back!  Pot stickers and crab rangoon will always be on the hit list!  :)

Frequently ordered in over the span of a few months, but will be avoiding vehemently going forward. Ordered in for a family dinner last Sunday and nabbed a small House Special Lo Mein. It looked good enough until I noticed a staple in a bite I had taken. 

Removed it and separated the food out on a plate to check for more. Grand total of four staples in a small Lo Mein. 

Good food or not, that's a level of carelessness I prefer to avoid when having my meal prepared. Will never order from Fortune House again.

I ordered the spring roll, veggie fried rice, beef lo mein and calamari, everything was hot and delicious especially for such a cold day out I expected to have to reheat but I didn't have to at all. I also enjoy the convince of the order online through yelp. That option and the reviews were the reason I checked this place out in the first place and I am happy I did;)

We've been ordering takeout from here for a few years now and they have always managed to keep the food tasty and hot. They could not be quicker with making it. They tell me 15minutes and its always ready to be picked up at the time. The portions are generous. They don't include hot mustard or hot sauce unless you ask for it, so if you like your food with some heat you have to ask. I find their prices to be a little expensive. They do smaller portions of just about everything except for orange chicken (the thing I order the most), so a little disappointing but I guess it doesn't hurt to have leftovers for lunch the next day. Food is always great. Its the best place I know for takeout Chinese food in Schaumburg.
Great price and great food! My family and I were dong a weekend trip as usual and wanted some Chinese food and found this place near our hotel.
Solid Chinese American food, reasonable prices, fast delivery. A migraine day life saver.

horrible customer service!!!!  these people have no idea what they are doing!!!  its not hard to take an order thru the phone now is it?? and your managers, oh man are just as horrible!!!!  heres the story and my experience of what happened!!  i placed my order right? and as she asked for my payment i gave her my debit card # and she says its expired.. i said what? it doesnt expire til like 5 yrs from now. i told them thanks, but no thanks i thought it was cancelled!! not even 20 mins later, i hear ding dong, and its you guys at my door, im sorry i canceled my order the driver looks at me like if im crazy no sir, youre company is horrible!! called the manager explained my whole story!! and he tells me ok  did you pay cash or credit excuse me are you not listening? damn other people in this world need jobs. you guys need better people and better service at your store.... good day!
Best Chinese food in town. We ordered the generals chicken and Crab Rangoon. Both were delicious. The large is plenty to share and still have left overs.
Love it! Lunch specials are a great bargain. Food is fresh, hot & ready to pick up (or delivered) quickly. We've been going here for years & highly recommend them!

Reading these reviews, one has to wonder that some have been paid to give a good review or some people don't know the difference between Chinese and Slimese! I have to say this is some of the worst Chinese food I think I have ever eaten. Okay, so many of you are now trying to label me as a snob or a foodie, neither of which I am. What I am is a person who has lived in Hong Kong for eight years and had the luxury of experiencing quality Chinese cuisine. I can tell you that the fortune house doesn't come close to this experience. For the first time the other evening, I ordered takeout hoping that the bulk of these reviews reflected the quality of the food. What I did get was large portions of 1). Lo mein which was swimming in a dark brown sauce, 2). if you think the lo mein was swimming, then you should've seen the Moo Shoo pork which was taking a bath in its own sauce. Considering that the pancakes were dry and cracked, you can only imagine the unpalatable mess of trying to eat this slop with the juices running everywhere. On top of that, the takeout container was cracked and this ubiquitous dark sauce was everywhere. Lastly, the only dish that held any hope was the curry chicken which pretty much was 80% mushrooms and onions, and the only reason this dish comes to the top is because it was boring and inoffensive as opposed to plain disgusting and unpalatable.

You might think my review harsh but the food reflects the mood. I can also say that I'm honestly not impressed and will never come back to this place for anything. Do the owners really eat here?

OK, so I have been sitting on this review for a couple weeks now deciding on whether or not to post it.  In all fairness to the other customers, I feel like they should be forwarned.

It's not that their food is bad, but my husband and I will never return due to their customer service.

I placed an order with Fortune House at 7 on a Sunday evening via Grubhub and we paid via credit card.  We were quoted a delivery time of 8:10.

8:15: I called Fortune house to find out where our food was.  The rude guy on the phone said it was on its way and should be there in ten minutes.

8:30: I call back to find out where our food was AGAIN.  He put me on hold.  He comes back a few minutes later and says that they never received the order.  Whaaaaat?  So which is it--it's on its way or they never received it (furthermore, if you never received my order, how is it that you know EXACTLY what I ordered without me telling you--ESP perhaps??)?!

He said he would get my order right out to me.  I said not to bother and to cancel our order.  He said he wasn't going to do that.  When pushed further, he blamed grubhub for a glitch and it wasn't his fault, blah blah blah.

Soooooo, Grubhub made you lie to me when you said my food was on its way.  No, sir.

I asked to talk to a manager.  He said he was a manager.  **insert eye roll**

It's not like I was asking for free food or compensation or anything.  I wasn't even asking for ANYthing, I just wanted them to refund my credit card.

All he kept saying was "Sorry, I can't do that".  Over...and over....and over....and over...

Yes, sir you CAN.  You are choosing NOT to.

We finally received our food (that we didn't even WANT at that point) at 9:15.  So well over two hours after we originally placed the order.

We will never give them our business again.

Discovered this place when I was in high school and have been eating here since. I finally am getting a chance to review it so here goes:

Must try: Mongolian Beef, Crab rangoon, and house fried rice

The lunch specials here are amazing! A $6 meal that turns into 2-3 extra meals is insane :D the lunch special comes with whatever you order and an eggroll, fried rice, and a pop. Can't beat the value and it is delicious food. The crab rangoons are huge and filled with tons of cream cheese which is an awesome surprise since others normally come with so little cream cheese and end up being all wonton. The restaurant is very small but it seems to be really busy because there is always someone in there. The staff is usually high school kids and they are really friendly.

If you are in the area I would advise stopping by for some good chinese!

A few little things detracted from a higher rating but all in all, I was pleasantly surprised with my first order from Fortune House. I think if I had it delivered, my rating would have been higher, but seeing the slightly dirty interior, wall art with a broken glass frame, and guy with possibly infected facial piercing sort of detracted from my rating. Even though being able to see the kitchen and cooking through the window was a plus.

Having said that - fattest crab rangoons I have ever had! Also, they allow you extra meat for a small upcharge, and my order of Mongolian Beef easily had a pound of tender flank steak in it. I was very impressed with that. But the rest of the meal (an order of Dragon & Phoenix) was just sort of meh. General Tso's chicken was very bland, as was the shrimp and broccoli. Having them together in the same container meant the sauces mixed and that was not good.

This comment is coming from a Sous Chef at an Italian restaurant. I have eaten at so, so many Asian cuisine places. Downtown,  suburbs i mean lets face it,  im a foodie with a professional palette!  This place serves amazing food and a super reasonable price point. Delivery was 20 minutes before the 45 they promised!  I order vegetable foo young, chop suey, mongolian beef. I must say with a tad bit of low sodium soy sauce and some heat, i have to say this food sticks out better than any place ive eaten at! They say in culinary "less is more" simple dishes w/ great taste.  I can say i have no need to go anywhere else! Tender beef, tender chicken :-) simply awesome. #lovethisplace #cantwaitfor #leftovers

We ordered this for Lunch on a sunday and I thought the food was ok. The General Tso's chicken was not really spicy like i was hoping it would be and the Vegetable Lo Mein was really really sweet. I will give the place another try and ask for extra spicy Chicken next time. 
The delivery was really fast so that was good.

I must admit, I was a bit skeptical going to this place but the food is definitely worth the price. This is by no means a 5 star restaurant or 5 star food, but the food for the value is pretty good. For $9, I got a big container of rice and Mongolian beef which has lasted me for 3 meals. The onions complement the beef really well and the beef is tender and juicy, not like the rubbery stuff you sometimes get at low grade restaurants.

Be cautioned, though, I walked into the restaurant expecting places to sit and there were only 2 tables with 4 chairs. The place is geared towards delivery and take out. The person at the counter was great at taking my order and they are fast at making your food. I would go again.

We purchased restaurant coupons from an internet site, PAID for them, and Fortune House refused to accept them. Why?! "Because we don't work with that company anymore." Management chose to punish the customer (me) rather than honor the coupon's value at the time of purchase. Their food is not good enough to live through a TOTAL RIP-OFF.  (FYI: the coupon clearly states "no expiration date" so he couldn't use that as an excuse.)

This place is now my guilty pleasure for dinner. At least twice a month I order the General Tso's chicken. I can make 3 meals out of a combination platter.  I plan to cut back on takeout this year, but I cannot cut out Fortune House.

If I could leave ZERO stars I would. I have eaten food from this place twice- the first time was good- second time I got terrible food poisoning after eating the sesame chicken. I called the next day to let the restaurant know and was told the manager would call me back- 8 hours later I received a call back. I explained to the manager what happened and was literally laughed at!!! He said there would be a lot of people complaining if it was from his food and that I did not get sick from there. I told him it was the only food I ate last night and I was sick 5 hours after eating it- so sick I lost 3 pounds in one night! He went back and forth arguing with me. I told him I did not want to argue with him and just felt he should know the chicken- or portions of it were contaminated. I also said I felt I should be reimbursed for the sesame chicken considering it made me so sick. He laughed and said no he cannot do that. He said he could do nothing for me and that he knows I was sick with something else. Well, needless to say I won't be back and I would recommend staying far away from the sesame chicken or any of their food for that matter! What terrible customer service.

This place used to be really good but has gone downhill. The last few times we had the beef sticks they were like raw rubber. This time tried the chicken sticks and they were a deep fried shoe. The sweet and sour chicken was completely dried out also just like shoe leather. 
Find somewhere else !

I am surprised for as much as I eat here I haven't written a review....

I love the food here, when I am out this way in the NW suburbs we head here...Always consistent and always tasty. 

The crab rangoon is always Really good. The fried rice here is the way I like it-good flavor with enough goodies of veggies and egg. My friend's husband gets some veggie noodle thing that is always delicious (I wish I remembered the name)  and I always steal some from his order...and there is always plenty of leftovers they give you great portions! We always do family style and there is plenty of food to go around. The prices are good too you get a lot for your money. 

I like the people who work there, they are always nice and pleasant. We have a lot of picky eaters in our bunch and they have never gotten an order wrong yet. 

It really isn't a sit down Chinese place it is more of a take out..but there are 2 little tables but I think these are more for people waiting to pick up their order. 
 
If you have a itch for some tasty Chinese food come swing in here you won't be disappointed.

I have recently moved away and now as I try several Chinese restaurants in my new neighborhood I realize that this place was a diamond in the rough. The sweet and sour chicken is pretty good, the lo mein dishes are a crowd favorite, and my personal favorite is the Hunan chicken. The delivery service was usually faster than the ETA the call taker suggested. Overall, whether I picked up my order or it was delivered the food always came hot and to order.

So one Monday evening, boyfriend and I want to get some Chinese but none of them are open... But wait Fortune house is! yay!

Ordered: Dragon and Phoenix (general tso chicken and shrimp)- Very good, not to spicy ( I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy foods). I would def get the General tso chicken again. 
Sesame chicken- It tasted good but by the time we ate it, it was a little soggy and had a little to much breading for my liking.  The leftovers I popped in the oven and it was a little better but I don't think I would get it again. 
Combo fried rice- Very good, it was like the old Yu's fried rice, not dried out.
and Crab Rangoon- Holy crab rangoon! They give you so much and they are huge! Wish it had a little more crab but still pretty good. Way to much for only 2 people.

 It's kinda odd that a bunch of high schoolers work there, never saw that before but it seems to work okay! For all the food we got it was about $40. Pretty sure this is going to be our new go to place for Chinese!

We have ordered here twice for delivery and both times it's been great!!! We finally found a great Chinese place in Schaumburg! Try the chicken fried rice, Mongolian beef, egg rolls, and crab Rangoon! Soooo good!

Now THIS is what I'm talking about!! Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for pointing this one out!

Fortune House has very good chicken fried rice, crab rangoon, spring rolls, and General Tso's chicken (all of MY basics). The leftovers were great.

The service is also friendly and fast. Went in, placed our order, ran to Walgreens, came back and the bag was ready to go on the counter waiting for us.

They also deliver to my area even though they are almost in the heart of Schaumburg and I'm on the other end.


I can dig it...

I ordered delivery from here a couple times. The food was mediocre but not the worst. I didn't have too big a problem until TODAY. I called to order delivery after a long day at work and didn't feel like cooking.  One of the workers told the girl taking my order after she had taken it that they didn't deliver to my apartment. Really?? Myself and my roommate have gotten food delivered to our apartment at least 4 times. In fact she just ordered food there last week.  If your employees don't want to drive because of the weather fine but don't cone up with some bs that you don't deliver to my location when you just delivered here last week.  I'll never order from this place nor will my roommate again!

Chinese delivery with free items just for ordering? Sign me up! General Tso's chicken is the dish to order here, no question, best in the area. Their crab rangoons are huge and awesome. I would order more often but Chinese takeout is so terrible for you I just can't.

So its been a while since I ordered from here but decided to drop in and get some mangolian beef and garlic chicken with crabrangoon for the app. I was so excited until I got home and started eating. Have they changed something? The rice is a much cheaper quality, the mangolian beef was not spicy at all. I loved this place before so maybe I just came to get chinese on the wrong day? I hope this is not a permanent change.

I'm a firm believer that everybody MUST have a good Mexican or Chinese or whatever place near their home.  This place fits the bill perfectly.  Huge portions, consistent quality, great price.  We get dinner here at least once a month and they never disappoint.  I love the kid at the counter and his super high "Goku Hair."  And it looks like his grandmother, aunts, and uncles are all doing the cooking.  

Fantastic place!

The fried rice was great and the perfect taste with the green onions. The general tso's wasn't spicy and there was no broccoli included!  We also got the chicken and broccoli which was kinda slimy. The egg roll would've been alright w/o the shrimp. Still on the search for good Suburban Chinese
Simply delicious. Our go-to Chinese takeout place. I love the spring rolls!!
Great Value - Great Taste - Huge portions and value added extras like egg roll and pop included in lunch.  I will be back.
There good might be good but they always seem to mess up our orders.

Ordered from these guys last night based on the positive reviews. Can't figure out what everyone is so excited about.  My pan fried noodles were soggy ramen noodles hidden under an enormous pile of bean sprouts.  There was some chicken, but no flavor at all.  My husband's empress chicken was overly breaded and very gristly.  Won't be going back.

Good food, big portions and they deliver! My kind of neighborhood restaurant. Been going here for the last 6 yrs and loving it. Oh, we have used them to cater our parties and everyone loved their food.

THE best Chinese in the area. Eaten here numerous times, and have never been let down. Menu is endless and prices are reasonable. Definite #1 option is takeout or #2 delivery. Only downside is limited seating,

Our family just moved to the area and tried a few local chinese resturants and Fortune House is by far the best we have tried. My husband swears that the sweet and sour chicken tastes like a chicken donut :) We usually order the beef fried rice from any chinese resturant we go to but I usually pick out the beef since it's usually tough but it's pretty tasty at FH.

Also.. The delivery is amazingly fast! I ordered and it was at my door in 20 minutes!

My only draw back are the eggrolls...  Don't like them.

Take-ou/delivery strip mall chinese doesn't get much better. Lunch combos are a steal and they're wicked fast in getting them ready for you. In comparison it makes their dinner menu seem price but it's on par with the others.

The food is almost always of above average for the type of shop they are. It's no Chinatown secret wonder but it'll do and for lunch two can eat for under ten and that's including an extra soda and eggroll to avoid fist fights. 

Insider tip: They have a list of official lunches but I've frequently gotten stuff from the regular menu at lunch prices and portions. Super deal!
Very good Chinese Food!  This is our usually Chinese take-out spot.  Great portions for the price!!!
basic junk food Chinese done exceptionally well. fair prices for the portions.

It was OK! for the people saying the portion size is BIG ... its not, its average. Its a little pricey for me compared to other places. (lunch specials decent price tho under $7) but i ended up paying over $17 for a small rice and orange chicken and they guy even had the nerve to ask for a tip after i paid for my food for carry out -__- . The food was OK not the best. If you looking to try something new i guess go for it but if i return it would be a once in a blue moon type situation.

The office I work at were sick of the old Chinese place we used to order from so I went on Yelp and found this lovely place and ordered food for the whole office. 

This place offered GREAT prices. We fed 7 people for about $40. Delivery was pretty fast and surprising because it's a bit further away from us (we're on Higgins & Barrington). They arrived within 30 minutes. The food was VERY delicious. I had their mangolian beef and it was spicy and I loved it. Everyone in the office loved the food. The portions are HUGE. We all had to save our food for later tonight.

So happy we found a new place to order Chinese food!

I love this place! I bet the cashier knows my name by now since I always order from here (well, just my yummy Chinese)

Although I haven't really tried a lot of the menu, I love their shrimp fried rice and S&S chicken. I always get the small S&S but the sauce is always plentiful! 

I love coming to this place after class or from work.

My girlfriend and I were looking around trying to find a good Chinese place who will deliver for lunch, and we found it! The food was/is great! And the sizes were enough to keep us fed until the next day.

Try the Chinese Doughnuts, they are truly yummy!

I've had a difficult time locating a good Chinese restaurant that delivers. Some deliver but deliver crappy food, and then some have delicious food but don't deliver. 

I've driven past Fortune House many times before, but have never eaten there. 

So on a whim, we decided to order from Fortune House. 

I was a little hesitant, because I've had many a horrible experience from these "on the whim" orders. 

Our food came in about 20 minutes. And thank God for that.. Because I was so hungry I was ready to eat my left leg. 

And at the very minute I opened the containers...I could smell the deliciousness escape...and I was drooling almost immediately. 

We got the Kung Pao combination (one of the best I've had), the combination fried rice (very tasty), walnut shrimp (deelish!) and the fried calamari (good). 

Thanks for posting about Fortune House, guys! I've finally found a great Chinese delivery place! Yay! Yay! Yay!

I am at a complete loss for words for how this place got any positive reviews. Got the sesame chicken, and it was clearly generic brand frozen chicken with generic brand "Chinese" sauce. No veggies, and bizarrely, not even sesame seeds. The crab rangoons  were just stuffed cream cheese wontons, again clearly from some generic vendor. Save yourself the money and take a trip through the dollar store if this food is your style, you can't do much worse.
Veggie fried rice had chicken in it- so ridiculous. The only good thing is this place is always consistent- they ALWAYS mess up vegetarian order. This was my last time ordering from here.

Fortune House is my favorite local Chinese spot for lunch.  The staff is super friendly.  The lunch specials are cheap and come with a can of pop.  I can get in and out for less than $7 and ALWAYS have leftovers.  I mainly stick with the chicken dishes and have never been disappointed.  Oh and I don't like egg in my fried rice, so they make me an egg-less fried rice for my lunch special without an extra charge.  Bottom line...great food with fast and courteous service at a very fair price.

Without a doubt the best Chinese take out in Schaumburg! Have tried at least 5 others, and still keep coming back here. The crab rangoon and potstickers are wonderful, and their house special soup is some of the best I have had. Have tried several entrees and have not been disappointed yet, my favorite being General Tso's chicken or Schezwan Beef. Remember that pretty much every order qualifies for free egg rolls!

I've been craving Chinese food for a week and Friday was the day my dreams came true. Fortune House has been bookmarked on my list to try so this was the perfect opportunity. 

Upon walking into this place, I do have to note that the air was pretty thick and smoky. The kitchen is not far from the cashier/desk. If you decided to sit inside and wait for your food, I'm sure you would come out smelling like an eggroll. We ordered way too much food for just 2 people. We got a large cashew chicken, large chicken with garlic sauce, small veggie fried rice, 2 egg rolls and 2 cans of pop. The bag of food had to weigh at least 10 lbs! They also threw in 2 large sized white, steamed rice and sauces/fortune cookies. I am very picky about Chinese take-out, but I really liked the food from here. Everything was super fresh and one of the entrees we got had super huge, full mushrooms (most places just throw in sliced mushrooms). The prices were pretty reasonable too, everything was under $30. If I am craving Chinese takeout, this would be one of my places to go. Since I work nearby, I might try their lunch menu one day.

ETA: Since I enjoyed the food so much on Friday, I decided to stop here for lunch today. I got the sweet and sour chicken lunch special. It came with fried rice, egg roll and can of pop for under $7.00! The portion is HUGE. 

Oh, and it just dawned on me....this place is open on Mondays! I've never found a Chinese restaurant or takeout that has been open on Mondays!!

The Crab Rangoon is delicious!!! I always get at least two orders! I love that they don't mind special orders. I always ask for the chicken and broccoli, which usually comes in a white sauce, to be done in the brown sauce. They never have a problem with it. I usually order through GrubHub, and therefore get it slightly cheaper than menu price, and it's always ready in record time!
Highly recommend. Great food and great prices. General Tsu chicken is top notch.
Can't believe I have waited so long to try this place...go for the combo platters.  2 meals from the portions they give...food is excellent!  Highly recommend.
I was under the weather and ordered some Chinese takeout for dinner. Unfortunatley I didn't have the positive dining expieriance some of my fellow yelpers had. My food was greasy and overfried.
Great food, fast delivery, and friendly service.  If I lived in the area I would have this place on speed dial.
Excellent food!  Ordered from here for 5+ years and will never go anywhere else.
